675361197.name: GO ANYWAY YOU CAN
675361197.author: a TripAdvisor user
675361197.reviewBody: Amazing place, spend the money to go with a good company.  It\'s a bit of a ride out there but beyond worth it.

672144782.name: Isla Espiritu Santo
672144782.author: a TripAdvisor user
672144782.reviewBody: This is a mystical place with unbelievable formations.  Also a great place to dive in February and April with around 450 seal pups.  They love to play with you ...

666637855.name: Great time
666637855.author: a TripAdvisor user
666637855.reviewBody: This island is quite long, and looks like all rock and cliffs, along side the beautiful sandy beaches.  We took a boat ride out to snorkel with the sea lions, and one of them turned out to be more than overly friendly.  We careful snorkeling with them.  Hard to get away from them when they start bumping you, swimming over your legs and biting you.

666066078.name: A beautiful adventure
666066078.author: a TripAdvisor user
666066078.reviewBody: We purchased a tour package from Marlboro who owns a bar at Tecolote beach.\n\nI cant say enough about Espiritu Isla.  The stark beauty of the desert islands, the breeding area for the frigate birds, the sea turtles, the sea lions.....and swimming with the sea lions!  Not just near them....with them.  There were also a wide variety of beautiful fish when snorkeling.  Lunch on the beach was amazing.  Fresh seafood ceviche!  This is an amazing trip..... well worth seeing once or twice!

665515082.name: Truly the Pearl of the Sea of Cortez
665515082.author: a TripAdvisor user
665515082.reviewBody: What can I say? Beautiful, fabulous, pristine, full of birds and sea lions! Snorkeling, private beaches, I loved it.

661947488.name: Isla Esp\u00edritu Santo
661947488.author: a TripAdvisor user
661947488.reviewBody: Our tour guide was awesome !! We left La Paz (malec\u00f3n ) he took us all over the island we swam with the sea lions and he took us to a private beach it was beautiful I highly recommend him he was so patient I had 4 kids  and 1 was very fussy \ud83d\udc76\ud83c\udffb. It was a private tour so we were not sharing the bought with other people .

660039005.name: Solo Dive Vacation 2019
660039005.author: a TripAdvisor user
660039005.reviewBody: Wow SEAL SEALS and more Seals about One Hour thirty to one hour forty mins boat ride beautiful backdrop with beautiful water Sun is killer make sure you stay in shade

659049000.name: Great place to camp out
659049000.author: a TripAdvisor user
659049000.reviewBody: The beach is clean with nice sand. Great to watch the pelicans picking up food diving into the sea. There are some hikes on the island as well. Worth it.

658798633.name: The island is beautiful, the boat ride is painful.
658798633.author: a TripAdvisor user
658798633.reviewBody: Espiritu Santo Island has gorgeous camping areas, a nice short walk among granite stones and cacti up to an overlook of a beautiful beach and sea lion watching/swimming with at the northern end of the island.  Be sure and take a comfortable boat that won\'t cause you pain during the long ride to and from the island.

658504817.name: Playful sealions
658504817.author: a TripAdvisor user
658504817.reviewBody: We had a wonderful experience with On Board Baja out to Espiritu Santos Island from La Paz!  We swam with the sea lions and they were so playful!  Our guide Maria was so sweet and very knowledgeable about the marine life and the area! She and Victor, our boat driver, went beyond our expectations to keep us comfortable and organized while getting on and off the boat. Lunch afterwards on a beautiful white sand beach was great!

657868145.name: Snorkeling Isla Esp\u00edritu Santo
657868145.author: a TripAdvisor user
657868145.reviewBody: Super experience! Great gear, guides, Skipper, who spent time following porpoises when they happened to show up.

657691638.name: Amazing
657691638.author: a TripAdvisor user
657691638.reviewBody: We visited here on a Lindblad/National Geographic cruise.  We snorkeled at 8:00 am before the other tour boats arrived and then toured around the island in Zodiacs. Snorkeling with the sea lions was amazing-definitely a check-off on the bucket list!

657256997.name: Great day
657256997.author: a TripAdvisor user
657256997.reviewBody: We took an excursion to the island for some snorkeling and swimming with the Sea Lions.  It was a great day!

657002735.name: A must do
657002735.author: a TripAdvisor user
657002735.reviewBody: We thoroughly enjoyed the tour to Isla Espiritu Santo with Alonso tours.  The island\u2019s shoreline geology is interesting and beautiful.  Watching the birds and sea lions was a real treat. \nThe beach where we stopped for lunch, Ensenada grande, was beautiful and calm.  The boat ride was not rough and we saw a pod of dolphins.

655056787.name: Went sailing around Espir\u00edtu and snorkling
655056787.author: a TripAdvisor user
655056787.reviewBody: Beautiful place - and with a chance of spotting resident dolphins or even a tortuiose while sailing there.\n

654538465.name: Do not miss!
654538465.author: a TripAdvisor user
654538465.reviewBody: Beautiful and so glad to see Mexico protecting this treasure! Wear sunscreen and enjoy. I went with a group called Red Travel Mexico. They did a fabulous job and the guide was awesome.I highly recommend an Underwater camera if you can swing it but even if you don\u2019t have one, you will love this place. If you are afraid of close encounters with wildlife or snorkeling, this is not the trip for you.

654391870.name: Must things to do
654391870.author: a TripAdvisor user
654391870.reviewBody: This is a great trip. The whole espirito santo island is beautful. We did the swim with the seals first then to the beach. The seals is fun to watch. Seems like lots of activities. After an hour we went to the beach wich is beautiful white sand and very clear water. Excellent exoerience

654212731.name: Don\u2019t know where to start
654212731.author: a TripAdvisor user
654212731.reviewBody: I had went to excursion with Debora and her company Selkie Travels for snorkelling excursion - the island is magnificent and full off incredible beaches plus the whole experience of snorkelling with sea lions made that place extra special-if you are in La Paz this island is an absolute must do !!!!!

652651896.name: Horrible Tragic Day, person died no reimbursement whatsoever
652651896.author: a TripAdvisor user
652651896.reviewBody: On a day that was supose to be great ended in tragedy when a lady unfortunately passed away on trip to islotes appears from a diving accident.  After this happen nobody wanted to dive or do anything I mean I just witnessed someone dying right in front of me, so no Isla Espiritu Santo just a water downed trip nobody really wanted I just wanted to go back.  So basically this trip was over.  I demanded a refund from company and to my surprise and disgust they gave me the run around so I decided to handle it with my credit card company and I explain them what happened and I was given a credit. But today I saw I was recharged from them.  I really didnt want to write a bad review but this made me mad and shame on them I should get some sort of money back from what I had go theu, this is just a company who cares more about money than their customers. SHAME

651261989.name: Amazing
651261989.author: a TripAdvisor user
651261989.reviewBody: This was a wonderful experience, except for the newbies. Not sure why people who have no respect for nature or any understanding of what a "protected UNESCO biosphere reserve" means (or perhaps they just don\'t care) - why they would go to a place like this? The shouting, screaming and lack of understanding of the need to use reef safe sunscreen baffles me. If you can ignore that - the sea lion colony is amazing. The young are playful and plentiful. You don\'t need to move just float and watch. Amazing.

651161801.name: The coolest 6 hours you will spend
651161801.author: a TripAdvisor user
651161801.reviewBody: Beautiful shore lines interesting history of this protected area. disappearing tidal beaches snorkeling with sea lions in a area known for great whites all jam packed into a boat tour We were lucky to have a guy translate all the details to us in english. We left from the La Paz ferry area

650627318.name: Sea lions with Alonso Tours
650627318.author: a TripAdvisor user
650627318.reviewBody:
We took the day boat trip and were not disappointed. Yes, at this time of year it wasn’t the warmest, but went you step into a boat you have to come prepared. we did as we needed several layers to keep out the cold.
We went to Isla Espiritu Santos and had a wonderful adventure with David who is a biologist and there is nothing he doesn’t know about the area or the flora and fauna.
The wetsuits and snorkelling gear were provided as was being accompanied into the water with the guide.
The sea lions on the whole kept to the rocks but several came in for a short display and they were very close. I saw one “tease and play” with a bird that had dived in to catch a fish. He kept holding on and letting go of the bird who was eventually let go and none the worse for wear.
Great time on a beach with lunch and drinks.
A great value day with everything thought of.
Thanks David.

646366891.name: Go!!
646366891.author: a TripAdvisor user
646366891.reviewBody: We drove in a car rental from San Jose del Cabo just for this! I found Alonso Tours via trip advisor and they were great. We decided last minute on the wet suits. In the end my husband didn\u2019t use it. I did. It\u2019s was really cold in the cave we went in but other than that I might have been fine. Definitely if it had been warmer I wouldn\u2019t have used it. I think the temp outside was around 72 that day. \nSwimming near the sea lions in their own habitat was amazing! Some came close enough to nibble on my fin! They wanted to play! It was fabulous!!\nLots of info on history of the isles. A decent lunch on a little beach. Can\u2019t wait to come back.

646183605.name: We Kayaked there and camped with Baja Outdoor Activities (BOA)
646183605.author: a TripAdvisor user
646183605.reviewBody: The protected islands were amazing and pristine. You need special permissions to go to these islands as they are sanctuaries for flora and fauna. I was happy to learn how well they are protected. We were only on a few beaches but ouldn\'t really leave the beach as there only a few designated trails for hiking into the interior of the island. I was told that you can hike way up into the mountains at certain times and there is plentiful water in the right season. Maybe next time. We saw turtles, sand rays, lots of fish on the coral reefs, Pelicans and Frigatebirds. Not a single sea lion or seal which seemed odd. BOA was a great guide company if you\'re looking for one. They are based in La Paz, BCS, Mexico.

646160370.name: Snorkle with the Sea Lions!!
646160370.author: a TripAdvisor user
646160370.reviewBody: This is an amazing trip if you snorkle with the Sea Lions.  Make sure you have a wet suit on board for you before you leave.  Waters can be pretty cold during the Winter months and windy\n

644134701.name: love it
644134701.author: a TripAdvisor user
644134701.reviewBody: must do this boat trip to see whales n sea loins, snorkel is lots of fun , giant sting rays , lots of sea life in the sea of cortez  \n

641375295.name: Magical
641375295.author: a TripAdvisor user
641375295.reviewBody:
We went on a tour to snorkel with the sea lions. 

Beautiful island with gorgeous untouched beaches, stunning rock striations and lots of marine life.

640444087.name: Day trip.
640444087.author: a TripAdvisor user
640444087.reviewBody: Go with a good tour group with the larger boat. Really nice day trip. Cantamar tour very good. Very reasonable prices.

640387210.name: Swimming with sea lions
640387210.author: a TripAdvisor user
640387210.reviewBody: What a cool island. The sea lions and birds in the area make it a must see trip. Also the rock formations in the area are wonderful.

638633613.name: Beautiful, and fun trip
638633613.author: a TripAdvisor user
638633613.reviewBody: We used Alonso tours which I highly recommend. It was a little windy that day which made the sea a bit rough, but the crew worked hard to give us the best possible experience.

638484122.name: Kayaking, snorkeling, hiking, beaches, wildlife!
638484122.author: a TripAdvisor user
638484122.reviewBody: An amazing place to explore in or on the water or on land. Sea lions, frigatebirds, whale sharks, desert landscapes. Very accessible and yet remote. Fantastic!

637658230.name: Geologic and natural wonder
637658230.author: a TripAdvisor user
637658230.reviewBody: You must take a trip out to the island at some point. There is a lot you can do (swim, hike, camp, eat, snorkel, boat), but you should definitely make this a priority on your trip. We did a snorkel trip and loved it. I\'m a bit of a naturalist/dork so I was in heaven. Amazing birds, wonderful and colorful layers of rock, lovely plants, and amazing sea life. I\'ve honestly had several dreams about this place since our visit.

637464977.name: Magical place
637464977.author: a TripAdvisor user
637464977.reviewBody: One of my favorite experience of all my life. This place is magical. My favorite part was swimming with the sea lions !

637249392.name: Gorgeous
637249392.author: a TripAdvisor user
637249392.reviewBody: This is a must see if you are in La Paz.  40 minute boat ride.  You can even "Glamp" there with an outfitter.  Great snorkeling, great water clarity.

631671151.name: Mesmerizing island
631671151.author: a TripAdvisor user
631671151.reviewBody: Whether you take a tour from Tecolote beach, or you book an outing with a established company, the Espiritu Santo Island is a must visit. It has a nice sea lion colony, great snorkeling and beautiful landscapes. The beaches are unbelievable.

630700390.name: Sea kayak trip
630700390.author: a TripAdvisor user
630700390.reviewBody: This is a beautiful island. We did a 7 day trip with Baja Outdoors Adventures, fully supported.The water was warm and clear, lots of snorkeling opportunities, interesting coastline to explore by kayak, sea lion colony to visit. You are limited to only a few hikes on the island to protect it.

629973158.name: A Private Trip to Isla Espiritu Santo Was Awesome!
629973158.author: a TripAdvisor user
629973158.reviewBody: We used Baja Adventure Co to take 6 of us to Espiritu Santo. The island is amazing and we feel that we will certainly return.

629669562.name: Sea Lion fun
629669562.author: a TripAdvisor user
629669562.reviewBody: Had a wonderful time diving and playing with the sea lions. They were so active and swimming around us. I would go back again for sure .

621935982.name: romantic & cute place
621935982.author: a TripAdvisor user
621935982.reviewBody: lots of history & pretty interesting place.. \neveryone is very nice & its a very nice place to be because it\'s not so touresty . \nthere area  lot of locals :)

621497754.name: Must See
621497754.author: a TripAdvisor user
621497754.reviewBody: This is a must do when in La Paz.  The water is out of this world and the trip is smooth and comfortable.  Enjoyed every minute.

618564903.name: Do you want to be Robinson Crusoe?
618564903.author: a TripAdvisor user
618564903.reviewBody: Do you want to be Robinson Crusoe? you found the ideal island. Clear sea, colors of the bow, phantasmagoric shells ... it\'s really a paradise!

616571523.name: Fun in the sun!
616571523.author: a TripAdvisor user
616571523.reviewBody: Our favorite...snorkeling with the sea lion pups at seal rock, kayaking and having an awesome lunch on a private white sand beach.

615998746.name: Pretty island, OK tour
615998746.author: a TripAdvisor user
615998746.reviewBody: The island itself is very pretty, with some gorgeous white sand beaches with turquoise, warm water. So I definitely recommend finding some way to visit the island.\n\nBut I did not love the all day tour we took to go there and back, which I think was one of the typical boat tours leaving from the La Paz marina. We took a total of 6-7 hours from La Paz and back, and spent way too much time on the boat and way too little time snorkeling/swimming. Overall, we only saw a couple of turtles, birds, sea lions on the rocks, and a few fish. We did not swim with the sea lions (they were just sleeping), nor see dolphins, rays or any other exciting animal. Apart for the sea lion snorkeling stop, the tour consisted of a stop seeing some birds and pelicans, another to quickly view an arch, and then a 40-50 minute stop at a small beach to have lunch and swim for 10 minutes. Overall, we spent 5-6 hours on a boat and only 1-2 doing activities. I recommend you chose a tour company that makes this ratio better, either by having a faster boat or by leaving from Tecolote Beach instead of La Paz.

613953280.name: Paradise!!
613953280.author: a TripAdvisor user
613953280.reviewBody: Worth the day trip. We went with the tour company recommended by Hotel Catedral and it was an amazing day trip. Really affordable.

613463646.name: Spectacular
613463646.author: a TripAdvisor user
613463646.reviewBody: Nature is incredible! A visit to Isla Esp\u00edritu Santo is just amazing. The nature, rock formations, sea life and beaches is something you need to see. The two hour boat ride is worth it! If you have the chance do not miss this

611171021.name: Beautiful Island for Outdoor Adventure
611171021.author: a TripAdvisor user
611171021.reviewBody: We camped on Isla Espiritu Santo with our two kids, ages 5 and 7, with a tour operator (Kayak Baja) and a small group. We kayaked, snorkeled, hiked, and played on the beach. The island is beautiful and serene. It was well worth the trip. The one drawback was the wind. It got very, very windy at times, which made the boat ride to and from the island a bit more exciting than I would have preferred. All in all, I highly recommend a trip to Isla Espiritu Santo for those looking for an outdoor adventure off the beaten path in baja.

610914530.name: Experience of a lifetime
610914530.author: a TripAdvisor user
610914530.reviewBody: An Unesco world heritage site, Espiritu Santo is breath-taking.  Different kinds of sea birds are seen all of the island.  It has some great spearfishing in designated areas, kayaking, sailing, scuba diving, camping, hiking, beaches, flying rays and a sea lion colony.

608104033.name: A must do !!!
608104033.author: a TripAdvisor user
608104033.reviewBody: We enjoyed our trip to the isla Esp\u00edritu Santo, it\u2019s all day trip but it was the best thing to do in La Paz , it was very relaxing and beautiful to see all kind of animals and a blue turquoise water, then we had a delicious ceviche, sandwich, fruit, drinks what a deal , I loved !!!!

607849757.name: Lovely Island
607849757.author: a TripAdvisor user
607849757.reviewBody: A great place to visit. Amazing things to do and see. I hope people take care of this amazing place and respect it.

607465954.name: Great tour with VIP Tours
607465954.author: a TripAdvisor user
607465954.reviewBody: Fantastic, great dramatic views, clear water, lots of inquisitive sea lions. Our tour operator was top of the line, a bit more expensive than other, but totally worth it, great service and communication from the beginning. Excellent guide Katrin and great food y excelent quality equipment, we will be back

606531664.name: Breathtaking
606531664.author: a TripAdvisor user
606531664.reviewBody: Must see, take a private boat and enjoy the incredible colours of the island and the sea, an incredible beauty

605458743.name: Incredible snorkelling
605458743.author: a TripAdvisor user
605458743.reviewBody: However you get there, it\u2019s worth the ride.  Our son, who visited the Galapagos recently, said the sea here is just as exciting (apart from that there are fewer turtles).  \nTake a trip with a snorkel and it will be memorable.

603441946.name: Awesome day trip!
603441946.author: a TripAdvisor user
603441946.reviewBody: Our boat captain set up an impromptu picnic on the island with fresh ceviche! It was great fun to swim with the sea lions!

601176406.name: lots of sea lions to see
601176406.author: a TripAdvisor user
601176406.reviewBody:
did a boat trip with cortexclub out of La Paz for the day and it was a great time.

there's some pretty cool stuff to see including tons of sea lions and bird turd island (it should be named that).  it was a great day overall with great vistas and snorkeling and scuba diving if that's your thing.  outside the harbour in La Paz there was a small island and you could scuba or snorkel right up to the sea lions.

had a blast overall and the instructors and captain were awesome.  one of the best days of my trip for sure.

600897421.name: Gorgeous and awesome!
600897421.author: a TripAdvisor user
600897421.reviewBody: Great beach!! Very shallow so good for kids. \nBeautiful place to take lots of pics, take a waterproof cel case so you can take pics of the coral when you snorkel

599433940.name: Must see
599433940.author: a TripAdvisor user
599433940.reviewBody: We booked a tour boat  which seem all about the same. Paid 750 pesos pp. The boat trip takes you along the scenic coast before turning into tecolote beach for supplies. We got to swim and enjoy the beach before heading to the Isle. We made several Stops spanning the day\u2014the nesting area of a large variety of birds, one of several beaches for ceviche lunch and snorkeling, and lastly snorkeling and swimming with sea lions. The Isle is a UNESCO biosphere site and shouldn\u2019t be missed.

597937696.name: Great destination - Even in the Off Season
597937696.author: a TripAdvisor user
597937696.reviewBody: Did a day trip and fully enjoyed our visit Espiritu Santos and surrounding area with Alonso Tours (did a full review of our day under their name). Even though snorkeling with sea lions is newly banned this year during July and August for calving season, still had a blast. Lots of dolphins, sea lions, dramatic scenery and calm seas from La Paz and both sides of the island. Want to return to see whales and whale sharks during "the season".

597755745.name: Amazing Place!
597755745.author: a TripAdvisor user
597755745.reviewBody: If you come to La Paz you have to go here. Enjoyed watching the sea lion colony and the baby seals were adorable!

597491873.name: Great beach to have lunch
597491873.author: a TripAdvisor user
597491873.reviewBody: We had lunch there after snorkeling in Esp\u00edritu Santo. It was peaceful and the bay was like a pool. There is a popular beach inside the bay with parked cars. We were taken by our boat guide to the right most beach.

597397455.name: Beautiful of course!
597397455.author: a TripAdvisor user
597397455.reviewBody: You can\'t go wrong - even when it\'s stifling hot - it\'s simply stunning. The beaches and the wildlife abound and the area proves interesting for exploration. During summer snorkelling is like wading in soup....so you don\'t have to wear too much.

595218793.name: This area is worth the time to visit
595218793.author: a TripAdvisor user
595218793.reviewBody: Isla Espiritu Santo is a nature preserve area for snorkeling, swimming, and hanging out on the beach. We saw a variety of the local sea life including manta rays, schools of fish jumping out of the water, various kinds of tropical fish, the sea lion pups and adults. The area is best explored with a knowledgeable local or a knowledgeable tour guide who can answer any questions about the area or the licenses needed while in the area visiting.  There were a many people in the area visiting with their own boats and docked in the area open water and adjacent to the land to get to the shores to enjoy the beaches or have a nice picnic under the their shade tent under the sun. The area was just awesome.

592789877.name: National Park Perfection.
592789877.author: a TripAdvisor user
592789877.reviewBody: This is the most beautiful place you can imagine.  We chartered a small motorboat from the mainland skippered by two nice locals.  It\u2019s a beautiful ride out to the island and the island experience itself does not disappoint.  The island is so pristine, the water is so incredibly turquoise, the sea birds abundant.  We stopped once for a short hike around the island, then enjoyed a picnic lunch on the beach.  Later we stopped again for snorkeling off the boat where we enjoyed tropical fish and healthy coral.  On the way home, I felt like bursting into song\u2014the beauty is magical.  A truly lifetime experience.

592599513.name: Breathtaking!
592599513.author: a TripAdvisor user
592599513.reviewBody: I\'ve been to Espiritu Santo Island about five times and I\'m still amazed by how beautiful this place is. I\'ve been to all continents and traveled around the world, and can safely say that Espiritu Santo Island is one of my favorite spots in the world. I\'ve done this tour with three companies already, and the best (hands-down) is "Espiritu Baja Tours". Their staff is amazing, their Tour Guides are very knowledgeable and provide the best service a tour company can provide.

590607930.name: It\'s like swimming in an aquarium
590607930.author: a TripAdvisor user
590607930.reviewBody: Every time we\'re in La Paz, we make a quick trip out to the island at least one of the days.  Love swimming on the various reefs and seeing all the sea life.  Truly a spectacular place and worth its status as a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

583879480.name: A must do trip to the island
583879480.author: a TripAdvisor user
583879480.reviewBody: I have taken this trip to Esp\u00edritu Santo twice already. Both experiences where a little different. It is an all day excursion, about 8 hrs with one good meal included which is seafood (ceviche and sandwiches) First time was October 2017 & second visit was April 2018. October was very hot and warm waters. April is overcast and cold waters. Best time for me personally is warm weather between June and November. But we did see more wild life during cold season. We saw hump whales, dolphins, sea turtles, mantarays, and even a random goat in a deserted island!    The tourist guides are wonderful explaining history from one island to another. Swimming and snorkeling in the island is so much fun! They take you to a nearby beach Ensenada Grande which is Beautiful, Crystal clear aqua blue waters to chill, swim, and snorkel if you wish. Many beautiful pics!! Definitely a must do when visiting La Paz, BCS!!

583420709.name: Great price; AMAZING experience with Club Cantamar
583420709.author: a TripAdvisor user
583420709.reviewBody:
We chose Cantamar for our Isla Espiritu Santo trip because they were the most affordable option.. and boy it did not disappoint! We got a hotel pick-up and drop-off (from the middle of Zona Central) before and after the trip and the guides were extremely knowledgable and nice. My parter and I were the only English-speakers on board but Rodrigo made sure to translate everything for us - even his funny jokes & stories! He knows so much about the geological structures and history behind the area, and is amazing at making you feel welcome onboard!

A lot of tours I've been on will have you glimpse wildlife from afar. I was so surprised that not this! We actually swam in and around the sea lion colonies.. the majestic creatures swam under and around us.. one even swam up and lightly bit my finger before realizing I wasn't so tasty. The sea lion experience was very up close and personal!

We went in the end of May, so we did not get to see any whale sharks but instead, we saw many flying mantas! We saw so many schools of them jumping in the sea!

After the sea lion swim, we had an awesome lunch on board and got to spend time on a beautiful beach. The crew brought umbrellas for us to sit under.. as it was the middle of the afternoon and extremely hot. Afterwards, we had fresh fruit and cookies passed around on the way back.

All in all, an amazing experience for an amazing price. We felt so well-taken care of the entire way through! 100% would do it again!

P.S. We went on a weekend so it was more busy and a bigger boat was used. I think a weekday tour may be even better.. more sea lion attention, and I believe a smaller boat means that lunch can be eaten on the beach itself (as opposed to on the boat)!

581547881.name: Awesome!
581547881.author: a TripAdvisor user
581547881.reviewBody: One of the things you need to do when you are in the area, either Cabo or La Paz, is to hire a local guided tour to take you to Espiritu Santo island. Of course they will take you to "La Lobera" which is he place where you are going to find the Marine wolfs, and dive/snorkel there and play with them. Then the tour should take you to the best beaches in the Espiritu Santo island, candelabro, calaveras are top beaches there. Definitely a must do when in Baja California Sur.

581093839.name: Swimming with a Sea Lion Colony
581093839.author: a TripAdvisor user
581093839.reviewBody: My experience went from being terrified to swim with sea lions to being in complete awe of these beautiful creatures. It was truly magical.

580694259.name: Not what we though
580694259.author: a TripAdvisor user
580694259.reviewBody: The sea lions were awesome, but the tours we looked into only give you about 45 minutes in the water with them.  We thought we would get to explore the island a little, but all you get to do is sit on a small "beach" on the edge of the island for an hour and a half.  Definitely not worth $100+.  Find a tour company closer to the island, and make sure you know what is involved in the 6-8 hour tour.

580671235.name: Camping in Paradise!
580671235.author: a TripAdvisor user
580671235.reviewBody: We took a fishing adventure trip with Mar Y Adventures - we camped on the beach, fished all day, kayaked in the evening and went for a hike.  We had the cove to ourselves other than a sailing boat out in the water.  \n\nSo much wildlife in the water - we saw turtles, rays, sea lions, moray eels, whales and all kinds of fish?  Beautiful spot.

578162295.name: Great spot for eco-tourism
578162295.author: a TripAdvisor user
578162295.reviewBody: Highly recommended to take a day trip to Espiritu Santo. However, you can save as much as half price if you bargain with touts near the pier instead of booking fro overpriced agencies like Cantomar. Also, Mexican guides insist that you\'ll wear life vests when swimming with sea lions, which makes swimming much harder. That was an unpleasant surprise.

576833464.name: swim with the sea lions
576833464.author: a TripAdvisor user
576833464.reviewBody: Dive with the whale sharks, amazing and a real thrill. Swim with the sea lions and the pups come right up to you and want to play

576615940.name: Do this!
576615940.author: a TripAdvisor user
576615940.reviewBody: The waters are amazing shades of blue and green, you can swim with sea lions and whale sharks, then dine on pretty deserted idyllic beaches.  I used Red Travel to book the boat excursion, their guides are very knowledgeable and provide you with an excellent day.

575840283.name: Spent a week kayaking around the island.
575840283.author: a TripAdvisor user
575840283.reviewBody: We joined Baja Outdoor Adventures on a guided trip around the island. Leah is an amazing guide, cook, snorkeller and hiker. The highlight is snorkeling with the sea lion pups. But there are lovely beaches, good hikes, and lots to see and do. Worth the trip!

574273549.name: Swimming with sea lions!
574273549.author: a TripAdvisor user
574273549.reviewBody: Yes, it\'s true.  We enjoy encounters with marine life, and this was a highlight.  It is a bit of a trek to get out to the sea lions, but worth it.

573851914.name: Amazing nature
573851914.author: a TripAdvisor user
573851914.reviewBody: I went with Punta Baja Tours and Capitan Piolin. They were really great and very knowledgeable about marine life and nature. In the return he stopped to find whales and we met one (although is not high season anymore). All colors nature and animals that you see are fantastic. Lots of Sea Lions. Trip can be bumpy and with chilly winds, but even though it is great.

572718237.name: Bonanza
572718237.author: a TripAdvisor user
572718237.reviewBody: We camped on the large, sweeping Bonanza beach.  Wonderful location on the east side of the island.  Lots of marine life sighted on the way - mantas, mobulas, sea lions, turtles.

571492046.name: Cute playful Sea Lions!
571492046.author: a TripAdvisor user
571492046.reviewBody: Make sure to keep your arms at your sides as you play with these fun pups! they are like puppies wanting to nip and chew :)

571111287.name: Anchored at Carleta Pardida
571111287.author: a TripAdvisor user
571111287.reviewBody: Spent the Easter weekend at anchor in this beautiful place.  Great snorkeling at the reef and crystal clear water for swimming and diving.

567790802.name: National park island
567790802.author: a TripAdvisor user
567790802.reviewBody: Beautiful island wirh kayaking, paddleboarding, over night camping.  The island is primitive and pristine.  Visit for a day or longer.

566675858.name: Beautiful day
566675858.author: a TripAdvisor user
566675858.reviewBody: A national park designated for obvious reasons. It is a beautiful island that is very unique in its colours. The rock formations are incredible and the surrounding sea is amazing. The turtles love this protected area. The sea lions are amazing and if you take a tour, you can swim with them. I recommend using On Board Baja tour company.

565899046.name: Swimming with sea lions
565899046.author: a TripAdvisor user
565899046.reviewBody: Espiritu Santo is just off the the coast from La Paz. The trip takes you past the beautiful Balandra Bay. At the furthest tip of the Island you have a chance to swim with sea lions. Or you can book a trip to spend a week kayaking around the island.

565668269.name: Worth a trip
565668269.author: a TripAdvisor user
565668269.reviewBody: Absolutely fabulous day out. Book through Baja Adventures. We didn\u2019t have a waterproof camera - strongly advise!

565169382.name: Wonderful
565169382.author: a TripAdvisor user
565169382.reviewBody: This is one of the most beautiful places I have ever seen!  The combination of desert and ocean is breathtaking.  And swimming with the sea lions is great fun!

564739620.name: Spiritual, Emotional Experience
564739620.author: a TripAdvisor user
564739620.reviewBody: From the beauty of the rock formations in the morning light, the little ringtailed cats, figs and old cactus...moonlight on the ocean shore. Snorkel with diverse fish populations in warm water, and seals! I spent the entire 3 days in AWE of the beauty of the land, the sea and the sky. Go. No matter what it takes, spend the night on the island.

564037058.name: Unspoiled island
564037058.author: a TripAdvisor user
564037058.reviewBody: We took a day tour to this beautiful island on a windy and not to warm day. Even though the weather was not fantastic, the trip and the whole experience there was worth it. You are able to see nature at its best and untouched by tourists since most of the island  is protected by the government. White sandy beaches with aqua color waters. There is a  colorful reef with many different kinds of fishes.

562798404.name: A must do in La Paz
562798404.author: a TripAdvisor user
562798404.reviewBody: If you\'re going to La Paz you HAVE to visit this place and swim with sea lions. It\'s cold a long way to get there, but worth it.

562392545.name: Red rocks where plates collide
562392545.author: a TripAdvisor user
562392545.reviewBody: Dramatic landscape. Beautiful. Like parts of US southwest but with tricolor water and trade winds. Boat trip to get there. Snorkel with sea lions. Glamp if your budget permits. Leave from costa Baja or la Paz.

561784611.name: Amazing  experience and beauty!
561784611.author: a TripAdvisor user
561784611.reviewBody: This is a must see if visiting La Paz. On your boat trip to the island, which takes about 40 minutes from La Paz, you might be lucky enough to see some whales breach or observe dolphins.frolicking through the water. After following the western shore line north and stopping off at the frigate bird colony, you will reach a few small ragged  rock formations, Las Islotes,inhabited by the southernmost California seal colony. You can snorkel, dive and frolick with the pups. Although the water might be cold, it is still a very rewarding experience. Returning to La Paz along the eastern side of the island you will see some amazing rock formations and colours of both volcanic and igneous rock formations. We were entertained by a school of dolphins at the permanent  fisherman\u2019s camp. This island is a true gem and if you are able to do a one week sea kayaking expedition along the west shore, you will have an incredible experience!

561777563.name: Kayaking, hiking and snorkelling
561777563.author: a TripAdvisor user
561777563.reviewBody: Amazing scenery, great kayaking, a little strenuous at times, camping, swimming with the sea lions was amazing!! We went with ROW and had an amazing time.

561312283.name: Isla Esp\u00edritu Santo and sea lions
561312283.author: a TripAdvisor user
561312283.reviewBody: Beautiful! It was a wonderful experience. Our tour guide was very nice and knowledgeable. Our tour included lunch and drinks. Everyone should go it a hidden paradise.

560962519.name: Amazing Sea Life
560962519.author: a TripAdvisor user
560962519.reviewBody: We spent 4 days kayaking and snorkelling Isla Partida and Espiritu Santo.  Swam with Sea Lions (guided Tour with Mar Y Adventuras - a very professional and helpful outfitter, guide and hotel service in La Paz) We snorkelled with sea Turtles, saw manta rays, sting rays, and all kinds of birds, fish and crabs. We even had a ring tailed cat visit our camp one night. There were wonderful sunsets, private beautiful beaches, hiking trails, corral reefs and phosphorescent sea water.  Of course if you are less lucky with the weather it won\'t be the same experience, the boat shuttle from La Paz is about an hour and the windy season is November to June so expect a wet and bumpy shuttle, but this place is totally worth it.  Please go there and if you find a Go Pro in Playa Gallo Bay with some awesome video of sea turtles on it please help it find its way back to me. :-)

560886358.name: Private 7hour charter
560886358.author: a TripAdvisor user
560886358.reviewBody: There were 4 of us so we did a private charter. We fished, had lunch at a small cove, saw the sea lions and thoroughly enjoyed our day with Raul.

560340149.name: Coast to coast wellness tour
560340149.author: a TripAdvisor user
560340149.reviewBody: Fabulous camp site, kayaking and nature with mar y aventuras! Loved it. Isla Espiritu Santo was magical and just one part of the tour. The setting, kayaking and snorkeling was wonderful and staff was excellent as well.

558860781.name: Beautiful place to visit
558860781.author: a TripAdvisor user
558860781.reviewBody: Please take care of the nature, it is beautiful but every time I come back I see more trash on the island. I hope all can save this nature beauty.

558154504.name: Beautiful Island
558154504.author: a TripAdvisor user
558154504.reviewBody: Esp\u00edritu Santo is breathtaking.  The boat ride out to the island was really lovely too.  But this highlight is spending time viewing the wildlife (sea lions, birds, etc.) and enjoying the beautiful, sandy beach.  The landscape of the island is so impressive and the water surrounding it is incredibly clear and clean.  It was wonderful to swim in the warm (it was late Jan.) water in the bay.

558002017.name: Glamping at its best
558002017.author: a TripAdvisor user
558002017.reviewBody: Spent three nights on the island. Snorkeling, fishing, kayaking and hiking.  A lovely trip.  Our guides were very knowledgeable about the history, land, plants and animals. Great experience. Highly recommend if you can. Snorkeling with the whale sharks and sea lions.

557421866.name: Beautiful Island
557421866.author: a TripAdvisor user
557421866.reviewBody: I took a week long vacation with the tour group Mar y Adventura (Sea and Adventures) and had an amazing time.  I highly recommend this group. Everything was perfect.  The food was amazing. We snorkeled a couple of sites - lots of fish, coral, etc. Swam with the sea lions - boy are they fun and fast.  Swam with whale sharks - huge, beautiful and majestic fish. A great hike. Lots of birds.  Water is clear and blue!

556021337.name: Danny Tours was so fun!
556021337.author: a TripAdvisor user
556021337.reviewBody: Danny tours offered us the best rate. Our group of 4 girls were not interested in the whale shark part (we\'re chicken) but we wanted to see the island. They accommodated our request to be dropped off at Ensenada beach while the rest of the guests went snorkeling. They exceeded our expectations. Very friendly, safe, knowledgeable and courteous. Ceviche and beer was everything I hoped for in Baja. We got so much more than our money\'s worth. We all want to do this again.

555909043.name: Day boat trip to Esp\u00edritu Santo, near La Paz, BC
555909043.author: a TripAdvisor user
555909043.reviewBody: Last day in La Paz so we got up early and signed on for a boat trip. 800 pesos p.p.  Set off not too late, just 15 mins ... at 10:45. am which doesn\u2019t qualify as unpunctual in Mexico! We were a contingent of about six adults & a few kids.  After about 45 mins we collected two other families from a nearby beach and set off. No toilet on this boat. But the posher boats do appear to have a \u201cporta-loo\u201d contraption at the stern.  Two or three of the guests had their own wet suits. There were flippers & snorkels provided for those who wished to swim with sea lions.   Do bring a hoodie or fleece for the journey out. It gets cold with speed of boat/wind. Guests were wrapped in their towels. It was uncomfortably nippy (but not on the return). We ate lunch (provided) at an empty beach, very pretty:  cheese & ham rolls & a very good ceviche, fresh fruit & soft drinks.  Back around 5 pm. A pleasant, if at times, noisy & bumpy, but definitely recommended.

555031461.name: Mar Y Aventuras - snorkeling with sea lions at Los Islotes.
555031461.author: a TripAdvisor user
555031461.reviewBody: Benjamin was a very knowledgeable guide.  Alejandro was an excellent driver.  We saw whale sharks in La Paz Bay.  The sea lion pups were very active and I got kissed on the mask.  The fish in the area are plentiful and beautiful.  Our lunch at camp on Espiritu Santo Island was fantastic. Alejandro made the fresh ceviche.  We snorkeled at a Coral reef and saw lots of fish and coral.  On the way home we saw a humpback whale breaching.  We could not have asked for better guides.

554502464.name: Delightful time snorkeling/swimming with sea lions
554502464.author: a TripAdvisor user
554502464.reviewBody: Great day trip out of La Paz - nice staff, good service, great lunch and knowledgeable guide, Dorian from Desconocida Tour Company.  Juan, captain of boat also very friendly and safe.

553880705.name: Mar y Aventuras Adventure!
553880705.author: a TripAdvisor user
553880705.reviewBody: Bucket list check! Swam with the sea lions and Kayaked beautiful bays. Stellar scenery and wildlife sightings!!!

553558906.name: bucket list group trip
553558906.author: a TripAdvisor user
553558906.reviewBody: Came to Espiritu Santo on a guided group trip. Its a national park, so you have to pay a small fee & get a special wristband (Im not sure how; our trip leaders did it). Weather is incredible; snorkeling is great, like being in an aquarium.  Best part was snorkeling near a sea lion colony! In January we needed wet suits to snorkel, but most of the year you dont.

553251262.name: Awesome place!
553251262.author: a TripAdvisor user
553251262.reviewBody: I have been doing kayaking trips and stays on Espiritu Santo for 30 years and never get tired of it.  A little slice of Paradise so close to La Paz.  Swimming with Sea Lions, fishing, snorkeling, all great.  My favorite is to book a trip with Mar Y Aventuras out of La Paz - have done several with them and they are superb.

551570600.name: La Paz, Isla Esp\u00edritu Santo and other surroundings
551570600.author: a TripAdvisor user
551570600.reviewBody: Island Esp\u00edritu Santo, La Paz and other surroundings. Our flight arrived very early at La Paz, Baja California Sur. We left our things at Hotel Catedral and went for a wonderful breakfast at DoceCuarenta, Casa de Caf\u00e9. Hotel Catedral is three  blocks away from the beach, and is quite nice, clean, functional and its service is good. The first day we had a nice surprise called Whale\u00b4s Museum. This place is in front of the seaside and there we could see enourmous skeletons of whales.  A video said that whales and hoppopotamus are far away cousins as evolution can say. And also in the Museum they had several other skeletons of whales, some big turtle shells and even a reproduction of several types of sharks. Yes, Baja California has been a place of whales since many years ago. Next day we drove to Balandra Beach, which is very calm and with a marvellous view. Fo rus the w\u00e1ter in December was very cold, so we walked around the beach, enjoyed the sights, took a good sunbath and drove 10 minutes to El Tecolote Beach to have something to eat. Balandra Beach is a natural reserve so there are no constructions on the site. In El Tecolote I had three \u201ctostadas de ceviche de pescado\u201d that made happy my belly and gave me strenght to wait until dinner. The day was so relaxed, and the only important noise was the one of the strong waves of El Tecolote. Oh, in Balandara there was only complete delicious calmness that you could feel it when the sea was toching your feet. In the car we rented we drove to Todos Santos to take a look at Hotel California. We noticed that the Hotel is still there while its song is everywhere. The visit was nice. Next day we went to Isla Esp\u00edritu Santo. You do not see it from the bay of La Paz, and on our way  had the company of several groups of dolphins. We were also lucky, because we saw three whales. Two of them showed us their tails and the other one only its back. When we arrived to the end of the island we saw the colony of sea lions. From afar we heard their noises. I do not know if all of them have some throat problem, but I am sure that the gutural sound they made came from that part of their body. Most of the people of the boat went swimming close to the sea lions. Before returning to La Paz the boat went to a small beach of Isla Esp\u00edritu Santo that was very nice, even nicer than Balandra Beach.  In our last day in La Paz we drove south La Paz to Bah\u00eda de Muertos also known as Bah\u00eda de Sue\u00f1os. A wonderful sight of the bay, and alos a place where fishing boats were coming and going. The not so good parto f it is that although the beach very nice and calm it is not good place for swimming because of the bunch of small rocks that is where the sea touches the sand. There again you could feel the calmness of the place with your feet when the sea tocuhed them. From Bah\u00eda de Muertos we drove to Bah\u00eda de Ventanas. Ah!, here the story is different. We were received by a huge feast of kitesurfers. The wind was blowing very hard and this made it posible to see too many kites in the sky next to the beach. I do not know, but may be there were more than one hundred kitesurfers of differnet colors in the sea at the same time and you could see how the  kites moved, sometimes softly and sometimes quickly, with the wind from one place to the other. I enjoyed very much my visit to La Paz and its sorroundings. Places to eat: La Paz and its sorroundings has very good and even wonderful places for having a lunch. DoceCuarenta Caf\u00e9 turned out to be a first world class bakery. Then Bismark_sito in La Paz was also a good place for lunch. There I had two toasts (tostadas) of ceviche de pescado (fish ceviche) and a red snapper cooked in the frying pan. Here part of one side of the fish stick a little to the pan, but this detail did not spoil its softness and flavour. Then there were the toasts de ceviche de pescado at El Tecolotle. In Todos Santos we went to the restaurant called  El Sinaloense, and here I had a red snapper with a wonderful chili chipotle sauce that was not hot. I strongly recommend it. Well, the climax came in Bah\u00eda Ventanas in a place called Las Palmas. There I had a garlic \u201ccabrilla\u201d fish. I think that this kind of local fish and the way they prepare it was outstanding. There I also had another fish ceviche that was also wonderful, but this one was in a cup and not in toasts. I can tell that I will go back to La Paz because I enjoyed the place and its surroundings very much and also because I want to go back to Bah\u00eda Ventanas and have once again the \u201ccabrilla\u201d fish and also the fish ceviche they prepare there. After eating too much I know that I will have to wait 15 or more minutes to be able to move again, and thinking that in that momento I am like a big whale that came up to the sea surface for fresh air and then goes back into the the deep sea looking for more food.

551483392.name: Fantastic Snorkeling, Some of The Best
551483392.author: a TripAdvisor user
551483392.reviewBody: This place by far was some of the best snorkeling for sea lions and other aquatic life that I have experienced in the last 2 decades.  Superb!! The sea lion juveniles are quite playful and so curious. Not bashful at all.  Many varieties of fish life and other invertebrates will be seen and so colorful.  Water temperatures during our visit was cool enough that we wore wet suits. Highly Recommended.

551295862.name: Absolutely worth it!
551295862.author: a TripAdvisor user
551295862.reviewBody: Awesome trip, our guide Sebastian was insanely knowledgeable! Super friendly, answered questions, and spoke very good English! Highly recommend this trip. You start by taking a long boat ride to an area with sea lions who you snorkle with, then you go to part of the island that they have a camp on, get fed AMAZING ceviche and cervecas, where you can snorkle more, kayak, and hike. A seriously great time for the whole family, even my 2 and 5 y.o. nieces enjoyed it thoroughly!

550764518.name: Please go here, I was the highlight of our trip
550764518.author: a TripAdvisor user
550764518.reviewBody: We saw sea lions, kayaked and enjoyed the primitive beach area.   The water was clear and there was plenty of ocean related wild life to see.

550402348.name: Great Island with unique landscape
550402348.author: a TripAdvisor user
550402348.reviewBody: We had a great tour of the island and its unique features. the landscape is pretty cool and we got to see a lot of wildlife. if you plan on a visit make sure you use Mexplore tours as they did a great job for us.

550328341.name: Fantastic geography!
550328341.author: a TripAdvisor user
550328341.reviewBody: Took a boat tour to the top of the island (to where the sea lions have a colony), and then tried to snorkel.  However, the current was WAY to powerful, so don\'t be surprised if you have to skip this part of the trip.  Cruised 1/2 back down the island, and then stopped for lunch on the beach.  We actually had to take a taxi from the mainland, as we stayed out too late on a tour boat with no lights!  But....got to see the most AMAZING sunset in the process - I think the best I have ever seen!  The geography & geology of the island is so varied, and you can see it all from your boat - not a lot of places to go ashore, but the boat goes along the entire shoreline.

550210559.name: Once in a lifetime experience
550210559.author: a TripAdvisor user
550210559.reviewBody: Swimming with the Sea lions was one of the best experiences ever.  You also see many endangered bird species and breathtaking beaches. A must if you are in La Paz.  We highly recommend Espiritu & Baja Tours to take you there. The guides really educate you and give you the best possible experience of the island.

550103255.name: Incredible Experience
550103255.author: a TripAdvisor user
550103255.reviewBody: This place is simply amazing! I visited and dove two days in a row. The sea lion pups are a pleasure to play with. They are so full of energy and love to interact! A check off my bucket list! I will remember forever. I was able to get excellent footage. Make sure you dive with these amazing animals!

549828534.name: Nice boat ride, no snorkeling
549828534.author: a TripAdvisor user
549828534.reviewBody: Well we expected to be taken to a few secluded coves for some snorkeling where people don\'t impact the water.  We left La Paz at 11 and continued to ride past the entire island, past beautiful beaches and coves with obvious nice formations to snorkel.  I said to myself " wow this is a long ride - if we are passing these up we must be going somewhere really great."  After 2.5 hours we finally drive all the way past the entire island to a little rock in the ocean. Several boats are already there.  The guide who spoke no english had us jump in the water together, travel to the rock where we saw a few sea lions, then back on the boat in under 20 minutes. I tried to linger and see some fish but was hurried back on the boat. Then we thought we were being tern to another beach to snorkel but was dropped on a beach where we were served delicious ceviche. We spent the rest of the day standing around the beach, then a 2 hour ride back to La Paz. \nApparently it\'s more of a sight seeing thing than snorkeling as we were in a boat for 7 hours and spent 20 minutes snorkeling. The guides were nice but explained nothing to us and provided no information (in english at least).  \nThe day was nice, we saw some dolphins and whales, and the people were nice but they shouldn\'t call it "snorkeling".

548518895.name: Swim with the sea lions!
548518895.author: a TripAdvisor user
548518895.reviewBody: Highly recommended to take a trip out to Espiratu Santo and Isla Partida to see beautiful, remote, deserted beaches and swim with the sea lions.  If you are lucky, your guide will find a few whale sharks to swim with too along the way.

547376845.name: Simply spectacular
547376845.author: a TripAdvisor user
547376845.reviewBody: This dive absolutely lives up to the hype. 25 feet of water or so and loads of extremely playful sea lions pups. It\'s worth a trip to La Paz just to dive here.

547184973.name: Sea Lions Everywhere!
547184973.author: a TripAdvisor user
547184973.reviewBody: Took a boat tour to Isla Espiritu Santo. It was awesome! There is a huge colony of sea lions there! With the tour we took we were able to get in the ocean and swim near where the sea lion pups play! It\'s fun to watch them zip around in the water playing with each other. If you are lucky enough they might come and play with you too. If you are an ocean/ animal lover this is a must see!

545077715.name: Can\'t wait to get back!
545077715.author: a TripAdvisor user
545077715.reviewBody: So beautiful - we did a one day boat tour and are already thinking about going back and trying to camp here.

544875577.name: Pristine, clear water, clean beaches, incredible tropical fish.
544875577.author: a TripAdvisor user
544875577.reviewBody: Declared part of a Biosphere Reserve by UNESCO in 1995 the water was 82 degrees in November, air temp high 80s to low 70s at night.  Gorgeous beaches, sunsets, fantastic snorkeling.

544674376.name: Better Than Expected
544674376.author: a TripAdvisor user
544674376.reviewBody: Booked an excursion through Sun Rider from our hotel (Royal Solaris) to visit Isla Espiritu Santo. Note this is an all day trip, leaving the hotel around 7:30 a.m., and returning 12 hours later. I was a little apprehensive at first, because snorkeling with seals didn\'t really sound very exciting, as I live in an area where we see seals all the time. But we were told it also included snorkeling elsewhere where we\'d see fish and coral. \nIt didn\'t disappoint. It does take approx. 3 hours to get to La Paz, and although the only word utter by our driver was "Banos" approx. 45 minutes into our trip, we were in a small van with approx. 12 other people, so it was a pleasant enough drive visiting with other trip goers. Once at La Paz, you stop at the Sun Rider office to be fitted for snorkel fins and mask (we brought our own) and note it wasn\'t mentioned when we booked this at the hotel, but there is a $5 per person fee to go out to the island. Our tour guide Sam was great, his buddy didn\'t say much, not sure if there was a language issue, but Sam was great at explaining what we were seeing, etc. on the way out. Once out to where we were suppose to get in the water to snorkel with seals, the ocean was too rough, and we couldn\'t go into the water. However we then went to the 2nd stop of the day, which was a beautiful cove (to ourselves!) everyone but my husband and I wanted to eat lunch first instead of jumping into this gorgeous crystal clear Sea of Cortez. My husband & I snorkeled and we did see fish and coral, not a ton, but enough to impress. Once we got back to the boat, everyone had eaten any food provided, but that was fine, we weren\'t\' there to eat (we\'re staying at an all-inclusive with all you can eat and drink) and we\'d brought our own snacks and they had bottled water so no biggy. We actually stayed there for quite some time, which was very nice, most excursions give you like 20 minutes and you need to get back in the boat, we were there easily an hour and half. Then we headed to a different area that wasn\'t so choppy and were able to get in the water to snorkel with the seals. Although there wasn\'t as many seals, it was still very fun to actually swim with them. Once back at La Paz, on the way back to the hotel, our driver made a detour and we stopped at the Hotel California, (to use the banos of coarse) but also to see the hotel, which was an unexpected plus. I haven\'t done a lot of excursions, only because we are usually very disappointed in them-too many people, not enough time, etc.,  but I would highly recommend this one. It went above and beyond what we were expecting. Anxious to go back to the Sea of Cortez.

544291394.name: Go with Alonso Tours for this stunning experience!
544291394.author: a TripAdvisor user
544291394.reviewBody: IG: suinaknows \n\nA simply stunning and amazing experience visiting this UNESCO Biosphere Reserve. We went with Alonso Tours and everything was well organized and professional! Our guides also provided great history of this reserve. We got to see many birds, swimming with sea lions with guides, and some beach time at the clearest and cleanest beach ever. Alonso Tours provided a delicious homemade ceviche lunch made by the staffs.  Everyone visiting La Paz should go visit this beauty with Alonso Tours!

541575932.name: Nature at it\'s best
541575932.author: a TripAdvisor user
541575932.reviewBody: Spent one day touring and had a swim and picnic on a nice beach .\nIf your in La Paz it\'s the one place you must visit..lots of wildlife can be seen

540959438.name: Eco Tour
540959438.author: a TripAdvisor user
540959438.reviewBody: Great Island to visit and swim with the Sea Lions! Its a day trip by boat with lunch on a nearby island.

538694825.name: Great dive
538694825.author: a TripAdvisor user
538694825.reviewBody: Dived here off the Valentina and had great fun with the sea lions. You do need to be careful and respect them. They will show you by barking if you get too close but we kept our distance and they approached us!  Nibbled our fins and were very playful - a great experience.

537522998.name: Aweeee
537522998.author: a TripAdvisor user
537522998.reviewBody: I visited Isla couple of times, once during a snorkeling tour and once scuba diving. When we went snorkeling, we had booked our excursion with Alonso Tours in which due to high winds we were unable to reach Loberias. Loberias its the larger colony with sea lions. Overall, Espiritu Santo it\'s a wonderful inhabited island with great ecosystem in the middle of Sea of Cortez. For the nature lover, I would highly recommend it. Scuba diving was fascinating.

535531940.name: Amazing Island
535531940.author: a TripAdvisor user
535531940.reviewBody: Isla Espiritu Santu is definitely worth a trip. It has beautiful virgin beaches, great diving and snorkeling spots and gives you the opportunity to go play with Sea Lions.\n\nDo not go to La Paz without going to Espiritu Santu.

534147857.name: Breathtaking Place!
534147857.author: a TripAdvisor user
534147857.reviewBody: Calm waters, nature, beautiful beaches... you can\'t miss this experience. I highly recommend taking this tour with On Board Baja Tours.

532895674.name: Played with Sea Lions
532895674.author: a TripAdvisor user
532895674.reviewBody: Can play with sea lions with snorkel or scuba. But must go in October when the sea lions are there. Also saw lots of fish while scuba diving. Definitely worth the trip.

530657345.name: A day of fun
530657345.author: a TripAdvisor user
530657345.reviewBody: Nice snorkeling , warm and clear water.The sea loins were a little shy. There were a lot of sea lion pups on the island. It was a nice excursion.

530069426.name: Stunning landscapes
530069426.author: a TripAdvisor user
530069426.reviewBody:
We took a boat cruise on a panga stopping to see the dolphins play, the sea lions lazing on the rocks, snorkel amongst the fish and Balandra beach.

We've been told that La Paz is very green at the moment. The cactus, flowers and varied landscape is just stunning.

Strongly recommend this for a day trip.

529203854.name: Highly recommend a snorkeling/diving trip.
529203854.author: a TripAdvisor user
529203854.reviewBody: We boated all along the south and east sides as we were heading out on a fishing trip. It\'s so pristine. The rock formations and water close to the shoreline are beautiful.\nThen we went on a snorkeling trip, traveling the west side, and snorkeled with the sea lions on the north end. We had lunch on a secluded beach in a cove. More snorkeling there; I had a school of sardines dart all around me and saw a group of needlefish in addition to the plant life in the water. Beautiful island, especially if the boat captains/staff can tell you more about it.

528834557.name: Natural reserve, ton of sea life
528834557.author: a TripAdvisor user
528834557.reviewBody: Beautiful island in the middle of a natural reserve. Totally worth a day trip there (camping might be even better).\n\nWe went for snorkel with Red Travel and it couldn\'t have been better!

527459900.name: Climate Change Made This Island Even More Beautiful
527459900.author: a TripAdvisor user
527459900.reviewBody: Thanks Tectonics! Thanks Global Shmobel!  This is a beautiful island and since it\'s not scheduled for development anytime soon, we\'ll be able to enjoy the view of it on our horizon and cruise around it on a magnificent day.

527141621.name: Wonderful sea lion colony>
527141621.author: a TripAdvisor user
527141621.reviewBody: The island of Espiritu Santo is about a half an hours boat ride from the center of La Paz. The sea lion colony at Espiritu Santo Island  at the northern end of Espiritu Santo is around an hour and a half boat ride. I would siggest if you want to have the best experience it is important to go early and miss the crowds. The island it self has some wonderful opportunities to spend a few nights camping and walking around the island which is a magical place full of history. It is best to go with a guide who know the island well and he or she will be able to expanded the basic  local knowledge that you average boat may or may not have.If you are not going for a stay on the island be prepared for an all day trip which usually includes a picnic at Ensenada Grande after you have snorkeled with the sealions. If you want to dive make sure you go with one of the licensed operators as there are restrictions governing visiting the  area as it is a protected area and you will be obliged to pay a small fee to be able to go there. A wrist band should be issued to you by the operator which you should wear throughout your visit just in case the authorities decide to check your boat. For me it is one of the real jewels of a visit to La Paz and in spite of the regulation you will have a wonderful time either snorkelling or diving with the sealions. There are plenty of them and you are guaranteed to see and swim with them with out any problems. Just note that if you are planning a trip the colony is closed during the mating season of July and August when there is a danger of aggressive males being not too friendly to visitors who they see as a threat to their territory.

522708517.name: Beautiful place, clear beaches, white sand. Lovely.
522708517.author: a TripAdvisor user
522708517.reviewBody: It was the best part of our trip! The clear water made it so easy to snorkel. It was great to learn about the history of the island. We had the best guides (Sergio and Raul) at Espiritu Baja Tours.

520950675.name: Sea lions snorkeling prohibited...\u30a2\u30b7\u30ab\u30b9\u30a4\u30e0\u306b\u5236\u9650\u304c\u30fb\u30fb\u30fb
520950675.author: a TripAdvisor user
520950675.reviewBody:
夏休みの行先をラパスに決めたのは、アシカシュノーケリングに参加するため！だったのですが・・・
直前に「アシカシュノーケリング禁止」となってしまいました。。。なんでもルールを守らず岩場に登ったりしてアシカに噛まれる事故が起きたらしく、８月いっぱいまでは禁止になったとのこと（９月以降は解除されると聞きました）。
そのため急きょダイビングに変更。結果、１０歳の子供も体験ダイビングでアシカに会うことができました！それはそれですごくいい体験でした。
人間の側が彼らのテリトリーを侵さず、きちんとルールを守って自然を楽しめるよう、配慮が必要だと改めて思いました。

We decided to go to La Paz to do snorkeling with sea lions, but it was prohibited during our stay...It will be permnitted again in September (so I heared, not sure).
So we decided to go diving instead of snorkeling, and it was fantastic!
For my 10years old son, it was the first diving. But no plobrem at all. He really enjoyed cute sea lions.
I hope, all visitors must respect natures and do not invade their territorry.

515722470.name: Amazing but watch out the weather
515722470.author: a TripAdvisor user
515722470.reviewBody: This place is heaven but make sure is sunny day to apreciate all the colours!\nIf is cloudy is just another breach out of the others.\nYou cannot swim with sea lions from june to september (ask the guide the right period ti do so)

510985038.name: Fishing
510985038.author: a TripAdvisor user
510985038.reviewBody: Excellent fishing with Baja Pirates of La Paz, BCS.  Captains speak English and are very capable at finding, hooking and help landing fish.

509863436.name: IT HAS BEEN SHUT DOWN
509863436.author: a TripAdvisor user
509863436.reviewBody: Two weeks ago a girl was bit by one of the sea lions and the government has shut down Islotes, the Sea Lion colony on Espiritu Santo, to boats until the end of the breeding and young pup season.  Don\'t go, boats still take out tourists but just to a couple of mediocre snorkel sites and viewing the sea lions from a distance.

509111148.name: what a treat
509111148.author: a TripAdvisor user
509111148.reviewBody: we were not sure if going but it was worth it.. took the boat  from the beach around 60 round trip with lunch included... dont miss this trip and swing with the sealions..

508226531.name: Beautiful!!!
508226531.author: a TripAdvisor user
508226531.reviewBody: We took a tour out to the island and it was beautiful and amazing!! The beaches there empty because the only way to get to them is by boat. The travel there is about an hour away from El Malecon, but absolutely worth it!!! The water is crystal blue!!

504637895.name: amazing experience/sleight disappointment
504637895.author: a TripAdvisor user
504637895.reviewBody: The day we went (7/20/17) expecting to swim with the sea lions the park rangers had (for the first time ever) decided not to allow people to swim with the sea lions in this protected area.  Our guide said he has been snorkeling there 50+ times without issue, but apparently in the past few days there had been issues about the big males fighting in the water in front of snorkelers + apparently one person got quite a good bite in the side from one of them.  So with three reported animal/human issues in a row the rangers closed it off at short notice to snorkelers.  Our guides were great + took us to other areas to snorkel, and then lastly to snorkel closer to La Paz where there is a small area where there are mostly juvenile sea lions one can swim with...it was still a really amazing experience. The island is fantastic to see in general + seeing the main area with the sea lions is spectacular. Julio Baylon of Nautilus Dive tech out of Cabo, + Dellis Montuy of Marlin Adventures out of La Paz were our guides - they + their companies are so nice, accommodating, knowledgeable + are highly recommended.

503741615.name: Kind of wild
503741615.author: a TripAdvisor user
503741615.reviewBody: Well, swimming surrounded by sea lions was pretty excited. The only warning is when the guide start yelling"the male lion is around you and is mad"!!! Gosh I never swim as fast as that day.

503007550.name: Wonderful island
503007550.author: a TripAdvisor user
503007550.reviewBody: It is a jewel of nature, I had never seen such a beautiful island and sonrkel safely and admire the surroundings ... worth spending some time there and just make the trip to expend some time there

501691908.name: Snorkeling
501691908.author: a TripAdvisor user
501691908.reviewBody:
It was awesome!! We enjoy the view and the marine life ...

Fue asombroso!! Nosotros disfrutamos la vista y la vida marina...

Super!!

499018339.name: A natural aquarium setting .... along with world class beaches
499018339.author: a TripAdvisor user
499018339.reviewBody: It is a very unique place.  Not only for the diversity of the sea life that is in abundance but also because its amazing beaches!  A must see place when in southern Baja.

498980174.name: Swimming with sea lions in the ocean beats swimming with dolphins in a pool any day
498980174.author: a TripAdvisor user
498980174.reviewBody: We booked our Isla tour directly with the vendor out at El Tecolote beach and we had a great time. Departed at 11am and returned at 5:30pm.  Capt. Boa and Negro were really nice and outdid themselves to be sure we had a great time. Swimming with the sea lions was amazing, but that was only part of the tour. We also stopped at Ensenada Grande beach for a picnic lunch and had the place to ourselves. They brought umbrellas, drinks and ceviche and we stayed there for at least an hour. On the return, we made another deep water snorkeling stop. All in all, a great time and a great day.

498889106.name: omg sea lions!!
498889106.author: a TripAdvisor user
498889106.reviewBody: Swimming and petting sea lions is such an incredible experience.  The snorkeling is also excellent. Saw HUGE parrot fish, grouper, angel fish and more.

494995701.name: Just WOW,
494995701.author: a TripAdvisor user
494995701.reviewBody: These islands are unspoiled and beautiful. I am so happy that aI was able to experience this beauty. Thank you God!

494783775.name: Private tour is the only way to go
494783775.author: a TripAdvisor user
494783775.reviewBody: Explored this island and the beaches with a private captian on the boat the donpiriy and what an adventure. The captain showed us so many sites and gave incredible background and history to us. This island has so much life it\'s hard to see it all in one day.

494431077.name: Baja connection tour
494431077.author: a TripAdvisor user
494431077.reviewBody: Took a boat tour around the island of Espiritu Santo. We met this guy named Edgar on the beach in La Paz and he does tours on his boat. He took us out to the island and showed us everything it has to offer! There were a lot of sea lions out there! We also saw dolphins and dodo birds! He took us to a cemetery where the people were placed in the rocks on the cliffs right by the water. You can still see the human bones! Epic tour highly recommended!

493775367.name: Go Now!
493775367.author: a TripAdvisor user
493775367.reviewBody: scuba diving with the sea lions is a once in a lifetime experience. You have to get out there and try it, words don\'t do it justice.

493585957.name: Definitely worth doing this excursion
493585957.author: a TripAdvisor user
493585957.reviewBody: This is an amazing day trip.  Pack your sunscreen, hat and go!  My favorite thing was to swim with the sea lions.  They were playful and incredible.  This is a must!  Even thought the water was cooler than usual, i did fine for about 45 minutes without a wetsuit.

491116284.name: Cantamar <3
491116284.author: a TripAdvisor user
491116284.reviewBody: Went this May to La Paz with my mother and we went with Sergio from the Cantamar tour. Not only its a unique beautiful experience you cant miss, but also its was brilliantly and extremely professionally led by this tour company. Consider it takes a the whole morning to get to where the sea lions are and to come back stoping to have an amazing lunch in on of the virgin, protected beaches.

490837172.name: Diving with sea lions
490837172.author: a TripAdvisor user
490837172.reviewBody: Great interaction with nature. If you are an animal lover, this is a must.  Its about a 90 boat ride from La Paz. We had really bad visibility the day I was there. But there were still about 7 or 8 different sea lions swimming around my group at different times. My suggestion would be to get there earlier in the year when the pups are younger and more playful. But still had a blast.

489866262.name: Unforgettable!
489866262.author: a TripAdvisor user
489866262.reviewBody: I would highly recommend Club Cantamar Resort and Sports Centre for this trip. Competitive rate, all equipment supplied, great focus on safety and the environment, but above all the staff were excellent and did everything they could to make our excursion memorable.

489494958.name: Snorkel sea lions + picnic on beach with DANY
489494958.author: a TripAdvisor user
489494958.reviewBody: We asked several organizers and chose DANY. very good price (way lower than the 2+thousand marketed by others),  captain Richard and his assistant (oops, forgot his name) were very professional, serious to apply the safety rules. Boat stopped at several places on the way to show the bays, the rocks etc.  Worth the trip and the price. No need to pay twice the price. We snorkeled close to the seal lions who preferred to stay on the rocks. Only a few did swim under or next to us but it was surely worth it anyway.

488750782.name: Spectacular
488750782.author: a TripAdvisor user
488750782.reviewBody: This is a place for all the family. Incredible place to do snorkel, swimming, and relax under the sun!! \nSpectacular views! Definitely a place to visit and do camping in the specified areas!

488602794.name: One of the best days of my life!
488602794.author: a TripAdvisor user
488602794.reviewBody: We joined a tour departing from Playa Tecolote. The tour lasted almost 6 hours and was simply AMAZING! The island is HUGE. We saw dolfins and flying rays on the way to the island. We toured around the island on the boat and made several stops. First we swam with sea lions, then we snorkeled in a coral reed and finally we rested in a gorgeous and incredibly peaceful beach.

486696178.name: Snorkeling
486696178.author: a TripAdvisor user
486696178.reviewBody: Club Cantamar is the best place to go diving and snorkeling with. The staff is the best, including George, Julie and Pollo.

486601681.name: sea lions  and sea life
486601681.author: a TripAdvisor user
486601681.reviewBody: Best adventure ever, On Board Baja was amazing, swam with sea lions, lottos fish and coral to see. Ask for Stefanie

485200748.name: Swim with the sea lions!
485200748.author: a TripAdvisor user
485200748.reviewBody: Beautiful trip to the island. Snorkeling with the sea lions is breathtaking. Highlight of the trip to La Paz.

485072781.name: Take a tour
485072781.author: a TripAdvisor user
485072781.reviewBody: When with Baja Outdoor Adventures. Snorkeled with the sea lions and kayaked. Excellent. It is a protected island and a world heritage site.

483760970.name: A Must See!!
483760970.author: a TripAdvisor user
483760970.reviewBody: World heritage site, and gorgeous.   We have gone five times now, and it never ceases to amaze me the beauty of the place.

481917619.name: Flyboy
481917619.author: a TripAdvisor user
481917619.reviewBody:
Visited via a charter sailboat 

Each individual Bay has something to offer, but mostly quiet, secluded enjoyable nights on the water 

Fresh fish available from a fish camp in between Isla Todos Santos & Isla Partida

481389112.name: Swim with the sea lions
481389112.author: a TripAdvisor user
481389112.reviewBody: We LOVED this. Got to snorkel and see the lovely fish and swim with sea lions. As SF Bay residents we found it quite amusing to be offered wetsuits when the water temperature was 74, because that feels like bath water...absolutely gorgeous.

481135411.name: Wedding Anniversary
481135411.author: a TripAdvisor user
481135411.reviewBody:
A little jewel hidden in La Paz, look for Lobito tour and ask for Edgar. You will love it, they also feed you on the tour...
Espiritu Santo is a breath taking paradise. 🐚🦈🐋🐠🐳
We also saw mom and baby whale along with dolphins,  sea lions,  huge turtle and the snorkeling was the cherry on the cake. 

🐳🐋🐠🐚🦈👌👍

480683708.name: Coolest thing to do in La Paz
480683708.author: a TripAdvisor user
480683708.reviewBody: Diving or snorkling with the sealions is absolutely fantastic. Make sure to go with a company that prioritizes animal wellfare. We tried both Club Cantemar and Bucep Carey and both where good. The pups come very close and are so playful and will (softly) bite your fingers and some will snuggle right up to you in the surface, hoping for a bellyrub. Remember it is wild, free animals and close encounters are not guranteed.

478673863.name: Kayaking Bliss
478673863.author: a TripAdvisor user
478673863.reviewBody: Kayaking, swimming and snorkeling in these crystal clear waters is pure bliss.  We saw sea lions, whales, many types of birds and were awaken by a band of wild goats.

478361770.name: A highlight of our trip
478361770.author: a TripAdvisor user
478361770.reviewBody: We went on a day trip to Isla Espiritu Santo with Baja Outdoor Activities.  Snorkel with sea lions, kayak, and just enjoy the beauty of the island.  If you are in La Paz, this should be at the top of your list!  Although I do not love camping, I would consider a multi-day return visit.  According to our guide, for warmer water visit at the end of summer, up to the first week in November.

476572566.name: a dream realised
476572566.author: a TripAdvisor user
476572566.reviewBody: could it be possible that we swam in the clearest water with sealions cavorting around, even bumping into you, while a National Geographic expedition ship is moored in the background?\nBeautiful, beautiful - stuff to make memories for old age.\nluckily its protected - park guards come to check licenses and you pay a fee with your tour - make sure you go with a reputable company

476111333.name: Got to go
476111333.author: a TripAdvisor user
476111333.reviewBody:
Big island near La Paz, you can have a tour arranged and go for the day or stay overnight.
A lots of beaches to attend and there are a few sea lions colony's to   Watch or snorkel.

475147652.name: Beautiful Sunsets!
