475147652.author: a TripAdvisor user
475147652.reviewBody: GLAMPING at it\'s best. Can\'t begin to explain how good the food was. Our own 5 star chef, cooking three great meals a day. We snorkeled with whale sharks and sea lions! Kayaking was limited because of high winds, but the staff found plenty of other things to do. Did a couple of beautiful hikes with the staff. Their local knowledge was readily apparent.

474402117.name: If you are traveling to la paz...there are TWO MUSTS to do...ONE:Espiritu de Santo
474402117.author: a TripAdvisor user
474402117.reviewBody: I live in cabo--two hours away from la paz.  I try to make the trip out to Espiritu de Santo at least 4 times a year.  Even though I have done it dozens of times, swimming with sea lions is one of my favorite things to do when I snorkel.  There is nothing quite like it.\n\nThe island is uniquely stunning, with some of the most beautiful beaches in the world.  You have a lot of a lot of options to go with different outfits...I always go with a smaller outfit---the boat owner is named Rogelio.   You can do the island at about $300 for a full super panga.  (plan to add a tip to it)

473949048.name: Off the hook
473949048.author: a TripAdvisor user
473949048.reviewBody: The best day ever of snorkeling I have ever had and I have over 100 dives. We saw whale sharks, sea lions, mobula rays jumping out of the water and clear blue water.

473873028.name: Swimming with sea lions
473873028.author: a TripAdvisor user
473873028.reviewBody: It was extraordinary to swim and play in water with little sea lions!\nCabo Adventure guide Alex made sure we are safe and enjoy interaction with sea lions as close as possible while photographer Chris took unforgettable pictures under the water!

473429934.name: Go with Espiritu Baja Tours!
473429934.author: a TripAdvisor user
473429934.reviewBody: We went on three tours with Espiritu Baja Tour Company, and were more than satisfied with their knowledge, friendliness, and professionalism. This tour is not only about snorkeling with their smalller-than-Northwest-Coast sea lions. We were outfitted with wet suits and life jackets for the boat ride across the Bay of La Paz to the sea lion rookery. Bottle-nosed dolphins accompanied us on our way. We stopped at several historic sites (e.g. pearl harvesting) and a frigate rookery. Our capitan, Saul, guided us skillfully through a rock arch, and our snorkeling guide, Raul, gave excellent instructions about how to respect the animals we were visiting to get the most of our time in the water. I can\'t describe how it felt to actually stroke a young sea lion, stretched out across Raul\'s arms like a puppy inviting us to touch!  After returning to the boat, we went to a nearby beach for a delicious lunch of fish seviche tacos, and a standard North American sandwich option. At $85US dollars, this 6-hour trip was well worth the price. \n

473240966.name: Beautiful Island surrounded by beautiful sea
473240966.author: a TripAdvisor user
473240966.reviewBody: Natural beauty on and around the island. Fantastic colors. Great kayaking, snorkeling and hiking. Great experience with Mar y Aventuras and their extremely knowledgeable and capable guide, Miguel and staff.

473050376.name: Our favorite short cruising destination
473050376.author: a TripAdvisor user
473050376.reviewBody: It\'s about 5 hours cruise for us out of La Paz.  The higher speed tour boats take about two hours each way.   We often anchor inside Balandra Bay overnight on the way out.  Further in route I have spotted a colossal sperm whale, drawn here by the giant Humbolt Squid.  There are dozens of coves and reefs with good snorkeling.  Fishing and cruising require permits that are easily obtained at Marina La Paz.   When leaving our regular anchorage in La Partida, a collapsed cinder cone, we have been accompanied by leaping manta rays.  The charm of cruising slowly and quietly is in the sea life you encounter, porpoise, flying fish, turtles, and sea lions.

472791389.name: Loved it !!!
472791389.author: a TripAdvisor user
472791389.reviewBody: If you do anything near La Paz, take a trip up to La Isla Espiritu Santo .. you won\'t regret it!  We swam with sea lions, saw loads of other animals, and had a great lunch too.

471772724.name: Rare Unspoiled Nature for the most part
471772724.author: a TripAdvisor user
471772724.reviewBody: Just awesome.  everything from stunning anchorages with few boats to a great reveal on nature how it should be viewed.  we saw incredible sealions, Manta Rays jumping out of the water, schools of many fish at reefs, fishing pelicans and frigate birds, turtles. crabs on beach migrations but the 1000\'s, incredible hiking and bird watching.  Best weather anchorages in the area as well, very well protected no matter the weather and swells if you are smart.

471202069.name: Drift diving santos
471202069.author: a TripAdvisor user
471202069.reviewBody:
Diving off Island Cat amazing!!
I spent the day diving off the island...Great photo oops.
I've been diving all over the planet...Old x diver...This was an amazing wonderful moment to remember...Just gorgeous coral...Untouched...
Breakfast if bacon n scrambled eggs...Pancakes...Fruit..Pineapple...Cappachino....Best lunch.
Most of all the crew magnificent to​o!!!! Marianna bless y...Chris amazing...Leo bandito I learned so much gracias .
All day pleasure...What a diver wants ... In gorgeous water ...
Clear visibility...Quiet time in
Underwaterworld...I will be bk
Thanks..Mahalo..

471033388.name: Beautiful landscape and swimming with sea life!
471033388.author: a TripAdvisor user
471033388.reviewBody: The islands are so barren, but yet sea life is thriving. It\'s a beautiful area. Join a tour and you will get to swim with sealions, kayak, and even stay on the islands.\n\nThe part that most blew me away are the school of flying rays. I haven\'t seen such a big school elsewhere, and it is a gorgeous and strangely calming sight. Something I won\'t forget for time to come.

470966783.name: Take a day-boat tour to this beautiful spot to snorkel with sea lions
470966783.author: a TripAdvisor user
470966783.reviewBody: This beautiful marine reserve merits a visit, even though it\'s difficult to get to. You have to book a boat tour to snorkel with sea lions. However it\'s worth it! Unspoiled marine site where you can see and snorkel with fish and sea lions.

470621509.name: Life changing
470621509.author: a TripAdvisor user
470621509.reviewBody: Beautiful, tranquil, stunning....this is heaven on earth, with so many beautiful sights and sightings....how lucky we are to have visited a place like this one!

468424969.name: Great to visit
468424969.author: a TripAdvisor user
468424969.reviewBody: We spent 4 days and 3 nights on a trip to Isla Espiritu organized by Fun Baja -- it was one of the very best trips I\'ve ever been on. If you are at the stage in your life where you still want to experience real, wild Nature, but without having to really tough it, this trip with Fun Baja is a GREAT choice. Besides the stunningly beautiful setting of the camp, and the excellent day trips each day, and the fabulous (really fabulous) food, the best thing about Fun Baja were the people who work there: Juan, Adrian, Salvador, and Jose were terrific company and took great care of us. Juan is an especially wonderful guide, and Adrian an incredible cook. Thanks Fun Baja for being the most memorable part of our trip to Baja.

467967426.name: lots of sea lions
467967426.author: a TripAdvisor user
467967426.reviewBody: We swam and played with sea lions, which was really incredible. The area was very clean and not spoiled by tourists at all. The sea lions didn\'t seem to mind us being there and the pups actually played with us just like a dog would. Our guide was very good at showing us how to interact with them and was very gentle with the pups.

467915495.name: Quiet, remote, and beautiful
467915495.author: a TripAdvisor user
467915495.reviewBody: What a great spot!  We did a "glamping" trip with an outfitter and loved it.  There are numerous bays for snorkeling, a few good hiking spots, and great opportunities for viewing sea lions and mobula rays.

467420881.name: Good Destination
467420881.author: a TripAdvisor user
467420881.reviewBody: The trip to Isla Espiritu Santo is very long so if it is a cool, windy day I would not recommend it.  The day we went was cold, windy and the swimming was not pleasant.  I think it might be a good trip in the middle of summer, we visited in February of last year (drop down did not support that date)

467067626.name: Isla EspirituIt
467067626.author: a TripAdvisor user
467067626.reviewBody: Was quite a long boat ride to visit the sea lions who unfortunately didn\'t cooperate the day we visited. I would have been more disappointed had a not swum with them at another sight.\nThe day was rescued by a huge pod of dolphins, playing along side  and in front of the boat. Another beautiful encounter with nature!.\n

466666665.name: NatGeo Wild
466666665.author: a TripAdvisor user
466666665.reviewBody: Do this tour and include the whale shark component. We swam with sea lion pups, amazing. So interactive. It was great to see them swim up to your face stare you in the eyes and then dart off, exhilarating! Lunch on the island was also a nice treat.

466309757.name: First scuba experience, best place to try this sport.
466309757.author: a TripAdvisor user
466309757.reviewBody:
I have had scuba diving on my 'list' for many years, and I'm not getting any younger, so what better time to combine two great experiences. I used Dive in La Paz (reviewed by others), and I had a great, safe, memorable day. The island is a about 90 minutes by boat (take sun screen, hat, jacket and dry clothes), it does seem a long time, but if you are diving (or snorkeling) some time will be taken up with the technical stuff, like how to stay alive.
There are lots of seals at the island and depending upon the season, lots of fish, but I saw no coral.
The young seals are just crazy, the swim right up to your face mask, and love to play in the bubbles from the mouth piece. They will tug at your fins and nibble you fist, but do not bite. Suggest not offering them any fingers though.
Seasons will vary the bird life (I'm not an expert), but I think just a boat trip would be boring. Dive La Paz instructor was so patient and took no chances, helping with every little detail, nothing was too much trouble.
Had two dive sessions / tanks and that was plenty for a beginner,
So go to the island but try snorkelling or scuba as well. The added bonus was lunch on a beach only accessible by boat, you will get your feet wet. A great day out!!

465697854.name: Fun time swimming with sealife
465697854.author: a TripAdvisor user
465697854.reviewBody: We had a great day with Mar y Adventures going to Esp\u00edrito Santo. The water was cool but our wet suits helped with that and the sea life is unbelievable out at the colony. Don\'t hesitate, book your trip today.

464622632.name: Awesome day trip!
464622632.author: a TripAdvisor user
464622632.reviewBody: We started out at 9:30am and we\'re back around 5pm. We first had a tour of the island and islands along the way. It was great to swim with the sea lions, go to a small beach nearby and have lunch. On the way back we were lucky to see a couple of humpback whales. Awesome experience for all (we went with 2 kids under 10).

464174227.name: Swim with the sea lions
464174227.author: a TripAdvisor user
464174227.reviewBody: If you can afford it - go with a smaller boat.  We had a total of 7 people on our boat = less people to swim around with, and your boat can go closer to the rocky shore.  We saw large boats dumping off 30 or so people at a time.  The fish are larger than the ones you see along the shorelines.  But, too many visitors go to this location.

464163420.name: amazing nature reserve
464163420.author: a TripAdvisor user
464163420.reviewBody: loved snorkeling with the sea lion pups and kayaking the island from north to south.  Mangroves were so peaceful to explore and everyone we met was very friendly, lots of sharing as you camp on the island with no stores :)

463875874.name: Swim and snorkeling
463875874.author: a TripAdvisor user
463875874.reviewBody: What a great place to take a tour to, it was excellent. The variety of the landscape can been seen so well from the boat and there was many wonderful things to see. Take a tour with Eduardo\'s they did a great job of finding interesting things and explained the varied animals and sea life.

463340337.name: Tips for snorkelling with sea lions
463340337.author: a TripAdvisor user
463340337.reviewBody:
Enjoy the encounter with these playful animals as it is a truly amazing experience, but do it wisely and prioritize well-being of the sea lions as these are wild animals. Below are some of the most important guidelines to follow - these should be a part of your briefing before you get into the warer:
- the boat/ kayak should be anchored at least 30m from the island
- do not climb the rocks 
- do not aproach the rocks closer than 5m
- when you snorkel with the sea lions stay pasive, don't make unexpected movements, let the sea lions see you and record your presence
- don't chase the animals to take the perfect picture, instead let them come to you
- aviod making loud noises or using strong light
- be wary of the alfa males as they can be very territorial in the mating season
- young sea lions can be very playful - they may come to you and try to catch your fin or your hand with their mouth like puppies do. This may cause some scratches - when they try to grab your hand, tight your fists so thet your fingers don't stick out and stay calm - they are only playing 
- when an adult sea lion comes to you and makes some air bubbles into your face it is a warning sign to step out
Hope you will find these tips helpful. Enjoy your time with sea lions on isle Espiritu/ Los Islotes, La Paz, Mexico!

463273465.name: beautiful island and beaches
463273465.author: a TripAdvisor user
463273465.reviewBody: Make sure to book a boat to get to this island. It will take a full day. The beaches are lovely and a chance to swim with the sea lions is one you don\'t want to pass up. Water was very cold in February; I would suggest a wet suit. Several companies make this trip and our local host said they offered very similar itineraries. Go on the calmest day possible!

462825104.name: Beautiful Day But Pick Your Guides Well
462825104.author: a TripAdvisor user
462825104.reviewBody:
I would love to do this again but would not go with the same guide - the ones that pick up from the hotel go all the way around so I think I'd rather go and meet the guide and get out earlier on the water (we didn't leave until after 11am).  Other boats seem to go a lot earlier.

One guide I spoke to said "you have to wear a wetsuit because of the coral and rocks."  I don't know, our guide said it was optional and another 100 pesos (I also paid more than another person who had booked direct - another 100 pesos) but I got one because I got so cold the day before on the whale shark tour (there's a reason all the guides wear them - it gets very cold on those boats, especially when they pick up speed).

Having said that it's a great tour, the sea lions are so friendly, there is coral and fish aplenty in the area and the beach we stopped on on the way back was delightful.  Other people on my tour said that it was the best ceviche they'd ever tasted - I was doing my best to be vegan, so ate some beans out of a bag (they were very nice!)

I will say that our guide did a fantastic job of translating everything into Spanish even though I was the only english speaker - although by the end giving him a reaction to everything was a bit tiring and I felt like I was letting him down by not being super enthusiastic about all the rock shapes (it had been a long day!)

462736988.name: Boat trip gives excellent tour of this island.
462736988.author: a TripAdvisor user
462736988.reviewBody: Good way to enjoy being on the beautiful Sea Of Cortez. Will see abundant wildlife, eat lunch on beautiful beach swim with the sea liins.These adventure tours to swim with sea lions or whale sharks are a little more strenuous then you might know ahead of time. In Feb water is freezing cold even with we suit on. The swims 4eqyire vigorous swimming to keep up with the animals and or manage current. But that also keeps you warm. Our group had an unusual occurrence with sea lion getting on woman\'s vack,nipping her around hips, Scared her badly. Our group was not violating their terrrirory.  It pays to always remember the sea liins are wild and not pets. We enjoyed how curious they were and how fast of swimmers they are.

462117001.name: Beutiful cruise
462117001.author: a TripAdvisor user
462117001.reviewBody: Cruised out to Isla Espiritu Santo with a sailboat from La Paz. I was impressed with the remoteness and complete absence of any sort of commercialisation. Vast bays with only a boat or two on anchor in what is supposed to be high season. Only dissapontment that tere wasn\'t much of the advertised wildlife to be seen. Excellent place to really chill out and fill up your batteries.

461830191.name: fun
461830191.author: a TripAdvisor user
461830191.reviewBody: We arranged a tour out of Pichilingue Beach to Isla Espritu Santo.  Our guide was very knowledgeable and spoke English.  The trip was a nice mix of Spanish and English speakers.  We snorkeled with some baby sea lions.  And the ceviche served on a nearby beach was delicious.

460501865.name: Do not take a panga from La Paz
460501865.author: a TripAdvisor user
460501865.reviewBody: You are looking at about 4 hours on a bumpy, uncomfortable, wet, cold (even on a hot day), windy boat. I talked to other travelers on other tours who had similar opinions.

460415280.name: Cortez Expeditions- Best way to see this place!
460415280.author: a TripAdvisor user
460415280.reviewBody: The sea Lions are beautiful creatures but should be protected. If you are going to go here and do it the right way please please pick Cortez Expeditions and have Luke Inman show you the ropes on how to interact with wild beneath the surface!

460178577.name: If You Do ONE THING in La Paz...
460178577.author: a TripAdvisor user
460178577.reviewBody:
Take a day trip to Isla Espiritu Santo. If you can combine it with a stop to swim with the whale sharks, even better! We did them separately.

Our guide took us to a nice snorkeling beach, then on to swim with the sea lions, with a few birding stops along the way. There is a place where birds from the Galapagos migrate, and we did spot one blue footed booby. Also a frigate bird rookery, where we saw great mating displays. The highlight was being in the water with the sea lions, and tons of fish! All this before lunch, when we dined on fresh ceviche and sipped cold beers on a beach all to ourselves. Amazing.

You will need a wetsuit. The water is cold. We went in February, and were glad our trip left early (8:30 am vs 10:30 am of other operators). The wind comes up in the afternoon. Bring layers. I popped on light fleece for the fast, splashy ride back to port.

459903791.name: barking sea lions!!!
459903791.author: a TripAdvisor user
459903791.reviewBody:
swimming with the babies of sea lions is an incredible experience!!
and the wonderful  beach ! going with the boat and looking dolphins running around you!

459653737.name: Sea Lions Stink- Fact
459653737.author: a TripAdvisor user
459653737.reviewBody:
Despite the title we had an incredible day doing this boat tour. The guide was knowledgeable and passionate about the environment.
 Its a speed boat rather than a slow touring boat out for a day that you might expect in Europe. It was really cold due to the speed. Take layers.
The tour is well planned and you can see lots of the island) and natural surrounds ( from the boat).
The water is point blank freezing ( its a long way out to sea and Winter) We could only rent summer wet suits ( do not attempt without it- a few on our boat were brave but lasted a very short time) not that a tour operator is going to mention it but there are jellyfish so a winter suit much better if you have one or able to get one. I got stung but nothing in comparison to my Australian days with blue bottles.
The sea lions are so engaging if not remarkably smelly. The fish were fantastic.
You get to thaw out for a decent knock up simple lunch on a lovely beach underneath the pink cliffs. Not a bad day out for 40 quid!
An adventure.

459358349.name: One of my top wildlife encounters!
459358349.author: a TripAdvisor user
459358349.reviewBody: My daughters and I went on a trip to Isla Espiritu Santo with a stop over in La Paz harbor for whale sharks. At Isla Espiritu I was scuba diving and my girls were snorkeling.  We all had an unbelievably fantastic experience!  Yes, I was told to keep distance and not touch and I followed those directions to the t. But the sea lions are habituated to humans and dove down into the water to swim circles around me and other divers and snorkelers.  The younger ones even pulled on my fins and came up to blow bubbles into my face! And there were SO many of them - in the water and on the rocks. Usually this trip is combined with a stop over in La Paz harbor where you can snorkel with whale sharks during the winter months (Dec to about Feb).  The first time I did this (Dec 2014), there was just one whale shark but it was still a phenomenal experience. The second time I did this trip (Jan 2017), there were probably about 8-12 whale sharks all feeding in the same area.  Again, it was hard to keep the required distance because the whale sharks were gliding up right next to me, completely focused on feeding on plankton - wide open mouths, sinuous, long, dappled bodies.  It was just breathtaking and unforgettable!

459253736.name: Sea Lions, Whales, Turtles, Flying Manta-Rays, Lunch on the Beach & More!
459253736.author: a TripAdvisor user
459253736.reviewBody: Unbelievable experience! A sea lion came up to play with me and then kissed me with her whiskers! Definitely rent a wetsuit. The water out at the island is much cooler and there can be some current to deal with. Our captain & guide stopped for all kinds of wildlife viewing & natural history lessons and were never in a hurry. Lunch on the beach after snorkeling was delightful. Beautiful location and warm calm water for kids (and adults) to enjoy. We got back to port as the sun was setting and the full moon was rising. I booked my trip through Las Gaviotas Resort. The captain picked me up and returned me directly to the hotel. Because the Las Gaviotas owners are local, they are able to get a great price on this full day trip. Our boat had 20 passengers and about half of us snorkeled. The other folks stayed onboard & viewed the sea lions from the boat.

459218954.name: Fabulous place to snorkel
459218954.author: a TripAdvisor user
459218954.reviewBody: This island is inhabited by California sea lions. On a smooth water day, it is a fabulous place to snorkel. Watch the sea lions in action above and below the water. They are playful and will come right up to you. And there are plenty of tropical colorful fish to enjoy. Get there however, but don\'t miss this beautiful natural treasure.

459148208.name: Beautiful natural environment
459148208.author: a TripAdvisor user
459148208.reviewBody: The island\'s pink, orange and black rock strata and secluded white sand beached would be enough reason to visit. The waters around the island are crystal clear and on the way there we spotted two whales, a pod of dolphins, a turtle and manta rays jumping out of the water. We also visited a colony of frigate birds and the sea lions that live on the northernmost tip of the island (but we did not go in the water because it was freezing, I suspect the ideal time to do this would be the summer). This place is a naturalist\'s heaven (the National Geographic ship was anchored near the sea lion colony). This tour is a must if you come to La Paz.

459027976.name: Swim with sea lions - but don\'t touch
459027976.author: a TripAdvisor user
459027976.reviewBody: We went with Esp\u00edritu Tours from La Paz. Great tour guide and boat captain...and amazing up-close views of wildlife. \n\nThey stopped at several islands in the Esp\u00edritu archipelago so we could see blue footed boobies, a magnificent frigate bird rookery, and the sea lion colony lounging on the rocks, well as swim with the sea lion pups. Very knowledgeable guide who was careful to remind the group to respect and protect the animals and environment.

458734939.name: Wildlife galore
458734939.author: a TripAdvisor user
458734939.reviewBody: A fantastic place to swim with sea-lions, explore the national park and view lots of wildlife.\n\nCheck before booking what your boat is licensed for, not all have the permits for snorkelling or diving.

457950397.name: Beautiful Beach
457950397.author: a TripAdvisor user
457950397.reviewBody: We stopped here to have lunch while on a tour with VIP whale shark tours. The beach is absolutely gorgeous.

457753269.name: Baja Outdoor Activities (BOA)
457753269.author: a TripAdvisor user
457753269.reviewBody: EVERYTHING WAS AMAZING!!! Last week I went on a fully catered trip with BOA around the beautiful island of Espiritu Santo! Every single meal was delish from freshly caught trigger fish ceviche to Nopales (a cactus and steak dish), kayaking amongst mangrove trees filled with 100s of birds, swimming with sea lions, laying under the stars with a group of amazing individuals, watching the sunset over mainland Mexico with nothing but the sea of Cortez in between, swimming alongside a whale shark in the bay of La Paz... the list goes on! Thank you to Mario for being such a great informative guide along with everyone at the office! 10/10

457145242.name: Camp if you can
457145242.author: a TripAdvisor user
457145242.reviewBody: A group of 10 of us spent 5 days and 4 nights on Isla Spiritu Santo and had a trip of a lifetime in January with Mar y Aventuras.   Our guides were Marco, Hugo, and Moira.   We got to swim with the whale sharks and sea lions.  We also went sea kayaking, snorkeling and hiking.  The camp was in a beautiful, shallow bay called El Candelero.  We had spectacular sunsets every night.  Each night we got visits from the Babisuri--ring-tailed cat/raccoon.   If you got up in the middle of the night, you could see the bioluminescents in the water.  One evening Marco gave us a astronomy lesson and he pointed out many constellations in the sky.  The entire crew was friendly and helpful and made us feel right at home.  They kept us entertained, gave us many interesting talks and answered questions.  I absolutely recommend this trip to others.  Mar y Aventuras is a great company and a pleasure to work with.   Highly recommend them.   Our weather was a little chilly but bring everything on their list and you will be fine.  All of us hope too come back and do more kayaking with these great guides.

454866091.name: Beautiful island
454866091.author: a TripAdvisor user
454866091.reviewBody: Our family took a daytrip here with Dani\'s tours and we loved it.  If you show up at the dock in the morning the day of the tour you will get a good price.  I don\'t recommend paying in advance.  We paid $200 total for thr boat for the whole day for 3 kids and 2 adults.  We got to pet the friendly sea lions and take the boat around the island.  The water is carribean clear here.  We also stopped at a wonderful beach for lunch.  The kids loved the trip and so did we.

453210390.name: Swimming with seal lions!!
453210390.author: a TripAdvisor user
453210390.reviewBody:
Had a wonderful day out on the boat taking in the scenery and snorkelling with seal lions!! Well worth booking a tour to spend the day on the water. Our tour guide was very knowledgable about the history of the area and about the wildlife.
It was quite chilly - we hired wet suits but they only had short summer suits - full ones would have made the water more bareable!
Stopped at a beautiful little beach for a late lunch of ceviche/sandwiches and soft drinks then was glad to have some warm layers to wrap up in for the journey back!!
The trip is pretty much all on the water taking in the scenery so not great if you get sea-sick and were expecting to go to an island for the day!

452788943.name: beautiful white sands beaches
452788943.author: a TripAdvisor user
452788943.reviewBody: wow trip from la paz...must do if you are in the area...swim with sea lions, birdwatching, snorkelling, have lunch in a beautiful beach

452106157.name: Amazinggggg
452106157.author: a TripAdvisor user
452106157.reviewBody: You have to go!\nWe swim with sealions! Such a great experience! The tour was amazing, a little long to get there but tottally worth the trip! We took Baja tours and the crew was professionnal :)

452013282.name: Worth the visit.  Lovely.
452013282.author: a TripAdvisor user
452013282.reviewBody: We had a lovely excursion here.  Highly recommend the sea lion snorkel. Really fun.  Lovely peaceful island. If you go from tecolate beach ,it\'s much cheaper.

451536195.name: Glamping Adventure!
451536195.author: a TripAdvisor user
451536195.reviewBody: We booked our amazing trip through Eco Adventures- great company, great guides, great food! On the way to the island we stopped to swim with huge whale sharks. This island is so beautiful. We snorkeled, swam with sea lions, hiked and ate gourmet food.

451481195.name: Sea Lions!
451481195.author: a TripAdvisor user
451481195.reviewBody: So much fun to see the sea lions frolicking in the waters and the scenery here is incredibly beautiful. Highly recommend visiting.

451293816.name: Can\'t beat these sea lions
451293816.author: a TripAdvisor user
451293816.reviewBody: I went here with five friends with Cortez Expeditions, and we had a fabulous time. Half of us are divers, half snorkelers, and tons of fun was had by all. We were there in early January so the water wasn\'t particularly toasty (73F), and there were definitely some jellies in the water, but we pulled on wetsuits and hopped in the water and had two great days with the sea lions. These graceful, curious animals will come right up to you and the younger ones will actively play with you by pulling on your fins, gently chewing on your hands, and in my case, sticking my entire hair bun into their mouths to see if it came off. Hilarious! They were a pleasure to be in the water with and I would highly recommend visiting this gem of Espiritu Santo. As an underwater photographer, there are endless opportunities for getting beautiful shots. I\'ll be returning next time I\'m there for sure.

451003740.name: Fun Snorkel with Sea Lions
451003740.author: a TripAdvisor user
451003740.reviewBody: This tour is a great activity even if you don\'t get in the water. The scenery and wildlife is amazing. Snorkeling with the sea lions is worth the effort, they come right up to you. You\'ll also see  many tropical fish, so colorful. Even though I was there in the winter, the water and air temperature is warm and comfortable.

450580456.name: Snorkeling with sea lions was hilarious
450580456.author: a TripAdvisor user
450580456.reviewBody: Funniest snorkeling ever - the sea lions were so playful. It was a long boat ride from La Paz and the sea was a bit rough, that was the only downside. The island beach is absolutely breath taking.

450058778.name: A gem in the middle of the Sea of Cortes
450058778.author: a TripAdvisor user
450058778.reviewBody: the colors of water and earth are amazing, it looks like grand canyon colors by the sea! I was there in winter, so the it was a little windy and some days kayaking was difficult. There are no trails to hike on the island, it newly became a protected park so maybe in the future there will be some which would be nice for exploration. Seeing the island from the water kayaking is great, nice perspectives as well as seeing fish, birds, and sea lions.

449972264.name: Incredible fish and sea life
449972264.author: a TripAdvisor user
449972264.reviewBody: Worth paying for a tour to go. Amazing snorkelling. Very unusual geographic features. Not very many people.

448604738.name: Aquarium of the world
448604738.author: a TripAdvisor user
448604738.reviewBody: Tucked in the Sea of Cortez, this magical island offers an underwater paradise available to first time snorkels as well as experienced divers.

448170871.name: Beautiful Island
448170871.author: a TripAdvisor user
448170871.reviewBody: We went with a tour that went all the way around the island, it was an amazing place, pristine, wild.  Bigger than I expected.  Swimming with the sea lions is an amazing experience!

447237380.name: Fabulous
447237380.author: a TripAdvisor user
447237380.reviewBody: This was our best day of our trip to Baja. We snorkeled with sea lions and had lunch at a beautiful beach. The scenery was amazing. On the boat ride on the way to the island, we saw whales and dolphins very close to our boat. We also so an amazing frigate bird colony. Highly recommended activity.

447154727.name: Amazing
447154727.author: a TripAdvisor user
447154727.reviewBody: Use Punta Baja reasonable rates excellent guide professional captain. swimming with sea lions how can you go wrong

446626648.name: Wild Natural Beauty
446626648.author: a TripAdvisor user
446626648.reviewBody: Incredible island, great fishing and bleakly beautiful.  About an hour out of La Paz or 20 minutes from Tecolote.  Well worth seeing and experiencing.  You will see much marine wildlife.  If you are fishing, there is a huge variety of fish around the island and always sea lions at the top end.

446481215.name: incredible and beautiful
446481215.author: a TripAdvisor user
446481215.reviewBody: Beautiful white sand beach, blue water, most incredible and beautiful. A must visit if you are in la paz.

445899171.name: An Amazing Adventure into your own Natural Aquarium
445899171.author: a TripAdvisor user
445899171.reviewBody:
Isla Espíritu Santo is one of the most amazing places i've ever been.
Once you get on your boat, the adventure is on...
Prepare your camera and your swimming suit!
Marine life is so abundant you won't believe your eyes.
The contrast of colors: the sea, the blue sky and the rock and sand formations make it a trip to remember.
So on a boat and under the sea the Island is full of beautiful surprises that will make you want to come back to discover every corner.

445848220.name: Highlight of our Trip
445848220.author: a TripAdvisor user
445848220.reviewBody: Interaction with the sea lions blew me away. We went out on a day with rough waters, but our captain (Punta Baja tours) did an excellent job getting us there and it was well worth it. Best day of my trip.

445753519.name: Highlight of the trip
445753519.author: a TripAdvisor user
445753519.reviewBody: Carol from Casa Tuscany recommended Espiritu Tours for swimming with the Whale Sharks. They are a wonderful tour  company our guides couldn\'t have been better they have a lot of respect for the sea life. I don\'t know how to swim so they took my hand and swam with me so I could have the experience of a lifetime.

445600754.name: Diving in La Paz
445600754.author: a TripAdvisor user
445600754.reviewBody: Friendly and curious sea lions, low to medium visibility, nice temperature and enough life to watch underwater.  I love the south tip and "the arc"...

444685876.name: Swim with the Sea Lions!
444685876.author: a TripAdvisor user
444685876.reviewBody: It was a windy day so the boat ride was a little rough, but it was a great trip.  Playful sea lions and a lot of fish to see.  The snorkeling stop on the way back was great!

444553661.name: Magic
444553661.author: a TripAdvisor user
444553661.reviewBody: Took the day tour around the islands and had a wonderful guide, Alan who was very knowledgable and friendly. The geology and marine life are truly breathtaking. Snorkel with the sea lions (I didn\'t love it, but everyone else did - to me they are big and scary lol). This is a MUST DO when in La Paz. Bring a jacket and towel!

442067274.name: Long day, but a memorable one
442067274.author: a TripAdvisor user
442067274.reviewBody:
If you have the time i recommend this trip, but be aware it does take all day.
On the map the Isla is quite close to the mainland, but the sealion colony is actually on a rock north of the island that's north of Isla Espiritu Santo.
Our Club Cantomar boat left an hour late and took 2 hours and 2 minutes to get there, and the same travel time back.
Plenty in our group snorkeled with life vests on, but it seemed they were still able to enjoy the experience.
One the way back we stopped in a calm bay and did another snorkel over a coral reef. That was great.
They did have food on the boat, but take your own snacks too.
Take your underwater camera as you'll want to share the experience.

441654198.name: Snorkeling with baby sea lions - no kidding
441654198.author: a TripAdvisor user
441654198.reviewBody: Amazing place - take a small Lancha from La Paz - you will not regret it. You can snorkel with baby sea lions, and the fish are numerous. Besides the sea lion rookery, there are many amazing beaches all around this island with crystal clear water.  We were there in September, and the visibility was ridiculous - maybe 90+ feet. It\'s an island with a wide variety of topologies and plenty of places to explore on both sides of the island, from caves on the eastern side, to wide fine-sand beaches on the western. There\'s even a fresh water spring with a well and a bucket to drop down for a quick shower during a hot day. An amazing place all around.

441203585.name: Sea lions are adorable!!!
441203585.author: a TripAdvisor user
441203585.reviewBody: The sea lions, sea lions, and the sea lions! They are the highlight of this island. The juveniles are extremely playful, curious, and adorable. They are like the puppies of the ocean. Be sure to stop by here if you have a chance. I was able to play around with the sea lions underwater since I dived there. But I saw them emerging out of the water to play with snorkelers as well.

440989558.name: Swimming with sea lion!
440989558.author: a TripAdvisor user
440989558.reviewBody: Swimming with sea lions??!?  How could I give that anything but 5 stars?!  The sea was very rough that day, and the staff on the charter said we might not be able to snorkel, but the sea lion colony hangs out on the side of the rock/island that is more calm and where the rocks block the rougher part of the currents. It was November, and there were many baby sea lions that swam playfully around me. I have a Sony ActionCam, and I\'m so happy to have captured the experience. So don\'t forget your GoPro etc. Also, please, PLEASE don\'t enter the water with harmful sunblocks. There are reef-safe sunblocks out there.  For the most part, all the common sunscreens are contributing to the death of the coral reefs. The specific harmful ingredients are well known now.  Google it!

440652021.name: 4 day sea kayaking and camping through Baja Outdoor Activities.
440652021.author: a TripAdvisor user
440652021.reviewBody: Awesome experience!  Beauty above and below the water.  The exercise of kayaking was rewarded each day on a white sand beach with turquoise water and wonderful food and drink.

440198148.name: Amazing island
440198148.author: a TripAdvisor user
440198148.reviewBody: It was my second time! We went with Baja expeditions to sleep 2 nights on the island and dive around! it was incredible!\nWhale sharks on the way!, snorkel and diving with sea lions! \nAmazing sunsets!

438649490.name: Sea lions
438649490.author: a TripAdvisor user
438649490.reviewBody: An incredibly beautiful island, not crowded. We swam with sea lions and it was one of the best experiences of our lives.

438476819.name: Frisky Sea Lions
438476819.author: a TripAdvisor user
438476819.reviewBody: Scuba diving with the sea lions was so much fun.  Like an underwater circus, they frolic and play and interact.  Keep your hands to yourself though, as my husband was bitten!

437880386.name: Magical as always
437880386.author: a TripAdvisor user
437880386.reviewBody: This is a terrific place every time I visit &  provides wealth of different experiences both above snd below the water. Abundant sea life and beaches. The bugs can be irritating so bring DEET or other insect repellent.

436112218.name: Must see in La Paz
436112218.author: a TripAdvisor user
436112218.reviewBody: Stunning beaches, dramatic scenery, snorkeling with sea lions and on corals - it was the best day on our Baja trip. We also did the whale shark safari before heading out to the island.\n\nEasy to organize from the Malecon - plenty of boats waiting for business there. 6000 pesos for a private trip for 4, full day including whale sharks and the island.

435976029.name: Snorkeling with sea lions was a highlight!
435976029.author: a TripAdvisor user
435976029.reviewBody: We had so much fun and the trip will be an everlasting memory. Our guide was very helpful and made sure everyone\'s experience went well.

435968998.name: Great Time Swimming with and Watching the Sea Lions
435968998.author: a TripAdvisor user
435968998.reviewBody: This was a trip we planned for several years ago, after briefly visiting and noting that the beaches near La Paz rivaled those in Cabo - but were much less populated.  We booked our boat trip right from the little shop next door to the Club Playa el Tecolote restaurant.  The trip cost under $50/person and took approximately 6 hours.  It included lunch and two snorkeling stops.  While I was a bit disappointed with the numbers/variety of fish we saw, swimming in close proximity with the Sea Lions was thrilling.   Our guide, Boa (Jose) was quite knowledgeable of the island, its bays, coves and fauna, and presented the information in an entertaining manner. He and his assistant did a good job of taking care of the passengers.  I\'d recommend the trip to any outdoor/snorkeling enthusiasts but encourage you to take a few personal snacks, as the lunches were on the light side, consisting of ceviche and simple sandwiches.

435730387.name: Wonderful Dive Experience
435730387.author: a TripAdvisor user
435730387.reviewBody: We were on a liveaboard diving our way down the West coastline of the Sea of Cortez. We had a fantastic time at Espiritu Santo diving the wreck of the Salvatierra and the bombora at Suany Reef.\nThe visibility was brilliant and the dive sites had great numbers of fish species. I loved seeing the seahorses near the ship wreck as well as some golden grouper. A highlight was when a school of around 30 Mobula Rays went past.\nGreat diving, a highlight of the trip.

435110866.name: Truly worth the long boat ride from La Paz
435110866.author: a TripAdvisor user
435110866.reviewBody: Sea lions, caverns, the best place to scuba near La Paz.  The reefs are not like the Caribbean, but there is a lot of sea life near the rocks.

434159600.name: Gorgeous
434159600.author: a TripAdvisor user
434159600.reviewBody: Well worth a trip. Nature at its best. I\'ve had three trips to this beautiful place. If you have a chance to snorkel or dive as los islotes do it! Unforgettable.

433058556.name: incredible diving
433058556.author: a TripAdvisor user
433058556.reviewBody: we loved this dive, the swim through area with the sea lions made our day. We dove with Club Cantamar and enjoyed everything  from our accommodations, to the dive crews. we will be back

432526706.name: Tour Isla Esp\u00edritu Santo - Cantamar
432526706.author: a TripAdvisor user
432526706.reviewBody: Hicimos este tour con los chicos de Cantamar, es una experiencia inolvidable. Son muy respetuosos con la naturaleza y te cuidan muy bien.\nIf you think about taking a tour to the island Esp\u00edritu Santo, do not hesitate to consider Cantamar as your best option: the guides are profesional and they do respect the nature, so you will be comfortable and happy knowing they care about not harming the environment

431540329.name: Breath taking!
431540329.author: a TripAdvisor user
431540329.reviewBody: It is a must see in Baja California. Beautiful waters and great sea life, you can see the sea lion cubs in late june!

428458512.name: Great location
428458512.author: a TripAdvisor user
428458512.reviewBody: We made a day trip here, reviewed at alonso tours. We recommend visiting the island. Ask for Raul at alonso tours.

425995178.name: Wonderful visit!
425995178.author: a TripAdvisor user
425995178.reviewBody: Took a tour with Punta Baja. Puncho, the guide, was wonderful and very informative during the whole route. The meeting with the birds and seals is very interesting and recommended. Snorkeling in the area was a great experience.

424172918.name: Nice Trip/Snorkeling
424172918.author: a TripAdvisor user
424172918.reviewBody: Took a "Fun Baja" full day trip to do some snorkeling and relaxing after a couple of days fishing.  Enjoyed the first snorkel stop at a coral "reef" but not many fish were present and the type of coral present lacked color.  Snorkeling with the sea lions was great, had a large male with-in arms length on several occasions.  Most of the pups were on the shore so didn\'t have the opportunity to experience their curiosity.  Had a nice lunch on the beach and was able to take a short hike into landscape of the island to see some of the interesting cacti. Fun Baja guide & captain did a fine job, very informative.

423368581.name: Amazing wonderful place to go scuba diving.
423368581.author: a TripAdvisor user
423368581.reviewBody: We spent two glorious days diving on Isla Espiritu Santo. Don\'t miss it. We dove with Fun Baja, can\'t recommend them highly enough.

421170435.name: Isla Espiritu santo Wow AMAZING
421170435.author: a TripAdvisor user
421170435.reviewBody: It\'s a gorgeous island with spectacular views and beaches the water is so clear with gorgeous blue tones you\'re able to see lots of fishes swimming, if you are lucky you might also see turtles there too that\'s where they lay their eggs. We felt as we were in paradise. A must do in La Paz for sure!

420628523.name: Awsome nature experience
420628523.author: a TripAdvisor user
420628523.reviewBody:
This was the most amazing natural experience I have ever been to!
There is nothing but you and nature, you take a swim with sealions, you get to see plenty of fish with your snorkel mask or you can go diving.
They take you to an island where you eat and swim a little bit more, clear watter and white sand. a virgin island.

413578466.name: An absolutely memorable experience
413578466.author: a TripAdvisor user
413578466.reviewBody: The entire tour was brilliant ... from the boat ride out to Isla Espiritu Santo to snorkeling with the sea lions (which was a truly magical experience) to lunch and kayaking in a beautiful cove. The guides were pleasant and knowledgeable, and we couldn\'t have had a better time. I will treasure that experience forever.

411569879.name: My favorite island in Baja
411569879.author: a TripAdvisor user
411569879.reviewBody: Wow this place is beautiful.  Some of the best little private coves and reefs.  No crowds.  You can find your own little slice of paradise.  Amazing sea life and nature.  If you have not been here your missing out.

411256420.name: It will be in my heart forever
411256420.author: a TripAdvisor user
411256420.reviewBody: Swimming with sea lions, see the dolphins, dive on those blue/ clear water was much more than I expected. This experience is going to be in my heart forever

409676663.name: Baja nature at it\'s best
409676663.author: a TripAdvisor user
409676663.reviewBody: We visited on our personal sailboat.   Quite an adventure.  Good anchorages, lots of sealife, and dusty, cactus covered trails.

409093351.name: Amazing trip
409093351.author: a TripAdvisor user
409093351.reviewBody: Most likely the best experience to date: sailing around the (quite big) island, with possibilities to watch whales, dolphines, turtles, sharkwales; diving with sealiones, surrounded by a rich reef environment; stopping in a remote spectacular unspoilt beach to enjoy a unique sea and a good light lunch. Check those tours sailing from El Telocote beach, 30 mins drive from La Paz

404731296.name: Sea Lion and lots of fish Snorkeling adventure!!!!
404731296.author: a TripAdvisor user
404731296.reviewBody: Visiting the island of Espiritu Santo is by itself a wonderful experience.   You can see dolphins swimming in front of your boat, the scenery is amazing and they have several places to snorkeling and enjoy "Nemo and family" in their habitat.    You have the opportunity also to get closer to a colony of Sea lions and jump into the water and get close to them.    The young ones will swim around you and the adventure is breath taking.

402955227.name: Snorkeling
402955227.author: a TripAdvisor user
402955227.reviewBody: We had a nice snorkeling trip to swim with the sealions, a lunch on a beach and snorkeling on a other place with Mar Y Adventuras

400398343.name: Glamping on Isla Espiritu Santo
400398343.author: a TripAdvisor user
400398343.reviewBody: On our trip through Baja, we decided to try the Glamping on Espiritu Santo. It was expensive, but for what you get, it really wasn\'t. We booked it with Todos Santos Eco Adventures. No electricity, Wi-Fi, it was a true escape from a busy life. They had canvas tents with real beds, fed us breakfast, lunch & dinner, and happy hour, the food was very good. We had a boat, in which we would tour the island, swim with the seals, snorkel, also paddle boards, and kayaks. They treat you like royalty. We went during July, so it was hot, but you did have the water to help with that. I would recommend this for families & couples.

400205816.name: We loved it!
400205816.author: a TripAdvisor user
400205816.reviewBody: Although it takes like 2 hours to get to the island, the ride is relaxing; the scenery is magnificent and once we got to the island we enjoyed snorkeling. our tour included a one-hour stay at one of the beaches. Do not miss it!

397520479.name: Worth the visit
397520479.author: a TripAdvisor user
397520479.reviewBody: We booked a tour online which was supposed to take about 6 hours if I recall correctly. It took at least 3 hours in a very bouncy boat to get there and overall the tour took 2 hours more than planned but it was beatiful swimming with the sea lions and relaxing in one of the most amazing beaches ive seen. The lunch was delicious too. I really recommend you do this on your trip to la Paz

396436089.name: Fun day with sea lions
396436089.author: a TripAdvisor user
396436089.reviewBody: I kid you not.. you can actually touch the sea lions if they get close enough, and they swim with you. The reefs and the fish there are a great sight also!

396380361.name: Swimming with the Sea Lions
396380361.author: a TripAdvisor user
396380361.reviewBody: Based on recommendations used Sunrider Tours to go out to the Island.  Sergio the captain of the boat and Ra\u00fal were knowledgeable, professional and FUN.  Liked the fact that the boats are not over loaded with people so the trip was very comfortable.  Their ceviche was fresh and well done.  Would recommend them to anyone.

396192770.name: Great for al ages!
396192770.author: a TripAdvisor user
396192770.reviewBody: This is a breathtaking experience for all. The tour was great. I went diving while the rest of the people went snorkelig. Fun for everyone! Lots of sealife! Thanks to Sea Raider

395547757.name: Swimming with the Sea Lions
395547757.author: a TripAdvisor user
395547757.reviewBody: Great day in the Sea of Cortez. This UNESCO protected Island is worth a visit, if your looking for something out of the ordinary this is the place to go.  Be sure to have a good guide who\'s well informed about the history of the Island and the large variety of marine animals you\'ll see while your there. Be sure to listen to your guide when your in the water, Sea Lions are territorial and will defend their herd, it\'s very easy to see the males, they\'ll come out to check you out and the guide will usually have a technique to keep them at bay and to show them that we mean them no harm. The marine life was tremendous and the snorkelling was the best I\'ve done in a very long time.

395325475.name: Not worth the hype
395325475.author: a TripAdvisor user
395325475.reviewBody:
I've been on lots of Marine Adventures throughout Mexico and felt that this was one of the most disappointing. If it weren't for swimming with the sea lions, I'd have given it one star. My friend and I booked a trip from the malecón for 750 pesos each, or roughly $41. I don't know that the $200 tours are any better (in my experience, they are nothing but tourist traps), as all boats out there seemed to have the same itinerary. 
Here are my thoughts:

PROs:
- Lunch was served on a beach with fresh ceviche.
- While swimming with the seals and sea lions, my group swam away and I stayed. A seal began to play with me, swimming around me and under me sideways so he could look at me. Then he played "chicken" with me a few times by swimming straight at me then diving down at the very last moment, inches from my mask. Then he barked at me and swam away. 
That experience was better than the $250 I paid in Cancun to swim with the whale sharks with a million other boats of people out there. 

CONs:
- We spent 8 hours on this trip, only 1.5 hours of which was off that dang, crowded, uncomfortable boat. They packed 14 people into a boat made for 10, and the bench seats were too hard to spend 6.5 hrs sitting on them. 
- It's 1.5 hours to get to the island, and then you spend another hour looking at birds and rock formations (yawn) before spending 30 minutes swimming near the sea lions. Then a 40 minute stop for lunch on a tiny beach without chairs or restrooms, then the long boatride back. 
- Normally, the trip is about 6 hours, but an extra 2 hrs was added to our trip since we stopped at Tecolote Beach (an hour away) to pick up, then drop off a family. That made the trip excruciatingly long. 
- It is windy on the open sea and the water at the sea lion location was very cold. Despite the hot July weather, 30 min of swimming there was enough to deliver a nasty cold the rest of the week.  
- The water was very murky and other than a few fish, there wasn't anything to see while "snorkeling" (other than the sea lions we were to observe from a 15ft distance). Soon other boats showed up, and then it was a sea of fins. People's, not fishes'.  
- There weren't enough fins supplied, so I swam without.
- My mask didn't seal properly and fogged up. 
- The captain DID supply us with a steady stream of smoke from his cigarettes, though. 
- There's no actual "island" to explore. There's a rock island inhabited by seals that you swim near, but that's it. 

In sum, I was disappointed by this tour and recommend you spend an extra hour to drive north and then head out to Jacques Cousteau Island or drive south to the reserve. Unless you've never been snorkeling before and love long boat rides, I'd skip this one.

394853157.name: Amazing experience!
394853157.author: a TripAdvisor user
394853157.reviewBody: You will falll in love with nature after your visit, even if you are resident of Baja, visit and discover the wonders of the underwater world.

394338413.name: A once in a lifetime experience
394338413.author: a TripAdvisor user
394338413.reviewBody: Sometimes we need mother nature to give us some inspiration to keep up with our lifes. When you visit this place, the phrase "life finds its way" gets it\'s meaning.\nI strongly recommend to go to El Tecolote and book direct, tours coming out la Paz take longer to get there and only visit one side of the island. We rented a boat for 2 families and it was prefect. You have to do this.

393743309.name: A piece of paradise
393743309.author: a TripAdvisor user
393743309.reviewBody: I visited the all key tourist spots. Including the sea lions, the beaches and some of the historic sites in the island. It is part of a World Heritage Site. Like in all the islands in the Gulf, you need to make sure you carry a canopy for shade.

393391690.name: Chased roosters here
393391690.author: a TripAdvisor user
393391690.reviewBody: My wife loves the white sand beaches, I loved the abundant marine life.  Really beautiful oasis.  I highly recommend a visit for fishermen, snorkels and general beach aficionados.

392540102.name: Great tour, strongly recommend, but the water can be cold
392540102.author: a TripAdvisor user
392540102.reviewBody: This is a lovely tour, fantastic experience to swim with the sea lions and see amazing rock formations on the islands and beautiful remote beaches.  Rather than repeat what\'s already been said, I do want to share an important tip.  Although we visited in late June, currents had shifted and the water was unpleasantly cold.  It was tough for the adults and even worse for the children.  Clearly below the temperature at which one would be advised to wear a wetsuit.  We had them at our hotel, but had been advised that we didn\'t need them.  Also, don\'t follow the guide on the swim through the arch (this will be understandable when you get there).  At the time we were there, we were swimming against a current, and visibility was low with little to see.  We\'re experienced snorkelers and divers, but for me and my children, it would be been better avoided, and we would have preferred to spend time with the sea lions.  By the time we got to the sea lions, all but the hardiest were too cold to enjoy themselves and spend much time with them.\n\nAgain, I strongly recommend this trip, but I wanted to convey some important advice that I wish we had known in advance.

391854427.name: One of the most amazing places on Earth
391854427.author: a TripAdvisor user
391854427.reviewBody: Went diving to Los Islotes and had an amazing time with the Sea Lions. "Baja Diving" or "Cantamar" is a fantastic operation for diving or snorkeling. I had one of the very best dives in my life here, and was able to swim in my speedos in one of the most beautiful beaches I have ever seen. It\u00b4s the very best trip in La Paz, you should do it. Don\u00b4t miss it.

391550730.name: Very good experience
391550730.author: a TripAdvisor user
391550730.reviewBody: Being in La Paz and not going to Isla Espiritu Santo is missing a very nice and exciting experience. The place is a magic island and there is the chance to see from the sea many animals that makes the experience close to the Nature. Don\'t miss it!

390262089.name: Scuba diving
390262089.author: a TripAdvisor user
390262089.reviewBody: Amazing diving, sea lion colony was fantastic. Great marine life. I wish I could dive in La Paz everyday. I could have watched the sea lions for forevor. Our divemaster said the visibility that day was better than normal so I guess I was spoiled but it was amazing. This is a must do if u snorkel or dive. Boat ride to the island is nice also, it take a a while but we saw marine life along the way and a few islands with Mexican snow lol

389852029.name: Don\'t miss this Eco tour opportunity
389852029.author: a TripAdvisor user
389852029.reviewBody: The sea life and geology of this island is incredible. Visiting the park helps contribute to the continued responsible management of this ecological treasure. The highlight for me, as a diver, is the sea lion colony. There are many species of sea life & birds, and the rocks are stunning to view as the sea lions sunbathe and there is lots to observe. I can\'t say enough about this beautiful wonder if the world.

386476256.name: kayaking adventure
386476256.author: a TripAdvisor user
386476256.reviewBody: We took a boat over to the island with "Mar Y Adventures". They took us kayaking and snorkeling.  Ben was a very pleasant and knowledgeable  guide. Great boat trip over. We saw many dolphins frolicking.  Manta rays flying out of the water and flopping back down. A very entertaining day for us.

379730235.name: So much fun!
379730235.author: a TripAdvisor user
379730235.reviewBody: The seals are wonderful! We swam with them, and there were babies (I guess, maybe older, but little and cute and fun loving) in the water doing spins and leaps and jumps, just amazing!

377737836.name: Nice Island close to La Paz, full with sea lions & all sorts of birds.
377737836.author: a TripAdvisor user
377737836.reviewBody: The island itself is nice, however the path on the sea & the different stops in beach & islands are awesome! To see the edge of the continental plate in the Pacific is really unique. If you enjoy looking at marine diversity you\u00b4ll be also satisfied. Do go short in sunscreen & all kind of sun protection, bikinis are nice but not convenient because the  sand is clear as the water, therefore the reflection in the skin is stronger.

376609857.name: Remote Island Tour
376609857.author: a TripAdvisor user
376609857.reviewBody: Today we took the Espiritu Santo island tour.  This was a great day. Transportation from Cabo to La Paz was good and on time. The Island Cat is a great boat with a Great Crew. We swam with the sea lions, panga tour of several coves, kayaking and paddle board.  The food and beverages were Great. We will be doing another boat tour soon.  Would recommend this to anyone.

376236884.name: amazing natural place
376236884.author: a TripAdvisor user
376236884.reviewBody: It is a place with so many things to do, the only problem is that the only way in is by boat. Good things of the travel in boat is that you will probably see something in the way in (dolphins, whales, etc.)

375847573.name: Beautiful!
375847573.author: a TripAdvisor user
375847573.reviewBody: 1 hour ride in boat from La Paz ... so be ready for that. Water in May was cool, not best time for sea lions as there are in breeding, but still the same was wonderful scuba diving, saw moray eels, many fishes even a manta!

373081498.name: A Very Special Place
373081498.author: a TripAdvisor user
373081498.reviewBody: we visited various bays at Isla Espiritu Santo  on our own boat, but there are charter boats out of La  Paz that  will take you there for day trips. It\'s a fantastic place for swimming, snorkelling, hiking, and kayaking.  The water is gorgeous, for our first visit to the Sea of Cortes this place is like paradise - so much to see, you can\'t do it all in a week. Quiet, isolated, and yet so close to La Paz.. it\'s a perfect place to holiday.

372829163.name: One of the world\'s must do\'s
372829163.author: a TripAdvisor user
372829163.reviewBody:
We took a day trip with Baja Puntos and loved every minute. Pancho and Loreto guided us around the Isla and gave brilliant information about the history and the area. 

We snorkelled among the best fish have seen and while we were there, sadly the sea lions were not in the water. But that didn't detract from a stunning experience at all. 

The lunch on a beach rated second best in the world was a highlight. Loved how caring of the ecology the Mexicans are. Great fun and highly recommended. There are many hours in a boat though, so make sure you are prepared for that.

370538714.name: Real great fun snorkeling
370538714.author: a TripAdvisor user
370538714.reviewBody: Did this trip with "Mars y Adventura" company. Was a real pleasant experience from 9am to 4pm all day adventure. Hit 2 spots snorkeling, had lunch on the beach courtesy of them. Would definitely do this again.

370272634.name: Boat Trip to Isla Espiritu Santo
370272634.author: a TripAdvisor user
370272634.reviewBody: Our day-long trip with 12 people included close-up views of Isla Espiritu Santo and finished with snorkeling with young seals and colorful fish along a rock outcrop.  We had lunch on a beach.  We got up close and personal with bird life, dophins and a variety of sealife.  It was a great trip with a great guide, Benjamin Duarte.

370205733.name: Wonderful Islands Indented by The Sea
370205733.author: a TripAdvisor user
370205733.reviewBody: Just twenty-odd miles north of La Paz, Isla Espiritu Santo and neighboring Isla Partida are part of the marine parks system in the Sea of Cortez.   We visited by sailboat and enjoyed the anchorage of Caleta Partida, including kayaking around the perimeter of the bay.   The contrast of arid volcanic island and turquoise to deep blue waters is lovely.   There are many ways to enjoy the islands, via sailing, snorkelling, kayaking, diving, hiking, etc.   Our visit to Isla Espiritu Santo has a highlight of our sail up the Sea of Cortez this season.

369630527.name: 5 nights camping
369630527.author: a TripAdvisor user
369630527.reviewBody: Sea kayaking by day, camping on beach at night.  Even if you can only do a day visit, this spot is worth it, but staying overnight on westside beaches provides dividends.  Mar y Aventura is a great tour outfitter from La Paz.

369294908.name: Definitely worth the trip
369294908.author: a TripAdvisor user
369294908.reviewBody: Wonderful day outing (maybe not for those who have a very squeamish stomach) ... so enjoyed the whale sharks and sea lion snorkels, and seeing this beautiful island up close.

368991012.name: Interesting, but not unusual
368991012.author: a TripAdvisor user
368991012.reviewBody: Maybe I\'m a bit spoiled, but I\'ve seen better wildlife in Puerto Vallarta, Hawaii, the Galapagos.  The sea lions and boobies and frigate birds were interesting, but not unusual.  Not real good snorkeling.  Poor lunch - white bread with sliced cheese. Good ceviche.

368844572.name: amazing view
368844572.author: a TripAdvisor user
368844572.reviewBody: if you come to La paz you must take the tour to the espiritu santo island and enjoy the amazing views, the sea lions, the rocks. We loved every minute. You should do this once.

368501676.name: Swim With the Sea Lions
368501676.author: a TripAdvisor user
368501676.reviewBody: Absolutely the best outing in La Paz!!  We were pick up at our hotel by bus and driven to where we got on a boat north of town. The trip by water took about two hours.  Along the way our captain played tour guide, tell us about the various locations, ecology, wildlife and history.  When we got to the island we snorkeled with the sea lions for about 30 minutes.  They were very friendly, continually swimming up to investigate us. On the way back, we stopped at a beach near Balandra bay for a lunch of ceviche and cold cuts.  All in all a wonderful day.

367644820.name: solo
367644820.author: a TripAdvisor user
367644820.reviewBody: By far my best day on the Sea of Cortez. whale shark watching ,swimming with the sea lions, Espiritu Isla, Balandra bay drive by, bird waatching. Then lunch on a nice white beach. We were fortunate to follow to hump back whale a mother and her cub.

367485535.name: Tecolete Beach is gorgeous and relaxing
367485535.author: a TripAdvisor user
367485535.reviewBody: Took the EcoBaja bus from the Malecon station in La Paz to the beach. The 196 peso round trip ride took about 45 minutes each way.  The bus had Wifi! Returns are about every hour but ask driver for schedule.  The beach was as described earlier- gorgeous and relaxing. Food and drink available as are inexpensive (150 pesos/day for 3 chairs and umbrella) amenities.  If you think about a ride to Espiritu Santo to look around, consider it is a long 30-45 minute , bottom-pounding boat ride on a smooth sea each way!  Tecolote was better than Ballandra - which is also a stop on the same bus route!- because Ballandra becomes a mud flat at low tide, something other reviewers neglected to mention.  Tecolote was the best beach I saw in Baja!

367467857.name: Incredible unique experience
367467857.author: a TripAdvisor user
367467857.reviewBody: It was almost ten years since the last visit and I asked myself what took me so long? Playing with the sea lions (as far as I know it is the only place in the world) was the highlight of this trip. Just remembering their huge eyes looking at you and asking you to do another underwater spin with them, wow. Swimming trough the arch surrounded by immense amount of fish was another highlight. The pic nic on the unspoiled white sandy beach was the relaxed end of this beautiful day excursion.

366723204.name: Lots of sea lions
366723204.author: a TripAdvisor user
366723204.reviewBody: The sea lions are friendly and come right up to you in the water. bring sun screen and a towel. Most tours offer free lunch and beverages.

366189984.name: One of the best ocean activities ever
366189984.author: a TripAdvisor user
366189984.reviewBody: Swimming with seal lions is an incredible rare opportunity. Do not miss it! Don\'t forget to take your GoPro as you\'ll want to re-live this over and over again. We did this four days ago and I\'d go back tomorrow. Awesome.

365570667.name: Fantastic sea lion experience
365570667.author: a TripAdvisor user
365570667.reviewBody: Spent several days scuba diving with the sea lions. Took 1 1/2 hours to get there by boat from La Paz. Worth the effort as the sea lions gave us great under water displays and came to play with us.

365463470.name: Swimming with the sea lions
365463470.author: a TripAdvisor user
365463470.reviewBody: This can be a little intimidating but the tour guides provide good instruction regarding how to behave.  The pups get a little playful and can nip!

364873136.name: Isa Espiritu Santo
364873136.author: a TripAdvisor user
364873136.reviewBody: Great snorkelling, the sea lion pups are very friendly! They play fetch with clam shelves, breath taking experience. They would swim right to you and engage with you. Amazing marine diversity, with colourful fish, star fish, clams and large fish. I would recommend a wet suit as the currents from the pacific tend to be cold.

364191426.name: Isla Espiritu Santo
364191426.author: a TripAdvisor user
364191426.reviewBody: Great snorkeling, scenery...great birding, secluded beaches, kayaking.\nSea Lion rookery was super cool.

363732368.name: So beautiful
363732368.author: a TripAdvisor user
363732368.reviewBody: We spent two nights under canvas on this quite beautiful island. Our visits were by boat and we were delighted to visit bird colonies and see seals and whales. A short walk along one of the trails through the cliffs was also memorable. Under the circumstances, we ate really well, with the staff producing soups, tortillas and pastas under challenging conditions. But the island is the star and should be an essential visit for anyone visiting the area.

362673329.name: Friendly Sealions but follow the rules!!!
362673329.author: a TripAdvisor user
362673329.reviewBody: As a dive guide, this is one of my favorite spots to take customers to. This mus be the firendliest see lion colony I have ever seen. Pups are most playful in April and in October. But please DO NOT go to teh sanctuary, do not drive your boat through the Arch, stay off the cliffs and remeber that these are wild animals that we need to respect. But for sure go ther and check out the sea lions whether diving, snorkling or staying on the boat ... even the boat ride up is worth it.

362288747.name: Unique experience, worth the boat ride
362288747.author: a TripAdvisor user
362288747.reviewBody: Snorkeled next to many sea lions. One nibbled on our snorkel fins. Be sure to have an underwater camera and wetsuit, as the water isn\'t warm and you\'ll want to stay in with the sea lions as long as you can.

361656393.name: Beautiful and rugged
361656393.author: a TripAdvisor user
361656393.reviewBody: We stopped at Espiritu Santo while on an Un Cruise vacation in the Sea of Cortez. It is a very cool place for hiking, snorkeling, and boating, although the water can be rough in spots. The island is lovely, and the geology is magnificant.

361631404.name: Amazing!!!stunningly beautiful
361631404.author: a TripAdvisor user
361631404.reviewBody: we loved this place! you can see hills with some cacti and weird rock formations on the way to the island . sea lions are also close happy to say hello and play with you , snorkelling is a must to see beautiful coral reef full of life !

361319209.name: Memorable, action-packed adventure
361319209.author: a TripAdvisor user
361319209.reviewBody: A day to remember forever! We took an 8am-4pm boat tour with RED to Isla Espiritu Santo, also passing close by Balandra Beach on the way. Saw a school of leaping dolphins, a frigate colony, snorkeled with sea otters at La Lobera, saw many tropical fish and sea stars, and for the grand finale, snorkeled with whale sharks. For lunch, we landed at an island beach and ate delicious ceviche. They do accommodate special food requests. Great, unhurried trip.

360066877.name: Lovely island, nice beaches, swim with sea lions!
360066877.author: a TripAdvisor user
360066877.reviewBody: This island is like 45 minutes away in boat from Balandra beach or 1.5 hours from the malecon, it can be a long ride but you will enjoy it, white sand beaches, clear water and the best, swimming with sea lions, they are friendly, you can pet them while they play with you, also very nice snorkel spot. This is definitely one of the best attractions in La Paz, a must over there.

358207291.name: Clear Blue Waters!
358207291.author: a TripAdvisor user
358207291.reviewBody: This place is like nothing you\'ve ever seen. Or maybe you have. I hadn\'t. It was the best thing we did on our trip to Baja!

357395873.name: Snorkeling
357395873.author: a TripAdvisor user
357395873.reviewBody:
We made reservations with Royal Solaris concierge to go snorkeling here. The tour company picked us up at San Jose Del Cabo and drove us to La Paz. 

Once at La Paz, we got our snorkeling equipment and walked across the dock. We boarded and enjoyed the boat ride.

It was only a 60 minute boat ride to Isla Espírito Santo from La Paz. Glad we did it. We went snorkeling to Isla Espírito Santo.  We saw tropical fish, sardines, sea otters, and star fish.

356023881.name: Eduardo\'s Tours was a great choice
356023881.author: a TripAdvisor user
356023881.reviewBody:
We had Daniel for a tour guide and Loreto as the captain.  The tour was very educational, and my boyfriend loved the snorkeling (I lounged on the boat).  Lunch was the some of the best ceviche I've ever had.  

Daniel is an excellent guide, and truly passionate about the history of the island.  He did an amazing job of doing everything twice (English and Spanish).  Loreto did a great job of piloting the boat back through the channel between the Espiritu Santo and Pichilingue beach as the water was a bit rough.  We felt entirely safe despite some pretty good swell.  

I'd highly recommend checking out the island with Eduardo's Tours!

355369278.name: Snorkel, Kayak AND SWIM WITH SEA LIONS!!
355369278.author: a TripAdvisor user
355369278.reviewBody: We did an overnight camping trip on Espiritu Island with BOA (Baja Outdoor Activities), who were incredible, but this review is about the island itself.\nThis is an amazing island that needs to be visited by all, it is quiet and beautiful and full of awesome nature that makes this earth so beautiful. We did some kayaking around the island and we did a ton of snorkeling.  the snorkeling on the island was the best I have ever seen and a highlight of my trip to the area. BUT the most important thing to do in this area is to swim with the Sea Lions.  That was one of the most memorable things I have ever done and was lucky enough to purchase an underwater camera just to make that memory last a lifetime.  I cant recommend enough swimming with those awesome friendly animals, they are so sweet and playful, like giant puppy dogs and I will be returning to this island to swim with Sea Lions as soon as I can.  The other beautiful thing we did was to take a motor boat to where Espiritu island and Isla Partida meet together which is a breathtaking location as beautiful as any beach I have seen in Europe or the Caribbean.

353970540.name: A great trip from La Paz
353970540.author: a TripAdvisor user
353970540.reviewBody: I would highly recommend this as a trip from La Paz. We went with RED which is an Eco Tour company. It takes about an hour to get to the island. Once there we snorkel end with the sea lions which is a fun experience. I was surprised at all the fish and beautiful coral that we saw. Definitely worth the money. Lunch was at a white sand beach, only down side were all the wasps.

352606522.name: Espiritu santo Islan snorkeling
352606522.author: a TripAdvisor user
352606522.reviewBody: It\u00b4s a wonderful, place to visit, calm, clear ocean water. National protected park. We tour around the island by boat, and stop a two diferent beaches and snorkel. We saw seal lions very close. It\u00b4s worth the 2 1/2 hours drive from san jose del cabo. We wont forget this marvelous experience. I recomend this trip for families with kids , at least 8 years old, because is an all day tour.

351688843.name: Worth the Expense
351688843.author: a TripAdvisor user
351688843.reviewBody: There are a lot of ways to see Isla Espiritu Santo.  I definitely recommend finding one that includes all the activities you want.  We swam with the sea lions, ate lunch of a beautiful beach, kayaked to see the turtles and got to snorkel on a reef.\n\nI was so surprised with the number of tropical fish we saw while swimming with the sea lions.  The water was so clear and abundant with such beautiful fish.  The water is cold in February, so make sure you get a wet suit.  Also if you are near a beach, shuffle your feet when walking in the water because there are small sting rays and our guide told me he\'s gotten stung three times.  Our day trip was a once in a lifetime trip with the family.  I highly recommend it.

350254246.name: Swimming with sea lions
350254246.author: a TripAdvisor user
350254246.reviewBody: Taking a speed boat fro La Paz was an exciting ride in the choppy seas but once sheltered we donned wet suits and dived in. The young pups came to investigate, loved their whiskers being tickled and skins scratched. They gently mouthed us their sharp little teeth clenching onto arms not knowing their strength. Amazing experience twisting and turning with these creatures.

350032884.name: not to miss
350032884.author: a TripAdvisor user
350032884.reviewBody: Getting to the island is not easy or cheap but well worth the trip. We were a group of 9 and ended up renting a small boat from La Paz. The trip across is super pleasant even for those prone to seasickness (if weather cooperates, as it did for us. We heard sometimes you cannot do it because of high winds). The island is a magical place. An amazing meld of the perfect desert landscape and South Pacific idyllic beaches. In one bay, we walked in chest-high water for about 300 meters of crystalline water to reach a completely deserted beach. Not a soul to be seen or heard around. Amazing experience. Very strange to reconcile the absolute lack of fresh water on the cliffs and the gorgeous beach below. Somehow you can imagine one or the other but not both. There are rumors of cave paintings in some of the cliff caves, but hard to tell if it is real or just myth. We did go to the ruins of an old pearl oyster farming encampment, which has deteriorated to frigate bird colony and small enclosed salt water lagoon. The birds are super approachable and we we all felt we had our \'National Geographic Moment\'. \n\nNote that the water IS cold. Having wetsuits and our own snorkeling gear made a huge difference.
