349202650.name: sea lions
349202650.author: a TripAdvisor user
349202650.reviewBody: It is amazing how those big blobs of blubber can climb up on the rocks as high as they do. The snorkeling was great. Those sea lions can be real teasers.

348986729.name: What a day!
348986729.author: a TripAdvisor user
348986729.reviewBody: We did a day tour from La Paz - fishing enroute to Espiritu Santo in the early morning followed by a magical experience "playing with the dolphins" in the bay between Espiritu Santo and Isla Partida.  About six dolphins enjoyed racing in front of our boat and swimming alongside us.  We also saw a whale and a manta ray that jumped out if the water near our boat.  The rock formations of the islands are also interesting and there are a number of beautiful beaches and bays.  Definitely a lifetime experience for us!

348847253.name: Sea tour
348847253.author: a TripAdvisor user
348847253.reviewBody: An amazing day at sea we left port about 11:00 AM touring multiple  islands, snorkelling twice and great lunch the tour guide found blue whales and others

348731320.name: Beautiful View, Yet Freezing Water
348731320.author: a TripAdvisor user
348731320.reviewBody: Beautiful View, Yet Freezing Water \n\nWe got to see Sea Lions, Dolphins and Humpback Whales. 3 for 1 adventure.

347904393.name: Nature at its best
347904393.author: a TripAdvisor user
347904393.reviewBody: Went with BOA (Baja Outdoor adventures).  Beautifully preserved island with hidden beaches. Isla has preserved its beauty and trails were limited. Take a tour whether it is one day or a week, as the colours, cliffs, beaches, rocks ad wildlife is amazing

347056701.name: Packed with wild life and varied geology
347056701.author: a TripAdvisor user
347056701.reviewBody: Went by boat (about 40 mins).  Circled the island, stopped to snorkel with sea lions, then to explore trhe coral, had picnic lunch in a magical sandy cove and back at 5pm.  Couldn\'t have been a better escape from the town.

346112215.name: a magical island with so much to see and do
346112215.author: a TripAdvisor user
346112215.reviewBody: swim with sea lions (and whales - one popped us to see us whilst snorkelling!). lovely snorkelling spots, pristine bays, spectacular sunsets.  best visited when the wind is not too strong as the  swell outside of the bays can be quite severe

345692284.name: Sea Lions and snorkeling
345692284.author: a TripAdvisor user
345692284.reviewBody: A great day on the Sea of Cortez to Isla Espiritu Santo.  Don\'t miss this.  Lots of wildlife beneath and above the surface.

345641447.name: My favorite place in Baja
345641447.author: a TripAdvisor user
345641447.reviewBody: This must be heaven because it is perfection. I would recommend to go by boat and spend the night stargazing

344866106.name: Swimming with the Sea Lions
344866106.author: a TripAdvisor user
344866106.reviewBody: We decided to spend Christmas Day swimming with the Sea Lions. We went to Tecolate Beach and went on a boat from there. We had a great time.  Although the day was warm, it was very cold on the boat so dress warm.  After swimming with the Sea Lions we went to this beautiful beach and had lunch that was supplied by the company.  I am a vegetarian and they had mostly fish.  So, if you are on a restricted diet, bring your own food.  Also, the boat has a cooler if you want to bring beer or wine.   The wind seems to pick up in the afternoon, so a morning trip is advised during the winter months,

344739975.name: Camping and Kayaking
344739975.author: a TripAdvisor user
344739975.reviewBody: We booked with Mar Y Aventures to camp and kayak on Espiritu Santo. It was marvelous. The landscape in this area is not to be missed, nor the underwater scenery.

343886554.name: It was gorgeous
343886554.author: a TripAdvisor user
343886554.reviewBody: I wish I could remember what tour agency I we took out to the island. They were super knowledgable about the marine and island life. We stopped at one inlet that had a amazing population of frigate birds. We also saw dolphins on the tour and stopped at one of the beaches to snorkel and eat ceviche. I would 100% recommend visiting this island if you are traveling to La Paz or Cabo area.

342644811.name: OMG so gorgeous!!
342644811.author: a TripAdvisor user
342644811.reviewBody: Wonderful island only obtainable by boat.  So many deserted which sand beaches and turquoise waters.  You feel like your in a movie!  Plenty of sea life for snorkeling too!

342039586.name: The sea lions wouldn\'t swim with me
342039586.author: a TripAdvisor user
342039586.reviewBody: I think this is a "must not miss" excursion.  We could have had a better day for it, as it was quite windy and cold on the water.  Snorkeling wasn\'t the best with the water a bit churned up.  Nonetheless, we saw humpback whales, dolphins, the recalcitrant sea lions, and amazing geological beauty.  We also had a good time with the other people on the boat.

341526481.name: Dive with the Sea Lions
341526481.author: a TripAdvisor user
341526481.reviewBody: We spent the day thanks to Fun Baja diving with the sea lions.  Very interactive experience with the juvenile sea lions topped off by a shore lunch on the way back to Costa Baja.  Great day on and in the water.

338779789.name: Awesome and awe. inspiring.
338779789.author: a TripAdvisor user
338779789.reviewBody: This was an incredible trip.  The islands we saw were like nothing I have seen before.  Be sure to bring sunscreen, sunglasses and some warm clothes if you go in January

338778356.name: Swim with dozens of Sea Lions - be aware and cautious
338778356.author: a TripAdvisor user
338778356.reviewBody: We got there very early in the morning New Years Day before the day crowds from La Paz and had the area to ourselves on our Un-Cruise adventures ship of 48 people. We snorkeled with sea lions all around us - it was so fun to sea them dancing and flying through the water.  We snorkeled with sea lions literally all around us. You should be aware that sea lions are very curious and approach you VERY close.\nA word of CAUTION: The sea lions like to check out what they see with there mouth! We had full wet suits on and as the sea lions play with you they will nip at you all over your legs and arms. You should know and expect this - this was not told to any of the passengers in our group! My wife had a juvenile female nip at her arm and when checking out her hand SHE GOT BIT. It was not major wound but none the less she had a bite mark and a small puncture on her hand. Luckily she did not get panicky or excited and all ended ok.  It happened to be on the hand with her wedding ring. I strongly suggest you take off all shiny rings / jewelry as we suspect that the sea lion was attracted by the shiny ring. This too was not mentioned as we prepped for our snorkel.\nThe day we were there the water was a bit rough and had some swell so you need to know your swimming and water limitations before you get in the water.

338608725.name: Can\u00b4t miss it
338608725.author: a TripAdvisor user
338608725.reviewBody: A wonderful exerience on the sea of Cortez.\n\nA trip that is totally worth it. Can\u00b4t go to La Paz and not take this tour to Isla Espritu Santo

337997150.name: Beautiful History
337997150.author: a TripAdvisor user
337997150.reviewBody: Our day-trip with Espiritu Baja to Espiritu Santo was an amazing adventure. The boat ride out was beautiful and full of history of the area. Swimming with the Sea Lions was an enthralling experience, they are curious playful creatures. We even were able to see two whales on our return boat ride home, which was a magical experience and made the entire day.

337278789.name: Great sea life
337278789.author: a TripAdvisor user
337278789.reviewBody: We went on an excursion with Espiritu & Baja tour company all around the island. Much of it is a reserve that people aren\'t allowed to enter, but the coast is a beautiful combination of cliffs, caves and sandy beaches. We swam and snorkeled at the sea lion colony, and learned about the native inhabitants of the island.

337081339.name: Paradise. Found.
337081339.author: a TripAdvisor user
337081339.reviewBody: Touring this island was truly an out-of-this-world experience. Sparkling clear waters, loads of birds and marine life and postcard beaches - this island was one of the best places we visited on our Mexico trip. Would love to camp a few nights there (allowed with a handful of operators, and expensive) during our next trip.

336937444.name: A natural wonder
336937444.author: a TripAdvisor user
336937444.reviewBody: We spent a day snorkeling around Espiritu Santo, and had a great time.  All kinds of local sea life was easily found: we saw rays, frigate birds, and sea turtles, we swam with sea lions, and explored coral reefs.  We had lunch at a tent camp run by Baja Expeditions at a beautiful beach.  A great day!

336455773.name: Sea lion colony and beach
336455773.author: a TripAdvisor user
336455773.reviewBody: My family of four took an excursion from La Paz and snorkeled with the sea lions. They were very playful and swam right up to you. Crabs galore and some schools of fish. We went to another sea lion colony and it lacked enthusiastic sea lions...beautiful beaches and clear water! :)

336277271.name: Beautiful!
336277271.author: a TripAdvisor user
336277271.reviewBody: I visited this island and was pleasantly surprised with the abundant bird life--so many species in breeding plumage! Crystal clear water, great kayaking. Nature overload (in the best way possible).

336276515.name: Must go
336276515.author: a TripAdvisor user
336276515.reviewBody: Amazing place!!! Cannot miss it!\nIt wonderful all the different species that you can see there like many fish, birds and sea lions.

336256211.name: Amazing trip!
336256211.author: a TripAdvisor user
336256211.reviewBody: #1 experience in La Paz!!  Very cool to swim with the sea lions they are fun and playful!  I have been on snorkel and dive trips around the world this was one of the best snorkeling experiences I\'ve had.  We went with a guide boat the company was called Mar y Adventura, I highly recommend both the guide and this trip.  Can be combined with whale sharks too.

336076382.name: Sea kayaking and camping for a long weekend
336076382.author: a TripAdvisor user
336076382.reviewBody: We spent 3 days with Sea & Adventures (kayakbaja.com) on the island  Beautiful scenery and snorkeling with sea lions  Sea kayaking to another part of the island.  Camping on the beach with a full moon was amazing.

335132852.name: Amazing place
335132852.author: a TripAdvisor user
335132852.reviewBody: We booked our boat ride at Tecolote beach at the big restaurant.  Our tour was different than the ones that come from La Paz in that we went completely around the island, and the boat ride was shorter.  We were gone for about 5 1/2 hours.  It is longer coming from La Paz.  The island is amazing with pink and red cliffs that drop into the sea, large bird populations, many geologic strata, marine life, snorkeling with the sea lions and reef fish, dolphins, and my favorite, a frigate bird rookery.  It was an exceptional experience.  The only thing that would have made it better is if the captain spoke English.

335068751.name: Great Place to See Wildlife
335068751.author: a TripAdvisor user
335068751.reviewBody:
We took a tour with Espiritu and Baja Tours. It was very convenient, because the boat ride started at the beach, in front of the tour office, on Malecon, which is La Paz's seaside promenade.
The trip started at 10 am and lasted over 6 hours. The boat carried 10 people and 2 crew members.
We circled the island (actually two islands separated by a small channel). We saw a variety of rock formations, plenty of birds (the blue-footed boobies were our favorite) and a few seal colonies. Our guide was very knowledgeable (it turned out that he graduated from the La Paz University with a degree in Marine Biology). The highlight of the tour was supposed to be swimming with the sea lions. There were some sea lions in a grotto we swam into, but after that, we did not see any more. The water was murky and there was a strong current which made exploring the area a little difficult. We stopped for lunch at the pretty beach. Beware of stingrays hiding in the sand when you take a walk in the water (shallow water is clear and inviting).
On our way back we saw two humpback whales close to the boat.

335057944.name: Lovely Island
335057944.author: a TripAdvisor user
335057944.reviewBody: We enjoyed scuba, great wildlife and a welcoming white sand beach. We recommend making a trip out to this island during your stay in La Paz.

334916068.name: Unique features
334916068.author: a TripAdvisor user
334916068.reviewBody: Distinct geology, history, and anthropology. Worth the boat trip time. Be sure to snorkel with the whale sharks.

332966012.name: Must go to Isla Espiritu Santo
332966012.author: a TripAdvisor user
332966012.reviewBody: My husband and I sail to the islands every year we are in Baja.  The water is clear and Carribean like, we saw whales, dolphins and sea turtles on our last trip and the paddle boarding and hiking is great.  Just bring lots of water!

332261957.name: Beautiful island
332261957.author: a TripAdvisor user
332261957.reviewBody: Beautiful place with crystal clear blue water and white sandy beaches. Definitely width a trip out to. Make sure to swim with the sea lions while you are there.

330607434.name: having fun with Mother Nature
330607434.author: a TripAdvisor user
330607434.reviewBody: Espiritu tours did an excellent job taking us all around the island and showing us where to swim it was a perfect day

329831669.name: Isla bella!
329831669.author: a TripAdvisor user
329831669.reviewBody: Beautiful island.  I\'m very pleased that the Mexican government has prevented development of the island.  Everything about the island is wonderful - the clear, warm blue water, the beautiful beaches, the pink and gray cliffs, flocks of frigate birds, and amazing plant life.

329211711.name: Exhilarating experience in pristine waters
329211711.author: a TripAdvisor user
329211711.reviewBody: This is definitely one of the most amazing things you can do while traveling through Baja California. Take an expedition that will take you sailing through the most amazing desert landscapes to the Espiritu Santo Island, right in front of La Paz. Here you will have the chance to swim with sea lions in pristine waters. See them swim playfully right by you, under and beneath you. This is an incredible and humbling experience you cannot miss. \nAfter the swim you will have a chance to eat some of the best fresh cooked ceviche in a deserted beach, which will round up this truly amazing experience.

328256026.name: Amazing!
328256026.author: a TripAdvisor user
328256026.reviewBody: After years wanting to visit we finally did. We booked a trip with Espirtu & Baja Tours after we were told they were the best and we confirmed that they are. We were a party of 8, they set us up with a 12 person super panga with shade and rest room, we left La Paz docks about 9, our captain Saul and guide Alan made us feel welcome right away. We started on the southeast of the Island and made our way north to La Partida, the Cave and the Arch. We took a snorkeling brake at the Cave and was great time to set up the gear and organize out group. After we visited a tight rock canal that we traverse in the Panga and went north to the Arch where we snorkeled with the sea lions, our tour guide Alan is Marine Biologist and he was very well inform on how to swim with the wildlife. After about an hour we made our way to the west side of the Island to a beach called Ensenada Grande where they set up tables and shades and they treated us with an awesome Ceviche. We swam for the rest of the afternoon and we started our way back and stopping along the way to view the Fragata Birds and the old Pearl production area. \nIt was much more that we were expecting, the crew was super friendly and knowledgeable and very Eco Conscious

327598355.name: Lovely!
327598355.author: a TripAdvisor user
327598355.reviewBody: Was an nice experience! We tried to swim with seals, but the sea was full of jellyfish. Be careful with jellyfish! So, we jumoed back to the boat. No injuries tho... The beach was nice and calm. It was a great day.

326272315.name: La Paz, Baja, Mexico
326272315.author: a TripAdvisor user
326272315.reviewBody: A natural wonder close to La Paz you can reach by boat from La Paz. A kayaking dream which can be enjoyed with 1 of the local outfitters. I have gone with both BOA or Mar Y Aventura & both are excellent. Swimming with the sea lions or watching the rays jumping combined with the beauty of these islands is a great way to spend a day or a week.

326135398.name: A must do for your trip to La Paz
326135398.author: a TripAdvisor user
326135398.reviewBody: A great experience whether you scuba dive or snorkel.  We experienced both here and had a fabulous experience with the sea life and the world that lays underneath.  My husband don\'t even swim and he enjoyed it snorkeling and using a life preserver.  Swimming with the seals was fun and adventurous as they are like a child wanting to play.  We are looking forward to returning and this will definetely be a "do again".

326018322.name: Died and went to Heaven
326018322.author: a TripAdvisor user
326018322.reviewBody: Waters crystal clear, teaming with sea life. Sea lions are frindly and very photogenic. Personally I\'ve never seen such a diversity of fish and sea life. I got pictures of fish that were so camouflaged didn\'t know I took till I was looking threw them at home. I felt I had died and gone to heaven, when everyone else was back at the boat for a drink and bite to eat I was still out taking a ton of photo\'s and enjoying every second. I can only imagine what the scuba divers are seeing. This is an absolute must for anyone travelling to La Paz. The boat ride to and from was amazing, to the tropical blue waters of the bays where you can go for lunch and do more snorkelling, kayaking, or just sit back and relax and take it all in. My next trip will be to do the camping, look forward to the hiking and other views this island has to offer. The water is very warm and salt content very high so you float like a feather which I loved as am not a good swimmer, no need for a lifejacket but to each his own.

325974414.name: beautiful
325974414.author: a TripAdvisor user
325974414.reviewBody:
Just a gorgeous island.  The day I went around and saw the sea lions was quite windy for November so pretty choppy ride.

The sea lions are such a incredible experience, you have to go.

So many nooks and crannies on this island you can find a beach for yourself too.

Next time I visit La Paz, I plan on camping on the island.

325822534.name: Isla Espiritu Santo  from La Paz, Baja, Mexico
325822534.author: a TripAdvisor user
325822534.reviewBody: Isla Espiritu Santo is a 45 minute motor Launch (panga) ride from La Paz, Baja, Mexico. There are good SCUBA, snorkeling, fishing, and island exploring opportunities around the island.  La Paz has some excellent dive masters and snorkel guides that can get you into the most scenic, abundant life waters for a fairly reasonable price.  At the North end of the island are Los Islotes (group of small rock islands) making a calmer protected water area that is great for less experienced snorkeling people.  It is a protected sea lion nursery with many cubs.  At times you come to a playful cub that does rolls and circles in front of you.  If you imitate, sometimes the game is on!  I\'ve spent hours enjoying the water life at Los Islotes.  November the water is warm, hurricane season is usually over, and the land is cooling.

325578369.name: Special Place
325578369.author: a TripAdvisor user
325578369.reviewBody: This is a "must" see if you are able to visit La Paz. Our B & B owners arranged a tour with "Edwardo\'s". There were 6 of us on a 24 foot panga boat along with Edwardo himself and is teen son Abraham. The tour cost us $75 a piece for an entire day. I had previously researched other tours and some were as much as $199 per person. We went to the Isle and snorkoled. Then he took us to a beach for lunch. He had homemade ceviche and sandwiches. We then went to another site to snorkel. There we swam with tame sea lions. Edwardo went in for a dive and brought up 5 scallops in shells about 6" in size. He opened them and prepared fresh ceviche as we watched and then of course ate. A wonderful and memorable day.

324702502.name: Awesome Mexican National Park
324702502.author: a TripAdvisor user
324702502.reviewBody: I\'ve been here 3 times over the last 7 years and always manage to see and discover new features of this special isle. Sea turtles popping up in a quiet cove, octopi hidden in the volcanic rock that shaped the island and cool nights camping under the luminous Milkyway. A gem of an isle.

323999676.name: Awesome!
323999676.author: a TripAdvisor user
323999676.reviewBody: We just loved this tour.  Make sure you plan your trip when the water is calm.  No use going if it is windy.  ne of the highlights of our trip.

322997510.name: Enjoy the remoteness close in
322997510.author: a TripAdvisor user
322997510.reviewBody: The only access is by boat, and there are no facilities on the island.  There are a couple of eco tourism groups that offer overnight camping/kayaking trips. Each bay is different and unique - from the tall red cliffs of Ensenada de la Raza to the sandstone sculptures of Ensenada Grande.  Hiking, exploring, snorkelling or just sitting and being!  It\'s quiet, remote, and beautiful.  It is a protected island, so leave your dog on the boat or better yet, at home.  By panga it\'s only about a 90 minute ride from town.  Watch for whales, dolphins, seals and other wildlife on the ride.

317632939.name: Unspoiled island and snorkelling with sea lions
317632939.author: a TripAdvisor user
317632939.reviewBody: Not to be missed. Quite a boat ride with opportunities to see dolfins... Fantastic opportunity to snorkel with sea lions... They like colors and yellow so they will play with you. One was playing with a starfish. Perfect!!! The. Island beach was beautiful as well as the colors of th sea and cliffs. Unique!

316874907.name: Perfect Baja Day
316874907.author: a TripAdvisor user
316874907.reviewBody:
This is a long day trip from Cabo, but very worth it!!! We left Cabo at 8 AM and got back at 8 PM.
Driving to Tecolote Beach (just north of Balandra) will save some time in the boat, so that is what we did. The tour operator there did a good job. Not much English spoken but very friendly. We rented a little private boat for the day for $4000 pesos (about $250 USD). This included food and drinks.
It is a very peaceful 40 min ride to the sea lion colony. It is AMAZING! they are so cute and friendly and the fish life was amazing. Also, the water was crystal clear.
Next we went to a private beach that is beautiful and snorkeled, ate some lunch, and enjoyed the water. Our kids loved it as much as the adults. 
Then we went to a coral reef on the way back to the Tecolote for more amazing snorkeling. 
It is about a 5 hour tour. Highly recommend.

316167826.name: Beautiful and memorable trip
316167826.author: a TripAdvisor user
316167826.reviewBody: We toured the island by boat - starting out at Tecolote.  Tour guide was very informative about the history of the island including the pearl \'farm\' that used to be on the island.  Snorkeling on the northern end of the island was phenomenal (comparable to Cozumel) and getting to play with the sea lions was the highlight of my vacation.  Well worth the time.

315855968.name: Amazig place
315855968.author: a TripAdvisor user
315855968.reviewBody: Beautiful place to go, worth while. Th boat ride to the islotes is very relaxing. Perfect to spend the day or staying over night camping.

315694064.name: Swimming with the California Sea Lions
315694064.author: a TripAdvisor user
315694064.reviewBody: It was a hour out of La Paz but what a great ride. The baby sea lions were all over you when you got into the water. playful and inquisitive. The larger ones watch with a careful eye and grumps when you got to close to tem. Great trip.

315192917.name: Water sports around Spirit of Saints Island
315192917.author: a TripAdvisor user
315192917.reviewBody:
This is a destination that can only be reached by boat.  The Island, protected under UNESCO as a biosphere, is managed by Mexico’s Commission of Natural Protected Areas.  While the terra firma is a desert the water is teeming with life.  Diving is better than snorkeling (get PADI certification there) with ship wrecks, sea lion colonies & caves to explore.  Huge fish and sea life are everywhere.  Recommend Fun Baja as outfitter.
Fishing was excellent all 3 days we went.  Wide variety of fish but the Dorado is most fun. (Recommend Tailhunter)
The beaches are great for lunch or to park a launch for an afternoon.  
Hiking on the island requires water so don't start out without a supply.  Some say camping is allowed but I, personally, didn't see anyone.
Wreck diving on the sunken ferry is really interesting (vehicles & debris in abundance). 
If you're in Baja this is a trip worth taking.

313415694.name: An amazing experience
313415694.author: a TripAdvisor user
313415694.reviewBody: We went through "cantamar travel" and they were very professional and not expensive like other companies we checked out. The explanation along the way, the snorkeling, the lunch at the amazing playa, they all were very enjoyable. And sea lions are the most amazing animals!

312859318.name: Great day trip from La Paz
312859318.author: a TripAdvisor user
312859318.reviewBody: You can arrange a trip to Isla Espiritu Santo from vendors in downtown La Paz or by going to the Tecolote beach area. We prefer the later. You can get to Tecolote by car or by bus from the bus station in downtown La Paz. We chose the bus. The Playa el Tecolote offers on-line reservations for 1/2 day tours that are an interesting trip on the water, plus snorkeling and stopping for lunch. Frankly, we would not reserve in advance because if the weather is bad...windy or cold...you are just stuck with it. It is not very fun to be on the Sea of Cortez in the wind. We have done this tour twice and would recommend making the arrangements after you get to La Paz. As suggested by other reviewers, the facilities at Tecolote beach are pretty primitive by American standards...but the food is excellent and the rest of it, just part of the experience. The beach is very clean and the water is nice. We usually go to La Paz in February and it can be quite chilly. Last time we were at Tecolote beach, a man got stung by a stingray that was buried in the sand right near the shore. I would not go in the water there again in the early spring without wearing shoes.

311867308.name: Great Trip
311867308.author: a TripAdvisor user
311867308.reviewBody: This is a great trip. Snorkelling is probably better than diving here as the sealions are more curious about people on the surface

310757406.name: A day trip.
310757406.author: a TripAdvisor user
310757406.reviewBody: Not sure what to expect but the tour of the Island is excellent, a lot to learn and it\'s the best place to swim with the sea lions, to snorkel and just relax at the crystal clear beach. Excellent day trip.

310280612.name: Great trip, diving with the fish and sealions, whales close-up, great lunch, nice skipper.  A great value for the price.
310280612.author: a TripAdvisor user
310280612.reviewBody: Loved that trip.  Second time we\'ve taken it.  Nice diving, pristine beach, clear water, wildlife, cave paintings all at a good price.

310202028.name: Do not miss it.
310202028.author: a TripAdvisor user
310202028.reviewBody: Well worth the cost.  It is almost too beautiful to describe in words.  Unfortunately our camera was on the blink, so I have no digital pics to show.  Sea lions, manta rays, coral, all types of fish & aquatic life in the clearest waters I have ever been in.  A picnic lunch on a remote, pristine beach, the list goes on.  Go with Cabo Expeditions. We took the tour from San Jose del Cabo as we did not have a vehicle of our own, but you can drive out yourself & depart from the marina.  It\'s all day & the only complaint we have is that we had to come back!

307553115.name: World class secluded beaches, fishing and diving
307553115.author: a TripAdvisor user
307553115.reviewBody: Quiet remote white sand beaches with world class scuba or snorkeling.  Only accessible by boat, you will pay about a hundred bucks to get out there from La Paz.  If you have or have access to a boat you will be in heaven.

305048055.name: Nature at it\'s best
305048055.author: a TripAdvisor user
305048055.reviewBody: You cannot come to La Paz and not visit Esp\u00edrito Santo.  Beautiful, the color of the water and the sea life are beyond what I expected.  Very clean, with amazing anchor spots.

304199674.name: sea lion adventure
304199674.author: a TripAdvisor user
304199674.reviewBody: Wonderful tour to Isla Espiritu Santo, swimming with sea lions and many colorful fish. AMAZING trip, beautiful island!

302145750.name: A Must
302145750.author: a TripAdvisor user
302145750.reviewBody:
You simply have to go. 
Fantastic green sea with white beaches and red rocks.
Unforgettable snorkeling together with sea lions.
Great photo opportunities

301955862.name: Isla Espiritu Santo
301955862.author: a TripAdvisor user
301955862.reviewBody: Great experience! The Spring was a great time to visit.  The water was a little on the cool side but is offset with wetsuits, that is if you are in the water for some length of time.  The wildlife was fantastic...whale sharks, sea lions, frigate birds, tropical fish, cormorants, pelicans. Sunsets were spectacular each night, a great way to end the day.

298903195.name: The Reason You Go To La Paz
298903195.author: a TripAdvisor user
298903195.reviewBody: Wonderful, austere island with beautiful remote beaches and abundant wildlife. We went with Fun Baja, and had great dives and a delicious lunch in a picturesque cove. The trip to the dive and lunch spots is as valuable as the activities. This is surreal terrain and beautiful to view from the boat. The wildlife is not immediately apparent, but after a bit of accommodation to the harsh light and vast water, it is astonishing the variety of birds, dolphins, mantas, sea lions and fish you will see.

297035556.name: A tour to remember....
297035556.author: a TripAdvisor user
297035556.reviewBody: One of Gods beautiful places. Worth the trip. The right tour guide will make the day a memory you will not forget...

296470559.name: Do Not Miss A Trip There
296470559.author: a TripAdvisor user
296470559.reviewBody: We spent a day traveling around the island. This place is SPECTACULAR. The birds, the sea lions, the snorkeling, the geology and the blues of the Sea of Cortez made for a wonderful day out. If you visit La Paz, you must spend at least a day on Espiritu.

296467145.name: Yes, you need to go here!
296467145.author: a TripAdvisor user
296467145.reviewBody: This is a must see when you are in La Paz. We went with Rafa and Alexia, Dive in La Paz. They are awesome guides, very knowledable. The sea lions have taken over the far northern end of these islands. They have no natural predators in the area and will let you snorkel near them. The pups are quite friendly, some of the males, not so much, just like people...lol. The main island has a very interesting history and is dotted with beautiful white sand beaches and unbelievable wildlife. Go and enjoy!

296055509.name: You need to go..
296055509.author: a TripAdvisor user
296055509.reviewBody: The island is amazing and offers you a memory of a lifetime. Pick a local who knows the island. Don,t miss it Great!!!

295863919.name: Great experience IF you have a competent tour guide
295863919.author: a TripAdvisor user
295863919.reviewBody: Snokeling with the sea lions was a lot of fun and appropriate for all ages.  We later went to another island for lunch which again was a great experience.  Our only problem was the incompetent tour guide.  He actually told an English speaking couple that the reason sharks do not attack people in this area was because sharks come here to lay their eggs!  Can\'t say we had much confidence in anything he said after that gem.  In addition, he blasted heavy metal music on the trip out and on the return, a total of three hours of noise.  We chose to go on this excursion because we wanted to see the wildlife which no doubt avoided our boat becAuse of the pounding "music".

293949143.name: A Highlight of our trip to baja
293949143.author: a TripAdvisor user
293949143.reviewBody: We went snorkelling and boating around the island. The beaches were stunning, snorkelling with the sea lions exquisite, and the trip out was devine.

293534470.name: Isla Espiritu Santo a very special experience.
293534470.author: a TripAdvisor user
293534470.reviewBody: A very special Island experience if you have the time!  Relax  or do all of the activities. Whatever you choose it will be a wonderful memory!!!\n

293393975.name: Simply Amazing
293393975.author: a TripAdvisor user
293393975.reviewBody: My wife and I did the boat tour of the Island, which we arranged via our hotel in La Paz. One of the best days of life I have to say. An amazing place to cruise round. We saw dolphins, marlin, stingrays, whales etc., as well as snorkelling with the wild sea lions. To top it off lunch was in a cove where you snorkelled around the coral reef as they prepare your lunch for you on the beach. An absolute must.

291623768.name: Breathtaking Underwater Experience
291623768.author: a TripAdvisor user
291623768.reviewBody: We drove from Cabo to La Paz specifically to visit the Isla Espritu Santo. Worth the drive. A must see for anyone who snorkels or SCUBA dives.

291453466.name: Best day of vacation!!
291453466.author: a TripAdvisor user
291453466.reviewBody: This was by far the highlight of our Baja vacation. What an amazing and special place. We swam with the sea lions, learned so much about the history of the island and surrounding islands, and saw blue footed boobies. This is a very special place. We went with Espiritu Baja Tours and they are fantastic! I hope to get to visit again!

289819727.name: Wonderful Experience
289819727.author: a TripAdvisor user
289819727.reviewBody: The boat was immaculate, the guide Lorenzo was very knowledgable and helpful. Beautiful Sea Lions and pups, starfish and coral. Food on the island was prepared fresh and served to our table by friendly amigos. Beach clean, kayaks and boards readily available to only our boat. Recommend highly!

289576902.name: Diving around the island is just OK.
289576902.author: a TripAdvisor user
289576902.reviewBody:
There just wasn't that much to see on the island. My real adventure was the trip out to dive around it.  I indulged myself in a couple of days of diving around this desert island.  

It was already hot by the time our boat departed at 8am, but ocean breezes cooled us along the way.  We saw pods of dolphins and a couple of fin whales on our trips to and from the various dive sites located around the island.  Sea lions were in abundance and visited us on a couple of dives.  

72F-76F water temperature, 30ft-50ft visibility.   Experienced some very strong currents at times.

289383763.name: We went with The Cortez Club. The staff were exceptional.
289383763.author: a TripAdvisor user
289383763.reviewBody: We had an opportunity to go diving here. It was so much fun! Barking Sea Lions and playful pups. So many fish to see as well. Such a lovely adventure.

286749958.name: A Must See!
286749958.author: a TripAdvisor user
286749958.reviewBody: Great fishing and lots of sea life! Have spent the night on the island which was amazing! Beautiful!!

285285866.name: A must do in Baja
285285866.author: a TripAdvisor user
285285866.reviewBody: We were a party of 6 ages 17 to 48 and booked a private tour with Alan from Espirito and Baja tours.  It was the best snorkel trip I have ever done!  For a few bucks more you can have your own boat, tour guide and private experience.  Alan grew up in the US close to our home in Santa Cruz, CA and speaks perfect english.  A marine biologist and respects the beautiful environment.   We drove from Cabo San Lucas and it took a little over an hour.  Highlight of our trip!

285054517.name: Beautiful!
285054517.author: a TripAdvisor user
285054517.reviewBody: We spent the day snorkeling around the island. Stunningly beautiful. We swam with the sea lions, picnicked on a deserted beach, swam in gloriously clear, blue water. We booked for a full-day and we were not disappointed.

284210254.name: It is worth it!!
284210254.author: a TripAdvisor user
284210254.reviewBody: We did the usual day trip from the Tecolote. It was great, we saw a lot of marine life. Beaches are wonderful. We did not sleep on the island, but it should be amazing. It is worth the effort and the money

282515520.name: Highlight of our La Paz leg
282515520.author: a TripAdvisor user
282515520.reviewBody: We saw an amazing array of sea life, from the obvious (sea lions) to the unusual (numerous pods of various whales species, manta rays, & hundreds of dolphins!) Pick the boat company carefully so you are assured good service & a memorable outing. If you do, the price will be more than worth it!

282333970.name: Well worth the excursion
282333970.author: a TripAdvisor user
282333970.reviewBody: Enjoyed a day trip to Espiritu. Ther are different companies with excursions to the islands. The high end ones leave on time, the others \'fill\' up as they can and get a boat for your group.

280944422.name: AN ABSOLUTE MUST
280944422.author: a TripAdvisor user
280944422.reviewBody: Such overwhelming natural beauty. It\'s a spiritual experience that will leave a lasting impression. The landscape, plants and animals are all so incredible that there are few places in the world that could rival it\'s beauty and diversity.

280643135.name: Can\'t miss excursion
280643135.author: a TripAdvisor user
280643135.reviewBody: $50 per person from Tecolote beach, for a boat ride out to this island (we used Azul Tours) You will see mobula\'s, dolphins, you will snorkel with sea lions, you will visit a pirate cave, and you get lunch and beers, on a beautiful beach....go you will be happy!

280595248.name: Beatifull
280595248.author: a TripAdvisor user
280595248.reviewBody: Beatifull landscapes, very close to the nature, nace to go with family. Of you go to La Paz this island is mandatory.

278293606.name: Safety issues with SunRider tours in La Paz
278293606.author: a TripAdvisor user
278293606.reviewBody:
I would discourage anyone booking with SunRider.  They do not have safety as a prime concern and in particular the dive guide Sergio.  Two major issues:
1) They encouraged an older man who did not even swim to come into the water in this challenging environment.  They strapped on a life jacket and then told him to lean on another life jacket.  The man was clearly uncomfortable and bailed within a few feet.  Thank goodness!
2) My husband indicated that the snorkel he was using wasn't working but the guide just said to clear it and keep going.  It continued to leak and he breathed in salt water.  After a while, he couldn't catch his breath and wasn't able to swim further.  I could hear gurgling in his lungs and was very concerned.  The guide just encouraged just to "take it easy" and we would "swim slowly to the boat" which we couldn't even see at this point.  At my insistence he swam to another boat and got them to pick us up.  After all of this, their attitude as a reluctance to throw away the snorkel!  And an offer of $10 off a trip the next day!

Given this, I don't know what kind of approach they would take to even more serious situations that might arise.

277726515.name: Very Hot But Still Beautiful
277726515.author: a TripAdvisor user
277726515.reviewBody: My boyfriend and I went to the island with Fun Baja. We snorkeled and paddle boarded. The best part of the trip was the incredible sea life and having your own personal beach.

277713963.name: WOW!
277713963.author: a TripAdvisor user
277713963.reviewBody: We took a tour from the harbour in La Paz with the Sun Rider company out to Isla Espiritu Santos to swim with the Sea Lion colony and sight see along the way. It was so awesome that we went twice in one week. Swimming with the Sea Lions is a thrilling experience! They are very friendly and safe to swim with. Just do what your guide says and all is good. The swim also included a snorkling swim through a cut in the rocks to the other side and the fish life is the most colourful and varied that I have ever seen. The rocks there make a perfect untouched habitat for the creatures that live there. The Sea Lion colony is about 400 strong and is also a permanent home and breeding spot. It\'s great to see the Bulls fussing over the cows and pups. Very familial. Have no fear and enjoy what Jauque Coustue calls the aquarium of the world. The trip back included lunch on an isolated, pristine beach in a bay surrounded by high rock cliffs. The water is clear and tranquil. On the way back back we saw Rays jumping and even saw a Blue Whale mother with a calf. Amazing! I wish I could live there.\nOur skipper and guide are both named Sergio so ask for team Sergio if you book a trip. The boat is a very large and comfortable super Panga with a bathroom and a fresh water shower.\nSergio, the guide, is an avid buff of Baja history and very engaging to talk to. Have a great trip.

277544632.name: Magnificent!
277544632.author: a TripAdvisor user
277544632.reviewBody: The Island is a must see. Charter a boat for the day, take your family and explore this natural treasure. So much to see. Don\'t miss it if you come to La Paz.

277221184.name: an amazing experience
277221184.author: a TripAdvisor user
277221184.reviewBody: Highly recommended!  Contact the whale museum on the main boardwalk ("Museo de la ballena") and hire a panga and captain for the day.  The 90 minute boat ride is worth it, passing by amazing virgin beaches with stunning blue waters and white sands.  Espiritu santo is whehere the sea lion colony is.  We stopped and snorkelled for around 1 hour in the sea lion area where they swim along side you in the wild.  There is also loads of sea life and giant starfish and corals to see.    Definately do this tour when in La Paz

276281759.name: Beautiful desert island
276281759.author: a TripAdvisor user
276281759.reviewBody: Check out my review for Baja Bay Tours to learn more. We went to snorkel with the sea lions, and there are beautiful white-sand beaches at various points along the shoreline.

274895950.name: pristine beaches
274895950.author: a TripAdvisor user
274895950.reviewBody: Great place to break up a day on the water. Magnificent wonder of the world. Tie it in with snorkeling trip with whale sharks and sea lions and you have a life experience few could even imagine.

273505084.name: Incredible day!  Must do for any traveler to Cabo!
273505084.author: a TripAdvisor user
273505084.reviewBody: This trip was so worth the time and cost!  Beautiful water that made us think we were in the Caribbean, snorkeling with sea lions and a variety of beautiful fish, the most healthy coral we\'ve seen in years, watching dolphins play; this trip had it all! Great guides and the best snorkeling in years, due to protected environment. So glad we went!

273459997.name: A Must!
273459997.author: a TripAdvisor user
273459997.reviewBody: I\'ve been to Espiritu Santo 2 or 3 times and each time it\'s an absolute thrill.  The trip there is so enjoyable you almost forget the wonder of what is to come.  Most often you will see whale sharks, dolphins and other sea creatures.  The tours also take you in some of the caves and explain some of the rock formations.  When you get to the Sea Lion colony it\'s awesome.  Different times of the year, you will see the babies hanging on the rocks with their parents.  The rocks are full of sea lions of all sizes.  I did brave the swim with them once and it was fascinating how they are so curious that they come right up to your mask to check you out.  All in all, this is one of the best tours I have ever been on and it\'s a must for all visitors to La Paz!\n\nFirst off, the water alone is the most beautiful color

272639383.name: a bucket list item
272639383.author: a TripAdvisor user
272639383.reviewBody: Wow! So much to see do and experience! Swam with manta ray\'s, sea lions, tons of fish and slept on white sand beaches. I can understand why joque Cousteau called the area the world\'s biggest outdoor aqaurium.

272238198.name: Best Tour EVER
272238198.author: a TripAdvisor user
272238198.reviewBody: This is the 2nd time we have had Alan, our Marine Biologist Tour Guide and Saul, our captain of Espiritu Tours take us to Isla Espiritu Santo to snorkel with the sea lions.  This time our 35 yr. old son went with us and he was so impressed.  WOW.  Everyone was amazed at how much information we received about the marine life and the land.  We all had so much fun.  We had a delicious ceviche lunch on the beach and then more to learn about the birds and sea life on the way back.  I cannot say enough good about these guys.  They are GREAT.

271533967.name: Swimming with the sea lions at Isla Expiritu Santo
271533967.author: a TripAdvisor user
271533967.reviewBody: Swimming with the "sea wolves" (in Spanish) was a true thrill. One female came right up to us and played, bumping me, swimming on her back below me looking up into my face, and patting my husband on the head with her flipper. Lunch was delicious, served on a gorgeous beach, and we loved seeing osprey nests and a frigate nesting site on the way back. Very highly recommended!

270259284.name: Paradise Here on Earth
270259284.author: a TripAdvisor user
270259284.reviewBody: Cabo Expeditions took my wife and I to Isla Espiritu Santo\'s,and this place is so Beautiful it truly is Paradise.The water is as clear as drinking water.We saw a whale,sea turtles and swam with Sea Lions,the whole purpose of the trip.It was so unbelievable you can only imagine it until you do this excursion,so get out there and experience nature up close and personal.

269149509.name: Very eerie rock formation
269149509.author: a TripAdvisor user
269149509.reviewBody: While on a sea lion snorkeling trip, we cruised by Isla Espiritu Santo (spirit island). As you can see from the picture, there is a face in rock. According to the guide, the island has been the subject of legend for centuries - even prior to the appearance of missionaries and Christianity. They gave the island its current name. However, the original native people in the area did not believe the spirit was benevolent, but something to fear. Makes sense considering how scary the face is. If you are planning to visit the Sea of Cortez, make sure to check out this island. Obviously you can only get there by boat. We used Mar Y Adventures.

269140726.name: Don\'t Miss This!
269140726.author: a TripAdvisor user
269140726.reviewBody: Baja y Espiritu Tours took us to Espiritu Santo. It\'s a very cool place, a desert island with unique geology and plenty of sea life. If you do nothing else in La Paz, go here. It\'s a protected national park, so take a responsibly run tour, don\'t just haul yourself over there.

267618610.name: Beautiful desert island surrounded by the deep blue waters of the Sea of Cortez
267618610.author: a TripAdvisor user
267618610.reviewBody: Sunny days and starry nights. Kayaking, snorkeling, hiking and environmentally conscious camping. Cacti and canyons. Blue-footed boobies, frigatebirds, sea lions, and dolphins. Like a miniature Galapagos (with the tortoises).

267516770.name: Highlight of our LaPaz, Baja trip
267516770.author: a TripAdvisor user
267516770.reviewBody: We had been pointed toward another snorkeling company, but they were full the day we wanted to go on a snorkeling trip.  That company steered us to Espiritu&Baja.  We could not have been happier. Our guide Alan spoke perfect English, having been educated at USC, Santa Clara, in Marine Biology. He knew the area and the wildlife, as well as the history of Espiritu Santo. Espiritu is a National Park and Alan was careful to instruct everyone to treat it with care and respect. The cost was totally reasonable.  We were out for 7 hours on the water or in the water, had a good lunch on a sugar sand beach, and were able to sun bathe and swim off of the beach for an hour. Would advise bringing coverups and lots of sunscreen, as it is a full day. Thank you Alan for a great day. www.espiritubaja.com La Paz, B.C.S. Mexico 612.140.1748 cell @ Espiritu & Baja

267236441.name: Paradise for kayakers
267236441.author: a TripAdvisor user
267236441.reviewBody: Beautiful and numerous beaches, dramatic cliffs, beautiful weather, clear blue water, abundant fish and marine life, indigenous history.  We will return regularly.

266145559.name: Beautiful, arid , remote and pristine.
266145559.author: a TripAdvisor user
266145559.reviewBody: Healthiest coral gardens I\'ve seen, amazing snorkeling, varied sea life, playful sea lions, warm waters, few tourists.

265764387.name: Nice Sea of Cortez island but ecosystem (above and below water) is not protected
265764387.author: a TripAdvisor user
265764387.reviewBody: As noted in the title, the ecosystem around Isla Espiritu Santo (and other La Paz area islands) is not protected and therefor shows serious decline in both flora and fauna species, especially below water. Islands near Loreto, Mexico on the other hand are protected and are teaming with wildlife and plant life.

264780606.name: Breathtaking beach
264780606.author: a TripAdvisor user
264780606.reviewBody: the water activities are amazing, especially when you get to swim with sea lions. If you are looking to get away and be in a peaceful beach this can be it.

264257827.name: Amazing Island
264257827.author: a TripAdvisor user
264257827.reviewBody: Loved every minute of the trip and found no good reason to come home...except that thing called work that pays money so that I can come again!

263967670.name: Lovely Island!
263967670.author: a TripAdvisor user
263967670.reviewBody: I loved the island! I got to camp on Candalero bay beach for 4 days with the EPI group! The views are amazing and the color of the water was fantastic!

263613713.name: Spectacular!
263613713.author: a TripAdvisor user
263613713.reviewBody: Stunning scenery and teeming marine life. A wonderful unspoilt oasis. We took a cruise and thoroughly enjoyed it.

263489727.name: The World\'s Aquarium, Jacques Cousteau
263489727.author: a TripAdvisor user
263489727.reviewBody:
We coupled a whale watching/petting/hugging weekend experience at Magdalena Bay with a 5-day/4-night kayaking expedition along Isla Espiritu Santo, and, using BOA as our guide service, the experience could not have been better.  

We were five 65-year-old retirees who had never been in a kayak and didn’t even know how to pitch a tent, and we could not have been in better hands.  Chino is a 32-year-old guide who with BOA who is experienced and wise beyond his years, and he  could not have been more patient and caring.  Coupled with Ricky our full-time cook and Christian our boat pilot, every aspect of our trip was top-notch.

When we arrived, we had a general schedule, but Chino reviewed the schedule with us each evening, and we made adjustments on the fly just about every night, depending upon how our group felt, the weather, and the sea conditions for the coming day.  Often, Chino would give us 2 or even 3 options and it would be up to our group to set our own schedule for the next day.

Isla Espiritu Santo is a Mexican National Park with pretty severe restrictions that keep you off of the island's interior, but oceans, bays, wildlife and views as you kayak the coast are unforgettable.  We slept on secluded beaches, swam with baby sea lions, snorkeled until we could snorkel no more and ate like kings.  Baja California Sur and Isla Espiritus Santo are must destinations for adventure travelers of all ages and expertise.  If you go, contact BOA in La Paz and they will customize a tour just for you.

263479534.name: Awesome awesome awesome
263479534.author: a TripAdvisor user
263479534.reviewBody:
We booked with Edith at costa baja tours , she is sweet and thank goodness can speak English because unfortunately we can't speak Spanish 
Our tour guide lalo was awesome.  You can tell he is very passionate about his job 
The sea Lions , fish and plant life are incredible !!!!
DO. NOT. MISS . THIS .
Our kids are 12 & 14. They loved it.  As long as your kids are decent swimmers they will really enjoy it.   
Recommend a wet suit as believe it our not we got cold ( and I have some extra padding :)
The Canadians

263341393.name: What an experience!
263341393.author: a TripAdvisor user
263341393.reviewBody: This is a must for anyone visiting La Paz. The scenery getting to the island is fabulous.  Stop at one of the isolated white sand beaches for a picnic or snorkel or swim in the beautiful turquoise water.  Then continue on to swim with the sea lions.  It is a wonderful adventure.

263166433.name: Sea Lions and snorkeling
263166433.author: a TripAdvisor user
263166433.reviewBody: We hired a boat trip for the day -  sea lions entertained us - also we snorkeled getting a chance to see many different species of fish.

263076771.name: aquarium of the world
263076771.author: a TripAdvisor user
263076771.reviewBody: Beautiful and desolate--we camped 3 days/2 nights with Baja Expeditions on Bonanza beach.  The color of the water is not to be believed and the diversity of marine life was astounding. Can\'t wait to plan another trip there.

262696956.name: Kayak and camp on Espiritu Santo
262696956.author: a TripAdvisor user
262696956.reviewBody: I did the 4-day, 3-night trip wth Baja Outdoor Adventures (BOA) located in La Paz and have to say this is one of the highlights of my traveling life, ranks up there with hiking the Grand Canyon and Mt. Everest. I don\'t swim well and had never sea kayaked before, but the guides, Pedro and  Drew, were careful, experienced, and fun! The Sea of Cortez and the island are spectacular scenery with interesting wildlife and geology. And with the support of BOA, I ate great food and slept in nice tents.  Despite the negative press about Mexico, I can\'t thnk of any place I\'d rather be than in Baja Sur, looking across the sea to Espiritu Santo.

262515286.name: A Mini Galapogos
262515286.author: a TripAdvisor user
262515286.reviewBody: Espirito and Baja tours gave a  great tour of the island. The area is packed with all kinds of birds, fish, sea mammals,land animals - you name it. The rock formations were awesome and the beach we stopped at for lunch had that perfect combination of white sand and clear blue water.Our tour guide, Allen, was extremely knowledgable. If you are in the area - you need to take this tour!

262215665.name: Absolutely a MUST!!!
262215665.author: a TripAdvisor user
262215665.reviewBody: Beautiful island with pristine beach and wonderful wild life. Absolutely a must for all visitors to this area.

262051529.name: Sea lion heaven
262051529.author: a TripAdvisor user
262051529.reviewBody: Fantastic time swimming with sea lions and snorkeling around the island. This is a do not miss! The sea lions are playful; one actually "nibbled" on my side to get my attention.  Wet suits were a must have. We brought 5 mm for swimming in March and it was perfect.

261695017.name: Heaven on earth
261695017.author: a TripAdvisor user
261695017.reviewBody: We were group of four couples on. Boat with a captain and a very informed guide by Marlin Adventures of La Paz. Wonderful service and great lunch served on a secluded beach after or trip to the island to swim with the wild sea lions.

261339317.name: It was a real adventure
261339317.author: a TripAdvisor user
261339317.reviewBody: Got convinced to take the tour because I was told it takes 30 min To get to the island. It\'s 90 min. I thought we might have more land time to sun bath and hike or walk, that didn\'t happen. It\'s a snorkeling/swimming tour. Regardless of that we enjoyed the tour and saw sea lions, dolphins, sting rays....iit was an adventure!

260015043.name: Heaven on earth
260015043.author: a TripAdvisor user
260015043.reviewBody: This is a very special place - a treasure.  There is a "vibe" about it that is like nothing else.  You want to tiptoe and whisper ... and always remember what the feeling was while you were there.

259176545.name: Marine life wonderland
259176545.author: a TripAdvisor user
259176545.reviewBody: Rich in marine and wildlife, idyllic beaches and crystal clear waters. Make sure you snorkel with the sea lions at the northern tip of the islands.

259099248.name: A day on and in the water.
259099248.author: a TripAdvisor user
259099248.reviewBody: Dress to get wet. The tour we went on lasted most of a day. About a 45 min boat (panga) ride to get to the island from Tecolote , then about an hour of beautiful scenery and history from our guides. The rest of the tour is pretty much what has been described previously in other tours . Our one exception is we were there between hurricanes and the sea was very rough, and caused the tour to be cut short. We were lucky to see and do as much as we did. Still a wonderful experience.

258562210.name: beautiful experience!
258562210.author: a TripAdvisor user
258562210.reviewBody: Wonderful trip booked with Baja and Espiritu tours. Go early so you avoid the later boats arriving to swim with the sea lions and hang on the beach for lunch.  Swimming with sea lions is fantastic!

258476092.name: Scenic, historical, lots of wildlife!
258476092.author: a TripAdvisor user
258476092.reviewBody: This was an excellent trip for nature lovers. We traveled to Espiritu Santo Island via a small boat called a panga, and snorkeled with sea lions at our first stop.  At the next stop,  I snorkeled the beach while Marlin Adventures prepared lunch for us; the fresh ceviche was excellent!  In one portion of the trip, we saw lots of magnificent frigate birds and even some of their babies.The island is made up of volcanic rock and has some interesting formations, one of which looks eerily like a mask.\nHighly recommend this trip to anyone visiting La Paz.  Be sure to bring a jacket in case of rain, as it can get quite chilly on the return trip.

258275824.name: Wonderful day trip
258275824.author: a TripAdvisor user
258275824.reviewBody: Swimming with the sea lions was the highlight of this day trip. Alan, our tour guide, provided a very interesting and informative narrative throughout the trip: giving details on the various birds (blue footed boobies, frigate birds, pelicans, etc.), pointing out rock formations and telling us about the history on the various islands. The freshly made Cevice was excellent.

257489339.name: Breathtaking
257489339.author: a TripAdvisor user
257489339.reviewBody: Beautiful scenery clear water and wonderful snorkeling with many kinds of sea life and coral. Definitely a close call comparing the Sea of Cortez and the Great Barrier reef experience!

257203462.name: must do this trip!!!!
257203462.author: a TripAdvisor user
257203462.reviewBody: make sure you book it with Marlin Adventures they are the best!!! All of our guests loved this trip and cant wait to go back. If you only do one thing in la paz do this!

256934457.name: A wonder island
256934457.author: a TripAdvisor user
256934457.reviewBody: Situated in Cortes Sea, considered by Jacques Cousteau the aquarium of the world. In front of La Paz, you go by boat during one or two hours depending the place of departure, chances are you will watch whales, dolphines even rays. When you arrive at the island you may swim with sea lions, and watch thousands of sea birds. After swimming with the sea lions you land in a white sand beach with blue emerald sea, famous and sometimes called the Caribbean of  the Pacific due to the color of the water. You may swim there and have lunch with very nice service provided by the same agencies that take you by boat to the trip. Facilities as bathroom and food depend on the tour you buy. Funbaja is very recommendable.

256515872.name: A Long Day\'s Journey
256515872.author: a TripAdvisor user
256515872.reviewBody: The boat trip to the interesting part of the island, the area where you can swim with the sea lions, is far and long if you are in a motor boat.  Swimming among the sea lion\'s is exciting and, by far, the highlight of the day.  Afterwards, the passengers are taken to a beautiful bay for a lunch featuring a wonderful ceviche.  The length of the excursion is advertised as 6 hours but due to head winds on our return, we were gone for over 8 hours.  It isn\'t a trip that I would repeat but it is worth doing. If you visit La Paz.

256078644.name: Great way to spend a day
256078644.author: a TripAdvisor user
256078644.reviewBody: Went on a boat cruise to go snorkel with the sea lions and it was great. Had a little pup that was playing with us and he kept swimming within a couple of feet of us and then playfully turning away. The cruise stopped on a little secluded beach where we had a lunch (sandwiches and ceviche), it was really secluded, our boat was the only one that stopped here and there was about 20 of us in our group. We stopped and saw some great rock formations and it was just a great way to spend the day. It cost us about $50 CDN per person and I feel it was money well spent for the experience.

256027523.name: Beautiful!
256027523.author: a TripAdvisor user
256027523.reviewBody: We used Eduardo\'s Tours (by far the most reasonable tour guide!!) to go over to the island, see all the different rock formations and historical stuff, swim with the sea lions, and have a lunch at a almost deserted beach.  It was a GREAT day and I highly recommend for couples &  families!

256022356.name: camping
256022356.author: a TripAdvisor user
256022356.reviewBody: Hotel can help you plan trips, kayaking, camping. We\'ve camped with family and friends for several days on Espiritu Santo and other islands. Sea and Adventures provides great guides, wonderful food and beverages, and great accomodations.

256018301.name: Highly Recommend
256018301.author: a TripAdvisor user
256018301.reviewBody: I enjoyed swimming with the sea lions and the snorkeling.  Water was a little chill for Feb, BUT nothing you couldn\'t do.  They also provide wetsuits if you don\'t want to be cold at all.

255798708.name: Great trip with BOA
255798708.author: a TripAdvisor user
255798708.reviewBody: Guided trip to Espiritu Santo with Baja Outdoor Activities, who did a wonderful job! Knowledgeable staff, skilled outdoor guides, great food, with the backdrop of a world class ecosystem!

255261678.name: Must see and snorkel!
255261678.author: a TripAdvisor user
255261678.reviewBody: Swimming with the sea lions is a fun and exciting topping to the travel by panga to see Isla Espiritu Santo. I highly recommend Espiritu Baja Tours. They enjoy their tours as much as the travelers and respect the land and sea. Tell Alan we sent you! The views of the island are a beautiful contrast to the blue and emerald waters. This is a must do for your visit to La Paz!

255135547.name: Pretty views
255135547.author: a TripAdvisor user
255135547.reviewBody: You should go.  Head to the main palapa for good and drink. The best part of this trip are the employees at the big Palapa restaruant. The feature Chocolate Clams ( I don\'t est them) but they are fab!  Drinks are great and prices fair. Service and friendly staff.... 10+. LPM

255096918.name: Simply Amazing!
255096918.author: a TripAdvisor user
255096918.reviewBody: One of the best days of my life!!  Candelero bay is my favorite, cristal clear water, great weather, visibility underwater 30\'+ , the underwater structures "Garden in the Sea" is shaping up, http://www.jardinenelmar.com/ ; http://www.estanciassumergidas.com/  great spot, if you are in Isla Espiritu Santo Candelero Bay is a must!!!   Just like the other bays, San Gabriel, Ensenada Grande, Bonanza, Partida, Lobera...... \n\nThis is by far one of the best areas in the world!

254957221.name: Beautiful!
254957221.author: a TripAdvisor user
254957221.reviewBody: Took one of the tours out to the absolutely beautiful island.  It\'s well worth the boat trip out there (a little over an hour).  We snorkeled in a couple different spots but the best was the Sea Lion colony on the island.  Swam with the wild sea lions.  They had babies that came out and played and are like puppies!!  Wonderful experience.

254023599.name: Beautiful!!
254023599.author: a TripAdvisor user
254023599.reviewBody: We spent several nights in "coves" anchored around this beautiful island.  Several bays had beaches and trails to explore.

253268164.name: Completely amazing
253268164.author: a TripAdvisor user
253268164.reviewBody: I don\'t know how to begin to describe this trip to Isla Espiritu Santo other than breath taking.  The diving/snorkeling was amazing.  Swimming with sea lions is an unforgettable experience.  Be sure to get a sea lion selfie!  There is great diving around the island as well.  \nOn your boat ride out to the island you may encounter whales, jumping rays, dolphins and many birds.  Enjoy the ride, enjoy the geology, and most of all, appreciate the wonder of the Sea of Cortez.

252836991.name: White sand beaches crystal clear water
252836991.author: a TripAdvisor user
252836991.reviewBody: Very nice beaches and sea water you would expect to find in the Caribbean. The sea water is different on different parts of the island. You can swim with sea lions to snorkeling at coral reefs.

252671180.name: sea lions!
252671180.author: a TripAdvisor user
252671180.reviewBody: We took a specific tour with a guide, and we snorkeled with baby sea lions. One of the best days of my life! We used the boats from the Cortez Club, which is nearby. We also snorkeled with whale sharks but it was rainy and murky, so they were hard to see.

252658428.name: Swimming with the Sea Lions/Snorkeling
252658428.author: a TripAdvisor user
252658428.reviewBody: It was an amazing trip and traveling to isla spiritual is once in a life time journey that you always want to go back.\nRiding in a boat for 45 minutes and not to mention stopping by other island attractions is just really amazing. Our tour guide Jorge is a great guy  he knows the area very well and he gives us instructions and guidance  and he provided us brief history of each islands that we stopped by, The birds colony island, the pearl  island, the tortuga island which we saw a lot of sea turtles, the mantra Ray  can\'t remember what island it was.. It\'s just too many and after we swim and snorkels with the sea lions we went to another island for our lunch.  And it was indeed relaxing I could\'say anything else than praise our tour guide Jorge and his captain who is manning the 16 persons pangga. We will definitely come back next year for another exciting journey.

252497826.name: A little kayaking, a lot of beach time.
252497826.author: a TripAdvisor user
252497826.reviewBody: A group of friends and family ages 23 to 87 went to Isla Espiritu Santo for 6 nights. We stayed two nights in each camp spot and only traveled a total of 8 miles by kayak. We chose to spend more time hiking and snorkeling.  A great trip!

252006671.name: The Night of the Land Crabs
252006671.author: a TripAdvisor user
252006671.reviewBody:
Most people take a day trip to Isla Espiritu Santo. Not us, we went and camped overnight. Just so you know they don't allow dogs on the island. I never did figure out why. Lots of reasons were given but none of them made much sense. 
My partner and her daughter slept in the tent but it was too hot for me so I slept outside on a blanket on the sand. If you have never been woken up by things crawling over your body and face you can't really understand the experience. I turned the light on and there were thousands of land crabs migrating down the beach to the water and I was sleeping in their path. 
The next morning we went snorkeling and the water was fantastic, full of fish. I saw a few Moray Eels and lots of small Mantas. Probably the best snorkeling area I have seen. People here have complained that it was crowded but we never saw anyone else on the shore in the two days we were there.
On the way back there was a school (?) of Manta Rays leaping out of the water. Fantastic trip.

251663854.name: Amazing!
251663854.author: a TripAdvisor user
251663854.reviewBody: I did an excursion through a guy a company that included a boat ride, whale watching, snorkelling with sea lions and a secluded beach lunch. It was all so exciting and wonderful! The price was very reasonable and was a full day event that still allowed for time for something else in the evening if I wanted.

251338852.name: A must do!!!!!
251338852.author: a TripAdvisor user
251338852.reviewBody: Fabulous day!!!!! The water and beaches are gorgeous. Even in June, we saw whales... among other sea life. Seeing the sea lion colony was awesome and even though the water was very cold, we jumped in to swim with them. The bulls can be quite large and scary if they swim toward you. The boat navigated into a couple of caves which was great. The unique rock formations were awesome to see. Don\'t miss this!

251239788.name: Beautiful daytrip but can get very crowdy
251239788.author: a TripAdvisor user
251239788.reviewBody:
We went to the island with a tour company called Espiritu y Baja, which was great (see my review on them)
Highlight was snorkeling with sealions.
You might see a humpback whale or a manta ray on the way to the island, but since they are on a tight schedule they won't wait 15 minutes for a humpback to breach again... (so have your camera ready on the boat)

Just too bad loads of other tourists are doing the same trip everyday, so a bit of piece and quiet is very hard to find on this excursion. Do the whale-shark swimming instead if you only have a budget for 1 excursion...

If it's affordable rent your own private boat, it's always a much pleasant experience...

251002984.name: An amazing adventure
251002984.author: a TripAdvisor user
251002984.reviewBody: The trip to the island is definitely worth the journey! We snorkeled with sea lions and had friendly dolphins chase the boat. The beaches and the rock formations on the island are breathtaking.

250017726.name: Unforgettable trip of a lifetime and I am the proof!
250017726.author: a TripAdvisor user
250017726.reviewBody: I did the cooperatively-catered 9 day circumnavigation with Baja Outdoor Activities in, I think, 2007, and trip memories have done that thing they do, and become part of my life. I am seriously considering a return trip, and I would always go with Ben and Alejandra\'s crew.  Exactly the right amount of care and respect for your independence, deep knowledge of the ecology of the area, great gear - they had everything it took to make my trip wonderful.  FWIW, this was a solo trip for me and they also helped me integrate right into the group.

249571622.name: You cannot miss it !!
249571622.author: a TripAdvisor user
249571622.reviewBody: avoid Marlin adventures. ask to the people or directly in the restaurant El Tecolote from Tecolote beach. the offer is between 600pesos and 750. That allways include ceviche, sandwiches, drinks and full tout of the island if conditions are good. choose a day with no wind, take a wind breaker with you and sit on that back of the boat. wetsuit to swim with sea lions, pareo or towel for the beach stop. very nice day!!

249277636.name: ROW Sea Kayak Tour
249277636.author: a TripAdvisor user
249277636.reviewBody: Amazing landscapes, amazing sea life, amazing guides.  Say no more!  Oh, well, Trip Advisor says to say more....  The only thing I might add is to come down here in March versus January, as you will probably have a few more calm days to enjoy paddling and snorkeling.  Otherwise, a must-do for adventure travelers!

249062234.name: Great snorkeling
249062234.author: a TripAdvisor user
249062234.reviewBody: We did an over night on the island a few weeks after a hurricane. Everything was lush and alive.  A bit buggy at night, but generally not the case we were told.  No body out there, easy get away.

248709683.name: Total disconnect
248709683.author: a TripAdvisor user
248709683.reviewBody: If you need to unwind and disconnect, visit La Paz, Mexico and take a trip out to Isla Espirtu Santo.  I did a 5 day sea kayaking/camping adventure, but will revisit La Paz.  Beautiful place, clean, friendly people.

248483567.name: Dont Miss This Island or your missing one of the Jewels of La Paz ! Seriously Jacques Cousteau made sure it a santuary
248483567.author: a TripAdvisor user
248483567.reviewBody:
This is my second review of this Island and I came back to get Scuba Certified mainly because of how great it is.  First of all take a reputable company Like Carey Dive Center (They have a small bathroom on their boats and supply wet suits if needed) or Baja Adventures is also a reputable company.

Some of the guys off the beaches may be less but keep it in mind that you are going an hour and a half out into the ocean.  Safety is more important than saving a few bucks.  If uyou do go off the beach.  MAKE SURE THEY HAVE LIFE JACKETS AND A RADIO.  You might be surprised to find out how many have NO safety equipment.  Dont Go !  That area can whip up bug wind waves in no time.  

That being said do not miss this island.  Take extra clothes, a couple of towels and some extra snacks and drinks just in case you do not like what they have on the boat.  You will be out for most of the day.  Dont let not being prepared ruin your time.  I have seen some reviews where the customer bashed the guide because they did not speak english or did not have what you expected.  Remember you are in their country and simply be prepared so you dont look like a tourist that blames others for your lack of planning.

Plan ahead,  Do it right ! and have The Time of Your Life Underwater !

247944172.name: A Magical Day
247944172.author: a TripAdvisor user
247944172.reviewBody:
This is an exceptional attraction, spoiled only for us by a poor choice of tour company- Rebequitas Tours.  The captain of the tour boat was very good, but knew virtually no English.  There was no guide.  The only saving grace was that we had two Spaniards aboard, one of whom spoke quite passable English.  They also seriously overloaded the boat, telling us that there would only be 12 passengers, then loading six more on at Tecolote Beach.

We had paid for swimming with the whale sharks as well as the sea lions , but he stop for the whale sharks lasted only about 20 minutes and the water was so murky that you only saw a blur going by.

Isla Espiritu Santu and the sea lions made up for almost everything!  My wife was able to get nose to nose with a sea lion pup and the sea lions were all around us and very non threatening and curious.  I have snorkelled and gone scuba diving in the water around British Columbia where the sea lions are much more aggressive, so this was a pleasant surprise!

We finished with an indifferent lunch on a beautiful sandy beach on the island where we looked enviously at another Super Panga (tour boat) farther along the beach with far fewer passengers and a guide.

I must say that our captain made every effort to make our experience as enjoyable as possible, taking us very close to the precipitous cliffs and even taking the boat into a cave!  We intend to return next year to La Paz and plan to make the Espiritu Santu trip again, but with a more reputable tour company!

247896576.name: Gorgeous!
247896576.author: a TripAdvisor user
247896576.reviewBody: The Isla is beautiful. I was on my sailboat and anchored at Balandra on my way to the Isla. Not real sure about getting around on the Isla but there were plenty of Pangas coming from La Paz bringing divers and sightseers. A beautiful place to visit.

247865376.name: not a good trip to Epiritu Santo
247865376.author: a TripAdvisor user
247865376.reviewBody: we got a private charter to go and visit Isla Espiritu Santo and spite of the fact that day was cold and very windy we were advised to go ahead and ended up in a complete disaster. all our clothes, towels, wet for at least two hours we were driving against waves wind and water until we could not longer tolerate it so we had to go to near beach called Ensenada thanks to the beauty of this beach we felt better. Esparto Santo is to visit during spring and summer time.

246809457.name: Beautiful place
246809457.author: a TripAdvisor user
246809457.reviewBody: If you like nature, incredible views and swimming with sea lions, this is a trip for you. The island is about an hour and a half. Take some beverages and snacks, most trips include this, but they are not very good. Also consider something to keep you warm depending on the time of the year.

246703428.name: Don\'t miss this one of a kind place!
246703428.author: a TripAdvisor user
246703428.reviewBody: Life-changer for me, I got to swim and play with wild sea lion pups, who are pretty much like dogs that live in the water.  We also saw a humpback whale and a school of dolphins on the way out, and stopped at a deserted beach for lunch.  If you\'re in La Paz and you don\'t go to Espiritu Santo, you are seriously missing out! We went with BOA Kayakers, they are the best!

246082901.name: Sea lion tour to "the island"
246082901.author: a TripAdvisor user
246082901.reviewBody: Great trip to Snorkel with sea lions. Use Eduardo\'s tours. They were terrific. Book at booth on Malecon for cheaper rate.

245995032.name: One of the pearls of the Pacific...well, actually "just" the Sea of Cortez
245995032.author: a TripAdvisor user
245995032.reviewBody: In all its glory!  take some time, cruise the bays, visit different parts of the island from the sea.\nvisit the rugged backside.  This island is not immune from the "no- see-um\'s" that afflict much of this gulf from time to time.. simply shift to a different bay or cove!\nSeals galore at Los Islotes, snorkel, fish the island, bake on a deserted beach.

245829715.name: Beautiful island
245829715.author: a TripAdvisor user
245829715.reviewBody: Visit this island! It is a unique and gorgeous place, well worth a visit .Take a full day tour so you can fully enjoy your time.  They offer camping and kayaking trips also, if you are up to the adventure.

245254236.name: Wonderful Family excursion and good scuba dive spot
245254236.author: a TripAdvisor user
245254236.reviewBody: Entire Family took the Mosquito Fleet from La Paz to Isla Espiritu Santo with the Cortez Dive shop. It\'s about an hour from the dock to the island and keep your eyes peeled as you may see whales on the way to the island.   We did a 45 minute dive with he Seals and Sea Lions, who will come visit as long as you are calm and try not to reach out to touch them.  Nice array of fish, star fish and good underwater visibility.  Don\'t miss this opportunity if you are water safe and want to enjoy a group of playful sea mammals.

245167445.name: fab trip
245167445.author: a TripAdvisor user
