245167445.reviewBody: that was a highlight of our Baja adventure, a boat trio around the island and seeing flying mantas and whale sharks, OMG!

245003774.name: Fantasy island
245003774.author: a TripAdvisor user
245003774.reviewBody: Part of a marine park, Isla Espiritu Santo is easily reached from La Paz by tour boat or panga. With seemingly endless coves, each sporting a perfect curve of white-gold sand and crystal clear turquoise water, this is a perfect place to relax and enjoy a picture-perfect day. A background of rocky hills painted in hues of red, pink and purple add to the magic, and a humpback whale and a school of dolphins appearing on our passage in didn\'t hurt either! No matter how you get there, this will be day to remember.

244832028.name: The Highlight of La Paz
244832028.author: a TripAdvisor user
244832028.reviewBody: I visited the Island of Esp\u00edritu Santo with the Company Mar y Aventuras Last november and i have to say it is the most beautiful island i have ever been.\nThe contrast of desert with the turquoise waters... harsh enviroment with an extraordinary diversity of sea life makes this place so special.

244709569.name: Swim with the Sea Lions
244709569.author: a TripAdvisor user
244709569.reviewBody: Well worth the long boat ride! Go with Buceo Carey, they provide lunch and have a little bathroom on their boat.

243660700.name: Excellent Sea Kayaking,... and more
243660700.author: a TripAdvisor user
243660700.reviewBody: Isla Espiritu Santo is not just an island for kayaking. There are white sandy beaches to rest on, corals and sea colonies to snorkel at, beautiful sea shores to paddle past, short but nice hikes around the island, many many wildlifes to observe... the combination of the above made for a very nice experience in the few days I spend there kayaking/camping. I highly recommend a trip there - just remember to bring mosquito repellents depending on the time of the year you go.

242860623.name: Amazing solitude, snorkeling and kayaking
242860623.author: a TripAdvisor user
242860623.reviewBody: Clear, warm water, great snorkeling and kayaking.  Beautiful nights camping on gorgeous beaches under the stars

242783448.name: Tour to Espiritu Santo
242783448.author: a TripAdvisor user
242783448.reviewBody: Love the beach and the one of a kind experience to be able to swim \nwith sea lions, turtles, rays. etc.. Love it

242639994.name: Stark beauty above the waters, and fascinating life below
242639994.author: a TripAdvisor user
242639994.reviewBody: Home to an amazing array of sea-life, we loved our boat tour of Isla Espiritu Santo, and especially the opportunity to swim with the sea lions!

242631587.name: amazing
242631587.author: a TripAdvisor user
242631587.reviewBody: Did a tour up to the sea lions... made several stops along the way to see birds, beaches, and other sites along the way... really pretty amazing.

242585603.name: Enjoy Espiritu Santo
242585603.author: a TripAdvisor user
242585603.reviewBody: A wonderful day trip to explore the bountiful sealife on and around Isla Espiritu Santo.  We\'ve been multiple times but it is always different and never disappointing.

242331172.name: Really Breathtaking
242331172.author: a TripAdvisor user
242331172.reviewBody: Try Carey Diving, a little bit of a splurge but professionally and totally worth swimming with the seals.

241903912.name: Galapagos only cheaper and closer
241903912.author: a TripAdvisor user
241903912.reviewBody: There\'s nothing not to like.  It is a beautiful, reasonably priced opportunity to see nature at its best.  Be ready to spend a full day and if it\'s not a hot time of year, you might want to bring a wet suit or dive skin so you can stay in the water longer with the sea lions.  They are the most amazing treat.  The \'teens\' play with you.  Take the time to explore the subtleties of the bay where they stop to eat.  There are some really amazing things living in the bay.  Savor it.  The aware, though, that if the winds are too high, the trips will not go.  Don\'t be mad or try to force it.  It\'s not safe or enjoyable in that weather.

241287685.name: Great Beaches
241287685.author: a TripAdvisor user
241287685.reviewBody: We visited the island in a 32 ft sail boat. The beaches were uncrowded, the water was warm and clear. Snorkeling was good lots of fish. Ensenada Grande is worth a visit.

240770267.name: Once in a lifetime opportunity, to do list; checked!
240770267.author: a TripAdvisor user
240770267.reviewBody: Me and my family took the tour through kayakbaja.com website.so friendly, Guillermo was an amazing guide. The accomadated our group well for the light lunch (I am celiac gluten free and another was vegetarian). We went swimming with the whale sharks, and sea lions, seen many fish and sea creatures (starfish, crabs...). Toured the island driving the boat through caves and channels between rocks. This is by far one of the best days of my life. No regrets only smiles all the way.

240753986.name: Interactive diving experience
240753986.author: a TripAdvisor user
240753986.reviewBody: Shallow dive with cheeky sea lions. Don\'t miss the swim through where you will have the best chance of the young sea lions playing with you.

239734266.name: A Swimtrek Adventure on Isla Espiritu Santo.
239734266.author: a TripAdvisor user
239734266.reviewBody: Hurricane Odile left the desert island lush with greenery. The beaches are idyllic. The water is warm. There is phenomenal birdlife. We saw blue footed boobies in profusion. The downside is the no-seeums. They were relentless and I felt like going mad from the bites. Bring your strongest repellent. Don\'t bother with holistic or natural oils to keep the bugs away. The mosquitos and the no-seeums are impervious. I am glad I went but weeks later, the bug bites remained.

238831893.name: Great Island
238831893.author: a TripAdvisor user
238831893.reviewBody: Late spring or early to mid fall. Crystal clear bays, mantra rays, eco tourist, mid summers great but really hot.

238507961.name: Don\'t miss Espiritu Santo while you are in La Paz
238507961.author: a TripAdvisor user
238507961.reviewBody: The boat trip around Espiritu Santu was great, the snorkeling with the seals, lots of fish to see while snorkeling, great lunch in one of the cove beaches,

237918727.name: One of the most wonderful nights in my life!
237918727.author: a TripAdvisor user
237918727.reviewBody:
One of the most interesting trips we have done my husband and I, was when we anchored our sailboat in the middle of what must have been the sunken crater of an ancient volcano, in the middle of the Espiritu Santo Island, at the Mar de Cortes in Baja California Sur, Mexico. 
The sea was so still during the night, that we thought we had been aground in the shallow water. But not, as we came out, the ocean reflected to the perfection the thousands, if not millions of stars above us, in the still ocean that looked as an endless mirror. We were suspended in the middle of the sky! 
Then my husband told me to lower my hand into the sea and move it around. Instantly, hundreds of tiny lights of the phosphorescent creatures began to greet us. What a marvelous pause in our quiet night at “La Partida”, which is the name of this place, one of the most interesting spots on earth!

PS. Isla Espiritu Santo is not located at Playa El Tecolote, which is in the mainland. Isla Espiritu Santo is an island.some nautical miles away from Playa El Tecolote.

237282927.name: Beautiful islands
237282927.author: a TripAdvisor user
237282927.reviewBody: I\'ve flow over them been around them in boats, but never landed.  But they are beautiful, reasonably unspoiled, and worth the visit.

236136342.name: Like no other place on Earth!
236136342.author: a TripAdvisor user
236136342.reviewBody: Go enjoy this un-spoiled place with Fun Baja! They take you to Los Islotes to swim with the sea lions too! We even got to pet wild sea lion pups! Then kayak, or just do nothing on this desert isle!

231719350.name: Awesome experience
231719350.author: a TripAdvisor user
231719350.reviewBody: We dove this with few others around. The baby sea lions were curious and playful. Quite an experience. Bring an underwater video camera to capture the magic. Every time I watch my go pro videos I smile. They might want to "bite" you but don\'t freak out. It\'s a playful bite. They are more gentle with flesh than they are with wetsuits.

231038175.name: Gorgeous and secluded
231038175.author: a TripAdvisor user
231038175.reviewBody: This is a must see if you are in La Paz.  We were on a private yacht, so we were able to visit all the secluded beaches and coves and swim with the sea lions.  The water is warm and clear.  Simply gorgeous!

229860323.name: Simply AMAZING!!!
229860323.author: a TripAdvisor user
229860323.reviewBody:
every view is breathtaking, 

FYI---- there is many or well not many but quiet a few tours that will take you there... and well there are also the fisherman who will take you to the island for very little, but what every you do... please dont do that... you'll miss all the excitement.... since they only take you to see and nothing else..

OK now for the real deal... The tour I had originally in mind would not make up their minds if they were going to make the tour that day so i wasn't going to make another trip from cabos (I had a rental and drove myself everywhere) the prior day the port was closed so they canceled my reservation.... well looked around for another option and as soon as i walked out their shop surely enough another tour guy was waiting for us lol.... 

well now to the action.... we got on the small boat and departed to the island.... roughly 40 min trip on sea to the island... so if you get sea sick easily well just take it easy and close your eyes... lol 

once there the tour guy which by the way was very serious at the begining, started making conversation, and showed us @ the island and the many figures the rocks formed and every detail of what made the island so special, in one of the beaches (they are a few)  there was a rock formation man made rock formation bout 500 ft long, on the water, and he started telling us about the fact that Pearls were very common there back in the day... and that of course, like many natural resources man exploited the place, but well your tourist buide can tell you the whole story....  Queen Elizabeth I and many other important people wore these beautiful pearls. many stories he had for us... 

now we get to the sealions... which is pretty much the hype of the tours since you do get to snorkel with them or sorounded by them... its scary i guess if your not to use to it or not really atracted by the fact that you will be sorounded by mamals 3 or 4 times your weight...  in their own habitat... but after all you'll get the gut to jump of the boat and start sknorkling..... trust me this will be fun so enjoy it at your fullest.... we snorkeled for about 1 hour and we saw plenty of them all sizes came really close to them... and well it was  a whole bunch of fun...... btw the snorkling equipment was provided by the tour.  all in all great experience....  there is more activities we did but well ill let you find out when you go... 

all in all it was awesome it is well preserved, many regulations that keep the place beautiful, and awesome for us tourist.... and well without a doubt we will be headed back.  Im 100 % sure you will fall in love with the place... it has one of the most beautiful beaches in the world..... and well its all still there just waiting for you.

IF YOU GO TO CABOS AND DONT GO TO ISLA DEL ESPIRITU SANTO.... WELL YOU DIDN'T ACTUALLY WENT TO CABOS...... you've just missed the best part of it....

228912602.name: Snorkey with sea lions
228912602.author: a TripAdvisor user
228912602.reviewBody: Not many places you can do this.  Great experience and great scenery to and from the island.  Our tour also included a picnic on a beautiful, secluded beach.  Try it.

228264835.name: Nothing short of amazing!
228264835.author: a TripAdvisor user
228264835.reviewBody:
My friend and I read about this as one of the trips to do in la paz.
We booked through fun baja, as our hotel recommended them. I think we paid $105.
The journey out to the island takes over an hour. We had glorious weather and the scenery of the coast line is just beautiful...
When you arrive at the sea lion colony you can see and hear them all around. Getting in the water with them is an experience I will never forget and the young sea lions are inquisitive enough, often coming right up to your face... Scary but such a rush!
We stayed in the water about an hour then headed to Ensenada grande. This bay is just unreal. Crystal clear calm azure waters with contrasting red rock canyon type walls enclose this bay, and a white sandy beach. I have been lucky enough to visit maya bay in Thailand and lake Mackenzie in Fraser Island, but I reckon this tops them both. With Only 15 people on and in the bay may have swayed my opinion but kayaking in this tranquil and stunning bay was amazing.
Chabelo out guide was excellent, speaking fluent English, Spanish and Japanese! He was knowledgable,friendly, and worked hard to ensure that this was a day never to forget...cheers Chabelo!!
With a delicious lunch and a couple of beers(all included), and a view to die for... Simply stunning. Oh and we even saw a large pod of dolphins on the way back..
Best $100 I have ever spent!
Don't miss this trip!!!

226890064.name: Absolutely Sublime!
226890064.author: a TripAdvisor user
226890064.reviewBody: For the ultimate family get away and bonding experience, lease the beautiful Maranatha for an extraordinary holiday. Our family had a fantastic time on the Maranatha, it was 5 days of bliss, staggering beauty, excellent fishing and snorkeling, and the best family time ever.

226073817.name: Frigets nesting
226073817.author: a TripAdvisor user
226073817.reviewBody: If you are here in the Spring don\'t miss seeing the baby Frigates nesting. Absolutely amazing.We were lucky enough to be invited on a friends private boat, but it is really worth the price to pay the tour guides as well.

225875548.name: A must place to see!
225875548.author: a TripAdvisor user
225875548.reviewBody: This was my most memorable place in Mexico! Isla Espiritu Santo is an absolutely beautiful island with a breathtaking beach. The water is as clear as ever and we got to snorkel with sea lions. There are small boats leaving to Isla Espiritu Santo close to La Paz so it\'s a bit of a drive if you are staying in Cabo San Lucas. However, it\'s definitely worth it!

223090146.name: Went 7.24.14 Family of 4 + 2 Adults
223090146.author: a TripAdvisor user
223090146.reviewBody:
We went w. Mar Y' Adventuras and had an absolute great day of swimming, snorkeling, eating and sightseeing!
The water was calm, the boat ride long (but broken up with little stops and/or commentary from our guide), and the swimming/snorkeling utterly fantastic!  
I, myself, had a sea lion swimming upside down underneath me through the cave section.  It was so close I could have touched it!
This was easily one of the high points of our entire trip!  I recommend doing this to anyone!  
Our tour was fabulous because the guide and captain of our Panga knew what they were doing, had everything down to a science, and went out of their way to make it memorable to everyone in our group!

222445116.name: Isla Espiritu Santo
222445116.author: a TripAdvisor user
222445116.reviewBody: This was one of the best days we have ever had on an excursion. 5 minutes out on the boat "Sun Ridr" we saw bottle nose Dolphine- they are Porpoises, swimming ahead of the boat. We saw Whale Sharks, (we swam with them earlier in the La Paz Bay) At the Frigate bird sanctuary we saw babies. juveniles and adults in their Frigate glory. When we got to the Sea Lions colony (400 of them) A Marlin kept out of the water 3 times!!! Swimming with the sea lions was a gas, they were all over the place, under over, sides to us. The coral and fish life was so intact and pristine. It is a treasure of the world. On the way back to the La Paz Marina. we saw Blue Whales. The company we went with was Sun Rider, the launch was good and the staff was informative and friendly. It was a superb day!

221648517.name: National Geographic like moment...
221648517.author: a TripAdvisor user
221648517.reviewBody:
My wife and I did the trip to the Espiritu Santo Island tour with Cabo Expeditions. Let me start by stating that this was by far the highlight of our trip to Los Cabos. If you want to experience a National Geographic type moment, this tour if for you. The tour is basically an all day event. Our tour guide, Jose Hernandez, picked us up at our hotel in Los Cabos at 6:00 AM. From there we were off to a very good local breakfast on our way to La Paz, BCS. 

The tour itself starts with a 25 minute boat ride to the island. Jose pointed out various geological and wildlife points of interest along the island. Next stop was a snorkeling session with sea lions in their natural habitat. I can not find the words to explain how incredible this is. This area also has a very nice coral reef with abundant sea life. Jose and the rest of the Cabo Expeditions staff (in total there were 3 plus two drivers for a group of 13) explained various details regarding the sea lion colony. The staff was very knowledgeable and answered all our questions. They were also very helpful in guiding the team safely along the colony as well as always ready to help take a picture or any other matter. 

From there we were off to a deserted beach. Nothing there but sand and another coral reef. The experience of having lunch in such a secluded place was awesome. And the sea water in that cove was like being in a huge swimming pool. The colors went from blues to greens to simply transparent. I have been to various beaches in the Caribbean (starting with Cancun) and the snorkeling experience here is second to none. 

Jose took us out to explore the reef were we saw pufferfish (at least two kinds), starfish and various other critters. From there we took the boat back to La Paz and were driven back to our hotel in Los Cabos. In all a great experience. You can tell Jose and his staff love what they do and this is clearly reflected in the quality of the tour you are paying for.

Gracias señores por tan increíble experiencia y espero pronto volver a tener la dicha de tener otra excursión con ustedes!

221566995.name: Pristine beaches
221566995.author: a TripAdvisor user
221566995.reviewBody: We were lucky enough to see an enormous tiger shark right in front of our noses, the water, the mountains, the whole scenery is incredible.

218852628.name: Do not miss this Island it is a preserve and the sea life is amazing ! Snorkeling or Scuba its Amazing !
218852628.author: a TripAdvisor user
218852628.reviewBody: Took a tour out to this island where they not only take you to swim with the sea lions they educate you on your surroundings and landmarks.  Lunch is usually provided on the tours.  The larger boats usually have toys to float on where the smaller boats do not have the room for that.  Either way this place is not to be missed.  I used Marlin Adventures.  They were great !

218788335.name: An incredible place to visit
218788335.author: a TripAdvisor user
218788335.reviewBody: It\u00b4s the most wonderfull experience in La Paz. We went swimming with sea lions and snorkeling between thousands of tropical fish.

218618241.name: Paradise on Earth!
218618241.author: a TripAdvisor user
218618241.reviewBody: Excellent snorkeling around the Isla Espiritu Santo. Lots of beautiful fish and even got to swim with the seal...excellent.

218474592.name: Very nice but 1 suggestion
218474592.author: a TripAdvisor user
218474592.reviewBody: I really enjoyed the trip with them. Snorkling, Lunch on the beach. on the way to beach and snorkling, we stopped by some places to see something so that transportation period is little too long for me. my suggestion is they can concentrate more into shorkling and beach. Maybe 15-20min we can extend to enjoy snorkling or spending time on the beach.\nThe staffs were excellent and very kind. I love this team !

218396758.name: Fantastic day
218396758.author: a TripAdvisor user
218396758.reviewBody: A must do in La Paz, the captain and guide were fantastic. Swimming with the sea lions was a great experience. The boat is small, but works out to be a good thing as you get to enjoy chatting to everyone on the boat.\n

217168651.name: One of the "Things to do before you die"
217168651.author: a TripAdvisor user
217168651.reviewBody: There are the full range of operators that will take you there, from $40 to 200 each, depending on your pocketbook and taste. Find operators at La Paz and some at Playa el Tecolote ready to go.

216866122.name: Freediving, spearfishing, snorkeling
216866122.author: a TripAdvisor user
216866122.reviewBody: Great place to visit by Panga for snorkeling, spearfishing.  Especially nice in the summer with clear water and enough fish life, turtles, and occasionally a Pekagic to keep family happy.\n\nSpearfishing can be good depending on season, weather, and your abilities.

216173646.name: Fantastic Islands
216173646.author: a TripAdvisor user
216173646.reviewBody: Beautiful beaches, gorgeous nature, great snorkeling. We had a wonderful day - trip with Buceo Carey. Excellent service!

216148445.name: The \'near islands\'
216148445.author: a TripAdvisor user
216148445.reviewBody: Amazingly clear water with sheltered anchorages. Plenty of sea life when snorkeling , and not TOO far to travel from La Paz.

215993199.name: Put this on your bucket list!
215993199.author: a TripAdvisor user
215993199.reviewBody: This tour was the highlight of our trip to La Paz.  Booked through Espiritu Baja Tours and they out did themselves on every part of this trip.  Punctual pick up at hotel, easy ride out to the island, stopped to share history and stories of the island, snorkeling with sea lions and fish were the best we have ever seen.  Much better than any snorkeling in Hawaii (we\'ve been to every island) and Cozumel.  Simply put this is a must do for everyone.  The highlight was stopping at a deserted beach with turquoise water and white sand to eat fresh ceviche and drink cervezas!!  A memory we will never forget.  Highly recommend this tour to anyone.

215956011.name: Nice
215956011.author: a TripAdvisor user
215956011.reviewBody: It is a bit pricey for what you get.  The boats are okay, and the guides are very nice.  May be worth doing once.

214168846.name: Swim with Seals
214168846.author: a TripAdvisor user
214168846.reviewBody: Went Snorkeling with Costa Baja adventures. Great trip, Great Crew and a must see! Boat ride was approx. 1 1/2 hours to get there and smooth water. The bay is more like a Lake than Ocean.

212932077.name: Snorkeling trip to Isla Espiritu Santo
212932077.author: a TripAdvisor user
212932077.reviewBody: We went to Isla Espiritu Santo with Marlin Adventures located on the malecon in La Paz.     They run a superb operation ---great captain, great boat, well timed, and knowledgable about the area.   This is NOT to be missed if one goes to La Paz, and I would also give Marlin Adventures 5 stars too.

211512597.name: Magic place to visit!
211512597.author: a TripAdvisor user
211512597.reviewBody: If you go to la paz, you MUST go to Isla Espiritu Santo! Dive with the sea lions, watch the whales, the fish, and have a great meal on the beach!

210712404.name: Just beautiful
210712404.author: a TripAdvisor user
210712404.reviewBody: If ever you have the chance to see this beautiful island, or even better-circumnavigate it by boat, drop everything and say yes. Your eyes and spirit will thank you!

210081009.name: La Paz experience
210081009.author: a TripAdvisor user
210081009.reviewBody: We were picked up at 915am, got our snorkel equipment, and on the water in 40 minutes. The boat ride out was easy and the guide, Alan, was great with info and history on the way out and back. We snorkeled all we wanted. Alan dove with us and was a great companion. We stopped at a beautiful white sand beach for a great light lunch and more swimming. Diving with the sea lions was great too. We can say it was one of the highlights of our vacation.

208097736.name: kayak
208097736.author: a TripAdvisor user
208097736.reviewBody: beautiful scenery plus easy kayaking= a great trip! I highly recommend a visit to the island..............................................

207750668.name: Outstanding!
207750668.author: a TripAdvisor user
207750668.reviewBody: Fifty minute boat ride to the island followed by snorkeling with the sea lions.  You then go to a secluded beach where a light lunch is served.  The water is incredible- absolutely crystal clear with a lot of fish to see either snorkeling or just by wading into the water.  Not to be missed!

205340780.name: MOST AMAZING TIME!!!!!
205340780.author: a TripAdvisor user
205340780.reviewBody: We took "Rebequitas" tour to the beaches.... balandra, tecolote, pichilingue, etc... we swam with sea lions, we swan with shark whales!!!! that was awesome!!!! \nwe stopped in a very secluded and beautiful little beach and have lunch.  They provided the food, delicious, fish ceviche, fish escabeche (fish in vinegar with vegetables) chips, drinks and beer!! \nThis was one of the most affordable tour business and no regrets at all!!! they are awesome!!!

205088905.name: Diving and snorkeling at Espiritu Santo
205088905.author: a TripAdvisor user
205088905.reviewBody: My wife and I booked a few days of diving and snorkeling with a tour operator called Fun Baja.  They are located within the upscale Costa Baja Resort Marina and we found them to be very professional and service oriented.  They\'re a little more expensive than the competition, but their attention to detail, safety, high quality equipment and outstanding customer service is worth every penny!

204856757.name: World Heritage Fund Site
204856757.author: a TripAdvisor user
204856757.reviewBody: Preserved island (no development) about 15 miles long with wonderful beaches and moorages; great snorkeling, and hiking. You need a permit to visit. Just a short distance further north is the sea lion colony where you can literally swim with the sea lions while admiring the marine life below!

204839023.name: Bueno!
204839023.author: a TripAdvisor user
204839023.reviewBody: HIt this Island on a non windy day and OMG!!!  You will love it!  They know when the wind is coming and will not do tours if they feel it will be a bad experience.  It is a must see and do even from the Cabo area it is well worth the day trip!!  Just DO IT!!

204222449.name: An Amazing Day
204222449.author: a TripAdvisor user
204222449.reviewBody: We took a day trip to the island with Marlin Adventures.  Our captain and guide, Alan, took extra steps to make sure everyone on our trip has an great experience.  On our way to the island we encounter two pods of dolphins.  Alan made several stops while circling the island to explain the geology and native species.  The highlight was snorkeling with the sea lions and fish.  The day was capped off by encounters with more dolphins, manta rays, and two humpback whales.  It was week of wildlife watching in a day.

202763116.name: Incredible.
202763116.author: a TripAdvisor user
202763116.reviewBody: We took the day trip to snorkel with the sea lions. It was fantastic and included a ceviche lunch on a beautiful, secluded beach.

202496068.name: Loved our camping trip for 3 glorious days
202496068.author: a TripAdvisor user
202496068.reviewBody: Paradise! We went with Baja Adventures and were treated royally. Everyday was an adventure, the food was amazing, and sleeping under the stars in our luxury tent was sosoososo peaceful.

201079085.name: Worthwhile!
201079085.author: a TripAdvisor user
201079085.reviewBody: Came in from Cabo for the day to scuba. Our hotel connected us with FunBaja.  The drive took longer than expected and although they waited extra 30 minutes, they left without us.  No fear... a private FunBaja charter was boarding and the group graciously allowed us to join and connect up with our original diving group.  The dive was great.  I hadn\'t dived in years and originally thought the $180+ price was too much but really saw so much and was well worth it.  Lunch on private beach was delicious.  It was and 8hour trip including the 1hour boatride each way.  Great and want to go back!

200433662.name: Clear waters
200433662.author: a TripAdvisor user
200433662.reviewBody: Glad it was fairly calm with our trip. We had a wonderful guide and that made the trip, he was very knowledgeable. Had an excellent lunch on the beach, standing in clear water watching the fish dart in and out of my feet. Friends had the wonderful experience of swimming with the sea lions

200271006.name: A Beautiful Island
200271006.author: a TripAdvisor user
200271006.reviewBody: I have a sailboat in La Paz.   I love to take short cruises out to the island to enjoy the quiet beauty of the nights.   The endless activities include snorkeling, hiking, bird watching, and the sea creatures from sea lions to whales are fantastic.   Go anyway you can get there!!

200149543.name: Must See
200149543.author: a TripAdvisor user
200149543.reviewBody: Incredibly beautiful (and huge) island! We went with Marlin Adventures- they have a little shack on the beach of Tecalote\'. Amazingly kind and knowledgable guides who cater to the interests of the guests on the boat. We saw whales, swam with the sea lions, saw turtles, beautiful snorkeling and crystal clear turquoise warm waters with white sand as fine as silk. Absolute must do!

199180246.name: Not to be missed.
199180246.author: a TripAdvisor user
199180246.reviewBody:
The islands (there are three included in most boat trips) are a marvel.  We  snorkeled with seals off Los Isoletes,  stopped at Ensenada Grande beach on Espiritu Santo,  visited the Frigate bird rookery, and snorkeled off a reef.  We were extremely fortunate toward the end of the trip to be very, very close to a pair of breaching humpbacks. They continued to breach for well over a half an hour and our panga rolled with their wake.  Awesome in the true sense of the word.

There are so many tour operators/boats to choose from.  We decided we'd prefer to leave from Tecolote beach, which is closest to Espiritu Santo in order to save time.  We also chose to pay the extra to have a panga for the two of us.  More expensive, but we had more room and control over our time.

The ride out and back was a fast and  rough because we had some chop. Pangas do bang you around a bit.  It took the better part of an hour to get to Los Isoletes the far island with the seal colony.  We're seniors and were tired the next day!  It would be a challenge with little children, I think., especially if you leave from further away.  The islands have no facilities.

198975999.name: Awesome snorkeling with baby Sea lions!
198975999.author: a TripAdvisor user
198975999.reviewBody: Great for our family with 11 and 13 year olds. Took BajaFun tour of island. Actual time with sea lions about 40 minutes. Would have liked to stay longer. I recommend you spring the extra $200 and get the private tour because the boat is smaller, faster, and gets you more time snorkeling with sea lions. Nice lunch on a deserted beach set up with tables, etc. Food good. Ask them to make sure they bring the paddle boards for beach lunch. There are kyacks there. Very memorable. Saw whales, and marlin and manta rays (which were jumping out of the water doing flips!), dolphins, etc. Awesome for whole family.

198555570.name: Mar Y Adventura Day trip was
198555570.author: a TripAdvisor user
198555570.reviewBody: We selected Mar Y Adventura to take us out to Isla Espiritu Santo for a day of kayaking and snorkeling.  Our guide was Benjamin and our Panga Captain was Alejandro.  They were a great team who assured our day was fabulous.  The equipment, lunch, and trip planning was perfect.  And a day out at the island is such a special aspect of visiting La Paz!

197962344.name: Wonderful time with the sea lions and more
197962344.author: a TripAdvisor user
197962344.reviewBody: We went on the Isletas and swim with the sea lion tours with Baja Bay tours (which I already reviewed) and it was just wonderful.  One of the owners of the company came out on the boat with us and he even made the best cerviche we have ever tasted!!!!  Great swim with the sea lions, saw the huge frigate bird colony, lunch on a nice private beach and a wonder boat tour of the surrounding gulf of California - what more could you want - pure paradise!  Thank you so much for a great time

197750780.name: The absolute best place to go while in La Paz
197750780.author: a TripAdvisor user
197750780.reviewBody: Go kayaking or snorkeling out to Espiritu Santo with Mar Y Aventuras. Drive up the Cliff hugging San Juan de la Acosta road. Take a cool day trip to Todos Santos.

197725168.name: Kayaking and camping
197725168.author: a TripAdvisor user
197725168.reviewBody: We did a kayaking/camping trip with BOA that circumnavigated Espiritu Santo Island. It was a challenging and wonderful trip. We had calm waters on the day we visited the caves and arches, just spectacular!\n

197592364.name: The most wonderful day ever!
197592364.author: a TripAdvisor user
197592364.reviewBody: We did a day trip with Baja Expeditions, and had the most memorable day of our lives: dolphins, mantas, humpback whales, cavorting with sea lions, swimming with a school of devil rays, sea turtle sightings, wonderful lunch on a secluded beach, and a sunset swim with whale sharks. Forever etched in our memories!

197497977.name: Very cold water and tough ladder
197497977.author: a TripAdvisor user
197497977.reviewBody: On a catamaran with stairs to water 10 or so degrees warmer probably great. Everyone struggled mightily to get back in the boat. One woman fell backward 3 times. I elected to stay in the boat rather than risk reinjuring a pulled muscle. The day before I had no trouble off a cat altho the water was really brisk. Sights were gorgeous. Tour a bit too long.

197497925.name: Worth the visit
197497925.author: a TripAdvisor user
197497925.reviewBody: The water looks like a poster from a travel agency, and the desert landscape sets it off. Avian and marine life abound.

197167683.name: Love the Sea Lions!
197167683.author: a TripAdvisor user
197167683.reviewBody: What a great experience to be able to snorkel with the sea lions.  It was so awesome to watch them play in the water around us and some even coming up to check us out!

196699288.name: One of the best things we did.
196699288.author: a TripAdvisor user
196699288.reviewBody: We went out to the island and swam with the sea lions.  It was one of the most awesome experiences ever.  Just like swimming in an aquarium.  You have to go,

196653911.name: Espiritu & Baja Tours
196653911.author: a TripAdvisor user
196653911.reviewBody: Fabulous trip -- don\'t miss it.  Whales (LOTS of whales), sea lions, blue footed boobies, nice lunch, great guides .. You will not be sorry.

196430975.name: Isla Espiritu Santo Tours
196430975.author: a TripAdvisor user
196430975.reviewBody: This tour of Isla Espiritu Santo was fantastic!  Our group of 11 people, guided by boat pilot Sergio and guide Alan sighted whales on our tour!  First, we saw two humpback whales (a mother and her calf) and later three blue whales which are the largest of all whales.  We saw a very large blue whale close up...right next to our boat, swimming alongside us.  It was an incredible experience!  This is not a part of the usual tour, but a very exciting extra.  We also enjoyed very much the regular tour of the island, snokeling, lunch and other special sights, such as a large group of frigate birds which also inhabit the Galapagos.  I highly recommend this company which is located on the Malecon next to Hertz.

196425891.name: Great Whale Watching Experience
196425891.author: a TripAdvisor user
196425891.reviewBody: We were not expecting such a memorable whale-watching adventure....our guide, Alan, and captain, Sergio, teamed up to provide our group a truly exciting and fantastic experience.  Every aspect of this excursion was excellent....really impressed by professional, friendly and very knowledgeable staff.  Well worth it!

195938573.name: Espiritu Tours gave us a fabulous day
195938573.author: a TripAdvisor user
195938573.reviewBody: Our hotel booked this day trip for us to snorkel and see Isla Espiritu. Our guide Allan was an expert on history and marine life. We saw huge schools of dolphins, a whale and hundreds of sea lions. The tour provided lunch on a secluded beach. The only drawback was there were no rest rooms on the boat or the beach, so it\'s a trip for more adventurous people. Definitely not a  pampered cruise around the island.

195727422.name: Do not miss this tour!
195727422.author: a TripAdvisor user
195727422.reviewBody: This tour represents amazing value and has a duration of approximately 4 hours. Highlights included whale sighting, dolphins, snorkelling at seal island and interacting with the sea lions, lunch on a secluded beach etc. Fabulous!

195726132.name: Silly Sea Lions
195726132.author: a TripAdvisor user
195726132.reviewBody: Being from San Francisco, California, where marine mammals are protected, I signed up with some hesitation at the tour where you can swim with sea lions who are reportedly friendly and playful and where you can touch them. Isn\'t that bad for them, I asked? However, getting to the island where this particular sea lion colony lives and literally playing with the pups was one of the highlights of our trip. This colony doesn\'t have many predators and they are accustomed to us humans and seem to take such delight in playing with us. Only the pups are curious and playful, while the adults tolerate us. It was great fun. Our guide was Alan from Esperitu tours, and he is a marine biologist. The sea lions know him and they swim together beautifully. Then they play with us. One of them kept pulling on our wetsuit strap and nibbling on our arms; he or she rolled around in front of us, and we could pet him all over. It was quite remarkable. The snorkeling was really good, and the beach where we had our lunch was out of a picture book. It was a great all-day tour.

195605324.name: Don\'t miss it
195605324.author: a TripAdvisor user
195605324.reviewBody: We got to snorkel with sea lions and swim in some of the clearest water I\'ve ever seen.  If you take a trip to La Paz, this should definitely be on your agenda.

195495559.name: Espiritubaja.com
195495559.author: a TripAdvisor user
195495559.reviewBody: These guys gave us a memorable day on their "swimming w/ sea lions" tour to Isla Espiritu Santu. Our captain was Paco, who was a friendly and able pilot. He was accompanied by Alan, a marine biologist who\'s a wealth of knowledge about the animals and the geology of the island. The sea lion swim was amazing! Additionally, we saw lots of manta rays jumping out of the water and had a school of dolphins riding under our bow. The ceviche that they served for lunch was great and the beach was beautiful.

195388013.name: An Unforgettable Experience
195388013.author: a TripAdvisor user
195388013.reviewBody: This day trip to Isla Espiritu Santo was one of the highlights of our trip to la Paz. It is a beautiful 45 minute boat ride out to the island and along the way we saw humpback whales, dolphins, and pelicans. At a small island on the north side of Isla Espiritu Santo we snorkeled with tons of playful sea lions and colorful fish. On the way back we stopped at a gorgeous sandy beach for a great lunch of ceviche, sandwiches, and sodas, and had an opportunity to snorkel again. This is a full day trip and we arrived back to La Paz at sunset.  It is easy to arrange  tour with any of the fishermen hanging out on the beach or through your hotel. A few years ago we went to the Galapagos Islands in Ecuador and this is almost as good, except that there are no sea iguanas or penguins. It is well worth the money.  Snorkels, masks and fins are included. I brought my own wet suit but didn\'t really need it.  We liked it so much that we went twice.

194730034.name: A beautiful trip!
194730034.author: a TripAdvisor user
194730034.reviewBody: We did the day long trip to Isla Espiritu Santo with lunch included on a beautiful beach.  Snorkeling with the sea lions is something to behold.  The young ones are as interested in us as we are them. They will come right up to your mask and stare at you with their sweet faces.  Words cannot explain the experience.

194389402.name: Long trip, but worth it!
194389402.author: a TripAdvisor user
194389402.reviewBody: Long all day trip but our experiences with whale sharks, pods of dolphins, mobula rays, sea lions, and the countless reef fish make this trip worth it.

194387609.name: Camped on the beach
194387609.author: a TripAdvisor user
194387609.reviewBody: We arranged a 3 day camping trip with O.A.R.S, and they put us with Mar Y Adventures.  Absolutely the best!!!   Camped on the beach, snorkelled with sea lions, kayaked around the island.  Be sure to keep your tent flap zipped at night!   We had a visit from a ringtail cat, who ate though plastic and all of our nuts.   Beautiful island, wonderful sunsets.

194323518.name: Amazing
194323518.author: a TripAdvisor user
194323518.reviewBody: Did a day tour with FunBaja, and enjoyed it immensely.  We hope to be back again soon for camping and kayaking, as one day wasn\'t nearly enough for exploring the island.

194314589.name: sea-kayakking and camping on the beach
194314589.author: a TripAdvisor user
194314589.reviewBody: Like the sunsets, the snorkelling the beaches, the hikes the views, the animal life \n\nDisliked nothing much.

193202318.name: One of the best island in the world for outdoor lovers
193202318.author: a TripAdvisor user
193202318.reviewBody: Swimming with sea lions; some of the best sea kayaking in the world; camping; and beautiful unspoiled beaches!

192619990.name: Super awesome sea lions
192619990.author: a TripAdvisor user
192619990.reviewBody: A group of four of us took a tour out to the island to swim with the sea lions and it was such an amazing experience! We went in mid January so the water was a little chilly but we had wet suits and had no problem. The lions were so playful and seemed to really enjoy the interaction with us and the schools of fish were not afraid of us either. They seemed to follow us as we snorkeled around. Definitely bring an underwater camera and get some video of the interactions with the sea lions!!! A must-do!

192054774.name: Paddle into Paradise
192054774.author: a TripAdvisor user
192054774.reviewBody: My husband and took a guided kayak expedition on the Island - 4 days of gorgeous sandy beaches, beautiful sunsets and no cell phones! Beautiful weather, sea birds, leaping manta rays and peaceful swims plus snorkeling with the curious sea lions.

191829837.name: Cute Sea Lions
191829837.author: a TripAdvisor user
191829837.reviewBody: Great day at sea LOVED the sea lions - they were like super cute puppies!  The beach for lunch was also very nice and ceviche yummy!

190351005.name: An incredible experience! A few tips to enjoy this place in winter!
190351005.author: a TripAdvisor user
190351005.reviewBody: My wife and I did a guided day trip to snorkel with the sea lions and multitudes of fish while staying in La Paz. The scenery was amazing (desert cliffs and cacti, similar to what you may see in the mountains near Tucson, AZ) ending in the sea. The sea lions were playful, interactive and entirely unafraid of humans. The reefs were beautiful and we got to swim within countless schools of many types of fish. However, remember is that Baja is NOT equatorial/tropical hot, like, let\'s say, Costa Rica. The air is dry, and the water is rather cool (68 degrees F in early January). The boat ride from La Paz to the island takes a little over an hour. The water and rock formations are amazing to see. To enjoy the ride, wear a sweatshirt, sweatpants and a windbreaker. I stayed in the water for a few hours of the day. To interact with the sea lions and really absorb the environment you are in, you need to "hang out" in the water for a while. To do this, wear a WELL-FITTING full wetsuit. (My wife ended up with one that was much too big, and she could only stay in the water for a few minutes before being rendered painfully cold). I wore my own 3mm wetsuit that I own for triathlons back home and lasted all day. Wear a bibbed neoprene hood. Some people wore two wetsuits (a 3mm and a 5mm) and they felt great. The guide company will provide all this stuff (you do not need to bring it), but you need to ask them for it. I learned all this by a combo of luck (I happen to remember from previous Baja trips in winter that the temps were cooler than I expected) and from a very experienced scuba diver we shared our day trip with. Overdress, rather than underdress, and go for it. This day trip was worth every minute and every penny we spent on it.

190280402.name: Anchors Away
190280402.author: a TripAdvisor user
190280402.reviewBody: We anchored overnight at Candalera. Beautiful and quiet, except for some wind gusts. Beautiful beach!

189946715.name: Amazing and a never forgettable experience!
189946715.author: a TripAdvisor user
189946715.reviewBody: This island has beautiful snorkeling, and you get to play with all the young and adolescent sea lions! It is amazing to get so so so close to the wildlife in it\'s natural habitat. I suggest not playing with the giant sea lions because they play too hard! That was an amazing experience!

189933618.name: unforgettable
189933618.author: a TripAdvisor user
189933618.reviewBody: An unforgettable swim with baby sea lions which seem eager to make contact with us to find out who the strange-looking creatures donning masks and snorkels were!  A humpback whale with her baby breaching and playing were a bonus to the trip.

189919095.name: Incredible place
189919095.author: a TripAdvisor user
189919095.reviewBody: Great beaches, white sand, real nature...definitively the paradise! The only tiring thing was the journey

189471160.name: Not a good trip in Winter!
189471160.author: a TripAdvisor user
189471160.reviewBody: We did the snorkelling trip Dec 26th - weather looked beautiful but ended up with 4-5 hrs on the boat with chilly winds, then snorkelling in wet suits wasn\'t too much fun. Lunch on the beach was awesome. Didn\'t get to really explore the island or snorkel again on the reef due to the rough water and cooler weather. would highly recommend in warmer weather.

189405440.name: A must go when visiting La Paz
189405440.author: a TripAdvisor user
189405440.reviewBody: You should not be afraid of sea if you want to visit this place; as you have the opportunity to snorkel/scuba dive in a sea lion community.

188566087.name: Fished here. Please get rid of the minimum for writing.
188566087.author: a TripAdvisor user
188566087.reviewBody: A bit chilly in Dec, but very scenic. Will return for more fishing and exploring in warmer months.    Please get rid of your minumum for writing, so I don\'t have to write lines like this one.

187490175.name: first trip, planning the next one
187490175.author: a TripAdvisor user
187490175.reviewBody:
Did the 4 day kayak trip with Baja Outdoor Experience, got back yesterday and was on the website last night figuring out a trip for next fall. Very accomodating, fit me in as a single with a group that was doing the circumnavigation. 

Instructions on what to bring and confirmations were bang on, boat ride was rough but glorious. 

Joined a supported tour, a gorgeous and magical place. spectacular views, clean and deserted beaches, great food, Mario was a wonderful guide and Ricky a great cook and capitan. 

I have worked in the tourist business most of my life and this was a very well organized, adaptable, and smoothly run operation. Highly recommend.

186874063.name: Go For a Multi-day Kayaking Trip
186874063.author: a TripAdvisor user
186874063.reviewBody: There are a few outfitters who organize multi-day group kayaking trips on the island, generally 3 to 5 night stays. You get ferried from La Paz by boat to their base camp on the island and camp/kayak from there. We did a 5-night "circumnavigation" trip thru Mar Y Adventuras, aka Sea & Adventures Inc., and had a terrific experience. The staff was top-notch and it didn\'t cost a lot considering 2 extra nights in La Paz are included (one night before and one night after at Posada Luna Sol). We moved camp twice in order to paddle around the island, though the itinerary is dependent on the wind and not all tours actually get to go all the way around. Besides kayaking, there was snorkeling, fishing, a visit to a frigate bird rookery (amazing), nature hikes and 2 visits to the sea lions, but perhaps the best part was getting to see the natural beauty of the island up close. The food was good and we enjoyed getting to know the other people on the tour. It\'s not for everyone as there is no indoor toilet and you won\'t get a proper shower, but if you like camping and backpacking then this is for you.

186487897.name: Magical Experience!
186487897.author: a TripAdvisor user
186487897.reviewBody: If you are looking for something completely out of the ordinary, this is the place to go! I was completely astounded by the clear refreshing waters and the beautiful rock formations that we got to go through with our little boat. There is so much interesting history on this island, that I witnessed on our hike to an old water well that was used previously by the military and is still in use! Truly a window to the past. The island is covered with lots of cacti and shrubs, feeling that one is thousands of miles away from civilization, but is actually really close to La Paz! Of course, playing with the sea lion pups and watching the large quantity of colorful fish was an enriching experience. It is so surreal to be on the Island, that when you think about it back in La Paz you can hardly believe the adventure you just took part in.

186089212.name: Totally worth it
186089212.author: a TripAdvisor user
186089212.reviewBody: Take the time to head out to Isla Espiritu Santu.  This uninhibited island boasts beautiful coved and great dive and snorkeling sites.  We snorkeled with sea lions and saw a host of fish.  We kayaked, hiked, and paddle boarded.  What a great day.  We plan to return to do an overnight camping trip on the island.

185143867.name: One of the Best Day Trips for wildlife in this hemisphere
185143867.author: a TripAdvisor user
185143867.reviewBody: If you like wildlife and sea lions, this is a must see.  We had been on a deep dive prior to going out there with Club Cortez, so we had some time to kill before we could dive again.  I opted to snorkel with the sea lions--it was really cool, but if you\'re a diver anyway--do both.  Underneath the water you can see the 800 - 1000 pound bull coming--which is good information given that he was pretty irritated the day that we were there.  Underwater the seals are a little more playful.  You\'re not flailing about and they come and grab at your mask; your hoses.  We could pet one of them . . . they bite like puppies--and like puppies some bite harder than others.  Check out some video of Espirtu Santo, including Los Islotes and sea lion videos, and you\'ll get a tiny taste what the awe that you will be in.  The fewer people in your trip--the better, so I\'d try to find a smaller trip with fewer people.

184925687.name: One word: amazing!
184925687.author: a TripAdvisor user
184925687.reviewBody: Take a full day tour to Isla Espiritu Santo. It is totally worth it. I took a tour through Espiritu Baja tour company. I enjoyed every minute of it. The island itself is gorgeous. Such a unique place. The snorkeling as part of the tour was one of the best snorkeling I ever did in my life. Our boat stopped for twice for snorkeling. Once with the sea lions and once at a big reef where you see so many colorful fish. The water around the island is crystal clear.

184540328.name: MUST HAVE DONE IN LA PAZ!
184540328.author: a TripAdvisor user
184540328.reviewBody:
Awesome day trip!

We started at 9am with a 40 min ride on a small boat to the isla. Then we went snorkeling with sea lions!! They were everywhere around us! Also a great spot for diving!

Then we took a break on a lonely beach on the smaller isla next to Espiritu Santo, had lunch there and then went snorkeling a second time where we saw sea turtles before heading back around 5pm :)

Overall great day trip! Totally recomendable!

Hint: always negotiate with the organizations or fisher men who want to bring you there. Prices range from 400 to over 1000 pesos per person!

182176066.name: Sea lions are fun
182176066.author: a TripAdvisor user
182176066.reviewBody: we went with Expiritu y Baja tours to the island.  What a good outing.  Snorkel or dive in the crystal clear water.  Such a fun time.

182035630.name: Underwater fantasy worlf
182035630.author: a TripAdvisor user
182035630.reviewBody: The seals are so fun to swim with as everyone has mentioned.  The beautiful fish were a surprise for me, blue, yellow, black.  The seastars were varieties I had never seen before & it was awesome watching seals eat the seastars.  FunBaja is outstanding, great clean boat.  Lunch was actually the best meal we had all week in town.  That is saying a lot since we had a lot of great meals.  So worth the money.  Our guide Rafa made our trip fun & best of all, no seasickness!!!

180994421.name: Awesome !
180994421.author: a TripAdvisor user
180994421.reviewBody: Loved the area. Very beautiful boat ride to get there. Loved swimming and snuggling with the sea lions.

180484347.name: isla de santod with Marlin adventures
180484347.author: a TripAdvisor user
180484347.reviewBody: I did this trip with my wife and 3 children, we booked this through Marlin adventures. It is billed as snorkelling and site seeing , we did all of this and more. We had a nice trip out with a stop at Ballendro beach a gorgeous white sand oasis, next was a bird colony then snorkelling at the tip of the island with sea lions ( very cool). \nOn the return we stopped at another isolated beach on the lee side of the island and had an excellent lunch  provided by our guides, more snorkelling in clear blue water. We then started our return and were interupted with a swim with some humpback whales and then a dolphin pod.\nExcellent value and fun , kids were aged 10 and 12 and 23.

177408047.name: Entrancing Espiritu Santo
177408047.author: a TripAdvisor user
177408047.reviewBody:
La Paz is still a bit too touristy for me, but I would definitely recommend the snorkeling at Isla Espiritu Santo!! Gorgeous array of fish and the unique opportunity to swim with sea lions! They are curious, especially the young ones. A female and her offspring came to investigate us several times. Great experience.
http://www.caboexpeditions.com.mx/adventures/espiritu-santo-island-expedition/

Hope this helps. :)

177279679.name: so incredible!
177279679.author: a TripAdvisor user
177279679.reviewBody: friends of our took us on a three day/two night boat tour of isla espiritu santo, which just didn\'t feel like enough!  it\'s an incredible place!  we hiked (a hard hike, but nice since the islands lack many of the predators of the main land), swam, snorkeled with sea lions WHICH WAS AMAZING, and saw several HUNDRED blue footed boobies....  absolutely incredible!

177275758.name: If you miss this on your visit to La Paz, ....big mistake.
177275758.author: a TripAdvisor user
177275758.reviewBody: For 25 years we have lived part time in La Paz, and the absolute most fabulous place to visit is the islands.   We have never grown tired of all there is to see in the beautiful Baja desert, and the cities of La Paz and nearby villages, but the Islands of Espirito Santo carry so much natural history in their lovely bays, cliffs, and geological formations.  Not to mention active fish camps, pangeros, reefs for diving and snorkeling, incredible number of tropical fish species, not to mention the chances of seeing larger varieties.  Whale Shark, Dolphin, several species of whales, including rarely a blue whale...giant Manta Rays, exotic birds and the incredible Sea Lion Refuge at Los Islotes where you can swim thru a natural arch, and paddle around a coral garden, even get \'face masked\' by a frisky juvenile sea lion.  It\'s all very safe with a good guide who knows the territory.  I recommend FUN BAJA....look them up on the internet.  They have good fast boats, and  Spanish, English, Japanese speaking crew .    I could write pages about what to look for where, but the best thing I could say is just go and see for yourself.   Do ask about Osprey Nest and Magnificent Frigate Bird Rookerie in San Gabriel Bay.   the next question in the review refers to what sort of visit it was...I have to say all of the selections but never business or solo.

177038361.name: Not to be missed!
177038361.author: a TripAdvisor user
177038361.reviewBody: For $75 USD each, we took a tour of Isla Espiritu Santo with Espiritu Baja, and it was worth every penny.  You need a whole day to experience the island, and these guys explained everything about the rock formations, the history, the folklore, flora & fauna, sea lions and fish.  We snorkeled with the sea lions and also snorkeled at 2 additional places as well.  We went to a very secluded (that\'s without saying because every beach is secluded on the island) for a wonderful ceviche lunch and swam in the warmest, clearest, azul water.  This is a definite must go!

175601340.name: Awe-inspiring!
175601340.author: a TripAdvisor user
175601340.reviewBody: We took the Marlin Adventures tour of the island, complete with a swim with the sea lions and lunch on the beach. Every view of the island is breathtaking. The only problem was the gasoline fumes from the large outboard motor on the "panga" style of boat, which made us feel a little sick. Still a great tour.

173576663.name: Just do it
173576663.author: a TripAdvisor user
173576663.reviewBody: Two nights in the camp with Fun Baja. Perect organization, good food, free drinks, perfect bath and showers. Everything ok. We were the only two guests in the camp; all at our disposal: the boat for super tours of the island (do it; espiritu santo is beatiful but if you can see it with calm entering almost all the small bays itis wonderful - Rafa, the guide took us for snorkeling in superb spots with no one else) Free use of kayak and stand up paddle and snokeling gear. The bay in which the camp lays is beatiful with clear waters full of fish (we saw mantas and turtles among the many fishes).\nStrongly recommended even if not cheap; staying for the night make the trip to the island a real experience.

173367761.name: Super awesome and sea air
173367761.author: a TripAdvisor user
173367761.reviewBody: went with friends and left at 9:30am .Was an all day adventure . Swam with the Sea Lions and their pups ,saw lots of dolphins and enjoyed the secluded coves where on our tour we ate while looking at crystal blue water . Retuned around 6pm so was a long but very enjoyable day. Would recommend it to anyone who come to La Paz.

172288243.name: Great boat tour !
172288243.author: a TripAdvisor user
172288243.reviewBody: This was a great experience !\nWe got on the boat around the island, seeing the colored stones, lots of birds. And then we got to swim with lobos marinos. There was a lot, it was an awesome experience !! Totally worth it.

171399415.name: If you do not go, there was no reason for your visit to La Paz
171399415.author: a TripAdvisor user
171399415.reviewBody: Amazing place, great wildlife even if low season (August, no whales). The sea lion rookeries are fun and the sea lions playful. The multitude of coves in the island offer places for snorkel, relaxation, and picnic. Even from a non=descriptive beach you can snorkel to small coral reefs where you can spot tropical fish while standing water-depth.

170776947.name: Isla Espiritu Santo Tour
170776947.author: a TripAdvisor user
170776947.reviewBody: It\'s a wonderful Island located very near from La Paz, BCS. You can take a local tour guide and they will show you it. Go to make some snorkeling in the coral reef, take a nice lunch in a lovely virgin beach, see stone caves, well everything was awsome!

170638613.name: Beautiful Marine Park
170638613.author: a TripAdvisor user
170638613.reviewBody: I took two different day trips to Isla Espiritu Santo. Each day was a different experience. On one day, hundreds of dolphins accompanied our boat and we swam in two different beaches. The other day, we were able to spot the "bobos" (blue-feet birds who live in the Galapagos as well). In winter, whale sharks and gray whales are around, so I plan to be back for that. In summary, the Isla Espiritu Santo is an extremely intriguing desert landscape bathed by clear emerald and turquoise warm water bays. Do not miss this.

170561068.name: Amazing!
170561068.author: a TripAdvisor user
170561068.reviewBody: We took the Baja Fun Swim with the Sea Lions trip. It was a fantastic outing. The one hour boat ride to the colony was stunning. Swimming with the Sea Lions was very strictly controlled for our safety, making for a terrific experience. Afterwards we went snorkelling, kayaking and had a fresh cooked lunch on a secluded beach. Just amazing!

169675648.name: A True Jewel
169675648.author: a TripAdvisor user
169675648.reviewBody: This is a protected biosphere reserve accessible from usually a panga style boat.  We have taken boat trips to the island many times.Trips are available from Tecolote Beach and it takes about a half hour to get across to the island.  The tour will take you around the island, through caves, snorkeling, swimming with sea lions, and provide a lovely lunch on the beach.  The cost from Tecolote is somewhat less than booking a trip in town.  We live in La Paz and frequently take a private boat across to enjoy snorkeling and lunch on a beautiful white sand beach.Just make sure you shuffle your feet to avoid rays who hang-out in the sand. Depending on the time of year, you will see whales, dolphins, sea turtles, rays, and many gorgeous fish.

169655329.name: Excellent Sea Adventure
169655329.author: a TripAdvisor user
169655329.reviewBody: The Island has MANY DIVE and or Snorkeling sites. You truly understand why Jacques Cousteau labelled this region of the Sea of Cortez the AQUARIUM OF THE WORLD!  The boat trip out to the island offers the opportunity to sea Dolphins, Whales, Orcas and Schooling Game Fish.\nThis makes for a very pleasant day or overnight trip.\nTry FUN BAJA for a great company with knowledgeable dive masters and attentive service with first class equipment, for you day trip to this World Heritage Island

169647833.name: Beautiful Island
169647833.author: a TripAdvisor user
169647833.reviewBody: Espiritu Santos is a beautiful natural reserve off Tecolote beach...easy to access and is a gorgeous, natural paradise to view wild life and snorkel...well worth the trip...

167940084.name: A piece of paradise
167940084.author: a TripAdvisor user
167940084.reviewBody: This is a wonderful ecological jewel in the Sea of Cortez.  The Island is a protected Biosphere Reserve, accessible by boat.  We did not do the tour from Cabo but drove to La Paz and hired a boat through a local agency.  It was wonderful - we did all the snorkeling, swimming with the sea lions, had dolphins following our boat and playing alongside the boat - absolutely marvellous.  It is a worthwhile trip to a little piece of paradise.

167554199.name: A must during a visit to La Paz
167554199.author: a TripAdvisor user
167554199.reviewBody: Booked through Mar Y Aventuras. Super group and very professional. The tour was 9:00 until 5:00 with a wonderful lunch on a white sandy beach.

167011643.name: Amazing experience!
167011643.author: a TripAdvisor user
167011643.reviewBody: I snorkeled here with my 9 and 10 year olds.  AMAZING.  I have scuba dived all over the world, and this snorkel was among my most memorable and favorite experiences.  To be to be so close to such large, interesting animals (sea lions) was real cool for me.  And for my two kids - they were blown away.  We did the tour with Sun Rider and they were outstanding.  \n\nWe stayed in Cabo San Lucas and were disappointed in the scuba diving there.  Cold water and poor visibility.  We ended up driving up to La Paz a couple of days to dive around these islands.  We wish we had stayed in La Paz instead, at least for the diving.  There are lots of dive sites around this island preserve.

166742416.name: Amazing
166742416.author: a TripAdvisor user
166742416.reviewBody: Beautiful...experienced this with Leos Baja Oasis and had a great time!  Be sure to ask them about swimming with the Sea Lions!

166502400.name: July trip
166502400.author: a TripAdvisor user
166502400.reviewBody: Great value for a 7 hour guided tour.  Saw the sea lion colony, several islands, and beautiful rock formations.  The water in early july was not more than 10 feet visibility.  The water warms in the summer and we were told that 100 feet visibility is the norm.  Water was cold even in our wetsuits but we spent 2 hours in the water with no problem.

165600319.name: Eco Paradise
165600319.author: a TripAdvisor user
165600319.reviewBody: I loved to had the experience to swim with a colony of sea lions. One of them, a beautiful young male,  kissed me without permission. My husband got jealous.

165454742.name: Amazing island
165454742.author: a TripAdvisor user
165454742.reviewBody: I been to Isla Espiritu Santos in May for a few hours and fell in love with it. I did snorkeling there with sea lions and then went to a beach to have a picnic lunch. Unforgettable!

164553564.name: If I could do it again I certainly would!
164553564.author: a TripAdvisor user
164553564.reviewBody: Paradise!  Gorgeous beaches, beautiful water and friendly seals to swim with. A great place to visit.

163679166.name: Great place
163679166.author: a TripAdvisor user
163679166.reviewBody: A magical island with beautiful beaches. The northern part  has a sealion colony called Los Islotes. Great place to snorkel and dive. Have fished all around the island and have always had a great time.

163290868.name: Paradise in a Sailboat
163290868.author: a TripAdvisor user
163290868.reviewBody: wow. what a lovely harbour. a lovely island. sea turtles, snorkelling, swimming in the Sea of Cortez, hanging out on the boat in the sun or shade w a cool drink. we bought a fish from a fisherman when we visited a camp, we walked up and down the beach, we had leisurely days and gently rocking nights. This is a boat trip well worth taking. I got seasick on the way back because the warm wind in the morning just did not stop blowing and the waves were high. And I did not like it that boaters dump their heads and sometimes, if very ignorant, their garbage in the water. They are not supposed to but I guess they think they are free to do so....sigh. not much official presence for a national park, and we never did figure out where to pay for staying there. if they could make that easier it would be good! But wow. The sky! the Sea! the turtles and sea lions! the rocks! it was amazing!

162238642.name: Trip to Espiritu Island with Espiritu Tours
162238642.author: a TripAdvisor user
162238642.reviewBody: This was so much fun, we snorkled, saw the sea lion colony.  We saw turtles, dophins and flying mata rays on the way to the sea lion colony

161355746.name: Never miss a chance to explore this island!
161355746.author: a TripAdvisor user
161355746.reviewBody: Such a jewel of an island with deserted beaches and coves, incredible geologic formations, crystal waters except during the season of algae bloom, a natural phenomena that takes place as the water temp changes from winter cool to summer hot...visibility for snorkeling incredible in the clear bays and near Los Islotes.  Fish may be caught year round...bottom, or more sporting varieties.  You may be surprised by giant schools of dolphin, occasional whales: blue, fin, orca, gray, pilot,...did I forget anyone?  We\'ve seen them all over the years.   Frigate Birds, Blue footed boobies, other fabulous species.   there are small caves along the shores, lovely mangroves, that conceal lagoons in some of the bays.   Even an occasional turtle may cross your path.   definitely the best tourist attraction in La Paz, in my opinion.... oops...forgot the sea lion preserve on Los Islotes.

161285143.name: A day tour is ok, but spend the night if at all possible!
161285143.author: a TripAdvisor user
161285143.reviewBody: Did not think I liked the dessert until this trip.  Isla Espiritu Santo has changed my mind! Breaktaking colors on land, an indescribable aqua water  with clarity down to the bottom white sand, fish, dolphins, sea lions, sting rays, sometimes even a whale! Night sky is filled with stars, peaceful, and quiet. Find a friend with a boat to take you out for an overnighter!

161029293.name: Wonderful day!
161029293.author: a TripAdvisor user
161029293.reviewBody: We managed to get a boat to ourselves and saw schooling manta mobile, sea lions, dolphins and lots of whales. Fabulous :-)

160824946.name: Prepare to be stunned by natural beauty!
160824946.author: a TripAdvisor user
160824946.reviewBody: The islands (Espititu/La Partida) are definitely the most enchanting location to visit near La Paz. No matter what "type" of traveler you are or the budget involved you are sure to have an unforgettable experience with nature. Whether you are a backpacker with limited funds and looking to do hiking and kayaking for an affordable price or an A list celebrity looking to charter a private yacht in paradise one thing is for sure... you\'ll love it! Wake up to amazing fishing, spend the afternoon enjoying water activities then end the evening with a stunning sunset acrobatic show put on by the rays and dolphins. This is the best of what nature has to offer here in the Baja!

160515415.name: Starkly beautiful
160515415.author: a TripAdvisor user
160515415.reviewBody: Dramatic desert island with spectacular (mostly empty beaches). Crystal clear water.  We saw hundreds of dolphins in the waters surrounding the island.  According to our boat captain, the island, despite its starkness, is populated with goats, rabbits, jackrabbits, snakes and squirrels.

160017288.name: A Must!
160017288.author: a TripAdvisor user
160017288.reviewBody: A day tour like no other.  Sun, dolphins, manta rays, sea lions within feet of the boat,, ditto for seals, ,,,,,,,and I never left the boat! Nature and beauty at its best. A natural National Park. I love how no one is allowed closer than 15 feet to shore so the animals rule out here. Cost to get there far less than if you were in any other tourist area. Just do it! ENJOY!!!!

159490315.name: Should be on Your Bucket List
159490315.author: a TripAdvisor user
159490315.reviewBody: Even if you\'ve never kayaked, Isla Esp\u00edritu Santo should be on your bucket list. Gorgeous beaches, awe-inspiring sunsets, fascinating geology, beautiful fish--the island has it all. A week of paddling and camping on the island will change your life.

159391625.name: Magnifical Place!
159391625.author: a TripAdvisor user
159391625.reviewBody: I\'ve visited La Paz for this month and this place is magical! Its very beautiful. I went with a group of people from California and they were fascinated, we are very excited of our trip in La Paz, its very beautiful and quiet.

159318344.name: Nice but too long of a tour
159318344.author: a TripAdvisor user
159318344.reviewBody: The tour was nice however I think it lasted too long (from 9am-4pm). I wish I would have taken a tour from the beach right in front of the island (Tecolote) since the other tour boats take over an hour just to get to the island from the rest of the part of the cities.

158981573.name: real natural Baja
158981573.author: a TripAdvisor user
158981573.reviewBody: Did a snorkel trip so saw many whales, beaches, and a huge pod of Dolphins (300-400 maybe). Snorkeling was with wet suits and sealions. They swim right up to you and sniff your hand

158856321.name: Beaches + Bays
158856321.author: a TripAdvisor user
158856321.reviewBody: Wonderful get away from it all vacation: paddling from bay to bay,  camping on Espiritu Santu and Isla Partida.  Sub contractor BOA (Baja Outdoor Adventures) took care of the food and equipment, ten people enjoyed the first 4 days; five people stayed for another 4 days.  It was all good.  A lot of wind the first night blew my tent onto its side.  That was entertaining in the middle of the night.  THe kayak  guides were first rate, informative and cheerful.  There could have been better safety procedures (no-one had a whistle) and I felt somewhat infantilized as snacks and rest times were scheduled without participants input.  THey  forgot  about my gluten sensitivity and i was served pasta - which i cannot eat -my friend the cook made eggs for my dinner one night , saving me from being hungry all night.

158635242.name: You have to go there\u00a1\u00a1
158635242.author: a TripAdvisor user
158635242.reviewBody: I liked everything, the beach, the site, the panorama. Try seeing it from an ultralight flight, you will never forget it.

157376244.name: Unforgettable
157376244.author: a TripAdvisor user
157376244.reviewBody: We went with Fun Baja to swim and snorkel with the sea lions on Isla Espiritu Santo. The most amazing experience ever. Once we\'re in the water, the sea lions came cruising around us trying to check us out. I had accidentally dropped my goggles in the water. One of the baby sea lions decided to retrieve the goggle and hand it over to my guide. I was totally blown away. How smart was that! \nWe\'re lucky to see a couple of humpback whales near the island as well. It\'s exciting to see them blowing air thru the water surface then diving and flipping their tails in the air. What a show!\nFun Baja also took us to their campsite on the island for lunch. The best sashimi with jalapeno, vegetable soup, fresh salad, grilled fish and freshly made tortillas served under the tent by the bay with the most pristine water. We had the whole bay to ourselves for kayaking and paddle boarding.  Relaxing under the palapas with cold beers (and swarms of wasps), now that\'s life!  Let\'s go again!

157356196.name: A must do visit
157356196.author: a TripAdvisor user
157356196.reviewBody: Whilst n La Paz for a couple of days we took a day trip out to Isla Espiritu Santo, what a place.  Beautiful scenery and great beaches.  We took a short sea kayaking trip and were able to watch ray\'s jumping out of the water.  This was followed by snorkelling with the sea lions at Isla Isoltes.  All truly memorable experiences but for me the highlight was on the way back to La Paz when we encountered 2 Blue Whales, followed by a Fin Whale and the 2 Humpbacks to finish off.  Words are inadequate to describe those experiences.

157146834.name: Island sanctuary so near La Paz!
157146834.author: a TripAdvisor user
157146834.reviewBody: A nice stop-off for boaters near La Paz as no one lives on ES!  It is a protected island  park and a pass is required - but rarely checked. Many bay anchorages surround the island end up being "private" bays. The rock formations are beautiful. Often the winds scoop through the bays (called "Cormuels") that can cause a rocky-rolly night anchored out. No shore facilities and pets are discouraged. Most Baja islands discourage pets due to native flora and fauna being disrupted by domestic pets.

157017913.name: Wonderful day trip
157017913.author: a TripAdvisor user
157017913.reviewBody: Took a day trip with Baja Outdoor Expeditions and had a wonderful day. Motored out to the island seeing whales and dolphins then stopped at great beaches to kayak and snorkel and have lunch. Highlight of the day was snorkeling with the sealions - such fun. A must for your time in La Paz

156883836.name: A La Paz Must Do!
156883836.author: a TripAdvisor user
156883836.reviewBody: Negotiated a private boat at Playa Tecolote for our family of four ($3500 pesos - about $300 US) for the day. Standard trips are about 7 hours and we wanted the flexibility of timing and itinerary.  About 1 hour to Isla Islotes where we snorkeled with the sea lion colony. With them entertaining you, it was easy to miss the spendor of this spot for the other sea life.  We stopped at Ensenda Grande, for lunch but so did everyone else. There are many more beaches, and most with no one visiting, so I would find a more private one in the future.  We stopped for another snorkel and then had about a 30 minute run back to Tecolote when we finished with a great magarita at Palapa Azul beach bar. All totaled our trip was 5 hours which was just perfect.

156450698.name: very nice but long trip by boat
156450698.author: a TripAdvisor user
156450698.reviewBody: We saw dolphins, manta rays jumping out of the water and lots of seals. It is really an incredible experience to snorkel with the seals. Also there is unbelievable fish around the rock and they have incredible beaches with water you usually only find on post cards edited with photoshop.\nThe BUT/ downside is the quite long trip. more than 2 hours ride - one way - is quite boring and without a toilett for some a real challenge.\nI forgot - prices we found from ~600MXN starting from Pilichingue up to 850MXN per person starting from La Paz.

155519621.name: Perfecto!
155519621.author: a TripAdvisor user
155519621.reviewBody: We took a one day outing to Isla Espiritu Santos with Fun Baja in La Paz. Noho made booking and communication very easy evening following up the day before to confirm.  It was the most amazing day of our vacation. (or maybe of my life). Carlos and the other staff were well prepared, kind, interesting, professional and provided an enjoyable and safe day snorkeling with sea lions, a leisurely afternoon on the most beautiful beach, delicious food and beer provided, and we even saw dolphins close up on our return.  I can\'t believe how affordable it was.  I would go on this adventure again and again and again.

154777041.name: The Sea Lions of Espiritu Santo
154777041.author: a TripAdvisor user
154777041.reviewBody: One of the must do\'s on anyone\'s list, whether local or tourist, is to go swim with the sea lions here.  It will be an unforgettable experience of a lifetime.  I know there are probably seasons for when there are more babies, or when the water is warmer, and I have been at different times and have had completely different experiences.  I had to wear a full wet suit once, and another time none.  I had babies swim between my legs and other times protective mothers come at me for being too close. I was never scared, though, even though the males can be a bit more aggressive and HUGE!  It\'s just great fun....even though most of the times quite crowded with other boats floating around...but it doesn\'t matter,...it\'s actually more fun with more people around.  I highly recommend Todos Santos Eco Adventures for an excursion...and they take you to another island for lunch, too.  A wonderful experience for families with kids who know how to swim.

154742964.name: World class sea kayaking
