154742964.author: a TripAdvisor user
154742964.reviewBody:
Thanks to the forward thinking of the Nature Conservancy and others, Isla Espiritu Santo was spared the fate of rampant tourista development.  This is especially fortunate due to its close proximity to its sprawling neighbors to the south, the Cabos and the East Cape.  Yet Espiritu is so easily accessible and affordable, it is a wonder that relatively few people visit.

Perhaps most people who visit book a tour far in advance.  I would advise against that during the windy months until after March 15.  There is no point in visiting Espiritu when the wind is blowing.   During the winter, I would recommend your plan stay in Baja Sur to be longer than the time you plan to kayak Espiritu.  Then adjust your trip plan according to the weather forecast, say mountain biking, hot springs or kiteboarding in Los Barrilles during the windy period.

Some people also try to combine whale watching with kayaking.  The whale watching season ends early in La Paz, so people book kayaking in the winter.  Not a good plan because of the wind.   Book your trip later.   You still might be able to combine whale watching if you go up to San Ignacio, where the whale season ends later.

We booked our flight to San Jose del Cabo on miles and the ecobajatours shuttle to la paz.  Just days before the flight, the weather report was for no wind, so I reserved a tandem kayak from Mar y Aventura and their co-located hotel Pasada Luna Sol.   When we arrived in La Paz, I noticed that the bus was going to go right past the hotel, so I asked the bus driver to drop us off and he did! 

The next day we firmed up the arrangements to visit the island with Belen at Mar y Aventuras.   Their motor boat would shuttle us out to the island, stopping at the seal colony first for a swim with the seals.  We would spend 4 days and three nights camping.  Then they would pick us up again at our last campsite.

Die hard kayakers can paddle to and from the island, but this is potentially dangerous if the wind is blowing.  It still requires a land shuttle to Tecolote, the beach closest to Espiritu.  

The rest of our first morning in La Paz was spent shopping.   In particular, we wanted to buy a coleman 1lb propane canister.  We walked to the Chedraui, but they didn't have it.  Just a little further, there is a Mega, and they had it.  We bought the rest of our groceries there as well.  There is a bus stop right outside, and costs 10 pesos, and brought us back to our hotel.

We brought all of our camping gearing with us, including tent, air mattress and camp stove.  We rented a potty, kayak, pfds, paddles, snorkeling fins, and dry bags from Mar y Aventuras.

We camped at Candelara the first night.  This is shared by outfitters, including Mar y Aventuras.  There is a nice campsite on the beach just north of the outfitters.  It has a very nice tree.  Negatives are algae on the shore and the proximity to the outfitters. We stayed at Candelara the first night because there is a hike there up the arroyo.  We also were able to buy some fish from the the fisherman camp on the north side of Espiritu.

The next two nights we spent in Coralito.  There is a fisherman's camp here as well on the north side of the bay.  We camped on the rocky south side of the bay.  This bay has great snorkeling on both sides of the bay.

The next day we spent exploring the large bay to the south, Gabriel.  This is an expansive beach, quite beautiful, with a bird nesting colony on the south side.  The north side has excellent snorkeling.  There is also a long hike there to the east side of the island.

This bay would also make a great camp, but it is too shallow to be reached by motor boat.  I would avoid camping in most of he area between Candelara and Coralito due to non-biting gnats from the little islands in the area.  One nice camping spot instead of Candelara would be Mangelcito, the tiny bay just to the south.  It has a rocky but very protected camping spot on the south shore.

154541821.name: Visit the seals and make memories!
154541821.author: a TripAdvisor user
154541821.reviewBody: Get in the boat in Tecalote and hang on for a great boat ride to the Seal Island at the northern tip....swim with the seals, eat lunch at a wonderful empty white sand beach and head home for a nap to recover from a wonderful day that you will always remember!

154462765.name: Swim with the seals!!
154462765.author: a TripAdvisor user
154462765.reviewBody: What can I say, the previous reviews have been right on.  We booked a trip to the Islands and left around 9:30 in the morning.  Our captain was Marco and our guide was Eduardo.  It was so much fun.  I was afraid that this would be a "canned" tour but I was pleasantly surprised.  Marco and Eduardo made sure we saw the most we could. They would go out of their way to stop and show us things that were different.  We saw a lot of dolphins, seals, birds, etc.  If you go to LaPaz don\'t miss this!!  I highly recommend it!

154214632.name: Out of the world
154214632.author: a TripAdvisor user
154214632.reviewBody: This is an extraordinary place to take some holidays and to enjoy a new experience. We had a lovely trip all around the isle which seems to be very far of our planet. Swimming with the seals and encountering dolphins was really exciting. A fantastic place to discover !

153903665.name: wonderful water, rock formations and weather
153903665.author: a TripAdvisor user
153903665.reviewBody: the environment is everything you imagine.  it could be a desert movie set with crystal clear water surrounding it.

153840701.name: Isla espiritu santo with espiritubaja.com
153840701.author: a TripAdvisor user
153840701.reviewBody: Espiritu baja is an agency who is located on the La Paz malecon. They organize several tours, but i chose the snorkelling on the isla espirito santo. I had a very nice them with them. They organized all the tour very well. they pick you at the hotel with their van. once you are at their office, they make you choose the sub dress and snorkelling equipment. if you dont have, they give you everything you need.  that day it was a little windy but they assured us that later in the morning it will be calm. and so was. we arrived first at the sea lions area and 1 of them took us snorkelling in this area, to get close to the sea lions baby, which was so emotional!!!! i loved it!!! also there were a lot of coloured fish over there!!! after that, they took us on a paradisiac beach, we had lunch (very good lunch tought!) and have time to relax, enjoy the beach, swim and sleep on the sand! the captain and the other guy who stayed with us all the day were very nice, helpful, and kind. so i highly recommend to choose espiritubaja if you want to enjoy la paz!!

153434102.name: Snorkeling with the sea lions
153434102.author: a TripAdvisor user
153434102.reviewBody: It was one of the most beautiful experiences I had in my life! The "wild" animals were just lovely! And the picnic afterwards in a wonderful lagoon was so relaxing and with the richness of colors a dream come true.

152831627.name: amazing place
152831627.author: a TripAdvisor user
152831627.reviewBody: views! great kayaking, hiking, swimming with sea lions, snorkeling, people... Just come and see for yourself.  Accomadations are basic, so you can touch the nature!

152786116.name: Unbelieveable!
152786116.author: a TripAdvisor user
152786116.reviewBody: Swam with the sea lions, followed a pod of dolphins, snorkeled with a whale shark in crystal water - this is heaven!  Used Marlin Adventures to get out there and had a great lunch on the beach.  Highly recommend!

151398376.name: excellent beaches - went on kayak day trip
151398376.author: a TripAdvisor user
151398376.reviewBody: there are definitely unspoilt beaches on this huge island, and many tour groups have day trips to kayak in the island\'s shallow inland waters. did not stay all day- but would recommend for a day trip (which was about $100 with mar y aventuras, a great local company).

151053678.name: Incredible white sand beach!
151053678.author: a TripAdvisor user
151053678.reviewBody: Saw lots of birds, sea lions, an Oliver Ridlley turtle and a couple of puffer fish.  But the best part was a shore lunch on one of the most beautiful white sand beaches in the world.

150375823.name: Los Islotes and Espiritu Santo
150375823.author: a TripAdvisor user
150375823.reviewBody: We went on a snorkelling tour with Buceo Carey.  Swam with sea lion pups, saw cormorants diving after the myriads of small fish (sardines?), lots of colorful tropical fish.  Sea lion pups are so curious about you that they will come right up to you, even going as far as nibbling on your arms or legs to check you out.  We were lucky enough to have a marine biologist (Rodrigo Rocha) along, and his knowledge of sea life, geology, and flora really added to the trip.

149574575.name: Crystal Clear Sea and Lots of Fun
149574575.author: a TripAdvisor user
149574575.reviewBody: Everyone loves this place obviously and me too. My little bit of advise though is to dry off completely before getting back into the motorboat if it is at all cool or windy.  I was so cold at the end of the trip I suffered minor hypothermia.

148636348.name: Baja Fun - whale sharks, sea lions and crystal waters
148636348.author: a TripAdvisor user
148636348.reviewBody: if you can manage a full day excursion and enjoy nature, you must plan to go to Isla Espiritu Santo. Baja Fun picked us up from our hotel at 8 am (yes, on time) and delivered us to the marina. From there we were outfitted with wetsuits (not everyone needs these!) and snorkel gear. We swam with whale sharks, frolicked with a large family of sea lions, and then chillaxed on Enseneda beach -- really AWAY from it all. The captain and guide were friendly and helpful, a total high quality experience to appreciate all that the Sea of Cortez is known for.

148618930.name: Nearly pristine Baja
148618930.author: a TripAdvisor user
148618930.reviewBody: Took a boat tour of the islands with a small group and had a lovely day.  Snorkeled at  sea lion colony, hung out near a pod of dolphins, saw a wild frigate bird colony, pic-niced, etc. Surprisingly beautiful coral land tropical fish at the sea lion spot, as nice as I have ever seen.

148596649.name: A REAL LIFE NATIONAL GEOGRAPHIC EXPERIENCE
148596649.author: a TripAdvisor user
148596649.reviewBody: You can watch this stuff in HD on Nat Geo or do this tour and film it yourself with an HD camera. This was like being transported into one of the Seas of life episodes!!!

148101100.name: Kayak Trip, a must!
148101100.author: a TripAdvisor user
148101100.reviewBody: We circumnavigated this beautiful island on a 4 day kayak trip. There is lots to do there, even for one day: hiking, fishing, picnics on the beach.

147805061.name: Swim with sea lions...
147805061.author: a TripAdvisor user
147805061.reviewBody: Whole day trip to Espiritu Santo Island. Big sea lion colony, great spot to dive and snorkel. Some tours include lunch and drinks. Bring your towel, sunscreen, bathing suit and enjoy!

147498934.name: Gorgeous Island
147498934.author: a TripAdvisor user
147498934.reviewBody: Beautiful bays, lovely coves, great snorkeling. Very impressive place to swim with the seals and using a kayak.

147351082.name: Spritual
147351082.author: a TripAdvisor user
147351082.reviewBody: I\'m a frequent visitor to La Paz.  But a "to-do" on every trip is to visit Espiritu Santo, every trip.  Sometimes it is like you are in a National Geographic movie.  But it is always enjoyable.

147324444.name: Amazing Island
147324444.author: a TripAdvisor user
147324444.reviewBody: We did diving and also sea kayaking around this island. Its stunning and totally worth it in every way. Both sides are worth seeing at least from a boat.

147197158.name: Up close and personal
147197158.author: a TripAdvisor user
147197158.reviewBody: Ziiiippppp.  This is not for the faint hearted - you will have sea lions getting up close and personal with you as the swim straight towards face then stop when it seems like they\'re about to hit you!  A throughly enjoyable experience where you get to interact with sea lions in their natural environment.  This is an experience most people don\'t get to try, so do it if you have the chance!!  It can be a little uncomfortable if there is a swell running so make sure you check the weather report before you head out - or take seasick tablets.  Aside from that, make sure you take warm clothes for after and a waterproof camera!  Enjoy!

147030209.name: Don\'t miss the seal colony!
147030209.author: a TripAdvisor user
147030209.reviewBody:
Did a trip to the islands by boat, to snorkel with seals.
It was so much fun! They were so playful and loved having us in the water with them.
Espiritu Santo is well worth to see from the boat, it is beautiful.
We came back to La Paz and then snorkeled with whale sharks, which was amazing. 
It was one of the most memorable days ever!

146824988.name: Swim with sea lions
146824988.author: a TripAdvisor user
146824988.reviewBody: Great Small boat ride.  We decided a boat from Tecolote beach, just across from Isla Espiritu Santo would be better than a boat from town because town is 27km to the island.  So we drove to Tecolote and it was only 7km to the island.\nThe Sea Lions were so cute.  The young ones love to swim up to you and surprise you.  They are very playful.  I saw one sea lion balancing a piece of a snorkel on its nose underwater.\n  The trip takes all day.  The small boats leave at about 10:30AM and get back at 4 or 5.  We drove out the afternoon before and got the phone number of the boat, and the price, and made a reservation for the next day.  Balandra bay was nice to visit too.  Here is the number for a boat: Balandra Tours 612 10 5 61 74 or 612 10 5 62 00.  We paid 650 Pesos for the boat ride and lunch and softdrinks.

146521120.name: What fun!
146521120.author: a TripAdvisor user
146521120.reviewBody: The only ones having more fun than you are when you go out to this island are the young sea lions who are swimming and darting all around you while you snorkel around their rookery, looking at beautiful fish, but mostly marveling at their versatility and speed.

146452667.name: A BUCKET LIST MUST
146452667.author: a TripAdvisor user
146452667.reviewBody: You cannot go wrong with this snorkelling tour, but what really made this special was getting up the courage to do it all. Enjoy

146169829.name: Sea Lions and whale sharks
146169829.author: a TripAdvisor user
146169829.reviewBody: Loved swimming with the sea lions and with the whale sharks. Beautiful island with stunning landscapes and rock formations. \nAbsolutely amazing!

145623562.name: Holy Spirit Island
145623562.author: a TripAdvisor user
145623562.reviewBody: This is the island which is protected as a natural heritage. We joined the tour to visit this island. The island is small, however, the color of the sea was emerald green. It was so beautiful. I was very impressed how people respect to protect their nature, bath room was using the water from the sea, and also their toilet was very unique with manual flash. But because of that, this island could keep their beauty. Around this islands, there are the area you can see many sea lions. they are so friendly.

145352178.name: Island Spirit isWonderful
145352178.author: a TripAdvisor user
145352178.reviewBody: This is an incredible trip, easily accessible from the Baja Beach Oasis....do it....you won\'t be sorry.  Circle an incredible island in a small boat and stop to swim with sea lions and whale sharks....amazing.  The Sea of Cortez is full of life.

145340991.name: Magical Island Off of LaPaz
145340991.author: a TripAdvisor user
145340991.reviewBody: White sand beaches for excellent camping. Great snorkeling right from the shore. Los Islotes, where you can swim with the sea lions. Be sure to bring your bug repellent!

144687906.name: Swim together with the sea lions
144687906.author: a TripAdvisor user
144687906.reviewBody: A wonderful experience to have all the sea lion cubs play around you whilst you swim. You can also swim around the rocks where elder sea lions sleep, relax and milk their cubs.

144246273.name: money well spent on the sea lion excursion.  do it!!!
144246273.author: a TripAdvisor user
144246273.reviewBody: We got very lucky and with the help of the nice lady in the tourist kiosk on the malecon, got on a tour at the very last minute one morning.  We met the group at Tecolote Beach and off we went to the Isla.  Our guide showed us several cool and interesting caves and arches on the island.  You actually enter them on the boat.  We then jumped in and swam and played with the numerous sea lions on the norther tip os the isla.  What a blast!!! One sea lion we got to interact with was extremely curious and playful and nibbled my hand and tried to take off my fins! Super cute.  after wards we stopped on a BEAUTIFUL little beach, Ensenada Grande.  The water was sonwarm and clear and the sand smooth and nice.  We swam, watched pelicans diving,and had a wonderful lunch supplied for us of fish ceviche (hubby raved about it) and sandwiches, cookies and drinks.  as if that weren\'t enough we had one more snorkeling episode on the way back to check out the coral and the fish.  Our guide found and caught an enormous pufferfish and we got to touch it too.  It was a gorgeous way to spend the day and they really took good care of us.  we both felt it was a bargain at only approx $50  US.  Go do this!  You will not regret it.  (the outfit we went with was Palapa Azul right on Tecolote Beach---ask for Diana).

144172871.name: Fun snorkel with the sea lions
144172871.author: a TripAdvisor user
144172871.reviewBody: We are traveling by sail boat and have enjoyed many anchorages around Isla Espiritu Santo.  There are many outfitters that take tourist out for a day and you should do it.  It is stunningly beautiful and should not be missed.

143952017.name: Great day out but bumpy ride!
143952017.author: a TripAdvisor user
143952017.reviewBody: Fantastic day trip with Roberto,Arturo and Sofia.Be warned,however,the ride to the tip of the island to swim withbthecsea lions is 90 mins long and can be very bumpy!!It\'s so worth it though.....

143579972.name: Beautiful
143579972.author: a TripAdvisor user
143579972.reviewBody: We\'ve fished off the island, and also taken a snorkeling trip there.  It\'s beautiful, varied, and truly worth the trip.

143487216.name: Amazing!
143487216.author: a TripAdvisor user
143487216.reviewBody: We were very happy to find an amazing tour provider (Hector) on the street and go into the tour with great people and wonderful guide Bety.\nSnorkeling, swimming with sea lions, pictures in water made by Bety, ceviche, our amazing capitan who could go with a boat to all kind of narrow arcs etc.

143026394.name: Mexican Vomit Comet!
143026394.author: a TripAdvisor user
143026394.reviewBody:
On Oct 14, 2012, our last day in Los Cabos, my husband insisted we book a tour. We booked this tour through Olympus Tours in the RIU Santa Fe. We had told Adolpho through Olympus Tours that I was 14 weeks post op from having my pelvis broken in 3 places to correct hip dysplasia. We specifically said no activity that was jarring no bumping up and down. We were told no problem amigo (yes he spoke English well). We were told that this would be a 12 hour trip and there would be snorkeling and plenty to see. We were picked up by a wonderful English speaking driver who drove us the 2 hours to the town of Pichilinge. We were asked what our shoe sizes were and got fins as well as life jackets. We boarded a very small fiberglass boat that was covered with a canvas canopy. By the time we got there it was almost 12 noon. The waters in the Sea of Cortez looked extremely choppy. We were never told that the boat was going to be the size that it was. Even our driver firmly questioned us if were had been given all the glory details of the this tour, which we were not. 

Our boat was piloted by a young man who could not have been more than in his late teens to early 20's. At one point the conditions were so rough that an older man whom was the actual guide had to take over because of the wave conditions. The wind was very strong. The boat ride was quite scary at times. The bottom of the boat kept smacking the waves with a violent force. We were never told to take motion sickness medications before the trip. This is not our first boat trip as we are avid cruisers and have been on small boats so we were prepared. There were 5 other participants on this trip. A couple from Venezuela with a 2 year old child as well as another couple who where enjoying "life off the grid." Our guide did not speak English and he always talked to the family from Venezuela never looking at the English speaking people. If we were lucky they would translate for us what the guide said. We were not given a map of the area we were traveling. We did not know where we were going or what we would see. After about an hour or so we arrived at our first worthy stop. It was a foul smelling group of birds siting on mangroves. We lingered there about 2 minutes. We did not see any whale sharks, though we were told they were in season. I believe the reason we did not see any was because of the harsh surface conditions. We then visited Baja Camp. This camp is only open a few months through September. Our non English speaking guide starts trekking up to a rocky side of a cliff. We were told that sandals were all that we needed to bring as far as foot wear. I was unable to climb with the others. The terrain was wet, sandy and rocky. Yet our guide was barefoot.

The next stop was sea lion mountain. We were not told that the same place the sea lions were was where we would be snorkeling.  Everyone was ushered out of the boat. I could not use the flippers because that would have caused too much resistance on my hip, so my husband and I hung out on the "life line" behind the boat. The couple from Venezuela told us that the guide told everyone not to get too close to the sea lions. Too me the people who where snorkeling were too close to the sea lions. There we're several large bulls grunting and could have been asserted their dominance over anyone in the water. I was also stung my several jelly fish and I was told not to worry they are very small. We stayed there too long. Our next stop was another small island beach where we were served ceviche and were given the option of making a ham and cheese sandwich. After a snack which I did not really partake it we were allowed to play in the shallow clear waters for about 30 minutes before heading back. We just wanted this trip from hell to be over. Please don't waste your money or time on this trip.

140069208.name: Snorkeling with the Sea Lions
140069208.author: a TripAdvisor user
140069208.reviewBody: We could get SO close!  The sea was so clear and the sea life abundant! Leo and Romi made sure we got to the "choice" areas

138836497.name: Not to be missed
138836497.author: a TripAdvisor user
138836497.reviewBody: An extraordinary sanctuary accessed only by licensed guides.  Beautiful sea life and views.  Boat ride is a little long, but a must-do trip.

136858767.name: GORGEOUS!!! island
136858767.author: a TripAdvisor user
136858767.reviewBody:
I hade such a good time... it took us over 6 hrs to go around the island, lot of cliffs, wild sealife, dolphins, niche beaches everything....
Sad it was WAY TOO HOT but it is only this way from july to september...
We had great cebiche at the beach.
snorkel with sea lions, wow.. i love pictures and this was a great location.

136761399.name: Once-in-a-lifetime
136761399.author: a TripAdvisor user
136761399.reviewBody: Amazing experience with the sea lions, especially swimming through the arch. Also loved the gorgonian corals, which I did not see elsewhere in the Sea.

135101467.name: A Snorkeler\'s Dream
135101467.author: a TripAdvisor user
135101467.reviewBody: Better than Molokini on Maui. Fish and Seals everywhere. Too bad it\'s so far to get to it. Still... I\'d go again anytime...

134831431.name: Was definitely fun
134831431.author: a TripAdvisor user
134831431.reviewBody: Booked a dive trip through Fun Baja out of La Paz,(Very good business).  Dove the Sea Lion rookery and a drift dive near where we had lunch on the island.  Both dives were good, but not spectacular.  Water was green and 30ft visability.  This is in mid July 2012, and apparantly they are having a lot of upwelling issues keeping the water cool and green this year. Probably better later in the year.  The beach and lunch were fantastic.

134585856.name: Beautiful, just beautiful!
134585856.author: a TripAdvisor user
134585856.reviewBody: The sand is white and the water a lovely turquoise blue.

134221712.name: Up close and personal with sea lions
134221712.author: a TripAdvisor user
134221712.reviewBody: I found the water too cold for my liking and should have rented a wet suit for $10. My wife was more adventurous and spent an hour in the water with the sea lions. They came right up to her and seemed to sniff her hand like a dog would.

134043877.name: beautiful...just beautiful
134043877.author: a TripAdvisor user
134043877.reviewBody: This is a must do tour!!!!! It may be 2hours away from Cabo, but the it is absolutely stunning. We were able to see Sea Lions in their natural habitat and was provided with a history lesson about the island. Truly spectacular. We ended up in an untouched/remote beach. the water was crystal clear, water lukewarm and atmosphere was relaxing. went there brown came back dark due to how hot it was!\n\nwe done this tour with Tours R Us and they were extremely friendly. i would recommend them to everyone!

133977403.name: Sea lions
133977403.author: a TripAdvisor user
133977403.reviewBody: Great day boat trip. Beautiful sea life and the greatest experience of all. Swimming with the nice and huge sea lions.

132855742.name: Snorkeling trip with The One Baja
132855742.author: a TripAdvisor user
132855742.reviewBody: Snorkeling with sea lions was the most exciting thing my children and I did in Mexico.  Loved it.

132816927.name: Sea of Cortez at its best!
132816927.author: a TripAdvisor user
132816927.reviewBody: We are sailors and the anchorage between Espiritu and Partida doesn\'t get any better!

132494169.name: THE REAL SEA WORLD!!!
132494169.author: a TripAdvisor user
132494169.reviewBody: Wow. What a day. This was one of the coolest things I\'ve done in my life. We saw 20-30 dolphins, hundreds of sealions, their babies, snorkled, had a picnic on the beach, manta rays, and a 5 hour boat tour all for less than a visit to sea World, and this was the real deal out there where they live. Amazing. Everyone should do this. Snorkel, mask, drinks, & simple lunch was all included. Prices in town vary from 600-750 pesos per person, but oh so worth so much more!

132464322.name: Snorkling Trip
132464322.author: a TripAdvisor user
132464322.reviewBody: We saw the island from a boat on a snorkling trip. It was really pretty and the snorkling was amazing.

131951548.name: An incredible island
131951548.author: a TripAdvisor user
131951548.reviewBody: If you go by boat, there are many beautiful and protected anchorages.\nThe Islands of Espiritu Santos and Partida are just wonderful and swimming with the seals at Los Islotes is an unforgettable experience.

131194817.name: Not like any place on earth
131194817.author: a TripAdvisor user
131194817.reviewBody: It takes most of a day by boat to circumnavigate the islands of Espiritu and la Partida.  The islands are a moonscape of geology and history. Take time to swim at the sea lion colony, have lunch on a beach and snorkle in one of the bays spot the fish and mammal activity on the sea.

130944572.name: boat trip is a must
130944572.author: a TripAdvisor user
130944572.reviewBody: We did a day trip out on a boat. We went snorkeling with sea lions!

130687679.name: Must See Day Tour by boat
130687679.author: a TripAdvisor user
130687679.reviewBody: Wonderful day tour where you can see Sea Lions, Whales, Dolphins, secluded beaches, etc.

129783012.name: Clear water abundant sea life
129783012.author: a TripAdvisor user
129783012.reviewBody: The water was brisk in March but still warmer than PNW waters in August!

129654068.name: Very hard to add more than what has already been written.
129654068.author: a TripAdvisor user
129654068.reviewBody:
I have visited the island along with the northern neighbor Partitad many times and always love the experience. i am fortunate because I live on my boat here and travel around the Sea of Cortez. On a windless day the water is the most beautiful colors and the sand beaches are as white as you will find on the Pacific Coast. Because this is a National Park, the flora and fauna are protected from predation except by a few pangueros who base here. And they are well controlled so the snorkling is awesome (lots of sealife).

Cruising around here you are likely to see hundreds if not thousands of Bottle Nosed Dolphins, occasionally Whale Sharks (docile plankton feeders) as well as other Whales, jumping Ray's as this place is alive with sealife.

You will need a Park Permit to visit. They are available in La Paz and the rangers sell them as well once you are over there.

129619790.name: Sailed
129619790.author: a TripAdvisor user
129619790.reviewBody: Sailed and anchored. Very nice!!! The water is amazing.

129324496.name: Island getaway!
129324496.author: a TripAdvisor user
129324496.reviewBody: It is a protected area, and just lovely beaches that we walked and swam in.  We didn\'t see any other people, which made it so nice!

129258323.name: Best experience Ever
129258323.author: a TripAdvisor user
129258323.reviewBody: If you\'re in Baja you have to go to the island! No matter what tour company or private boat you choose, a trip to the island is a most. After all, it\'s the famous Aquarium of the World

128432036.name: Fun Baja Mini-Safari to Espiritu Santo
128432036.author: a TripAdvisor user
128432036.reviewBody: My first thought was $360 pp for a single night seemed awfully steep, but this turned out to be one of the most incredible adventures our family has had in 13 years of visiting Baja.  We only had a couple of days before our timeshare week in Cabo, and my wife and 17-year-old son and I flew into La Paz.  Having flown over the Sea of Cortez many times we imagined exploring some of the deserted islands and beaches we saw, and this time we decided we would do just that.  I found Fun Baja (funbaja.com) after a little looking around, and they offered a 2-day "mini-safari."  The communications with Chabelo and Naho in the office via email was prompt and detailed, and since the island camp was mostly occupied by one group, the three of us essentially ended up with a private tour guide and boat driver.  Juan, the guide, was knowledgeable and incredibly enthusiastic - he really loves his job and has just as much fun as the guests.  Edcardo, our boat captain, was able to take us to wherever the whales or dolphins were, and was always careful to drive the boat in a way to minimize bouncing or rolling.  We headed out of La Paz and visited several sea bird rookeries along the way.  We spotted a young whale shark (the season was pretty much over, so this was a find), and jumped in to swim along with him.  We were able to see the other island camps run by the other companies, and Fun Baja has by far the most beautiful location - an emerald-green protected cove ringed by spectacular rocks.  They had spacious tents set up for us with cots and clean sleeping bags, sheets, pillows, and towels.  The bathroom facilities were rustic, but were clean and green (they are like boat toilets and the pump out tanks go back to La Paz).  There was another group there with about 10 tents who we barely encountered, since they were out and about most of the time, and everyone goes to sleep worn out anyway.  Fun Baja has a meal tent and kitchen set up and provided hot lunches and dinners, beer & other adult beverages, soft drinks, etc.  We enjoyed freshly-caught fish tacos and beef fajitas.  They brought along pineapple, snacks and drinks on the boat as well.  The beach was amazing and you could wade out well into the cove.  They have kayaks and stand-up paddle boards, and there are several great hikes through the rocky interior.  You pretty much let them know what you enjoy and they\'ll make it work for you. A quick boat ride away is a rocky outcropping where the sea lions hang out, and we went snorkeling there under Juan\'s watchful eye (he\'s a scuba instructor so we felt very secure following his lead).  We paid a $10 extra fee each for wetsuits before we left, but it was a good idea in early April.  We interacted with sea lions (the baby ones are very playful, although their parents will rein them in if they are too rambunctious) - they\'ll let you touch them and they\'ll playfully bite at your arms or hand (softly though).  There\'s a cool sea-cave, an arch you can swim through to the other side of the rocks, and a wonderful coral reef with all kinds of sea stars and other fish.  We also visited another cove where black pearls were once farmed (it was apparently the world capital for pearls at one time), but now it is a sanctuary with very little sign of previous habitation.  A hike across the island revealed the cliffs of the seaward side, and the mangrove swamp was beautiful.  We also drove our boat through schools of dolphin that swam with us and jumped, then went in search of whales.  We ended up seeing four types of whales, some were just yards away from the boat.  Edcardo would kill the engine and we\'d be surrounded by the sounds of whales spouting.  For a spectacular camping adventure under the stars, four meals, drinks, snacks, swimming with the sea lions (twice), hiking (twice), kayaking, stand-up paddle, dolphins, whales, whale shark, and birds, we couldn\'t believe how much adventure we got for our money.  This is not like those canned tourist adventures in Cabo - this is a real eco-adventure with people who really care about the environmental wonders they have in La Paz.  I HIGHLY recommend this to anyone who wants to experience the real magic of Baja.

128431980.name: Beautiful rock formations
128431980.author: a TripAdvisor user
128431980.reviewBody: The island is most interesting with all of it\'s creative rock formations and unique colors, alot of nice secluded beach areas to explore. The most memorable view was at the tip of the island.. listening to the sound of the barking sea lions as we approached  and then being able to dive in and swim with them, we anchored there for sometime and really enjoyed ourselves, would certainly go back there.

128167528.name: Sea Lions
128167528.author: a TripAdvisor user
128167528.reviewBody: We went on a great panga ride out to the island and snorkeled (they outfitted us with wetsuits and all equipment) with the sea lions. On the way back, we stopped at a beautiful deserted beach and the captain set out a table and umbrella with lunch: 2 types of ceviche with tostadas and ham & cheese sandwiches and a huge chest full of drinks , including beer. We booked at Tecalote beach with Diana (something) tours for $650 pesos each. Our hotel was charging $75 US. for their trip.

128081353.name: great day trip
128081353.author: a TripAdvisor user
128081353.reviewBody: Island swimming with the sea lion pups will always be remembered...these are wild and NOT in a pool!

128073721.name: Beautiful area & boat ride
128073721.author: a TripAdvisor user
128073721.reviewBody: Really enjoyed but was cut short by wind & rain.  Really want to go again.

127997501.name: Loved this Baja island
127997501.author: a TripAdvisor user
127997501.reviewBody: Perfect.  Clean. Sunny.  Warm.  Filled with great snorkeling, friendly sea lions, dolphins, manta rays.

127841451.name: Amazing variety of wildlife, beautiful place
127841451.author: a TripAdvisor user
127841451.reviewBody: We saw fin whales, a whale shark, hundreds of dolphins, manta rays, swam with sea-lions, not to mention frigate birds... an absolutely amazing experience

127776685.name: A Favorite for Cruisers
127776685.author: a TripAdvisor user
127776685.reviewBody: I am a local so have gone here many times.  Water is usually always clear with lots of fish life for snorkeling or great for Beginner/Intermediate divers.  Coves are sandy beaches and there is a few places to hike to.  You will need a pass to visit but the operator will get that for you.  If you go this far try and go out to Los Islotes the sea lion colony.  Fantastic area to snorkel and dive or just to watch the sea lions or many birds that visit.  My favorite areas are; Los Islotes, Caleta Partida *snorkeling/diving, Candelaria *snorkeling/diving, Isla Ballena *snorkeling/diving and Ensenada Grande anchorage/exploring/fishing

127309978.name: Amazing land forms and sea life
127309978.author: a TripAdvisor user
127309978.reviewBody: This area has been called the Galapagos of the north...once there you can see why this is true.

127073111.name: Very good Baja kayaking
127073111.author: a TripAdvisor user
127073111.reviewBody: What Baja best offers:  few people, ocean and sand and good camping.

126904450.name: Best way to spend a day in La Paz
126904450.author: a TripAdvisor user
126904450.reviewBody: We did a day trip with Marlin Adventures, and we were so glad we used our full day in La Paz to visit this island. Its a beautiful place to tour, and snorkeling with sea lions was the highlight of our entire trip to Mexico. Lunch on a quiet beach, and dolphin and whale sitings topped off the day.

126808675.name: Nice island !
126808675.author: a TripAdvisor user
126808675.reviewBody: There are trips from the beach to this island with foods and you can also see whale !

126746718.name: Away from it all
126746718.author: a TripAdvisor user
126746718.reviewBody: Travel by panga or kayak, view whale sharks and sea lions, snorkle and swim with the fishes, walk in the desert, or lay on a beach with ceviche and cervaza. You can have it all with a trip to Isla Espiritu Santa.

126393262.name: Amazing. We saw two(2) Blue Whales and swam with Sea Lions.
126393262.author: a TripAdvisor user
126393262.reviewBody: Went with FunBaja and we liked everything, I have memories for a lifetime!

125811601.name: Sea Kayaking
125811601.author: a TripAdvisor user
125811601.reviewBody: Quiet and beautiful when waters are calm; plenty of beaches for camping; lots of fish and amphibians; great sunsets; sea lions were enjoyable and playful; snorkeling was good when waters were calm.

125230343.name: Beautiful!
125230343.author: a TripAdvisor user
125230343.reviewBody: Got to swim with Sea Lions, and kayak in this beautiful spot.

124996896.name: Chilly in Winter
124996896.author: a TripAdvisor user
124996896.reviewBody:
If you can tolerate cold water and wind in February then book this tour. Had we known how cold it was out on the boat we would have never done this tour. Our B&B booked it for us through Eco Baja Tours. Our guides were terrific, Arturo and Paako. The water was way too cold for us so we didn't swim with the sea lions. We did manage to see a whale shark and the dolphins were the highlight of the tour. 

If you have back problems avoid this tour. The boat is small and you feel every bump. My husband got sun burned/wind burned badly. He was cold as well the whole time. When we.were out on one of the fingers of the island, I had an allergy attack. I couldn't stop sneezing. Needless to say this continued for about 5 days of our trip in La Paz. 

After we got back to land, my husband and I were having dinner and decided we would have been happier not to do this tour. In part, the time of year, too cold for us and we are not big water sports people. I know this sounds strange for a couple who came to La Paz with so much water sports available. We love the water from the shore or restaurants. 

I think we paid $66 per person. It did include lunch and they fit you for fins and a wet suit which we didn't wear. It was an expensive boat ride for us.

124907705.name: Camping with Roomservice
124907705.author: a TripAdvisor user
124907705.reviewBody:
If you like to kayak Isla Espiritu Santo is a wonderful adventure.  Mar y Adventuras is the way to go if you want adventure on a kayak and camping with all the extras.  This is the only way to see Isla Espiritu Santo if you like to paddle.  Miguel and his team will take care of everything for you (OK, you do set up your own tent and dress yourself).  Their equipment is nice, food great and an adventure that the whole family would love.   I would suggest that you stay the first and last night in their Inn.  This allows you to meet your fellow fellow paddlers and an early start.  At the end of your trip the hot shower and beds will feel great after a lovely dinner with your new best friends to keep the adventure going just a little longer.

You can get all the equipment you need from Mar y Adventuras or bring your own sleeping bag, bad, etc.  While it can be very hot during the day bring something for the evening when the sun goes down.  In our group there was a musician who brought her guitar that added so much to the down time, we also took wine although there was plenty of beer.  You will not go hungry but take your special snacks or energy bars if you want them.  It's easy to go to the market in La Paz and pick up anything you want there (the hotel staff will help you find it).

Our only unfortunate experience was loss of luggage for a few in our party who flew from the US La Paz via Cabo.  We flew into Cabo and then rented a car one way and drove to La Paz which was cheaper and easier than taking a shuttle.  There is also a bus that you can take from the airport but not sure were it takes you in La Paz.  

After our week camping and kayaking we headed via bus to Todos Santos for a little pampering.  You do not need a car there and the bus between La Paz and Todos Santos was easy.  Also easy to get back to the airport in Cabo via bus.

124636041.name: Gorgeous isl;and and coast
124636041.author: a TripAdvisor user
124636041.reviewBody: We boated and fished out here. An intriguing and beautiful area, lots of porpoises and sea lions.\nThe beaches along the coast in this area are often totally deserted and have no development for the most part. You have to stay out of the traffic lanes, as it is for the ferrya dn transport ships.

124372865.name: Lovely kayaking
124372865.author: a TripAdvisor user
124372865.reviewBody: BOA runs awesome 4 day trips around the island. Beautiful break.

124155833.name: Wonderful beaches
124155833.author: a TripAdvisor user
124155833.reviewBody:
We chartered a boat from Seascape Charters and spent a few days on Isla Espiritu Santo, Isla Partida, and Los Islotes.
Having our own boat was terrific. Saw dolphins, whales, and, of course, the sea lions. The best part though, was getting to wonderfully deserted beaches. We spent hours and hours on white sand and did not see another person. 
We took Seascape's fishing boat, but they have a couple of sailboats, too. 

One note for people who don't charter their own boat -- it looked to us like all the daily tours go to Los Islotes (Sea Lion colony) and then stop at the middle beach on Essenada Grande. The beach is beautiful, don't get us wrong. But, we saw 7 boats all pull up at once when there are numerous other beaches that are deserted. So, try to get your tour operator to take you to one of the other beaches.

And, if you have it in you to charter your own boat (you can get a captain for $50/day if you can't do it yourself), do it that way-- and not with a tour!

124150605.name: It is a long day!
124150605.author: a TripAdvisor user
124150605.reviewBody: The trip out to the island and back can be hard on the body. Boats are small, shallow v craft designed for loading from beach. The island is 2 hours out and back and a little breeze makes it a bones jarring ride. Count on some standing around while leaders get organized to depart each stop. We can\'t recommend this trip, at least during the winter.

124090045.name: Amazing Sea Life
124090045.author: a TripAdvisor user
124090045.reviewBody: well worth the trip we saw dolphins, whale sharks, hump back whales, flying manta rays, sea lions, frigget birds

123937479.name: Great excursion, chilly water
123937479.author: a TripAdvisor user
123937479.reviewBody: Went with a tour recommended by our hosts, and the people couldn\'t have been nicer.  Our guide Luis was such fun and guided me to swim with the whale sharks and the playful juvenile sea lions.  The water is quite cold in January, and I\'d like to try it again when it\'s a bit warmer

123220542.name: Don\'t miss the sea lions!
123220542.author: a TripAdvisor user
123220542.reviewBody:
Carol at our B&B made arrangements for us to visit the island with Espiritu y Baja tours.  They whole experience was magical.  We lucked out with good weather and little wind.  The water is cold but the tour company provided wetsuits as well as snorkel gear and fins.  First, we made a stop at a beautiful beach just to have a look around.  Coyote spore was in evidence.  We were obviously the first humans of the day.

We circled the island while our tour guide, Alan, gave humerous and knowledgeable details about the island, the flora, and fauna.  At the sea lion colony we jumped overboard to swim with the pups.  They love to play, and some came close enough to touch.  

From here we went to a beautiful white sandy beach where we had lunch of ceviche and sandwiches, fresh fruit, and beverages.  The fish among the rocks were exciting to see.  I saw the biggest sand dollar I've ever seen but knew not to disturb it.  I would have loved to bring it home.

The trip back was exciting because we encountered a school of dolphins that swam all around us and surfed in the boat's wake.  What a grand day!

Thank you, Alan, for showing us such a good time.

122848743.name: Worth the trip
122848743.author: a TripAdvisor user
122848743.reviewBody: We saw a whale, dolphins and of course swam with the sea lions!

122148294.name: pristine natural setting
122148294.author: a TripAdvisor user
122148294.reviewBody: had a few picnic lunches on way back from viewing and swimming with the sea lions, did a little snorkeling in beautiful bay very pleasant

121335650.name: Inolvidable
121335650.author: a TripAdvisor user
121335650.reviewBody: For me is the more wonderfull place on the world, this incredible place has a lot of history .  One more day for me, I like to visit espiritu santo Island because always is a new adventure, you can see dolphins, whales, rays, SNorkeling with the sea lions. the color of the beachs was incredible blue green water. perfect for make diving in the rockery areas. also if you have lucky maybe can find a turtle o just see like  300 differents species of fish.\nalso you can do kayak, diving, take a walk on the beach, camping

121266512.name: So much to see
121266512.author: a TripAdvisor user
121266512.reviewBody: So lots of different sea life, swam with a Tiger shark and Sea Lions

120249348.name: Diving with Fun Baja.
120249348.author: a TripAdvisor user
120249348.reviewBody: What an amazing display of fascinating geology!  Dove a few sites around the island and it was great.  Lots of fish to see!

120122255.name: the best island ever
120122255.author: a TripAdvisor user
120122255.reviewBody: swimm with whale sharks and sea lions! The picnik on the island was great!

119484954.name: Diving around it was fun
119484954.author: a TripAdvisor user
119484954.reviewBody: The Fang Ming ship wreck. We saw 10 manta rays swimming around us while we dove and took pictures with the oldest turtle I\'ve ever seen.

118870795.name: This was a marvelous boat trip!
118870795.author: a TripAdvisor user
118870795.reviewBody: This boat ride takes about six hours from the center of La Paz but is well worth it. The first destination is the island Espiritu Santo where a large seal colony lives. The boat stops there for about an hour or more to enjoy the water and look around with snorkels. On the way back, the boat came in closer to other attractions and we stopped at another beautiful, crystal clear beach.\nWe enjoyed it immensely!

118009854.name: Not to be missed!
118009854.author: a TripAdvisor user
118009854.reviewBody: Unparalleled natural beauty and sites. The land formations, beaches, history, caves, sea life and incredibly spectacular. This is the best part of La Paz!

115425382.name: Definitely worth the trip out of the city center
115425382.author: a TripAdvisor user
115425382.reviewBody: We rented a car to search for the best beaches around La Paz.  Bandalara has beautiful water and was very quiet in a small cove. Unfortunately, it had no facilities for food, drink, or bathroom.  We were very pleased with Tecolote Beach right next door. It had white sand with plenty of huts and chairs to enjoy the water.  There were a few small restaurants, but we loved Palapa Azul.  It was very cool with a nice breeze and the staff were very accommodating without being pushy.   Surprisingly, the food was great.  We ordered grilled shrimp. They were fresh and well seasoned with butter and garlic. The bathroom was also  clean which was a nice treat when we returned from our trek  and wanted to change clothes.\n\nAfter lunch, we rented a jet ski right next to the restaurant and drove ourselves on our adventure to see the coastline and Bandalara beach from the water, as well as Isla Espiritu Santo.  The views and beaches were breathtaking.  The water is so clear that you can actually see large fish around you.  When going around the tip of the island, we were greeted by  pelicans and other birds atop beautiful rock formations.  Well worth the trip.

102768300.name: get away from it all and reconnect with nature
102768300.author: a TripAdvisor user
102768300.reviewBody: We had a great time on our four day kayak/camping trip with Baja Outdoor Adventures.  The trip was well organized, the staff was friendly and knowledgeable and the group size was just right.  We took a boat out of La Paz and went north to the top of Espritu Santo to swim with the sea lions then proceeded to our first campsite.  We were on a catered trip so our job was to set up our tents and take charge of our kayaks -- the guides did the cooking, camp set up and were happy to help with tents.  Our trip was a family one so not having to cook/clean up was a treat. Daily, after breakfast, we kayaked for about two hours to our next campsite, set up camp, had lunch and in the pm went hiking and/or snorkeling.  We saw many aquatic creatures: sea lions, turtles, manta rays, whales, birds and many different fish.  Sleeping on the beach in a tent, totally unplugged, is a great treat in my mind.

100448674.name: A fantastic experience
100448674.author: a TripAdvisor user
100448674.reviewBody: We booked our panga tour from Playa Tecolote. The previous days had been windy and the water choppy. The wind had died down so we were excited to take this trip to Isla Espiritu Santo. What a great time we had! Our tour lasted almost 6 hours and was worth every penny. (approx $ 65.00) We swam with the sea lions, saw the most amazing scenery, had a lovely lunch with drinks at a beautiful beach where we were also able to snorkel. Our guide and most of the other passengers spoke only spanish, however, the guide really made an effort to help us to understand. This panga tour was absolutely wonderful.

98845324.name: Never again
98845324.author: a TripAdvisor user
98845324.reviewBody:
We booked a trip to leave from La Paz and go to Espiritu Island  with one or two stops along the way for more snorkeling among the beautiful protected bays along the way.
The guide spoke no english. Not spanish either. We went out in choppy water and begged him to tell us where we were going and to please stop and show us on our map where we were going. We do speak spanish a little. Then finally we bagged him to return to the harbor and be done with it. After 2 hours in a small boat, we finally reached the most pathetic small rock with a few sea lions and no fish. He never stopped at any of the other bays on the way back. Than he jumped out of the boat 500' from shore and left us there to figure out our way back.
We were in fear for our lives during the first 1/2 of  this trip. Truly the worst snorkeling trip we have ever had in the western hemisphere.
We will never visit La Paz again and will never talk kindly of Espiritu Santo. What a perfect waste of a day.

32568120.name: A day of multiple Peak Experiences
32568120.author: a TripAdvisor user
32568120.reviewBody:
During our visit to La Paz last month, we took a day trip from Playa Tecolote (excuse spelling, this may be incorrect) to Isla Espiritu Santo with Azul Tours, azultourslapaz.com.  The entire day was amazing, fabulous, wonderful, you can put in your own superlative here.  Not only was the scenery astounding--turquoise sea meets blue sky meets volcanic islands--but the tour guides were wonderful as well.  They took us snorkeling with the sea lions and pups, which was thrilling, and manuveured teh boat through rock arches that we could barely slip through.  For me, the geology was reminiscent of the Grand Canyon, but the water was so stunning.

When we beached for lunch, I slipped and cut myself.  There was blood, and then there was the first aid kit with alcohol swabs and gauze bandages, so I have healed very happily.  I was also pleased that teh tour was prepared for problems, and give them high marks for that.

I would go on this tour with this operator in a heartbeat, and totally recommend that anyone in La Paz take a trip to the island.  It is a real treat.

17368065.name: Isla Espiritu Santo boat tour
17368065.author: a TripAdvisor user
17368065.reviewBody: 13 of us took two boats out of Calandra. That had to be almost the highlight of our trip. The waters were clear beautiful and many shades of blue and green. We had lunch in paradise, a desserted island with a long emerald clear beach. They fed us excellent ceviche and had beverages,sandwich meats and cheeses too.\nWe stopped at the sea lion island and the snorkling was great, we saw many sea lion pups, the bulls were quite vocal but otherwise, awesome. The terrain of the island was quite the contrast, the rocky cliffs had many colors, some rock formations like a face, huge windows , just spectacular , Highly recomend this tour. Do brush up in your spanish this is still a true Mexican city. Lulu

676616493.name: Beautiful and Pristine
676616493.author: a TripAdvisor user
676616493.reviewBody: I was very impressed with the Malecon. Scrubbed clean with lovely sculptures, a bike path ran along side and the beach on the opposite was raked and studded with public palapas.

675811975.name: Beautiful, relaxing, filled with people in the evenings
675811975.author: a TripAdvisor user
675811975.reviewBody: This is such a beautiful part of the city. Lots of space and nice breezes. Beautiful views. Great for people watching. There is play equipment, including some for people in wheelchairs, as well as bike paths and bike rentals. I walked here every night I was in town.

672685060.name: Pretty view of the water, so-so businesses
672685060.author: a TripAdvisor user
672685060.reviewBody: My overall thoughts on LaPaz...Gorgeous beaches and crystal waters, but tourism has declined and the town itself is very run-down   A lot of boarded up businesses and graffiti. The malec\u00f3n is great place to walk or bike or roller blade. Lots of families and couples strolling around and it\u2019s a good place to watch the sun set.

672124083.name: Malecon board walk
672124083.author: a TripAdvisor user
672124083.reviewBody: The Malacon is truly a beautiful place. It has several unique statues and it is highly used.  Please do not bring your dogs!  New rule by the City.

669811463.name: nice breeze for a walk
669811463.author: a TripAdvisor user
669811463.reviewBody: when you are in la paz you have to have a walk on the malecon\nyou will not regret that for the nice breeze

668694294.name: Lovely location to hang out
668694294.author: a TripAdvisor user
668694294.reviewBody: With all the bustling shops accross the street the Malecon was a nice peaceful walking area right on the water.  Many area paved for  blading or biking.

668243845.name: Great family friendly waterfront location
668243845.author: a TripAdvisor user
668243845.reviewBody: We stayed on the Malecon for two nights. The parks and boardwalks were great spaces for our children to stretch their legs. There are lots of restaurants to choose from as well. If you are staying in La Paz I would highly recommend a visit to the Malecon.

667942328.name: Spectacular walk
667942328.author: a TripAdvisor user
667942328.reviewBody: Dont miss this walk in the afternoon to see the sunset. Have an ice cream in La Fuente and rent bicycles in that corner.

667210009.name: Loved strolling the Malecon
667210009.author: a TripAdvisor user
667210009.reviewBody: We took several walks along the bay, best in the evening, but we loved the Malecon and all the public art.

666788501.name: Excellent
666788501.author: a TripAdvisor user
666788501.reviewBody: However they are doing remodelation, the malecon is nice you have postal views with a quiet sea! you may walk any time and at night there is  alot of people who enojoyed the sunset for a family ride, doing skating or cycling.

666765357.name: Great place for sunset and lots of restaurants
666765357.author: a TripAdvisor user
666765357.reviewBody: This is s lovely area next to the ocean.  Many shops and restaurants and some hotels.  Very popular on weekends and holidays.

666638517.name: Beautiful to walk along the malecon
666638517.author: a TripAdvisor user
666638517.reviewBody: The malecon was surprising clean, well maintained, nice place to walk along the shoreline.  All the restaurants and shops are across the street.  They are working on part of it to make the beach area bigger, and fixing up a section so a little construction going on.  Tons of nice benches to sit on, if you get tired of walking.  Great views of the water.

666473698.name: Nice views
666473698.author: a TripAdvisor user
666473698.reviewBody: Nice place to walk by and take pictures or grab some food, dessert, a drink etc... almost everything is on this street

663525231.name: Pleasant stroll
663525231.author: a TripAdvisor user
663525231.reviewBody: This malecon is great for a nice walk, somewhere around 7 miles round trip. It would of been better, however there is a big patch of construction happening. There was a bike race being set up and you had to move around equipment being set up. -

660397641.name: Fun walk and great shop of artistic materials, reasonably priced!
660397641.author: a TripAdvisor user
660397641.reviewBody: I don\'t remember the name of the shop but it was near the southern (?) end of the main drag, facing beach, thinking it was close to statue of woman, I\'ll try to attach.

659763121.name: Beautiful Spot
659763121.author: a TripAdvisor user
659763121.reviewBody: Very beautiful stretch of the Sea of Cortez. Blue water & sky, long stretch of gorgeous ocean, lots of shops and restaurants across the street. This area feels safe and laid back.

659163096.name: Long and family friendly
659163096.author: a TripAdvisor user
659163096.reviewBody: One of the best boerdwalks I\u2019ve been on.  Jog, eat, sightsee.  Great sunsets, lots of coffe shops and restaurants. Some construction going on.

658661313.name: Great way to experience La Paz at night!
658661313.author: a TripAdvisor user
658661313.reviewBody: We visited the Malecon several times during our stay in La Paz. Lots of restaurants, bars, etc. all along the strip. We were they during Carnaval, so we got to experience the parade as well. Fun stuff!

658629377.name: Wonderful spot
658629377.author: a TripAdvisor user
658629377.reviewBody: Great place for everything! Watching a sunrise or sunset, walking, running, biking and then afterwards you just head across the street for dinner and/or drinks.

657914831.name: What a great place to hang out in La Paz
657914831.author: a TripAdvisor user
657914831.reviewBody: The city of La Paz spends a great deal of time and effort keeping their waterfront looking pristine. The 3-4 miles of beautiful sidewalk/bike path are one of La Paz\'s best features. Even during Carnaval, the huge mess that got made every night was very quickly cleaned up before noon the next day so it could happen all over again. There must be a small army employed to keep the place looking as great as it does.

657412160.name: Great Malecom
657412160.author: a TripAdvisor user
657412160.reviewBody:
Amaizing views,impecable place( there is people
cleaning all day) ,and security around
A long Malecont to walk e
with benches to rest and direct acces to the beach and full of restaurants in front of the street.
Only negative for me is in some places it needed a kind of protection between the beach and the Malecon( to easy to fall if someone is distracted )

657278419.name: Artwork along the Malecon is so beautiful
657278419.author: a TripAdvisor user
657278419.reviewBody: There are many sculptures along the Malecon and they are beautiful.  Also, the view of the ocean in spectacular, especially at sunset!

657256909.name: Nice walk in the city
657256909.author: a TripAdvisor user
657256909.reviewBody: Beautiful and clean Malecon.  Great for walking day or evening,  lot\'s of restaurants and stores across the main road.

657240004.name: A must here!
657240004.author: a TripAdvisor user
657240004.reviewBody: Several miles of winding, diverse, concrete walkway of the water-side of the main road, across from the many shops, bars and eateries.  Stunning!

656988448.name: Walking or riding on the Malec\u00f3n is a must!
656988448.author: a TripAdvisor user
656988448.reviewBody: We stayed at Hotel Marina which is at the far north end of the Malec\u00f3n. We were able to walk from our hotel all the way down the Malec\u00f3n to the other marina. It\'s about 3 miles with the turquoise ocean on one side, with shops and businesses on the other. The sidewalk is very wide and smooth for easy walking, and the artwork statues along the way are amazing! MUST DO

656647487.name: Construction could not keep me down
656647487.author: a TripAdvisor user
656647487.reviewBody: I walked the whole thing one morning, bay and restaurant side.  The bay side had sections shut down for construction, but joggers were out and about anyway.  Had a second breakfast at a place on the north east part of the Malecon (boardwalk).  I think the north east end has more of the local favorites, the south west end the tourist section.

656053740.name: Run, stroll or people watch!
656053740.author: a TripAdvisor user
656053740.reviewBody: This is a great place for an early morning run or an evening stroll. Find a spot at one of the many restaurants and people watch! Great way to spend some time in La Paz.

655673378.name: Keeps getting better
655673378.author: a TripAdvisor user
655673378.reviewBody: La paz is sure going the extra mile with the malecon, new improvements, new additions. It all looks great and I can hardly wait to see how it all turns out.

654800776.name: Enjoy a stroll and all the fabulous public art
654800776.author: a TripAdvisor user
654800776.reviewBody: Cant have a proper Latin America City without a thriving Malecon. La Paz\'s delivers with fun, cultural interaction, oodles of public art, beach on one side, and endless bars and restaurants on the other side.

654185022.name: Pretty place to stretch your legs
654185022.author: a TripAdvisor user
654185022.reviewBody: The Malecon is a nice wide, clean path along the waterfront in La Paz. Has great ocean views and a nice breeze to keep you cool. It\u2019s also an arts scene, as it\u2019s lined with different bronze statues, some fun, some whimsical, some religious. After being on a cruise ship for a while, it felt good to walk and shake out the legs.

654108308.name: Nice walk
654108308.author: a TripAdvisor user
654108308.reviewBody: This is a nice maleco.  You can take pic with La Paz sign and walk and walk.  The area is nice and calm. There were areas still under construction but it was ok. It\u2019s going to end up looking nice.

653964491.name: Great running
653964491.author: a TripAdvisor user
653964491.reviewBody: Very nice Malec\u00f3n. There is a bike running lane and traffic was very polite. Restaurants and coffee shops are all around and there are nice playgrounds for kids.

653816181.name: The Malecon. La paz mexico
653816181.author: a TripAdvisor user
653816181.reviewBody: Day or night....the malecon delivers!. Fantastic sushi.suberb original margueritas. Mojitis and local delisce drinks!!!! What more can one ask!? ...oh....white sand beaches with romance in the air!!!??? Of course! Hello!!!? Malecon....take your lover there ;)

653586986.name: Nice walk
653586986.author: a TripAdvisor user
653586986.reviewBody: The Malecon actually begins well south of the city.  Many people walk, jog and bike it.  It was really clean.  There were workers sweeping it daily while I was there.  La Paz in general was very clean but the Malecon was spotless.  There are plenty of shops and restaurants opposite the Malecon.  Take your time and enjoy the scenery and art...and people watching.

653363282.name: The beauty of the Pearl of La Paz!!
653363282.author: a TripAdvisor user
653363282.reviewBody:
Another must see, MUST WALK!! Beauty of la Paz.
It must be around 3-4.5 miles of beautiful sightseeing walking, with statues to take pictures with, exercise bars, docks to take a beautiful sunset picture, and delicious snacks stands all over it.
If you like skating or riding bicycles there are several stands around the strip that will rent you for very low price.
Enjoy!! This is one of the best attractions in La Paz.

652119784.name: Walk along the bay
652119784.author: a TripAdvisor user
652119784.reviewBody: This is where the limited tourist amenities are for La Paz. Restaurants, gift shops etc. They are spread out a bit. The Bay is nice to view.

651280642.name: Easy and clean
651280642.author: a TripAdvisor user
651280642.reviewBody: Really nice walking path and cycling path. They are doing work improving it even more. Has benches to sit and watch the water. Restaurants across the street have unobstructed views of the water too. Just lovely

650748582.name: Malec\u00f3n
650748582.author: a TripAdvisor user
650748582.reviewBody: I love this place with all my heart! I just love walk and buy a ice cream while listen music and watch the different but beautiful views...

650421996.name: Very nice stroll
650421996.author: a TripAdvisor user
650421996.reviewBody: Long, smooth and very nice. Gives the ability to look at all the places to eat and drink while walking whitout being harassed. Long long walk. And as i said very smooth do the kids can dkateboard and ride all types of devices. Also good for anyone with mobility issues ... nice little beaches off it so you can put your feet in the water.\n\nArtis located along it as well....

649907001.name: La Paz Malecon
649907001.author: a TripAdvisor user
649907001.reviewBody: A stroll along the Malecon in La Paz is not only good exercise, it gives visitors a glimpse of the choice of restaurants, bars and shops easily available, especially for those that don\u2019t wish to venture out to \u201c the city.\u201d\n\nOne recent change in local laws that should be noted is that dogs have been banned from the area, causing quite an upset with residents that enjoyed evening walks with their canine friends.

649579391.name: Clean and intriguing
649579391.author: a TripAdvisor user
649579391.reviewBody: We walked this area after returning from snorkeling with whale sharks in the bay.  The various sculptures along this walkway are beautiful and very well presented.  It is fairly touristy here, but if you walk a block or two away from the water, you are immersed in the local area.  My favourite sign was the "La Paz" city sign with the water behind it.

649536399.name: I love La Paz
649536399.author: a TripAdvisor user
649536399.reviewBody: I love Mexico.  Really love it.  I have spent most of my Mexico time in Los Cabos.  This was my first extended trip to La Paz and the highlight of the trip is the Malecon.  Exceptionally clean and well cared for.  Lots of people walking and roller blading.  No one getting in anyone\'s way.  Beautiful view of the water as you walk along.  No one tries to sell you anything.  Everyone is just enjoying their walk and the wonderful views.  La Paz has become my favorite place in Mexico and in large part, because of this the Malecon.

649006055.name: Beautiful relaxing place!
649006055.author: a TripAdvisor user
649006055.reviewBody: This is a beautiful place to go for a walk with the faimly, explore and take wonderful pictures. You can even rent bikes, and cruise threw the boradwalk, there is many places to eat all located around the way.

647985939.name: Cool
647985939.author: a TripAdvisor user
647985939.reviewBody: The town is cool, one of the better, cleaner areas along the beach. And gets more Mexican the deeper you good. Good separation of locals and gringos if you want to get away from them. Also nice active scene on the water front. And fantastic bike lane!!

647139166.name: Roller skate
647139166.author: a TripAdvisor user
647139166.reviewBody: We walked most of it but I think more fun way would be to rollerblade it. I enjoyed the sea related sculptures along the way but unfortunately most were damaged in some ways, mostly descriptions which originally appeared at the base had missing letters or were gone all together. Still worth the walk.

646820887.name: Amazing
646820887.author: a TripAdvisor user
646820887.reviewBody: If you want to walk while you\'re enjoying an ice-cream or spending time with your friends, family or couple it\'s the perfect place to do it also for take pictures, ride a bike, running... U must do it.

646141927.name: The perfect seaside stroll.
646141927.author: a TripAdvisor user
646141927.reviewBody: Creative art, sparkling sea, happy people skating, hiking, biking, strolling, running along a five kilometer promenade. Plenty of good cafes and bars across the street.  Great for evening strolls.  My wife and I walked along the Malecon every day we were in La Paz.  Explore the side streets for a true taste of this wonderful city.

646131555.name: Nice walk !
646131555.author: a TripAdvisor user
646131555.reviewBody: It was a pleasant walk , people out there enjoying the view and exercising. Watch out for people on bikes that rather use the sauce walk instead of the bike lane on the street . Got to see some kids hit the ground while skateboarding or on their bikes doing tricks . Very entertaining.

646058434.name: Wonderful place to enjoy the community
646058434.author: a TripAdvisor user
646058434.reviewBody: We spent a week in La Paz over the winter holiday and really enjoyed walking along the Malecon every day. There were so many local families with their children walking, roller skating, trying out new bikes and socializing. It made us feel like we were part of the community.

644085728.name: Interesting Promenade
644085728.author: a TripAdvisor user
644085728.reviewBody: A very nice upgrade from the past. You can see many visitors as well as locals on their nightly walk in the evenings. Everyone gets their ice cream cone at the very busy place with the tree painted with polka dots. Sorry don\'t know the name, and then strolls by the waterfront. Take care with footing.

643157149.name: Best place in town for a walk
643157149.author: a TripAdvisor user
643157149.reviewBody: Have made several trips to the Malecon for long walks.  Excellent sidewalk and a separate bike lane.  Several lovely public are installations.

642240138.name: Fabulous
642240138.author: a TripAdvisor user
642240138.reviewBody:
The 3 mile malecon runs alongside restaurants and shops and the sea. Amazing view. Lots of benches, statues, places to stop and rest as well as locals and tourists enjoying the blue skies and sun. 

Great for strollers, bikes, wheelchairs, rollerblades and skateboards. 

The tide changes quite dramatically during the day and when it’s low, it’s a haven for sea shell hunters. 

Photo opportunities anywhere!!!  Grab your flip flops or sneakers and enjoy!!!

641623368.name: Nice view
641623368.author: a TripAdvisor user
641623368.reviewBody: Very clean.  Lots of restaurants across the street.  Lots of photo opportunities.  There is a cute children\'s playground.

641477854.name: Lovely view
641477854.author: a TripAdvisor user
641477854.reviewBody: Well maintained walkway by the Sea of Cortez. Lovely music and decorations for the holidays. We relaxed and enjoyed the  strolls along the way.

640882394.name: Sit, stroll, run
640882394.author: a TripAdvisor user
640882394.reviewBody: You can while away time, have a drink, watch sunset, watch people it is ideal for spending time at whatever your mood or plan.

639799880.name: Nice palce to stroll and enjoy the bay views
639799880.author: a TripAdvisor user
639799880.reviewBody: El Malecon is a long walkway along the shoreline in La Paz, Mexico.    The walkway is very wide and dotted with sculptures.  All the business are on the other (inland) side of the street, so the views of the harbor and bay are unobstructed.  A very pleasant place to stroll for an afternoon or an evening.

639010252.name: Beach front boardwalk
639010252.author: a TripAdvisor user
639010252.reviewBody:
This four kilometre long boardwalk is the place that Mexicans and visitors frequent.   You can buy fresh fish around 3pm when the boats come in.
Lots of restaurants bars and nightclubs for Mexicans and tourists alike
Walking jogging bike riding.

638936898.name: Window to La Paz
638936898.author: a TripAdvisor user
638936898.reviewBody: Nice for strolling, taking in the beauty of the water and all the sculptures, and seeing local families playing and working.  Tour operators can get a little aggressive trying to get you to sign up for a tour, but it\'s not overwhelming.

637124477.name: Nice walk on the promenade
637124477.author: a TripAdvisor user
637124477.reviewBody: The walk is very busy all the time with a lot of attractions waiting for the visitors. Despite the many people, you feel safe all the time and get to see the nice places La Paz has to offer.

636339219.name: Wonderful Walkway Along the Bay
636339219.author: a TripAdvisor user
636339219.reviewBody: Well lit and clean. Appeared very safe with women and elderly, locals and tourists, walking.jogging solo, even at night.  Great for walking, bikes, scooters, skateboards, or roller blades.  good nightlife shore-side across the street most places along the way.

634751540.name: Centre of Activity
634751540.author: a TripAdvisor user
634751540.reviewBody: The malecon is about 5km long. Lots to see and do. Many restaurants, bars and shops. If you like ice cream, there\'s probably a shop on every corner. Great for people watching, great for a brisk walk at night (to burn off the extra calories you may have consumed throughout the day) Beautiful sunsets..sidewalks are clean and well maintained, totally safe.

634181193.name: Boardwalk of beauty!
634181193.author: a TripAdvisor user
634181193.reviewBody: This boardwalk runs about 3-4 miles with shopping and restaurants along it. The views of the bay for sunset are breathtaking. We got ice cream and sat for a hour just watching locals enjoy the boardwalk. You have a few local hand craft artist that make some beautiful art. Bars and restaurants litter the boardwalk. Fresh fish to fresh Mexican food it has it all. We walked this boardwalk every night for sunset and enjoyed shopping and people watching after dinner. For you Americans it\u2019s really safe no matter what part of the boardwalk. They had police influence through the hole town. If you visit La Paz this is a must. Don\u2019t miss the statues through and the La Paz sign!

633282038.name: We enjoyed the Malecon!
633282038.author: a TripAdvisor user
633282038.reviewBody: Other reviews mentioned construction, but most of that was on a few side streets, nothing out of the ordinary for any city. It was clean, safe and hosted a lot of fun activities in the evenings. All kinds of restaurants and bars, and some shops, all on the waterfront.  Locals shopping, mercados and farmer\'s markets were within walking distance.

632267076.name: Clean and Well Maintained
632267076.author: a TripAdvisor user
632267076.reviewBody: Lovely walkway along the main street of town.  Nicely finished and maintained with artwork throughout.

631094284.name: Great day and night.
631094284.author: a TripAdvisor user
631094284.reviewBody: Looking for something to eat or drink? Looking to get som exercise? Looking to do some people watching? Looking to get some pictures? You can do all this and more on the Malecon.

630843891.name: Center of Activity
630843891.author: a TripAdvisor user
630843891.reviewBody: More then a mile long the malecon is a real treasure with many sculptures along the way.. A nightly walk is a great reward

630821093.name: Just a great place to walk for no reason.
630821093.author: a TripAdvisor user
630821093.reviewBody: Surprised at how clean and nice the Malecon is it\'s very relaxed people walking running rollerblading zero issues.

629973314.name: A Highlight for a Beautiful City
629973314.author: a TripAdvisor user
629973314.reviewBody: We really love La Paz and the Malecon really shows off this beautiful city. I really have to admire the city planner for not allowing bars, restaurants, and hotels to crowd out the waterfront. The malecon stretches for many km and on any given evening is full or people enjoying this beautiful city. There are plenty of places to eat just across the street.

629679950.name: Beautiful, clean, well lit boardwalk
629679950.author: a TripAdvisor user
629679950.reviewBody: We are staying for a few nights in a hotel overlooking the Malecon and it is a lively place day and evening. We arrived on a Sunday and it was very buy then. Now it\'s just people out getting their exercise or sitting enjoying the views. Kept very clean. Lovely long walks/ jogs or to people watch.

629023944.name: Noisy
629023944.author: a TripAdvisor user
629023944.reviewBody: There are a lot of tourists and restaurants with very loud music. Nice for a walk during the day or night.

628522505.name: Fall School Break
628522505.author: a TripAdvisor user
628522505.reviewBody: Beautiful walk along the Sea Of Cortez during sunset. An amazing sunset photo can be taken here. Plenty to do and amazing places to experience great food. Skating, jogging or cycling the Malecon is a must. This place is the jewel of Baja California.

627598680.name: A pleasant walk
627598680.author: a TripAdvisor user
627598680.reviewBody: During the day, you see a lot of people running and biking, at dusk you can watch the sunset and in the evening, you will see folks selling knickknacks and snacks.\n\nOn the other side of the street, you have numerous bar and restaurant options!

624541626.name: A lovely stroll ...
624541626.author: a TripAdvisor user
