624541626.reviewBody: When in La Paz (BCS) you must stroll the entire length of this lovely \'walkway\'. There are many restaurants (across the street) and plenty of wildlife along the way \u263a.\nCheers

623030781.name: Great spot worth exploring and amazing feel
623030781.author: a TripAdvisor user
623030781.reviewBody: Great spot to explore town at night, get food fee the culture and see the culture of this Amazing California South town !!!

621963164.name: Nice place to visit
621963164.author: a TripAdvisor user
621963164.reviewBody: Its very nice especially on Fri, and Sat, evenings. Restaurants and Bars along the Malecon. We see families and couples walking along the pier.

619810433.name: Take a walk
619810433.author: a TripAdvisor user
619810433.reviewBody: It\'s a nice drive or walk.  There is lots to see and some decent places to stop and eat.  We really liked La Paz.

615091882.name: Nice area to walk
615091882.author: a TripAdvisor user
615091882.reviewBody: The beach is directly next to the Malecon, with no change in the level of the land, so you can literally just sit down under a permanently placed wooden palapa style sun umbrella. This is area has gently waved and a view of some docked boats to the far light, a cruise port terminal where a large boat docked which is used to keep the water clean by collecting any trash with nets. Statues are set at intervals along the Malecon. There is a a beautiful statue of an Oyster holding her pearl, another which I am guessing is Neptune, but can\'t say for sure as there was no plaque nearby explaining who it depicts. And a statue of The Old Man and the Sea\'s character holding his boat, in search of the Blue Marlin, from Ernest Hemingway\'s book of the same name, which I have read many years ago as an adolescent in school and always loved.\nThe museo de la ballena is across the street, there are ice cream shops, a coffee shop, a few different bars that play music (loudest at night) and an Applebees restaurant.

612652029.name: Gathering place with interesting sculptures
612652029.author: a TripAdvisor user
612652029.reviewBody: Long stretch against the coast where runners, rollerbladers, walkers gather - especially at the end of the day to catch the sunset and/or see the many beautiful sculptures that depict various facets of life in La Paz.

610320366.name: Beautiful sun set!!!
610320366.author: a TripAdvisor user
610320366.reviewBody: Go to the malecon and enjoy the beautiful sunset, I\u2019m sure it is a beautiful sunrise too but I\u2019m not a morning person so missed. Malecon can be crowded in the evening, a lot of bicycles but nothing to keep you out the place. Enjoy !!!

609594946.name: beautiful sunsets
609594946.author: a TripAdvisor user
609594946.reviewBody: Even that was under construction, we still enjoyed the beuaty of the marine inspired statues and the beautiful sunsets. Besides de WHale Museum is the only thing worth to visit in the city

608769347.name: Nice people, fantastic food, wonderful views.
608769347.author: a TripAdvisor user
608769347.reviewBody: Nice and friendly people, fantastic fresh food, and a turquoise and calm sea.\nLa Paz is a perfect place to relax.

606425136.name: Great night walks
606425136.author: a TripAdvisor user
606425136.reviewBody: This is one of the nicest malecones to walk great people and awesome sites.\nLots of bars and restaurants and museum

604252772.name: Not sure what the big deal is.....
604252772.author: a TripAdvisor user
604252772.reviewBody: ....because there isn\'t.   Goes for miles, nice view of the harbor and waterfront.   Plenty of restaurants and bars nearby, very little shopping except for usual Mexican trinkets.  Not interested in returning, and I have been all over BCS.

600014866.name: Fun
600014866.author: a TripAdvisor user
600014866.reviewBody: Stroll along the malecon for miles and watch the dolphins playing in the bay. What could be better? Stop anywhere and enjoy a cold drink. Lots of fun for all.

597756053.name: The Place to Hang Out and Relax
597756053.author: a TripAdvisor user
597756053.reviewBody: The Malecon is so enjoyable. Their are so many activities going on at the same time. Beach volleyball right beside it, kids and adults  riding bikes, rollerblading,eating ice cream, people watching, eating delicious food, watching the sunset to name a few.

596445149.name: Very nice seaside resort
596445149.author: a TripAdvisor user
596445149.reviewBody:
Malecon is a very nice seaside resort.
Lots of bars and restaurants for both families and couples.
There is a good sea front promenade, with lots to see. The is a string of statues on the route to appreciate.
Set back a couple of streets from the front is the shopping area.
The police have a presence out and about, but I saw no trouble at all.

594516428.name: Crowd on a Friday night but that was part of the charm
594516428.author: a TripAdvisor user
594516428.reviewBody: Lots of beautiful statues and tons of couples and families walking around.  And of course right on the water.  Great activity after dinner when you don\u2019t want to go home just yet.  Fun mix of locals and tourists!

594462807.name: Beautiful Sunset
594462807.author: a TripAdvisor user
594462807.reviewBody: Walking down the Malec\u00f3n at sunset is a must do for locals and tourists. Grab an ice cream and enjoy the cool sea breezes which will bring \'Paz\' to your soul after a long day on the beach or at sea.

593663212.name: Beautiful malecon
593663212.author: a TripAdvisor user
593663212.reviewBody: This is a lovely, long walk along the bay at the edge of town with several impressive sculptures. On the historic part of the old town.

591759360.name: Take a Walk on the Malecon
591759360.author: a TripAdvisor user
591759360.reviewBody: This is a lovely walk along the beach in La Paz. On the one side there are restaurants, shops, etc. On the other there is the beach and the Sea of Cortez. If you are in La Paz, I recommend a leisurely stroll along the Malecon.

591406323.name: Always something to see
591406323.author: a TripAdvisor user
591406323.reviewBody: Last week my friend and I went into a shop and I looked out just in time to see a dolphin feeding. He popped up twice fairly close to shore. Wow

590608137.name: Getting better each day
590608137.author: a TripAdvisor user
590608137.reviewBody: Love the improvements La Paz is doing to the Malecon.  It\'s really shaping up to be a beautiful project and really enhances the downtown feel.

589764482.name: Great place for a seaside stroll
589764482.author: a TripAdvisor user
589764482.reviewBody: Dotted with statues depicting the Gulf of California, this is a La Paz highlight. Join local families as they come out in the evening to socialize and relax.

589349004.name: On the Baja boardwalk...
589349004.author: a TripAdvisor user
589349004.reviewBody: ....we\'ll be havin\' some fun in Baja!\n\nLa Paz is an interesting town.  The boardwalk has a surprising diversity - boba cafe, high-end sushi, everyday local agua fresca stores where families order ice cream (served in an open snack chip bag, very clever!).  Water is flat, flat, flat.  It feels like you can see the edge of the world from the boardwalk.  Enjoy and get the jamaica (hibiscus drink) or horchata from the agua fresca place!

588699149.name: A wonderful place to walk and people watch!
588699149.author: a TripAdvisor user
588699149.reviewBody: You can spend hours here, enjoying the sounds and smells of the ocean, watching boats and people. I liked to go to the east side and grab ice cream and watch the people! The Sculptures are wonderfully done and make it very easy to land mark with

588517191.name: Nice clean quiet beach.
588517191.author: a TripAdvisor user
588517191.reviewBody: Nice beach. Easy parking. Lots of food options. Not a bad drive from Los Cabos. Very easy going spot.

588425702.name: Fun for sunset!
588425702.author: a TripAdvisor user
588425702.reviewBody: We walked around a few nights with our young kiddos. They rented scooters and big wheels for them to rip around on, watched fish from the pier, bought some snacks and handmade jewelry from an artist one night. Didn\u2019t stay out late but it was fun for sunset. Especially on the weekend! Very family friendly.

587945437.name: Nice sunsets!!
587945437.author: a TripAdvisor user
587945437.reviewBody:
Best golf ok California sunsets...
Nice restaurants and pubs...
Good food, and friendly ambient,
La Paz people offer nice info from The best beaches in town

586193732.name: Day trip
586193732.author: a TripAdvisor user
586193732.reviewBody: We came to la Paz to check out the beaches it is a big city but drive down to the boardwalk and explore. You can walk, bike, roller blade the whole shoreline. Grab a bite to eat. Watch the sunset and vise the shops.

584901221.name: Perfect!!
584901221.author: a TripAdvisor user
584901221.reviewBody: If it to go for a walk, jog or bike ride it\'s a wonderful place to go for a stroll or just hand out and watch the sunset... Restaurants along the Malecon are awesome!!!

584449152.name: Great place for a walk
584449152.author: a TripAdvisor user
584449152.reviewBody: We stayed at The Perla hotel which is right on the  Malecon. Along the Malecon you will see tons of statues, quaint restaurants and coffee shops. Just a couple blocks off the Malecon you find banks, shops and more restaurants. Well worth spending a couple of days here.

582809679.name: Nice Walk
582809679.author: a TripAdvisor user
582809679.reviewBody: The Malec\u00f3n in La Paz is beautiful lots going on and plenty of ocean views to keep you walking farther and farther. Shopping is across the street all along the walk as well. Very safe police are everywhere as traffic tends to be heavy. Lots of bicycles and roller blades. It seems the preferred choice if you want to see the whole Malec\u00f3n or it will be quite a long walk. There are even place to put your feet in the ocean and sit on the beach. Enjoy your time in La Paz beautiful relaxing town.

580179170.name: Very nice
580179170.author: a TripAdvisor user
580179170.reviewBody: La Paz has a great malecon full of art scultures and beautiful views. It is very well maintained and wide so there is plenty of room for everyone. There is a nice little park towards the north that has a little shade in the evening. It is a great place to take a stroll or ride a bike.

578691268.name: Beautiful walk along Malec\u00f3n
578691268.author: a TripAdvisor user
578691268.reviewBody:
I really enjoyed this beautiful Malecón. It’s about 20min (non stop. Looks fat but it’s really not) walk from the main strip attraction. You can purchase tours, great food and souvenirs.

The views are so beautiful. Once you start your walk from the first statue I believe by the second statue on the right there’s a street and there’s a little stand which we purchased fresh ceviche tostada and a michelada, (bloody beer) that was absolutely delicious. Unfortunately, I don’t recall the name of stand or street. But it’s by the beginning of the Malecón to your right.

There’s great bar-restaurants with views to the Malecón. You can park on the street we didn’t have any type of issue. Seemed really fair and there’s always police men patrolling. There’s also a small park for children. There’s many beautiful murals and gift shop stores. I recommend to take cash because you’ll get a better price from the little individual stands by the beginning of the Malecón. 

It is a little pricey when it comes to souvenirs in the Malecón stores so look around. You can get a tour map from your hotels which will give you a better idea where to start. You can catch taxis from Malecón. 

Make sure to take glasses, hat and sunscreen!

578586387.name: Free People Watching
578586387.author: a TripAdvisor user
578586387.reviewBody: We had lots of fun walking the Malecon. You walk along the water. It\'s especially fun at night. Lots of nightlife, restaurants, and bars.

577266588.name: very pleasant walk along the shore.  Interesting sculture/statues.
577266588.author: a TripAdvisor user
577266588.reviewBody: beautiful water, boats to watch, nice walkway, intersting statue/sculpture along the way.  Excellent mango gellato a block or so from the whale museum

576339380.name: Make sure you wander off the main part..
576339380.author: a TripAdvisor user
576339380.reviewBody: to see some great street art. Sculptures, murals, street markets with artisan crafts set up at night, all off the side streets from the malecon. \n\nI was a solo female traveler and felt entirely safe walking all around the area at night.

576237101.name: Perfect
576237101.author: a TripAdvisor user
576237101.reviewBody: People giving this anything less that four or five stars are questionable, I just can\'t see why anyone would rate the La Paz Malecon as anything less that four or five stars.  I didn\'t even bother to look at their comments, and you shouldn\'t either.  This is a great, LONG, boardwalk along the beach of La Paz.  Like other Mexican cities, they have plenty of art installations.  The sunsets are outstanding, and the people are great.  Being there in the evening, you see the locals arriving to enjoy the evening, they are always to happy and enjoying life.

575734818.name: Wonderful place to walk
575734818.author: a TripAdvisor user
575734818.reviewBody: We loved walking the Malecon everyday. It is beautiful to feel the breeze off the sea and plenty of spots on the beach to sit and enjoy the sunshine or a sunset.

575417414.name: La Paz Malecon
575417414.author: a TripAdvisor user
575417414.reviewBody: An amazing Malecon, dotted with statues, and bike lanes so we felt safe riding our bikes.  Very picturesque with lots of great eating places.

574273685.name: The Malecon makes for a wonderful stroll!
574273685.author: a TripAdvisor user
574273685.reviewBody: Three miles of sites, sounds, restaurants, sculptures, the best ice cream in town!  Lots of tourists, but mostly from the area. \nA great contrast to the insanity of Cabo.  Next time we\'re going to rent bikes and go all the way up and down it.

573852442.name: Nice walk
573852442.author: a TripAdvisor user
573852442.reviewBody: It\'s very nice to walk over there mainly at sunset. Several restaurants and gift shops across the Malecon.

573283709.name: great for an evening stroll. all towns should have this!
573283709.author: a TripAdvisor user
573283709.reviewBody: so much fun...enjoy in the evening when all the locals are out strolling and watching the sunset. many interesting sculptures and art work along the way also

572534545.name: Comes alive at night
572534545.author: a TripAdvisor user
572534545.reviewBody: Great way to soak up Mexican seaside resort culture.  Note 90% of people on Malecon are Mexican, so this is a refreshing change for anyone seeking antidote to the Cabo Resort experience.  Quiet by day, busy at night - even on weekdays. Lots of nice restaurants, shops and cafes along the front and side streets for all budgets. Even a natural history museum about local marine life. We rented bikes for a few pesos (brakes, air in tires and helmets must have cost extra because ours didn\u2019t have any) to cycle along the front during the day.  You can cycle upto the beaches at Corumuel in 15 minutes. La Paz feels safe in general, and even more so on the Malecon itself.

571561866.name: Beach front esplanade
571561866.author: a TripAdvisor user
571561866.reviewBody: The Malecon is a nice level walkway along the Beach in La Paz. It\u2019s great for bikes,wheelchairs and scooters. Not much shade though. It\u2019s across the street from lots of different restaurants.

571375992.name: Beautiful walk
571375992.author: a TripAdvisor user
571375992.reviewBody: Nice place for a stroll, was not too busy which was great.  Lots of restaurants and a few souvenir shops

570669483.name: Good walk, interesting sculptures
570669483.author: a TripAdvisor user
570669483.reviewBody: It\'s a nice walk along the Malecon. You\'ll see lots of shorebirds like pelicans, ibis, herons in the morning and if you are interested in art you\'ll find more than 10 interesting sculptures. Also very good for morning jogging - you\'ll even find some fitness equipment on the way.

570378207.name: Nice to be able to walk along the waterfront
570378207.author: a TripAdvisor user
570378207.reviewBody: La Paz did it right.  No highrise hotels blocking the beaches from view.  It was a delightful change from Cabo,and San Jose del Cabo where most of the beaches are blocked from view.

570237517.name: Great place to walk, run, or people watch
570237517.author: a TripAdvisor user
570237517.reviewBody: We stayed in La Paz for 1week . Every morning we went for a run. It was so great to see so many lo calls out enjoying this place. Sunday night it was more festive with families and others out walking, enjoying the entertainment and venues. A must see in La Paz

569275492.name: Evening promenade
569275492.author: a TripAdvisor user
569275492.reviewBody: We very much liked La Paz and nowhere is better to enjoy the local life than the malec\u00f3n, the place to see and be seen. Great for an evening stroll, a drink watching the sunset, an ice cream or dinner.

568783676.name: Lovely place especially in the evening and night.
568783676.author: a TripAdvisor user
568783676.reviewBody:
It's nice during the day, a well done walkway along the foreshore, but can get a bit hot.

But in the evening and night the place comes alive with both locals and tourists. They walk, ride, skate along the Malecon or just sit at one of the many restaurants or bars that line the adjacent road.

A must see if you're in La Paz.

568655999.name: Must-do if traveling through BCS
568655999.author: a TripAdvisor user
568655999.reviewBody: Malec\u00f2n translates roughly to "boardwalk" and this one extends right alongside La Paz Bay for miles.  There are a lot of really fantastic statues and it is incredibly well lit at night.  Enjoy watching the boats or stop in and grab some food at the local establishments.

568286883.name: Newly renovated and beautiful!
568286883.author: a TripAdvisor user
568286883.reviewBody: Walking the malecon is a personal favorite of ours....always lively!  The sidewalks have been spruced up and the streets widened so that there is more parking at the beginning or south end of the malecon.

567940049.name: Great place to walk and people watch.
567940049.author: a TripAdvisor user
567940049.reviewBody: The Malecon, or break water, runs for approximately 2 KM  along the waterfront of La Paz. Walking paths are nicely constructed ( and under construction at the moment) and there are interesting large scale sculptures every few hundred yards. There are numerous bars, restaurants and shops on the opposite side of the street.

567112863.name: Quiet and peaceful walk / bike ride
567112863.author: a TripAdvisor user
567112863.reviewBody: We started out as a walk down the Malecon and then rented bikes (which I highly recommend). All the restaurants and shops are on one side and the beach on the other! We\'ve been to several Malecons in Mexico. This is one of the best with the fewest peddlers. You can stroll along and enjoy the walk / ride with a pleasant waterfront breeze. I do not recommend the beach itself as it is full of seaweed and rocks. They are in the process of some upgrades and repairs so there was some men working in various areas. But that should not detour you from a great stroll and some good food!

566164266.name: Great stroll and shop
566164266.author: a TripAdvisor user
566164266.reviewBody: A bit under construction on my visit, but still a nice walk and base to head inland and shop and eat.

565581727.name: You have to go, but very touristie
565581727.author: a TripAdvisor user
565581727.reviewBody:
Very touristie and commercial. Lots of very loud bars and restaurants that just scream “Spring Break!”- which is not at all what we expected or wanted in La Paz.  Reminded me, and not in a good way, of Révolucion Avenue in Tijuana 20years ago, of of Squid Roe in Cabo every night. 

A few more traditional and quieter places are hidden here and there.  

The water side of the Malacon has a nice promenade and sculptures spread out over its entire length, so you can walk the Malacon and skip the craziness.

We were there over Carnival week that that was great.  Both sides of the street were lined with vendors of food and crafts and 6-7 big  stages for live music, and a big parade with many elaborate floats every night  Still noisy and crazy, but in a festive way. 

Except for a few restaurants and coffee shops, almost everything we liked about La Paz was away from the Malacon.

565470061.name: Loved everything about the area
565470061.author: a TripAdvisor user
565470061.reviewBody: The people the restaurants the shoreline the seaside sculptures. We spent time there everyday of our trip to La Paz. This is a place I want to visit again and again. Boating marinas, scuba diving shops with a low key feel to it all. Personally, I liked it more than Cabo although I think Cabo is fun and interesting.

564175543.name: Love it
564175543.author: a TripAdvisor user
564175543.reviewBody: Great location for long power walks or for just sashaying along.  Many Resteraunts many quaint shops.  Lovely view of La Paz Bay

564148746.name: Wonderful Ocean Front Walking!
564148746.author: a TripAdvisor user
564148746.reviewBody: Great place to walk along the ocean side or cross the street and shop the commercial businesses. Sunsets are spectacular. Many social activities are held in this area with various sponsors through out the year. Restaurants all along the strip with various offerings. Tourism is a main stay event. Enjoy the experience!

564059993.name: Favourite activity in La Paz
564059993.author: a TripAdvisor user
564059993.reviewBody: Spent my days in La Paz walking half the Malecon in the morning and the other half in the evening. Love the views and people watching!

563799793.name: Beautiful drive along the Malecon
563799793.author: a TripAdvisor user
563799793.reviewBody: After our tour with VIP LA PAZ - Wonders of the Sea of Cortez, we drove along the Malecon ; so pretty; lots of interesting sculptures; would have been fun to walk around some if we had more time. I felt totally safe and noticed a few truck loads of armed police officers making their presence known... no worries visiting this town.   Do it!  And take a swim with the whale sharks tour....

563732161.name: I love LA Paz
563732161.author: a TripAdvisor user
563732161.reviewBody: LA Paz Malecon keeps getting better and better! They have expanded the walkway and the food along the boardwalk is the best. I went during Carnaval which is celebrating before lent and it was Wonderful! There was a parade every night with floats, carnival rides, 4 music stages and Food! Food! Food! Last Paz should call themselves music city because  every restaurant has music coming into the street. It is also a great place to take a shark whale watching cruise and tour of Espiritu Santo Island.

563425060.name: Fabuolous La Paz beachfront
563425060.author: a TripAdvisor user
563425060.reviewBody: Great first experience of Mexico. Tha Baja Coast, \u201cthe world\u2019s aquarium\u201d and swimming with Whale Sharks. WILD.

563055786.name: Nice place to walk.
563055786.author: a TripAdvisor user
563055786.reviewBody: The views were great. The weather was perfect. There weren\'t really things to "do" other than a small playground. But the kids loved the long walk in the fresh air.

562989702.name: A highlight of LaPaz
562989702.author: a TripAdvisor user
562989702.reviewBody: This bay front boulevard has been upgraded, and offers a variety of restaurants and shopping for over a kilometer. You can select fine dining, or walk safely off the main street a few blocks to enjoy street vendors. La fuente ice cream is amazing!

562802843.name: Waterfront art
562802843.author: a TripAdvisor user
562802843.reviewBody: Walk for miles. Shops, restaurants,whale museum, exercise and play centers.  Stay for hours night or day.

562572575.name: LaPaz Malecon
562572575.author: a TripAdvisor user
562572575.reviewBody: Love the Malecon, it has been refurbished and expanded since my last visit, even better than before.  Just a nice place to walk and enjoy the view, people, and  environment.

562155432.name: Malecon
562155432.author: a TripAdvisor user
562155432.reviewBody: Great place to walk. Lots of sculptures. Very clean with lots of shops, bars and restaurants. We were there in February  and they had just had a festival so a lot of the stages and food stalls were still there waiting to be taken away.

561807885.name: the best walking path
561807885.author: a TripAdvisor user
561807885.reviewBody: A great walk all along the water, cannot be beat!  The city is clean and the artwork and path are pristine.!\n

561778124.name: Great walk along the ocean, restaurants, shops, etc
561778124.author: a TripAdvisor user
561778124.reviewBody: The art work, sculptures and wall paintings is awesome.  Great place to walk as far or as little as you want with lots of options for eating, drinking and entertainment.  Awesome during carnival (week before Ash Tuesday).

561547499.name: Street food vendors on weekend nights!
561547499.author: a TripAdvisor user
561547499.reviewBody: Malecon is a fun walk during the day - restaurants, shops, and bars on one side of the street and the water on the other. Clean sidewalks, lots of photo ops, sculptures every couple of blocks, and cute trashcans (really! They are decorated with sea lions on top so they look like sculptures). At night, you can walk and find a great restaurant, fun bar, or hopping night club. Lots of people, but not overly crowded. Feels very safe. On Saturday and Sunday evening, there were tons of street vendors (churros, fruit, corn, handmade quesadillas, pastries, etc). We happened to be there for Carnivalito so there was a huge children\'s parade, but we think most of the food vendors are probably there year-round (or most of it). We loved walking to dinner each evening.

560750353.name: 3km long promenade with everything!
560750353.author: a TripAdvisor user
560750353.reviewBody: Long, long promenade with shops, restaurants and a cycle-way.  All with a fantastic view over blue water and blue sky.

560122657.name: Nice walk!
560122657.author: a TripAdvisor user
560122657.reviewBody: Pretty walkway along the bay. People work hard at keeping it clean and we saw improvements being made all the time we were there. Driving along it is a bit of a challenge though....can get pretty busy!

558297501.name: Such a shame.
558297501.author: a TripAdvisor user
558297501.reviewBody: This beach could have so much potential but unfortunately the beach is quite dirty and there is lots of construction going on. I would also advise not to swim here...

558155062.name: Wonderful Sea Wall Walk
558155062.author: a TripAdvisor user
558155062.reviewBody: The Malecon, which has undergone improvements lately, is a lovely way to experience La Paz.  Taking a stroll, particularly on a warm evening, is a relaxing way to spend time. There were many local residents no the Malecon in the evening, particularly on Friday evening.  There are lots of places to stop for a meal or a drink and it was a lovely walk.

558002636.name: Great improvements going on
558002636.author: a TripAdvisor user
558002636.reviewBody: The city has been working on the boardwalk and it is looking good. A nice place to walk along the water. You can walk, ride a bike or roller blade. Nice place to relax and have a picnic with the family.

557911258.name: A lovely place to walk
557911258.author: a TripAdvisor user
557911258.reviewBody: With the recent updating of the Malecon this walkway is spacious and well-lit and a huge bonus for this area.

556022987.name: Cool
556022987.author: a TripAdvisor user
556022987.reviewBody: This is where the tourist action begins. Plenty of restaurant options. We enjoyed breakfast on the beach and dinner while watching the promenade. Night transforms this place into a hot spot for bars and clubs. Had options for pop music and pub atmosphere, lots of outdoor patios, Banda, Cumbia  and Latin pop dancing. I did not find much for daytime souvenir shopping though. I think a couple of small streets open some carts on certain days of the week  but I was unlucky.

555997305.name: A Beautiful Setting
555997305.author: a TripAdvisor user
555997305.reviewBody: The Malecon is a beautiful stretch along the shoreline. It is now under renovation and should be completed in four months. A great place where families gather at night to enjoy all the fun there.

555738069.name: Off Season Visit... Under Construction
555738069.author: a TripAdvisor user
555738069.reviewBody: Visited the Malecon first week of November.  Met with a fair bit of construction as the prepared for the busy season to come.  A bit of an inconvenience but I was still able to enjoy myself.  La Paz is beautiful, and wasn\'t too touristy- which I really appreatiated.  A great place to go diving.

555656364.name: Beautiful long paved path along the La Paz waterfront
555656364.author: a TripAdvisor user
555656364.reviewBody: This bulkhead boardwalk is being completed, and is lovely.  Frequent artwork sculptures, wide, used by joggers, strollers, skaters.  There is a separate bike path on the street adjacent.  Attractive addition to the town.

555250948.name: An experience you won\'t regret!
555250948.author: a TripAdvisor user
555250948.reviewBody: I love strolling the Malecon especially after 5pm. People are skating, biking, running, and laughing, smiling, and waving. It\'s such a beautiful place to walk before or after dinner. When the construction is complete, I will be so happy!!!

555164749.name: They are working hard to improve
555164749.author: a TripAdvisor user
555164749.reviewBody: While we were there a couple months ago it looked dated and worn from salt air. Now they are working hard to update and restore. It\u2019s just a nice place to be near the sea and the town. It\u2019s touristy but not overly so with good restaurants and activities but no hecklers trying to get you to buy junk, trips or time shares.

554768704.name: Pleasant place to stroll and enjoy the little beaches dotted alongside
554768704.author: a TripAdvisor user
554768704.reviewBody: It will be nice when its finished!  Currently (Jan 2018) its undergoing some major refurbishment.  Nice statues featured along the way.  Lovely views and colours at sunset.

554671990.name: Nice place.
554671990.author: a TripAdvisor user
554671990.reviewBody: It\'s a nice place for a stroll, a jog, or even to drive by in your car. I would walk it often and it\'s just a easemt place and it\'s nice to look at.

553878070.name: Quintessential La Paz
553878070.author: a TripAdvisor user
553878070.reviewBody: Loved walking the Malecon every evening. Beautiful scenery and access to great restaurants and bars.

553877353.name: Always under construction
553877353.author: a TripAdvisor user
553877353.reviewBody: It seems like every time I come to La Paz some part of the Malecon is under construction.  For years!  Whenever they get it finished (if they ever do) it should be great, but not holding my breath.

553835079.name: Nice area for a walk
553835079.author: a TripAdvisor user
553835079.reviewBody: Well worth spending an afternoin walking the area.  Many great bars and restaurants as well as water activities and cultural destinations.

553559754.name: Nice place to walk by the water
553559754.author: a TripAdvisor user
553559754.reviewBody: Nice statues along the way, and the view of the water is nice.  But when looking for fresh air, I really found that the fumes from the many cars along the busy road really interfered with any sense of fresh air.  In fact I almost got a headache from the fumes. There are one or two small beach areas. Lots of locals biking and jogging in the morning, but they wear buffs over their mouth/nose, which I thought at first was strange because it made them look like they were about to rob us at gunpoint, but then I realized it was because of the fumes. Nice restaurants along the Malecon as well, but there are very very good restaurants a few streets inland as well.  So dont be afraid to leave the Malecon.

552822679.name: Just needs completing...
552822679.author: a TripAdvisor user
552822679.reviewBody: There\'s obviously been an effort to beautify this walkway round the bay.  It\'s looking good so far with neat sections and great statues. It just needs to be finished and some seating provided along what might well become the Promenade to compare to The Prado!!

552134549.name: La pat malecon
552134549.author: a TripAdvisor user
552134549.reviewBody: TheMalecon is beautiful and so pleasant to watch families strolling along together very clean ,\ud83d\udca5wonderful sunset ,  nice whale shark excursion near by. Organic market couple blocks NE Tuesday and Saturday Am\u2764\ufe0f

552042892.name: Enjoy walking and sun and air!
552042892.author: a TripAdvisor user
552042892.reviewBody: Be prepared to walk a long way around this malec\u00f3n ;) I believe about 5 or 6 miles walking, maybe more ?  But you will enjoy it .  Lost of restaurants , but you will find more little stores on the other side of the Main Street , little market, banks and small jewelry fair selling nice Mexican jewelry.  There is small store where you can rent bicycle, skates....lot of fun

551970131.name: Walk for seafood and ice cream
551970131.author: a TripAdvisor user
551970131.reviewBody: Very nicely done seaside boardwalk with bike rentals and walking paths- good restaurants and ice cream- not great for shopping- safe and friendly

551297467.name: Pretty boring and dead
551297467.author: a TripAdvisor user
551297467.reviewBody: Malecon is pretty depressing for a downtown area. First and foremost, there is one good mexican food place in this entire city...no joke, ask anyone. Second, La Paz is supposed to be an "up and coming" area, well it still hasn\'t even gotten up lol. It\'s legitimately dead. 1/20 places seems nice/enjoyable. At night it got pretty busy, but there isnt anything to do besides eat. Pass. Go to Cabo or Puerto.

550752139.name: Great place to walk and gather
550752139.author: a TripAdvisor user
550752139.reviewBody: I loved walking along the malecon. Great restaurants and shops. Great place to get a coffee or ice cream and sit in the evening to people watch.

550733907.name: Great boardwalk
550733907.author: a TripAdvisor user
550733907.reviewBody: The Malecon is packed with wonderful restaurants, ice cream shops, and coffee shops. I ventured out for five nights and found some wonderful options. Very safe and lots of kids present. The breeze felt great at night. The only thing I would change is the landscaping. It would have been nice to see the place taken care of a little better. Beautiful but it could use some sprucing up. Otherwise the location is wonderful!

550210971.name: Awesome place !!!!
550210971.author: a TripAdvisor user
550210971.reviewBody: Restaurants, Tours, shops, bars, beach, parks, museums, and amazing sunsets are just a few of the things we love about the Malecon.   It is the heart of La Paz.

548422670.name: Love to Walk it Every Day!
548422670.author: a TripAdvisor user
548422670.reviewBody: Wonderful walk/stroll along the water on the La Paz malecon.  Friends and families and lovers and singles stroll for miles daily, especially in the late afternoon/evening.  However... this visit the malecon was GONE! Completely torn up for some reason - such a huge disappointment.  No way it will be ready for Navidad.  What a bummer.

546808236.name: One of the best places in La Paz
546808236.author: a TripAdvisor user
546808236.reviewBody:
This aerea will be renovated shortly in a very beautiful way.
Nice to walk along the oceanside.
Good location for relaxing moments.
Good bars and restaurants around.

546396142.name: under construction , very bad experience
546396142.author: a TripAdvisor user
546396142.reviewBody: noise, dust, dump truck all day and nights. really disappointed. It appears that nearly the whole distance is being worked on at the same time.

545976505.name: Walkable
545976505.author: a TripAdvisor user
545976505.reviewBody: We went to the anthropology museum and it was a don\'t miss experience...very nice, and cool, and a ban\u00f3, and all in Spanish, so bring your brain, your translation guide, or wing it...great place!

545867722.name: Under construction!
545867722.author: a TripAdvisor user
545867722.reviewBody: Currently under construction scheduled to be completed by February 2018 for carnival. Looks like it will be beautiful when finished. You still have access to all the stores and restaurants along the malecon however a few detours may be in order. \n As always watch where you are walking for trip hazards, holes and unfinished areas.

545643626.name: Going to be a great walkway in January 2018
545643626.author: a TripAdvisor user
545643626.reviewBody: ok, this is an amazing walkway right on the waterway in La Paz.\nHowever they are in a huge upgrading program right now with 60%of the Malecon ripped up as well as street frontage.\nBeautiful sculpture every few blocks so this well be awesoem.

544882032.name: Beautiful, safe, awesome people
544882032.author: a TripAdvisor user
544882032.reviewBody: We were in La Paz two nights and days after sailing around Isla Espiritu Santos for 2 weeks.  The local government is completely redoing the sidewalks - they\'re wide, flat, and beautiful.  There are many restaurants, adventure stores (swim with whale sharks, visit Isla Espiritu Santos on a day trip, camping, kayaking, swimming with the seals, scuba diving and more), excellent hotels, beautiful sculptures, night markets (not sure which days and what time of year).  The tourist police are very helpful, happy, and friendly.  We love La Paz and recommend visiting.

544110921.name: By this time next year, I would probably rate this 5 stars!
544110921.author: a TripAdvisor user
544110921.reviewBody: There is so much new construction going on down the strip along the Malecon so when it is completed it will be a beautiful walk along the seaside. It is difficult now because of all the construction. There are still a lot of great photo opportunities and the breeze feels great. A lot of shopping, activities, and places to eat along this strip as well. So many restaurants have open air seating and great views. It still has an \u201cold town\u201d local feeling. Hopefully with the new construction this won\u2019t change too much.

543642293.name: Under construction!
543642293.author: a TripAdvisor user
543642293.reviewBody: It will be great in a few months, but all torn up when we were there.  great restaurants and bars, happening place on Saturday nights for the local youth.

543393023.name: Nice sea side walk.
543393023.author: a TripAdvisor user
543393023.reviewBody: Lots of random loud construction all up and down the Malecon. Beautiful unique bronze statues everywhere.  Stop at the Corona beer store for a cheap icy cold beer!  \nWe would definitely come back to La Paz once all the construction is complete.

542259044.name: Definitelyy not Gringolandia ;-)
542259044.author: a TripAdvisor user
542259044.reviewBody: Very pleasant Safe and fun walk along the beach on the Malecon. Families and kids on bikes and skate boards. great sunsets and not too many American tourists. Awesome sunsets!

542098126.name: Not much to speak of, but there it is.
542098126.author: a TripAdvisor user
542098126.reviewBody: The coast along the malecon is absolutely amazing, but the malecon itself is nothing to speak of. The sea being the only reason for visiting La Paz, oh, and the food, the shops etc along the malecon are useless, when you walk it, it\'s the water you want to see!

542017817.name: A nice bike ride/walk
542017817.author: a TripAdvisor user
542017817.reviewBody: La Paz is not the prettiest place, but has a great vibe. The malecon is central to this. The view on the sea, the nice statues and the sunny walk past it all are enjoyable. The people selling tours less so, and the beaches aren\'t really nice as well.

540780209.name: Awesome walk
540780209.author: a TripAdvisor user
540780209.reviewBody: Such a jewel of the Baja, a must do in LaPaz.  Walking along the Malecon in LaPaz at sunset or after is such a wonderful thing.

540544386.name: Major Construction occurring for pipe installation and malecon construction
540544386.author: a TripAdvisor user
540544386.reviewBody:
We didn't end up walking much on the malecon but, did spend a lot of time on the store side which is still opened.  Much of the  street and sidewalk is being worked on as crews install new pipes, sidewalks, parking areas and wheelchair approaches.  They are evidently completing this in very large sections and they are working into the evening to try and complete this work.

The malecon did not look like it needed replaced and I'm guessing that this project was driven by the replacement of underground utilities i.e. water, sewer, & power.  

Most of the restaurants are opened but, a few have taken the opportunity to remodel interiors during this time.  Some stores are completely blocked making access impossible but, none were stores that we needed entry. 

Overall, the construction was not a big problem during our stay.  It's good to see the La Paz economy support a large construction project like this.

540317956.name: Great area.. enjoyed the Malecon
540317956.author: a TripAdvisor user
540317956.reviewBody: Did a day trip to LA Paz..  their street are under construction .same as San Jose del Cabo.  Walked the Malecon a few blocks it was a very warm day and just need to get out of the heat.  With the other side of the street pretty much not walkable. we did not stay very long.  But do enjoy the sculptures along the area.  \nMay nice restaurants and shop around this area.

540099531.name: must do
540099531.author: a TripAdvisor user
540099531.reviewBody: Take a 30 mile taxi ride out to the airport to the resort with the private beach the taxi driver will know the name and the place pure luxury

538696445.name: Nice stroll
538696445.author: a TripAdvisor user
538696445.reviewBody: The Malecon is being upgraded at the moment and so is quite a mess and noisy with the renovations (they seem to work all hours!). However, it is worth the cruise both during the day and evening when there is often a spectacular sunset over the bay.  There are some interesting sculptures on the beach side...

538613832.name: Ripped up
538613832.author: a TripAdvisor user
538613832.reviewBody: Major project underway to widen the Malecon and provide more parking. So of course the whole strip is a mess. But they\u2019re moving fast and pouring concrete overnight. They might actually make their December deadline.

536706104.name: Nice Malecon but under Major Construction
536706104.author: a TripAdvisor user
536706104.reviewBody: We started out walking the Malecon by the 1st pier and stopped by the Marina Hotel. It is a nice walk and the Malecon will be much nicer after all the construction is completed. There is lots to look at and if you are a people watcher you will love it.

535759016.name: Fantastic Malecon!
535759016.author: a TripAdvisor user
535759016.reviewBody:
We have been to some coastal town all over Mexico, but La Paz is just so special. The Malecon is amazing to experience the real Mexican way of life. 
On the weekends, this walkway is packed with people, strolling, jogging etc. There is always some sort of event going on, dancing, acting, art. Vendors offer all kind of local products. 
It is a wonderful place to sit and people-watch.
They are in the process of embellishing the sidewalks and it will look very nice when they finish.
Since we came last time, they have added a new statue 'la perla' and it gives tribute to the importance of La Paz as the center of the pearl industry up until the 60's. Right now there is a great foto exhibit in town ('Casa de Gobierno' across from the church) about 'Men at sea' and fishing.

535699679.name: Nice Walkway
535699679.author: a TripAdvisor user
535699679.reviewBody: There was construction when we were there. It seems like some of the businesses on the street had seen a better day. But the views and the artwork were very nice.

534097963.name: Great Walk. Best In The Afternoon.
534097963.author: a TripAdvisor user
534097963.reviewBody:
Even in the middle of October, La Paz, BC is hot. I was sweating the minute I started walking. I managed to make it all the way to the end and back, and then some, to my RV park about a mile away. The malacon itself isn't anything like my fave, El Boradero, in Colombia, where there are a ton of trees and the beach is long and clean. The beach all along the malcon in La Paz has some kind of green plant that is swept up every day or two. It ruins the beaches. Throughout my walk, I could not find one stretch of beach that I would swim in. The fact that there are all kinds of boats at anchor off shore, make me wonder if that is what is contributing to the plant outbreak. I want to use the word that starts with an "a" but I can't remember how to spell it. lol.

Although there are sections of the malcon where there is shade, 90% of it is in direct sun. Because there is so much cement, it really kicks up the heat factor. Along with malcon there are several statues depicting various sea scenes, including a wonderful statue of Jacque Custeau. To walk the entire malacon it's a good idea to bring a bottle of water, unless walking in the late afternoon/early evening, to stay hydrated.

There is a ton of construction going on across the way of the malacon, including a hotel and all kinds of other construction. Roughly 70% of the waterfront is under construction, and many of the streets leading to the malacon are closed to traffic.

I have been told that the time to walk the walk the malacon is in the evening on Sundays, when everybody, both locals and tourists, walk it's length. Locally, anyway, it's how people re-connect and have the opportunity to mingle.

533613593.name: It is more than perfect
533613593.author: a TripAdvisor user
533613593.reviewBody: 6 km walking path in the beach line. Very safe, local peoples dominated, no crowd tourists. Many local restaurants. I enjoyed walking in the malecon. Hope to visit there again.

532168247.name: Always a surprise awaits
532168247.author: a TripAdvisor user
532168247.reviewBody: You can never walk, run or stroll on the Malecon without noticing some new detail, or the touch of a new season.  From the beach volley ball players, school children on field trip, art in the making, mixture of all ages of citizens enjoying this pristine city by the sea....the variety of sensual experiences is unending.  This doesn\'t even touch the beautiful sunsets, or early morning light.  Think of watching the pangeros arrive with their catch almost each morning, the army of sweepers to smile at as they keep the walkway pristinely clean...then there is music, skate boarders, venders, artisanos. and finally the lovely statuary along the entire 3 miles plus of this beachfront walk.   We make it a point of not passing La Fuente across the street from the cruise ship pier with out enjoying a waffle cone or cup of incredible home made ice cream!  La Fuente with it\'s balloon trees have been a land mark in La Paz for almost 25 years!  One more thing, we have lived in La Paz part time for 29 years.   Early morning runs or walks on the Malecon can\'t be beat.

529199096.name: Beautiful, safe, family-filled walk.
529199096.author: a TripAdvisor user
529199096.reviewBody: We walked well over 2 miles of the Malecon. There are numerous excellent restaurants (an Applebee\'s, really? If I wanted that, I could have stayed home), one great little souvenir-type shop, the Whale Museum, marinas, not to mention a clean sidewalk and a beautiful view. Our condo overlooked the walk, and it was great to see how well used it is by the locals. Many families with kids of all ages, bicyclists, roller-bladers, runners, are there from early morning to late into the evening.

529144663.name: you wont recognize La Paz If it\'s been a while
529144663.author: a TripAdvisor user
529144663.reviewBody: La Paz is serious in bringing attention to it\'s beautiful and roomy boardwalk. A great walk along the oceanfront. On my visit in Sept. 2017 the other side of the Malecon was being imulated with new sidewalk for miles. What\'s was surprising is no junk curios stores lined the streets as in most tourist locations.

528345620.name: Beautiful sites
528345620.author: a TripAdvisor user
528345620.reviewBody: Couldn\'t believe how beautiful the water was.. The people are too sweet. They have a few small shops that make you feel like you are in a small secluded city.

524510368.name: perfect picture
524510368.author: a TripAdvisor user
524510368.reviewBody: there are LA PAZ letters in there so you can miss them, you need to go and take that picture of you right there! \nyou will like la paz

524105600.name: A Sunday Must!
524105600.author: a TripAdvisor user
524105600.reviewBody: The Malecon is a beautiful promenade on the Sea of Cortez in La Paz.  It\'s wide, it\'s beautiful and its well used throughout the week, but on Sundays it\'s full of families enjoying a stroll.  Grandma, Mom, Dad, Teenagers and little kids.  Some walking, some skating, some bicycling.  The sculptures along the Malecon are spectacular as is the view of The Sea of Cortez.

523253924.name: Walking the Malecon
523253924.author: a TripAdvisor user
523253924.reviewBody: We enjoyed walking up and down the malecon. This was the heart of the city and all walks of life were walking, biking, roller blading, exercising or just sitting and watching the sun set.  Early morning and later in the evening were the best times to be out.

521289567.name: Evening strolls on the Malecon
521289567.author: a TripAdvisor user
521289567.reviewBody: The Malecon is a lovely place to take evening strolls, this is when the place came alive because when we were there in August it was way too hot to be out during the day!

520927086.name: Malec\u00f3n of la paz
520927086.author: a TripAdvisor user
520927086.reviewBody: Great place for a wonderful walk, family gathering, for an afternoon run, very clean,lots of security, had a great time

520913265.name: Prime people-watching zone
520913265.author: a TripAdvisor user
520913265.reviewBody: This was the best malecon we visited during our drive along the length of the Baja Peninsula. My wife, myself and our dog found the seaside walk had something different each time we visited. This was a daily destination during our week in the city. Great spot to watch a pick-up match of beach volleyball, see a live concert, grab a bite to eat, or just take in the pulse of life in La Paz.

519691208.name: Beautiful place
519691208.author: a TripAdvisor user
519691208.reviewBody: Great place to walk and shop around... Love the colorful street art and sculptures that are all around  \ud83d\ude3b\ud83d\udc9c\u270c\ud83c\udffd\ud83c\udf0a\ud83d\udc33

517233896.name: Day of fun
517233896.author: a TripAdvisor user
517233896.reviewBody: What a good time we had we spent the day walking around visting all the local shops. If you have time vist the whale museum it all right on the water so when the sun goes down the breeze from the ocean great..

516265981.name: family friendly
516265981.author: a TripAdvisor user
516265981.reviewBody: A great place to hang out with the locals. a great assortment of places to dine and shop.We would bike it every day and find a out of the way restaurant to stop at for a treat. There lots of little places tucked away.

514852539.name: It was Okay - Nice Statues but not impressed by Malecon
514852539.author: a TripAdvisor user
514852539.reviewBody: I really did not see anything going on at the Malecon.  We drove up for the day from San Jose Del Cabo, I loved San Jose Del Cabo a lot better.\n\nDon\'t get me wrong, the ocean was a sight to see.

512001882.name: Small but lovely
512001882.author: a TripAdvisor user
512001882.reviewBody: Really a hidden gem.  By far the largest city in BCS. The waterfront is beautiful,  especially the clear waist high water that goes out 300 yards before it reaches 2meters. Great for kids to swim in all day. The offer beautiful art and the famous La Paz sign for Instagrammers. Cool casual restaurants filled with locals. La Paz is a worthwhile day trip away from the touristy  insular resorts of Cabo San Lucas into the heart of Baja Mexico\'s people, food, culture, and beaches.

511495325.name: Statues and views
511495325.author: a TripAdvisor user
511495325.reviewBody: This is a beautiful and scenic malecon (boardwalk) with many lovely statues along the way.  There\'s also a bike path if you like cycling.

510996289.name: Fun walking along the beach.
510996289.author: a TripAdvisor user
510996289.reviewBody: I had fun walking along the ocean looking at all of the islands. There are a lot of things to do. Bars, restaurants and shopping. This place is good for the kids also because there places for them to play, playgrounds and museums, I wouldn\'t recommend going in August it is way to hot.

510681113.name: Sight see on the Malecon
510681113.author: a TripAdvisor user
510681113.reviewBody: Great street to shop, eat, stroll, swim, enjoy the beach, the sights and the people, tourists and natives alike. Restaurants, cafes, ice cream shops, bars...the whole gamut is on the Malecon.

510536533.name: Fun way to spend an evening
510536533.author: a TripAdvisor user
510536533.reviewBody: During the day there is not a lot going on, but at night there are entertainers and food vendors galore.  At the very end there is a small workout area that my son and I enjoyed.

509864110.name: Not friendly to US tourists
509864110.author: a TripAdvisor user
509864110.reviewBody: We were in Cabo and came to La Paz for the day.  Once while parked and once driving the Malecon a cop asked to see my driver\'s license and then made up a fake traffic violation and said they would not give me back my driver\'s license unless I paid them $100 US dollars.  I said I only had $50 and they took it and let me go, but Mexican cities need to crack down on police corruption if they want US tourism. No problems in Cabo.

509385343.name: Quiet break from the Tourists in Cabo
509385343.author: a TripAdvisor user
509385343.reviewBody:
La Paz doesn't have a lot of 5 star hotels with fancy lounges and pools facing the ocean.  No hordes of American tourists looking for excitement .It's buildings are old, and there are no mega nightclubs with deafening music pounding away all night.  
This is precisely why we chose to take our family vacation here.  The place exudes a laid back vibe which you won't find closer to Los Cabos and is an easy 1 hour and 45 minute drive up the modern toll road. 

Food is great and everywhere along a picturesque Malecón which serves as the center of social life in the city.  Rent a bike and meander through the streets next to the ocean.  Stop and try a gelato or Cafe helado.  On weekends the Malecon hosts bands and events which attract masses for great people watching.  A visit to the small Catedral provides a quiet time for reflection.   Hire a lancha (boat) to take you to the meager, but interesting coral reef on Isla Espíritu Santo.  It's not the greatest snorkeling, but the colony of sea lions is an awesome spectacle.  

Overall, La Paz isn't for those looking for Spring break type revelry, but it's provides a relaxing, inexpensive, and authentic Mexican alternative.

508224853.name: Amazing Boardwalk
508224853.author: a TripAdvisor user
508224853.reviewBody: We went to the Malecon, which is essentially the citys boardwalk. Very beautiful and very call place to go walk during the day. There are plenty of restaurants and things to see. If you go during the day, you might that it is a bit too hot, the locals don\'t come out until the evening and that\'s when it really lights up! fun place to check out!!

501314064.name: A true Mexican treasure
501314064.author: a TripAdvisor user
501314064.reviewBody: A walk and or lunch on the Malecon is a must do while in La Paz. The scenery is awesome with it ocean, beaches, harbour, restaurants, and many bronze sculptures. The best time is during Carnival in Febuary.

500055691.name: beautiful Malecon
500055691.author: a TripAdvisor user
500055691.reviewBody: Great place for a stroll and to see the harbour, plenty of restaurants and bars but not too touristy. La Paz is a great taste of the real Mexico

493136301.name: A Beautiful Walk
493136301.author: a TripAdvisor user
493136301.reviewBody: The Malecon is a very wide walkway along the beach in La Paz. There are many sculptures and a wonderful view. Walking along it was very enjoyable. On the side away from the water there is a street lined with many businesses, including a lot of restaurants and some shady spots. It would be nice for there to be a bit more shady spots along the walkway itself.

486471462.name: Excellent Malecon!
486471462.author: a TripAdvisor user
486471462.reviewBody: We\'ve been to many piers along the west coast of Mexico, but thoroughly enjoyed the Malecon in La Paz.  Extremely relaxing to stroll the path alongside the water.  Beautiful art to view and friendly locals made for great walks throughout the day.  Especially fun at night when the families come out, plays and celebrations are enacted and street vendors serve delicious local fare.  Especially loved the gorditas with Nutella!  Highly recommend a visit to La Paz. We will absolutely return!

486108639.name: Beautiful scenery
486108639.author: a TripAdvisor user
486108639.reviewBody: We only had a couple of hours in La Paz.  This is not your typical touristy town with huge resorts. It\'s smaller with boutique type hotels in town. The area along the ocean is beautiful, with tour boats, statues, and other pieces of art. Might want to have paceo for shopping here. Not many souvenir stores from what we saw.

485073959.name: Great place for a walk or bike ride
485073959.author: a TripAdvisor user
485073959.reviewBody: The Malecon is filled with impressive art.  It was the destination for Ernest Hemmingway who wrote "The Pearl" and "Old Man and the Sea" that were inspired by La Paz.

484773145.name: Take a walk
484773145.author: a TripAdvisor user
484773145.reviewBody: After having a big meal, it\'s a great place to walk off those calories.\nMany Mexican families walk at 7pm.  It starts cooling down.  Only the gringo\'s walk in the heat of the day.

481959553.name: Center of activity along beautiful waterfront
481959553.author: a TripAdvisor user
481959553.reviewBody: Great place to stroll morning, afternoon or evening to take in sights along the waterfront. Plenty to see and do-- restaurants, shops, music, water activity, etc.  Nice place to watch beautiful sunsets too!

480686920.name: Where you hang out in La Paz
480686920.author: a TripAdvisor user
480686920.reviewBody: All you need in shops, beach, restaurants, seaview and beautiful sculptures. Will get quite lively as night falls. For hairdressers, local shops and manicure, go a street or two back.

480367476.name: Waterfront Walk
480367476.author: a TripAdvisor user
480367476.reviewBody: Noisy, touristy but very pleasant.  The walk along the coast. Is scattered with art, playgrounds, restaurants and bars.  More Mexican tourists than Americans.  We felt very safe with the federales on patrol.

479586992.name: Scenic Malecon
479586992.author: a TripAdvisor user
479586992.reviewBody: The Malecon is used by everyone.  It has many restaurants, bars, ice cream parlors and gift stores along it.  Stop for a drink and someone you have met before will stop and say hi.  Very friendly place.

479483812.name: Marvelous Malecon
479483812.author: a TripAdvisor user
479483812.reviewBody: This malecon goes on forever overlooking the turquoise waters of the Sea of Cortez.   Very clean and lovely sculptures along the way.

479326548.name: Well kept, nice place for a walk
479326548.author: a TripAdvisor user
479326548.reviewBody: A must if you are in La Paz, livelier at night, safe place for a walk or ride, as you can rent bicycles for next to nothing.

478830934.name: A great place for a morning walk
478830934.author: a TripAdvisor user
478830934.reviewBody: The malecon in La Paz is several kilometers long, stretching along the bay of La Paz.  It is always bustling with tourists and locals.  You can walk, rent bikes or just sit on a bench and watch the spectacular sunsets.

478300092.name: Fun Place To Walk Around
478300092.author: a TripAdvisor user
478300092.reviewBody: Beautiful views and a great place to walk around.  Also some decent restaurants in the area.  The water is beautiful here as well.

478243639.name: Lot\'s of Restaurants and Bars
478243639.author: a TripAdvisor user
478243639.reviewBody: Lots of stores, restaurants, and bars.  We didn\'t eat at any of the restaurants because they seemed a little touristy, but the people watching was great.  I would recommend getting some ice cream from one of the shops, finding a bench across the street, and enjoying the people watching.

477743280.name: Waterfront walk
477743280.author: a TripAdvisor user
477743280.reviewBody: The Malecon is a waterfront walk next to the Bay.  Best done after dinner downtown.  You will find all kinds of people out enjoying a leasurly stride.   Well over a mile long in the downtown area.  A must if you visit.

475656326.name: Nice
475656326.author: a TripAdvisor user
475656326.reviewBody: Just drove through here, but it had a beautiful beach, and lots of restaurants and shops.  Similar to the Malecin in Puerto Vallarta, with lots of statues and art work along the way.

475140473.name: Beautiful walk along the beach
475140473.author: a TripAdvisor user
475140473.reviewBody: La Paz has a long Malecon which is exceptional for walking along the beach and takes you all the way through town. Many restaurants and activities along the way. Very friendly community and seemed very safe.

475027829.name: Nice boardwalk and family friendly
475027829.author: a TripAdvisor user
475027829.reviewBody: Take a stroll down this boardwalk day and night and enjoy the view. While your down there, stop at one of the many restaurants and bars along the way and be sure to stop at La Fuente for some good ice cream.

474802127.name: Wonderful people viewing
474802127.author: a TripAdvisor user
474802127.reviewBody: This 5 mile beach front walkway is the perfect way to people watch in La Paz. Go in the early morning when La Paz residents are out jogging, walking their dogs or biking. The evening scene is also very active with families taking a stroll, lovers walking hand in hand and teenagers skating by. Friday and Saturday nights are especially festive. Get out and enjoy La Paz on foot. Take your phone - there are plenty of fun signs and statues to photograph.

474420790.name: La Paz
474420790.author: a TripAdvisor user
474420790.reviewBody: Beautiful resort. Lovely walks along the Malecon. If you get the chance to visit Baha California Sur take it. Amazing place.

473238434.name: Nice walk along the water with vendors and shops
473238434.author: a TripAdvisor user
473238434.reviewBody: The tide goes in and out and the water is actually a bay, so not really ocean front. It\'s quite lovely and there are a few vendors along the way. Lots of shops and restaurants along the other side of the street. Easy to walk and take in the views and breeze. Can be romantic in the evening.

472191064.name: Beautiful!
472191064.author: a TripAdvisor user
472191064.reviewBody: A really beautiful walk along the LaPaz waterfront.  Beautiful artwork and lots of great eateries.  Take the time to take pictures of the many sea life inspired statues.

471610968.name: Great Sea Front
471610968.author: a TripAdvisor user
471610968.reviewBody: I found this an extremely interesting walk, on one side the beach, on the other shops. They have various statues along the way on the beach side, mostly all about the sea.  They even have a giant clam shell with a glistening pearl in it! The bins were quite cute as they were all in the shape of sea lions or seals etc which also helped to brighten the place.  You have access to a lovely beach which has a few raffia umbrellas. Would definitely recommend you walk along it but make sure you have sun protection on and a hat! Can be extremely hot.

471218449.name: La paz town
471218449.author: a TripAdvisor user
471218449.reviewBody: La Paz in town is a fun time well spent...Try Mind to eat ...Off main draw...Good food...Pleasant people...Walk to the harbor to greet COUSTEAU statue...Who said sea Cortez is ... World aquarium...\nLove La Paz...Quiet beach harbor town...thanks

470845989.name: Nice place to stroll
470845989.author: a TripAdvisor user
470845989.reviewBody: My father and I stayed several days in La Paz and we parked the rental car and took a walk along the Malecon.  It is very nice and clean.  There are some piers and the water is clear so you can see some fish.  There are some beaches along the way with very calm water.   Restaurants are all over the place as are shops and hotels.   It was a nice place to spend some time just walking.

470722142.name: A nice, long Malecon
470722142.author: a TripAdvisor user
470722142.reviewBody: You can get a good walk in and see a lot of the town and a lot of the Sea of Cortez. Very safe. Lots of shops and places to eat across the street and you can stop and poke around at any time

470364050.name: Beautiful during day, exciting at night.
470364050.author: a TripAdvisor user
470364050.reviewBody: It\'s really nice to see that this area is family oriented. Many family dining spots right on the strip but also activities. You can walk along the docks and see many of the beuaitiful standing statues they have for visitors to see and take pictures with. There is also a playground to stop at right on the beach. The water is beautiful there are tons of places you can just sit with a margarita right across from the water. Also at night the strip is poppin. Many bars and nightclubs that are super fun to hang out at.

468644832.name: The Place to Be Seen
468644832.author: a TripAdvisor user
468644832.reviewBody: This is the main activity area in La Paz. All the restaurants and bars go on for miles. Poeple come down to hang out with their kids and families and work out. They run, bike, you name it.

468338546.name: Nice views of the bay
468338546.author: a TripAdvisor user
468338546.reviewBody: This long, approximately 5 km, boardwalk is a wonderful for for walking along downtown La Paz. It is very wide, with frequent and interesting artwork along its course.  Also a great place to enjoy sunsets.

467916901.name: Don\'t bother
467916901.author: a TripAdvisor user
467916901.reviewBody: First, a disclaimer:  Some people like this kind of place, I know, and the view of the water is very nice.  That said, I would recommend spending your time elsewhere.  Like most "boardwalk" type places, it is lined with very touristy restaurants, including a couple of American chains.  For good measure, there are some trashy gift shops. One good restaurant, Casa del Abuelo, I reviewed elsewhere on this site.  There are some good ice cream shops, too.  Unless you have a particular purpose for coming here, I would avoid it.

467813363.name: Where La Paz Meets the Water
467813363.author: a TripAdvisor user
467813363.reviewBody: The malecon is a great place to walk, people watch and enjoy views of the bay. Residents walk, in-line skate, and jog along this walkway. Boats are moored close by and art is featured at various points along the stretch of malecon. The occasional festival will fill Avenida Obregon next to the malecon. If you are a tourist you will likely be located near it and will want to visit as this is a major attraction of this fine city.

467667018.name: Yes this is where you Stroll
467667018.author: a TripAdvisor user
467667018.reviewBody: The waterfront drive and beach is very walkable and reminds one of many such beach fronts along urban centers. Two cautions. It is a long walk as La Paz is not a small town, and remember where you parked if you did find parking!

467420355.name: Great safe place to relax or exercise
467420355.author: a TripAdvisor user
467420355.reviewBody: Plenty of space to run, walk or sit and relax wile checking out the shops and resaurants across the street.

467069171.name: Malecon
467069171.author: a TripAdvisor user
467069171.reviewBody: Loved the bronze sculptures as we strolled Valentines evening.\nA beautiful place to catch the sunset.

466648094.name: A great and beautiful walk!
466648094.author: a TripAdvisor user
466648094.reviewBody: Go any time of day....morning, afternoon or evening. The malecon walk is a treat. The view is lovely. Lots of places to sit and watch families, couples,etc. Lots of places to get snacks or a meal.

466575105.name: Very Nice
466575105.author: a TripAdvisor user
466575105.reviewBody: We really enjoyed the Malecon at La Paz! Took the locals bus up from Cabo as we were getting tired of the resort and wanted a truer Mexican experience. Everyone was very nice, even though our Spanish was horrible to non-existant!

466106220.name: A walking distance from our Hotel
466106220.author: a TripAdvisor user
466106220.reviewBody: Great place for an early morning walk or rent a bike and travel up to 7 miles on bike lane and preview great sculptures on the beach wall. across the street, small cafe\'s and restaurants will satisfy your thirst and appetite.

466049950.name: Nice place to walk without being hustled
466049950.author: a TripAdvisor user
466049950.reviewBody: There are much better restaurants in La Paz than along the Malecon, but it\'s a great place for a stroll along the beach.  It\'s rare in a Mexican tourist area to be able to walk without hustlers bothering you trying to sell time-shares or junky souvenirs.

465945336.name: Very Enjoyable
465945336.author: a TripAdvisor user
465945336.reviewBody: Lots of restaurants and shops. Great place to be for the sunset. Lots to see. Great places to take photos.

465697329.name: Take a stroll
465697329.author: a TripAdvisor user
465697329.reviewBody: The male on in La Paz is just beautiful. So many shops, so much to see, so many statues. The sunsets are just amazing and there is so much activity on the water. A great place to while away the hours.

465135057.name: Beautiful smalll town vibe.
465135057.author: a TripAdvisor user
465135057.reviewBody: Beautiful drive on malecon. Great for bicycling and walking. La Paz is a beautiful small city where you can find the real pace of the laid back mexican life style.

464855686.name: Super fun during Carnival!
464855686.author: a TripAdvisor user
464855686.reviewBody: Shouldn\'t be missed if you have the opportunity.  A great Mexican experience without the Cabo tourist schtick.

464163675.name: beautiful walk
464163675.author: a TripAdvisor user
464163675.reviewBody: any time of day this is a great place to walk, people watch and enjoy the breeze off the water.  So many shops and restaurants for food, drinks or ice cream

464139854.name: Beautiful views!
464139854.author: a TripAdvisor user
464139854.reviewBody: Must do in La Paz is a walk along the malec\u00f3n. Lovely breeze and great places to stop along the way.

463936898.name: The town\'s must-go attraction.
463936898.author: a TripAdvisor user
463936898.reviewBody: You never were in La Paz if you didn walked down the malecon or at least got into a car to drive from start to end multiple times drinking a beer while enjoying the views of your sorroundings. Period.

463923760.name: great walj
463923760.author: a TripAdvisor user
463923760.reviewBody: And a good way to find your way around.  We just walked the male on until we got to the squid sculpture and turned up

463887233.name: Long Malecon
463887233.author: a TripAdvisor user
463887233.reviewBody: Lots of beautiful sculptures to see and has a section for a bike lane. This walk is long and has lots of places to get a drink and take a seat at a pier or bench. The carnival was here when I visited so a bit messy but they did try to get it cleaned daily. Nice safe vibe with mostly locals and a few gringos mixed. The local here are the most friendly so far I\'ve found but really there is not a ton of English being spoken here and bartering is not really done here that I have found but prices are very good.

463301984.name: Errrr what is this????
463301984.author: a TripAdvisor user
463301984.reviewBody: Hilariously this is one of the very top things "to do" in La Paz. Sorry, just don\'t get it. It\'s a long walk along the marina next to the road with lots of very odd statues. The other top things "to do in La Paz" involve leaving La Paz either by boat or car up the road to one of the actual beaches. \nWe had a very pleasant time with this stroll and took some fun pictures but that\'s it. Allow an hour or so for this while you decide what to have for lunch and book a boat trip to while you\'re there!

462825873.name: Love It but it is polluted.
462825873.author: a TripAdvisor user
462825873.reviewBody:
Love the malecon and the views of sunset and sunrise, but as the road runs right along it and it's not that wide you are constantly breathing in petrol fumes.

You can walk a little further out on various piers and jetties.

I still love it.

462672094.name: La Paz Visit
462672094.author: a TripAdvisor user
462672094.reviewBody: Lots of great restaurants; clean streets, friendly people.  Beautiful view.  Nice walking area.  No obnoxious salespeople.

460747472.name: Excellent place to relax
460747472.author: a TripAdvisor user
460747472.reviewBody: This is in central La Paz and along the water. Across the streets are places to shop, eat, or just relax with a beer or cocktail. It is a long street of walkway, but it is kept clean and easy to manage in an afternoon. You can sit and read or think along the way as well. \n

460741626.name: Malecon with Mermaids
460741626.author: a TripAdvisor user
460741626.reviewBody: La Paz, Baja, Mexico isn\'t the hottest destination for American tourists, but if you want a working city on a crystal clear Sea of Cortez filled with whales and dolphins, and some of the best seafood in Baja,  you won\'t mind the general disrepair of the sidewalks.  Mermaid sculptures on the Malecon make up for the rough spots.\n\nAs a woman traveling alone, I experienced friendliness, generosity, and safe walking day and night. Not to mention The Whale Museum on the 3.5 mile Malecon, which is spectacular.  I happily stayed at Hotel One La Paz for $44 a night, with a lavish free breakfast, roof pool, and seven blocks from the Malecon, but there are also many resort hotels.  A hurricane blew through in August, but that only made the trip more memorable.

460738935.name: The reason to visit La Paz
460738935.author: a TripAdvisor user
460738935.reviewBody: This is the heart of La Paz, the waterfront.  People are always there, riding bikes, walking, running, enjoying being by the sea.  There are statues along the way, and restaurants along the other side of the road.  In the evening, families congregate.  Festivals are held here.  We walked every day for a week.  The pelicans and other seabirds are also entertainment.

459705172.name: Endless walking, sunbathing and swimming
459705172.author: a TripAdvisor user
459705172.reviewBody: The Malecon is together with everyday\'s  sunshine for us  the main reason to visit La Paz, capital of Baja California, Mexico: it is about 6 kilometers long.

459033458.name: Savor the atmosphere
459033458.author: a TripAdvisor user
459033458.reviewBody: Families, couples, teens, grandparents, locals and tourists - everybody comes to the Malec\u00f3n to stroll, ride bikes, have an ice cream or a meal, watch the sunset and sailboats, check out the larger than life sculptures, or just sit on a bench and people watch. No pressure, no rushing, relax and enjoy. It\'s the big friendly heart of La Paz. And great for seeing shore birds when the tide is coming in.

458592972.name: scenic
458592972.author: a TripAdvisor user
458592972.reviewBody: nice, scenic drive of the waterfront in La Paz; take a stroll and don\'t miss the ice cream shop with the tree in front, painted white with polka dots......Yum!

458555825.name: Best sunsets in town!!
458555825.author: a TripAdvisor user
458555825.reviewBody: Great place to take a long or short walk, run, swim or sit on a bench and enjoy the view!! Stop for a beer at one of the restaurants facing the water or have a cold scoop of yummie ice cream!!!

457777027.name: Lovely romantic walk in the night
457777027.author: a TripAdvisor user
457777027.reviewBody: Nice place to walk in the evening or on days when it is not that warm. The view is nice but not spectacular . Eat an ice cream and sit or walk and enjoy your holiday .

457133323.name: Don\'t miss if you are staying in La Paz
457133323.author: a TripAdvisor user
457133323.reviewBody: Lovely ocean walk through town with ice cream, restaurants, bars, shopping and people watching.   Lots of photo opportunities and statues.   La Paz was very clean and felt safe walking around.

456589732.name: A Beautiful Walk!
456589732.author: a TripAdvisor user
456589732.reviewBody: We were only in La Paz for a day, but one of the highlights of the old town was the waterfront. No stopping, nice sculptures along the way, and lots of places to stop for ice cream or beer directly across the street.  Great sea views too.

456492331.name: very nice sunsets
456492331.author: a TripAdvisor user
456492331.reviewBody: in the morning i would go for a run and in the evenings i would walk along, watch the sunset and then grab a beer.

456210018.name: Love the Malecon!
456210018.author: a TripAdvisor user
456210018.reviewBody: What an amazing stretch of waterfront! I could walk and people watch for hours and not get bored. It\'s a slice of La Paz life.

456203626.name: A lot has changed in 10 years!
456203626.author: a TripAdvisor user
456203626.reviewBody: Been quite a while since I\'ve been in La Paz - the malecon is huge compared to what it used to be, and the change is for the better.  Lots of great restaurants and bars, but family friendly and not a lot of people trying to sell trinkets or tours (unlike other malecons I\'ve strolled down).  Plus it is super long!  Will be spending plenty of time on it over the next month.

456049876.name: Not that impressed
456049876.author: a TripAdvisor user
456049876.reviewBody: So we drove from Cabo San Lucas and it was quite the drive. We were just not that impressed with La Paz in general. I\'m not sure what I was expecting but it wasn\'t a big city with a walking path on the edge that is up against the sea. I guess I thought it was going to be more like Todo Santos but with the water closer by. It was not. If you are making a decision between the 2 places pick Todos Santos for sure, it is a quaint little town with little shops and great restaurants. Very artsy.

455529667.name: Had a great time favorite city in BCS.
455529667.author: a TripAdvisor user
455529667.reviewBody: Walked around for hours. great shops good food. Nice people. seemed really safe. will come back again.

455405186.name: Great walking area
455405186.author: a TripAdvisor user
