455405186.reviewBody: As a place to spend some time walking around this can\'t be beat. We spent most of a half day walking the Malecon enjoying the sights & flavor of this part of the Baja. If you get tired just cross over for a clod drink at the many restaurants & bars. Pleasant & safe.

454866235.name: A wonderful place to stroll
454866235.author: a TripAdvisor user
454866235.reviewBody: There are beautiful statues, views, and lots of people biking, walkinh, and roller skating here.  We loved it.  La Paz is a great city to visit, don\'t miss it!!

454780732.name: A  lovely sunset stroll
454780732.author: a TripAdvisor user
454780732.reviewBody: Clearly the. Pulse of La Paz.  A wonderful stroll, or run, or skate, or cycle, or public crawl with scenery, art, people watching, what more could you want?

454363833.name: Sun, Sand, and Seaside Promenade
454363833.author: a TripAdvisor user
454363833.reviewBody: The Malecon is the thing that, for me, will symbolize our vacation in La Paz. It\'s an amazingly long seaside path; we didn\'t walk more than a small part of it but it still stands out in my memory. A broad expanse of blue water on one side, with boats of all sizes out on the horizon; restaurants and shops on the other side of the street filled with people out and about, grabbing a meal or some ice cream or just having a beer. We were glad to have stayed at Hotel Catedral, a nice new hotel that placed us within walking distance of this La Paz landmark.

454146393.name: Go mingle with the locals
454146393.author: a TripAdvisor user
454146393.reviewBody: Take your camera is you stroll this famous bayside walk in La Paz.  There are many photo opportunities of amazing and whimsical statures.  The kids ride bikes and skates but you\'ll be safe even though they look like they are out of control.

453651231.name: Great place to meet the locals and for strolling or evening jogging
453651231.author: a TripAdvisor user
453651231.reviewBody: The Malecon is well-kept and lit with street lights and lights strung around the palm trees. Clean and beautiful, with lots of locals jogging during the evening or using the outdoor gym on the north end. It runs across the street from shops and restaurants, so you can stroll and chose where you want to go!

453430497.name: Watch your step
453430497.author: a TripAdvisor user
453430497.reviewBody: The Malecon runs several kilometers along the Sea of Cortez from the center of the touristy area of town to a beach that has recently received national accolades for it\'s pristine water. There is also a water park near that beach. Along the way, one will find beautiful sculptures, several benches on which to sit and take in the views, and even an area for runners to stop to stretch. There is a small children\'s play area next to an establishment that serves fruit and fruit drinks. We were there early January and the Christmas lights were still up and wrapped around the palm trees...a festive sight in the warm evenings. I would have given it a five but for a couple reasons. The first being a piece of rebar that caused my friend to trip, break her arm, and separate her shoulder...a bit of an inconvenience. It was a small piece of rebar (1"-2") that was sticking up but which had been painted over. Why not just cut it off at the ground? My friend is well aware of the tripping hazards around LaPaz, of which there are many, but this was unexpected because of it\'s placement near one of the many ramps that allow for transition between grades. The other is the graffiti that has been sprayed along the lesser traveled section that connects the tourist area of LaPaz to the water park. That part of the Malecon winds through sort of an industrial area and past some hotels before it merges again with the water. Overall the Malecon really is a nice place to be any time of day...just watch your step.

452905707.name: Go every morning and every evening if you can.
452905707.author: a TripAdvisor user
452905707.reviewBody: What a joy to walk along this long malecon. Many people use it as their morning exercise and others use it as their evening stroll. Try both!

452892014.name: Excellent promenade
452892014.author: a TripAdvisor user
452892014.reviewBody: The Malecon in La Paz is about 4 km long, is always full of people walking, exercising, chatting. \nIn the morning we like to walk all the way to the outskirts of town where there is a little open-air gym. On the way we watch the fishermen get ready to go out at sea and the small groups of people who, every day, are busy cleaning the little beaches, which as a result are always in perfect conditions. We see the birds (frigates. pelicans, sea gulls, herons, egrets) soar in the air and dive for fish and the water is so clear that at high tide you see schools of tiny fish swim by.\nThe Malecon is dotted with lovely sculptures, we particularly like the mermaids and the one of Jacques Custeau looking out at what he called \'The Aquarium of the world\'.

452789962.name: dirt and spoiled
452789962.author: a TripAdvisor user
452789962.reviewBody: Probably was great back in the days but now is dirt, spoiled and ruined with nothing special to attract

452622789.name: Great place to run
452622789.author: a TripAdvisor user
452622789.reviewBody: Wonderful, clean place to run or walk each day.  Enjoyed the family atmosphere and the use by the local population

452500823.name: Interesting walk along the water front
452500823.author: a TripAdvisor user
452500823.reviewBody: The La Paz malecon is a great place to take a stroll, watch a sunset, have dinner and enjoy warm weather and friendly people. A relaxed, laid back setting. No bothersome street vendors like in Cabo San Lucas or other seaside spring break towns. Plenty of good restaurants across the street. Very pleasant experience.

450799552.name: Nice for a night walk
450799552.author: a TripAdvisor user
450799552.reviewBody: It\u00b4s a nice attraction and it\u00b4s perfect for a couple night walk, enjoying the warm weather. I don\u00b4t really think you can enjoy it during the day because La Paz is a very hot place. Don\u00b4t forget the sun blocker!

449939584.name: Beautiful place to walk around with beautiful viewss near historic sites and local souvernirs
449939584.author: a TripAdvisor user
449939584.reviewBody: It was nice weather to sit in one of he benches and look out towards the Sea of Cortez, then stop for a coffee in a nearby local coffee shop

449756468.name: Long way coastline!
449756468.author: a TripAdvisor user
449756468.reviewBody: La Paz Malecon is veeeery long and it perfectly suits everyone who can not live without long distance evening stroll, jogging, bicycling, skateboarding, longboarding, roller-skating! It has a perfect view as you can see lots of sailing boats, hobby cats, simple boats, yachts etc! Many of them are available for rental! Here you will always find various restaurants and cafes, candy shops, souvenires. There is also a bus station where you can buy tickets to the nearby cities e.g.Todos Santos, Los Cabos, Balandra or Tecolote Beaches! Besides that there is a kids playground just on the sandy beach! Daily you can see many people running, exersising, doing sports! Additionally you can find good shops with kayaks, supboards, all snorkling and fishing gears and belongings, pumps, sea shoes etc! You can always find many excursion spots, the most popular are snorkling with whale sharks and swimming with the sea lions!:)\nEnjoy!:)))

449442888.name: So clean & lovely
449442888.author: a TripAdvisor user
449442888.reviewBody: You should experience this before it gets overrun by tours  and trust me just like other Mexican towns get discovered and people move there and soon becomes crowded. Now it enjoyable and in chanting. If you like to people watch, this is the place and little people having fun. There are cany stands, ice cream shops, restaurants, bars and dress sops along the way. It is the happening place at night.

449285192.name: Nice walk
449285192.author: a TripAdvisor user
449285192.reviewBody: we spend Christmas in La Paz and enjoyed walking the malecon.  There are some beautiful statues along the walk and they had it all decked out for the holidays.

449170161.name: Great walk
449170161.author: a TripAdvisor user
449170161.reviewBody: We walked along the beach on the malecon a number of times over our 5 day stay in LaPaz. There are great restaurants and sites to see both day and night.

448917399.name: Strolling and enjoying the sites and sounds of La Paz
448917399.author: a TripAdvisor user
448917399.reviewBody: Clean with tons of families, restaurants, bars sitting on the Lagoon.  Enjoyed ice cream while looking for boat operators to take us out to snorkel with the Whale Sharks.\n\n

448715871.name: Fun Street
448715871.author: a TripAdvisor user
448715871.reviewBody: Great place to hang out for beach, food and drink.  Runs the length of town along the beach.  Even good for families.

448605502.name: Nights on the Malecon
448605502.author: a TripAdvisor user
448605502.reviewBody: In the sweltering heat of a July days the Malecon is best at night. The entire town seems to be enjoying the cooler air and lively sounds after sunset. The ocean laps up onto the beach while families, couple and solo travelers stroll along.

448171043.name: Fun walk
448171043.author: a TripAdvisor user
448171043.reviewBody: Have to walk the Malecon in La Paz-- fun sculptures, lots of people walking and exercising, beautiful views of the ocean!

448168700.name: Fantastic bay with great views!
448168700.author: a TripAdvisor user
448168700.reviewBody: This is too good to be true.  This tidal bay has a boardwalk that is well kept.  We didnt expect such beauty from La Paz but were pleasantly surprised with a gorgeous water way.  Unlike other cities in Mexico, i was never harassed by vendors on the waterfront here.  Another plus!

448060733.name: Wonderful walk
448060733.author: a TripAdvisor user
448060733.reviewBody: The views and sculptures are wonderful. There are no vendors hawking their wares to harass you so can enjoy. At every block there\'s a new monumental sculpture. Across the street are all the stores, restaurants, and bars you could imagine. It\'s really long. It\'s suitable for strollers, joggers, walkers.

447238470.name: Nice Walk
447238470.author: a TripAdvisor user
447238470.reviewBody: Nice place to walk along the shoreline. Good place to see the sunset, listen to music. Gift shops, street art, many restaurants. Almost every restaurant that we ate at while in La Paz was on the Malecon.

446785327.name: The Malecon is the place to be!
446785327.author: a TripAdvisor user
446785327.reviewBody: We stayed at the Perla Hotel right on the Malecon. Nice basic hotel, cheap rooms and the best location! Right in the center of everything. Great place to sit and people watch and check out the view. The Malecon is the heart of La Paz. Christmas Day everyone was out with their families, the kids with their new bikes, roller blades and toys! The Malecon is very clean and well kept.

445475362.name: Wonderful place to spend the day
445475362.author: a TripAdvisor user
445475362.reviewBody: For the last month, I havbe had friends drop me off at the Walmart so I could walk downtown.  Lots of photo ops and community art installations...not really thrilled about the the new La Paz sign but I mey so many wonderfulpeople at the busineses along the Malecon. Great spot to people watch!!

445459212.name: Best sidewalk
445459212.author: a TripAdvisor user
445459212.reviewBody: Walking the malecon is wonderful, both day and night. Perfectly safe. Many people, couples, families groups all enjoy strolling the malecon. Restaurants and bars at night. Best place to be for sunsets. It is the longest Malecon in Mexico

445452221.name: Lots of cool stuff to see
445452221.author: a TripAdvisor user
445452221.reviewBody: Perfect for biking or a stoll.  Lots of great sculptures/artwork.  Very scenic.  Always something going on.

444686133.name: Great place to walk and relax
444686133.author: a TripAdvisor user
444686133.reviewBody: Love walking on the Malecon - both day and night.  Always felt very safe and the locals were very friendly and helpful.

444553266.name: Stunning
444553266.author: a TripAdvisor user
444553266.reviewBody: What\'s not to love about the Malecon in La Paz? Beaches, vistas, statues, happy people enjoying life. Great restaurants and night life. Boat tours to Isla Espiritu Santo. Loved this place so much.

444077875.name: Lovely Day Trip
444077875.author: a TripAdvisor user
444077875.reviewBody: Enjoyed this not so crowded waterfront strip for our day trip to La Paz. Not so over run with those trying to sell their wares. Got a pretty good deal down by Burger King (a tip we received to look for Captain Mike) to swim with the whale sharks.

443348136.name: Great food and shopping along a gorgeous waterway!
443348136.author: a TripAdvisor user
443348136.reviewBody: Wonderful food from around the world all available on one gorgeous street meandering along the stunning Sea of Cortez. Fresh seafood, delicious al pastor pizza and much much more. Dont forget to stop in during the evening where they often have live music and other fun things right on the water!

442252417.name: Convenient place to walk
442252417.author: a TripAdvisor user
442252417.reviewBody: Tiled and/or paved walkway along the water, across the street from restaurants, shops, and hotels.  Some points of interest along the way.  The only issue is La Paz doesn\'t seem to have an ordinance or rule to clean up after your dog.  Lots of families walk along here, people bicycle along here, great place to take pictures, you can walk from one end of the malecon to the other.

442068279.name: Better than Puerto Valerta\'s because,.....
442068279.author: a TripAdvisor user
442068279.reviewBody: No one hassled us to invest in a time share, or to buy cheap jewelry, or to enter their restaurant for "2-for-1 drinks"\nA far more civilized experience !!

441563899.name: Atho very pretty it has a bit to go
441563899.author: a TripAdvisor user
441563899.reviewBody: I enjoy a good malecon as much as the next person and I try to seek them out. The La Paz malecon is on its way to becoming something nice. The more local sculptures get involved, the more enjoyable it will be. I was struck by how close the piers for large ships were to shore, making the walk feel a bit like a patrolling the harbor as opposed to a long strolling art or sunset walk. \n\nI look forward to visiting again to see some more malecon art, altho iIenjoyed the aquatic themed trash and recycling bins.

440652806.name: Lots of activity, shopping and food.
440652806.author: a TripAdvisor user
440652806.reviewBody: Take the time to walk the Malecon especially at sunset.  This is when the activity starts up and the beer tastes especially good.

439231896.name: Most do
439231896.author: a TripAdvisor user
439231896.reviewBody: Is where everything happens, you have everything from restaurants, bars, views, etc. \n\nYou can just walk around and have a great time, there is also a line for bikes so you can have a great way to see the city.

438477186.name: Unique Statues
438477186.author: a TripAdvisor user
438477186.reviewBody: Stroll along the Malecon and photograph the statues.  Having said that, I expected it to be more beautiful than it was

437780968.name: Pleasant walk
437780968.author: a TripAdvisor user
437780968.reviewBody: The malecon is a lovely stroll with beach on one side and roadway on another. This gives an open view to the sea where one is able to sit for a while on the many benches along the way. \nThere are also many small plazas and boardwalks along the way. It\'s a pleasant way to watch the sunset or get away from the shopping side of the street.

437656691.name: Great place to people watch
437656691.author: a TripAdvisor user
437656691.reviewBody: Grab the kids and take a walk and enjoy an ice cream or twelve at la fuente we had a great time walking w the kids and grandparents too

437291845.name: A walk in La Paz
437291845.author: a TripAdvisor user
437291845.reviewBody: Enjoy the beautiful Malecon, with its beautiful sculptures, you can exercise, take a long walk or just have an ice cream!\nAnd if you catch the sun set at the right time, you will never forget the beauty of the Vermejo Sky of La Paz.\nGive your self the gift of enjoying true beutiful nature and pleasent walk in the city.

437270054.name: A Fun Walk Next to the Water
437270054.author: a TripAdvisor user
437270054.reviewBody: The Malecon is perfect for anyone who enjoys walking and seeing the sites. It goes along the whole waterfront for a good 5 miles.

436846142.name: A Must Do
436846142.author: a TripAdvisor user
436846142.reviewBody: The best Malecon I have found in all of  Mexico hands down. It has to be at lest one mile long or longer.

436484204.name: Great people watching!
436484204.author: a TripAdvisor user
436484204.reviewBody: La Paz is all about family and the place to go in the evening is the malecon.  You will see toddlers on big wheels, teenagers on roller blades and couples old and young strolling along the malecon.

435622996.name: Amazing sunset stroll.
435622996.author: a TripAdvisor user
435622996.reviewBody: During our trip to La Paz we spent each evening enjoying a beautiful stroll along the Malecon. So many of the city residents come out in the evening to enjoy the breeze and the sights that you feel as if you are part of the city and not a tourist. A great way to enjoy the end of a day.

434923909.name: Great walk, be sure to venture a few blocks in too
434923909.author: a TripAdvisor user
434923909.reviewBody: Great walk, be sure to venture a few blocks in too.  The most turesty stuff is always on the beach, not a bad thing, but some of the more native and upscale places are just a bock in from the beach

434026512.name: Independence Day
434026512.author: a TripAdvisor user
434026512.reviewBody: Was there during independence Day.  I saw a couple kids dancing. They can tear it up.  It\'s a nice walk from restaurants to hotels, nice bars to stop and drink along the way. I have a video but can\'t upload.

432765144.name: Delightful walk in the sun
432765144.author: a TripAdvisor user
432765144.reviewBody: Seaside walk with marinas and beaches. Statues spaced periodically. Stores and restaurants across the main drive. Not a lot of shade. Probably best to stroll early morning or late PM.

432409651.name: A relaxed view
432409651.author: a TripAdvisor user
432409651.reviewBody:
La Paz has a relaxed view from the malecon. You can ride a bicycle or use a roller.

You con go to the market and appreciate "artesanias" and maybe bought some mexican curious. 

I recommend to visited the 12-40 coffee shop, it has an excelente service and a high quality coffee.

431660344.name: Pleasant
431660344.author: a TripAdvisor user
431660344.reviewBody: A nice place to walk , look at the statues and think about the world or just daydream. Plenty of places to eat on the other side of the street.

431302342.name: Beautiful walk
431302342.author: a TripAdvisor user
431302342.reviewBody: Very pretty and pleasant walk along the water front.  Beautiful sculptures with ocean themes and white sandy beach.  Take the time to stop and enjoy a cup of coffee or an ice cream at one of the spots along the malecon.

429471482.name: Beautiful
429471482.author: a TripAdvisor user
429471482.reviewBody: La Paz has a long (3 miles?) malecon, with shops and restaurants across the street.  On the weekend there were festivals and live music in the main stage in the heart of the malecon.  It seems to be the hub of the families and the town.

429439854.name: cozy and safe
429439854.author: a TripAdvisor user
429439854.reviewBody: The Malecon is basically the center of town or the board walk. There are good restaurants, bars, shops  and some museums....had a great time in a safe environment

429430561.name: La Paz Malechon is a great place for families and some fresh air!
429430561.author: a TripAdvisor user
429430561.reviewBody: Great place to take a walk, ride a bike or roller blade. Lots of families at night enjoying time together and meeting friends.  Good place for an ice cream or a liquid refreshment.

426007511.name: Nice promenade
426007511.author: a TripAdvisor user
426007511.reviewBody: This promenade goes along the city. It is quite nice and has nice statutes along it, though some parts of it feel less comfortable after dark.

425099315.name: don\'t go on a weekend unless you want crowds
425099315.author: a TripAdvisor user
425099315.reviewBody: Crowded, noisy, junky stalls, right on the water. lots of restaurants and bars to stop in.Went on a Sunday it was crazy busy,,,,went on Thursday  nice and quiet.

425056761.name: Nice place to walk with vibrant storefronts
425056761.author: a TripAdvisor user
425056761.reviewBody: La Paz is all about the Malecon. This is the heart of activity in the city, and there are plenty of excellent restaurants and cafes along the strip on one side, and gorgeous beach on the other.

423838296.name: The very long Malecon La Paz Mexico
423838296.author: a TripAdvisor user
423838296.reviewBody: The Malecon is a nice place to go walk, I could see that it was very clean, every morning there would be a large group of people sweeping  it.  It has beautiful views and in the evening it\'s full with locals and tourists exercising:  running, cycling and walking. There\'s also lots of places to eat, Shop and bars just across the street.

420677123.name: Endless stroll along the beach
420677123.author: a TripAdvisor user
420677123.reviewBody: A paved walkway beachside in La Paz, the Malecon, is gorgeous. The total length is over 5k (or so I was told). It is extremely hot in mid to late September so I couldn\'t bare walking or running in the heat. An early morning or evening stroll was all I could handle. Along the way are beautiful statues of sea creatures which make for perfect foreground subjects in your flawless backdrop of the Sea of Cortez. Enjoy!

419814441.name: excellent walking area along the bay
419814441.author: a TripAdvisor user
419814441.reviewBody: The Malecon is a long promenade on the Bay of La Paz. There are thoughtfully placed benches in the shade of palm trees, and umbrella covered spots on the strands of beach where you can take a swim.  Right across the street are good shops for browsing and outdoor bars and cafes to enjoy the view.

416973178.name: Highly developed ocean front road with restaurants and walkway
416973178.author: a TripAdvisor user
416973178.reviewBody: The malecon road is highly developed and filled with restaurants and cafes. Very touristy with a walkway pavement that is maintained well.

416313369.name: Great place to walk around
416313369.author: a TripAdvisor user
416313369.reviewBody: My hubby and I strolled up and down the Malecon. This is definitly made for all to enjoy. Took lots of pics of all the artwork up and down the area.

414034354.name: Beautiful Promenade
414034354.author: a TripAdvisor user
414034354.reviewBody: Best View of La Paz\'s beautiful sunset.  \nEnjoyed early morning walks with my husband and Bichon.  Shops, restaurants, coffee houses directly across the Malecon.  One of La Paz\' s precious jems.

409842005.name: The Safe Side to Walk
409842005.author: a TripAdvisor user
409842005.reviewBody: Melecon is the beach side promenade along Paseo Alvaro Obregon. There are wide sidewalks, art work, benches, and other attractions along the way. Across the street are many restaurants, bars, shops etc. While the area right in front of the shops can be a little risky with potholes and other obstacles, and a few friendly vendors inviting you in to their establishment, the beach side offers easy walking. It doesn\'t offer much shade or drinks etc. so for that you need to go back to the other side. Interesting area, seems to be the hub of entertainment. Taxis are found on many street corners. There was even a fishing competition one day we were there.

409075267.name: You can see the best sunsets in the world
409075267.author: a TripAdvisor user
409075267.reviewBody: Is the heart of La Paz, has a lot of sculptures, shops, restaturants, children playgrounds by the beach, a lot of people jogging, on their bicycles, etc. The best moment to be there is on sunset where you can take the best pics you can imagine.

405426983.name: Neat outdoor strolling promenade
405426983.author: a TripAdvisor user
405426983.reviewBody: They had a mini carnival set up for kids the night we were there. Mainly locals - or maybe tourist from the mainland. Perfect spot to get an ice cream and walk along the waterfront and people watch.

400123057.name: Great stroll for people watching and bar bouncing
400123057.author: a TripAdvisor user
400123057.reviewBody: Walk the Malecon for people watching and bar bouncing.  Families are out late and people are very kind

399228801.name: Beautiful
399228801.author: a TripAdvisor user
399228801.reviewBody: The Malecon is a great walk in La Paz, on the water, good to watch the sunset. People watching, right in the middle of all the restaurants and sites.

398215811.name: La Paz and Isla Mujeres Malecons
398215811.author: a TripAdvisor user
398215811.reviewBody: On both the La Paz and Isla Mujers malecons, there are some incredible statues to see. Some are graceful and some even humorous. Sitting on the malecon wall while enjoying a delicious Mexican ice cream cone is a wonderful way to pass an evening. People watching there is also a fun thing to do. Someone will always stop to talk to you.

397399007.name: Friend walk
397399007.author: a TripAdvisor user
397399007.reviewBody: I walked by Wednesday with my friend from Santa Cruz. It\'s been remodeling right now it\'s not a good idea to go the because you can\'t walk freely. Wait until is finished

395320854.name: Stroll, eat, club, people-watch
395320854.author: a TripAdvisor user
395320854.reviewBody:
- The malecón is a paved waterfront sidewalk with the harbor on one side, and many restaurants and a row of competing nightclubs on the other.
- Every few blocks you'll find a large, beautiful sea-themed sculpture
- Many benches for relaxing while viewing the sea
-Many places to eat on the malecón, (though pricier than those a few blocks away, of course) 
- Beautiful beaches just an hour bus ride away
- Boats to La Isla de Espíritu Santu launch from the malecón. Talk to venders on the street in front of the wharf area. Don't pay more than 750 per person ($38). 
-EXCELLENT salsa dancing venue (a restaurant with a small dance floor) called STELLA at the far end of the malecón (opposite the row of clubs). Salsa dance class Thursday, dancing (dj) until 11pm. Fridays and Saturdays feature a good live band that plays salsa, cumbia, and some bachata and merengue. Skilled dancers. Get there early (before 9pm), as the place is small and fills up fast. 

Enjoy La Paz!

395298499.name: Very scenic
395298499.author: a TripAdvisor user
395298499.reviewBody: Nice view and several statues and monuments for picture taking, spotted a fisherman bringing in a Swordfish and everyone around started to take pictures to it. Visited on July 21 st, weather was hot to be walking around. Spotted several watering holes to cool off, you\'ll have a lot of choices, check it out !!!

395110203.name: An amazing walk
395110203.author: a TripAdvisor user
395110203.reviewBody: We walk the malecon every day with our dogs. It\'s so beautiful, peaceful and it\'s fun the watch the occasional porpoise that come in the harbor to play.

393743785.name: Great place to exercise and relax
393743785.author: a TripAdvisor user
393743785.reviewBody: I enjoyed the malcontent because I went for walks everyday and it was always excellent, particularly at sunset. I took many photos and enjoyed sipping a coconut while sitting there.

393588090.name: Enjoyable strolling
393588090.author: a TripAdvisor user
393588090.reviewBody: We enjoyed all the statues on the ocean side, and the restaurants and shops on the inland side.  Definitely spend some time walking along the whole thing--very friendly people, no pushy vendors or anyone unpleasant.  We\'ve been in places where shopkeepers are really aggressive to get you to come into their stores, but encountered none of that here.  Friendly and helpful, but not in-your-face.  The sidewalk on the ocean side is nice and wide, and completely clean, with nice views of the water the whole way.

393391942.name: Great watering hole with sports on in the bar!
393391942.author: a TripAdvisor user
393391942.reviewBody: While I fished with another outfit, Tailhunter restaurant proved to be our regular spot for drinks after a day on the water.  Friendly and engaging staff, great carne asada and a comfortable place for tourists.  Also affords magnificent views of the Bay!

392895850.name: Wonderful Sea Side stroll!
392895850.author: a TripAdvisor user
392895850.reviewBody: One our favorite things while visiting was strolling the Malecon before and after dinner. Being a visitor, we felt very safe and welcomed to this unique area.

392271014.name: The Malecon
392271014.author: a TripAdvisor user
392271014.reviewBody: What a great idea is the Malecon, we would walk it everyday for the 10 days we were there. Lots of things happening on different days, the weather was beautiful, sunsets so brilliant. Loved all the statues along the way.

392162513.name: Great place to visit, amazing sunsets
392162513.author: a TripAdvisor user
392162513.reviewBody: Malecon is the main street with ocean in La Paz, the tradition is to walk and join many people doing so every morning or during the sunset. Also is a local tradition to drive very slow with friends on nights of thursday, friday and saturday. Malecon has a big sidewalk.

388217653.name: Malecon La Paz
388217653.author: a TripAdvisor user
388217653.reviewBody: The Malecon was an easy walk from my hotel Posada Luna Sol. I encountered both tourists and local families at play. The beach is small but gentle enough for young children. I found food available and reasonably priced from the hot dog cart on the boardwalk to the cafe patio where I enjoyed a chile relleno ( surprisingly hard to find ) and watched the sunset. I felt completely safe, a woman alone, the entire outing

387783982.name: Evening Stroll.
387783982.author: a TripAdvisor user
387783982.reviewBody: The Malecon was a great place to walk after dinner.  People were friendly, you can sit and watch a La Paz sunset.  We did see Federales and police but no issue.  It is beautiful.

387094704.name: When in La Paz el Malecon you have to visit!
387094704.author: a TripAdvisor user
387094704.reviewBody: For everyone who is visiting La Paz, you have to stop in this beautiful Malecon, on one side the Marina and the other the hotels, stores and restaurants. This makes a nice walk with the family and friends. If you happen sto stay overnight check the sunset on this beautiful walk way.. very romantic and excelent to be with your loved one.

386773642.name: Love the Malecon
386773642.author: a TripAdvisor user
386773642.reviewBody: Love the Malecon, the families, the statues, the ice cream stores across the street.  I\'ve taken my granchildren many times and they always look forward to it.

386473186.name: Great evening vistas
386473186.author: a TripAdvisor user
386473186.reviewBody: A wonderful esplanade that is popular with the locals for evening strolls, jogging, riding  etc. Local events seem to take place in the evenings when the summer heat subsides.

380969780.name: A beautiful walk!
380969780.author: a TripAdvisor user
380969780.reviewBody: One of the nicest ways to enjoy the sea and to walk after a meal. There are really cool brass sculptures of sea life on the little circular plazas throughout. If you like to jog or bike it is a great place to do so. It is one of the really unique things of La Paz and the people that live there are very proud of it and they use it often.

379736622.name: Beautiful!
379736622.author: a TripAdvisor user
379736622.reviewBody: It is a lovely walk up and down the beach side of the street, with lovely and unusual sculptures, small beaches with palapas, a couple of small restaurants, and sometimes live music and other events! A great place to people watch, lots of local families, from babies in strollers to great grammas! Cross the street and there are shops with ice cream, coffee, drinks, a few NICE souvenir places and the Whale Museum. Beautiful walk any time of the day or night!

378796794.name: An amazing walk
378796794.author: a TripAdvisor user
378796794.reviewBody: The prettiest walk along the beach front,  or a great place to sit and people watch. the most incredible sun sets you will ever see

377742109.name: Nice for a walking, biking or skating.
377742109.author: a TripAdvisor user
377742109.reviewBody: La Paz is in a really nice spot of the Pacific, clear water, beautiful \tbreeze. It is not as warm as in the Caribbean or Golf, so even if it is noon it is possible to enjoy the Malecon. There are ice cream places, restaurants, stores in front of the Malecon & places to rent bikes to have more speed in the way. Check TripAdvisor before enter to a restaurant once not all of them are good.

375275127.name: Love to walk in the malecon
375275127.author: a TripAdvisor user
375275127.reviewBody:
There is always something going on in the malecon 
Nice to see families having fun there all the time .
We enjoy stopping at the bars for happy hour with mostly locals and also having delicious ice cream 
A really authentic lovely Mexican town 
Love La Paz

375226063.name: Very Enjoyable and Relaxed
375226063.author: a TripAdvisor user
375226063.reviewBody: We have now been to La Paz twice while vacationing in Cabo San Lucas. It\'s about a 100 mile drive but well worth it. As you drive closer to the beach, you suddenly see the gorgeous turquoise waters. Once you find a place to park (unless you are staying in La Paz), you can just take off exploring the walkway along the waterfront. I was very impressed with the way it\'s been decorated and the many statues along the shoreline. The beach has palapas if you want to stop and relax on the beach. The statues all have a story. There is a lovely gazebo to sit and relax. The views from anywhere along the waterfront are gorgeous. The colors of the water are beautiful starting from a light blue, green, turquoise and a darker blue. You can walk out almost 100\' before you have to start swimming. The water is warm and the sand soft and white. There are many shops and restaurants to enjoy. There are flowers and plants as you walk down the docks and many boats at the marina. We spent 3-4 hours enjoying Malexon and the city itself.

372903815.name: A fun place to walk!
372903815.author: a TripAdvisor user
372903815.reviewBody: We really enjoyed walking on the La Paz malecon - especially when there is a festival on. The energy, the joy, the fun - night time is beautiful with all the lights and the people. It is a great place to wander, enjoy the sights, meet the people... The public art is lovely and seeing all the fishboats lined up on the beach was great. I never felt pressured or pushed into buying anything, it was all very relaxed and fun.

372709426.name: Enjoyable any time of the day
372709426.author: a TripAdvisor user
372709426.reviewBody: If you either like to walk early, run on the boardwalk, take a drink, grab an ice cream, eat from a huge variety of options or attend a concert, there are plenty of options to choose from. The sightseeing is gorgeous.

372689152.name: great place to relax
372689152.author: a TripAdvisor user
372689152.reviewBody: If you\'re looking for a good beach location to relax and enjoy the sea, this is the right spot. Clean. Lots of store fronts along the coast. This is also a great place to go for a stroll (when it\'s not blazing hot).

371734467.name: Nice but....
371734467.author: a TripAdvisor user
371734467.reviewBody: The walkway can be beautiful with lovely views out to the bay, wonderful peices of artwork lining the walk and many restaurants along the way.  \nMy issue however is that it appears that the area is not being maintained.  It appeared more dirty and we saw a lot more noticeable trash from where we were here in September.  There were so many broken tiles and holes in the walkway that you had to constantly watch where you were going.    We had our very active 89 yo grandmother with us but she is blind in one eye so even though she enjoyed the sites and the walk, it made it a bit challenging to constantly have to look down and watch your step.  If you are wearing sandals or flip flops or open toe shoes be especially careful as the broken tiles will easily cut your foot. \nOther then this the area is beautiful, people are very friendly and there is a good presence of tourist police that are more then happy to answer your questions or assist with directions or suggestions of things to see and do.

370757353.name: Perfect
370757353.author: a TripAdvisor user
370757353.reviewBody: LOVED walking/jogging along the Malecon each morning, highlight of my time in La Paz.  Lots of locals enjoying the scenery, very safe, beautiful, the Ocean waters changes as you walk.  Sculptures  are lovely and add to the lure of the Sea.

370545971.name: Nice laid back board walk
370545971.author: a TripAdvisor user
370545971.reviewBody: Walked this area quite a few times in a 12 day stay in La Paz. Very laid back, good shops all around, fun night life, very safe area even at night. If you want a little less tourist area just walk 1 or 2 blocks into the city and you\'ll be there.

370429611.name: Great public area!
370429611.author: a TripAdvisor user
370429611.reviewBody: The easy strolling and the wonderful people-watching opportunities, as well as the sight of Mexican residents living their lives in this sweet old town make this one of the best Malecons I\'ve experienced.

370296172.name: Gnice place to walk
370296172.author: a TripAdvisor user
370296172.reviewBody: The malec\u00f3n is ver y nice , a great place to walk , Run , beutifull  sunsets , Also you Need to stop at la fuente for ice cream its delicias

370152247.name: Beautiful Art
370152247.author: a TripAdvisor user
370152247.reviewBody: One of the nice things about Mexico\'s Malecon\'s is that they have lots of local art along the walk, it makes for a very engaging experience.  There are many places to sit and watch the water as well as people.

370138185.name: Pleasant Walk
370138185.author: a TripAdvisor user
370138185.reviewBody: Great place to promenade, ride bikes, enjoy the sea and sites.  This lovely walk alongside the sea in La Paz is very pleasant both in the day and at night. At intervals along the walk are very engaging sculptures that will capture your imagination.  On our visit we enjoyed an outdoor concert there on the Malecon.  Along the way there are places to eat or to buy ice cream or other treat.  One day we rented bicycles at a very reasonable price.  The locals love it!  Not a place to drive, on the weekend evening we were there, the traffic crawled along at speeds slower than the pedestrians.

369147220.name: Enjoy World-Class Art Sculptures on the Malecon
369147220.author: a TripAdvisor user
369147220.reviewBody: Great walking Malecon any time of the day or night - always lively and good for people-watching. We love the bronze sculptures - favorites: The Old Man and the Sea, the Mermaid and the Dolphin and the Seashell Musicians - all from top-notch Mexican artists. La Paz has class!

368995509.name: Great for walking, biking, skateboarding
368995509.author: a TripAdvisor user
368995509.reviewBody: We were pleasantly surprised by the amount of activity at night on the malecon.  La Paz does not appear to see many tourists.  Mainly boaters and locals.  Lovely and long malecon - and very clean.

368545428.name: Nice mornings, evenings and nights
368545428.author: a TripAdvisor user
368545428.reviewBody: There\'s a very secure place to walk around. Nice restaurants, bars and friendly people all the time. And excellent place to have a morning run and also to try local food.

368297028.name: EXCELLENT WALKING WITH A BEAUTIFUL VIEW
368297028.author: a TripAdvisor user
368297028.reviewBody: You can walk or run all day long enjoying the view and the tranquility without any disturb and besides in front of many restaurants.

367756066.name: Great Evening Walk In La Paz
367756066.author: a TripAdvisor user
367756066.reviewBody: Evenings in La Paz are all about a long stroll down the Malecon. Its clean, safe, dog friendly with a number of interesting statues along the way to explore. Good people watching too, with plenty of diner options just across the street.

366190415.name: Great evening stroll
366190415.author: a TripAdvisor user
366190415.reviewBody: Great way to spend an evening in La Paz. We went on a Sunday night and it was mostly locals strolling the boardwalk. Good people watching. Lots of people of all ages. Plenty of food options across the street. If you\'re in the mood for ice cream, La Fuente is outstanding.

366128141.name: Walking Tour
366128141.author: a TripAdvisor user
366128141.reviewBody: I have walked and photographed the Malecon many times over the years we have been coming to La Paz.  The public art is the highlight for me.  From the whimsey of the "Old Man and the Sea", to the "pearl", the work of the talented sculptures is terrific.  Locals walk, run, bike or stroll this lengthy waterfront area.

366116136.name: World class
366116136.author: a TripAdvisor user
366116136.reviewBody:
Turns out Mrs. Walton from the Walmart clan donated the sculpture's along the malecon to the city of La Paz. They are some of the most beautiful, realistic and interesting I've seen in one waterfront collection. I don't say it often but thank you Mrs walmart. 
Safe day and night. Long well lit and always interesting. NO pan handlers, beggars, military presence or crappy junk selling. Just a couple of stalls selling balloons for little screamers. 

Only 2 small cafes on the waterfront walkway tiny calm beaches dot along for 2 miles.

365766810.name: Malecon
365766810.author: a TripAdvisor user
365766810.reviewBody: The Malecon itself is very nice and ocean views are great, however, we were underwhelmed at La Paz itself - not very scenic or architecturally appealing...

365746605.name: A wonderful place to while away an afternoon ....
365746605.author: a TripAdvisor user
365746605.reviewBody: Lovely small restaurants, coffee shops, views of the water.  Less expensive (food and drink) than I had expected.  People in the shops and restaurants were extremely friendly and pleasant.

365702571.name: Beautiful Location, but terrible meal
365702571.author: a TripAdvisor user
365702571.reviewBody: I loved the beach and beautiful water. People tried to be helpful most places and my husband speaks passable Spanish. Helpfulness and nice ended when we made the mistake of eating at a place along the main drag called The Jungle. It was handsdown the worst Mexican food I\'ve ever eaten either side of the border. The waiter we had was surely and didn\'t get a single thing correct regarding our order. We ordered Dos Equis and got Tecate. Not even close. We ordered verde sauce and got red. Never got chips and salsa while we were waiting for our order that came in staggered stages and was cold. Horrible service and terrible food. I can\'t even find a listing in Trip Advisor for this restaurant so I can write a more detailed account. If you go to La Paz, avoid this place whatever you do.\nThe rest of La Paz was okay if all you were doing was looking. Shopping, very, very overpriced. I tried to buy a pair of sneakers and asked to try two different pair. The women went into the back and came back after 10 minutes with a pair that was so big, both of my feet could have fit into one shoe. I kept telling them the shoes were too big and they disappeared into the back again for an even longer stay. There were about 5 women standing around the shoe store not doing anything but talking to each other and no explanation about why it was taking so long to find a pair of shoes. I left after the second pair arrived and I thought she had brought out the same pair as the first that were huge.\nGave up on shopping and just tried to enjoy the scenery.

365464457.name: Walking along the boardwalk
365464457.author: a TripAdvisor user
365464457.reviewBody: The Malecon is a fun place.  It is a long boardwalk and has lots of shops and restaurants.  It is an excellent opportunity to run, walk, bike or roller blade and join in the fun along the way!

364330297.name: La Paz, Baja California, Mexico, North America Title: Whale Shark watching at its finest -
364330297.author: a TripAdvisor user
364330297.reviewBody: We traveled up from San Jos\u00e9 del Cabo via Cabo san Lucas to La Paz - in the Baja California Mexico. What an experience swimming with those magnificent creatures - up close without any fear, theses plankton eating fish are magnificent and something deserving of a high spot on anybodies bucket list.

364178797.name: Walk the Malecon
364178797.author: a TripAdvisor user
364178797.reviewBody: Walled the entire length. It is 4 miles one way.....and full of interesting people, experiences and views.  Bring Water

363760350.name: Love this Malec\u00f3n
363760350.author: a TripAdvisor user
363760350.reviewBody: Is not as big as the Malec\u00f3n in Puerto Vallarta, Jalisco, but excellent and beautiful. It has lots of art and beautiful views, restaurants, bars, souvenir stores, etc, are available. My wife love this city, she said is quite and it has enough options to have fun.

362664215.name: Aka \'the strip\'
362664215.author: a TripAdvisor user
362664215.reviewBody: Well not officially, but it\'s just the main beach road through town. Restaurants, etc. Not sure why it\'s technically an attraction. Very few restaurants sand side. It\'s cool, but to be sure, it\'s just a road along the water with restaurants.

361666828.name: Walk in the sun
361666828.author: a TripAdvisor user
361666828.reviewBody: This boardwalk is tile n seems to be adverse to too much heat, the sights are beautiful, n the Pelicans are a novelty to watch. You will not be approached by any homeless or peddlers.

361656771.name: Good birding
361656771.author: a TripAdvisor user
361656771.reviewBody: We visited Malecon during a stop on an Un Cruise vacation, and walked the length of it while sightseeing and bird watching. There are many places to eat, shop, and book boating trips along its length. It can get very crowded at night, though, so if you don\'t like crowds visit during the day.

361346467.name: Beautiful but no swimming
361346467.author: a TripAdvisor user
361346467.reviewBody: Too bad this beautiful place is too polluted to swim at. Otherwise it is a gorgeous background for drinking coronas and eating too much.

360916667.name: Wonderful Seaside Walk
360916667.author: a TripAdvisor user
360916667.reviewBody: We looked forward to walks on the malecon, the seawall sidewalk in La Paz.   Extending along much of the waterfront, we walked from the north end near Marina Palmira to the south as far as Marina de La Paz.   Along the way there are birds to watch, picking morsels to eat.   There are several lovely statues and sculptures, numerous benches on which to rest and small park areas - one of which has some simple work-out machines.   Across the street are many restaurants, shops, some hotels and other businesses.   We will do the walk at least once every couple of days during our stay.

360478392.name: Gritty and decaying
360478392.author: a TripAdvisor user
360478392.reviewBody: The malecon looks like it was once a nice walk but the walkway is literally falling apart.  The views are ok but not spectacular - there is pretty heavy traffic right along it and the shops and surrounding area isn\'t much to look at.

359589198.name: A recreational plus for La Paz
359589198.author: a TripAdvisor user
359589198.reviewBody: This long "boardwalk" of tiles is a feature for the city. Attractive sculptures, a wide variety of restaurants and bars, tour companies, beaches, car rentals, even realtors, all along the waterfront, add to the interest and life of this part of the city. Residents and visitors, joggers, walkers, hawkers, gawkers, lovers and families, all make this\na favourite destination.

359191511.name: Friendly Atmosphere
359191511.author: a TripAdvisor user
359191511.reviewBody: The Malecon is a fun and friendly place. On Friday and Saturday nights it was very entertaining to watch local children bike, run, play, laugh, etc. with their families. It also offers great restaurants and dessert shops. I would have loved to try some mexican street food, but we did not find any.

358508523.name: Beautiful
358508523.author: a TripAdvisor user
358508523.reviewBody: So beautiful with amazing views for take a pictures and watching sunset. \nWalking the malecon is one of our nice activities in la paz.

358035152.name: Well Done La PAZ!
358035152.author: a TripAdvisor user
358035152.reviewBody: They must of had some forward thinking people on the town council when they decided to preserve their waterfront and create this lovely walk. It is now the attraction of La Paz

357998673.name: A great Stroll
357998673.author: a TripAdvisor user
357998673.reviewBody: Can always find something to do along the Malecon and the people watching is the best!  Watching the changes on the bay and eating at the restaurants is a very nice pastime.

357137234.name: Beautiful walking/ biking pathway along the bay.
357137234.author: a TripAdvisor user
357137234.reviewBody: Incredible views at every step of the long pathway.  Numerous shops and eateries.  Great to see sunrises and sunsets while walking on the Malecon.

356667823.name: Always something happening.
356667823.author: a TripAdvisor user
356667823.reviewBody: Great place to stroll, people watch, but r just hang out by the sea.  Always, it seems, some activity happening any time of year.

356541640.name: Beautiful City
356541640.author: a TripAdvisor user
356541640.reviewBody: A must visit in the Baja California Sur, the Malecon is bustling with runners, walkers, families, tourists, everyday, especially Sundays.

356193006.name: Stroll along the scenic beachfront, with public art to entertain.
356193006.author: a TripAdvisor user
356193006.reviewBody: A lovely clean walk, with lots of public art and many places to eat and drink and shop along the way.

355712679.name: Great for walking
355712679.author: a TripAdvisor user
355712679.reviewBody: Fun and active spot for walking or biking.  Very popular with locals and great for people watching.  Very long and flat.

355294736.name: Beautiful views!
355294736.author: a TripAdvisor user
355294736.reviewBody: The malecon is a beautiful place to walk.  The ocean views are awesome, from the many tiny boats to the very large ones that moor in the bay.  If you come in February and/or March you will see whales, they are spectacular.  Along the malecon (across the street) are various restaurants, bars and coffee places to stop for a bite to eat.

355010563.name: Great malecon
355010563.author: a TripAdvisor user
355010563.reviewBody: The malecon is not just a straight sidewalk along the beach.  There are rounded areas every block or so.  People use these areas to exercise and I even saw some classes being conducted in the early morning.  There are plenty of trash containers, so one can walk their dog and pick-up its waste and deposit it without having to carry it for blocks and blocks.  Lots of people walk their dogs on the malecon.  It is a very social place and I felt like part of the early morning family almost instantly.\n

354190362.name: La Paz is great
354190362.author: a TripAdvisor user
354190362.reviewBody: Early morning walks or jogging if so inclined, a nice evening walk also, needs some maintenance though, a lot of tiles missing or broken, still a beautiful view of the bay, morning or evening. I highly recommend it.

353467195.name: Great way to get to know the city
353467195.author: a TripAdvisor user
353467195.reviewBody: A really well done ocean side walkway with art and ice cream side by side. Great anytime for a stroll day or night and gives you an access point for anything you might want to do in La Paz downtown area.

353385350.name: Beautiful Scenery!
353385350.author: a TripAdvisor user
353385350.reviewBody: Lovely place to people watch and take in the culture and area. Lot\'s of opportunities to stop for a beverage and explore the seaside!

352625780.name: Walk on the Malecon
352625780.author: a TripAdvisor user
352625780.reviewBody: One if our favorite things to do early in the morning is a walk on the Malecon\nSo many people out enjoying the early morning \nCan\'t wait till next year as they are supposed to be redoing the Malecon this year to repair damage from hurricane in 2014

352600310.name: La Paz
352600310.author: a TripAdvisor user
352600310.reviewBody: Just 2 hours north of Cabo and so worth the trip. If you are a lover of nature this is place to experience it up close and personal. Espritu Santo island is an amazing place on this earth. As Jacques Cousteau said it is the "aquarium of the world".

352519176.name: I\'m sure it used to be nice
352519176.author: a TripAdvisor user
352519176.reviewBody: Expected to be impressed by walking along the Malecon but unfortunately it\'s showing its age.  The whole length is slowly falling into disrepair, a bit like the whole town of La Paz.  Lots of paving stones / tiles are broken and most of the benches are rusting and damaged.  Gave off an air of neglect.  It\'s a shame as it could be lovely.  Despite being high season a lot of the bars and restaurants were closed down or shut.  Tourists will stop coming if the area continues to be neglected.

352476165.name: Relaxing walk along the beach
352476165.author: a TripAdvisor user
352476165.reviewBody: The Malecon is a wide boardwalk along the water where people stroll.  It has several beautiful sculptures.  And you can cross the street to find delicious restaurants.

351413037.name: Nice Waterfront with Great Sculptures
351413037.author: a TripAdvisor user
351413037.reviewBody: We stayed in La Paz as a launching point for our whale watching journey. A very pleasant town. The Malecon is a beautiful waterfront "park" with beautiful views, beautiful sculptures and interesting restaurants and shops.

351214330.name: Impressive Promenade, Inspiring Sculptures, Very Pleasant
351214330.author: a TripAdvisor user
351214330.reviewBody: We had limited time to stroll along the malecon in La Paz, but we were here in the early afternoon of 17 Feb 2016 and were blessed with ideal weather. My wife and I took numerous photographs of the promenade, sculptures, and Sea of Cortez. Trees and flowers are nicely placed, and the promenade is wide and spacious. We were here as part of a day-long Esperanza\'s Tours La Paz Encounter tour. We learned about sites in La Paz that we can visit on future trips to BCS.

350799505.name: Great views
350799505.author: a TripAdvisor user
350799505.reviewBody:
If you come to La Paz you simply must
take the time to walk or jog along here
The city has done a beautiful job on
designing this. It's wide & paved nicely 
It's right on the water so you look out at the
Sea of Cortez & beautiful boats
Sunsets are beautiful

350640042.name: Nice place to walk in La Paz
350640042.author: a TripAdvisor user
350640042.reviewBody: Male con goes for 5+ms but is showing its age. Tiles are missing in some areas and you need to watch your step. Area is safe for tourists as they are many police patrolling the area. Lots of restaurants/pubs nearby and the ocean is beautiful. La Paz isn\'t your typical tourist spot so temper your expectations.

350637696.name: Go at sunset!
350637696.author: a TripAdvisor user
350637696.reviewBody: It\'s fun to walk up and down the Malecon.  The Malecon is a board walk on the water side.  It\'s very wide so lots of people can walk on it.  Very safe.  You see a lot of people running at night on it.  There are all sorts of restaurants and shops.  Just be careful what restaurants you pick because some are a lot better than others.  And some of the best ones, are not on the Malecon.  Watching the sunset though is the best thing to do here.  Absolutely beautiful.

350418770.name: beautiful boardwalk
350418770.author: a TripAdvisor user
350418770.reviewBody: La Paz is a Great safe place to visit! The Malecon is a beautiful boardwalk with many restaurants, bars and shops to see.

350255226.name: evening walk
350255226.author: a TripAdvisor user
350255226.reviewBody: 5.5km evening stroll with the locals after dinner at one of the many cafes and restaurants. \nTake your camera for the numerous statues along the route done by local artists. History and surrounds captured in metal.\nLocals \'cruise\' by in their oversized pickup trucks, swanky cars and fun vehicles.

348958645.name: Malecon walks
348958645.author: a TripAdvisor user
348958645.reviewBody: It was always pleasant to walk along the Malecon during the day or evening. Surprising clean and I always felt safe. Plenty of places to eat.

348847814.name: Carnival week
348847814.author: a TripAdvisor user
348847814.reviewBody: We arrived during Carnival week, stayed about one block off the parade route, what a great time so many people had, the parade was every night for about 4 nights straight (same parade) but still fun to watch and mis with the locals

348542013.name: La Paz malecon great experience
348542013.author: a TripAdvisor user
348542013.reviewBody: The malecon is a must to experience in the morning and in the evenings. It is beautiful with many bronze sculptures depicting the history there. Mornings are calm and scenery quiet before the city awakes and evenings are alive with music, vendors and families congregate especially on the weekends. A truly wonderful place to go and have a good time.

348476477.name: Carnival on the Malecon
348476477.author: a TripAdvisor user
348476477.reviewBody: Beautiful place to walk and lots of fun to people watch during Carnival.  Be sure to visit La Fuente for their amazing selection of sherbet and ice cream.

348282604.name: Perfect for a stroll
348282604.author: a TripAdvisor user
348282604.reviewBody: The Malecon is a perfect spot to spend your morning or day walking along the waterfront.  The locals keep the place extremely tidy and the area feels very safe.  There are several restaurants you will find along the Malecon, aswell as convience & shopping stores.  There aren\'t a lot of hawkers however on a good sunny day you will be approached by the fisherman offering you a tour out to the Whale sharks and Sea-lions, they aren\'t overly pushy and will leave you alone once you have said no.  Highly recommend a vist and a stroll along the Malecon.

347497961.name: Really liked
347497961.author: a TripAdvisor user
347497961.reviewBody: I went during the day and it seems like everything wakes up at night. Good place to take a stroll with your family while buying snacks and restaurants lined up too. There\'s even a whale museum which was unfortunately closed when we went. But really relaxing.

347426517.name: The beautiful sunset that I saw
347426517.author: a TripAdvisor user
347426517.reviewBody:
I love to walk or riding for evening along the La Paz Malecón before dinner. It’s a 5 kilometer boardwalk along the beach and the center of activity in La Paz. I love to watch the sun went down, walking up and down the beach, enjoying warm winter night.

La Paz is home to many fine hotels, impressive restaurants, and fun nightlife. The Malecón is the center of most culinary and libation activity. Come on a Friday or Saturday and the malecon will be alive with cars cruising the strip, families strolling down the waterfront, and sounds of laughter and excitement coming from all directions.

La Paz is a city rich with history and natural beauty. Nestled in a protected bay located on the Sea of Cortez, La Paz has provided the perfect resting place for seafarers throughout the centuries.

I highly recommend to visit this beautiful and peaceful place.

347005352.name: Is it always this dead?
347005352.author: a TripAdvisor user
347005352.reviewBody: We first went to La Paz in January 2014 and were pretty disappointed in how...boring...it was. Granted, it was an afternoon early in the week on a fairly windy day. The entire strip was empty and barely anything was open. The small area they allow the vendors to set up on was the only "happening" place. There was a small taco place right at the south end of the Malecon that had a huge taco bar, 2 for 1 margaritas, and was SUPER cheap - this was really the only high point of our visit! We have heard great things about La Paz in general, and would probably go back in the future to see what it is like on a different day.

346946243.name: Great long walk
346946243.author: a TripAdvisor user
346946243.reviewBody: Love this ocean front walk. It\'s like 6km long, and there are lots of things to see along the path, including of course the turquoise blue water of the Sea of Cortez. There\'s usually a nice breeze, making for a very pleasant walk along the sea wall.

346935545.name: Where you go to see and be seen
346935545.author: a TripAdvisor user
346935545.reviewBody: The Malecon is 5 kms along the sea.  Here you jog, skateboard, walk your dog or mor particularly, wander to look at the locals , to look at the interesting and fun sculptures and to be in tune with local life.  5pm is a good time or 6am for the fitness brigade

346867963.name: Wonderful merging of sea and city
346867963.author: a TripAdvisor user
346867963.reviewBody: I\'m not sure where else to put that La Paz is just a wonderful city to visit. It\'s not touristy, and especially in February, there were many days when we were the only tourists in sight in restaurants and on the street. There are a couple of Oxxos at which to get supplies though the main shopping is a few parallel streets inland. You find families strolling this place in the evening and it\'s just peaceful and nice. I noticed there are security officers of various kinds usually withing eyesight of each other, and we appreciated that especially when I was taking my early morning walks. February was a disaster in terms of diving, because high winds forced cancellation of most of our Scuba; but I would do it all again just to experience a lovely Mexican city without a bunch of drunken tourists or any tourists at all wandering around.

346598206.name: The life of the City
346598206.author: a TripAdvisor user
346598206.reviewBody: We loved the walk along the beach and the street that was full of life. They blocked off a street for vendors, food and entertainment. We had great fish tacos and sampled dried fruit. The dancers were great and in full costume. A lot of shopping opportunities as well.

346112450.name: good to waner
346112450.author: a TripAdvisor user
346112450.reviewBody: nothing special but great to wander and enjoy an ice cream, and people watch. Lots of restaurants to enjoy

344744361.name: Great stroll  in La Paz
344744361.author: a TripAdvisor user
344744361.reviewBody: The Malecon is a great place to stroll day or night. The sculptures along the way are beautiful and interesting. You have easy access to all the shops and restaurants along the way. And there are many places to stop and absorb the blue sky and water in the bay.

344071695.name: Love the Malecon in La paz
344071695.author: a TripAdvisor user
344071695.reviewBody: The walk is spectacular along the ocean front of La Paz.   The city keeps the Malecon clean and tidy, in comparison to Cabo which is really dirty.

342969505.name: A must do in La Paz
342969505.author: a TripAdvisor user
342969505.reviewBody: The Malacon in La Paz is a gem for the city.   It is long enough for a real nice roller blade or even a relaxing bike ride.   There are separate bike lanes between the walkway and car traffic.  There are occasionally bands playing and certainly we saw many people out enjoying a stroll - day or night.  It certainly seems safe and is well patrolled by the local police force.\nThe Malacon is separated from the numerous restaurants and shops by the road but traffic is generally pretty slow and it is easy to cross over to partake in whatever intrigues you.   A nice stroll on the Malacon will give you a good feel for La Paz.

342478532.name: Great walking and people watching
342478532.author: a TripAdvisor user
342478532.reviewBody: An easy walk with a fresh sea view and lots of shops, restaurants and people watching. It is clean and safe and one can stop for coffee or a beer whenever one wants a break. The center piece of La Paz.

342039813.name: They say it\'s "the living room of La Paz"
342039813.author: a TripAdvisor user
342039813.reviewBody: We didn\'t exactly experience it as a living room, but we found ourselves there every day, mingling with locals and visitors alike.  Great places to eat, stroll and people watch.  Also evidently ride a bike dressed as a golden pirate, but in that activity we did not partake.

341545986.name: Malecon Stroll
341545986.author: a TripAdvisor user
341545986.reviewBody: Great place for a walk along the \'harbour\' to enjoy the sites.  Typical restaurants and bars along the way.  Not a lot to see but interesting.

341516261.name: Walk and Enjoy
341516261.author: a TripAdvisor user
341516261.reviewBody: Perfect place to walk, jog, take pictures or just relax on a bench.  We were able to walk the Malecon day and well into the night and feel safe.  There are no such things as street hustlers here and you can enjoy the view and beautiful sculptures along the way.

341492961.name: Beautiful stroll along the sea side
341492961.author: a TripAdvisor user
341492961.reviewBody: Very nice and clean walking area without the constant begging and harassment from the street vendors that you get in some Mexican tourist towns. Lots of interesting shops and some of the restaurants have $2 margaritas, don\'t see that too often. \n\nWe visited from a cruise ship so it was nice to get a taste of the city, we met some local tour guides along the way for the whale shark snorkelling tours and they were only asking for $35 US and willing to bargain, much cheaper than the ship tours which were over $100 US each.

340566182.name: Great Family Walk
340566182.author: a TripAdvisor user
340566182.reviewBody: My family loves to walk the Malecon in La Paz.  The city has made a wonderful place for families to enjoy walking, strolling, biking and exercising. The art work, restaurants and sea add to the experience.  Walking the Malecon is one of our favorite experiences in La Paz.

340516261.name: Pretty Cool to walk along and people watch
340516261.author: a TripAdvisor user
340516261.reviewBody: Good people watching and right on the water.  Lots of restaurants and bars.  La Fuenta Ice Cream is a must.  Lots to see and do.  Lots of good restaurants a short walk away off the Malecon.  We preferred those over most we tried on the Malecon.

339252660.name: Pleasant strolls without any hassles
339252660.author: a TripAdvisor user
339252660.reviewBody: This is a very nice Malecon; very long too.  It made for some nice pleasant strolls.  It was especially nice to not get hassled once for money or somebody trying to sell something

338995079.name: Wonderful views but watch out for trip hazards
338995079.author: a TripAdvisor user
338995079.reviewBody: It\'s a great walk day or night, with wonderful views, watching out for the odd hole or missing pavement. The sculpture is beautiful and helps you navigate where you are.

338936538.name: Always a beautiful view strolling with an ice cream in hand.
338936538.author: a TripAdvisor user
338936538.reviewBody: Anytime morning, afternoon or evening, always good for a walk. But evening time gets more lively with all the locals.

338773358.name: Nice walk along the waterfront
338773358.author: a TripAdvisor user
338773358.reviewBody: People seem to rave about this town and walkway but honestly I don\'t get it. It is a nice, wide and clean walkway with some really cool statues of sea life including a giant oyster with a pearl in it at the entrance to a dock area where our Un-Cruise ship docked. You can also see a special walkway that was built when Queen Elizabeth visited years ago - it was built just for her and I think was never used again since it is in total disrepair and not usable now.\nIf you are in La Paz, you will want to walk along the Malecon and there are places to eat, drink and get ice cream. We were there New Year\'s Eve and it was not as busy as we were told it would be - actually fairly quiet.

338587879.name: Great place to holiday
338587879.author: a TripAdvisor user
338587879.reviewBody: My husband, his brother and a friend stayed in La Paz for the 2015 holiday season, and we all really enjoyed the Malecon. It\'s got very pretty views of the Sea of Cortez on one side, and all sorts of shops, restaurants and such on the other. We felt that although La Paz was pretty busy for the holidays, not many were around during the day, but there was lots of opportunity for dining and drinks in the evening. Of course some of it was touristy, but the people in the area are very warm and welcoming in general, and it was a very positive experience in that regard.

337701359.name: A very nice and attractive malecon
337701359.author: a TripAdvisor user
337701359.reviewBody: The malecon provides a very nice path to walk along the water front. Great views with access to both the water and the town lots of statues and bird watching. Walk across the street for a drink and a meal.

337279980.name: Public art in a beautiful setting
337279980.author: a TripAdvisor user
337279980.reviewBody: in our four days in La Paz, we saw the Malecon in the morning, mid day, sunset and at night, and all times had their own appeal. Sunset is magical, as the paddleboarders and boaters finish their day and reluctantly head to shore, but daytime is better for viewing the sculptures. My favorite is the giant shiny pearl that commemorates La Paz\'s former pearl industry and the fact that La Paz was the setting for John Steinbeck\'s "The Pearl"

337103069.name: A nice dining and sundowning place
337103069.author: a TripAdvisor user
337103069.reviewBody: This newly renovated Malecon sea side walk is nice to visit has many small places for a great meal o just to grab a beer and watch the sunset. It has been decorated by a wall artist and looks just great

337098136.name: So beautiful to see
337098136.author: a TripAdvisor user
337098136.reviewBody:
Wow, if you get a chance to see La Paz, make a stroll along the Malecon. Not only is it long,  but a simply beautiful place to walk along. The bay is huge, the colour of the water turquoise blue green and the birds hang over head in the breeze. A variety of statues line the walk as their ode to the sea animals. 

Plus the main quay had the National Geographic ships docked and can have a great look on their outsides. Their is a small charming lighthouse nearby as well.

Plus there is no shortage of restaurants and hotels across the main road. It was busy with lots of people strolling or on bikes enjoying their day. Come here and so will you.

337077440.name: Walk around and chill !
337077440.author: a TripAdvisor user
337077440.reviewBody: This is the centrepiece of La Paz - a wonderful place to stroll any time of the day. Lots of restaurants and shopping places around.

336914073.name: I like this Malecon with many designed statues
336914073.author: a TripAdvisor user
336914073.reviewBody: Our hotel is along the beach but out of town. Twice per day we drove into city along Malecon, and often stop by to take photos. Many statues there are well designed and pretty good quality. The inside of the city is not as good as Malecon.

336500001.name: Nice walk
336500001.author: a TripAdvisor user
336500001.reviewBody: It\'s a nice walk if you have time to kill. It\'s downtown. Very safe area. There are shops and restaurants to check out too. Several figurines for pictures. Lots of seating and beaches to sit down and take a break.

336420985.name: Incredible sunsets
336420985.author: a TripAdvisor user
336420985.reviewBody: We enjoyed strolling on the  Malecon watching the boats, families and incredible sunsets. Beautiful! There are sculptures to ponder, restaurants to sit in, or benches to relax on. It\'s a bueautiful, relaxing, very safe place to walk and visit.

335832499.name: Boardwalk
335832499.author: a TripAdvisor user
335832499.reviewBody: It\'s worth a stroll once or maybe once during the day and once at night.  The views are pretty and peaceful.  There are many restaurants, shops, and attraction booking places.  The fun things is people watching as families, locals and tourists alike, walking, wading, biking, running, etc.  I did a morning run along it and it was already busy.  Kept clean.

335135309.name: We love the malecon
335135309.author: a TripAdvisor user
335135309.reviewBody: We take a daily walk on the malecon.  It is a great walking area, safe, interesting to watch the changes in the sea, the boats, people.  Also great for bicycling, people watching, and relaxing on a bench.

334804514.name: Great place to walk and enjoy the Sea of Cortez ... nice to just relax!!
334804514.author: a TripAdvisor user
334804514.reviewBody: Great place to walk and enjoy the Sea of Cortez ... nice to just relax!!\n\nLots of Mexican Ice Cream places along it if it is hot!!

334540610.name: great malecon
334540610.author: a TripAdvisor user
334540610.reviewBody: We have been on quite a few mexican malecons but this one in la paz has got to be the best. It is very wide and runs for a long ways. Being so close to the ocean and beaches it takes a long time to walk the entire distance if one has the energy to do it. Parts of the malecon needs a little repair but for the most part it is okay. Great for people watching although some of the benches need painting to cover the rust.

334441588.name: nice spot to see the life of La Paz
334441588.author: a TripAdvisor user
334441588.reviewBody: Everything happens along here. Feels "old", but legit. The life of the town happens along here. Lots of restaurants/shops/etc. Unfortunately it was cloudy our entire time there, so we didn\'t spend as much time out there.

333776245.name: Would not choose to stay on it - too noisy!
333776245.author: a TripAdvisor user
333776245.reviewBody: \nReally just a sidewalk along the ocean. Not a place to have your morning coffee but at night it does have a pretty good vibe. Overall just a busy noisy street and the beach along it was not very appealing.  Quite dirty. If staying at LA Paz would recommend the Paraiso Del Mar! Much quieter and the shuttle boat was actually an appealing part of out stay.

333537665.name: The Malecon...where everything happens in La Paz
333537665.author: a TripAdvisor user
333537665.reviewBody:
The Malecon is a boardwalk along the Bay of Lapaz, approximately 7 kms. long which encompasses the entire beach area.  Quaint hotels and restaurants line the Malecon, where you can walk, bike, run for what seems forever.  The City of La Paz takes great pride in this special feature, which attracts tourists, local families, friends to enjoy the beauty of the Bahia de La Paz, and many special celebrations such as Carnivals, parades,  live music, a real gathering place.
It is hard to find anything that quite compares to this in other seaside towns.
Rent a paddle board at Harker's and tour the bay, or just sit at your favorite watering hotel with your friends and family.
The Malecon is what makes La Paz unique and beautiful, especially when the sun sets!

333367393.name: Beautiful
333367393.author: a TripAdvisor user
333367393.reviewBody: Compare to a tropical Boardwalk. Beautiful sunset views. Lots of daytime activities. Food and beverage and souvenirs available.

332967753.name: A beautiful place to walk, dine and take in the sunsets
332967753.author: a TripAdvisor user
332967753.reviewBody: The malecon is the featured place in La Paz to walk/run/bike, take photos, grab food, do Zumba and gather with friends and family.  Overlooking the Bay of La Paz, this is my favorite place to be.

332747826.name: Very clean and safe
332747826.author: a TripAdvisor user
332747826.reviewBody: The Malecon is a great place to get photos of the colorful boats, pelicans, and mountain views.  Friendly locals.

332498234.name: Great place to walk and people watch
332498234.author: a TripAdvisor user
332498234.reviewBody: We enjoyed walking the Malecon, at dusk, seeing the view of the bay and the very cool statues all along while people watching.  The best part about La Paz is that the vendors do not harass you here.  Just relax and enjoy a friendly town.

330551424.name: nice and clean
330551424.author: a TripAdvisor user
330551424.reviewBody: great place to take a quiet walk. boardwalk is very clean and it\'s safe. security and police parole it all the time

330386250.name: Good long malecon
330386250.author: a TripAdvisor user
330386250.reviewBody: this one malecon is nice for walking/running/cycling/entertainment. You can rent cycles from nearby shops for an hour basis and there are some event going on at some points on it. This one must 6-7 km long in total.

329420069.name: A Lovely Seafront Walk
329420069.author: a TripAdvisor user
329420069.reviewBody: This spot is simply a beautiful place to walk. Enjoy the sea, the breeze, the beautiful benches, and great seafood restaurants along the way. We ordered takeout fish meals at Mariscos Restaurant at the far end of the malecon. The food was delicious and fresh. Then we walked the other direction to simply enjoy being there. Highly recommended.

329213101.name: Good for an afternoon stroll
329213101.author: a TripAdvisor user
329213101.reviewBody: You need to walk this malecon to see the different options of food and entertainment that La Paz has to offer. Do this at sunset to enjoy it throughly.

328678061.name: Good view of the harbor and boats from the malecon
328678061.author: a TripAdvisor user
328678061.reviewBody: We spent 1 day here off a cruise ship.  Good ice cream place is La Fuente.  Not too much shopping or attractions on the malecon.  It\'s quiet and you have a great view of the sea with boats in the harbor.\nDon\'t know if last year\'s hurricane discouraged tourists, but there weren\'t many people here.  Hard to spend much time on this malecon.   If you have the time, visit the La Paz Serpentarium just south of town.  It has reptiles, tarantulas, birds and great volunteers working there to help the local ecology and also helps the locals understand how to appreciate the indigenous wildlife on Baja.  They bring out snakes and insects as well as the tarantula for people to touch. Worth a visit and donations help the center take care of the birds and snakes.\n

327500182.name: Lovely place to be
327500182.author: a TripAdvisor user
327500182.reviewBody: love the Malecon for walking and biking and shopping, people are friendly and not overbearing trying to sell items..

327439344.name: Nice walk, especially at sunset
327439344.author: a TripAdvisor user
327439344.reviewBody: Had dinner at a street side caf\u00e9, it was nice and the food was good, people friendly, prices very good

326389310.name: Lovely place to stroll, day or evening
