326389310.author: a TripAdvisor user
326389310.reviewBody: Shopping and sightseeing by day, in the evenings families come out to play, stroll, and eat ice cream.  Delightful!

326271095.name: La Paz, Baja, Mexico
326271095.author: a TripAdvisor user
326271095.reviewBody: A wonderful safe, place to sit & watch the world go by or burn off  some of the calories you devoured in the local restaurants.

326132456.name: La Paz visit
326132456.author: a TripAdvisor user
326132456.reviewBody: Beautiful walk with a view over the water. Interesting sculptures. Found lots of nice shells too. Enjoyed sitting on the many benches.  Places to sit and enjoy the beach.

326123435.name: Wonderful and clean Malecon
326123435.author: a TripAdvisor user
326123435.reviewBody: A inviting Malecon to explore.  Very clean and friendly place to explore La Paz from.  The art statues are very nice and interesting.  There are vendors to purchase items from...like bubble tea.  It\'s easy to find a place to relax and watch the water and boats.

325732799.name: Lovely strolling
325732799.author: a TripAdvisor user
325732799.reviewBody: The Malecon has the shoreline of La Paz bay on one side, and a series of restaurants and shops on the other (for the most part).  There are portions that are active and busy (especially during events and festivals) and long quiet stretches perfect for a brisk stroll.  Lots of locals like to exercise along here, too!  Parking can be tight at times so it\'s best to walk or ride your bike (careful of traffic!)

322777297.name: The better you can get in La Paz, sunsets.
322777297.author: a TripAdvisor user
322777297.reviewBody: This is a place for a beautiful morning walk or sunset walk. (bring sunscreen).\nThe sunsets are the most beautiful things you can see at La Paz and you can enjoy them at Malecon, of course, there are good restaurants, bars and everything there.\nThere is a bycicle road, safe to use.

321742413.name: Romantic main street with waterfront view on the Pacific Ocean
321742413.author: a TripAdvisor user
321742413.reviewBody: Excellent for couple or retired peoples who want to relax and have a walk along the beach. Ideally at the evening is the best time and in the morning early for breakfast.

318729743.name: Walking the Malecon in La Paz Mexico
318729743.author: a TripAdvisor user
318729743.reviewBody: The Malecon is starting to need a lot of work on the tiles. They are coming up all along the Malecon and make it look very used and abused. Looks like the city does not care about the Malecon anymore.

317544472.name: Really nice
317544472.author: a TripAdvisor user
317544472.reviewBody: You can spend a lot of time walking and thinking along a very large Boardwalk with beach, restaurants, shop. Very quiet place.

316469543.name: Very nice
316469543.author: a TripAdvisor user
316469543.reviewBody: We walked around here on a beautiful day with a light breeze and it was a near perfect day. It was not crowded at all and very clean. There are lots of shops and Restaurants along the way and really just something for everyone .

313892445.name: Great memories!!
313892445.author: a TripAdvisor user
313892445.reviewBody: Make this one night at least of your vacation!!  So much fun.  Restaurants bars shops people watching.  Worth your time!!

311698767.name: A gem of a beachfront
311698767.author: a TripAdvisor user
311698767.reviewBody: A really beautiful boardwalk if you will along the beach with every shop, and restaurant you could want. Very family oriented and very friendly.

310758315.name: Relax and shop.
310758315.author: a TripAdvisor user
310758315.reviewBody: If you want to do shopping it\'s a great place. If you just want to walk at the Malecon while havinh snacks it\'s a great place too. You have both worlds, shopping and relaxing time. They have umbrellas where you can just watch the boats go by or watch the sunset at night.

309927270.name: Wish San Jose had this
309927270.author: a TripAdvisor user
309927270.reviewBody: I wish San Jose del Cabo had this idea instead of lining the beach with Hotels and Resorts. La paz did it right and it is only getting better. Great for a morning walk or a sunset stroll.

309276351.name: Busy but nice.
309276351.author: a TripAdvisor user
309276351.reviewBody: Loads of restaurants and bars. Shopping is the same as anywhere else in Mexico. Same stuff again and again. \nGrab a seat and watch the people or the beautiful view of the bay. Dine and drink with the same views.\nTraffic is always congested with teenagers cruising the malecon.

305885392.name: Great Realxing weekend.
305885392.author: a TripAdvisor user
305885392.reviewBody: We went to La Paz for the weekend. Such a relaxing place with good food, great views, fishing, water sports, WHAT ELSE DO YOU NEED?

304199927.name: beautiful walks, views
304199927.author: a TripAdvisor user
304199927.reviewBody: Lovely, clean walkway. Perfect for morning and evening walks. Such a family oriented place. Loved our time on the malecon!

304084698.name: See La Paz Relax
304084698.author: a TripAdvisor user
304084698.reviewBody: Safe Festive, Great for people watching.  Great place to get a real feel for the local community--or maybe get into a beach volleball game...walking along the Malecon makes La Paz a vacation and not a trip.

301845176.name: Romantic sunset
301845176.author: a TripAdvisor user
301845176.reviewBody: typical latin Malecon. You have to walk at sunset, with the romantic and discrete nightlife (restaurants, shops, little markets, ...)

301671450.name: Walking
301671450.author: a TripAdvisor user
301671450.reviewBody: No better place for a nice evening walk. The whole town gathers here in the evening and carnivals on the weekends. The sunsets are spectacular.

300644861.name: Family vacation
300644861.author: a TripAdvisor user
300644861.reviewBody: Had a great time walking on the board walk along the Malecon. Many things to do. Nice place. Good for a morning jog or quick swim.

298859640.name: Stunning views
298859640.author: a TripAdvisor user
298859640.reviewBody: Gorgeous, clean, friendly and safe (even at night). Take a walk, enjoy the sunset and grab an ice cream or a fruit slushie (Respados). A delight- we really enjoyed it.

298303272.name: Great Place to Witness the Sunset
298303272.author: a TripAdvisor user
298303272.reviewBody: ,Local people and tourist alike walk the Malecon morning and evening.  Some do a leisurely stroll while others are power walking.  The latter is surprising since in late July, the temperature was hovering near 100 degrees Fahrenheit coupled with the humidity A lot can be said for acclimation. The Malecon is amazingly clean since trash receptacles are few a far between.  The highlight of the walk on the Malecon is when the sun sinks in the West.  I captured a moment in my camera with the black silhouette of a bobbing fisherman\'s boat with 5 large Pelicans settling in for the night on the boat\'s edge..

296057336.name: Nice place to visit..
296057336.author: a TripAdvisor user
296057336.reviewBody: Malecon is used by guest and locals to exercise, walk the dogs or spending time with a loved one. Great for sharing some time together.. Beautiful sunsets..............

296056098.name: AFTERNOON on the MALECON
296056098.author: a TripAdvisor user
296056098.reviewBody: Spend an afternoon walking the Malecon. Beautiful stroll along the bay. Admire the numerous bronze sculptures and be sure to take photos of each from lots of angles. These will become reminders of your fond afternoon in La Paz.

295146789.name: I love La Paz!
295146789.author: a TripAdvisor user
295146789.reviewBody: The Malecon in La Paz is a great place to take an evening stroll.  When we were there, we first ate chocolate clams from a little stand (they were amazing!) Then we ate some local flavored ice cream. Then finally bought some great hand crafted items.   \n\nThere are lots of people out strolling and riding bikes.  It\'s a great place!!

293534842.name: The Pink Malecon in LA Paz : Charming
293534842.author: a TripAdvisor user
293534842.reviewBody: La Paz has a really lovely Malecon: you can stroll over the pink tiles or ride a bike, the view are lovely and the restaurants and stores on the other side make for a very interesting experience.

293431542.name: Needs maintenance, but great concept
293431542.author: a TripAdvisor user
293431542.reviewBody: Great for a walk, but a little dirtier and rougher than I would have liked for a romantic walk or a family walk with small children. Great statues and fun stuff, but lots of littler.

292891504.name: Perfect to walk
292891504.author: a TripAdvisor user
292891504.reviewBody: El Malecon is the hearth of La Paz life, everyone walk on the Malecon: people running, with bycicle, with rollerblades, with dogs or and kids, doing exercises.\nSo nice all the day, in the early morning or in the sunset, el Malecon is a special place.

292108951.name: Great!
292108951.author: a TripAdvisor user
292108951.reviewBody: Best dog walking place! Added to our great stay at Casabuena, it made our stay in La Paz very memorable.

289314985.name: The best walk you ever had
289314985.author: a TripAdvisor user
289314985.reviewBody: While visiting La Paz we found ourselves walking in one of the best places in La Paz - " el malec\u00f3n" - two or the miles of a Boardwalk where the local families walk with their kids, wives, girlfriends and you will also see lots of dogs along the way. The breeze is just amazing, the people are very friendly and it is very safe. Police presence and the best ice cream at "La Fuente" for $35 pesos ($2.50) seat on one of the benches and enjoy people watching

286751458.name: Beautiful sunsets
286751458.author: a TripAdvisor user
286751458.reviewBody: Wonderful, safe place to see and enjoy what the locals do.  Always a good time. So many things to do around the Malecon.

286437079.name: It is a nice walk
286437079.author: a TripAdvisor user
286437079.reviewBody: Not very busy , but at night you will see more people and it is nicer. Could also be romantic with your spouse.

285601881.name: Honeymoon
285601881.author: a TripAdvisor user
285601881.reviewBody: BEAUTYFUL male on peaceful , nice walk , hoteles and food affordable , BEAUTYFUL beaches friendly community , no clubs , very family oriented , a place to get away if you like a calm quiet vacation \u2764\ufe0f

285054901.name: THE place to walk and hang out
285054901.author: a TripAdvisor user
285054901.reviewBody: The malecon is the main hub of La Paz. It\'s where everyone goes in the evening. Strolling along the malecon you will often encounter community events and festivals. A trip to La Paz is not complete without a walk on the malecon.

281797432.name: great place
281797432.author: a TripAdvisor user
281797432.reviewBody: great shops, an experience of Mexican culture without being too touristy, Tailhunter\'s restaurant and obviously the terrific views of the Sea of Cortes.

280643605.name: Beautiful stroll along the water
280643605.author: a TripAdvisor user
280643605.reviewBody: The beautiful malecon is a couple miles long, beautifully maintained, sculptures, activity, just a great place to start your morning or after dinner for a walk.  This is where everything happens in La Paz!

277713775.name: Great art!
277713775.author: a TripAdvisor user
277713775.reviewBody: As most Mexican cities I\'ve visited, the malecon in La Paz does not disappoint.  There are many wonderful works of art along the 5 kilometers the malecon stretches through the downtown waterfront of the capital city of Baja California Sur.

277669931.name: Nice stretch of beach
277669931.author: a TripAdvisor user
277669931.reviewBody: Always see people walking along the beach with children and dogs. The sunsets are beautiful. There restaurants nearby. The birds are diving for fish.

277545952.name: Sunset walk
277545952.author: a TripAdvisor user
277545952.reviewBody: The Malecon is the perfect place to go for a jog before the sun comes up! Or you can walk along the water as the sun sets on the Sea of Cortez. Do try to avoid this area immediately after a heavy rain. It\'s situated at the low point in town and it\'s prone to flooding. Local crews are quick to clean it up as soon as the water flow stops, though. Make sure you check it out while you\'re in town.

277095063.name: Beautiful sunset\'s.
277095063.author: a TripAdvisor user
277095063.reviewBody: Great place to stroll along the water to view the sunsets, run or jog or walk to restaurants.  Always something going on at the Malecon as soon as the heat of the day is gone.

275605583.name: Nice walk.
275605583.author: a TripAdvisor user
275605583.reviewBody: Right on the bay. Access to sand and water. Nice place to walk.a a a a a a a a a am a a v v v v v v v v v v v v e e e e r r r r y y y hot town.m m m m m m m m m m m m m m m m m m m m m m m m m m m m m m m m m  the hard work and the rest of the day.

274840832.name: Wonderful walking
274840832.author: a TripAdvisor user
274840832.reviewBody: This area is perfect for your morning power walk or your afternoon stroll - pleasant breeze on warm days.

274568744.name: Loved it!
274568744.author: a TripAdvisor user
274568744.reviewBody: Delightful walk, very family oriented during the day and early evening, adult entertainment late evening.  Interesting sculptures and lots of nearby restaurants.  Great place to watch sunsets.

272654944.name: A view of a community
272654944.author: a TripAdvisor user
272654944.reviewBody: It  was a very "real" place where families enjoyed the evenings, young people enjoyed each other and everyone was courteous, accepting and friendly.

271819805.name: Typical - and Unique
271819805.author: a TripAdvisor user
271819805.reviewBody:
Lots of Latin American waterfront towns have their Malecon, a pedestrian walkway that is busy with strollers (people strolling, not the obnoxious space hogs that ignorant parents put their kids in so they don't have to interact with them) day and night. Spain has its Ramblas that serve the same purpose.

The La Paz Malecon is active around the clock. Lots of fitness kooks, we saw a greater concentration of joggers and exercise groups here than we have ever seen anywhere else. 4 of the 7 days we were in La Paz, they blocked off the street that parallels the Malecon for fairs, music celebrations, the 450th birthday of the city.

We say cleanup crews sweeping to keep the place spotless. The clear blue sea provides a beautiful backdrop. Families, kids bicycling, teenage lovers, all out enjoying La Paz.

Gotta love it!

271777209.name: Make Mine A Shot of The Perfect Beach Scene
271777209.author: a TripAdvisor user
271777209.reviewBody: Some places just make you feel great and for me the La Paz Malecon is one of those places. This coastal promenade has it all. Laura, coconut and date palms line the paver walkway. You stop to admire the many sculptures like the La Ballena (the whale) or Robert Wyland\'s marine mural. In the morning joggers can be seen but at night people come for the beautiful sunset, restaurants and nightlife. It/s a perfect opportunity for a margarita and a view of the bay on the Sea of Cortez. Stroll down to the white sand beach, take off your shoes a chill out while you stroll through the water. At lunch time many business people eat lunch along the Paseo Alvaro Obregon. I suggest the Tailhunter Restaurant & Fubar Cantina, Great food and prices and allot to choose from. For shoppers there are many specialty shops. Oaxaca Black Pottery and wooden lacquered boxes are popular. The La Paz Malecon is developed enough to be entertaining and contemporary but yet small enough to keep it\'s tradition and culture.

271535430.name: Walking the Malecon
271535430.author: a TripAdvisor user
271535430.reviewBody: Strolling along the La Paz waterfront is a must. Just don\'t do it at high noon with all the other tourists. In the early morning you\'ll see joggers and tai chi practitioners; in the evening Mexican families are out with the kids and it\'s much more appealing. Grab a paleta (watermelon, mango and coconut are our favorites) and enjoy people watching as you stroll.

270816664.name: Enjoy the city view with the locals
270816664.author: a TripAdvisor user
270816664.reviewBody:
By far one of the nicest features of this city is the 2+ mile long malecon or boardwalk all along the bay.  The side walk is about 12-15 ft wide with seating areas at each street ending.  You don't have to cross roads or deal with traffic if you stay on the water side.  

At almost each seating area or 'round about' is a large sculpture depicting a historical feature, person or something you might see while swimming or boating in the bay or area. 
The locals love to come out and walk, ride, stroll, and enjoy the nice evening breezes.  Many times I'v e seen several generations of families all out enjoying the malecon together. 

At the far  North end is the Corumel beach park, a great place for swimming and beach playing.  A bit to the south is Marina Palmira with a couple of restaurants and shops.  Coco's has fresh coconut drinks and a large play area for the kids.  At the windmill there are a series of exercise machines for a do it your self work out - greatly in demand in the early morning, and late evenings.  There are a couple of small restaurants, coffee and juice options on the water side, with many very good sit down restaurants - very casual to fine dining on the opposite side.

In the center of the malecon is the kiosk. Several times a week you can see music, arts and crafts, perhaps a car show, dancing…. the options are endless.  Continuing south the Queens Pier is next with a new play area for the kids.  Conveniently located across the street from Fuente's ice cream - the best in La Paz! 
Of course if you're walking at sunset, we have some of the best to view!
 Continue your stroll south while enjoying a fresh ice cream cone.  Theres a nice beach right at the end near the Stella Restaurant.  If it's a Friday night, and you've still got energy after this walk, drop into Stellas for some Salsa dancing starting at 10pm!

270666848.name: Magical sunsets
270666848.author: a TripAdvisor user
270666848.reviewBody: The malecon in La Paz is one of my favorite places in the world. Always something going on. The locals take such pride in their reputation as Mexicos friendliest city and proove it every day... When you get tired of the time share come ons and high priced glitz of Los Cabos head north a couple hours to see the real thing. Carnaval in february is mostly centered on the malecon and is a party you\'ll never forget and in the summer, just as it\'s getting so hot the ice cold pacificos at the Perla are beading with sweat a cool breeze called el coromel comes rolling in off the bay to cool the evening

269406087.name: A walk on the windy side
269406087.author: a TripAdvisor user
269406087.reviewBody: I like La Paz and the Malecon because it has such a tranquil beauty; the water sparkles with promise and there are plenty of places on the road side of the Malecon to eat, drink and shop, or you can simply sit on one of the white benches and contemplate the bay. The art pieces strategically placed along the walk (and nearby) are wonderful and great for photo opportunities. The Malecon seems really safe and is generally clean. Every time I have walked there I have seen families and people enjoying themselves. The wind can toss your hair a bit on a regular day but it is a joyful breeze that invites you to play.

268554815.name: breathtaking at sunset
268554815.author: a TripAdvisor user
268554815.reviewBody: la pas is known for spectacular sunsets and the malacon is where to watch them.  this 7km beautiful walkway along waters edge is the in spot at sunset.  families, lovers, retirees skateboarders etc, all show up.  benches fot sitting and sat and sun nights is like a small usa city in the 50\'s.  everyone cruising the drag with their shiny car and dressed up ladies.  checking each other out.  plenty of places for food, drinks and views.  a must when in la paz

267565843.name: essential part of the trip
267565843.author: a TripAdvisor user
267565843.reviewBody: We loved the Malencon.  It\'s just great to walk along it, especially in the evening when lots of young families are out and about, just enjoying the sunset with an ice cream or a cappuccino.

267557705.name: Always something to see, Love it!
267557705.author: a TripAdvisor user
267557705.reviewBody: The Malecon of La Paz is a gathering spot for families, walkers, runners, bikers and anyone who loves being by the water.  It comes even more alive in the evenings.  I recommend to take a stroll and enjoy all the sea theme statues.  Rent a bike and go as far was you can.  The sunsets are incredible, love how the skies turn a bright red and orange.\n\nThere is also a little wooden "pier" that was recently built and allows you to view the sea from above.  Just in one day as my wife and kids walked along the malecon and the pier, we saw a sting ray swimming along the malecon, a small blue jellyfish, large puffer fish, 2 sun starfish on the rocks and different sized crabs.  My kids kept saying that this was better than going to the aquarium.

267237130.name: Fun and local
267237130.author: a TripAdvisor user
267237130.reviewBody: People-watch, stroll, enjoy the sunset, play in the parks with the local kids.  Rent a 3-wheeled "banana" bike and ride like a kid!  Don\'t forget to stop for an ice cream at La Fuente.

266151273.name: Life on the Malecon begins at 6 Pm
266151273.author: a TripAdvisor user
266151273.reviewBody: It was amazing to see La Paz come to life along the Malecon in the evening.  The bronze artwork is beautiful and the sunsets are stunning.  It\'s easy to walk and restaurants and bars are available across the street.

266147152.name: Nice place for a stroll
266147152.author: a TripAdvisor user
266147152.reviewBody: Feel the breeze from the sea, run, walk or ride your wheels down the Malecon.  Wide, clean, cool mornings and lovely nights.

266143531.name: Great place to walk in the morning or evening
266143531.author: a TripAdvisor user
266143531.reviewBody: In the morning, there are lots of people jogging and walking dogs; after dark, tons of families out with their kids.  A really fun place to walk.

265928295.name: Locals take care of their Malecon, make sure you do
265928295.author: a TripAdvisor user
265928295.reviewBody: Lots of activities abound for those who like to people watch or be watched by the people. Lots of exercising along the 5K Malecon and always lot\'s to do, even at night. \nNicely appointed rubbish and recycle bins so make sure you use them as the community does.

265899099.name: Real Mexican community
265899099.author: a TripAdvisor user
265899099.reviewBody: you can stroll for miles, see it all, shop and visit restaurants. Loved the vendors across the malecon.

265766207.name: Great place to walk, rollerblade, ride bikes, etc
265766207.author: a TripAdvisor user
265766207.reviewBody: The Malecon runs for several miles and is mostly in good condition. It is usually wide enough for walkers, runners, bikers, and roller bladers to share. There are many, many shops and restaurants right across the street along much of the Malecon.

265354644.name: Nice place to stroll, and view the sea
265354644.author: a TripAdvisor user
265354644.reviewBody: We walked most of this on a cruise stop. Lots to look at, benches for seating and of course lots of eating/shopping options.

265277423.name: Beautiful boardwalk
265277423.author: a TripAdvisor user
265277423.reviewBody: This boardwalk runs along the sea edge of La Paz. It features the characteristic white benches that can be seen through BCS, and offers opportunities for purchasing snacks, enjoying beaches, and dining across the street. A beautiful place to take in the beauty of La Paz.

264526858.name: Enjoyable promenade
264526858.author: a TripAdvisor user
264526858.reviewBody: This was my first visit back in 15 years. La Paz is a quaint Mexican town without the annoying tourists! Just trendy enough, with a few hip caf\u00e9s showing up. Nice restaurants right on the water. In the evening as the temperature cools it\'s fun to watch the Malec\u00f3n come alive with the locals. Everyone was nice and nobody harassed us to sell us things. This was a great trip, and the Malec\u00f3n centered on our activities when we weren\'t on the water.

263613970.name: A pleasant stroll
263613970.author: a TripAdvisor user
263613970.reviewBody: A clean, well maintained place to walk with plenty of interest things to see. Some amuse - the outdoor public fitness centre for one!

263490103.name: Beautiful Promenade
263490103.author: a TripAdvisor user
263490103.reviewBody: 40 years ago La Paz was a sleepy fishing village built along a mangrove.  Today La Paz has over 200,000 residents and village along the mangrove has been replaced by the Malecon (a world-class promenade) with first-class hotels, shoppes and restaurants.  Some people do not consider this to be progress because many of the changes have come on the backs of the locals who lived in this area for generations, but, it is what it is, and for today\'s tourists it is a lovely place to visit.

263308468.name: Great way to relax
263308468.author: a TripAdvisor user
263308468.reviewBody: Nicest people and beautiful nights, restaurants and public entertainment all over the place. Never a single nervous moment, (unlike Cabo San Lucas and its drug dealers and drunks, pushy hawkers and dubious offers.)

263166646.name: How majestic.
263166646.author: a TripAdvisor user
263166646.reviewBody: The malecon was a "sort of GPS map" for me since I was alone for part of the time in Mexico so always knew where I was due to the location of the malecon.  So well laid out with beautiful scuptures - what a fantastic community gathering area.

263075842.name: the heart of the town
263075842.author: a TripAdvisor user
263075842.reviewBody: Who doesn\'t love a clean, wide, safe sea front walk?  La Paz is a prosperous, safe, still mostly-Mexican tourist city.  Although there\'s an ex-pat community, much of the city still has a colonial Mexican flavor and you see this first on the malecon. Unlike other Mexican sea walks, this one has trash receptacles and the area is frequently cleaned.  Great to people-watch and grab a refresco.

262194875.name: Great to walk along
262194875.author: a TripAdvisor user
262194875.reviewBody: Walk for as long as you like, great place to meet and the sun sets are beautiful.  Plenty of benches along the way and all the different statues are interesting, grab an ice cream or stop for a drink.

262052206.name: Pretty waterfront
262052206.author: a TripAdvisor user
262052206.reviewBody: This is a lovely "boardwalk" along the bay in the city of La Paz. It makes for a beautiful stroll with the water on one side and the lovely shops along the other. There are bronze statues all along the Malecon depicting elements of the sea and life by the ocean. They are stunning.

261967389.name: Nice place to stroll along the bay
261967389.author: a TripAdvisor user
261967389.reviewBody: Pretty, peaceful boardwalk next to the water in downtown La Paz. Lots of restaurants and shops. Low-key. No one bothers you, no pan-handlers, no one tries to sell you cheap trinkets.

261369410.name: Stroll away the day
261369410.author: a TripAdvisor user
261369410.reviewBody: Beautiful walk, GREAT ART, friendly people, very clean, shopping, food, everything. Feb is when they have Carnival, that was fun, big event, free. Everything you need as a visitor is on the Malecon

261329693.name: Great place to walk
261329693.author: a TripAdvisor user
261329693.reviewBody: The long beach strip is lively- great views off to the Sea of Cortez, I believe. Lots going on - boats, shops, restaurants, people-watching.

261147480.name: Malecon at Christmas
261147480.author: a TripAdvisor user
261147480.reviewBody: Beautifully decorated for Christmas.  We thoroughly loved walking along there every day for an entire week.

261061898.name: Love it
261061898.author: a TripAdvisor user
261061898.reviewBody: I love it early in the morning and also at sunset. It\'s a beautiful place to take a walk, watch the locals, watch the tourists. \nPlenty on police presence so I never felt unsafe, or even uncomfortable

260329928.name: Could get even better
260329928.author: a TripAdvisor user
260329928.reviewBody: Now, the look of this place has been getting beetter over the years but still needs fixing. The principal attraction is the beach itself and the sunsets, which are absolutely beautiful each time around. Lately it became more and more common for people to go there to walk and exercise or to simply take a walk but there\'s a thing to be fixed; the trash. I\'m not against people taking their dogs there, but they should at least bring plastic bags with them and clean whenever their dogs leave little presents around instead of acting conveniently irresponsible and just walk away, leaving the thing for other people to step on,and I\'ve been very tempted to take plastic bags myself to pick the \'gifts\' dogs leave and which owners don\'t clean and follow them around with the thing to give them to them, at least they would get embarrassed.

260239491.name: Beautiful views
260239491.author: a TripAdvisor user
260239491.reviewBody: Great photo ops, shopping, food. Lots of action at night, lots of bars and clubs. A lot of fun! Best part of La Paz

260017096.name: Don\'t miss it
260017096.author: a TripAdvisor user
260017096.reviewBody: The la Paz Malecon must be experienced if you\'re in the area.  Families come out in the evening - children on scooters, teenagers on skateboards, strolling sweethearts .... It\'s a wonderful way to really feel like part of the la Paz community.  And the lights and sunset are beautiful!

259165951.name: Best at Night
259165951.author: a TripAdvisor user
259165951.reviewBody: Walking the Malecon is an essential part of visiting La Paz.  During the day, it can be pretty hot; but at night, the locals come out to mix with visitors.  You\'ll see families, romancing couples of all ages, and some public artworks.  You can\'t miss the clever (and cute) trash receptacles either.  Across the street are shops, restaurants, and bars.  The beach is narrow, particularly at high tide, and there are palapas under which to enjoy a siesta.  Some have "put down" La Paz\'s Malecon as not being equal to the more resort cities in Mexico, but it\'s important to remember that La Paz is a "real" city, not a tourist hub.  That\'s its charm.  If you want glitz and glamour, you won\'t find much of it in La Paz.  What you will find is a more realistic slice of life of Southern Baja. That\'s why we love it so much.

258672719.name: Just right
258672719.author: a TripAdvisor user
258672719.reviewBody: The Malecon at La Paz allows you to stroll, shop, eat, and feel far from the rush in a real town that caters to tourists, but isn\'t all about tourists.  It was a joy to walk amongst local folks of all ages enjoying the sea air and gorgeous views in the pleasant company of one another.  This is not a hard-sell town, rather a place where people seem to live-and-let-live.  Great place in Baja for those that aren\'t out for the crazy night-life and Spring Break Yahoo scene of Cabo.

258278904.name: Nice place to stroll
258278904.author: a TripAdvisor user
258278904.reviewBody: The various statues along the Malecon provide good photo opportunities. The wide walkways are used by locals and visitors alike, making this the perfect place to stroll after a nice meal or getting some exercise. The area is illuminated with plenty of street lamps, making it possible to enjoy the sunset and still feel safe walking back to the hotel along the water front.

257490252.name: Sunset on the Malecon
257490252.author: a TripAdvisor user
257490252.reviewBody: Walking, running, bicycling, view the sailboats in the Harbor.  Sunset can take your breath away.  A beautiful wide boardwalk used by locals and visitors alike.  Ice cream shops mixed in with eateries and artisan shopping available along the Malecon.

256521517.name: A Disappointing View
256521517.author: a TripAdvisor user
256521517.reviewBody: Not as attractive as most beach fronts I have visited elsewhere.  The stores, by and large, were not inviting and the views were anything but breathtaking.

256401077.name: Nice place for a walk
256401077.author: a TripAdvisor user
256401077.reviewBody: I\'m an early riser and was happy to see other folks out before daybreak walking along the Malecon. As a solo, lady traveler, I was a little apprehensive to walk around in the early light by myself, but the walk is well-lit and busy with other joggers and walkers, even in the early morning.

256077701.name: A bit of a disappointment
256077701.author: a TripAdvisor user
256077701.reviewBody: The Malecon itself is great, some neat statues and artwork, a great walk and a nice way to see the ocean front of the city. What disappointed me was there was not any entertainment. I am used to the Malecon in Puerto Vallarta in which there is quite a bit of entertainment every night and even more on weekends. The Malecon in La Paz didn\'t have that. Friday and Saturday nights the locals cruise up and down in their vehicles and there are a less people walking and enjoying the beautiful evenings.

256022827.name: Real Mexico
256022827.author: a TripAdvisor user
256022827.reviewBody: The Malecon is a classic seaside promenade in a still unspoiled Mexican city. Tourists and locals mingle here at all times of the day or night.  Great restaurants, bars, ice cream shops, coffee shops, and stores.  Walking the length of the Malecon is a great way to get exercise and see the sights.

255694634.name: great sunrise and sunset
255694634.author: a TripAdvisor user
255694634.reviewBody: Love to walk or bike up and down the Malecon early in the morning or evening. Stop to paddled board and refresh in the water of the Sea of Cortez mid way.

255265789.name: Walk along the sea
255265789.author: a TripAdvisor user
255265789.reviewBody: The Malecon is a great place to walk or jog along the sea. There were a number of folks making the run back and forth daily. I believe that\'s because it is a very safe place to work out or hang out. As you walk along you can also pick out the places you\'d like to dine or visit. This is where many of the tours take off from and there are festivals throughout the year for entertainment. Make sure you get an accurate map (i.e. Googlemaps) as many of the roads leading to and around the Malecon are not marked. It\'s easy to get lost if you wander off the Malecon but there are restaurants and shops to be found a couple of blocks inland as well.

255136786.name: The real Mexico
255136786.author: a TripAdvisor user
255136786.reviewBody: If you rent. Do it here in old LP. This is the life of the cty. Miles of walking. Bike riding. SUP rentals and good, lots of it. The spirit of the city lives here!!

255106013.name: Aughhh....unbeliavably dirty!!
255106013.author: a TripAdvisor user
255106013.reviewBody: We drove from Pto San Carlos from a couple of beautiful days in the bay watching whales and now, we are in La Paz; to be more precised we are staying at a hotel in "The Malecon" and the truth is it feels like a huge dump!!  Someone forgot to take care of the state capital, come on!!!

254377034.name: Delightful
254377034.author: a TripAdvisor user
254377034.reviewBody: The paved walkway along the Sea of Cortez is clean, safe and enables delightful walks any time of day.

254209087.name: very clean and nice
254209087.author: a TripAdvisor user
254209087.reviewBody: It\u00b4s really cool just to stroll around here. During the day, enjoying the sun and in the afternoon seeing more and more poeple getting here. Biking, jogging, or just eveing strolling. \nOur advise:\nGo there 1hour before sunset, buy an great tasting ice cream, sit down on a little wall and observe the scenery around you :)

254023925.name: Busy Place!
254023925.author: a TripAdvisor user
254023925.reviewBody: Very nice street across the street from the beach area of La Paz.  Pleasant walking around during the day...way more action at night...can be very loud with music blaring out of some restaurants/bars/nightclubs.  Plenty of places to eat and snack.

253912385.name: Your standard Malecon
253912385.author: a TripAdvisor user
253912385.reviewBody: Malecon means simply the street in fromt of the sea. That\'s what this is. You will find shops, restaurants, expedition agencies, etc. Very clean and safe.

253736029.name: really don\'t get all the hype
253736029.author: a TripAdvisor user
253736029.reviewBody: i guess if your looking for a place to walk or ride...the missing tiles and the silt from the recent rain kind of shows its age or design flaw..but hey have a look if you make to this part of mexico

253603610.name: Just go for it.
253603610.author: a TripAdvisor user
253603610.reviewBody: Explore it and discover its secrets along the way. I\u00b4m a runner and really in love with the location to do my training.

253401393.name: Malecon Walkway
253401393.author: a TripAdvisor user
253401393.reviewBody: Lovely place for strolling, watching the boats, good restaurants, places to shop, even on a windy day.

252889946.name: Really nice boardwalk
252889946.author: a TripAdvisor user
252889946.reviewBody: One of the only places to run, bike and walk without the fear of stepping in a hole. The locals come out at dusk and the boardwalk comes alive with running and cycling clubs, kids on bikes and the local policia patrolling their beat.

252671884.name: What\'s the fuss?
252671884.author: a TripAdvisor user
252671884.reviewBody: Overall, La Paz was just not what I was hoping for.  Really not much cool charm.  I don\'t mind the grittiness of real cities, but I was not feeling it.  At least we weren\'t too hassled by people selling stuff.

252334209.name: Tourist and Locals favorite place to relax and exercise
252334209.author: a TripAdvisor user
252334209.reviewBody: What I like the most is that it is safe lots of policia federal and municipali police a good place to stroll, roller blading, biking, skate boarding lots of restaurants and bars most restaurants has free internet (love it)  nice Boardwalk and pier  what I don\'t like about there are no public bathroom. And parking is scarce as well.

251984386.name: Perfect Stroll
251984386.author: a TripAdvisor user
251984386.reviewBody: Imagine waking up at sunrise,  having fresh coffee and fruit on your secluded patio in a private courtyard. Put on your flip flops, grab your essentials and go across the steet..You\'re now on the Malecon. It\'s very quiet with few people. You see the beautiful water, calm and still in the bay..before the winds unsettle the glassy surface.  Local fishermen stand on rocks catching bait fish. An occasional jogger or bicycle pass by. We stroll. We find hundreds and hundreds of shells as we head straight to the water. Tiny fish and then bigger ones can be seen. We stroll further, entering the heart of LaPaz, finding stores, Paddle board lessons, sculptures, a giant whale skeleton om display. We spot Rainbow Hawk..a local enigma, walking his dog and bumming a smoke (Google him..fascinating start in itself). There are parks with families. We pass by and pango boats waiting to take you out for an excursion. The cafes are now bussling and I\'m hungry again. By 10am, it\'s busy and filled with people, friendly and smiling.  We see a lady with a donkey, fresh clams just harvested for sale, tents with local art and trinkets. More families are out, music plays from live entertainers for the cruise ship people. We walked to the end of a long pier. An old man who is fishing hands me a piece of paper and asks me in Spanish if I can translate it. I know very little Spanish but I\'m able to decipher that someone wrote his horoscope down for him in English.  He had no idea what it said and through my limited Spanish and playing of charades, I was able to communicate that it said he was kind, honest and trustworthy but sometimes indecisive. I wondered who wrote it and how long he had it crumpled in his pocket, waiting for someone to tell him what he already knew.\n\nNight time is different. If you like people watching, sit outside a club and order some Pacificos and fresh tacos. Watch the nightlife. Skirt length just past the butt cheeks with lots of glitter and high heels. Young crowd, more locals, lots of traffic, police keeping an eye on things and a very fun vibe day or night.

250075879.name: Not like the Embarcadero in SF
250075879.author: a TripAdvisor user
250075879.reviewBody: This place is a bit disappointing if you\'re expecting a lot of restaurants and things to do.  Nice people watching at night. The statues are interesting.

249279406.name: Great Waterfront!
249279406.author: a TripAdvisor user
249279406.reviewBody: For our family trip, having the Malecon so close to the hotel was great for the kids, for beach walks.  It\'s a beautiful and pretty well-kept waterfront.  There was a little damage left over from Odile, but nothing to complain about.  There was also a good police presence there along the main drag, and this was the case all around town, which didn\'t feel overdone or troubling.  We were told that the extra police and Federales presence was to combat the small amount of looting that took place after the hurricane, but by January, there had been little trouble left.  We only met with smiling faces, lots of "Buenos Dias!", and lots of charming vendor stalls and open stores.

249178800.name: Fun.
249178800.author: a TripAdvisor user
249178800.reviewBody: Went during the Christmas holiday.  It was so nice to see the Christmas decorations and all the families strolling on the Melacon.  Beautiful atmosphere.

249057425.name: Very Nice
249057425.author: a TripAdvisor user
249057425.reviewBody: The Malecon is very cool. 9K of well paved sidewalk. Lots of people, bars, restaurants, stores, and tourist activities. It is almost impossible to be in La Paz and not see the Malecon.

248984796.name: Where to be at night
248984796.author: a TripAdvisor user
248984796.reviewBody: Great for everybody from singles to families. Places to eat, dance and even have a ice cream. Loved going down in the evening for a walk and a little people watching. On the weekend it is a very bustling place.

248933425.name: Better than the Seawall in Stanley Park
248933425.author: a TripAdvisor user
248933425.reviewBody: It goes for over 5 k, is well built and heart-stoppingly beautiful and in January not overly busy, during the week everywhere we went seemed to have few people, very uncrowded.

248709790.name: Main road in La Paz.
248709790.author: a TripAdvisor user
248709790.reviewBody: Not touristy.  Locals mingle with the visitors and people are friendly.  I felt safe.  Lots of great restaurants and good shopping.

247402993.name: This is a very wide concrete sidewalk that runs along the bay in La P
247402993.author: a TripAdvisor user
247402993.reviewBody: This is a very wide concrete sidewalk that runs along the bay in La Paz, BCS, Mexico.  It is next to a well traveled roadway and the gateway to the downtown area.  Restaurants abound and there is always someone walking, riding or driving along this great corridor.  Highly rated people watching place.

247187885.name: Malecon safe, entertaining, I love it
247187885.author: a TripAdvisor user
247187885.reviewBody: I am a regular visitor to La Paz.  I love the Malecon.  Even at night, there are families enjoying an evening outside, along the bay.  I have always felt very safe, even traveling by myself at night.

246840725.name: Nicest place in a rough looking city
246840725.author: a TripAdvisor user
246840725.reviewBody: Having lived in Mexico for years I do enjoy seeing all the differing cities and towns and each have their own personality . The malecon is a nice stroll for miles alongside La Paz bay . In the during the day and night the crowd changes ,from the exercise and morning walkers to the cruising and music of the ten crowd. It is a nice spot in a very busy and pesty looking city.  La Paz for one has a decidedly dumpy vibe. While 25 years ago it seemed manageable and peaceful how that has changed . Sadly it has become a tourist backwater and for good reason. It is full of bad roads, horrible drivers and graffiti .\nThe crime element has been very bad as well the so called \'petty\' crimes are abundant and property crimes have escalated . The traffic and road conditions are abominable ,too many untrained/uninsured drivers ,missing stop signs and lots of potholes and other problems.  Add crooked police and the bribing problem adds to a ghetto vibe.. La Paz might be ok for a couple of days but be careful and to be honest there are better areas to enjoy .

246438886.name: You can\u2019t miss it
246438886.author: a TripAdvisor user
246438886.reviewBody: You can\u2019t miss it\u2026 Wherever you are in La Paz, the Malecon attracts you as a powerful magnet. The whole city of La Paz is built around it and without any doubt this is the nicest place in the city to walk or bike. Just let you go from one extreme to the other, after all it is less than 3 kilometres long, with a few sculptures and palm trees. You can stop at any point a any of the numerous restaurants, boutiques, beer parlours or coffee shops (and a whale museum...).  Day and night the Malecon is crowded and well guarded.

246273200.name: Great to walk
246273200.author: a TripAdvisor user
246273200.reviewBody: Try to get there by sunset and it is a very nice walk. Not much to visit, just buy an ice cream and watch the great view of the ocean.

246083220.name: Nice place for a walk
246083220.author: a TripAdvisor user
246083220.reviewBody: Nice place to stroll in the evenings. Some nice statues, some public beaches. This is where the water activity companies are and most tourist restaurants.

245830040.name: Stroll the malecon
245830040.author: a TripAdvisor user
245830040.reviewBody: La Paz does the malecon right.  This malecon is 5 miles long, perfect for strolling, running, biking, roller blading, and watching the amazing sunsets.  It is lined with some beautiful sculptures. We were there in early Dec so the city was decorated for Christmas, adding to the view.  Very romantic.

245254938.name: The Malecon is the Hang Out area....
245254938.author: a TripAdvisor user
245254938.reviewBody: Beach road that runs along the harbor front with a wide walkway on the beach side.  Locals roller blade, run and bike along the sidewalk in the evening.  There are many restaurants, bars and shops along the Malecon, plus outdoor kiosks for local goods.  In December there was an outside LED wall set-up showing live broadcasts every night leading up to Christmas and several great places for Kids to play.

245167339.name: nice sunset with super size families
245167339.author: a TripAdvisor user
245167339.reviewBody: La Paz strikes me as an outpost of XXL people, they seems t be always eating or buying food, so I sat on the nice waterfront and tried to count the non-consuming passers-by, even the joggers were eating ice cream.  everyone seems pretty friendly, but beware of cheating cabbies.

243661590.name: a nice stroll with some shops around
243661590.author: a TripAdvisor user
243661590.reviewBody: The malecon is a beautiful waterfront walk about maybe 1 mile long. There are many shops lined along the malecone, mostly eateries, but there are other shops like sourvenirs and such. Worth  a walk there while at La Paz.

243644774.name: old world charm
243644774.author: a TripAdvisor user
243644774.reviewBody: A nice way to finish off the evening after a meal or if you just want to see the sites. An amazing amount of work that went into completing the entire walkway. Complete with sculptures, families and exercise buffs, this is a great way to see and get the feel of La Paz.

243114537.name: walking with a view
243114537.author: a TripAdvisor user
243114537.reviewBody:
The malecon is very nice to walk on, there is the beautiful view of the water and little fish in the water. It is a good distance to enjoy a good walk and view. 
Be careful because some tiles are missing and i nearly biffed it a couple times because i was looking at the pelicans hanging out on nearby boats and rocks..
They also clean the board walk everyday.
Just cross the street if you want to walk into shops or get food and icecream.

242640289.name: We walked the walk, and talked the talk
242640289.author: a TripAdvisor user
242640289.reviewBody: This delightful seawalk right along the city beachfront of la Paz is a wonderful community gathering place for residents and visitors alike who love to walk, ride, jog, explore and relax on this memorable landmark.

242632262.name: nice
242632262.author: a TripAdvisor user
242632262.reviewBody:
Seems odd to be giving something so generic as the malecon a review... its pretty much what you'd expect... but...

- unlike most places in mexico, its very UN-touristy.  relatively few trinket stores, people hassling you, etc... pretty much restaurants, "dive shops" (well, tours, fishing, etc), and local city stuff.  

- the water side is fairly empty (business wise), so its even a nicer walk.  There are statues every so often that give it a unique feel.  

just nice.

242587264.name: Can\'t miss
242587264.author: a TripAdvisor user
242587264.reviewBody: How can anyone go to La Paz and not take a leisurely stroll along the Malecon?  It is a great place to \'people watch\'  especailly the families enjoying time together!

242557149.name: a feast for the eyes!
242557149.author: a TripAdvisor user
242557149.reviewBody: The malecon is LaPaz\'s finest treasures!   An abundance of activity makes it entertainment for hours...strolling, stopping for drinks and food...wonderful view beachside, families doing activities and whatever cultural things are happening at the time....\nIt is a course of pride for the citizens of LaPaz and a truly wonderful experience for the visitors...!

242128119.name: Malecon
242128119.author: a TripAdvisor user
242128119.reviewBody: What a wonderful place! Good for a morning jog or an evening stroll. Pleasant shops. Food stands with delicious munchies! Not just for tourists

239869034.name: Where else to enjoy an evening promenade?
239869034.author: a TripAdvisor user
239869034.reviewBody: If you come to La Paz of course you will end up on Malecon to enjoy an afternoon or evening stroll.  Lovely palm trees and interesting statues on the sea side and restaurants and ice cream places on the town side.  Fun to watch people, the sea and the sunset.  Ten cuiado crossing the street with traffic but cars mostly moving slowly!

238833471.name: Sunset place
238833471.author: a TripAdvisor user
238833471.reviewBody: Calm coastal road, families and quiet water front. So much better than Cabo for families. No load pumping music just nice people. Try Rancho Viejo, classic taco 2 locations all close by.

238508714.name: Walking the Malecon
238508714.author: a TripAdvisor user
238508714.reviewBody: It was very lovely to walk along the malecon both in the daytime and the evening. Great spot to see the sunset as well

237908360.name: Peaceful and beautiful
237908360.author: a TripAdvisor user
237908360.reviewBody: The Malecon (boardwalk) is the most beautiful, peaceful walk anyone can take in La Paz. There are amazing statues all along the way. Everyday you can find joggers, walkers, or bike riding. At night the families come out and it is a lot of fun. There are vendors out selling food and even toys for the kids. It is a sight you should see in the day and the night. Also do not miss the sunsets especially if it is a little cloudy.

237906148.name: Beauty abounds
237906148.author: a TripAdvisor user
237906148.reviewBody:
Always nice to stroll along the bay. People watching, occasional dolphin sightings, plenty of birds and easy access to a quick snack, a  cocktail or  a beer . How good is that!
Today we were overwhelmed by a cruise ships clientele...but good for the local economy and they left!

This is an exceptionally clean safe well maintained highlight of La Paz.

237281554.name: Clean!!
237281554.author: a TripAdvisor user
237281554.reviewBody: The City is extremely clean and friendly.  The street is swept, and the statues cleaned, on a daily basis.

235745825.name: The heart of La Paz
235745825.author: a TripAdvisor user
235745825.reviewBody: The "Malecon" is the heart of this city and the most beautiful view of the Sea of Cortez . . . especially for the FABULOUS sunsets!!! It is hard to get enough of this view! Many people gather in this area in the evening to eat at one of the many restaurants, enjoy ice cream, walk, jog, visit, etc. The city recently upgraded much of the area and it feels secure and comfortable. ENJOY whenever you get the chance!!

235252566.name: Take time to walk the Malecon from end to end!!
235252566.author: a TripAdvisor user
235252566.reviewBody: The Malecon is one sight you do not want to miss when you visit La Paz and it is very close to where most tourists will stay anyway.  The statues are wonderful.  When the sun goes down, it is the HAPPENING place in La Paz.  During the day, you can walk along the beachfront for shells and stop for a drink along the way.  Love the Malecon!!

234001691.name: Nice Waterfront Walkway
234001691.author: a TripAdvisor user
234001691.reviewBody: Safe walkway right on the water.  Several restaurants and a few shops, but more shopping on side streets and a block or two up from the water.  Actually gets busier at night, when the weather cools down, many families and people gather along the waterfront to play, picnic and party.

231719855.name: Love the statues
231719855.author: a TripAdvisor user
231719855.reviewBody: Great artwork along the waterfront. I wish our waterfront city had statues to admire. Wear comfortable shoes along the statue side and take pictures, then cross the street and have drinks, food and shop.

230010201.name: Take A Stroll, Burn Some Megs
230010201.author: a TripAdvisor user
230010201.reviewBody: The malecon here has undergone some very nice renovations over the years.  I would even go so far as to say it one of the most beautiful in Mexico.  The carnival that is held here in the spring or each year is popular and a Mexican fiesta not to be missed.  The parade held in the evening is worth buying a seat at one of the restaurants with a balcony overlooking the main thoroughfare running parallel with the bay.  Plenty of floats and beauty queens.  As night falls the fireworks come out along with the food and beer booths.  I had to laugh when I saw one booth that was actually selling mattresses.  Bet they got a lot of business towards the end of the evening with partiers wishing to try out the product.\n\nPlenty of opportunities to burn through a few megs of pics with all the art work and statues that have been installed.  A peaceful evening stroll, when there is no carnival going on, is very much the local thing to do.

229861739.name: Nice CLEAN Malecon!
229861739.author: a TripAdvisor user
229861739.reviewBody:
I've traveled of Mexico's Malecon's and most of them are nice but either really short or dirty and abandon at parts.

But NOT  this one...it is clean and well preserved there is plenty of restaurants... and some night life..... bunch of local business and Hotels.... all in all it is a great place to got do any of these activities or just go for a walk...

228912761.name: Great place to walk and see the sights
228912761.author: a TripAdvisor user
228912761.reviewBody: A terrific ocean front walkway with views, art sculptures, access to the restaurants, shopping, and food carts that are some of the best we\'ve ever seen

228202307.name: La Paz Malecon
228202307.author: a TripAdvisor user
228202307.reviewBody:
Clean; well kept. Beautiful spot to walk.
Lots of good restaurants & art galleries within walking distance.
Nice, friendly, helpful people.
Bus depot for tourists is right on the malecon. One can take a bus there to Cabo. Very helpful tourist police.

227154665.name: Nice scenic walk
227154665.author: a TripAdvisor user
227154665.reviewBody: Our cruise took a detour to La Paz due to a hurricane. We were pretty disappoint however La Paz didn\'t let us down. Malecon is a very scenic walk the ocean is on one side and all of the shops are on the opposite side. So much to see and take in the people are very friendly and don\'t haggle you to buy anything which was a good change. You can get quite a bit of shopping done if time permits. Overall great place!

222883115.name: One of the most lovely Malecons in Mexico
222883115.author: a TripAdvisor user
222883115.reviewBody: Plenty to see and do here, the locals love to use this area for exercise.  In the evenings families are out for strolls, there are joggers and cyclists with a nice designated lane area, and street vendors out as well.  This makes for a wonderful family evening out enjoying the sunset and some brave souls even go for a swim in the 92F water.  The sands are lovely and there are plenty of amenities for restrooms, food, and more around the area.

222446172.name: The Malecon is very long in La Paz
222446172.author: a TripAdvisor user
222446172.reviewBody: The Malecon is where everybody takes a stroll in the evening. With the restaurants on the side, it is a very popular location. Unlike other more touristic towns. This Malecon is really for local families. Not much venders to disrupt your stroll, the sunsets here are fantastic.

222410135.name: I love the walking at el malec\u00f3n
222410135.author: a TripAdvisor user
222410135.reviewBody: El Malec\u00f3n is a strolling place Where you can walk along the beach.\nPeople can also use a byte to enjoyed the good weather and the peaceful place.

218788423.name: Beautiful sunsets
218788423.author: a TripAdvisor user
218788423.reviewBody: It\u00b4s a nice walk at the end of the day and there are lots of restaurants and ice cream shops to visit

218618379.name: Wonderful People
218618379.author: a TripAdvisor user
218618379.reviewBody: Unlike Cabo, La Paz is a real Mexican city with lots of culture, great authentic places to eat and the people are absolutely wonderful.

218414769.name: It is a nice walk
218414769.author: a TripAdvisor user
218414769.reviewBody: If you are there anyway, it\'s a nice walk. It felt very safe, even after dark. Nice way to walk back after dinner. I would never go so far as to call it clean. Some good taquerias.

218302719.name: View the Locals in Action
218302719.author: a TripAdvisor user
218302719.reviewBody: The Malecon is a must-do after dinner stroll for all visitors to La Paz. Seems every year, the city adds an interesting statue or other feature to make the experience interesting.

217168929.name: Sunset photo opportunity
217168929.author: a TripAdvisor user
217168929.reviewBody: The beautifully done malecon gives both locals and tourists a lovely place to spend any part of their day, but the sunsets can be a magnificent memory for your photo book.

214914106.name: Great people watching and sunsets
214914106.author: a TripAdvisor user
214914106.reviewBody: Strolling the Malecon is one of the most popular activities in the evening and on the weekends with locals and tourists alike.  It\'s a great way to soak up local culture and to find a restaurant for lunch or dinner with a view.

213143096.name: Lots of beautiful sculptures on the Malecon
213143096.author: a TripAdvisor user
213143096.reviewBody: There\'s a very nice malecon that goes along the waterfront in downtown La Paz. You can enjoy the views, the boats, and the people watching. What makes this malecon unique is all the beautiful marine life sculptures you\'ll see.\n\nAnd when you get hungry, there are plenty of bars and restaurants across the street.

213018664.name: Clean - lovely walk
213018664.author: a TripAdvisor user
213018664.reviewBody: An evening stroll, just wonderful. Saw sea eagle catching fish, vultures on the beach!\nA really nice beach resort

212050784.name: Beautiful and serene
212050784.author: a TripAdvisor user
212050784.reviewBody: Very nice boardwalk along the bay for strolls any time of the day or evening. Weekends are more crowded and not as serene, but full of energy and lots to see. Many restaurants across the street for a great meal or a cool drink. Not many good shops though.

210352996.name: Love the boardwalk
210352996.author: a TripAdvisor user
210352996.reviewBody: We had a pleasant evening watching the families walk past.  It was a very pleasant change from Cabo where the street and beach vendors can become overbearing at times.

209332473.name: Malecon (Boardwalk) is lovelier than ever.  Center of La Paz\' life.
209332473.author: a TripAdvisor user
209332473.reviewBody: My husband and I got engaged in La Paz in 2000.  We came back in 2003, and again just passing through in 2012.  The city is every bit as great as it was in 2001.  A great deal of investment has been made by the federal and state governments, and the Malecon is a big beneficiary of the funding.  Lots of lovely statues along the way, and lots of new children\'s parks.  The actual boardwalk itself has been expanded and widened.   Be sure and read the poem at the beautiful Reina del Mar statue-it is in Spanish and is very lovely.

209063264.name: An evening stroll
209063264.author: a TripAdvisor user
209063264.reviewBody: An evening stroll on the Malecon in La Paz is a wonderful experience. There are a load of families out and about, groups of young people doing what young people do without getting in anyones way. There are traders selling interesting bits and pieces but nobody is pressing or pushy so you can relax and just enjoy the cool of th evening and the calm calm sea!

206335777.name: Long, nice view and beautiful
206335777.author: a TripAdvisor user
206335777.reviewBody: it\'s the best of La Paz, the beach and the long malecon, i think it has 7 km or a lil lest, it\'s souch a nice place to walk with your husband, take his hand, so romantic. it has a nice view and the sunsets are beautiful

205407772.name: Good night activity
205407772.author: a TripAdvisor user
205407772.reviewBody: It\'s the best side walks in Mexico, you can view the gorgeous ocean, at the sun set, after it you can rent a bike or double bike and get fun there, in the night there\'s a lot of activity, very good!

205090662.name: Strolling along the Malecon
205090662.author: a TripAdvisor user
205090662.reviewBody: The Malecon is the street that goes right along the waterfront in La Paz.  There are LOTS of great restaurants, bars and shops here.  The city built a very nice walking path that follows the road.  There is a high police presence in this area and they really look after and value tourists.  Walking along the Malecon after a day of fishing & diving was an enjoyable and thoroughly safe experience.

204841200.name: LONG and Beautiful
204841200.author: a TripAdvisor user
204841200.reviewBody: Take time to stroll along the Malecon in La Paz(means peace), rent a bike, or a lie down trike!  Safe area for everyone.  Mexicans like their celebrations and there might even be one while you visit!  Dolphins are often seen playing right in front of you.  Lots of shopping across the street.  If renting a car, watch for stop signs!  Depending on which stop sign, their will be a local police officer ready to give you a "teeeeeket" if you do not stop.  Its rare to stop at stop signs but along the Malecon they are watching.  ENJOY!! and be safe!

204156213.name: Healthiest Avenue I have ever seen
204156213.author: a TripAdvisor user
204156213.reviewBody:
My favourite place in La Paz after playa Coromuel. 
In a way Malecon sort of leads to Coromuel. Palm trees, picturesque see view, people running/jogging up and down Malecon early in the morning and strolling/walking/jogging/running at like 6-7 pm, when the sun is not that hot anymore... 
There are free cocos hanging from palm trees, such a shame i was visiting too early for them to be ripe. I would definitely get at least one.
Malecon is sort of Broadway of La Paz. Many restaurants are located along this street, being only known due to their location... 
The street itself is gorgeous, with little statues, monuments, sculptures, tables containing historical/natural science facts... Incredibly relaxing.
At night Malecon turns into the place for showing off for locals. It is quite frequent to see la gente joven slowly driving up Malecon with friends in a cool car, music roaring, fun happening.
The pavement is grey and pink, very smooth for running... I enjoyed it so much, there are no words to describe.

203778753.name: Malecon attracts locals and tourists
203778753.author: a TripAdvisor user
203778753.reviewBody: The Malecon at La Paz is very well designed separating the ocean beach area from the main street.  The wide sidewalk is active with walkers, strollers, roller bladers, skate boarders and even bicycles. There is a designated bicycle lane beside the Malecon for one direction and another one on the Malecon for the other direction. There are two areas with children\'s playgrounds and plenty of ice cream shops.  At the south end there is an outdoor area with exercise equipment that was used every day by adults. The beach area is sandy but not many people swim in that area. There is a paddle board shop across the street where many people rent stand up boards.  The Pangas are lined up to offer tours to the peninsular, the islands, and the beaches. Many restaurants are located across the street.

203663607.name: Water front walk
203663607.author: a TripAdvisor user
203663607.reviewBody: Take an afternoon stroll along the harbor, there are several nice seafood restaurants to choose from.  We stopped for lunch and an ice cream along the way, viewed the boats anchored in the mooring field.  The restaurants are a bit on the expensive side so look for the smaller ones with local patrons.

203626513.name: La Paz at its best
203626513.author: a TripAdvisor user
203626513.reviewBody: LaPaz has grown steadily and progressively over the last few years.  While the city keeps saying it\'s bankrupt, they manage to keep putting funds into the Malecon - the walkway bordering the bay.  It is now extended for a couple of miles at least and is always used and enjoyed by exercisers (walking, biking, jogging, dog walking, etc.) and sightseers of all ages, abilities and nationalities.  There are very often evening events (dances and concerts) taking place at the public stages and the cleanliness and reparation continue to make us think that \'they\' care.  Use it and thank someone appropriate.  Hopefully the city will continue to see what an amazing asset they have.

203034750.name: You don\'t come to La Paz for the town
203034750.author: a TripAdvisor user
203034750.reviewBody: Look the malecon is fine and there is a great ice cream place but it\'s no Croisette or boardwalk.  By all means enjoy a pleasant stroll but don\'t be disturbed by the truly ugly sculptures and the wall to wall traffic (which is VERY kind to pedestrians so no worries there - in fact most polite drivers in Mexico, I think!).  It\'s just ordinary, that\'s all.  Not a destination.

201206317.name: A walk along the Malecon!
201206317.author: a TripAdvisor user
201206317.reviewBody: You love being able to walk along the Malecon in the morning and evening coolness.   A great time to just sit and relax and watch the people go by.  Along the way, you\'ll find shops, lots of restaurants -- stroll and enjoy.

201204268.name: Local life on the Malecon
201204268.author: a TripAdvisor user
201204268.reviewBody: Early morning watch the local keep fit folk workout on the Malecon in the evening families, young /old folk all come out to socialise and enjoy the not so hot temperatures

200270496.name: Great People Watching
200270496.author: a TripAdvisor user
200270496.reviewBody: This is a marvelous walkway on the waterfront!   It\'s the best way to get acquainted with La Paz and meet and watch her wonderfully friendly citizens.   When I\'m in La Paz, not a day goes by without a walk along the Malecon.

199935733.name: Nice breezy walkway
199935733.author: a TripAdvisor user
199935733.reviewBody: Malecon is the center of La Paz where you\'ll find a variety of restaurants, shops, and lodgings. It\'s always crowded especially on weekends and is always nice for a stroll.

199181622.name: Worth the walk.
199181622.author: a TripAdvisor user
199181622.reviewBody: This is the central draw of the city itself.  You get a good sense of the bay and there are many restaurants and bars as well as shops. We found it easy to park.  We happened to be in town for the PanAmerican triatholon which ran parallel to the Malecon.  Much fun.

198977757.name: Nice place to walk the kids or dog in the evening.
198977757.author: a TripAdvisor user
198977757.reviewBody: It\'s about four miles long and makes for a nice place to take an evening stroll. Lots of kids, dogs, skateboarders. I would recommend it after dinner.

198342364.name: Peaceful
198342364.author: a TripAdvisor user
198342364.reviewBody: Beautifully done wide space for walking. There are many benches for taking a rest. Also it has some nice sculptures. A great spot to appreciate the beauty of La Paz bay.

197962910.name: A very nice Malecon
197962910.author: a TripAdvisor user
197962910.reviewBody: We have seen the malecon in Puerto Vallarta and liked that one also, however, the malecon in La Paz is so much more peaceful - no time share vendors for one!  Beautifully done art and statues including a nice statue of Jaques Costeau looking out to sea (he said the Sea of Cortez was nature\'s aquarium).  The views are beautiful, it is clean with various seating options.  Plenty of restaurants and places to snack along the way.  Well worth the visit!

197663529.name: History in a pearl shell
197663529.author: a TripAdvisor user
197663529.reviewBody: A lovely place to visit, full of history. Also a work in progress. The Malecon provides the landscape for La Paz, and here is where you will get your bearings as you start to explore the city and the surrounding beaches and islands.

195727638.name: Sea front promenade that stretches for miles!
195727638.author: a TripAdvisor user
195727638.reviewBody: Walk along this stretch of coastline and be entranced with the sights of  locals and tourists interacting. There are Bohemian bars and caf\u00e9s and craft shops et al. Fascinating!

195605045.name: Perfect
195605045.author: a TripAdvisor user
195605045.reviewBody: The thing I loved most about La Paz is how full of life it seemed.  And I don\'t mean resort life, but actual everyday life.  And the Malecon is a big part of this.  It stretches all along the waterfront and fills up every night with people just enjoying the beauty.

195416358.name: Nice place to walk and eat
195416358.author: a TripAdvisor user
195416358.reviewBody: The Malecon is a long promenade along the sea front.  It is very pretty and has a good range of shops and restaurants along it.

194866444.name: Beautiful walk at sunset
194866444.author: a TripAdvisor user
194866444.reviewBody: Take your self and your loved ones for a stroll at sunset, can\'t be beat! Very local atmosphere, no hawkers, pleasant.

194552301.name: over 2 miles of tiled walkway at water\'s edge
194552301.author: a TripAdvisor user
194552301.reviewBody: people watching was great, especially on weekends. Lots of restaurants, cafes, bars, and shops. great views

194454865.name: People Watching on the Malecon
194454865.author: a TripAdvisor user
194454865.reviewBody: Excellent way to pass the time: Have a Margarita, Good Food, Dance a little Salsa at the Hotel Perla and Watch the Family Event of Walking the Malecon at Sundown Saturday and Sundays.  The Place to Eat Breakfast is KIWI Restruant 3 block from the Hotel Perla on the Malecon. The Benedictine Eggs are Excellent and the price is inexpensive. Breakfast is EXCELLENT.

194315061.name: Lovely promenade to walk along
194315061.author: a TripAdvisor user
194315061.reviewBody: Liked  seeing the Mexican people exercising and using it as part of their lifestyle.\n\nDisliked not much

193927506.name: The Best Malecon ever!
193927506.author: a TripAdvisor user
193927506.reviewBody: Loved walking the Malecon, it goes on forever. Lovely sculptures and little piers, gazebo and lots of benches. The best Malecon in the world.

193596073.name: Walking along the ocean
193596073.author: a TripAdvisor user
193596073.reviewBody: The Malecon was so close to the action of the city and near many great restaurants and stores. You could book any tour from there as well.

193493473.name: Beautiful bayside promenade.
193493473.author: a TripAdvisor user
193493473.reviewBody: Residents of and visitors to La Paz are so fortunate to be able to experience this lovely promenade along the bay.  Every block brings a beautiful marine-related sculpture into view, and the panorama over the harbor is pretty as can be.  Lots of benches for enjoying the view, plenty of space to walk, access to the white-sand beach, and nearby restaurants and shops make this a perfect spot for a visit.  Lucky La Paz to have had the foresight to create such an amenity for the public!

193014433.name: Near the beach in La Paz
193014433.author: a TripAdvisor user
193014433.reviewBody:
We had only hit the tip of beach walking last year so this year we could take the time to wander. 
The locals have many different activities on the beach side of the malecon. We watched a beach volleyball set, fishermen, rollerblading, biking etc.
It is a lot to explore. We were not in a real shopping mood, but the people are friendly, even the tourists. Plus there are many food cart vendors as well.
We found that the real shopping area is a few blocks down towards the town. They were brightly lit (the ones with a lot of windows) and there were some big name shops; such as Coach or name designers [I can't truly remember - as I said I wasn't into shopping 'Americano'.

192898118.name: Lovely Amenity
192898118.author: a TripAdvisor user
192898118.reviewBody: We loved walking the Malecon and taking a drink there. It got lively after dark but very serene during the day.

192451065.name: Great views and great food!
192451065.author: a TripAdvisor user
192451065.reviewBody: Enjoyable waterfront walks on the Malecon with varying views of the harbor, great sunset photography opportunities, enjoyable statues and even humorous trash cans! Multiple lively restaurants with great food and wonderful atmosphere. Sweet Ice cream shops next to great Mexican tile/ fabric and curio shops. Clean and very enjoyable. Easy access to the town\'s attractions and transport.

191830233.name: Nightly Visist
191830233.author: a TripAdvisor user
191830233.reviewBody: We enjoyed the Malecon each night before and after dinner.  Loved watching all the kids on their bikes and families together!

191092924.name: Great venue for my daily run!
191092924.author: a TripAdvisor user
191092924.reviewBody: On of the nicer Malecons I\'ve witnessed in Mexico. Beautiful design with the waterfront on one side and nice stores on the other with a nice well maintained street in the middle.

190298985.name: Malecon on New Year\'s Ever
190298985.author: a TripAdvisor user
190298985.reviewBody:
We also enjoyed our stroll on the Malecon.  We were there at 7 pm on New Year's Eve.  Because we were tired, we didn't stay until midnight.  It was very quiet at 7.  Reservations were necessary at many well known places, and many were still setting up for dinner.  Others had elaborate menus for the holiday that didn't interest my picky eater daughter.  Applebees was open, but we thought it was too much like home.  We went to a Mega grocery store a few miles away  (open New Year's Eve and New Year's Day) and cooked our own dinner.

udging from the fireworks and music we heard from our really nice b&b just outside the city (Hacienda Paraiso de La Paz), it sounded very lively in la Paz at midnight.  I'm a little sorry we were tired and missed it.

We enjoyed our early evening stroll.  As others have said, it is safe, interesting and laid back.  The few street vendors aren't pushy and don't even talk to you unless you stop and touch something.   Theg take US dollars and do the price conversions quickly and fairly.  I think the shops take credut cards.  There are many other tourists, but they are in the minority, which we liked.  It is fun to look at the people, architecture,  shops and sidewalk cafes.   We especially liked the statues on the beach.

There are a few nice gift shops with local crafts,  although I thought the selection was a little better in Todos Santos or San Jose Cabo.

189934064.name: Pretty stroll
189934064.author: a TripAdvisor user
189934064.reviewBody: Well maintained, clean waterfront promenade with lovely view of the ocean on one side and shops and restaurants on the other. We felt quite safe walking along the malecon even after dark.

189811820.name: The best part of La Paz
189811820.author: a TripAdvisor user
189811820.reviewBody: My wife and I love to stroll the malecon in La Paz, enjoying the scenery and soaking up the flavour of the town. There is a vitality here that has to be experienced, and a wonderful cross section of people out enjoying the ocean and beaches. It is a real tribute to the town of La Paz that they keep the malecon so clean, and are constantly updating and extending it. Highly recommended if you want to experience Mexico at its best!

188092100.name: Nice walk
188092100.author: a TripAdvisor user
188092100.reviewBody: If you want a nice walk, the Malecon its really a nice walk, its clean and you will always se the ocean. Friendly people.

187926568.name: Nice walk
187926568.author: a TripAdvisor user
187926568.reviewBody: Good place for a stroll, enjoyed by visitors and locals are alike. Safe and clean. You can ride bicycles as there are assigned lanes for riders.

187219381.name: the heartbeat of la paz
187219381.author: a TripAdvisor user
187219381.reviewBody: there appears to be something unique to the malecone here that i, and my other guests, had not experienced in other coastal cities in mexico. there is a rhythm of life by the sea that you tap into that is truly dynamic and infectious, walkers, joggers, fisherman, divers, the bay and birds, and sea life, couples and groups, young and old, from all walks of life come here to celebrate their life in la paz. what an incredible amenity this city has provided its citizens and guests, spend lots of time here. my hotel las gaviotas overlooks a vast stretch of the malecone, keep that in mind!!!!

186654699.name: The Malecon on a Sunday afternoon...
186654699.author: a TripAdvisor user
186654699.reviewBody: Walking on the Malecon on a Sunday afternoon is a great way of getting in touch with the local\'s customs. After learning some Spanish at El Nopal, you may as well be able to get your way around and have some great fun!

185436300.name: WOW....Spectacular  Walkway   on  the  Bay!
185436300.author: a TripAdvisor user
185436300.reviewBody: Usually  can\'t  wait  to get  to La  Paz   so I  can stroll  along  the malecon  with  our  standardpoodle,  with    the  wind in our  hair...the  pleasant  smell   in   the  air...heaven.    Very  safe  and  dog   friendly...just  pick for   sure!    I   so   look   forward  to  be  here  again,  it  makes  me  feel  so  free.
