185216125.name: Center Stage for La Paz
185216125.author: a TripAdvisor user
185216125.reviewBody: Lovely stroll along the water front in the heart of this city is a great to start and or finish your day.

184925805.name: Fun walk along the water
184925805.author: a TripAdvisor user
184925805.reviewBody: Malecon is nicely done. Clean and safe. Interesting bronze statues dot the whole road. People walking here are friendly. Nothing like Cabo where they try to sell you something at every stop. Here you see mostly locals just taking a nice relaxing leisurely walk. Lots of restaurants along the road. It\'s fun to do this walk even every evening!

184643229.name: strolling or a workout
184643229.author: a TripAdvisor user
184643229.reviewBody: this is a lovely stretch along the bay of LaPaz waterfront district. Lots of restaurants, I recommend TailHunter & Fubar Cantina, and night entertainment spots with shops interspersed along the way.

183976208.name: Fun place to walk
183976208.author: a TripAdvisor user
183976208.reviewBody: Great place to walk by the water. Goes pretty far and you can see all that goes on in La Paz. Interesting statues...great opportunity for pictures!

183846016.name: Great people watching
183846016.author: a TripAdvisor user
183846016.reviewBody: Families, friends, and couples seem to stroll the Malecon in the evenings.  And exercising.  Lots of restaurants here.

181735383.name: Nice evening walks
181735383.author: a TripAdvisor user
181735383.reviewBody: We have stayed at the Marina Hotel several times and enjoy the mile and a half walk to LaPaz central on the Malecon.  It is good exercise and well lit for evening walks.  There are many people out running, jogging, roller blading, skateboarding, bicycling, walking, etc.  it is very safe with many families out with their children especially during holidays.  There are beautiful sunsets and bountiful opportunities for excellent photos.  The only negative things I could say are sometimes people don\'t pick up after their dogs and there are some spots in the walk ways where tiles are missing and you have to watch your step.

181077383.name: Our favorite thing to do in the evenings is sit on the Melacon and people watch
181077383.author: a TripAdvisor user
181077383.reviewBody: Love the Melecon and walk along it several times per day and in the evening we love to just sit on one of the many benches and people watch.....we have walked all the way from La Concha hotel to Vista Coral, what an awesome view every step of the way....

181004985.name: Good safe and beautiful walk
181004985.author: a TripAdvisor user
181004985.reviewBody: My wife and I enjoyed walking the malecon each day or evening. Weekend evenings are very fun if you like to people watch. It seems the whole town comes down to the malecon on these nights. Very family oriented.

180990570.name: a nice walk
180990570.author: a TripAdvisor user
180990570.reviewBody: The La Paz Malecon is a much nicer walk than the beaches in San Jose del Cabo or Cabo San Lucas.  Hotels don\'t encroach on the beach and there are many good restaurants and shops on the other side of the Malecon

180269700.name: The atmosphere here is always so family oriented
180269700.author: a TripAdvisor user
180269700.reviewBody: We love watching people run, bike, skate, walk.....have a good time.  The atmosphere is so relaxing, it doesn\'t matter the time of day.  Nighttime is always the best.  There\'s always so much to do.

179374642.name: Wonderful Place to Walk!
179374642.author: a TripAdvisor user
179374642.reviewBody: This beachfront that stretches from one end of La Paz to the other, is a terific place to spend some time strolling upon. The city has placed many sculptures along the way. The weekends offer many events and act as a central location for car shows and other exhibits.

178758157.name: Great spot!
178758157.author: a TripAdvisor user
178758157.reviewBody: The Malecon in La Paz is a great spot!  You could walk for miles and it\'s flat.  Close to all the restaurants and shops and a great place for sunsets!

177351603.name: Great place to Stroll
177351603.author: a TripAdvisor user
177351603.reviewBody: Great place to people watch as the sun goes down. lots of bars and restaurants line the bay, so grab a margarita and enjoy.

176388849.name: Great view and sunset
176388849.author: a TripAdvisor user
176388849.reviewBody: If you travel to La Paz, dont miss to enjoy the great Sunset from El Malecon eating "mariscous" with the local people.

172385456.name: Take a stroll down the Malecon
172385456.author: a TripAdvisor user
172385456.reviewBody: The Malecon is where everyone goes in the evening to exercise and relax. Locals and tourists blend well and its is always a show on the weekend evenings.  Shops, Restaurants and houses all blend in to make a safe wonderful place.  Jonathan Roldans Tailhunter Bar & Grill are on the Malecon and have one of the best view spots available on the second and third floors.\n\nLa paz is a very safe and Laid Back Town not to be missed.

170777165.name: Take a walk in the Malecon
170777165.author: a TripAdvisor user
170777165.reviewBody: It\'s a nice way to look at the most turistic places in La Paz. Malec\u00f3n is the main street where you can find restaurants of all kind of foods, stores, coffee shops, and also you can watch lovely sunsets each day!

170638496.name: Fun and peaceful summer evening strolls
170638496.author: a TripAdvisor user
170638496.reviewBody: Locals hang out and bring their children at sunset to the Malecon in La Paz. Children at play, couples at coupling, families at familying, all under the sound of the ocean waves and a pleasant breeze. During weekends, it gets all too crowded and jammed with people looking for action. But the ice cream parlors are still busy and people smile everywhere. I know this sounds like an extremely biased/ subjective review, but it is a real picture of what you will see on a summer evening at the Malecon. Enjoy!

170561234.name: The world is alive in the evening
170561234.author: a TripAdvisor user
170561234.reviewBody: The Malecon makes for a fantastic evening stroll with a beautiful view, interesting statues, and people watching galore. The world is alive at night!

166742850.name: Fun and Relaxing
166742850.author: a TripAdvisor user
166742850.reviewBody: The malecon was a great experience.  The vendors were friendly and not pushy like some of the other places in Mexico.  The food was great and we felt very safe and comfortable walking around at any time.

165601624.name: To see and to be seen
165601624.author: a TripAdvisor user
165601624.reviewBody: The Malecon is a great place either  to the locals as to the  tourists. Every morning my husband and I went to Malecon to do jogging or to walk around. We could see that the population uses all the 5 km of Malecon.

165222865.name: Where the whole town meets
165222865.author: a TripAdvisor user
165222865.reviewBody: The malecon is  a wonderful 3 .5 mile long boardwalk. During the day it is not very crowded. As soon as the sun starts going down it becomes a lively "paseo" where young and old, rich and poor gather to spend time, having ice cream or just hanging out, enjoying what  seems so rare nowadays, a community feeling and a spectacular sunset!

161285289.name: A beautiful walk or ride!
161285289.author: a TripAdvisor user
161285289.reviewBody: \nThe malecon is right on the bay, wide enough for walkers and bike riders to share. Lined with palm trees, flowers, and sunshine!

161081212.name: Malecon   La Paz
161081212.author: a TripAdvisor user
161081212.reviewBody: Very nice & clean waterfront (bay) setting.  Popular locals family attraction.Several good restaurants.

161021840.name: Follow the Malecon brick road
161021840.author: a TripAdvisor user
161021840.reviewBody: We stayed in La Paz for three days at the Hotel Perla, which is located on the Malecon. This boardwalk sort-of path is wide and accommodating for tourists, joggers, residents, and anyone just strolling through the bustle of La Paz. It is very well maintained and stretches the length of the main street. We noticed it was a place for people to enjoy the day, watch the sunset, hang out on the beach; and is conveniently located across from dozens of restaurants, bars, and little shops. It is also safe to walk at night!

160825964.name: Night lights!
160825964.author: a TripAdvisor user
160825964.reviewBody: The Malecon offers 2 very unique experiences. During the day this is a popular location for fitness courses, sports and day time tourism. At night it comes alive with local artists, little souvenir stands and delicious street food! Locals bring their families to enjoy the cool fresh breezes coming off the bay while the tourists come to here to get a taste of the night life. This is family friendly location that is well lit and constantly policed, ensuring both locals and tourists the confidence and safety to enjoy themselves without worry.

160004601.name: Malecon walk
160004601.author: a TripAdvisor user
160004601.reviewBody: My husband and I took a nice walk along the malecon just before our dinner at Stella\'s Restaurant which is right by the downtown marina....great food and ambiance at Stella\'s BTW, but walking on the malecon is always a nice thing to do for beach lovers!

158993554.name: It\'s an Every Day Thing
158993554.author: a TripAdvisor user
158993554.reviewBody: La Paz has done a marvelous job of maintaing the Malecon for it\'s visitors and us locals.  It is wonderful to see families out on a Sunday evening

158775568.name: Locals strut their stuff
158775568.author: a TripAdvisor user
158775568.reviewBody: The Malecon is a major attraction for local La Paz citizens. It draws runners, in-line skaters, walkers and people watchers.\nThe city has done a wonderful job beautifying it with lovely works of art.

157356425.name: Easter Sunday attraction.
157356425.author: a TripAdvisor user
157356425.reviewBody: We walked the length of the Malecon several times on Easter Sunday, followed by a couple of beers watching the crowds go by.  Numerous Mexican families all enjoying the festival.  As the sunsets the views towards the mountains become quite spectacular.  A great way to pass a few hours and an essential activity for any visitor to La Paz.

157061788.name: Nice walks and people watching
157061788.author: a TripAdvisor user
157061788.reviewBody: Great place to walk, especially at night, no matter what day there are people running, walking, biking or just enjoying the beach at night.  Great place where locals hang out.  It\'s safe and no vendors bother you.

156884563.name: Backbone of La Paz for Locals and the few Tourists
156884563.author: a TripAdvisor user
156884563.reviewBody: This is where we were able to see the faces of La Paz as we walked to restaurants and other spots.  Many restaurants on the Malecon and shops are scattered along as well though most are a block or two off the strip. Local gatherings as well as music are often found to entertain you. Stopping for cocktails to watch the sunset you will see couples, families with little ones riding bikes, folks exercising, or just enjoying this beautiful coastal setting.

156266289.name: Lovely day and night, incredibly safe and a glimpse of real Mexico+
156266289.author: a TripAdvisor user
156266289.reviewBody: I\'ve been to a lot of Malecons (waterfront streets) in Mexico and La Paz\'s has always been my favorite.  It\'s long, clean, with wide walkways, chock full of public art and very authentic.  Since arriving in La Paz, I\'ve walked it at various times of day and night and it\'s always fun.  It\'s relatively quiet during the day, especially weekday afternoons, with tiny white-sand beaches with palapas on the water side and plenty of restaurants and ice-cream parlors on the inland side.  At night the malecon really comes alive with what appears to be the entire city out to stroll, bike, in-line skate, skateboard, enjoy ice cream, hear music etc.  Although La Paz is a tour destination, 99% of who you will see on the Malecon are locals enjoying their lovely city.  For those of you who are afraid to come to Mexico because of exaggerated reports in the media of drug wars and crime, I can tell you that in La Paz you are more likely to get run over by a young child riding a tricycle on the Malecon than getting mugged.

155267961.name: Always interesting
155267961.author: a TripAdvisor user
155267961.reviewBody: La Paz makes a great effort to make sure there is always something interesting going on at the beach front. Wonder to walk it in the morning or evening. The restaurants and bars on the other side of the street are right there if you need refreshment.

154867493.name: Fantastic Views of the Bay of La Paz
154867493.author: a TripAdvisor user
154867493.reviewBody:
Located right in the Town of La Paz the Malecon has
something for everyone - Young & Old.
Guitar music fills the Air every Saturday
evening.

154658729.name: Promenade The Malecon
154658729.author: a TripAdvisor user
154658729.reviewBody: The City 0f La Paz invested time and money to make a board walk for the locals and visitors. The Malecon is the place to be. The city inhabitants all like to walk, bike and rollerblade on the Malecon. Art work and benches along the entire length of the Malecon. Don\'t forget to buy an ice cream or frozen fruit bar. They are to die for.

154541553.name: 3 miles of easy walking.........
154541553.author: a TripAdvisor user
154541553.reviewBody: A perfect place for a long walk next to the beach without worrying about traffic other than a few bikes now and again....day or night it is lovely!

154049427.name: Great place
154049427.author: a TripAdvisor user
154049427.reviewBody: It was windy when we were there but the walk along the malecon is wonderful.  The art work and shops are very nice.

153890260.name: clean and fun to walk
153890260.author: a TripAdvisor user
153890260.reviewBody: cleanliness of La Paz with great restaurants lining the boardwalk.  Lots of families safely enjoying the fun walking along the water boardwalk.

153725829.name: Lovely boardwalk
153725829.author: a TripAdvisor user
153725829.reviewBody: The Malecon is amazing- people everywhere, plus shops and dining.  Everyone is very friendly and the atmosphere is calm.  Kids skateboard and bike, but they are very respectful of space.  People run or walk or dip their feet in the water.  It\'s a wonderful public area.

153605384.name: One of the Most Beautiful Spots in the World
153605384.author: a TripAdvisor user
153605384.reviewBody: The Malecon of La Paz is one of my favorite places to relax and watch the world go by. It\'s beautiful scenary and interesting to watch the locals and tourists enjoy this stretch of ocean with beautiful art work along the way.

153403169.name: La Paz\' Malecon rocks!
153403169.author: a TripAdvisor user
153403169.reviewBody: This is one of the BEST seaside malecon\'s Mexico offers. The paved, 12 foot wide strolling path probably runs 6 miles through town! Local families use the path as do the teens, lovers, seniors and Gringos!  You will see strollers to walkers, giggling kids, skate-boarders and artists. Entrepreneurs selling candy, balloons and cotton candy, toys and trinkets all along the way abound but are not intrusive. When annual Carnaval happens, the Malecon becomes mobbed with people, music, rides, games and costumes - very  is fun to see!

153402189.name: Great for exercise
153402189.author: a TripAdvisor user
153402189.reviewBody: We walked it in the morning for exercise and were fascinated with the sights.  Go in the morning before it gets too warm (watch out for the bicycles).  In the evening, it is a different animal, but just as enjoyable.  The locals are out strolling, just enjoying the sunset, the local vendors, the restaurants, and each other.

153243793.name: great place to walk along the ocean
153243793.author: a TripAdvisor user
153243793.reviewBody: Not to be missed. Everything you need is nearby. Food, people watching, relaxation on the waterfront.  great for a stroll after a meal out.

153232037.name: Nice walk
153232037.author: a TripAdvisor user
153232037.reviewBody: Malec\u00f3n is a nice place to walk and the view is fantastic. At this season the weather is a little cold, so bring a sweater to enjoy the Malec\u00f3n.

153093580.name: Beautiful!
153093580.author: a TripAdvisor user
153093580.reviewBody: This is one attraction not to miss! We love La Paz..it is BEAUTIFUL! We love to take a Sunday drive from Cabo to La Paz..The beaches are amazing! The Malecon is a wonderful beach walk. There are restaurants and attractions all along the boardwalk..There are lovely sculptures! I can\'t wait to go back!

152813485.name: Long with lots of businesses and sea views
152813485.author: a TripAdvisor user
152813485.reviewBody: Nice wide sidewalk for walking/running. Dedicated bike lane. About 3 miles long from water park to other end. Plenty of restaurants, although not my favorites in La Paz, which are Corazon Cafe and Azul Marina.  I ran the Malecon several mornings. Plenty of walkers/runners/cyclists out.  Get there early to avoid exhaust fumes as cars have no emissions.

152787047.name: Stunning views from Vista Coral to Costa Baja
152787047.author: a TripAdvisor user
152787047.reviewBody: About 5 miles of paved walkway,  decorated with unique statues, and\nunobstructed views of the Mogote peninsula, the Sea of Cortes, and in the distance Isla Espiritu Santo.  Perfect for a leisurely stroll or a serious workout.  Bike lane runs along side

152745813.name: every sunset is worth the visit
152745813.author: a TripAdvisor user
152745813.reviewBody: there\'s not a whole lot to do in la paz (though there are plenty of day trip options), but walking the malecon to view the beautiful harbor and sunsets is completely worth the trip. beautiful.

151099353.name: It is basicly just a walk along the front of the main street that runs along the water\'s edge.
151099353.author: a TripAdvisor user
151099353.reviewBody: I enjoyed walking along the malecon....would I go to La Paz based on that...no.  This time of year the weather is better in San Jose del Cabo, but I will probably go back to La Paz for the festival that starts Feb. 7th. I am told the malecon fills with tens of thousands of people.

151053760.name: Wonderful sunsets!
151053760.author: a TripAdvisor user
151053760.reviewBody: You can go forever on this paved waterfront walkway.  A fun, safe way to hang out with the locals.  Interesting sculptures along the way.  Great photo opps.

150379625.name: Take a walk
150379625.author: a TripAdvisor user
150379625.reviewBody: Great place to walk in the sun and ocean breeze.  Very clean, and La Paz people are so friendly.  Don\'t miss La Fuente ice cream shop opposite the ferry pier, Bismarckcito restaurant further toward the beaches, and Tailhunter restaurant (great ambience) further yet.

150134822.name: What a great addition to the waterfront...!
150134822.author: a TripAdvisor user
150134822.reviewBody: Very nice tiled long boardwalk along the waterfront in La Paz..  We spent alot of time walking this.  Wonderful sunsets from here.  Lots of beautiful bronze sculptures.  Rent a bike or take your skates!  Very wide and well maintained.

149999038.name: Take a stroll
149999038.author: a TripAdvisor user
149999038.reviewBody: Lots to see along this very long boardwalk. Restaraunts and bars to chose from and watch the sea. Also nice beaches along the malecon.

149891455.name: Wonderful to get excercise and see the bay and city
149891455.author: a TripAdvisor user
149891455.reviewBody: Beautiful sculptures, very serene, wonderful people.  A memorable way to see the Bay, thw Sea of Cortez, and the City of Peace.

149574996.name: Terrific Public Sculpture
149574996.author: a TripAdvisor user
149574996.reviewBody: La Paz doesn\'t have a whole bunch of art galleries as do a great number of tourist destinations -- a good thing because tourist galleries are so often tacky and overpriced. nstead, it has beautiful public sculpture all up and down its Malecon waterfront which is a joy to behold.

149267804.name: Great place in the evening!
149267804.author: a TripAdvisor user
149267804.reviewBody: Wanna get some shots of the best sunsets you will ever see? Take a stroll down the Malecon in the evening and catch some fresh air and beautiful sunsets!

149133568.name: Great fun at night
149133568.author: a TripAdvisor user
149133568.reviewBody: We visited the Malecon a few times at night, there are lots of great restaurants nearby. It is not very busy in January so many of the night clubs were not open when we went. Lots of people were riding bikes so it\'s pretty safe.

148758542.name: great new addition to a coastal city
148758542.author: a TripAdvisor user
148758542.reviewBody: La Paz did a great job here.  The renovation along the beach front is done very well.  There are bicycle lanes, charming sculptures, and lots of room to walk, even during Christmas week, and easy access to shops and restaurants.  Rent a bike but watch out...along much of the route the walkway has no fence...best to stay on the bike lanes on the road.  We felt safe throughout the day and evening.  Not many interfering vendors either.

148709312.name: Great views/shopping and restaurants
148709312.author: a TripAdvisor user
148709312.reviewBody: La Paz is a great friendly city with few tourists and lots to do.  It is more difficult to get to than Cabo, but worth the extra time/$ for travel.  Only Alaska flys now from LAX, and that flight is scheduled to be cancelled soon. Volaris from TJ is a good option, or thru Cabo with a 2 1/2 drive north.

148598662.name: Great Beach Boardwalk
148598662.author: a TripAdvisor user
148598662.reviewBody: One of the best scenic beach boardwalks. The Malecon is a scene from a favorite movie or any memory that gives you a warm feeling. A stroll along here opens up possibilities of holding hands with a lover or the opportunity to dine, shop or play along any encounters you find along the businesses and streets that fall into the board walk.

148400973.name: A walk along the sea
148400973.author: a TripAdvisor user
148400973.reviewBody: Whether it\'s called a promenade, boardwalk or strand, I always love having these kind of places to walk along the water.  This is the way Cabo should have been.  La Paz means Peace and that is what you get. No hawkers hassling you every step of the way like in Cabo.  La Paz had a bit of a tired look to it, but the sculptures and tile designs are a nice addition to the waterfront walkway. \nGo and enjoy the walk!

148104535.name: A beautiful long walkway
148104535.author: a TripAdvisor user
148104535.reviewBody: The walkway fronts the city of La Paz. It\'s around 6 metres or 20 feet wide with several courtyards off the main malecon. It\'s completed in an attractive tile with some unique designs. At night it can be quite hectic with skateboarders, cyclists, low-riding bicyles and roller skaters. The malecon is clean but it needs some upgrading in places. We\'ve still given it a 5/5 for La Paz. Definitely, the heart and sould of the city.

147961738.name: The Heart of La Paz
147961738.author: a TripAdvisor user
147961738.reviewBody: The Malec\u00f3n is truly the great heart of this waterfront city.  There are several small cafes alongside, and on the opposite side of the boulevard are just dozens of restaurants and shops.  It is dotted with numerous sea-related sculptures.  Joggers, walkers - with or without dogs, children in recumbent bicycles, everyone is out enjoying the Malec\u00f3n.  It was never deserted at any hour that we were awake!  If  your  hotel is not on the Malec\u00f3n, you\'ll want to head that way every day!

147956095.name: walk til you drop
147956095.author: a TripAdvisor user
147956095.reviewBody: The Malecon provides a safe environment for walking at night. It gives great views of the Bay of La Paz and access to a variety of eating/drinking establishments

147805342.name: Great walk...
147805342.author: a TripAdvisor user
147805342.reviewBody: Walking along the Malecon is a most do. Small shops around and fish tacos and ice cream along the way. Highly recommended when staying in La Paz.

147499230.name: What a gorgeous boardwalk
147499230.author: a TripAdvisor user
147499230.reviewBody: The city of La Paz did a great job to create such a beautiful Malecon.\nContrary to the mainland, it is absolutely safe at night, VERY CLEAN, wonderful natives who makes you feel welcome in their country. Plenty of nice restaurants, lots of entertainment from beach volleyball to Mariachi music.\nEven in Summer it is NOT to hot and the evenings / nights are pretty comfortable.

147337160.name: peace, beauty and tranquility.
147337160.author: a TripAdvisor user
147337160.reviewBody: The malecon in La Paz is so peaceful and tranquile.... no timeshare sales people or vendors.  The whole area is spotlessly clean and very pretty, the water being so clear and sparkling. Would have loved to spend more time there.

147157582.name: The best thing La Paz has done for itself!
147157582.author: a TripAdvisor user
147157582.reviewBody: We live in Cabo San Lucas and while we love it here and appreciate what it has to offer, we are always tempted to move north to LaPaz, in large part because of the Malecon!  Take note politicians!  It\'s the perfect place to enjoy the  sea and the peace of the La Paz bay.  There is always activitity - walking, biking (the new bike lanes are helpful but not always used) skate boarding, etc.  Obviously the locals love their malecon and we visitors do too.  I\'m a jogger and jogging in Cabo is almost impossible.  On the LaPaz malecon I go crazy and can jog unimpeded for miles.  They could use one last extension to the La Concha Hotel but given time I\'ll think they\'ll get it.  Also, the water is noticeable cleaned up.  Not sure if they got a handle on sewer treatment, but the seaweed on the beach problem is nil, fish are swimming, birds are happily eating.  Bottom line...we love it, thanks!

146704828.name: Awesome
146704828.author: a TripAdvisor user
146704828.reviewBody: Offered memorable morning and evening walks (and great shopping / dinning) beautiful views and unbelievable picture opportunities. A vacation we will never forget

146521032.name: Something for everyone
146521032.author: a TripAdvisor user
146521032.reviewBody: The city of La Paz really did it right on this one. This walkway along the shore is a place for the people. For tourists, for locals, for families, for everyone. There is often something interesting going on that you can view for free but no matte what time of day or night it is a welcoming, safe place to walk, roller skate or bicycle. Really nice

146154111.name: Fantastic
146154111.author: a TripAdvisor user
146154111.reviewBody: You must walk along the malecon, specially on sunset. Enjoy an ice cream or "agua fresca" along with their sculptures and people on their bicycletes, rollerblades or just walking their dogs. Great bay view!

145691116.name: Walkway
145691116.author: a TripAdvisor user
145691116.reviewBody: Great place to walk at night or during the day. Very safe and peaceful for a 2-3k walk. Great site seeing and taking in the local\'s.

144979888.name: walk
144979888.author: a TripAdvisor user
144979888.reviewBody: The malecon was really done well and clean and nice for the whole of the beach and town and many people of all ages use it.  We enjoyed seeing the beautiful sunset from the malecon.

144871902.name: Overrated
144871902.author: a TripAdvisor user
144871902.reviewBody: I\'d heard so much about the famous Malecon, and was very disappointed. The road itself, like all of La Paz, was deeply potholed in places. So bad in one spot, that only one of four lanes were passable! The beach itself was covered in seaweed

143780765.name: What a gem
143780765.author: a TripAdvisor user
143780765.reviewBody: This lovely walkway, frequented by local families, was a vibrant window into the local life and people. We truly enjoyed the evenings and sunsets from the Malecon.

143581011.name: A great walk, day or night
143581011.author: a TripAdvisor user
143581011.reviewBody: This is a very long, well-maintained brick walk along the water front of La Paz.  On the weekends, many of the locals bring their families down and stroll, run, or bike up and down the Malecon.  Food, music, exhibits, vendors, and people watching all combine to make a memorable experience.

143366076.name: Leisure strolling
143366076.author: a TripAdvisor user
143366076.reviewBody: Great views of the sea and often saw dolphins feeding at sunset.  The art pieces are beautiful, especially the mermaid.  Sunsets are so very colorful and everyone is very friendly.  Good place for exercise.  I walked on the shore side one way and back on the store side....great gift shops.  Also view Wylands wall on the shop side.  He an amazing sealife artist that has done walls all over the world.

143081121.name: Malecon
143081121.author: a TripAdvisor user
143081121.reviewBody: beautiful view and friendly atmosphere. Nice to see familys join together and walk the malecon and play on the beaches

142662035.name: The happening place.
142662035.author: a TripAdvisor user
142662035.reviewBody: The Malecon is the heart of La Paz. There is always something going on there. During the day there are joggers, walkers and cyclists enjoying the sea breezes. In the evenings and on weekends the families come out to enjoy people-watching, exercise and perhaps a meal at one of the many restaurants all along the sea-front. During Carnival it is where the action is, with stalls for eating and buying, and grandstands for entertainment. La Paz wouldn\'t be La Paz without the Malecon.

142603830.name: La Paz Malecon
142603830.author: a TripAdvisor user
142603830.reviewBody: Probably the most impressive part of La Paz is the Malecon. Upon first site you feel you are in an authentic Mexican town....and you are.  Like many coastal Mexican pueblas, they pave the walk along the sea for their residents to enjoy meeting their friends, stop for a bite, roller blade, jog, or just walk.  It\'s a wonderful thing, and it is particularly wonderful here in La Paz to do just that.  Busy all the time, it really comes to life at night, completely buzzing with chatty locals, getting their exercise while socializing.  It is so much fun to just sit and watch it all go by.  They\'ve made all sorts of improvements to the Malecon....more whimsical sculptures, safer sidewalks, recycle trash cans in the forms of sea creatures, better lighting, etc.  There are palapas on the beach for daytime sunbathing, but the water is not that appealing with all the boats right there in the water.

141880655.name: my husband and I walk this often
141880655.author: a TripAdvisor user
141880655.reviewBody: Its a great place to meet friends just walking on a Friday night and a great place for everyone to ride their bicycles. There is lots of artwork along the walk. Coconut palms that will supply you fruit in the winter, great place to launch a Kayak too but you better have good skills if you do this in the winter you fight the north wind. If there is a festival its happening on and near the malecon its the hub.

140069510.name: El Malecon
140069510.author: a TripAdvisor user
140069510.reviewBody: The people of La Paz are VERY friendly and helpful, no pesty vendors. Beautiful view of the Sea at every time of day.

136761505.name: Night
136761505.author: a TripAdvisor user
136761505.reviewBody: While the gift shops and delicious food make this a great stop during the day, it just comes alive at night. I felt very safe and loved La Cantina, Catrina, and the Jungle.

134585936.name: Love the Malecon!
134585936.author: a TripAdvisor user
134585936.reviewBody: It is so nice to just sit at Tailhunter\'s Fubar Cantina and watch the families come out each evening to  "cruise" the Malecon.  They come on foot, bicycles, roller skates, in cars and the backs of pickup trucks!  It\'s just great family fun!

134221341.name: Great fun
134221341.author: a TripAdvisor user
134221341.reviewBody: The Malecon becomes a great deal of fun once the sun goes down. Fine restaurants and the local people are out in large numbers and obviously enjoying themselves.

134034525.name: La Paz\' "living room"
134034525.author: a TripAdvisor user
134034525.reviewBody: The Malecon is a wide sidewalk that separates the main downtown street from the Bay of La Paz and it is the PERFECT place to watch the famous La Paz sunsets. In the evening it comes alive with local families and tourists - if you visit La Paz don\'t miss this experience!

132776879.name: Into running/Walking
132776879.author: a TripAdvisor user
132776879.reviewBody: As a runner, this is the place to enjoy early morning exercise, fish jumping as you move along, beautiful sea and greetings to all the other walkers/runners/dog walkers.  The Malecon is very clean and peaceful at all times of the day.

132494256.name: EVERY SEA SIDE CITY SHOULD BE LIKE THIS!!
132494256.author: a TripAdvisor user
132494256.reviewBody: Wow. So much to see & walking is good for you. I\'d like to know the history of this great idea !! Enjoy!

131951725.name: Gorgeous sea promenade
131951725.author: a TripAdvisor user
131951725.reviewBody: La Paz is a pretty clean city, but the Malecon is almost spotless.\nThe beautiful sculptures, the many shops and restaurants and especially the very friendly people gives a comfortable atmosphere. It is a pleasure to walk along, enjoy all the great impressions and most of all, feel absolutely safe. Safer than any place "up north".

131941755.name: only the best in mexico, period
131941755.author: a TripAdvisor user
131941755.reviewBody: I don\'t have all day to spend on this, I told it like is is and if you don\'t like it too bad, adios  How dare you tell me how many character to use,! You loose, bye by

131194977.name: Heartbeat of La Paz
131194977.author: a TripAdvisor user
131194977.reviewBody: One can spend hours, morning, noon or night, walking, dining, enjoying the Malecon of La Paz.

130630132.name: Lots of fun
130630132.author: a TripAdvisor user
130630132.reviewBody: Walked the Malecon and enjoyed the people watching

130593159.name: lovely place to stroll
130593159.author: a TripAdvisor user
130593159.reviewBody: The people watching is terrific. Early morning brings out the joggers, dog walkers and bike riders. Late afternoon and evening the families and the little kids and the lovers take over. Sometimes it gets crowded, but everyone is enjoying themselves and happy. The water is clear and beautiful.  The handsome collection of whimsical nautical themed sculptures is terrific. The beach is white powder. The best thing about the Malecon is how clean the City keeps it. Even during Carneval, every morning, the street was pristine and litter free. There must be an army of elves that tiptoe in during the night and clean the street until it sparkles again. Very impressive.

130453969.name: Great place to walk
130453969.author: a TripAdvisor user
130453969.reviewBody: There is always something going on on the Malecon. Everyoine in town seems to walking on the Malecon when the sun goes down. Everyone always seems to have that relaxed look and a big smile on the face

129783096.name: The Malecon Que Bueno!
129783096.author: a TripAdvisor user
129783096.reviewBody: The cleanlisness, feeling of safety, The Valdadores de Papntla

129653278.name: A throwback to "Old Mexico".
129653278.author: a TripAdvisor user
129653278.reviewBody:
First, La Paz is a very safe city.
Second, the Malecon is well policed.
Third, The Malecon is well lighted and is the focal point of the city.

Sooooooo........... why wait, you need to go and enjoy a stroll along with the rest of the city.

129146924.name: A peaceful stroll...
129146924.author: a TripAdvisor user
129146924.reviewBody: The La Paz Malecon is just like the name says...peaceful. The boardwalk stretches for what seems like miles. Maybe this is because you just seem to stroll along at your own pace while enjoying the sound of the water next to you. It doesn\'t take long walking along the malecon to work up an appetite...it is lined with so many restaurants full of people, you just don\'t know which one to choose! Found this great sushi place at the entrance to the malecon. I know I know - Sushi in La Paz?? yep and it was the best sushi I\'ve ever had!

128073415.name: Absolutely beautiful
128073415.author: a TripAdvisor user
128073415.reviewBody: Great place to see sunrises, sunsets, walk & view the beautiful scenery & friendly residents of La Paz

128018003.name: The best entertainment in La Paz
128018003.author: a TripAdvisor user
128018003.reviewBody: We went to the Malecon every evening of our stay. We had fond memories of it from a trip we made over 15 years ago and it lived up to them - no problem. Walking the Malecon is a wonderful way to enjoy a bit of Mexican culture and get some exercise! Being by the water is delightful and the people-watching is totally entertaining. If you do nothing else in La Paz, do visit the Malecon!

127776917.name: One of the Most Beautiful in Mexico
127776917.author: a TripAdvisor user
127776917.reviewBody: I am a local.  The Malecon is great to walk and feel safe in La Paz.  There are many shops to shop in and food to eat.  The city has done a great job with the design, lighting, trash cans, bike trail and benches all along the Malecon which stretches about 3 miles along the beach and water front.  There are many social events that take place here on a regular basis mostly during the weekends but some during the week.  The culture is alive with the people of La Paz and their families enjoying what they deserve.  There is also many attractions set up for children. At night during the weekend bumper to bumper cars parade and when there is something to celebrate it always takes place on the Malecon.  Go enjoy and don\'t sit in your hotel room go walk the Malecon.

127551189.name: Great!
127551189.author: a TripAdvisor user
127551189.reviewBody: We visit the Malecon regularly and it is beautiful with lots to do. It\'s a great place to watch the sunset or go for an evening stroll as the lights from the city start coming on. It\'s also great during the heat of the day and be sure to stop and get some ice cream at La Fuente.

127548388.name: malecon stroll
127548388.author: a TripAdvisor user
127548388.reviewBody: We walked the malecon and lunched at a cantina along the way. We enjoyed watching the unique bird life frequenting the bay, including egrets, herons, and the numerous pelicans. The bronze sculpures along the malecon are a beautiful example of the pride of the local people in their wonderful community.

127413114.name: Always a palapa open on the beach
127413114.author: a TripAdvisor user
127413114.reviewBody: There are no vendors harassing you here. The school kids liked to practice their English with us and many stopped to chat. We didn\'t see alot of other tourists and their was always a palapa available on the beach to relax in some shade. The Malecon is long and is wonderful for relaxing evening strolls. Felt very safe here.

127086445.name: Empty but cute!
127086445.author: a TripAdvisor user
127086445.reviewBody: We were there in the beginning of March and expected more activity, but didn\'t see many people. We were either there at the wrong time, or La Paz is just a sleepy town. Either way, make sure you get ice cream at the polka dot tree on the Malecon. It\'s the perfect way to top off a delicious dinner.

126748301.name: Enjoy the essence of LaPaz and Baja life
126748301.author: a TripAdvisor user
126748301.reviewBody: Enjoy your exercise with a stroll along the Malecon where you can observe the interaction of all segments of the LaPaz community and its visitors. In the morning you can jog and in the evening you can photograph your memories of the magnificent sunsets.

126597773.name: Great stroll
126597773.author: a TripAdvisor user
126597773.reviewBody: The waterfront stroll in La Paz is worth the visit. Five kilometers of ceramic tile walkway with various piers and docks. Lots of stores and restaurants. Great place to people watch.

126508032.name: Main artery of travel
126508032.author: a TripAdvisor user
126508032.reviewBody: a natural walking route for watching people and beach activities. runs a couple of miles so a good running zone as well. But do plan to get off the Malecon to see the authentic Mexican city, only a few blocks off the waterfront boulevard.

126393308.name: Very Safe to walk at night
126393308.author: a TripAdvisor user
126393308.reviewBody: My wife and I walked the Malecon each night after our late dinners and enjoyed seeing both tourists and locals doing the same thing.

125888549.name: Great place to walk.
125888549.author: a TripAdvisor user
125888549.reviewBody: Much of La Paz is cobbled and beset with huge cracks in the sidewalks. The Malecon provides a flat walking surface, free of hazards. We tried to move across town on the Malecon, using it as a landmark (along with the beach) as we ventured into La Paz. Loved walking the Malecon early in the morning and during sunset.

125677229.name: Pretty and Laid Back
125677229.author: a TripAdvisor user
125677229.reviewBody: Liked to eat an ice cream cone and stroll down the Malecon at sunset...beautiful. Dislikes? It\'s not a big deal but not being able to go into the water--its not really a beach but a promenade, rocks in the water, etc.

125529868.name: Lots to see and do.
125529868.author: a TripAdvisor user
125529868.reviewBody: Many shops and small restaurants to discover. Fair prices and very authentic. Photographers dream! Hidden areas to discover and beaches are beautiful.

125110429.name: Nice Stroll
125110429.author: a TripAdvisor user
125110429.reviewBody: I really think that getting out and walking (or running) along the Malecon is one of the better things to do in La Paz.  It is a great place to people watch and to get away from the city traffic.

124988526.name: Beautiful seaside stroll
124988526.author: a TripAdvisor user
124988526.reviewBody: This is the highlight of La Paz. The malecon is a wonderful place to take a walk anytime.

124931476.name: Carneval
124931476.author: a TripAdvisor user
124931476.reviewBody: My husband and I were in La Paz for Carneval.  The malecon is definitely a happening with all the booths and a lively parade.

124721275.name: waterfront full of kids and plus-size people
124721275.author: a TripAdvisor user
124721275.reviewBody: great ice cream - nice at sunset for one round and then you go home

124721267.name: long
124721267.author: a TripAdvisor user
124721267.reviewBody: great place to walk or run, with beautiful sight and lots of attractions

124635887.name: just a great walk any time of day, lots to see and very friendly locals
124635887.author: a TripAdvisor user
124635887.reviewBody: I would get up earlier than my hosts often and go down and walk along the Malecon, you see lots of wildlife, even though it is a port. It is clean and you can grab a great coffe here and there while walking or fish off the one of the piers, I got skunked but who cares!

124555765.name: Beautil place
124555765.author: a TripAdvisor user
124555765.reviewBody: What a beautiful place, lots of good vibes and harmony. People in La Paz  really take care of there city, Its clean and they are having a lot of fun. No rush, Makes me think that you need not much to be really happy. \nThanks

124504958.name: long and beautiful
124504958.author: a TripAdvisor user
124504958.reviewBody: I the view is beautiful. It is across the street from many restaurants\nand shops.

124151134.name: Great feature of La Paz
124151134.author: a TripAdvisor user
124151134.reviewBody: You won\'t miss this one, it is the energy center of La Paz. Stroll the tiled walkway, shop across the street, eat and party in the many venues. It is all here for you!

123937616.name: A family attraction with great seafood
123937616.author: a TripAdvisor user
123937616.reviewBody: We loved walking along the waterfront, looking at the sculptures and watching the families strolling or cycling down the wide promenade.  Across the street are great restaurants.  Our favorite was Bismarkcito, with an open front to the street and waterfront plus the freshest seafood ever.  Our waiter Oscar made us feel right at home, and we went back on Sunday for paella.  Great!

123874782.name: walk walk walk -
123874782.author: a TripAdvisor user
123874782.reviewBody: this is a beautiful walk - you can go either way and still have wonderful views - I have walked the length numerous times - just bring good shoes - and when carnival is happening - GREAT !!!

123426401.name: People watch the citizens and families walk, run, exercise and have fun.
123426401.author: a TripAdvisor user
123426401.reviewBody: Watch the Pelicans and Wading birds in the Sea of Cortez

123268447.name: Great seawalk
123268447.author: a TripAdvisor user
123268447.reviewBody: Exceptionally long and very clean. Lots of evening strollers. Lots of good restaurants.

122848776.name: Peaceful just like the name
122848776.author: a TripAdvisor user
122848776.reviewBody: Loved strolling the malecon amidst the families at dinner time.

122624472.name: People watching fantasy
122624472.author: a TripAdvisor user
122624472.reviewBody: In La Paz on the Malecon for Fiesta, thousands of people, loads of delicious street food, cold cerveza, banda music, magic acts, crazy vendors. A night to remember

122007285.name: Running along the malecon
122007285.author: a TripAdvisor user
122007285.reviewBody: It\'s around 5 km end to end and back. Since we were first there in 2003 and had to dodge the construction and unmarked holes in the brickwork and pavement, it\'s now complete and beautiful. If your seriously focussed on your running, however, be forewarned that you\'ll likely be distracted by the ambient beauty of the water, the beach and the sea life as you run.

121865335.name: Best walking and views.
121865335.author: a TripAdvisor user
121865335.reviewBody: I love walking on the malecon next to the bay.  Friendly people and beautiful views.

121476840.name: A sunset not to be ever forgotten.
121476840.author: a TripAdvisor user
121476840.reviewBody: Watching the sunset on the Malecon is what happiness is.

121462676.name: Beautiful ocean front walk
121462676.author: a TripAdvisor user
121462676.reviewBody: I liked the wide path and the overall happiness on the faces of people walking and exercising.

121301519.name: Goes on forever
121301519.author: a TripAdvisor user
121301519.reviewBody: The malecon is right at the water\'s edge and is great for strolling, walking, jogging, or just enjoying people watching and the fabulous views of the bay and the surrounding mountains.  There are benches all along the malecon to rest or just meditate, and in the evenings is well lit.  You never feel unsafe or uncomfortable.

120249400.name: A beautiful testament to this city.
120249400.author: a TripAdvisor user
120249400.reviewBody: What a lovely way to grace the waterfront.  I can\'t believe how clean the Malecon was and how so much detail went into creating a magical walk.  I loved the garbage cans with sea turtles, and the beautiful sculptures.

119414392.name: Great walk along the water
119414392.author: a TripAdvisor user
119414392.reviewBody: It had great views of the water, and the downtown area, and had some souvenier shops.

116995488.name: Pleasant and bustling with real charm
116995488.author: a TripAdvisor user
116995488.reviewBody: Beachfront boardwalk: This is not a tourist attraction - it\'s a real place people go to enjoy the sea and the evening. Lots of good restaurants, and food vendors along the way. No street vendors shoving unwanted trinkets in my face. People strolling around eating, chatting, relaxing all through until late night. I never felt unsafe. Grab an ice cream and enjoy the ambiance. Good for all levels, from a date, family, solo, or kids.

650194019.name: Great view!
650194019.author: a TripAdvisor user
650194019.reviewBody: Beautiful contrast of colorful desert mountains with a tropical sea. The tour allows to stay for a few hours to relax, eat and enjoy the beach.

613953621.name: Paradise on earth!!
613953621.author: a TripAdvisor user
613953621.reviewBody: We didn\u2019t want to leave:( Amazingly clear and warm water. You cand do a little bit of snorkeling. Only reachable by boat.

573850051.name: Fantastic beach
573850051.author: a TripAdvisor user
573850051.reviewBody: Amazing colors of the water combined with the rocks. Shallow and transparent water, but cold. It is accessible only by boat but it is a must see

556023427.name: Simply relaxing and pretty
556023427.author: a TripAdvisor user
556023427.reviewBody: We got to spend our time here while others snorkeled in open water. Danny tours left us with snorkel gear and we got a kick out of snorkeling in the shallows. We got to see angel fish, a puffer fish, and an octopus.

551491302.name: Great Beach, Great Snorkeling, Wild Rock Formations
551491302.author: a TripAdvisor user
551491302.reviewBody: One of our favorite stops in Baja. Great beach for beach walking, swimming and snorkeling.  Plenty of marine life can be found.  Water clarity was excellent. Water temperature was cool, but we did not need wet suits. Fascinating rock formations can be seen by touring along the coast via boat. No services are located here.  Highly recommended.

545077471.name: Beautiful beach!!
545077471.author: a TripAdvisor user
545077471.reviewBody: We stopped here for lunch on the beach.  The snorkeling was amazing all along the rocks on the side of bay - be sure to bring your camera!  Great for kids because the water is very shallow.

537525305.name: One of the best!!!!
537525305.author: a TripAdvisor user
537525305.reviewBody: I have visited many places, but I must say this particular beach it\'s like a hidden gem in the middle of the sea of Cortez. I visited this place on two different tours during a quick lunch stop and both times were breath taking. You can go near by the rocks to see few corals and find plenty of fishes. I went with Alonso tours and the guide highly emphasized the importance of leaving the ecosystem alone; meaning DO NOT TAKE ANYTHING FROM THE BEACH AND DO NOT FEED THE FISHES!!! which not many tour operators care about the environment as long as they make money. My tour offered umbrellas and we were able to sit back and relax on the shade to admire the tranquil waters. The boat ride was nearly over 2 hrs.

502310581.name: You need a boat to get here and its worth it
502310581.author: a TripAdvisor user
502310581.reviewBody: Ensenada Grande its a beach on Espiritu Santo Islan. If you are in La Paz its a must to do thing. We hired Espitiu Baja Tours, to do the Islan tour and they are the best. They are located on the Malecon Alvaro Obregon 2130-D. They always give us great price and service, Tell them Carlos sent you.

445015537.name: Beautiful "three lobed" bay
445015537.author: a TripAdvisor user
445015537.reviewBody: Visited Ensenada Grande with our UnCruise tour. Beautiful white sand beaches, excellent snorkeling, and great for stand up paddleboard and kayaking since bays are shallow with white sand bottoms for the most part and somewhat sheltered from the wind. We shared our beach, the large central one, with other day tours, but were not crowded at all. Definitely worth a visit!

668694462.name: Beautiful location for a market
668694462.author: a TripAdvisor user
668694462.reviewBody: Happened upon the church by going to the Saturday market just across the street from it and what an amazing view.

659763294.name: Sweet cathedral
659763294.author: a TripAdvisor user
659763294.reviewBody: Very sweet little area with a garden and museum across the street.  Nice cool place to rest out of the sun in this sweet little town.  Feels very safe and laid back.

659162285.name: Stop and see.
659162285.author: a TripAdvisor user
659162285.reviewBody: Lovely cathedral, nice stained glass and statues. Mass times were 0700, 1000, 1700, 1830, & 2000.  Very nice service with choir.

657278512.name: La Paz Cathedral
657278512.author: a TripAdvisor user
657278512.reviewBody: We explored the city of La Paz and went to this cathedral and it is a beauty.  It is on the square a couple blocks  up off the Malecon.

653767623.name: Orphanage ciudad de los ninos y las ninas
653767623.author: a TripAdvisor user
653767623.reviewBody: Within the cathedral complex is this lovely orphanage. Bring gifts and love and giggles! We spent a day eating treats doing magic and puppet show....laughter giggles and an unforgettable day in la paz b4 swimming with turtles dolphins and whales!

651262261.name: Small and Average
651262261.author: a TripAdvisor user
651262261.reviewBody: This is a fairly small and average church by central/ south American standards. Not really worth a special trip to see it.

648852372.name: Very nice
648852372.author: a TripAdvisor user
648852372.reviewBody: I am huge fan of histroicql churches and this one is very nice. Wood ceilings and a real sense of the construction period

633799686.name: Catedral de Nuestra Se\u00f1ora de la Paz de Baja California Sur
633799686.author: a TripAdvisor user
633799686.reviewBody: I was so thankful that I could visit this beautiful place on a Sunday morning. I heard the choir singing and the bells ringing as the congregation was gathering and I stopped to look at the items the nuns were selling out front. I sat in the back of the sanctuary for a few minutes and it was an awe inspiring experience. If I wasn\'t on a timeline to get back to Cabo I would have stayed through the entire service. Even as a Protestant Gringo I felt welcome.

633281466.name: Interesting local cathedral close to downtown and the Malecon
633281466.author: a TripAdvisor user
633281466.reviewBody: We happened to be there for a wedding ceremony, which was very moving. It\'s close to everything and worth a stop to admire.

632267177.name: Beautiful Attraction
632267177.author: a TripAdvisor user
632267177.reviewBody: Really lovely open air cathedral.  Worth the walk from the malecon.  It is impressive.  The gift shop is very nice too.

631094837.name: Worthy of a visit
631094837.author: a TripAdvisor user
631094837.reviewBody: We\u2019ve been here a couple of time and really enjoy the Cathedral and the town square across the street.

629680776.name: Beautiful old cathedral
629680776.author: a TripAdvisor user
629680776.reviewBody: Charming old cathedral in the center of La Paz with a nice plaza in front. Easy distance walk from downtown.

622869076.name: Excellent hotel
622869076.author: a TripAdvisor user
622869076.reviewBody: Amazing hotel shame about the location, I wouldn\'t recommend to stay there for two weeks! Definitely hire a car and get out and explore the coast! The breakfast was great, the pool was cold but great roof top views!

608132374.name: Beautiful
608132374.author: a TripAdvisor user
608132374.reviewBody: A great see in LA Paz. The old mission with it\'s beautiful stained glass windows. The building brings you back to the early 1800s

607844878.name: Nice church!
607844878.author: a TripAdvisor user
607844878.reviewBody: We visited the La Paz Cathedral on our last trip.  There\'s a nice park across tha street where you can sit and relax

606448020.name: So much history!
606448020.author: a TripAdvisor user
606448020.reviewBody: At the centre of La Paz is this old, historic building full of tradition.  Our Lady of Peace Cathedral was originally built in the 18th century and a must see while in La Paz!

591763074.name: Quiet Space
591763074.author: a TripAdvisor user
591763074.reviewBody: We had a short visit to this church in La Paz. It was quiet and cool. A nice respite from the streets of La Paz. We enjoyed our time in this holy space.

589844421.name: Simple, Peaceful Cathedral
589844421.author: a TripAdvisor user
589844421.reviewBody: A modest cathedral across from the Plaza. It is not too large or ornate provides a peaceful refuge from a hot day sightseeing.

588519147.name: Quaint cathedral.
588519147.author: a TripAdvisor user
588519147.reviewBody: Very pretty cathedral in the heart of La Paz. A short walk to the park and restaurants. Interesting bit of history.

587573829.name: Historical cathedral
587573829.author: a TripAdvisor user
587573829.reviewBody: Once we got downtown, first thing we visited was this beautiful old cathedral. We did go inside and mass was being held. I would really like to hear a presentation on its history and other significance, but otherwise it\u2019s a don\u2019t-miss spot.

578694381.name: Can\u2019t miss the beautiful Cathedral
578694381.author: a TripAdvisor user
578694381.reviewBody: I love the location and structure of this Cathedral. You can walk around it\u2019s plaza and straight to Malec\u00f3n. There\u2019s a coffee shop at the corner of the Cathedral with great coffee. You have pharmacies, ice-cream shops and all kinds of stores. \n\nUnfortunately, we were able to enter the church because they were preparing for a wedding but, it was great to at least see from outside. You get a very peaceful feeling when there.

575501630.name: You cant miss it
575501630.author: a TripAdvisor user
575501630.reviewBody: The good thing is that you can easily find close to Malecon and in the city center. very interesting architecture and what\'s more its nice place to hide in hot hot day from sun

574461622.name: Visit
574461622.author: a TripAdvisor user
574461622.reviewBody: Simple, well kept and the center of town...worth the walk there and maybe to sit in the park if hot!\n

572729787.name: Wish there was more information about the Cathedral
572729787.author: a TripAdvisor user
572729787.reviewBody: The Cathedral is easy to find, just a few blocks up from the Malecon in La Paz.  What you see is what you get - it\'s a church.  We looked for info about its history inside the church but did not find any.  To the left of the main entrance, there is an interesting historical marker that, surprisingly, is in English and notes some significant dates in la Paz history from the arrival of Cortes onward.

561597641.name: Stunning cathedral
561597641.author: a TripAdvisor user
561597641.reviewBody: Gorgeous cathedral, just a few blocks up from Malecon. Stained glass is beautiful. Fascinating history. Picturesque facade. Worth a visit, especially for anyone who is interested in the California missions. Plan 30-60 minutes to appreciate the whole thing...although you can do a quick perusal in less time.

558382855.name: Great History
558382855.author: a TripAdvisor user
558382855.reviewBody: While walking around La Paz we stopped in to look at this historical building. While I gave it 5 stars it\'s not for the attraction so much as for the history. We have traveled up & down the west coast & have always enjoyed stopping in at the missions & church\'s. It gives you an insight to the area. Worth a quick stop to soak in the past.

558296040.name: Nice church with much history.
558296040.author: a TripAdvisor user
558296040.reviewBody: Walking along the backstreets of La Paz you\'ll find this nice little church that has very nice architecture and a little plaque on the outside with a brief history.

557911735.name: In the heart of the city
557911735.author: a TripAdvisor user
557911735.reviewBody: Love walking thru old Churches and this is no exception  many tourists stop there. Beautiful ceilings

547880452.name: Our church
547880452.author: a TripAdvisor user
547880452.reviewBody: I was married here in 1996 after getting permission from the church. I met and fell in love with a woman from La Paz and the church was perfect. We visit every trip and recommend everyone go in. I have been to almost all the church\u2019s on the peninsula and some are more\nRustic but this is a well attended and beautiful place. It is in the center of old town and worth going to

547028579.name: Beautiful and historical
547028579.author: a TripAdvisor user
547028579.reviewBody:
A must to visit in La Paz,
beautiful with a warm flair inside.
You are allowed to go in whenever you want 
In the middle of the center
Close by the Malecon boulevard

544876168.name: Beautiful, historic
544876168.author: a TripAdvisor user
544876168.reviewBody: This is a large Catholic Cathedral, rebuilt in 1835, the original was finished in 1692 taking 70 years to complete.  There is an office where we were able to purchase a mass for a friend who had just passed away.  Very friendly people, beautiful cathedral.

538695991.name: Local history..
538695991.author: a TripAdvisor user
538695991.reviewBody: Worth a visit when touring La Paz. Some nice stained glass windows but has quite a modern feel to it..

536901703.name: Nice historic building
536901703.author: a TripAdvisor user
536901703.reviewBody:
Pretty inside and outside, nice bell concert. At Christmas they have classical concerts with multi- colored lights, very festive. 

Across from the church is the 'Casa de Gobierno' where they often have really interesting expositions, like now it's about fishing (free entry)! 
The plaza in front of the church is a great place to relax & watch people. There are shoe cleaning stands and when there is the Farmer's Market on Tuesdays & Saturdays (10am - 1pm) there are also stands at the plaza.

534201035.name: Compared to other Baja churches, Naaa.
534201035.author: a TripAdvisor user
534201035.reviewBody: From the outside, this is really a nice church. I like the twin bell towers and the outside has that solid, rustic look that are so typical of mission architecture. From the outside it\'s really impressive.\n\nHowever, the inside is anything but. Although the stained glass windows are nice, overall the church is very light on opulence. The religious art and decorations are very sparse. The front of the church has a large cross and some simple religious art. However, there is nothing out of the ordinary, in terms of the church\'s all around interior. It did not leave me in awe. Just slightly interested. However, being that it is La Paz\'s oldest church, it\'s a place everyone should at least stop by to visit, so they can say they have been there.

522708964.name: Beautiful History
522708964.author: a TripAdvisor user
522708964.reviewBody: It was a nice experience. Very pretty inside and historical. People were in there praying, so just have to be respectful of them.

510692845.name: Beautiful Cathedral
510692845.author: a TripAdvisor user
510692845.reviewBody: Nice architecture, reminds me of Spain, on a hot day, the cathedral is cool inside; area gets busy on Sundays.

494994677.name: Beautiful Catholic Church
494994677.author: a TripAdvisor user
494994677.reviewBody: Went to mass. It was very well attended. Wish there had been a better posting online about mass times.

493136739.name: Beautiful Cathedral
493136739.author: a TripAdvisor user
493136739.reviewBody: We went to a farmers market and happened upon this building. What looked like a double wedding was happening, so we only walked around the outside of the building. It\'s a great example of architecture from the time period around 1860.

486109173.name: Beautiful piece of history
486109173.author: a TripAdvisor user
486109173.reviewBody: The Cathedral was beautiful. I almost hated taking some pics in there. It was very old but worth seeing\n

485201633.name: Nothing special.
485201633.author: a TripAdvisor user
485201633.reviewBody: Under renovations. Not wonderful. Don\'t waste your time here. Very plain. Not much to see here. There, 100 characters!

484214402.name: No need to go out of your way
484214402.author: a TripAdvisor user
484214402.reviewBody: A small and unassuming cathedral.  Downtown La Paz is not particularly impressive, the town is not my top choice for cultural landmarks.   If you are in the area you would find the cathedral difficult to miss.

481133981.name: Important Landmark
481133981.author: a TripAdvisor user
481133981.reviewBody: one of the church towers dates back to the 16th century.  Spend some time here.  It\'s a Holy Place.  Read the plaques. Wander inside and out.  It\'s a cornerstone of devotion for all the people of La Paz.

479587472.name: Cathedral
479587472.author: a TripAdvisor user
479587472.reviewBody: La Paz Cathedral is definitely worth a visit.  Beautiful inside and out.  It was quiet and peaceful inside.

478300997.name: Nothing Too Special
478300997.author: a TripAdvisor user
478300997.reviewBody: We were unable to walk inside because they had a service in progress when we stopped by.  We only took a peak from the doors.  Nice Cathedral and the plaza in front is nice to sit and have a cup of coffee.

477791482.name: Interesting place to visit.
477791482.author: a TripAdvisor user
477791482.reviewBody: One of the oldest church in La Paz, nice to see the original construction and know the history .If you are staying in Los Cabos or in San Jose, be ready fro a long road trip.

473435350.name: Beautiful and welcoming
473435350.author: a TripAdvisor user
473435350.reviewBody: The cathedral was only a block away from our hotel, El Angel Azul, and across the street from a lovely square. The door seemed to be open all the time except after 9:00PM or so. Stop in and say a prayer, or attend one of the *many* masses offered daily in Spanish.

473240830.name: Beautiful cathedral on the square
473240830.author: a TripAdvisor user
473240830.reviewBody: We walked all over the area and loved going inside the cathedral for a look. It is peaceful and quite lovely. Nothing more to it really than just looking around or sitting in a pew to cool off or pray in silence.

470562901.name: Churches and Cathedrals
470562901.author: a TripAdvisor user
470562901.reviewBody: We always like to visit places of worship though out the world just for the beautiful architecture! Beautiful exterior with a plaque explaining the churches history. A service was in progress so we just peeked inside and the interior and stained glass was gorgeous.

468986120.name: Christmas Eve mass
468986120.author: a TripAdvisor user
468986120.reviewBody: This church was directly across the street from the hotel we were staying at. It was Christmas Eve the day of our arrival, so we had the privilege of experiencing a traditional catholic service in this very old church. It\'s full of old tradition, and clearly represents many generations of faith. The bells ring every hour, which makes it retain its charm. Beautiful brick work makes it a special church to visit.

467815070.name: Worth a Look
467815070.author: a TripAdvisor user
467815070.reviewBody: When you are wandering the downtown area, the cathedral is one place you will want to include on your list of places to see. As with many towns established in the Spanish tradition, you will have the church, plaza mayor/principal and government buildings all located together and it is like that here. Take time to read the historical plaques at the front. The interior will give you a chance to pray, meditate or reflect on the impact that religion has on a culture.

466661224.name: Worth a visit but not very memorable
466661224.author: a TripAdvisor user
466661224.reviewBody: The church and plaza across the street create that small Mexican town atmosphere, and the exterior of the church is attractive. The interior is interesting in that the stations of the cross are all captioned in English. It is a rather plain interior, but you can spend a few peaceful minutes here.

465903237.name: Beautiful misdion
465903237.author: a TripAdvisor user
465903237.reviewBody: This is a very pretty mission. The outside is well maintained and they are working on the inside. Beautiful stained glass windows and just a lovely place. Well worth the visit.

465456510.name: Lots of weddings happen here on the weekends.  Nice church bells
465456510.author: a TripAdvisor user
465456510.reviewBody: Beautiful old Cathedral with lots of history. Seen quite a few wedding parties here over the years.  Lots of color in the family wedding settings here.

464140107.name: Beautiful cathedral
464140107.author: a TripAdvisor user
464140107.reviewBody: Beautiful cathedral in the zocalo. However found it very strange that as soon as we walked in a lady was begging us for money.

459907785.name: are you Catholic?
459907785.author: a TripAdvisor user
459907785.reviewBody: The best church to pray, a nice church to visit, in the center of the town, enjoy and pray! This is a blessed country!

457777456.name: Beautiful in heart of la paz
457777456.author: a TripAdvisor user
457777456.reviewBody: Beautiful cathedral in city center , lovely build and open for everybody. When you visits la Paz just have a look, its like most of the cathedrals always beautiful . What else \ud83d\ude00

456590337.name: A Good Thing to Visit Among the Not Too Many Things to See in La Paz
456590337.author: a TripAdvisor user
456590337.reviewBody: We like churches, so visited this one.  Scenic setting in the square and interesting melange of rock types to make it.  Not much history available for the Spanish-challenged.  Pretty plain but interesting inside.  You are not here to see what churches in Spain or Italy look like.  It is county-esque but sincere and nice vibes inside.

454056685.name: beautiful bells
454056685.author: a TripAdvisor user
454056685.reviewBody: As I stayed in a hacienda two blocks away, I could hear the church bells each day. It reminded me of the cultural roots of this small ocean centered community. The Cathedral is the epicenter of community life.

452669325.name: Must see!
452669325.author: a TripAdvisor user
452669325.reviewBody: This catherdral is one of the oldest in La Paz. It is beautiful and definitely a must see! The jardin across the street is a wonderful place to sit in the shade and watch the world of centro go by!

447330301.name: Great service for Christmas Eve
447330301.author: a TripAdvisor user
447330301.reviewBody: Lucky to be there for this special service. Luckily got there early so we could sit. Service at 10 and by 9:50 it was SRO. beautiful church.

445475968.name: Love history
445475968.author: a TripAdvisor user
445475968.reviewBody: Great place to sit and revitalise after walking the malecon. Always awed by churchesan this one is so impressive in its own understated way.

444098198.name: Glad we stppped
444098198.author: a TripAdvisor user
444098198.reviewBody: Beautiful cathedral decorated for Christmas. Open during the day so travelers and locals can come in for a quiet look or prayer.

443179769.name: Deserved More Time
443179769.author: a TripAdvisor user
443179769.reviewBody: We were on a bus tour that dropped us off at the Cathedral and Plaza de la Constitucion for 15 minutes (then dumped us in a jewellery store for an hour).Impressive 19th Century mission church. Was able to take a quick look around. I liked the tower clock because it kept alive my streak-of all the tower clocks I\'ve seen this trip (5), not one had the correct time ;-) Maybe they\'re on different time zones, for the tourists.

427042860.name: Beautiful
427042860.author: a TripAdvisor user
427042860.reviewBody: The Cathedral was a stop on our walking tour with Red Travel. Our guide Hugo told the story of its architecture and construction. Worth a stop even without the tour\n

424895646.name: Stunning
424895646.author: a TripAdvisor user
424895646.reviewBody: The history here is amazing. Your guide will explain which parts of  the cathedral had to be rebuilt due to hurricanes. Its not St Peters Basillica in Vatican City but amazing none the less.

415890933.name: Casual sight-seeing
415890933.author: a TripAdvisor user
415890933.reviewBody: Rather enjoyed the simplicity of this cathedral as it contrasts favourably, in my opinion, with the conspicuous opulence of many. In an attractive setting, near markets, shopping, coffee shops, street vendors.

409850455.name: Historic Mission Church
409850455.author: a TripAdvisor user
409850455.reviewBody: Just a few blocks off of the Malecon sits the historic Catedral de Nuestra Se\u00f1ora de La Paz. Old structure, was built from 1861-1865. Very nice inside. Catholic church is a quiet place out get out of the heat. Right next to Jard\u00edn Velasco, a nice one block park.

396922618.name: Quick stop is all you need
396922618.author: a TripAdvisor user
396922618.reviewBody: Dont waste a lot of time here, a quick stop is all you will need.  The architecture and old world charm make it a nice visit.

380407605.name: The corner stone of this Mission Church was laid circa1861
380407605.author: a TripAdvisor user
380407605.reviewBody: Jesuit Father Jamie Bravo founded the permanent Mission of La Paz in 1861, This old mission church (Cathedral) has been well maintained and is worth a visit when in La Paz. Catholic mass, in Spanish, is available several times each Sunday.  I have attended Mass several times at the Cathedral, the most recent was this past Sunday. It is certainly worth a visit.

379487090.name: Wedding
379487090.author: a TripAdvisor user
379487090.reviewBody: We were privileged to attend a friend\'s wedding in this beautiful cathedral and would recommend a visit if you are walking through the city.

373681337.name: History at its best
373681337.author: a TripAdvisor user
373681337.reviewBody: Very beautiful and serene cathedral. Exterior a mix of stone from the area. Interior simple, clean white, beige and gold.

371323234.name: Purple Stone Church - Pretty Stained Glass
371323234.author: a TripAdvisor user
371323234.reviewBody: The Cathedral is constructed of stone of a pale purple - mauve - which gives the building an unusual pleasant appearance.   The church is less ornate than some others in Mexico, but still possesses architectural elements common to many cathedrals.   The stained glass windows are quite attractive.   The stone plaques outside the front door briefly describe the history of the area and the cathedral.   This is nothing exceptional but worth a visit as you tour La Paz.

370762011.name: Peaceful oasis
370762011.author: a TripAdvisor user
370762011.reviewBody: I generally head for the main church when visiting a town, and all too often I find it locked.  The Cathedral in La Paz was open each time I dropped in, and is a welcome piece of old-world Mexico in the central square of a busy town.  With coffee bars and a pleasant park outside the church, it is well worth a visit.

370151430.name: Historic
370151430.author: a TripAdvisor user
370151430.reviewBody: Don\'t spend a lot of time here, its a nice site, not a lot to see off the beat and path.  Nice History, pretty anticlimactic.

366135932.name: Very Interesting Visit
366135932.author: a TripAdvisor user
366135932.reviewBody: We stopped here during our tour of La Paz. The Church architecture and history are very interesting. We enjoyed our visit here.

365769694.name: simple but authentic
365769694.author: a TripAdvisor user
365769694.reviewBody: basic architecture, both outside and in.  It was OK, though not alluring enough to spend more than 10 minutes; the walk to & from was not particularly appealing.

365465512.name: Tour of Cathedral
365465512.author: a TripAdvisor user
365465512.reviewBody: This Cathedral is small and a mixture of old and new.  It is worth a visit while in La Paz, best to take a tour of La Paz and see some other local sites.

361356156.name: Worth visiting
361356156.author: a TripAdvisor user
361356156.reviewBody: Not extraordinary, humble place, where people go in crowds. We visited the Cathedral on Sunday, just before the noon. It was more than full, the service was going on - all impressive and nice to see and hear. Neatly decorated interior.

351213923.name: Catedral de Nuestra Senora de la Paz: Peaceful Site
351213923.author: a TripAdvisor user
351213923.reviewBody: During our brief visit to La Paz as part of a day-long tour from Cabo san Lucas, our Esperanza\'s Tours La Paz Encounter tour stopped here. We were able to enjoy the sanctuary and take photographs of the interior and exterior. This is a well-kept building. The skylight in the sanctuary is unique. The ceilings are beautifully arranged. The naves are beautiful. The cathedral is on one side of La Paz\u2019s main square, Velasco Garden.

350640456.name: Interesting historical Cathedral
350640456.author: a TripAdvisor user
350640456.reviewBody: One of the top places to visit in La Paz and easy to find. If your lucky a tour group will be there and you can listen in on the history which adds to the Cathedral. Important part of the community and worth visiting if you are here.

346866987.name: Quiet
346866987.author: a TripAdvisor user
346866987.reviewBody: Not a grand or imposing cathedral, but it felt very "sincere." There\'s a bit of interpretive history nearby, and it\'s on the way to a walk to the local English-language bookstore. Worth a stop, especially for the faithful, to enjoy the religious experience and a sense of the local history and culture.

346595284.name: Lots of History
346595284.author: a TripAdvisor user
346595284.reviewBody: We went here on a tour. Great history and it seems well cared for. This was built by the Jesuits when they came into Mexico and we were given history of what they did while there.

339039215.name: Worth a stop
339039215.author: a TripAdvisor user
339039215.reviewBody:
We have seen many cathedrals in Mexico and this is not the best, nor the worst but it is a beautiful church, both inside and out. In fact, the outside is very simple but there is a simple elegance inside with its yellow domed arches and white trim. 

There are two plaques commemorating the founding of La Paz, the city - English on the left; Spanish on the right. The cathedral dates to 1861 making it rather modern since Hernan Cortes first set forth in 1535 and the town was officially called "Our Lady of Peace" in 1683.

There is a beautiful zocalo across the street as well.

338779099.name: Nice and simple Cathedral
338779099.author: a TripAdvisor user
338779099.reviewBody: It sits at one side of the town square and is very basic and simple but was worth a 5 minute photo opp and peak inside. Nothing like other Cathedrals you may be thinking of or what you see in Europe but nice local culture.

335831198.name: See it
335831198.author: a TripAdvisor user
335831198.reviewBody: It\'s not overly fancy, but it is sincere and soulful - very locally spiritual.  Worth a few minutes to get there and a quiet, meditative visit.

335135590.name: Interesting Cathedral
335135590.author: a TripAdvisor user
335135590.reviewBody: This cathedral is small and fairly plain compared to other cathedrals I have seen.  It is lovely, none the less.  The statues and decor in Catholic churches are always interesting to me.  The square in front of the church is nice as well.  There are benches and it serves as a community gathering place.

334804849.name: Not the most ornate or impressive church in Mexico by far ... but OK for a quick look.
334804849.author: a TripAdvisor user
334804849.reviewBody: Not the most ornate or impressive church in Mexico by far ... but OK for a quick look. There are more interesting things to see in La Paz.

334695955.name: Very old casual church
334695955.author: a TripAdvisor user
334695955.reviewBody: this is normal church, not flamboyant.  If your looking for a cathedral this is not it   But it is a nice spot to learn about the culture
