328838985.name: Beautiful Cathedral in the central part of town.
328838985.author: a TripAdvisor user
328838985.reviewBody: Beautiful to see. It is a must if you are in LaPaz. So much history. I have to admit. I have been to Europe and have seen some amazing churches.This is probably a sanctuary for the people of Mexico as a community.

326921447.name: Nice cathedral worth a quick visit
326921447.author: a TripAdvisor user
326921447.reviewBody: Pretty stained glass windows, small and intimate. There was a lovely tiny chapel with individuals praying. The altar had flowers very pretty well maintained. \n\nClose to shopping and city building

317991638.name: la paz city tour
317991638.author: a TripAdvisor user
317991638.reviewBody: the cathedral was beautiful.  did not have enough time in there to see all the statues.   we were rushed by our tour guide.   excursion offered per princess cruise

291894991.name: Beautiful cathedrl
291894991.author: a TripAdvisor user
291894991.reviewBody: This is a beautiful old cathedral and should be of interest to folks that like historical buildings.  It is magnificent

285055253.name: Beautiful
285055253.author: a TripAdvisor user
285055253.reviewBody: The cathedral is beautiful. We stopped in to take some photos and came across a christening. In fact, they were christening a number of people of all ages, from baby to senior citizens. It was quite moving and interesting to watch.

266152009.name: The centerpiece of La Paz
266152009.author: a TripAdvisor user
266152009.reviewBody: Despite the exterior\'s larger scale the interior of the cathedral is small and intimate.  Really lovely.

263615282.name: Nothing special
263615282.author: a TripAdvisor user
263615282.reviewBody: It\'s worth a look if you are passing by, but it\'s nothing special so don\'t go out of your way to see it.

263490263.name: Very Plain as Cathedrals Go
263490263.author: a TripAdvisor user
263490263.reviewBody: I have visited Catholic cathedrals in many different countries and this one has to be the most unadorned cathedral I have ever seen.  This is not a criticism, just a fact.  A short visit of 10 minutes will be enough.

261370690.name: Lovely
261370690.author: a TripAdvisor user
261370690.reviewBody: I\'m fascinated by the devotion to churches and cathedrals in Mexico. Their devotion to living a blessed life is beautiful. The detail in all Mexican churches shows their love so I can never say enough good about visiting any Cathedral in Mexico

261060583.name: Shades of old Mexico
261060583.author: a TripAdvisor user
261060583.reviewBody: Beautiful old cathedral, not big if compared to older European cathedrals, but it must have been enormous for the population that the peninsula used to have. \nGreat place to visit, bells still ring on the hour, and it\'s only 2 blocks from the beach and touristy area.\nBonus, to the left, as you face the cathedral, go one block and at the corner you\'ll see a red awning. That\'s Corazon cafe, a great place to eat, or enjoy a drink in a completely surprising garden seating that you cannot imagine from the street

257490629.name: Old Mexico
257490629.author: a TripAdvisor user
257490629.reviewBody: The Cathedral in Central La Paz is a step back to the Old Mexico.  Church bells ringing and the structure do reminiscent of hundreds of years ago.  A must see for everyone

255695445.name: Sunday mass and ash wednesday
255695445.author: a TripAdvisor user
255695445.reviewBody: Thank you for the opportunity pray to you, to sing to you in Spanish. Thank you for a safe and enjoyable time with friends.

254023768.name: Beautiful old church!
254023768.author: a TripAdvisor user
254023768.reviewBody: Very nice old cathedral...cornerstone laid in 1861.  Went thru in the morning and happened to come by in the afternoon while a wedding was taking place...charming!

252334368.name: Small cathedral
252334368.author: a TripAdvisor user
252334368.reviewBody: Not impress of the upkeep and not so historical  there\'s nothing to be surprise like a wow factor.... Very simple less parking and less touristy not unlike the cathedrals in Austria, or European countries.

251198574.name: one of god\'s favorite haunts
251198574.author: a TripAdvisor user
251198574.reviewBody: this is a fine old church... and a good place to meditate and get away from the pounding sounds of the city.... as i fallen catholic i found some peace and quiet without too much guilt just sitting in the church ...

249276113.name: Wonderful piece of history!
249276113.author: a TripAdvisor user
249276113.reviewBody: A beautiful cathedral in the heart of La Paz.  We had a wonderful walk through, and the plaza was a great place to soak in the city.

248559519.name: Ancient splendor
248559519.author: a TripAdvisor user
248559519.reviewBody: This church was built in the 1800\'s and has never been remodeled and it looks as if it was just done.\n Great altar and for Christmas had the best manger scene I have ever seen

247819071.name: Nice small church
247819071.author: a TripAdvisor user
247819071.reviewBody: This is a nice very small church in the middle of town. You can walk around or try some of the small coffee shops or restaurants around it.

247105683.name: Beautiful Church at Christmas time
247105683.author: a TripAdvisor user
247105683.reviewBody: Simple, pretty Church. But one can feel the grandeur mixed with the difficulty of the architecture for the materials available at the time. (i.e. crystal chandeliers, curved wooden ceiling). I would have loved to attend a service, but the decorations were fabulous. And the fact that locals still come to pray mid-day, despite the tourists, made it special. An uphill climb if walking from Malecon, but would do it again. Pretty town square right across street; all locals at the many shoe shine stands. Just as pretty as large marble cathedrals I\'ve seen elsewhere.

245256367.name: Festive decorations for Christmas Holidays
245256367.author: a TripAdvisor user
245256367.reviewBody: Nice, traditional Spainish architecture made all festive for the Christmas Holidays.  Friendly, enjoyable atmosphere and open to wander in and have a look.

242632407.name: nice enough
242632407.author: a TripAdvisor user
242632407.reviewBody: no reason not to stop by and poke your head in, but nothing too exciting.  The cathedral under construction is also worth a peak, even in its completely unfinished state, just because its so big.

242130560.name: Not grand
242130560.author: a TripAdvisor user
242130560.reviewBody: Mexico has many very grand cathedrals. This is not one of them. To get the true flavor of this place, it\'s necessary to attend a service here and experience the devotion of the parishioners.

239282264.name: Agreed
239282264.author: a TripAdvisor user
239282264.reviewBody: I agree with Friar 4 our Cathedral is not impressive by any means whatsoever compared to other Cathedrals in the world. I think the one in Guadalajara is much more impressive. However... take in account WHERE we are, and WHEN it was built, and then you could say it is impressive.We are a land locked peninsula and we are located 1,000 miles from civilization, now, and then. NOW we have a PAVED road all 1,000 miles, then, we had nothing. Now we have an international airport, and a major seaport. THEN, we had neither. So... taking in account everything except the stones that were used to build the church. Everything else in the church had to be hauled down the impassible baja california desert via mules, or across the sea of Cortz, the only two routes to La Paz then. So, I would say that in 1835  when construction began it was an impressive feat. Take also in account that the population at the time numbered 800 inhabitants, prisoners were used to help build it. Later in 1908 the church that actually still stands was built.

239247336.name: Worth the walk
239247336.author: a TripAdvisor user
239247336.reviewBody: One needs to walk up a street from where the tour buses let you off, but it\'s worth the walk. The cathedral is very quaint, and we were able to watch a service take place. The architecture is very pretty, and it\'s amazing to see how they much they built with just stone.  A major stop? No, but if you\'re into local flavor and culture you should go.

200818664.name: Local Flavor
200818664.author: a TripAdvisor user
200818664.reviewBody: Worth a visit.  Impressive stone cathedral in this dusty humble Baja Town.  Faces the town square.  Good energy inside.

199181260.name: Not a major site, really.
199181260.author: a TripAdvisor user
199181260.reviewBody: This Cathedral was built in the 1800\'s.  It\'s nice and in use by the locals.  If you have seen many Cathedrals, you won\'t be wowed.  It is across from Plaza de la Constitucion, which is also OK.  I wouldn\'t rank these sites as major draws for La Paz.

197963035.name: Beautiful church
197963035.author: a TripAdvisor user
197963035.reviewBody: The La Paz cathedral is worth a visit.  Like most Spanish colonial churches in Mexico the architecture alone is worth the visit.  Check it out!

195129680.name: Rest and relaxation
195129680.author: a TripAdvisor user
195129680.reviewBody: A beautiful old Cathedral. Just sit in a pew and feel the serenity wash over you. An absolute must stop by for anyone with a real interest in the history of La Paz.

195090948.name: Interesting
195090948.author: a TripAdvisor user
195090948.reviewBody: Not a fabulous building but nice.  Worth a look. Not difficult to park for awhile. Good photo op for recording visit to la Paz.

194866649.name: Nice quick visit
194866649.author: a TripAdvisor user
194866649.reviewBody: Worth a pop in to see the chandeliers and the art. The virgin de Guadalupe was very nice.  Worth a ten minute stop!

193492554.name: Lovely historic church
193492554.author: a TripAdvisor user
193492554.reviewBody: La Paz Cathedral is a small gem in downtown La Paz.  Beautifully decorated and serene, it\'s a restful place and well worth a visit.  Peaceful atmosphere and a long history, nicely explained in the entry signs in both Spanish and English.

192508224.name: History, art, and culture without pomp
192508224.author: a TripAdvisor user
192508224.reviewBody: The building is not fancy but it is amazing; I was able to find something new in the structure every time I looked at it.  The inside is great--a house of worship, plain and simple, but with heartfelt stained glass and altars that evoked deep feelings in us.  The church is a real happening place--we witnessed concerts, masses, and a very community-oriented tradition of "La loteria" (more like bingo) outside on the grounds.  The bells are beautiful and have enhanced our month in La Paz.

185437464.name: BUILT  in  the  1700\'s!
185437464.author: a TripAdvisor user
185437464.reviewBody: What a beautiful  cathedral, one  of  the best  on  the  baja peninsula....everytime we  visit  LaPaz  we go here  and   stand  in  awe.    A  must   see  while visiting  LaPaz ,  and  cathedral  adjoins   the  old  zocalo   and  band   stand.     Historic   La  Paz   at  it\'s     best!!!

184643309.name: History
184643309.author: a TripAdvisor user
184643309.reviewBody: There are plaques at the entrance one in Spanish, other in English giving information and dates about the development of this lovely cathedral. It\'s a quick visit, however I did see several tourists enjoying the silence and beauty of the interior.

175728646.name: Beautiful
175728646.author: a TripAdvisor user
175728646.reviewBody: I attended a wedding in this beautiful cathedral.  it was majestic and very nicely maintained.  It\'s truly a place to see while visiting LaPaz.  The Cathedral will not disappoint you and your friends.

165601982.name: Quiet place
165601982.author: a TripAdvisor user
165601982.reviewBody: The Cathedral is a simple church, very well maintained, clean and peaceful. \nThe square in front of the Cathedral is where the local people goes to flirt and talk to the others as it is common in small villages.

160828920.name: This is a must see!
160828920.author: a TripAdvisor user
160828920.reviewBody: Stunning architecture and intriguing history... this is a must see in my opinion. This is truly a jewel within the city and a beautiful photo op. If you are lucky enough to attend an event here it is well worth the time!

158515460.name: Lovely Wedding Mass
158515460.author: a TripAdvisor user
158515460.reviewBody: This is a small but beautiful cathedral, impressed with the upkeep and decoration.  Parking was easy and it was not hard to find.

154754838.name: Beautiful church
154754838.author: a TripAdvisor user
154754838.reviewBody: The cathedral is a must when visiting La Paz.  I didn\'t realize it was such a historical site until I read the inscripture on the outside.  Located in a nice area to walk around in and explore.

154049520.name: Beautiful church
154049520.author: a TripAdvisor user
154049520.reviewBody: This cathedral is incredible.  The beauty of it takes you by surprise and it is very easy to walk to and the square is very well kept.

146154573.name: Amazing architecture
146154573.author: a TripAdvisor user
146154573.reviewBody: Fantastic and beautiful architecture. Visit this fabulous cathedral, enjoy its superb architecture and once you\u00b4re done, accross the street is town square and its quaint kiosk. Enjoy it along an ice cream and playing mexican bingo "loteria"

145691531.name: Historical
145691531.author: a TripAdvisor user
145691531.reviewBody: Nice Cathedral and a historical site. Easy to get to and great pictures to be taken. People are very friendly and helpful .

143579943.name: Local Landmark Worth a Trip
143579943.author: a TripAdvisor user
143579943.reviewBody: This cathedral is the original, and in the center of the waterfront shopping area.  It\'s open to the public, yet is still in use.  Walk through and see the architecture, icons, and other decorations.  The cathedral and the grounds are a true gathering place for the locals.

141880510.name: This is my favorite church and neighbourhood
141880510.author: a TripAdvisor user
141880510.reviewBody: I love this land mark so historical. This hole area grab a coffee from Cafe Gourmet say hi to the americans that hang out outside on almost a daily basis, talk to them tell them Donna Sent you and when you hear the churchbells check it out. I sit at the back due to my so-so spanish If you are spiritual you will love the feeling in this place.

136739887.name: Pretty downtown area
136739887.author: a TripAdvisor user
136739887.reviewBody: neat area to walk around. Not the most amazing Cathedral I\'ve even seen but it was nice. It was pretty but not all that much to do in the area, only takes a few minutes to see the Cathedral

129783252.name: Graceful and Beautiful
129783252.author: a TripAdvisor user
129783252.reviewBody: Serenity and peace surround The Cathedral and the surrounding square.

126842004.name: Cathedral in La Paz
126842004.author: a TripAdvisor user
126842004.reviewBody: It is very ornate inside, beautiful! Very nice area of town with the park across the street.  We love La Paz! \n

125888602.name: Photo Op
125888602.author: a TripAdvisor user
125888602.reviewBody: I liked the opportunity to shoot some very nice photos, using interior light that sprayed through the stained glass.

124721351.name: just another mexican church
124721351.author: a TripAdvisor user
124721351.reviewBody: If you have visited Mexico this will not impress you, it is however interesting

120249449.name: Beautiful!
120249449.author: a TripAdvisor user
120249449.reviewBody: What a  lovely church.  I loved the brick, and the architecture, and the gardens surrounding it.

677268876.name: Amazing Beach!
677268876.author: a TripAdvisor user
677268876.reviewBody: This was seriously one of the most beautiful beaches I\'ve had the pleasure to visit. It doesn\'t look like much from the distance but it\'s really quite lovely. The water is Crystal clear with a beautiful blue hue. The water is not too deep making it great for those who want to enjoy the water but can\'t swim. You can actually see where you\'re walking because the water is so clear. The beach had nice soft sand and some nice rocky areas that are quite scenic. The parking area fills up quick so you may want to go early or take a bus if possible. There are bathrooms but they are like outhouses so prepare for that.

676695648.name: Balandra Beach
676695648.author: a TripAdvisor user
676695648.reviewBody: Great beach for kids. Shallow water to almost no water at low tide. This beach use to be one if the best in the world. It had now been overrun with visitors and tour busses. Parking can be a real challenge.

675361408.name: As Advertised.  GO! plus the beaches along the way are amazing.
675361408.author: a TripAdvisor user
675361408.reviewBody: Go here as well and you might as well stop at the beaches along the way.  SO amazing.  We went on a sunday and it was busy.  I bet a week day you could have it to yourself.  The next beach over has bars and jet ski rentals etc.

674495576.name: A hidden jewel ..!
674495576.author: a TripAdvisor user
674495576.reviewBody: One of the top 10 most beautiful beaches in the world. Clean, safe, quiet and some reefs to do some snorkelling..!

672347196.name: Amazing place, the color of the water is unique
672347196.author: a TripAdvisor user
672347196.reviewBody: The beach is really nice, plus the view from the surrounding hills is really worth the short climb (<5mn). The beach is small and the number of free umbrellas is limited, so you should get there early (before 9am).

672168249.name: Beautiful beach
672168249.author: a TripAdvisor user
672168249.reviewBody: Balandra beach really is beautiful, u like anything I had ever seen. The color of the water against the rock formations and mountains are so beautiful. The only downside would have to be the stingrays. There are a lot her please be careful! My son got stung by one and we had to leave In a hurry to get him to a doctor. Those stings are no fun, and extremely painful. Seeing all those children in there made me so worried sick. Drag your feet make noise that should help to get them out of your way, we learned that too late.

672121258.name: Balandra Beach is one of the most beautiful beaches in Mexico.
672121258.author: a TripAdvisor user
672121258.reviewBody: Balandra Beach is one of the most beautiful beaches in Mexico.It is very shallow so it is very safe.

670329346.name: Most unusual, amazing and picturesque beach
670329346.author: a TripAdvisor user
670329346.reviewBody: About 20mins NE of La Paz, Baja Sur you will find a piece of heaven.  This white sand beach in an incredibly shallow triple bay has warm water, gentle currents and enables you to wade 100\'s of yard out and along the bay.  The very gentle swells cause little undulations in the water depth resulting in alternating hues of blue.  Take a walk up the stony path to the top of the hill next to the beach for amazing views of the triple bay , the Sea of Cortez, and the mountains beyond.  Make sure you look behind you for a view of the lagoon in green march among the desert. Quite a contrast.  No facilities but usually a food truck on site.

668760151.name: Paradise for little ones
668760151.author: a TripAdvisor user
668760151.reviewBody: What a beautiful beach!!! Little ones will love the shallow waters and the soft white sand. Unfortunately there are no services at this beach, so no toilets. However there is a small van selling food and other essentials. Parking is free, but limited.

667899181.name: One of the best beaches in the world
667899181.author: a TripAdvisor user
667899181.reviewBody: Incredible view, sand and water! Go early and try to stay to the far left. And climb the mountain to see on the the best views you can find!

666976356.name: Beautiful beach, very shallow
666976356.author: a TripAdvisor user
666976356.reviewBody: We enjoyed sitting beneath permanent mushroom umbrellas (get there early if you want one), walking the beach and wading in the water.  Not many fish for snorkeling, but a good place to practice for young kids.

666849050.name: Amazing beach
666849050.author: a TripAdvisor user
666849050.reviewBody: This is the most beautiful beach in La Paz and Mexico, here is a place so quiet, with white sand beaches and turquoise transparent waters, it is surrounded by the exotic desert providing this an expectacular view.

666787864.name: Balandra Incredible
666787864.author: a TripAdvisor user
666787864.reviewBody: Is a quiet place, beautiful clear water and amazing views, if you are planning to go book with Baja Desconocida, wonderful service and profesionalism.

666638113.name: Beautiful beach
666638113.author: a TripAdvisor user
666638113.reviewBody: Nice sandy beach, gradual water depth from shore, nice swimming.  Beautiful scenery and the color of the water is that turquoise you just won\'t ever forget.

664810835.name: So Beautiful
664810835.author: a TripAdvisor user
664810835.reviewBody: Amazing little beach area. Looks to be gaining more popularity so unlikely to be as secluded as you would like. Make sure you have some cash to rent a kayak!

663503365.name: Shallow wading beach
663503365.author: a TripAdvisor user
663503365.reviewBody: This was a very fun experience. If you want sun all day go down to the left, as the sunset begins to set the shade covers the right side. If you want shade well you get the idea.... Make sure to stroll in the water around the point and head across to see the Hongo, its one of La Paz\'s city icons. It\'s a must see

663343576.name: An Absolute Dream
663343576.author: a TripAdvisor user
663343576.reviewBody: If you\u2019re in La Paz, you have to make a trip out to Balandra Beach! We arrived at 5:30 PM and watched the sunset until 8 PM. It was the most beautiful sunset I have ever seen.\n\nThe water is clear and shallow. Tons of pelicans were diving all around us and even within a few feet of us to try and catch fish.  There was hardly anyone else there. It honestly felt like a dream.

663210254.name: A piece of Heaven!
663210254.author: a TripAdvisor user
663210254.reviewBody:
A PIECE OF HEAVEN...Get there by 9:30am to secure parking and a good spot, there are about 20 palapas free of charge, If you get there with the crowd after 11am, expect difficulty finding parking, you can still get a shade and chairs for about $30 pesos a piece. THIS IS A NATURAL PRESERVE AREA, CLEAN UP AFTER YOURSELF PLEASE. 
Take your own snacks and drinks as there are only a couple vendors with limited choices. By about 12pm there is a waiter that comes over from playa Tecolote, and he brings out fresh seafood relatively quickly. There is no restrictions for drinking alcohol, however local police patrols looking  for trouble makers. 
This spot is perfect for a relaxed day at the beach, and for the little ones is like a giant tidal pool with fishes and seashells. Beware of the stingrays, drag your feet across the bottom, so they can feel you coming and swim away, you're going to get stung if you step on them.
Have a wonderful time!

662221634.name: Paradise found!
662221634.author: a TripAdvisor user
662221634.reviewBody: What a gem.  A treasured natural area, which the Mexicans are doing their best to preserve.  Swim with mullets, cornetfish, and jacks.  Find teeny red-clawed hermit crabs and gorgeous brittle stars.  Hike well above the water on the volcanic cliffs.\n\nAnd remember how special these places are.  \u2665\ufe0f

662079495.name: Nice beach
662079495.author: a TripAdvisor user
662079495.reviewBody: We liked the beach. We camped here for a night and went for a swim. Very quiet an scerene. There are restaurants in the area but we found the food to be expensive. The beer looked reasonable but we didn\'t stay. They have bathrooms for use but you have to pay. There are no facilities on the beach so you have to use the resturaunt. Over all its a beautiful beach. Pack a lunch an enjoy!

660958351.name: Swimming with Whale Sharks
660958351.author: a TripAdvisor user
660958351.reviewBody: Great time, reasonable prices.  Loved our stay.  Nice that it was a short trip by bot to the whale shark feeding area.

660842425.name: The stuff (my) dreams are made of!
660842425.author: a TripAdvisor user
660842425.reviewBody: Absolutely gorgeous beach - the water looks like a swimming pool.  Go early to get a palapa and parking spot.  They had kayak rentals at the beach.  I wore water shoes and took a long walk around the bend through the shallow water.  So beautiful, we had to go back twice!

659654229.name: Great beach for families!
659654229.author: a TripAdvisor user
659654229.reviewBody: We took our 3 year old and 7 month old here on a recent family trip to La Paz.  I could have gone back to this beach every day, we had such a wonderful time.  Our kids really enjoyed it.  Perfect beach for small children.

659162086.name: Hike or swim or kayak
659162086.author: a TripAdvisor user
659162086.reviewBody: Great place.  Walk the beach to the mushroom rock or hike the hill.  Also swim or kayak to the mangrove estuary.  Lots to do. Venders on sits. Snorkeling too. Easy to get to from la paz

659050157.name: Nice place to chill
659050157.author: a TripAdvisor user
659050157.reviewBody: Peaceful and relaxing. Take a short hike up to get a better view. It is breathtaking plus a UNESCO site. There is some sun shade provided or you can purchase. We went to another side of the beach and just hung out for a bit. Note: stingrays in the area so make sure you shuffle your feet in the sand and you will be fine.

658871008.name: Great hike, snorkeling and beaches
658871008.author: a TripAdvisor user
658871008.reviewBody: Enjoyed the 3 mile hike around the beaches with incredible views, and the miles of white sand beaches, good snorkeling around the reefs. We stayed away from the main beach other than at the start and end of each day here. Shallow waters for miles.

658625297.name: WOW!!!!
658625297.author: a TripAdvisor user
658625297.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful, unique and unspoiled beaches I have ever visited. So happy it has been untouched by many of the mega resorts that have ruined many other beaches in Mexico. It is worth a trip to La Paz just to see this beach.

657915028.name: Beautiful Beach!
657915028.author: a TripAdvisor user
657915028.reviewBody: Not to be missed. Check the tide table and go when it\'s falling so you can wade out to the mouth of the bay. Worth the drive up there.

657417951.name: WOW! Don\'t tell anyone about this place!
657417951.author: a TripAdvisor user
657417951.reviewBody: We were told by several that the drive from Cabo to Playa Balandra was 1 1/2 hours.  We found even without much traffic it was 2 1/2 hours one way.  We rented a car and stopped at Todos Santos to see Hotel California and at La Paz to see the local festival setting up and to get some delicious sandwiches from a cute little coffee shop to take to the beach.  This is definitely a whole day trip.  Was is the highlight of our trip? Absolutely, without a doubt!  The water is more clear than at any beach I\'ve ever been to.  The day we were there you could walk all the way across to the other side and the water would barely be over waist high.  There were quite a few cars there, but not crowded at all.  It almost seemed like we had the whole place to ourselves.

657279195.name: Amazing beach with liw water level to walk
657279195.author: a TripAdvisor user
657279195.reviewBody: This is a especial beach where you can walk in low water crisraline turqouise waters.When you arrive tgere is a beach beside the parking lot but you keep walking around by the mountain and you can find a lot of spots to stop and use the montain side to give you shade. \nTaje water shoes to walk on rhat greats waters up to your waist more or less and sone food and drinks to nake a pucnic ir buy some fruits over ther and rent a chairs and un umbrella for your day. ENJOY IT

656588811.name: Shallow beach
656588811.author: a TripAdvisor user
656588811.reviewBody: You can\'t really swim here, or snorkel.  Thigh high water.  But beautiful, and peaceful before the tour buses show up (9am).  Good place to get sun, or kyack.

656436917.name: a nice family or couple day destination
656436917.author: a TripAdvisor user
656436917.reviewBody:
This beach has low tide at bout 4:30 in the winter. Its great walk nice and shallow during low tide you can walk right up to the rock. wonderful destination; vendors always on beach renting sun shades, artisian crafts and coconuts. Get a coco preparado...yummmy.
This place is picturesque, Its where I have seen people fly drones, pretend they are models posing for photos, and the cutest toddlers having a great time (on the very large sand spit at low tide). we usually spend the day taking snacks etc.

At high tide you need to swim to the valadra. the beach is a big "c" shape. 
as soon as the sun is ready to set get your but outta there the mosquitos ravishly attack! They are not out before sunset so you can enjoy your day.
Everyone is better at respecting the beaches so please respect the environment and take your stuff with you. 

only downfall is busy so parking lot is large, just take your time...after all your already there!

656184717.name: Rated the best beach in Mexico
656184717.author: a TripAdvisor user
656184717.reviewBody: This beach lived up to the hype. Definitely a beautiful beach especially when traveling with little ones. This beach is truly breathtaking and is a must when traveling to La Paz. Calm water, knee high depth, and warm.

656053396.name: Beautiful Beach!
656053396.author: a TripAdvisor user
656053396.reviewBody: This is maybe one of the most beautiful beaches I\'ve ever been to. It was windy and a bit chilly in La Paz so we assumed we wouldn\'t want to spend long at the beach but we got there and it was gorgeous. Hot, sunny, no wind - the perfect beach day!

655696195.name: Wow, just wow!  Must see.
655696195.author: a TripAdvisor user
655696195.reviewBody:
Amazing place.  

We went at low tide and were able to walk across the bay to the beaches on the other side.  Water was clear turquoise, warm and shallow.  Sand was creamy white.

We spent 5 hours there.  Had a spot in the shade next to the cliffs and walked around those whole bay.

There are toilets in the parking lot area.

Bring your own food and water.

You can catch a bus here from the bus terminal on the Malecon in La Paz (Eco Baja Tours).  Costs $100 Pesos and takes 40 minutes.  One bus goes back and forth all day, with the last one being at sunset.

An Uber from the centre of La Paz to here quoted $200 Pesos, so $400 Pesos return.  Drive takes 20 minutes.

Also saw cyclists along the road.

655677959.name: Sand and more sand
655677959.author: a TripAdvisor user
655677959.reviewBody: Was a beautiful beach, you can walk for a long ways before it\u2019s deep. There are some public palapa\u2019s to use. Beware the lady just sitting under the public palapa, she will charge you to use one of her umbrellas.

654214692.name: Fun in yhe sun
654214692.author: a TripAdvisor user
654214692.reviewBody: Spent an afternoon. Very enjoyable with food available in the parking lot and walk to see mushroom rock.  Very unique.

653976100.name: Nice beach
653976100.author: a TripAdvisor user
653976100.reviewBody: This is one of the nicest beaches, I totally recomend it. It a little far to get to the Pic. But it is totally worth it.

653829753.name: Worth a morning or afternoon
653829753.author: a TripAdvisor user
653829753.reviewBody: Beautiful beach. If you\'re adventurous, wear hiking shoes and climb over hill to private beach (looking at beach from ocean , youre headed left.) If not, throw down towel & enjoy beach, sand and ocean views.

653820664.name: Gorgeous!!!
653820664.author: a TripAdvisor user
653820664.reviewBody: Incredible beach to bring young kids very safe no waves.  Definitely bring your own snacks and water and clean up after yourself. The water is very shallow and a beautiful light aqua there are two parts to the beach which you can explore walking on the water.  We went in February and it was warm enough for swimming and lounging. Please bring Biodegradable sun screen.  Protect these beautiful natural areas, be a traveler not a tourist.

653819146.name: Excellent beach
653819146.author: a TripAdvisor user
653819146.reviewBody: Went here with the hubby on a Monday afternoon. There were trinkets, snacks, and drinks for sale (non-alcoholic). We walked across the small bay to our own private beach were the hubs snorkeled around some rocks with excellent results. I walked around in the shallows and saw several types of fish. \nIf you want food drive the extra kilometer to Tecolote Beach and have delish lunch right on the beach under an umbrella.

653488006.name: Must see!
653488006.author: a TripAdvisor user
653488006.reviewBody: This is an amazing beach away from tour areas of La Paz.  We took an Uber to the beach and arranged a pickup time later in the day.  We hiked, walked the lagoon, and relaxed in the sun.  It was perfect.  The water was too cold to swim (visited in February) but perfect to cool off if you got too warm in the sun.  Just walking in the lagoon you can see fish, starfish, shells, and beautiful birds.  This should be a \'must do\' if you are in the area.  There is a parking lot, restrooms and food trucks so even though it is remote, there are amenities.  There are also palapas but I recommend bringing your own umbrella so you can be more selective where you want to relax on the beach.

653361796.name: A small piece of Paradise on Earth
653361796.author: a TripAdvisor user
653361796.reviewBody:
If you are in la Paz and you did not visit this beach you did not go to la Paz!!!
Balandra is a clean, isolated from the city (only 25 min or less), gorgeous beach that has clear waters and a beautiful natural sea made mushroom shaped rock that has been there for 100 years or more (a picture spot definitely).
The water depth is so nice that you can walk for miles and miles and water will still be at your hip or knee level (depending on your height).

Take a cooler down there with your beers and gatorades, one umbrella, and you should be set to enjoy an excellent day at a gorgeous beach!!

653269652.name: Hard to park but beautiful
653269652.author: a TripAdvisor user
653269652.reviewBody: We went on a Sunday which seems to be a big day for Mexican families. Very hard to park so be careful and don\'t go all the way up if you see a bunch of cars. The road is very narrow. But the beach was beautiful, the water was nice, and it was better than expected. I should also say that the bathrooms were very reasonable and clean

652871994.name: A nice place to spend the day if you have a car.
652871994.author: a TripAdvisor user
652871994.reviewBody: This is beach is very clean and there are palapas at no charge.  Vendors are very polite and there are not many of them.  Great place for kids as the whole bay is no more than mid thigh deep.  Mostly ankle deep.

651896669.name: Beautiful beach
651896669.author: a TripAdvisor user
651896669.reviewBody: We loved Balandra. We took an Uber there from our hotel in La Paz and spent the day there. There is a shuttle you can take but we wanted to get there early in the morning (before the shuttle started running for the day). There are basic toilets. There was a couple keeping them clean between each use so make sure you bring money to tip them. The snorkelling was great as was the hiking. The water was pretty chilly when we were there so you may want to pack a rash guard shirt to help keep you warm.

651896354.name: Want to be there now!
651896354.author: a TripAdvisor user
651896354.reviewBody: Visited on our lunch stop on our whale shark excursion.  Pulled in, anchored the boat and enjoyed lunch, sitting on the sand.\nSimply Breath-taking, shallow, no one but the 8 of us there . . .the water and sand were like coves in the Caribbean.\nYou can drive about 1/2 an hour north of the CostaBaja resort area, park in and walk, as well. It\'s a beach frequented by locals, so it can get crowded on holidays and weekends, we were told.

651348492.name: Best beach in La Paz!
651348492.author: a TripAdvisor user
651348492.reviewBody: We went out to Balandra Beach after swimming with the whale sharks and sea lions, the beach is majestic! Super soft white sandy beaches and plenty of fish to see while snorkeling. It is perfect for paddleboarding too!

650626003.name: Wonderful.
650626003.author: a TripAdvisor user
650626003.reviewBody: Even though we visited on the weekend, there was plenty of room on the beach. The sea was out so as there is only a gentle gradient paddling was the order of the day. Apart from someone flying a drone and a couple of others swilling beer and listening to AC/DC it was free of most annoyances.\nSand is soft and the beach is free from litter.

650514671.name: Beautiful beaches!
650514671.author: a TripAdvisor user
650514671.reviewBody: Head to Balandra bay for a breathtaking day on the sea of Cortez! It\u2019s a family friendly beach with the most beautiful clear waters and sandy shores! Away from the hustle and bustle of the resorts, you\u2019ll find serenity while you take in some sun! If you\u2019re looking for a bit more activity....Kayaking, whale and sea tours are available too!

650325689.name: Walk for miles
650325689.author: a TripAdvisor user
650325689.reviewBody: Very nice sand and clear water. The waves are very small. The water depth is perfect for children or people that walk to walk into the water and not worry about a drop off. The beach area is very big ....no food or thing like that when we visted but there was someone renting paddle boats . I also undersatnd you can take a bus to the beach for 70 pesco return but i did not use it ...so check it out ..

650124054.name: Pristine beauty
650124054.author: a TripAdvisor user
650124054.reviewBody: We arrived at Balandra beach by kayak and were able to enjoy an almost private beach away from parking area. Fine white sand, clear turquoise water to gaze at while eating lunch. It is possible to walk across bay at low tide.

649936137.name: Photo op!
649936137.author: a TripAdvisor user
649936137.reviewBody: Absolutely beautiful setting. Walk across the bay for privacy on the other side! When the tide is out, you can get \u201cwalk on water\u201d pics!

649558953.name: Breath Taking Beach
649558953.author: a TripAdvisor user
649558953.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful beaches on the planet. Almost no amenities, but worth it. Just to stare and wonder at the beauty of Baja. The last time we were there, some vendors were there and we had to pay for a shaded spot. But this is a must see.

649552421.name: Very Nice but Crowded
649552421.author: a TripAdvisor user
649552421.reviewBody: We went on a weekend and the place was packed. There are palapas to rent but most people brought their own shade. Crowds aren\'t our thing so we wandered in the shallow waters (the tide was out) for a half hour before leaving. Very picturesque and I\'d be happy to spend more time here when there are fewer people.

649330924.name: The most beautiful beach near La Paz.
649330924.author: a TripAdvisor user
649330924.reviewBody: This beach is magical. When the tide is out you can walk a long way out  to the mushroom rocks. The water is a spectacular shade of aqua. It\u2019s a must see sea!

649047283.name: Beautiful!
649047283.author: a TripAdvisor user
649047283.reviewBody: This beach was perfect! We were able to walk a little ways from the the parking lot and it felt like we had the place to our selves. The water is shallow a long ways out so it was great for strolling in water up to your hips and louging around in the ocean

649001031.name: This is one of the most beautiful beachs in the baja!
649001031.author: a TripAdvisor user
649001031.reviewBody: If you have the chance, this place is a must! Balandra beach is amazing! From cabo san lucas it is about a 2 hour drive, you can even spend the night at a hotel in town. The water is very calm and cristal clear! Perfect for kids to swim or learn on there own.

648764797.name: Girls trip to La Paz- beach day
648764797.author: a TripAdvisor user
648764797.reviewBody: We came here on a Sunday and although there were quite a few people it wasn\u2019t overcrowded and we were able to find a peaceful spot. We got some fresh coconuts before heading to our spot. You\u2019re able to walk out through the water across the majority of the bay as it\u2019s only 2-3 feet deep which makes for some great photo opportunities. The weather was great only downside was the abundance of flies that liked to harass us. Would definitely go back.

648210497.name: Wade among the locals
648210497.author: a TripAdvisor user
648210497.reviewBody: A lovely temperature, you can wade up to your knees across the whole area, lounge on a beach, hike up the hill to a lookout, and walk along the beach to see the "Balandra Mushroom" Replica (original was knocked over by some rude tourists)

647988511.name: Nice beach but at low tide it is gone!
647988511.author: a TripAdvisor user
647988511.reviewBody: Balandra beach is a really nice beach. you arrive early to get a Palapa but beware that at low tide the beach disappears.  That can be good if you want to walk around the rocks to see the sites on the other side but if you want to swim! We were told there is no food there, so we brought a lunch and a few beers however there was a small restaurant.

647487281.name: Absolutely gorgeous
647487281.author: a TripAdvisor user
647487281.reviewBody: Rented a car for the day and drove up to Balandra, commute was roughly a half hour. Parked right in the very front of the parking lot closest to the beach. Grabbed a spot under one of the palapas. Wandered over the rocks and around to the other beach and walked to the mushroom rock which was a bit of work during high tide, recommended water shoes if possible but we made it with no trouble. Went back over to our spot under the palapa and sun bathed for an hour or so. Around 11am or so it started to finally get busy. I decided to rent a kayak and we ended up buying 2 cups of fresh fruit from one of the vendors and kayaked over to the other beach directly to the south. It was great, we had our own private beach enjoyed our fruit and sunbathed some more. Ended up walking up and down both ends of our beach looking for shells and marine life. Found some beautiful fish, crabs, pelicans and even a anemone. Ended up staying a total of five hours or so. If you wanna avoid the crowds highly recommend driving up early and seeing everything you\u2019d like to. Besides the kayaks they do have umbrellas and chairs available for rent and even paddle boards. We were there early enough that we experienced both high and low tide. During the low tide there were dozens of sand bars and I even walked out about 150 yards or so and water was barely up to my shins. Water is some of the clearest I\u2019ve ever seen. Absolutely a must visit if you\u2019re ever in La Paz. Will definitely be coming back.

646819927.name: Beautiful natural pool
646819927.author: a TripAdvisor user
646819927.reviewBody: It\'s a unique beach. Awesome colors, nice sand. Be careful with the jellyfish and rocks but only in specific areas. \nPerfect for children and families.

646790043.name: Part of a tour
646790043.author: a TripAdvisor user
646790043.reviewBody: Went to beautiful Balandra Beach with MeXplore Tours.  Great time.  Started the tour with the whale sharks and had lunch on the beach.  A place to go see.

646766035.name: Hidden paradise
646766035.author: a TripAdvisor user
646766035.reviewBody: This beach is just amazing. We arrived in the morning after a quick visit to El Tecolote, it was about 9:30 so finding a place to park wasn\u2019t an issue. We started to walk along the beach and just jumped into the water and we were amazed with the amount of sea life around the rocks! We walked around the rocks for quite a long time just amazed and grateful with the small things Mother Earth provides us. \nYou can lay in the beach, you can walk on the bay from one beach to the other and see sea life or you can even hike the mountains and take some great photos of this amazing place. There\u2019s kayaks and SUP boards to rent and some people selling refreshments and some snacks. Definitely a place not to be missed if you are in La Paz.

646688324.name: gorgeous
646688324.author: a TripAdvisor user
646688324.reviewBody: shallow, clear water, soft sand. great place for kids to play and swim. we had a picnic and the kids found lots of fish skeletons and cool things!

646495882.name: Wow.... 360 degree beach!
646495882.author: a TripAdvisor user
646495882.reviewBody: This beach ranks one of the top ten that I\'ve ever been to.  There is something unique about being surrounded in this large \'cove\', \'bay\', or whatever we should call it.  The tide comes in/out and it can be like being in a swimming pool.  White sand, totally clear, turquoise water, wow.  My kids were in heaven because it was shallow, safe and they were always looking for interesting critters or shells on the white sand - easy to spot something that stood out.  Family even saw an octopus - but I missed it.  Cannot recommend this spot highly enough.  No facilities so beware and treat it respectfully.

646471282.name: Low tide
646471282.author: a TripAdvisor user
646471282.reviewBody: I guess we were there at low tide.  VERY shallow.  Was told by a tour guide that you can snorkel there.  Must only happen at high tide so be sure to check before you go.  Lovely location,  food truck and the usual vendors.

646185256.name: Beauitiful but Popular
646185256.author: a TripAdvisor user
646185256.reviewBody: An amazing natural land and seascape. I\'d recommend coming ready to hike a little and perhaps wade a bit and you can get away from the crowds and maybe have a couple hundred yards of pristine beach to yourself. Hike up to get the birds eye view from the top of the central hill above the parking lots. Bathrooms were not open when I was there so that can be an disgusting issue in the desert where the landscape is so delicate and toilet paper doesn\'t decay anywhere as fast as in other wetter places. Pack it out people!! A kayak guide told me that years ago when he was a kid in La Paz there used to be many sea turtles in Balandra Bay but now they hardly ever appear there because of all the people. Leave them alone if you see them and maybe one day they\'ll come back in abundance. Look at the tide charts and time your visit to include a high tide. Our visit was almost all low and outgoing tide so we didn\'t get the full aqua blue water effect but still beautiful and very wade-able.

646129568.name: Awesome !
646129568.author: a TripAdvisor user
646129568.reviewBody: We loved this huge \u2018pool\u2019 . You can walk around with water ranging from your knees to your chest for the most part . If you do walk straight across the beach there\u2019s a spot that\u2019s deep enough that you have to swim thru it .

646083985.name: Get there Early
646083985.author: a TripAdvisor user
646083985.reviewBody: It is a very unique place.  The last 10 minutes of drive is very beautiful.  We got there early and grabbed shade under a palapa.  It did not take long for the crowds to come.  It was a week before Christmas so we expected it to be busy.\nVery sad to see people using the sand/beach near the rocks as a toilet.  I was totally grossed out by this and will not go back.  There are now toilettes in the parking lot, but I\'m afraid some people still decide to take a crap wherever they want.  So if you want to stay away from seeing this maybe go in the water, and back to your beach towel.  Do not hike around the corner to the other beach, you might see a surprise.\nThere are also a couple of less busy beaches on the way out there that may be worth a visit.  Obviously not as nice, but there is food and drink there.

644837868.name: Not worth a trip from Cabo
644837868.author: a TripAdvisor user
644837868.reviewBody:
We were in search of diversity and authentic, less commercialized beaches and that’s exactly what we got, and didn’t like it.

It’s crowded, garbage everywhere on the beach, but the water itself is fun for walking, shallow and unspoiled.

Not worth a 2+ hour trip from Cabo, sorry.

644363678.name: awesome but crowded
644363678.author: a TripAdvisor user
644363678.reviewBody: Pichlingee Beach much better and has two oceanside bars......!!! Families welcome ! great drinks and service. Awesome sunset!!

644133724.name: love it
644133724.author: a TripAdvisor user
644133724.reviewBody: top 10 beaches in the world!!! u must come n visit !!!! u can rent umbrellas n chairs there if u wish , bring your own water !

644084613.name: Overcrowded Mess
644084613.author: a TripAdvisor user
644084613.reviewBody: Sad to say Ballandra has turned into an overcrowded mess. I started coming to this area more than 25 years ago, and I know things cannot stay the same, but this beach has become overrun with the tourist bus crowd as well as individual visitors. Get there early? Maybe a bit better but hideously overrun.

643640441.name: Peaceful wade in clear waters!
643640441.author: a TripAdvisor user
643640441.reviewBody: Balandra beach (really it is three coves of gorgeous white sand beaches) is a wonderful way to spend the afternoon. It is about a 30 minute drive outside of La Paz with good roads. The beaches have no amenities (such as washrooms). There is one vendor with kayak rentals and a t-shirt vendor. Many Mexican families come to spend the day and bring their picnics, chairs and blankets. The water is very shallow and one can easily walk into each of the coves. Pretty fish to see. I recommend wearing water shoes in case you come across a ray in the sand. Come prepared with your water, snacks, sunscreen and towels to spend a glorious day. No entrance fee.

643374716.name: Balandra
643374716.author: a TripAdvisor user
643374716.reviewBody:
Beautiful beach
Very good point of view
Ideal for child because not dangerous at all
Not easy to park car because many people

642670311.name: Its probably the best spot in Baja
642670311.author: a TripAdvisor user
642670311.reviewBody: Honestly, beach is simply awesome. Water is warm, quiet and so pure. The cool visit could be in week days (early in the morning) because is very popular. Parking for free. Eco-friendly bathroom. No showers but is fine. Palapas (eco-umbrellas) are for free: first come, first serve. Also you can ask for some lunch in restaurantes near there. Is a perfect spot to spend a day and even a Night of camping (for free). So, paradise exist. Is here.

642524717.name: Great beach
642524717.author: a TripAdvisor user
642524717.reviewBody: Love it. The best vista is the south part of the beach with a view of the mountains and the beach. Get a coco for 60 pesos, enjoy the white sand. Climb to the top of the hill for the best view.

642472700.name: What\'s Around That Point?
642472700.author: a TripAdvisor user
642472700.reviewBody:
Beautiful beach. Well worth the 100 Peso return for the bus at the time we were there. The bus terminal in La Paz at the Malecon had Eco Baja Tour Buses that ran to the beaches. The only problem was that the bus can't turn around in the parking lot so they stop at a pull out that looks like they are dropping you off in the middle of nowhere. Just ask the bus driver 'Balandra' and he just nods... anyway, once you get there it is a bit of a trek but it is a beautiful beach....

I would make sure to pack drinks and snacks before you go. Not many stores around. 

Nice and shallow a longs ways out and the beach just keeps on going .... people were walking along the beach and kept going so we followed for a while. There are rock cropings where people set up their little spots in the shade and enjoy the warm weather and the beautiful clear water.

It was curiosity that drove us to walk around the point and then we just had to sit down for a bit, but we kept wondering if the next cove would be nicer... that's what you get when you have beaches all along the coast. 

Also found out on our way back there is another beach on the bus stop that has more amenities and looked like more people. 

Then again all the beaches on Baja California Sur were beautiful.... Clear water, warm weather, sand, and a beer in your hand!! You really can't go wrong.

642432963.name: Great beach even with holiday crowds
642432963.author: a TripAdvisor user
642432963.reviewBody: Family oriented beach with minimal services available. Take the bus from the malecon for a few dollars or rent a car. Parking was limited on the Christmas holiday we visited. Had a great experience with the bus. There were vendors offering service from a restaurant 1 km away but may only happen on busy days. Clear beautiful water with a family oriented vibe.

642116255.name: Amazing
642116255.author: a TripAdvisor user
642116255.reviewBody: Please arrive early so you can enjoy the beach without the crowd. Take goggles and a snorkel because fish are beautiful in there, and prepare to spend hours of il dolce far niente. Amazing place with cristaline water, no waves, nd you can walk a mile with the cold water up to your waist line. Few beaches this beautiful.

641374425.name: Beautiful Beach
641374425.author: a TripAdvisor user
641374425.reviewBody:
A beautiful beach surrounded by rock and cactus. Our hotel ran a shuttle to the beach which was about 30 min away. 

There are shaded palapas however they were all taken when we got there. Henry was renting umbrellas, table and chairs if you want. A couple of stalls selling cold drinks and juices. No food. Few people selling tourist items to purchase. There were a couple of portable washrooms.  

The tide changes dramatically and reveals many sandbars. You can walk and walk and walk and walk and still be maybe your knees.  Lots of people had small dogs that were loving it. 

We stayed for a couple of hours and then walked over to the tolocote beach about 30-40 min walk away with restaurants on the beach.  

A great place to spend the day. Be sure to bring sunscreen in case you can’t get an umbrella

641221963.name: Amazing beach
641221963.author: a TripAdvisor user
641221963.reviewBody: This is a great beach, especially if you have little kids (which we don\'t). Its really shallow and has "3 lagoons". You can actually walk across to the other side to several other beaches as well, its nice and shallow. But if you want to go for a swim you can definitely wade out into deeper waters too. We did some stand up paddle boarding too. There are kayaks and paddle boards for rent there. We went there 3 times/days. Overall a great beach and very photogenic one too.

641018851.name: The most incredible beach I\u2019ve ever visited
641018851.author: a TripAdvisor user
641018851.reviewBody:
Beautiful shallow beach where you can wade for hundreds of yards in any direction! Clear, clean water that feels great. If you’re in La Paz, you HAVE to come here.

I do have some suggestions on how to make sure you get the best experience. Think of this beach as more of a park than a tourist attraction—there aren’t many amenities. So, you should:
•Bring a cooler with plenty of beverages. If you bring alcohol, you might also pack some drinks high in electrolytes like gatorade to stay hydrated.
•Use a bathroom before.
•Pack your basic beach needs: sunscreen, sunglasses, towels, etc.
•Buy some cheap lawn/beach chairs to sit in. If you rented a car to tour the area, these can come in handy at other beaches as well! You can give them away before you go back home.

640991480.name: Stunningly beautiful
640991480.author: a TripAdvisor user
640991480.reviewBody: This is a must see when visiting la Paz. The water is crystal clear and warm.  You can wade comfortably for several hundred yards.  Recommend hiking the trails above.

640939297.name: Beautiful Bay!
640939297.author: a TripAdvisor user
640939297.reviewBody: Gorgeous turquoise bay facing the Sea of Cortes.  The water is shallow with sandy bottom so you can literally walk across to the other side.  I walked across bare foot but there are some stinging sting rays under sand,  so would use Aqua Socks next time. \n\nTake the Aguila bus from La Paz for $100pp/round trip.

640882149.name: Lovely all day
640882149.author: a TripAdvisor user
640882149.reviewBody: The beach was picture perfect and super warm. Even with a few people there it did not seem crowded. A great way to spend two or three hours.

640386667.name: Day at beach
640386667.author: a TripAdvisor user
640386667.reviewBody: Wonderful beach. Great hike around to the mushroom rock formation around the corner. The tides are interesting as well as it almost empties out at low tide.

639392900.name: its a magnificent white beach.
639392900.author: a TripAdvisor user
639392900.reviewBody: Dont stay on the first beach, there are three! Summon up a little effort and walk/swim around to the third bay and you might have your very own paradise!

638713005.name: Beautiful
638713005.author: a TripAdvisor user
638713005.reviewBody: Wow ! So pretty here just go see it! Everywhere you look here it\u2019s gorgeous! We loved it so much we went back the next day!

638640848.name: Gorgeous- just wish there were more services
638640848.author: a TripAdvisor user
638640848.reviewBody: Beautiful here, but you need to be prepared for no bathroom and no bar or restaurant.  The water is calm as a bathtub. Lots of interesting birds to see.

637658666.name: Nice beach, mediocre snorkeling
637658666.author: a TripAdvisor user
637658666.reviewBody: This place is the busiest beach we visited while in Baja Sur. The main beach was a little crowded, so we waded around the rock point to the second beach and had a great time sunning and swimming. The only good snorkeling we found was on the rocks near the mushroom rock. There\'s lots of sandy and shallow water, which is fun to pay in though, and our kids enjoyed that. And frankly, since this is such a draw for people, it meant other beaches (with better snorkeling) were relatively empty.

637464545.name: Favorite beache
637464545.author: a TripAdvisor user
637464545.reviewBody: This places is so beautiful, it\u2019s my favorite beach of baja! I love spending all day at this beach and the color of the water is beautiful

636470261.name: Tour stop
636470261.author: a TripAdvisor user
636470261.reviewBody: Our tour group spent an hour here. The water is amazing...super calm and you can walk to the other side since the water was so shallow.  There are people here selling snacks and renting out equipment and chairs and umbrellas. Would have rated this beach a 5 except the outhouse style bathrooms were locked up with padlocks \u2639\ufe0f.

635681618.name: Amazing
635681618.author: a TripAdvisor user
635681618.reviewBody: We were lucky enough to make it out here several times during out visit to La Paz and is always worth the trip!  It is a beautiful spot!

635117884.name: Beautiful waters
635117884.author: a TripAdvisor user
635117884.reviewBody: Extremely beautifully clear water . Great place to spend the day.. We packed a cooler and spent the entire day

634220535.name: AMAZING
634220535.author: a TripAdvisor user
634220535.reviewBody: We rented a car and drove to balandra , very easy and fast from La Paz. No need to tell you how, just follow signs . Amazing scenery , you\u2019ll see mangroves .... cactus forest and amazing beaches on the way there.  There is a truck that sells a bit of everything , so if you are one of those who doesn\u2019t like to carry anything around , you\u2019ll be able to buy at least something to drink and a floating device (lol). They have restrooms on site. Before you get to the parking you\u2019ll see a trail going up to the top of the hill that seats right Above balandra.  You\u2019ll get amazing views of the entire bay ( recommended ). \nGo earlier in the day , ties change during the day.

633792785.name: Love this beach!
633792785.author: a TripAdvisor user
633792785.reviewBody: I was here at low tide and was able to walk out to the mushroom rock but take water shoes or sandals incase the water is higher. What an amazing sight!

633701745.name: Beautiful shallow bays with white sand beaches - a must see if in the area!
633701745.author: a TripAdvisor user
633701745.reviewBody: The public beach has parking and porta potties, incredible views, warm shallow waters, white sand and was very clean when we were there on a Saturday. Plenty of space to spread out too. Other beaches in the area can be reached only by boat and are also spectacular. Take a photo with Mushroom Rock!.

632672274.name: Clearest water I\'ve ever seen.
632672274.author: a TripAdvisor user
632672274.reviewBody: This beach is pretty amazing totally chill, guys selling hats and food kids playing nobody acting stupid the clearest calmest water I\'ve ever seen white sand, slight drive to get to but no big deal. I\'d give it  5 stars but at the end of the day it still just a beach.

632662145.name: Beach that paints itself!
632662145.author: a TripAdvisor user
632662145.reviewBody: This is a must while visiting La Paz. The bays are full of colors and life. The parking lot leads to one of the bays that most of the people go to. I would recommend going over the small hill and go to the other bay. Bring snorkel gear, umbrella and environmentally safe sunscreen. They have a small snack shop and a guy with coconuts for sale. You can rent a umbrella on the beach for 200 pesos for the day. This bay has a lot of people were you can rent kayaks or walk 500 plus feet in waste high water depending on the tide. If you want a view from above to see both bays, you can go up a small hill that will lead you to a path that leads you to the point. You can see this path from the parking lot. Enjoy!!!

632072088.name: Nice Beach
632072088.author: a TripAdvisor user
632072088.reviewBody: Great beach for kids, a few vendors with umbrellas, etc. Make sure your trip does not coincide with a ferry departure - took us more than 1hr from La Paz due to ferry traffic. Our toddler loved the water, but I have never seen so many wasps in one place.

630313235.name: Looks like small lake
630313235.author: a TripAdvisor user
630313235.reviewBody: Driving from las Cabos to la Paz is scenic and interesting drive on mostly well-paved divided Hwy. The malecon walk and drive thru the centro area are the main attractions of the town. The Balandra Beach is not worth spending time to drive. Contrary to our expectation that the beach would be right on the ocean, rather it s enclosed on three sides with little mountains and an inlet for sea water from the fourth side. Nothing extraordinary of its being with shallow water and smooth off-white sands. A couple of food trucks are there to sell snacks, cold drinks and fresh coconuts slit open for sweet water. For a day trip to la Paz it is not worth going to Balandra, rather enjoy the town and plenty of restaurants on the Malecon.

630174733.name: Beautiful
630174733.author: a TripAdvisor user
630174733.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful beaches I have ever seen. A true gem with clear and calm waters and beautiful hikes

629104483.name: Lots of people and lot of moise
629104483.author: a TripAdvisor user
629104483.reviewBody: The beach is beautiful but full of algae. There is a lot of people and a lot of noise and music. The parking is just next to the beach which is very ugly. You can climb the mountains and walk all the beach across.

627756790.name: Ranked as one of the top beaches in the world
627756790.author: a TripAdvisor user
627756790.reviewBody: The water is crystal clear and you can walk around the cove as the water is chest high at the deepest point. There are 2 coves to explore. Kayak & SUP boards available to rent. I would bring a float, sunscreen, a small cooler, and sun umbrella. Uber is available and very reasonable may cost you only $8-$10 one way from La paz. Do not miss this beach! It is a very memorable lifetime experience of breathtaking beauty & fun.

627598515.name: Nice way to spend the day
627598515.author: a TripAdvisor user
627598515.reviewBody: If you are visiting, you can rent an umbrella, chair and get food and drink at the beach. Of course, you can always bring your own. Not much for snorkeling, but it is a relaxing spot to soak up some sand. There is a public bathroom there as well.

627485755.name: Perfect spot for lunch on the sand
627485755.author: a TripAdvisor user
627485755.reviewBody: As part of our tour with VIP tours, Captain Eddy and guide Katrin prepared a great lunch on the beach.  We\'l come back on our own as it is an easy drive from La Paz.

626845070.name: We arrived late so it was not as busy
626845070.author: a TripAdvisor user
626845070.reviewBody: We decided to head to Balandra after visiting La Ventana and the area (actually we did a big loop from El Triunfo, up to La Ventana and then to Balandra Beach which was a nice way to spend a day). There were still a lot of people at the beach and in the water which looked as if it was quite shallow for quite a ways out. We arrived for the sunset so that was about 630pm. What I didn\'t get to see because I arrived so late, was the beautiful blue of the water. It looks incredible. Lots of parking at this time and the sunset was pretty. I think I\'d come back again during the day to experience it more.

626615239.name: Fun
626615239.author: a TripAdvisor user
626615239.reviewBody:
This is a wonderful beach about 20 mins drive from La Paz. We got there around 10 am and found it to be quite and easy to park. Contrary to other reviews the is a refreshment truck selling drinks and snacks, and also toilet facilities ( just think of a massive litter box for people, and you’ll get the idea. Go in, do your business, and cover it with the sand provided!!!!😬😬😬). During the coarse of the morning, the proverbial beach vendors arrive in droves to sell their wares, rather annoying, unless you’re in dia need of a flotation devise or beach attire.  SUP and kayaks can be rented for about $18 an hour. We found this particularly useful as it was high tide , and access to the mushroom would have been impossible without it.
The beach itself is fairly clean, although it’s obvious that there are some people that camp there , and maybe don’t pick up after themselves as much as they could.
Another issue is that there were many dogs there with their owners........ they are not able to use the human litter box, rather they just go in the sand. Not so nice if your digging in it, and come across a big dog turd!!
On the whole, this is a must if you’re in the area.  Check for tidal updates........

626603724.name: Quite and beautiful!!
626603724.author: a TripAdvisor user
626603724.reviewBody: As we were driving....we came across this beautiful beach! When we arrived, there was only 2 other couples there. Later in the day it got busier. We came in the mid morning and then stopped to have lunch down the road to another great find!

625367865.name: The best beach in La Paz
625367865.author: a TripAdvisor user
625367865.reviewBody:
We (2 adults and an 11 year old) spent an afternoon at this beach. This one is in my opinion the best 'family' beach. Warm clean waters, shallow beach, and white soft sand.  What more can you ask for!
And if that isn't enough at low tide you can walk along the shoreline to the famous El Hongo 'mushroom' rock, or hike to it (over a hill).
Bring food & beverages and a parasol as it can get really hot early to late afternoon.
Take the bus there, it's only a 25-30 minute ride and relatively inexpensive.
Cheers :o)

623989854.name: Stunning beach!!
623989854.author: a TripAdvisor user
623989854.reviewBody: Definitely preferred this beach hands down over Tecolote beach! Palapas are free to the public. Get there early and stay all day! Bring lunch, water, snacks in a cooler because no restaurants around. Beach is super clean, water is pristine and you can walk out prettty far and still be touching the ground and the water is refreshing. You can also rent kayaks and paddle boards there if you want.

622217992.name: Beautiful Beach
622217992.author: a TripAdvisor user
622217992.reviewBody:
A must while in La paz or cabo.
A 2:30 hour drive from cabo this is truly one of the most beautiful beaches on earth.
Peaceful and clean.
Highly recommend to BOB since there is no restaurants or stores.

621962900.name: Beautiful area
621962900.author: a TripAdvisor user
621962900.reviewBody: I really liked Balandra Beach its really nice and the water is very warm. Please help keep this area clean when going. Note: this location does not have restrooms or changing area, since its a protected area by the government.

621837233.name: Balandra Beach
621837233.author: a TripAdvisor user
621837233.reviewBody: Amazing bay! The water is crystal clear, cactuses all around the hills. If you rent a car you should take a visit even if your hotel is in San Jose Del Cabo like ours.

619611459.name: Paradise!!! Exists
619611459.author: a TripAdvisor user
619611459.reviewBody:
A must when visiting La Paz or Los Cabos.

Nice, beautiful, clean.

A real jewel.

Take care of our planet and be conscious.

Keep it clean.

Nice people and attention.

A must...

617950437.name: Very Nice
617950437.author: a TripAdvisor user
617950437.reviewBody: This is a beautifull little cove just north of La Paz if you want to kick back on the beach and relax, It could do with a little resturant or a bar or even a shack that served food and drinks but worth a visit if you\'re in the vicinity.

616867925.name: The most beautiful beach at La Paz
616867925.author: a TripAdvisor user
616867925.reviewBody: This was our favorite beach. Very nice and peaceful. The level of the water would barely go over your knees. Depending on the day, there could be almost no waves which makes it perfect for kids or people who are afraid of waves. \nImportant to know: there are a few free Palapas, that are nice and can offer you the shade you need to survive the sun. However you need to arrive early if you want to get one of these!

615580549.name: Paradise
615580549.author: a TripAdvisor user
615580549.reviewBody: The perfect beach at the perfect location. We went during the week and it was not packed. I can see on the weekends the place being full but we were lucky to get one of the palapas and enjoyed a lovely day in this piece of paradise. A must when visiting La Paz

613959367.name: Good beach near La Paz
613959367.author: a TripAdvisor user
613959367.reviewBody: Although it\u2019s a little bit overrated, as you need to walk more than 100 meters to get the water pass your knees, is a nice and safe beach to go with little ones.

612650629.name: Peaceful relaxation!
612650629.author: a TripAdvisor user
612650629.reviewBody: This quiet beach is absolutely gorgeous!  Shallow turquoise water await to refresh and soothe you.  The contrast against the white sand and arid backdrop is stunning!  Not much in terms of activity... which is part of the charm!  You CAN rent some kayaks and there is one snack-bar (no tables) at the entrance but Balandra is best enjoyed with your own cooler.  No need to taxi if staying in La Paz:  bus terminal has regular buses for 100 pesos per person (return - 45 min drive along the coast). We went on the 1:30pm bus to miss the hottest part of the day.

611283561.name: Overhyped
611283561.author: a TripAdvisor user
611283561.reviewBody: We made the trip from Cabo to Balandra with much anticipation. Positives? Great coconut stand and soft sand. If you have kids it allows for wading without too much worry. Negatives? We found the beach a little smelly with dark weeds on parts of the sandy shoreline which was not attractive at all! Compared to beaches in the Virgin and Cayman Islands and Jamaica, Balandra leaves a lot to be desired.

610323589.name: Beautiful blue water !!!
610323589.author: a TripAdvisor user
610323589.reviewBody: Beautiful place with a nice blue water,  but when we went,  the tour man told us it was the first time in his life that the place was crazy crowded, so we didn\u2019t enjoy the please . It was impossible to get to the \u201c mushroom spot\u201d because it was too many people , but when we went to the the Esp\u00edritu  Santo island , we passed by on the boat and I took some pictures .

609743419.name: stroll in the beach
609743419.author: a TripAdvisor user
609743419.reviewBody: Balandra was spectacular, its the first I strolled in the beach..water was so clean & clear and you can walk from the shore and across walking..although the the end acroos is a deep cavity that you can\u2019t see the bottom so be careful...water was warm & perfect for non swimmers...so family oriented..there are no abnoxious vendors to harrass you..they are regulated and they stay where there suppose to... you can rent umbrella beach for 180 mexican pesos

609599370.name: Great beach and area
609599370.author: a TripAdvisor user
609599370.reviewBody: Easy to find, good parking area, very clean, shallow water, great to take children and pet. No restaurants in the area, BYO food and drinks or go to Tecolote next to it for lunch

608050585.name: Best Beach ever !!!\u2019
608050585.author: a TripAdvisor user
608050585.reviewBody: I\u2019ve been to most of the best beaches all over the world and Balandra Beach is right there in the top.It is the most beautiful place,many different coves that all face different directions.Each one more amazing than the last.Kayaks are available for rent and you can paddle around the whole area which is huge or you can walk through the thigh deep water to some.The water is crystal clear with white sand beaches. I never wanted to leave ever,but you know how that goes.\nI was in La Paz for the whole month of July and spent much time at Balandra. If you love beaches like I do then this is a can\u2019t miss!!!

607437291.name: Amazing Beach and Clean Water
607437291.author: a TripAdvisor user
607437291.reviewBody:
Balandra is amazing!
You can swim in clean waters, I recommend you to use snorkel equipment.
If you arrive on morning you have the beach only for you. 
You can also do Kyak and aquatic sports in this beach.

Greetings from Portugal

606823065.name: Beautiful beach with warm tranquil waters!
606823065.author: a TripAdvisor user
606823065.reviewBody: Balandra Beach is a beautiful retreat about 2 hours from Los Cabos.  It is worth a day trip!  The water is crystal clear and very warm.  It is a lagoon so there are no waves or rip currents.\n\nThere are some local vendors with fresh fruit, beverages, shaved ice and souvenirs.  You can rent chairs, sun umbrellas and kayaks.

606822398.name: Spectacular and safe swimming beach
606822398.author: a TripAdvisor user
606822398.reviewBody: Great place for kids, very shallow waters. A must see attraction if you can\'t surf, but want to relax in the water. You can wade hundreds of meters out to sea, and a few vendors had delicious mangos on a stick.

606531892.name: Great but avoid the Sunday
606531892.author: a TripAdvisor user
606531892.reviewBody: White sands, turquoise water, good palapa and also a place to rent umbrellas and buy something \nEverything you need to enjoy a great beach

606426174.name: Top 5 beach in Mex
606426174.author: a TripAdvisor user
606426174.reviewBody: Not to miss when visiting La Paz. 30 minutes by car. Sandy White beaches, great for snorkeling. Suggestion take an umbrella and chairs and cooler with food and drinks. Don\'t miss this place

606168162.name: Beautiful (and crowded)
606168162.author: a TripAdvisor user
606168162.reviewBody: The beach is gorgeous, but if you happen to be there during the weekend be ready to share the beauty with many many other people. We got there a little before noon and the beach was already pretty packed, but more people kept arriving steadily all afternoon. If you\'re not carrying to many things can always go for a swim or climb to cross the rock barrier that separates the crowded beach from it\'s private secluded twin (but the walk or swim can be a little tricky). We ended up paying for a parasol and a couple of chairs and finding a nice little spot on the right side of the beach next to the rocks).

605157621.name: Great for kids bur crowded
605157621.author: a TripAdvisor user
605157621.reviewBody: Certainly not what it used to be, does not live up to the hype anymore. Still a very nice beach in the early hours before it becomes super crowded. Perfect spot for kids, safe shallow crystal clear waters. No restroom or other services. Get there early and grab a free family shade or get in late and rent a tiny umbrella shade for 300-400mxn pesos. Bring your drinks and food and lots of sun protection.

603254932.name: Vacayion
603254932.author: a TripAdvisor user
603254932.reviewBody: My cousins and I came to Playa Balandra from Cabo San Lucas. Unfortunately, we came on a Sunday and it was packed, no area to put our stuff, visitors with loud \nDJ speakers. We decided to go to Playa Tecolote.

601172262.name: nice small beach
601172262.author: a TripAdvisor user
601172262.reviewBody:
we went here as part of the boat tour with the cortez club so they dropped us here while the divers went out.  it's a pretty little spot with crystal clear water and a nice beach.

they have a mushroom rock to look at and you can snorkel there as well.

it was empty in the morning but when we came back in the afternoon it had filled up.

598028175.name: Meh
598028175.author: a TripAdvisor user
598028175.reviewBody: Not as cool as it used to be. Bit dirty nowadays. Super crowded. I rather visit other beaches. Small parking lot.

597906285.name: Crowed in July
597906285.author: a TripAdvisor user
597906285.reviewBody: I read all the wonderful reviews and was so hyped to take my teen son there. Got there on a Tuesday about 1PM and was so disappointed. Car lot was full and people were parked along both sides of a one lane unpaved road leading up to entrance so our van guide couldn\'t drive in. I was determined to at lease take my son to see it, so we left the rest of the family in the van to walk down there. My dad couldn\'t make the walk. We got to the beach and it was so crowded. Families had staked out every possible area to lay a towel. There were a handful of vendors with mangos, drinks etc. My son and I walked into the water, noticed a couple of small fish, the mushroom rock and left. Our driver took us to Tecolote Beach. A much better beach. I\'ll do my review for this one too!

597755284.name: Beautiful Beach!!
597755284.author: a TripAdvisor user
597755284.reviewBody: Loved this beach, it was very busy when we went. Bring lots of water and snacks, and an umbrella for shade.

597384037.name: Great Beach and Vibe
597384037.author: a TripAdvisor user
597384037.reviewBody:
We have spent several days at Balandra so far this trip, and it is our favorite hangout in La Paz. Heartily recommended.

We have been riding the public bus from the terminal on the Malecon (just across from the two story waterfront pavillion) near the whale museum. Ecobaja counter sells tickets...100 pesos roundtrip.The trip follows the coast through desert north of town and takes about 40 minutes, depending on locals getting on and off at various stops. First bus (the one you want to catch to avoid the crowds) is at 10 AM. Returns roughly every two hours, with last one early evening.
