The early bus drops you at the public parking area by the beach, but because the road fills up, it picks you up several hundred meters up the road. Make sure you clarify with driver where pickup is!

There are two beach areas. The main beach where 90% of the people go has vendors and blue portable rental umbrellas (200 pesos per day-ish). About 99% of visitors we have run into are locals or from other parts of Mexico.  That may just be the season...not sure.

The best beach, though, is "around the corner" to the right when facing water, and requires either walking in shallow water around a point to see the cove, or a climb up and over the rocks to reachit. This beach is gorgeous and calm, and has only a fraction of the visitor load of the main beach area. This is also the area with the "mushroom rock". We have only gone to the more secluded beach, and avoided the booming crowd that seems to gather each day at the main beach.

Note: There are no bathrooms at either beach. Also, please, please, PLEASE pack out your trash.  We take an extra bag to carry out any trash we find...which hasn't been much, but is heartbreaking to see.

Despite temperatures of over 100 F each day we have been there, the water has been siper clear, cool and refreshing, and there have been very few (if any) biting insects. Wear reef walkers and/or shuffle your feet in water to avoid stingrays. Lots of small fish, some larger ones cruising through, all sand bottom and very shallow lagoon. The whole bay / cove has truly incredible colors of different aquamarine shades with the water right up to sand dunes with a desert backdrop and red / brown cliffs.

Really, Balandra is one of our very favorite beaches ever, right up with any we have visited in the Agean islands in Greece,  Crete, Thailand, Bali, other parts of Mexico and the Caribbean. It is a special, lovely spot.

596449460.name: Balandra Beach Spectacular
596449460.author: a TripAdvisor user
596449460.reviewBody: Came here on the city bus from la Paz. Earliest bus is at 10am 100 pesos rt then it runs every 2 hours coming back.  Beautiful and quiet when you get there early. There are palapas on the beach for shade. If they are all taken people don\u2019t mind sharing. You spend most of your time in the water anyways. Bring a snorkel and mask and you can see some fish by the rocks.  Don\u2019t forget your sunscreen and waterproof bag for your camera.  Water shoes are needed if you want to go on the rocks to take pics of the mushroom rock.  Enjoy the unspoiled area.

595896849.name: It is a fascinating place - very shallow water for the whole bay, sand bottom
595896849.author: a TripAdvisor user
595896849.reviewBody: This is an extraordinary place unprecedented in my experience.  The whole huge bay it set in the midst of desert hills about a half-hour drive from La Paz. There are no bathrooms or restaurants at the beach, just a few food trucks. Its a locals family beach. The whole bay is less than chest deep, no kidding, and you can walk hundreds of yards off the beach and still be mostly dry. It\'s beautiful, but it is a hang out, no waves, place.

595121318.name: Warning about theft from this beach
595121318.author: a TripAdvisor user
595121318.reviewBody:
Stopped at this beach for a quick swim. Left a camera and some cash in the trunk of the rental car. Returned a short time later and the car was still locked and seemingly undisturbed. Discovered cash missing when i got my wallet - no credit cards were taken. They went through my wife's purse and very carefully took some small amounts of cash, went through all our bags and took a couple of other small items (Kindle) then looked uip and took off. 

Granted we're an easy mark and made the mistake of leaving stuff in the car but it was a just a quick dipso didn't fuss with the usual security. This is clearly a very organized theft so just use this as a reminder.

Otherwise, an okay beach but nice water - like a giant ocean swimming pool.

593814814.name: Breathtaking! A must visit
593814814.author: a TripAdvisor user
593814814.reviewBody: Highlight of our trip to la Paz. Water has great visibility and super shallow. We could see the little fish swim around and could walk half way across the beach with the water until our waist. Most beautiful sunset of our lives!

593564428.name: This is a great preserve
593564428.author: a TripAdvisor user
593564428.reviewBody: This location is well worth a stop. It is a part of the natural preserve. It is very pretty and a clean area. On the day we visited, it was a bit cloudy and we got a break from the heat of the sun. This area has no staff members to help with questions and answers.  There were several boats anchored in the area.  Most of them had smaller boats to get to the beaches.

593554919.name: Remote beach worth the drive!
593554919.author: a TripAdvisor user
593554919.reviewBody: Beautiful beach with pure white sand and shallow water. There are no facilities so pack a cooler, sunscreen, beach umbrella and snacks for a fun day. Bring your favorite floats to soak up the sun or snorkel. Approximately 3 hour drive each way from Cabo San Lucas.

591924457.name: Gorgeous beach
591924457.author: a TripAdvisor user
591924457.reviewBody: This one is clean and looks like a pool. My favorite from the area. Make sure you were swimming shoes.

591551749.name: Visitor
591551749.author: a TripAdvisor user
591551749.reviewBody: All a good experience. The favorite locals beach they say. We were given chairs to sit on the beach. Good place for children.\n\n

591405466.name: Lovely beach
591405466.author: a TripAdvisor user
591405466.reviewBody: Our friends and we like to leave our "stuff" on the beach and walk out a little into the water and plant our umbrellas and chairs. It\'s fun sitting in the water. If you go out further, you need to shuffle your feet so the little rays know you\'re coming their way so they have time to get out of the way. Not difficult and its a great view.

590338004.name: Best Beach period.
590338004.author: a TripAdvisor user
590338004.reviewBody: I can honestly say this is the nicest beach I have ever been to, the sand is so nice and soft, the water is so clear It feels like a big pool, awesome place to visit!

589869912.name: must see
589869912.author: a TripAdvisor user
589869912.reviewBody: if you\'re in la paz you have to explore this beach. bring some ceviche, water, beer and you\'re good to go :)

589764039.name: Beautiful scenery
589764039.author: a TripAdvisor user
589764039.reviewBody: A great place to relax, but a bit crowded sometimes. You can easily walk across the bay if the crowds get too much. Not much snorkeling. Great views from the hill overlooking the bay.

589291568.name: Beautiful!
589291568.author: a TripAdvisor user
589291568.reviewBody: Wow! I thought it was so beautiful here. Shallow, warm water that is perfectly still. I could have swam around all day. It was part of a tour so only had an hour. If you like swimming and the beach it is a must go while in La Paz.

589200839.name: Amazing
589200839.author: a TripAdvisor user
589200839.reviewBody: Balandra is  an amazing beach young children and adults love this beach. About 2 miles of walking inside the warm water which never reach above our shoulders. Crystal clear water. Just beautiful. We adore this place.

588544041.name: A hidden gem
588544041.author: a TripAdvisor user
588544041.reviewBody: About 2 hours drive from Cabo. It\u2019s a hidden gem. We have visited so many beaches around the world, and this one is on the top of the list. Nature at its best. \nYou can rent an umbrella and relax. Make sure you stop by la Paz for seafood on your way back

588444627.name: Fun in the Sun
588444627.author: a TripAdvisor user
588444627.reviewBody: Nice outing with a visiting amigo.      When you go bring your own umbrella or get there early to score one of the many pomfon shaded areas on the shore

588421985.name: Breathtaking!!!
588421985.author: a TripAdvisor user
588421985.reviewBody: This beach is absolutely gorgeous. Traveling with small children we have to be mindful of the waves and the water was absolutely perfect for our toddler here. It was something out of a postcard! We tried going the first time but didn\u2019t arrive until 11 and the palapa were all taken so next time we arrived at 10 am and snagged one. Only thing to note: SAND FLEAS! Bring bug spray. I was eaten alive!

586525044.name: AMAZING!
586525044.author: a TripAdvisor user
586525044.reviewBody: We thoroughly enjoyed this beach, only a short trip from La Paz.  Kayaked in the mangroves and walked through the crystal clear, warm waters.  You don\u2019t need a mask and snorkle to see an array of sea life.  Next time we\u2019d take a cooler with cerveza and maybe a few snacks since the beach hasn\u2019t been commercialized at all.  Totally unique beach experience.

586189701.name: Day excursion
586189701.author: a TripAdvisor user
586189701.reviewBody: We rented a car from Cabo to head this way, it was well worth the drive. The beaches are white, warm waters and crystal clear you can walk for miles in waste high water. Bring you own food and drinks as the cart is very expensive since it\u2019s unpopulated. You can rent paddles boards or kayaks. This is the sea of Cortez side which is very different than the pacific. The drive was safe and fairly easy directions wise. A must adventure and you can stop at other places along the way.

585838622.name: Aqua Agua: Wade in Clear Shallow Water Among the Schools
585838622.author: a TripAdvisor user
585838622.reviewBody:
This beautiful beach was full of surprises. Maybe because I didn't do my homework, went on a whim and had no idea what to expect. Many wouldn't drive 2 hours out of Cabo San Lucas (the tourist area) and come to a beach they only heard from a local "was beautiful and you can wade out as far as you can imagine and see fish and stingrays!" Well, that was enough for me to visit this amazing aqua reserve and I was pleasantly surprised. 

Perhaps I was a bit nervous on the ride up as we rented a car to get there and braved the foreign roads on our own. Certain things to note that you don't see in the US are military vehicles with large guns and men in military garb commonly driving by on the roads. They are common in the area, however, and most likely looking out for the safety of tourists.

We drove through a few "deserted" desert areas, some random desert homes, and eventually ended up in La Paz. (It is pretty much a straight shot on the freeway so you will not get lost.) La Paz was built up and rather quaint. It was the traditional beach town, complete with statues, a harbor, restaurants, markets, and most helpful was an information booth, which provided free brochures. (Balandra is about 45 minutes outside of La Paz.) We took the brochure and were off.

This Sea of Cortez treasure was like nothing I had ever experienced. I have been in some amazing locations and a few beaches stick out such as a tiny beach on the Caribbean Island of Carriacou which also had some shallow beaches, but they were not tucked away and protected such as this. They also were not shallow nearly as far out as Balandra Beach.

It was an extreme delight to not even need snorkeling gear. The water was so clear you can see schools of assorted fish left and right (obviously be careful not to get too close to the stingray.)

585186695.name: Amazing Place
585186695.author: a TripAdvisor user
585186695.reviewBody: If you visit La Paz, Balandra beach is a must.  Its a very safe beach, and you can walk inside the sea more that 100 yards. The scenario is amazing combining the dessert and the sea.

584682588.name: Beautiful place!!
584682588.author: a TripAdvisor user
584682588.reviewBody: Go as early as possible! One time we went by car around sunrise and it was so magical. There was no one there, climbed up the little mountain for a perfect view and enjoyed it so much. If you go early you are sure you have a beach umbrella to project yourself against the sun. Another time we took the bus from Malecon (100 peson return), it was way more crowded on the beach but still wonderful!

583755681.name: Hidden Gem!
583755681.author: a TripAdvisor user
583755681.reviewBody: Balandra is one of my favorite beaches to visit in La Paz BCS. It is located about 25min drive from La Paz. The beach offers turquoise blue clear waters that are amazing to walk and swim into.  You can walk hundreds of feet into the ocean and will not sink in, 3-4ft deep. It\'s a Giant Natural swimming pool, perfect for Kids! I was a little skeptical to get in the water due to we were warned by locals to watch for stingrays, I recommend shuffle your feet in the sand.  But really no Stingrays to be seen. There are vendors that rent kayaks and paddle boards. We had an amazing day enjoying the beach, waters, and taking all the vitamin D from the sun. My recommendation is to stop by an Oxxo and buy a cooler and drinks to go, you may also take snacks. Lots of sunscreen needed or get there early to get a Palapa, about 15 of them available for public use at no charge. Parking is also available at no charge. If by the time you leave and feel hungry, just drive about 7minutes to El Tecolote Beach and they have variety of beach front restaurants. Balandra is a must visit!

583179106.name: Balandra Beach is Unadulterated Beauty
583179106.author: a TripAdvisor user
583179106.reviewBody: Unadulterated beauty is necessary in this world. Why, one might ask, is it necessary? I say it is because of the potential for a sort of epiphany one might experience in the magnificence of the natural world that is not possible through any other medium of human expression; whether it be art, music, or literature. Balandra Beach is an epiphany waiting to happen for you. Go there.

582472953.name: beautiful
582472953.author: a TripAdvisor user
582472953.reviewBody: Came here and it was amazing, crystal clear waters and light blue colors. there was just some garbage around which was disappointing.

581828353.name: Gorgeous
581828353.author: a TripAdvisor user
581828353.reviewBody:
The most gorgeous beach ever!!! 
You can walk and walk and the cristal clear water doesn't go higher than you're waist. 
It has beautiful white sandy beaches and it's an adventure to get to the famous rock!! Worth the climb through the rocks!!!
One of my favorite places to go!!!

581547072.name: One of the best beaches in Mexico
581547072.author: a TripAdvisor user
581547072.reviewBody: 2nd time in this beach and it is just very amazing. Last time there was no people, but this time, although it was crowded, we enjoyed very much.\nWorth going there even if you are in Cabo.

580177884.name: Amazing
580177884.author: a TripAdvisor user
580177884.reviewBody: Balandra is an absolutely amazing place. It is so peaceful and serene. It is the absolutely perfect place to spend a day. It\'s great for small children to play and enjoy the water safely. My 16 month old was able to wade in the water without fear of waves or rip tides. It was a little less than knee deep when we went, but I hear it can get as deep as waist high. It is a bit of a drive and in the middle of nowhere, but that just adds to its appeal. It is the perfect place for kayaking, canoeing, or paddleboarding. The day we were there it was 104 degrees outside, but there was a nice breeze and it only felt to be in the 80s (I was incredibly surprised when I saw the actual temperture). It has parking and a decent amount of palapas for shade, but there are no other amenties; no food or bathrooms. There was a truck vendor selling miscellaneous items, but you should take any food or water you want to consume. We went midweek and there were a decent amount of people there. I would expect it to be very busy on the weekend as it is such a great place.

579110711.name: Very nice, quiet and scenic beach
579110711.author: a TripAdvisor user
579110711.reviewBody: It is one of the beaches I never saw before due to the good quality of water and the scenic landscaping.

578618565.name: Paradise
578618565.author: a TripAdvisor user
578618565.reviewBody: Absolutely beautiful location just 30 minutes from La Paz. In May the water is still a little chilly, but warm enough to snorkel or play... floating in the rafts was too cold.  If you take snorkeling equipment, walk around the point towards the right, walk across that new beach to the next point. This is where the mushroom rock is. Get in the water there then keep heading that direction down the coast. You\u2019ll see a good variety of fish, including puffers if you are paying attention. Also some anemones, soft corals, urchins, etc.  it was impressing for shore based snorkeling

578067677.name: Mire than what you can exepct !!!
578067677.author: a TripAdvisor user
578067677.reviewBody: Don \u2018t loose this place ! It is unforgettable. \nNo doubt that is one of the best spot in Baja California

577770354.name: Breathtaking Balandra Beach
577770354.author: a TripAdvisor user
577770354.reviewBody: During our 7-day trip to Cabo, we opted to be courageous and drive to see the famous Balandra Beach in La Paz, Mexico. The approximately 2-5 to 3 hour drive was fun. Parking was a breeze and it wasn\'t packed since most folks were either in school or at work. The water was at least knee height throughout the entire day just as we were told it would be. Area is very safe and there are no issues in the parking lot or in the actual bathing area. We would definitely come back with friends and family as well as a bit better prepared with gear. Balandra Beach was very clean as well. Great place for couples as well as family and friends.

577440433.name: One of my favourite Beach!
577440433.author: a TripAdvisor user
577440433.reviewBody: Balandra is by far one of my favourite beach in Mexico! It can be crowded but you can always find a spot to be on your own. It\'s just like paradise!!

576585331.name: Heaven on Earth
576585331.author: a TripAdvisor user
576585331.reviewBody: My friend and I spent a couple days in Baja California Sur M\u00e9xico and got a chance to take a road trip from Cabo San Lucas to La Paz BCS is around 2hrs away, we had been told about Balandra Beach, saw a couple of pictures online and decided to go, OMG!! What a beautiful place, so if you\'re in BCS M\u00e9xico tristemente me it\'s worth the trip!

575938559.name: Time at the beach
575938559.author: a TripAdvisor user
575938559.reviewBody:
Everyone should take the time to visit this beach.
Beautiful stunning color and very shallow to walk in.
Nice short drive from Hyatt Place where we stayed 20 minutes.
There are no washrooms at this beach which was the only negative. Plenty of parking and there was a good amount of visitors which made the beach feel more safe.

575704586.name: Beautiful beach
575704586.author: a TripAdvisor user
575704586.reviewBody: We were able to rent SUP and cruise around the whole area. It was beautiful beach with clear blue water.

575535822.name: Nice beach, nice scenery but not for swimming
575535822.author: a TripAdvisor user
575535822.reviewBody:
Balandra Beach is a lovely beach about 30min out of La Paz.

The sand is nice and there are shelters around the beach but get there early if you want one.

The water is warm and reasonablely clear but you can walk out a couple of hundred metres and still only be knee deep, so not for swimming.

Around the point is Mushroom Rock which is a nice 10min walk either along the sand and across the rocks at the point or in the water a lower tide.

There's a vendor there that sells mangoes but not much else so bring drinks and any food you want for your stay.

To get there Ecobajatours, at the Malecon terminal, have regular buses that cost 100 Pesos for the return trip.

575294867.name: Amazing
575294867.author: a TripAdvisor user
575294867.reviewBody: I have never seen a beach like this. The water is crystal clear and you can walk out so far and the water wont go past your waist. Get there early if you want an umbrella/palapas. There are about 20 of them and they get taken fast. Other than that there is no shade. We encountered some rude people who would not share there palapa even though there were just 2 of them and were in the water the whole time. But besides that bring a ton of sunscreen and have fun. There is no restrooms so your on your own. They do have a little vendor and they come around and you can order ceviche or fresh fruit which is really nice. Definitely worth the visit.

575178072.name: Wow
575178072.author: a TripAdvisor user
575178072.reviewBody: Breath taking beach, get there early to get a shade umbrella, we arrived around 10:30 on a tuesday.  Remember bug spray as the sand flies bite a lot in the shade.

574773189.name: Relaxing and secluded
574773189.author: a TripAdvisor user
574773189.reviewBody: We spent two days here just relaxing. A few quiet, quaint, accessible beach used by tourists and locals alike.  It\'s not much for swimming or waves - excellent for wading, SUP/sea kayak and just enjoying the beautiful, peaceful setting. No services.. you can go to the next beach (about a 5 minute drive) if you need food and restrooms.

574463516.name: Not to miss but arrive early
574463516.author: a TripAdvisor user
574463516.reviewBody: This beach is not to miss if you are in La Paz. It\u2019s not far and really great. But it gets crowded quite quickly, which can change the experience. Arrive early. And don\u2019t forget to climb on the top of the small mountain next to the beach you will be rewarded by a breath taking view.

573850983.name: Amazing!
573850983.author: a TripAdvisor user
573850983.reviewBody: There are several bays and you can walk in the sea from one beach to the other. Shallow and transparent water. Lots of fishes. No services on the beach, but still it is wonderful. Must see place! You can rent a car, go by taxi or by bus from Malecon. Buses just pass every 1.5 hour.

573580001.name: Beauty beyond belief
573580001.author: a TripAdvisor user
573580001.reviewBody:
Balandra beach was my favorite beach we visited! We drove 2.5 hours from Los Cabos to go there thanks to the locals we spoke with at our resort. They all recommended Balandra for its beauty and the shallow, beautiful waters. Balandra has beautiful white sand (in complete contrast to Los Cabos’ pebbly sand beaches). The sand was like sugar. Very fine and soft. 

The water was placid and very shallow for several hundred feet. We could let the kids roam and explore without fear of waves or drop offs in the water. We rented a paddle board for $16/hour and tried that out. Was the PERFECT place to learn / self- teach paddle boarding! The water, due to the depth, was warm and inviting unlike the other areas of the Sea of Cortez which were still quite cold!! 

As other posts have mentioned, there is little shade at Balandra. There are now approximately 10-12 palapas to escape the sun under. There are also overhangs from the cliffs where we found shade along with the very friendly locals. There are now a few vendors who sell food out of the back of their truck. A man was asking the locals if they wanted ceviche (he seemed like a delivery guy) but he didn’t ask us. If my Spanish were better, we would have enjoyed ceviche on the beach.... 

We did however, enjoy empanadas on the beach from Doce Cuarenta, a hip coffee and sandwich shop in La Paz.

573514290.name: Calm, serene and beautiful!
573514290.author: a TripAdvisor user
573514290.reviewBody: This beach was lovely. The water was crystal clear and still as can be. We went to the section that you can only reach by boat, and it was very secluded which made for an incredibly peaceful experience. I recommend checking it out!

572297686.name: Beautiful Bay
572297686.author: a TripAdvisor user
572297686.reviewBody: Crowded when we visited over Easter weekend.  This is a beautiful beach!!  I wish it hadn\u2019t been so busy when we visited but this is a place to hang out for the day.  Water is clear with lots of marine life.

571799620.name: Beautiful Beach
571799620.author: a TripAdvisor user
571799620.reviewBody: This is a very beautiful beach just outside of La Paz. Totally worth the drive. Pack your own snacks...no services.

571516274.name: Picture Perfect!
571516274.author: a TripAdvisor user
571516274.reviewBody: Spent several hours here with 6 adults and 6 children (ages 8-5 months). We brought our inflatable paddle boards and spent the day on our own private spot. Fun in the sun, snorkeling, and loving life.

571487806.name: Best beach on the continent
571487806.author: a TripAdvisor user
571487806.reviewBody: Love Balandra Beach.  My brothers and I frequent La Paz and always spend a day or two swimming around Balandra.  If you can handle the trek, keep walking to the last beach in the bay.  The water is clearer, and the fish are more plentiful.  For a real good swim, go from Balandra to Tecolote.  The swim between the two has even better snorkeling and larger fish.

571375916.name: A must see, clearest water ever!!
571375916.author: a TripAdvisor user
571375916.reviewBody: Go early in the day as it can get quite busy. Take a beach umbrella with you, there are some shade palapas but you might not get one.

571164789.name: Hideaway beach
571164789.author: a TripAdvisor user
571164789.reviewBody: Really cool semi-hidden beach.  The water is pretty shallow, especially when the tide is out, so you can walk pretty far out in the water.

570377378.name: Bad timing on our part
570377378.author: a TripAdvisor user
570377378.reviewBody: Samana Santa is a huge celebration here in the Baja sur.  Everyone goes to the beach with family.  Not just this beach, all beaches were packed.  We got all the way there from San Jose del Cabo (2hr+ drive) and couldn\u2019t even get to the beach it was so busy.  Definitely bad timing for us.

570236772.name: Beautiful treasure
570236772.author: a TripAdvisor user
570236772.reviewBody: This place is beautiful. We were luck enough to visit when it wasn\u2019t too crowded . The second time we went there was not parking so we left and stopped by a beach closer to La Paz but no were near as nice.

569382268.name: Too Hot
569382268.author: a TripAdvisor user
569382268.reviewBody: We visited Balandra Beach in the middle of the day. It is just as pictured - shallow water, nice beach, beautiful. BUT be forwarned: there are no toilets, no wind, no waves, no shells for beachcombers, & if you aren\'t lucky enough to snag a spot under an umbrella, it is just too hot. So we relocated to Telecote Beach: food, toilets, wind, waves & plenty of shells. Balandra would be fun for families with toddlers, but not for us.

568980157.name: It\'s all true
568980157.author: a TripAdvisor user
568980157.reviewBody: Previous posters have summed it up quite well... Playa Balandra is a beautiful place.  The various hues of blue water against a backdrop of desert mountains is stunning.

568707104.name: Balandra beach
568707104.author: a TripAdvisor user
568707104.reviewBody: Amazing beach ideal for families. You can walk forever and before the water level reaches your waist. Calm water, beautiful  beach!

568655528.name: One of the best beaches ever!
568655528.author: a TripAdvisor user
568655528.reviewBody: Such an incredible beach!  Get there early to snag one of the palapas on the shore.  Also pay attention to tide charts because at low tide there is almost no water in the Bay, a perfect place to go at high tide.

568536288.name: Beautiful beach
568536288.author: a TripAdvisor user
568536288.reviewBody: This beach is gorgeous. The water is so clear and shallow. We went in few feet and the water won\u2019t go above our waste. Just make sure you bring your own food/drinks/snacks since they don\u2019t sell anything there. Great place to relax and enjoy the view.

568285038.name: Get there early!
568285038.author: a TripAdvisor user
568285038.reviewBody: What a gorgeous beach. I am sure by previous posts it has already been said. We got there by 9:30 and was one of three cars. We left at 1:00 and it was packed. Several vendors for a Thurs. We rented SUP for an hour. 250 pesos an hour. Go. Enjoy. Relax!

567939226.name: Pristine and lovely
567939226.author: a TripAdvisor user
567939226.reviewBody:
Probably the nicest beach in La Paz! Go early as the crowds are minimal and the basin is filled with water. At low tide the basin practically empties out and you're left with wet sand. 

Located a 30 minute drive from the La Paz Malecon it can be challenging to get to but taxi cabs take will you out there for approximately 300 Pesos ($15) which isn't bad considering the distance. However, there are public buses (at Obregon and Cinco de Mayo) that run approximately every hour for less than 100 Pesos. 
There are no public services at the beach such as changing rooms or restrooms so put your suit on ahead of time and bring your own TP if you think you'll need it. Bring lots of sunscreen and a hat if you have one!

567933447.name: Swimmable, beautiful beach!
567933447.author: a TripAdvisor user
567933447.reviewBody: My husband and I travel to Cabo at least once a year, and Balandra iso ne of our favorite spots. We rent a car and drive up from our hotel. It is a swimmable beach, which if you\'ve been to the Cab area you know that is rare.  The water is beautiful, warm and calm.  IT gets busy, so get there early if you want to claim some shade. There are always a few vendors there for snacks, drinks and necessities.

567332521.name: Beautiful Beach
567332521.author: a TripAdvisor user
567332521.reviewBody: The Beach is beautiful, the major problem that I found is the lack of available parking lot and that there\u2019s no restrooms available; so you should guess your options available when you gotta go... hope the authorities solve this issue because this is a great place to visit in La Paz.

566161857.name: Just beautifuk
566161857.author: a TripAdvisor user
566161857.reviewBody: Great beach.  Get there early for shade.  Walk to the mushroom walk and enjoy a serene beach.  Shallow, but sparkling blue.

565668014.name: Beautiful Beach
565668014.author: a TripAdvisor user
565668014.reviewBody: Watch out for the bus timetable - they do their own thing. We had to hitch back. No cafe/bar - take everything you need - it\u2019s a must see.

565566949.name: Just unique
565566949.author: a TripAdvisor user
565566949.reviewBody:
It’s really like two crescent shaped bays connected to each other. You have to walk or wade to the right side to get to the iconic, mushroom shaped rock formation. 

At high tide we could walk across the bay at about waist depth, at very low tide it was about to knee depth.  Out past the iconic rock where it gets deeper you can actually swim. If you wade or swim around the outcropping of rocks beyond the iconic rock there is another, even nicer beach. 

We took the local bus from La Paz, which was very easy and took about 40 minutes but was a scenic ride for 100 pesos round trip. The bus also goes to Técoloté about 5 minutes away (the bus stops at Balandra coming and going).

Note that there is a parking lot next to the beach (behind the row of palapa) and garbage cans, but no other facilities, i.e., no restrooms and no vendors.

565118293.name: Completely worth the drive
565118293.author: a TripAdvisor user
565118293.reviewBody: I was completely blown away.  Our trip to Cabo is complete with our day excursion at LaPaz.  Balandra Beach is simply amazing.  We can\'t wait to come back.

564758455.name: Really amazing beach!
564758455.author: a TripAdvisor user
564758455.reviewBody: This is such a pretty spot.  You can easily get away from the "crowds",  we went on a Sunday, the busiest day of the week and it was still very peaceful.  Safe, gorgeous, unspoiled, clean.  You can take a short hike up a hill to get an amazing view.  You can wade (it is very shallow) across the bay to a private beach. There is decent free parking (no restroom though)

563989392.name: Unexpected beauty
563989392.author: a TripAdvisor user
563989392.reviewBody: This was the first stop and we only stayed 45 minutes.  If I were to go again I would take an umbrella and snorkel gear.  A lunch and ice chest are recommended.  This is a spectacular bay and not to be missed.   Warning no facilities available.

563697728.name: Balandra Beach
563697728.author: a TripAdvisor user
563697728.reviewBody: A peaceful place to spend time walking between the different beaches across from each other and next to each other. There\u2019s a total of 7 white sand beaches. No one bothers you. You need to take your own picnic

563631909.name: It was worth the travel
563631909.author: a TripAdvisor user
563631909.reviewBody: We red the reviews from Trip Advisor and decided to drive out there.  It was worth the drive.  It was not your regular beach.  One side was black rocky mountains and other side was super fine sand.  Water was really shallow and light blue.  You have to walk for a while to actually get to deeper area to be able to swim.  There was free parking very close to the beach.  Many palapas for people to use.  We went even further and found a secluded are to sit.  Mountain looked like it was an inactive volcano.  There were caves at the bottom where people were sitting  there to hide from the sun.  We were there till 4 pm.  We returned thinking water may be returning soon.  We didn\'t want to get trapped in the area we were in.  THERE ARE NO BATHROOMS.

563619440.name: Beautiful beach
563619440.author: a TripAdvisor user
563619440.reviewBody: This is a beautiful beach only 15 to 20 min drive from la Paz baja, also very shallow waters.only minor problem there aren\'t public bathrooms but you can drive 5 mim arond the corner to coyote beach and there is a seafood restaurant bar.

563433082.name: Beautiful Beach but no beach bar or restaurant facilities
563433082.author: a TripAdvisor user
563433082.reviewBody: A lovely beach but Tecolote is the better beach a few minutes away. Good for kayaking and snorkelling but it was cool in February when we visited. Water was warm but ambient temp was off-putting.  Just one man\u2019s opinion.

562030101.name: The most beautiful beach you\u2019ve never heard of
562030101.author: a TripAdvisor user
562030101.reviewBody: If you surf, there are no waves. Beautiful white sand shallow cove. Mangroves at the top of the cove. Natural tunnels in the rock structure. Palapas open to the public.

562008382.name: Unique. Awesome.
562008382.author: a TripAdvisor user
562008382.reviewBody: Rustic and no facilities. But so fantastic. Sheltered from wind. Shallow crystal clear water. Shells for kids. Snorkel for adults. Palapa for shade. A view I will not soon forget!

561534361.name: Beautiful, but crowded
561534361.author: a TripAdvisor user
561534361.reviewBody: Balandra Beach is beautiful and remote, but it was very crowded on a Saturday afternoon. There is a fairly big expanse of sand along very shallow water, so it would be great for families with small children. There are several palapa-style umbrellas, but I imagine they are claimed fairly early in the day. There are many sandbars, so it is fun to walk way out in the water and only be up to your ankles. You may want to wear water shoes so you can explore the rock formations and tide pools at low tide. No bathrooms or other facilities. There were a couple of pick-up trucks in the parking area selling fresh fruit, but no other food or beverages. It is in a very quiet cove, so you are facing rocks not the open sea. Worth a visit, but I didn\'t think it was quite worth the hype.

561141190.name: Natural pool exciting view
561141190.author: a TripAdvisor user
561141190.reviewBody: Do no miss it ! It is the only beach to check out in the area. 25 min north from La Paz doen town, you can park your car on a small public parking and access the beach, take your shoes off here you are in. Just connect mother nature and enjoy the feeling, and the panoramic view

560952948.name: Shallow tidal lagoon
560952948.author: a TripAdvisor user
560952948.reviewBody: Awesome place to visit. Went at low tide, when you can walk for at least 300-400 feet and the water is just waist deep. Great place to take kids and specially those who love to see crabs and fish. The sunset from the hilltop is breathtaking. \nBesides some nice shades there are no other facilities here.

560884581.name: Beautiful!,,
560884581.author: a TripAdvisor user
560884581.reviewBody: You need a car or take a tour, but this place is gorgeous. There are no services - bring your own water and snacks. Good place to let the kids go in the water because it is so shallow

560832042.name: Beautiful
560832042.author: a TripAdvisor user
560832042.reviewBody: A must, jus be careful to take all your beach gear and food/water if you are planning to stay the day. It is a virgin beach area.

560750419.name: Amazing stretch of beach with enormous area of shallow water to enjoy
560750419.author: a TripAdvisor user
560750419.reviewBody: Good, clean beach that stretches for ever surrounding a huge lagoon-like area of shallow sea.  Excellent for relaxing or paddle-boarding

560672620.name: Beautiful
560672620.author: a TripAdvisor user
560672620.reviewBody: A large perfect beach in a protected cove. About 20 palapas lined up on the beach (no charge). Very shallow water but we were able to use a kayak. OK snorkeling around the rocks on the other side of the cove. A bit cool in February but still swimable. \nIt\'s about a 25 minute drive from downtown La  Paz. There\'s also a city bus.

560354731.name: Beautiful
560354731.author: a TripAdvisor user
560354731.reviewBody:
Nice virgin beach. It's like a giant pool, not deep at all.

Calm water.

I think it could have some ecofriendly infrastructure, it´s the only thing missing to have an excellente place

560122423.name: Pretty place
560122423.author: a TripAdvisor user
560122423.reviewBody: Very pretty little bay, fairly clean too! Easy place to wade in the water. Had some fun helping a little fish build his house!

559449638.name: Relaxing
559449638.author: a TripAdvisor user
559449638.reviewBody: Beautiful beach, not crowded and much cleaner than the private resort beach! Easy short drive from town

559299088.name: Most amazing beach I\'ve ever visited
559299088.author: a TripAdvisor user
559299088.reviewBody:
I am not a beach person. I feel the need to preface this review with that statement, because I did not want to leave Balandra Beach the day we visited. It is truly one of the most beautiful places I have ever been.

The enormous bay is only waist deep for hundreds of meters, and the pristine waters and sand just enhance every aspect of the place. I would return in a heartbeat.

The beach isn't overrun with vendors like many other popular beaches in Mexico, and the distance from La Paz seems to keep crowds down. We were there on a Saturday in February, and while finding shade was tough, the place was not so crowded that it was overwhelming.

559113258.name: Cool Place, Better on a Sunny Day
559113258.author: a TripAdvisor user
559113258.reviewBody: La Paz is a very industrial port city but some of the beaches are interesting because the water is clear, very shallow and walkable.  It was fun to take a hike in this area that has sand dunes and some great places for pictures.

558861285.name: Beatiful beach
558861285.author: a TripAdvisor user
558861285.reviewBody: We had a great time there, this beach has a lot of people on weekends, it is beautiful ant there is the famous stone fungus, a symbol of la Paz

558187825.name: Belongings Stolen
558187825.author: a TripAdvisor user
558187825.reviewBody: Beautiful area however we went out for one hour and our camera and phone were stolen. It was super busy and we hid them in our car... I know i know... I\'m in Mexico... don\'t leave stuff in the car but I can\'t exactly take everything with me out... Saddest part is all the memories /photos gone. Lesson learned. So beautiful and a must see but go looking poor and leave NOTHING behind. That way you will enjoy and not have the bad experience we had.\nAdios

558143848.name: Great Day Trip
558143848.author: a TripAdvisor user
558143848.reviewBody: While driving the Baja we stopped in to check out this beach. It was nice and sheltered as this was a windy day. Great for a little kayak adventure.

557996880.name: Amazing!!!
557996880.author: a TripAdvisor user
557996880.reviewBody: I love this place! Incredible views and great place to spend a great day! Bring your own umbrella also water and things to eat because there no place to buy things!

557558552.name: beach trip
557558552.author: a TripAdvisor user
557558552.reviewBody:
best beach in baja
shallow warm 

un busy

would def recommend to visit
about 45 mins by bus

lots of other great beachs near by

556989067.name: Absolutely beautiful!!
556989067.author: a TripAdvisor user
556989067.reviewBody: This beach was absolutely beautiful and different from any beach I\u2019ve ever seen. We stopped by to have some lunch after our day or snorkeling with whale sharks and sea lions. Watch out for things that may have washed ashore, my boyfriend stepped on a dead porcupine fish and the spikes punctured his foot. We were lucky enough to spot a shark very close to the beach. We had just climbed back into the boat and started to take off when I saw something, the captain even got his phone out to record because he said sharks never come into the beach there.

556970562.name: Easy access to an amazing beach!
556970562.author: a TripAdvisor user
556970562.reviewBody: We have visited this beach a few times and love it for its tranquil blue waters and white sand. Great for relaxing, bird watching, snorkeling and swimming. Its just a short drive from La Paz.

556963633.name: Relaxing day at the beach
556963633.author: a TripAdvisor user
556963633.reviewBody:
Very beautiful public beach where you can enjoy the water and views (climbing up the rocks).
Kayaking is also nice - although the water in winter is still quite cold.

Unfortunately day tours pass by the beach so it has become quite touristic.

556327933.name: Beautiful beach
556327933.author: a TripAdvisor user
556327933.reviewBody: Beautiful beach for walking if too cold to swim. There were a few areas that provided shade, so nice spot for a picnic.

556022043.name: Beautiful and easy fun
556022043.author: a TripAdvisor user
556022043.reviewBody: Bring a picnic and shade. No bathrooms. It was nice to not have any vendors hovering around. We did not encounter stingrays. We got to experience a relaxing and more secluded time near the rock formation in the first half of our day. When we returned to the beach closer to parking, we enjoyed the party crowd with live music even! It felt like two different places but in good way.

555595297.name: The Largest Swimming Pool in the Wrold
555595297.author: a TripAdvisor user
555595297.reviewBody: We recently revisted Balandra Bay after a twenty year absence.  Its beauty continues to take your breath away.  Its depth is only mid-calf, extending for probably a half-mile plus from shore.  We were informed it is now a protected area, and we noticed how visitors were careful to pick up their garbage.  There is a parking area with adequate spaces during mid-week, but you might have to park on side of road during a weekend.  There are no facilities, bathrooms or restaurants.  It is peaceful, tranquil, a gem.

555297426.name: Beautiful!
555297426.author: a TripAdvisor user
555297426.reviewBody: Must see!  Climb the hill for the view.  Shallow, safe, no amenities. Easy drive from La Paz.  Good parking.

554813932.name: Amazing!!
554813932.author: a TripAdvisor user
554813932.reviewBody: I truly believe after going up and down the Baja, that by far this is the most amazing beach in all of Mexico. The sand is icing sugar white and soft, the water is clear clean warm and completely beyond words amazing

554650314.name: Worth the visit!
554650314.author: a TripAdvisor user
554650314.reviewBody: Beautiful and very clean beach! Worth the visit!! to walk on the sea its great, water is without waves.. very peaceful and beautiful place.

553877903.name: A bay like no other!
553877903.author: a TripAdvisor user
553877903.reviewBody: We spent 2 days here, SUPing and swimming and wading. Breathtaking scenery and clear, beautiful water.

553462058.name: Beach day
553462058.author: a TripAdvisor user
553462058.reviewBody: We drove from Cabo to La Paz for the day; it was a beautiful drive. The crystal clear waters of the bay were amazing. It was not as secluded as we thought but the beach is huge and everyone is spread out so it was fine. We had a palapa (free) which was great. Fun for swimming, exploring, and relaxing.

552703604.name: Beautiful beach, go early!
552703604.author: a TripAdvisor user
552703604.reviewBody: We were cancelled for our diving trip and decide to head to Balandra Bach to know the place. Once we get there, the beautiful of the place catch us and desire to stay the day there. Was really fortunate for us just to arrive early, we could choose a nice Palapa to have shadow from the sun and spend all morning there.

552265579.name: Incredibly beautiful and peaceful
552265579.author: a TripAdvisor user
552265579.reviewBody: Incredibly beautiful and peaceful, even during a norte! The ports were closed, but it was beautiful in this protected cove.

552053605.name: Beautiful sunset with Mushroom Rock in pictures
552053605.author: a TripAdvisor user
552053605.reviewBody: The beach was not difficult to get to, about 25 minutes from the tourist area of La Paz.  Once parked, you walk about 15 minutes to the rock.  Beach was quite clean and I am glad people respect the environment and did not throw much trash around, unlike some places in Asia or elsewhere.  Go late in the afternoon, like 4 pm or after to catch sunset and there will be less tourists clamoring over the rock then.  You can take pictures without others around.

552040443.name: It is paradise!
552040443.author: a TripAdvisor user
552040443.reviewBody: You must visit this beach , water is super clear and crystal , nature so amazing that you can walk across the bay from one side to another, the sea only reaches knee height.  When the tide starts to reside in the afternoon, the bay is even shallower and small sand islands start to appear.  It\u2019s beautiful!  Locals said that there are mosquitoes or kind of bees after 4pm, so be careful , I believe perfect timing to visit this beach from 11-4pm.  Has some palapas, no food around , you will see some caves and rocks around , beautiful!

551969642.name: Low tide experience
551969642.author: a TripAdvisor user
551969642.reviewBody: This is a cool tide pool, sea life walk around beach expereince- tons of sealife all around- daughter did get a small Jellyfish sting wading in water- not without dangers but worth the great memories

551589740.name: Bello pero peligroso
551589740.author: a TripAdvisor user
551589740.reviewBody: Una playa muy bonita con aguas muy claras. Pero tengas cuidado con las medusas. Yo fui y me pico una. No hay servicios de sanitario y/o un lugar para comer. Hay mejores playas sin duda. \n\nBeautiful beach with crystal clear waters. But be careful with the jellyfish!! I went a few days ago, and I was stung by one. There are no bathrooms and a place to eat. I think there are better beaches.

551521092.name: Beautiful but watch out for bees
551521092.author: a TripAdvisor user
551521092.reviewBody: We drove to Balandra on one of the days staying there in La Paz. It was beautiful and the fact that you can walk out so far on low tide is fun. You can also rent kayaks and take it around. The only part that I didn\'t like was that from the moment you drive in, you start seeing bees flying around. I\'m nervous around so many so that was a major distraction. To my luck, I got STUNG by one however it was my fault for laying back on my towel, and not looking first. That\'s how many bees there were! I still have the bruise today a week later. Would I go back? Maybe but I\'d be distracted....

551469875.name: Beautiful spot
551469875.author: a TripAdvisor user
551469875.reviewBody: We were there on an overcast day but it was still absolutely beautiful. Lots of tide pool critters to see and the beach was totally wadable during low tide.

551296755.name: Worth the taxi ride!
551296755.author: a TripAdvisor user
551296755.reviewBody: Balandra was probably the highlight of our trip. Absolutely gorgeous beach, pretty secluded, if youre willing to venture along the coastline you can easily find private areas where very few people are out there. Highly recommend, only complaint is we didnt bring beer!

550751802.name: Beautiful
550751802.author: a TripAdvisor user
550751802.reviewBody: Shallow beach so you can walk out a long way. The water is no deeper than waist deep.\nIt was easy to find and get too.

550209726.name: Gorgeous beach at high tide.
550209726.author: a TripAdvisor user
550209726.reviewBody: at high tide, it is one of the most beautiful beaches we have ever been to. But at low tide, its not as good.  Also, depending on the time of year, it can get packed with lots of locals.   Be sure to climb up to the top of the overlook very carefully.  Lots of loose rocks, but its well worth it. The views are amazing and the sunset is one of a kind.

550102655.name: Gorgeous Rocky Beach!
550102655.author: a TripAdvisor user
550102655.reviewBody: This place was truly amazing. The water was crystal clear with white sugar sand. The backdrop looks like a chunk of the Grand Canyon with wild cacti growing on the mounds.

549322442.name: Drove there on a cloudy day.
549322442.author: a TripAdvisor user
549322442.reviewBody: Beautiful spot! The four stars are only because of the weather, which was out of our control. Highly recommended as cloudy days are extremely rare.

547975635.name: Amazing...just amazing.
547975635.author: a TripAdvisor user
547975635.reviewBody: Just no words describe the beauty of this place. The Palapas have just been redone. Beach is very kid friendly. There are however no public restrooms and the trash cans seem to fill up quick.

546494954.name: Paradise no more, it\'s been discovered
546494954.author: a TripAdvisor user
546494954.reviewBody: We went on a Saturday. Parking lot full, palapas taken (last time I visited there were no palapas..)\nStill a pretty spot, but not what it was ten years ago.

546136532.name: Beautiful Beach \ud83c\udfd6\ud83d\udc4d\ud83c\udffb\u2600\ufe0f
546136532.author: a TripAdvisor user
546136532.reviewBody:
One of the best beaches we visited when in Cabo. Was worth the drive of 2 hrs with screaming/hungry kids in the car.
You can walk all the way across and the water would reach a little over your waist. 
Water is a little chilly but once you get in and with the scorching nice sun you later feel the water get a little warm. Also water was a bit salty unlike any other beach .
Don’t recommend taking any sodas since there’s quite a few bees 🐝 . Also make sure to use the restroom before you get there (maybe an OXXO) since no restrooms or showers at all, especially if your traveling like us with 9 kids. 
There’s a couple of umbrella’s but have to get there early to get your own, since later in the afternoon more people come. There’s also a guy renting Kayaks for an hour for 2 or 3 people in a single kayak , 2 people was $250 pesos for an hour which is not bad. Highly recommend you wearing water shoes since there’s quite a few unusual things in water eg. some type of slugs and some small fishes.
Overall would definitely visit again.

545643285.name: spectacular
545643285.author: a TripAdvisor user
545643285.reviewBody: ok, everyone wants to find that special beach with white sand and crystal clear water.  Well this is it.  the netire bay is no more than 5 ft deep at any point and lots of fish to snorkle with as well.\ntake food and drink as No restaurants or bars there. but 5 min away at Tecolote Beach

544908019.name: Hidden gem near La Paz
544908019.author: a TripAdvisor user
544908019.reviewBody: This beach is excellent for those who can\'t swim well since the crystal clear water is pretty shallow. And the best part, at least for those who\'d rather travel by foot than with a rental car, is that there IS a bus that goes here from La Paz\'s Bus Terminal (Aguilar). From November to December, the bus for that route runs every 2 or so hours, and the last bus back to La Paz is at 5:45PM. For a round-trip ride, the cost is 100 pesos (5 USD), and the travel time is about an hour each way. I highly suggest taking an earlier bus to get the full glimpse of the beach in all its colorful splendor. Unfortunately for me, I only had enough time to take the 3:30PM bus, and I didn\'t get there until around 4ish. The beach was still beautiful but it didn\'t have the alluring blue color that I was hoping to see. It\'s quite a sight to behold with the shallow beach stretching in every direction being wrapped in a mountainous embrace by hills that are adorned with green, spiny cacti. When planning a trip to La Paz, make sure you allot enough time for this beach as well as the Tecolote beach, which is a bit farther away. I only got to see Balandra but it\'s still worth it.

543882169.name: Great White Sand Beach
543882169.author: a TripAdvisor user
543882169.reviewBody: This was a clean beach with free plapas if you get there early. You can walk around the rocks to the Flower Rock when the tide is low.

543876753.name: Pretty but crowded
543876753.author: a TripAdvisor user
543876753.reviewBody: This beach is beautiful, but the day we went there were WAY too many people.  The water is calm, clear and shallow.  Perfect for famililes with small children and conveniently close to town.  Fortunately we found other beaches nearby that weren\'t as congested.

543858543.name: Cabo whale shark tour
543858543.author: a TripAdvisor user
543858543.reviewBody: Incredible sunset visit to balandra water very warm. One of the most spectacular beaches in Mexico great for snorkeling and enjoying the beach and views

543394383.name: Beautiful beach and bay!
543394383.author: a TripAdvisor user
543394383.reviewBody: Just a short 30 minute drive from La Paz, definitely the nicest beach in the area.  The road is not marked very well but if you hit the ferry port you are on the right track.  Nice clean shallow water, great for kids.  There are many palapas on the beach but are taken by 10:30 so get there a bit early if you want shade.  We shared ours with an older Mexican couple who had come out later in the day.

542331815.name: Water is stunning !!
542331815.author: a TripAdvisor user
542331815.reviewBody:
Decide to drive here from San Jose del Cabo.. maybe 3 hours (one way).  Would of loved to have stayed near by for a night instead of driving back right away, lots of places I would of loved to stop at ..but we were leaving for home the next morning:(

I read where people mention something about a food truck.. but not while we were there. Come prepared with extra bottled water, food, blanket to sit on and a floating device (this would if been the bomb for me). No restrooms.

A handful of palapas lined the beach.  We hunkered down by the rocks to get a break from the sun.

I did see a vendor renting out kayaks and such.  If we would have gotten here earlier in the day, would have defiantly done that. Great inlet, could of went over to the other side to visit.. but you really could of walked to the other side, water was waist deep if that ....so beautiful and relaxing.

Couple dogs were out running in the water ..looked like they were enjoying this as much as we were.

Lot of great rock formation.  

As of right now,  this place it pretty much untouched..but give it time and their will be building all over this area :( which will be just another tourist trap.

Would defiantly take this drive again..

542097633.name: An absolute must "go to" when in La Paz!
542097633.author: a TripAdvisor user
542097633.reviewBody: Take everything you need, because they don\'t sell a thing here, but pack the cooler, some shade and spend the day swimming in this natural pool!

542091504.name: Good Beach- Be Prepared
542091504.author: a TripAdvisor user
542091504.reviewBody: Hello-\n\nGood day at the beach.   We are staying in Cabo so it\'s a drive!  The waiter at the Cape recommended we go since we had a car.  Be prepared - there are no close facilities/food/stores so think ahead.  We only stayed about 1.5 hours because I didn\'t want to drive back in the dark.  It was lovely and it\'s truly a locals only spot.

542072930.name: Beach paradise
542072930.author: a TripAdvisor user
542072930.reviewBody: Perfect turquoise warm waters and white, fine sand. This is one of the most picturesque beaches we\'ve seen and incredibly quiet. If you\'re in La Paz, Balandra is a must visit!

541656994.name: Most beautiful beach ever!
541656994.author: a TripAdvisor user
541656994.reviewBody: Wonderful beach a 30-minute busied from the Malecon in La Paz. There are very few services, so bring everything you need!

540545517.name: A must see in La Paz but you don\'t have to spend all day
540545517.author: a TripAdvisor user
540545517.reviewBody:
This beach is definitely a must see.  We spent about 3 hours here and it was very enjoyable.  

The water is from waist to chest high for what seems like miles.  The water was a great temperature and we never did get chilled nor did we need a wetsuit.  

There weren't a lot of fish in the first 500 feet of beach but, once you get to the rocks you will want your snorkel gear because the snorkeling was great.  

From where you park your vehicle as you look out over the Palapas the rocks are off to the right.  As you go around those rocks you will see another beach which you can't see from the parking lot.  At the end of that beach is the balancing rock that everybody photographs.  Once you get to the balancing rock, this is the place for some good snorkeling and fish viewing.  

We did not end up with a Palapa and I probably wouldn't again unless I had young ones.  Kakaks were available and I think it was $250 pesos per hour.  If you are in a hurry I would grab a kayak.

539754163.name: Gorgeous!
539754163.author: a TripAdvisor user
539754163.reviewBody: Beautiful beach! Water is blue and clear. Great for snorkeling and walking along the rocks. Bring food-drinks

539726550.name: Beautiful beach
539726550.author: a TripAdvisor user
539726550.reviewBody: Worth the drive, very clean beach.  Great for taking in the view of the Beautiful Sea of Cortez.  It can be very busy.

538782993.name: Paradise!
538782993.author: a TripAdvisor user
538782993.reviewBody: One of my favorite beaches, great for families with young kids, friends and couples, the colors of this place makes you believe in paradise!

538695123.name: Pretty beach if a little remote!
538695123.author: a TripAdvisor user
538695123.reviewBody: A lovely beach some 30 minutes south of La Paz. There are palapas for shade along the beach and kayaks for hire too. Worth a visit.

538334903.name: Most amazing beach area.
538334903.author: a TripAdvisor user
538334903.reviewBody: No stingrays and we walked for hours barefoot in the water. Highly recommend the kayak. No bathrooms, no beverages or food for sale. There are like 12 palapas\n

537524069.name: Desert vs Ocean = Contrast
537524069.author: a TripAdvisor user
537524069.reviewBody: Based on reviews, I had high expectations on this beach. When we visited Balandra it was low tide and 90ish F weather and had just visited Coyote beach. The contrast was magnificent as you sea the dry desert, but yet you have a beautiful crystal clear ocean and when you look further you can see a deeper blue ocean with sea boat passing by. People were taking advantage of the low tide and were walking to the other side of the mountains or kayaking. We admired the views, took some photos and ran to our car with ac. They don\'t have any vendors on the beach so you must bring your own beverages, but they had free palapas. I would recommend Coyote beach as the waters were calmed and you can swim and there were vendors. By all means, visit Balandra and admire the contrasts.

536723846.name: Beautiful locals beach and cove
536723846.author: a TripAdvisor user
536723846.reviewBody: We were so excited to have found this spot! It was relatively uncrowded, had plenty of parking, and public palapas available for use (some in the water and others on the beach). All palapas were being used when we arrived so luckily we brought our own beach umbrellas, which were great for the crazy hot sun, but it was so windy they kept getting blown away (not sure how often it\'s windy since we only came once). The water itself was surprisingly cool since most of the bay is no more than waist deep. Snorkeling wasn\'t great although you could see several school of fish swimming around. There are no facilities or food/drinks for purchase anywhere on this beach. There also were no vendors anywhere on the beach, which was a great relief from Cabo! I recommend getting there early (before 2 pm) to get a public palapa!

535532081.name: Most beautiful beach in Mexico
535532081.author: a TripAdvisor user
535532081.reviewBody: Amazing beach, protected from the waves which makes it very easy to swim. As it is quite big and far from the city, not a lot of people go there. One of the most beautiful beaches in Mexico.

534754279.name: Beautiful bay
534754279.author: a TripAdvisor user
534754279.reviewBody: Don\u2019t miss this stunningly beautiful beach. No sign of any jellyfish when we went - just amazing. Not very crowded either.

533613322.name: Very beautiful public beach
533613322.author: a TripAdvisor user
533613322.reviewBody: This is my first time in Mexico. It is very beautiful beach. You have to visit the mushroom, icon of la paz. Good thing to realize that this is a public beach. My friend told me that peoples of la paz refused hotel investment in order to make this beach publicly accessible and to protect environment. It\'s like people\'s wins over capital. No fee to enjoys this beach

533161413.name: Great Snorkling
533161413.author: a TripAdvisor user
533161413.reviewBody: It is October my family and I spent the day here.  The water is higher than when we visit in the winter months.  Went snorkling around the rocks near the upside down rock (on the right side of the beach) and it was great.  I continued snorkling quite far and came to another white-sandy beach.    It is true, there are agua malas (microscopic jelly fish) and they do sting.  I applied a thick coat of vasoline jelly as a barrier between my skin and the agua malas and it worked.  I didn\'t get stung once but other people did.  \n\nSuggestion is to pack a cooler with water and food.  It gets very hot out there so bring shade with you i.e. cabana or tarp with poles.

530650600.name: Beware the \u201cAgua Mala\u201d!
530650600.author: a TripAdvisor user
530650600.reviewBody: Balandra Bay is very pretty, but please be aware that in the warmer months (like now, October) swimmers can get badly stung by tiny invisible creatures. The locals call it \u201cagua mala\u201d \u2014 \u201cbad water\u201d. I call it \u201ca bunch of tiny microscopic bendejos\u201d! \n\nI went there for a snorkel at about 9:30am on a lovely clear October morning. The place was deserted, the water was warm and clear, and I set out with my snorkel gear and thankfully a long-sleeved swim shirt. That shirt saved me from having a horrible itchy rash over my whole body... I hit an area where these little buggers congregate, and got badly stung. It feels like stinging nettles being rubbed all over your skin. I have been stung by jellyfish before in Mexico, but there was nothing to see in the water. The rash didn\u2019t,t appear until that night, and an awful, bumpy, itchy rash it is. Thank goodness I had that swim shirt on... most jellyfish &o their nasties can\u2019t sting through even a thin layer of fabric. Even nylons offer protection -next trip I am bringing several pair.

529178295.name: Beautiful Beach
529178295.author: a TripAdvisor user
529178295.reviewBody: We spent Christmas Eve on this beach in 2016 and it was lovely.  We were able to walk all the way across the bay to the other side.  The beach was clean and uncrowded.  There is a small snack stand there where you can buy limited things, but it\'s good to bring your own

527431669.name: Great Beach
527431669.author: a TripAdvisor user
527431669.reviewBody: Well but much to say other than it\'s a nice Beach, one of the best in town, this Beach has great sunsets too!

526874208.name: Quite disappointing
526874208.author: a TripAdvisor user
526874208.reviewBody: We came to this beach with very high expectations because everybody told us that it was amazing. Arriving there and walking around for a while, we could not understand at all the hype about this beach. Shallow and brackish water, not really clean beach. Definitely no place to swim or even pass the day in our opinion. Even Playa el Tecolote 2 minutes drive from there was nicer for a swim. Both of them still nothing in comparison to the beaches around Todos Santos.

524510036.name: best beach in La Paz
524510036.author: a TripAdvisor user
524510036.reviewBody: this is a must on your trip... far but totally worth it!!\nbeautiful beach, beautiful views, free, nature, calm & short water, ideal for kayak!\ndon\'t miss it

523590797.name: one of my favorite spots
523590797.author: a TripAdvisor user
523590797.reviewBody: I never want this place to be crowded so I should keep everyone away but really it\'s amazing!  Not easy to get to. We rented a car and drove from San Jose Del Cabo.  Long drive but went by fast and we would do it again.

522708716.name: Nice surprise
522708716.author: a TripAdvisor user
522708716.reviewBody: We heard about this beach from another guest at the hotel. We recommend it. It\'s a state beach and they take good care of it. Go early to get a palapa, they are free to the public.

522444618.name: No sign of impact from hurricane Lidia
522444618.author: a TripAdvisor user
522444618.reviewBody: We explored all the famed Cabo swimmable beaches after hurricane Lidia and will not feel comfortable sending our kids into the water except this one. Beautiful and don\'t forget your snorkeling gear - no vendor here for equipment rental

522099330.name: Great Sunset !
522099330.author: a TripAdvisor user
522099330.reviewBody: It is a really nice and quaint beach with a stunning outlook for a sunset. I climbed the hill to get a better look and was totally worth the hike.

521910915.name: Hermoso paisaje
521910915.author: a TripAdvisor user
521910915.reviewBody: Una de las playas m\u00e1s bonitas que he visistado en Mexico. One of the most beautiful beaches in mexico, You might wanna go after raining season so the water level goes up.

521289367.name: Beautiful spot
521289367.author: a TripAdvisor user
521289367.reviewBody: Balandra beach has a huge expanse of sandy beach with lots of shallow water to play in. The snorkelling out around the rocks was quite good too.

520337526.name: Touring La Paz
520337526.author: a TripAdvisor user
520337526.reviewBody: Calm water,  clean and everyone was friendly.. also not too deep for those that don\'t swim.  We didn\'t realize to bring swimming outfits. Also you can see fish swimming

519721322.name: The natural paradise endless pool
519721322.author: a TripAdvisor user
519721322.reviewBody: The beach of your dreams. A natural pool with no end.\nYou should come and walk to the stone, little far but worth it!

517046400.name: Relaxing beach, great for small kids.
517046400.author: a TripAdvisor user
517046400.reviewBody: Picturesque beach on the northern outskirts of La Paz offer calm shallow water which is great for little kids.\nRecommend getting there early to get a Palapa.

514994057.name: Beautiful Place
514994057.author: a TripAdvisor user
514994057.reviewBody: We went kayaking in Bay with Cortez Club and was well worth our time.  Really a beautiful area with a number of beach, crystal clear water and easy to kayak across all of it.

514850534.name: Beautiful Beach but not worth the drive.
514850534.author: a TripAdvisor user
514850534.reviewBody: Don\'t get me wrong, it is a beautiful beach but it was super packed. There was no parking and it was a Tuesday afternoon.\n\nIt was just okay.

513330352.name: Great beach. Shallow and warm forever. Rent a kayak and head to the right along the shore. Turquoise and gorgeous wayers
513330352.author: a TripAdvisor user
513330352.reviewBody: Private beach with about a dozen shade shelters. A few vendors - food and trinkets - and you can rent kayaks (which I recommend). Very accessible via bus from the malecon in La Paz. I would be there now if I could be.

513243095.name: Interesting Place
513243095.author: a TripAdvisor user
513243095.reviewBody: It\'s a beautiful and interesting place. Not sure if it\'s worth a drive from cabo san lucas. We rented a car and drove to the beach from Cabo via todos santos and a stop at Hotel California and it took about 2.5 hours. The beach parking lot was small and filled to the brim but we managed to find a place to park. The bay was beautiful however, the water was warm and had an unpleasant smell near the beach and there was lots of sea scum floating in the water which was pretty pretty gross. You could walk out into the bay forever and the water was only waist deep, pretty cool as far as that goes. And if you had a kayak it would be all the more interesting as it is such a big area to explore.

512002895.name: Hands down the best beach in BCS
512002895.author: a TripAdvisor user
512002895.reviewBody:
Pull out the checklist:
1. Crystal clear water-check
2. Swimmable-check
3. Plenty of aquatic life--check
4.  Desolate-check
5. Minimal tourists--check 
6. White sand-check
7. Pure nature- check

This list can go on and on, but you get the picture.

510677700.name: Beautiful calm waters perfect for children, 1st time paddle boarding & view
510677700.author: a TripAdvisor user
510677700.reviewBody: Make the trek to Balandra Beach to enjoy the calm shallow waters of this amazing beach.  You can swim, snorkel and just kick back.  There are a few vendors that rent stand up paddle boards and kayaks.  If you get there early, grab a palapa for the shade.  There are chairs and tables set up on the beach that you can use.  Personnel on the beach do sell snacks, water and 1 vendor appeared to be selling fish.  The best vendor is the ice cream cart that is in the water..:)

509188404.name: Magical Beach in Baja
509188404.author: a TripAdvisor user
509188404.reviewBody: Loved this beach, a lovely expansive shallow lagoon with clear water surrounded by gently rolling, desert hills. Nice beach with palapas, parking and restrooms. A great place to spend the day, very relaxing.

508789531.name: Gorgeous!
508789531.author: a TripAdvisor user
508789531.reviewBody: Shallow waters all around, you can walk to the other side and have your own private beach. However recommend you bring some of your own shade if you come on a busy day

508228996.name: One of the most beautiful beaches
508228996.author: a TripAdvisor user
508228996.reviewBody: Balandra is one of the most beautiful beaches in the world!! A hidden gem, but make sure you take your gear there when you go visit! Take a towel and an umbrella if not you would have to rent one, it is insanely hot but the water is amazing!!! Water reaches about 5ft high, its like a giant swimming pool!!

507871173.name: One of the most beautiful places on earth
507871173.author: a TripAdvisor user
507871173.reviewBody:
It is a paradise!
Its better to get there by boat. We went with Cora Tours they really know the place, so they tell you exactly where the best scuba diving spots are.
it is great for kids because its very shallow.
Dont miss it if you ever go to La Paz

507700185.name: so we decided to visit the mushroom shape rock
507700185.author: a TripAdvisor user
507700185.reviewBody: after being some days in cabo we decided to visit the famous mushroom shape rock in balandra breach, it was a very very quite beach there were no waves so we could easly walk a lot of meters in this beach, it is very relaxing and admiring the mushroom rock was worth the visit

507257929.name: Most Beatiful Beach
507257929.author: a TripAdvisor user
507257929.reviewBody: This is the most beautiful beach you will ever see. The water is crystal clear, the beach is gorgeous and a must see.

507112822.name: One of The Most Beautiful Beaches in Baja California Sur
507112822.author: a TripAdvisor user
507112822.reviewBody: The first time I laid eyes on Balandra Beach, I was stunned. Having traveled the Baja Peninsula extensively, I thought that I had seen the most beautiful of what the beaches had to offer. This place is magnificent.

506761962.name: Gorgeous beach
506761962.author: a TripAdvisor user
506761962.reviewBody: Went there twice in our short 3 days getaway in la paz....... Gorgeous.. The water is nice..... The activity is affordable.

506492410.name: BEAUTIFUL AND CALM
506492410.author: a TripAdvisor user
506492410.reviewBody: This beach is very calm. I recommend it for smaller kids. Most beautiful beach I have visited in La Paz

506229038.name: Most beautiful beach!
506229038.author: a TripAdvisor user
506229038.reviewBody: If you are in La Paz make sure you check out Balandra. One of the most beautiful beaches in the world. Completely isolated and protected beach means nothing but absolute serenity.

505382281.name: Warm and clear water with wonderful views
505382281.author: a TripAdvisor user
505382281.reviewBody: I went there after going to Isla Espiritu Santo with On board Baja travel agency, they took us to a part of the beach that is not accessible by car or walking, so it was a more private part of the Beach. This is a very big place and the depth of the water varies a lot depending on where you are, what doesnt really change is that it is amazingly beautiful wherever you look at. It has a little for all tastes, there is a part  of the beach (where the famous stone is) which is crowded and if you are more into privacy, you can walk a little bit more of do SUP until you get to a more quiet place.

503740891.name: Bring everything!!
503740891.author: a TripAdvisor user
503740891.reviewBody: It\'s a nice, calm and pretty beach at La Paz! We brought our full face snorkel mask and we expend the entire day in water. Bring a wetsuit coz the water is a little chill. Food and drinks are a must coz there is just a small kiosk and nothing else.\n

503007110.name: paradise beach
503007110.author: a TripAdvisor user
503007110.reviewBody: It is a jewel of nature, I had never seen such a beautiful bay and could walk safely and admire the surroundings ... worth spending some time there and just make the trip to meet her

502631420.name: Beautful Beach!!!
502631420.author: a TripAdvisor user
502631420.reviewBody: Balandra beach is absolutely the most beautiful beach in Baja Mexico!  The water is stunning and the color changes depending on the angle of the suns rays. Incredibly breath taking. Its not deep and you can walk out forever.  Definitely a must see if you visit La Paz!

502509869.name: It\'s a Drive, But Worth It!
502509869.author: a TripAdvisor user
502509869.reviewBody:
Beautiful!  If you want a relaxing, photo op beach....this is it.  

It was an all day trip for us.  We drove from San José Del Cabo and it took about 2 to 3 hours to get there.  (We stopped on the way and had lunch.) There are two ways to get there from San José Del Cabo. On the way there, we went the Hwy 1 route.  It's mostly a two lane highway that goes through the mountains.  It was nice, but the steep turns/curves to get through the mountains became relentless.  If (when) you get stuck behind a slow truck or car, it's really hard to get around it because there are very few long enough stretches to see if a car is coming from the other direction (and I'm not a timid driver).  On the way back, we decided not to re-live Hwy 1, so we took the route that is mainly Hwy 19 with a partial toll in Cabo (about 35-50 pesos).  It was less hectic and we even managed to get to our dinner reservations on time--which we thought wasn't gonna happen.  

We used our iphone 7 to take a panoramic pic of the view and it was beautiful to send to friends and family at home or on social media.  (Ok, my 15 yr old daughter did it, but I used it. ;) )  The really nice thing about the water there is the fact that it's about waist high deep.  You can walk out very far (maybe even to the opposite beach, I'm not sure) throughout the cove.  My daughter and her friend went paddle boarding and said it was super easy to rent the boards and loved it.  

There are snacks and drinks you can buy as well as umbrellas, tables, and chairs to rent.  (We rented an umbrella, one table, and four chairs for 250 pesos.)  I think we got the last umbrella, so be aware that it isn't an endless supply.  (You will definitely need some sort of umbrella if the weather is nice, don't think you won't.)  

The beach had a lot of people on it, but not too many at all (at least the day we went on a Thursday).  We had plenty of room around us.

It's considered one of the best beaches in the world. So, if you are near or even if it's a bit of a drive to get there....go experience this beach.  You won't regret it.

502025104.name: Awesome!!!
502025104.author: a TripAdvisor user
502025104.reviewBody: This is one of the beaches in Cabo for children. I have a 7 year old that was able to swim almost through the whole place in the ocean. He also did some kayaking there and visited the mushroom rock. Water was clear!!! Great place for children.

500901081.name: Very busy beach
500901081.author: a TripAdvisor user
500901081.reviewBody:
We arrived around 10 am. Already, the parking lot was getting full. We found a corner for the car (Toyota Prius) but could not pull forward entirely because the spot had a huge rock. The parking was free.
Already all the public umbrellas were taken. A vender offered to rent some chairs, table and umbrella. This came up to 250 pesos. People keep on arriving. It was a Monday, and I just cannot imagine this place on a weekend. 
I searched for some food. Not a lot of options there. Someone had a stand and sold candy and lots of unhealthy food, and some cold sodas. Someone else had mango. It would have been a great idea to be better prepared with some sandwiches. 
Dogs were permitted on the beach, but not in the water. 
When we were ready to go, we could not proceed. Someone with a huge Toyota Hilux had packed right behind the Prius. 
I saw someone else wanting to leave, but there was also a car parked right behind him. This is when I witnessed the Mexican collaboration system. A group of men lifted the badly parked car and moved it just enough to allow the other guy to leave. 
Eventually we found the Hilux owner and he left with his big truck. Lots of other eager drivers wanted the spot and I had to stand in the way to prevent them from taking the spot until the Prius was out. That parking lot was a madhouse. 
The beach itself was the best one. The water was very shallow and clear.

500510102.name: Just amazing!
500510102.author: a TripAdvisor user
500510102.reviewBody: Balandra Beach is unlike any other spot I have seen, and I\'ve been to many of the best beaches in the world. Totally unexpected as the Pacific side of Mexico is not usually as clear and blue as the Cancun side. This place is an exception.
