It\'s like mother nature coughed up tons of pure white sand and filled the whole bay. Then flooded it with clean clear water that never goes past waste or chest level. You can wade all over the bay, look at fish, cool rock formations, hills of sand piled high and deep on the shores, and just float around in warm clear blue water. Warm water and warm beaches make this place a one of mother natures masterpiece\'s. Go there!!

500384316.name: Relaxing day at beach
500384316.author: a TripAdvisor user
500384316.reviewBody: We took a cab out to the beach, walked along the waters edge to the beach around the point and had the beach to ourselves all day. We hiked up the hill and over the top to the little rental building where the cab dropped us off  I do not recommend that hike,  to many rattle snakes. Stay by the beach. Take lots to drink.

499784327.name: Lovely beach
499784327.author: a TripAdvisor user
499784327.reviewBody: We went there after swimming with sea lions, and it was really lovely. It\'s nice and calm and so pretty. Chrystal clear water

499292159.name: Beautiful Beach!
499292159.author: a TripAdvisor user
499292159.reviewBody: One of the Best Beaches I have ever seen in my life! A must visit place! La Paz! 30 minutes from Downtown and Malecon La Paz! Please arrived at least 8:30am to save your palapa but must bring your own food and drinks! Loved it!! Will come back!

498561674.name: Beautiful beach where you can walk forever in one foot of water
498561674.author: a TripAdvisor user
498561674.reviewBody: We headed out from Cabo San Lucas via Todos Santos for a day trip to La Paz and Balandra Beach.  Easy drive and about two hours each way.  We arrived in the heart of La Paz and drove up the coast through the town.  Balandra beach is about 30 minutes from La Paz with little to no traffic.  There are some other beautiful beaches to stop at along the way.  The water is much like the Caribbean, turquoise, warm and clear.  For young children, this is the perfect beach because it is only ankle to knee high for almost a mile out.  Also a perfect place to walk out 200 yards and set a chair down in the sand, sit and take in the 360 degree view.  There are a few vendors selling water and soda, however, there are no restrooms anywhere, so be prepared.  This was definitely one of the highlights of our trip and we will be back soon.

496219792.name: Just AMAZING!!!
496219792.author: a TripAdvisor user
496219792.reviewBody: This is the place to take your young kids if they are into snorkeling or just playing at the beach.  It\'s not that crowded when I came here and nearly walked across to the other side of the bay.  Bring your picnic snacks and make sure you potty ahead of time.  Else fine a bush because there is not bathroom.

494995304.name: Loved it!
494995304.author: a TripAdvisor user
494995304.reviewBody: I loved being at this beach with the locals. We walked across the walked to the other side.\nIt was awesome!

493109745.name: Perfect spot to relax
493109745.author: a TripAdvisor user
493109745.reviewBody: This beach is beautiful. The water is very shallow and calm so it is perfect to visit with children or people who can\'t swim. We took por paddleboards and explored other nearby beaches. Definitely one of our favorite spots in La Paz.

492565834.name: World Class Beach so far unspoiled by Commercialization *Heads Up no Washrooms* Dog Friendly :)
492565834.author: a TripAdvisor user
492565834.reviewBody: Stunning Beach, warm clean water. We went 4 times during our 10 day stay we loved it so much! We were staying at the Hyatt Place La Paz and therefore were only a quick 15 minute drive from this glorious beach. Small parking lot, that did overflow on the weekend. We were there at the end of May beginning of June and the water was perfect. Apparently it gets quite cold in the winter months. You can rent paddle boards etc there. there are free palace\'s that fill up first and then you can rent umbrellas and chairs for approximately $5-$10 depending how busy the beach is.... worth it! There was a food truck and souvenir sales there as well. No washrooms so plan ahead before leaving town or prepare to go in the desert!

490128205.name: Beatiful and unrefined...
490128205.author: a TripAdvisor user
490128205.reviewBody: Balandra Beach is a beautiful location. We took the time to follow the beach and walked to Mushroom Rock. This place is magical. I suggest that you follow the shore toward Mushroom Rock to more secluded beaches. Be aware to NOT climb the sand dunes, there are snakes on them. The Baja is a magical place and this beach is part of that magic.

490010079.name: Balandra Beach!
490010079.author: a TripAdvisor user
490010079.reviewBody: Just amazing and a great place to visit!! You definitely need to kayak and go see the famous rock of Balandra!

489994826.name: Worth the Drive....
489994826.author: a TripAdvisor user
489994826.reviewBody:
We drove all the way from Cabo San Lucas which took about two hours. Getting through Cabo with the road construction and navigating through the unknown streets of La Paz took some time. Allow yourself extra time if this is your first trip.

We stopped for lunch along the Malecon in La Paz which afforded us a much needed break. The drive up to Balandra (Spanish for sloop) took about 30 minutes.

The waters are crystal clear and you can virtually walk across the bay. The depth is mostly 3 ft and at the deepest maybe 5 feet. There are kayaks, chairs and umbrellas for rent. Local venders have water, and other cold drinks. There are no restrooms.

If you have kids of any age, this is the pace to take them. No currents and the consistent clear shallow water will put anyone at ease.

We were there during the week in early June and the parking lot was full. I am not sure what it's like on weekends as this beach is popular with the locals.

As we have a place in Cabo we will plan on spending the night in La Paz to allow us more time for all the other activities there.

486905815.name: WHAT A BEACH...!!
486905815.author: a TripAdvisor user
486905815.reviewBody: This is one of the most photographed and popular beaches in La Paz, and for the Baja as well. About a 30 minute drive out the bay from the city, you wouldn\'t know it was there until you made the final curve. White-sand beaches, and desert-like cliffs add to the experience. A must-see for anyone visiting the area.

486633809.name: Ranked one of the best beaches in the world
486633809.author: a TripAdvisor user
486633809.reviewBody: At low tide you can walk all the way across the bay. The water is warm and the sand is fine. Also the location of El Hongo (the mushroom rock).

486600936.name: Beach till you drop
486600936.author: a TripAdvisor user
486600936.reviewBody: walk forever is crystal clear warm water, see fish and wildlife, soft sand, amazing colours and landscape, best beach ever.

486463669.name: Stunning beach close to La Paz - worth the drive!
486463669.author: a TripAdvisor user
486463669.reviewBody: We headed out to Balandra mid morning and the place was already busy!  Rented chairs, table and umbrella on the beach and enjoyed the fabulous view.  Also rented a SUP and took turns paddling in the cove.  The water is so warm and shallow you\'d think you were in a bath!  Busy, but everyone was so friendly and social it made for a very fun day.  No bathrooms is the only real downside. Highly recommend.

485739213.name: Very nice beach
485739213.author: a TripAdvisor user
485739213.reviewBody: Beautiful beach in the middle of the desert, perfect for kayaks. There are no bathrooms there, so you can go to the town next to Balandra, no more than 4 minutos away, the name of this beach is Tecolote.

485479483.name: Fanstatic Beach
485479483.author: a TripAdvisor user
485479483.reviewBody: This is one of the best beaches I have experienced in Mexico.  The water is calm and clear. The water level is low enough to walk across to the other side of the beach.  This seems to be a favorite spot for the local - so it gets crowded with families and large groups.  However, still a great place to spend the day or few hours.  There is only one vendor that has a few snack items for sale; umbrellas and chairs for rental - so, it is best to bring your own stuff.

485194013.name: Giant swimming pool!!
485194013.author: a TripAdvisor user
485194013.reviewBody: The water is so calm and blue! It was also a pretty nice temperature when we were there as well. It\'s also very shallow. You have to walk out really far to even get waist deep! I recommend bringing plenty of snacks, drinks, etc in a cooler so you can stay for several hours. There are people selling food, drinks, water, hats etc. in the event that you forget something, but the selection may be limited. This is a great place to go for fun in the sun!

485017303.name: Top beach
485017303.author: a TripAdvisor user
485017303.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful beaches I have ever been. Feels like being in Greece. Unfortunately some people visiting are loud, noisy, irrespectful and lack in education and sensitivity to admire this paradise.

483293099.name: Extremely crowded
483293099.author: a TripAdvisor user
483293099.reviewBody: Water level waaay too low and very crowded no umbrella rentals available. People selling mangos tried to rip me off bought 2 mangos and gave them a $20 USD and try to give me back 60 pesos.

481406231.name: A day of sun and sea
481406231.author: a TripAdvisor user
481406231.reviewBody: Beautiful beach with colors that reflect a true acquarium. A bus service from downtown La Paz make it easy to reach from town without the need of a car, snacks and drinks can be bought on place and kajak rental is available as well. It\'s advisable to arrive in the early morning to have the chance to enjoy a free umbrella.

481134884.name: Wedding Anniversary
481134884.author: a TripAdvisor user
481134884.reviewBody:
Gorgeous place hidden in La Pax, you definitely have to visit this paradise...

You will not regreat it, tour Lobito with Edgar is who to book with.

480365924.name: Perfection
480365924.author: a TripAdvisor user
480365924.reviewBody: Wow, clean warm and perfect.  We visited for a  few hours in our Panga with Baja Expeditions and could have spent a day "earthing" in this pristine spot.

479326174.name: one of the most stunning place i have visited
479326174.author: a TripAdvisor user
479326174.reviewBody: It is imposible to be in Baja California Sur and not pay a visit to this place! So easy to get to. Spend the day, it is never overly busy.

478993429.name: Marvelous spot
478993429.author: a TripAdvisor user
478993429.reviewBody: just a lovely, peaceful beach, about 30 minutes from the Malecon ... WELL worth the trip.  Only downside, no food available for sale... so take a picnic

478949986.name: Beautiful beach
478949986.author: a TripAdvisor user
478949986.reviewBody: We went mid week in late April. It was pretty quiet and a beautiful beach with a shallow, warm, clean, bright blue bag that is ideal for paddle boarding or families. Well worth the drive.

478362831.name: Everyone loves this beach
478362831.author: a TripAdvisor user
478362831.reviewBody: It is a beautiful white sand beach, absolutely packed with families camping out for the day.  Not my cup of tea, the beach in front of our hotel was just as calm and much quieter.

478299682.name: Great Place For Family
478299682.author: a TripAdvisor user
478299682.reviewBody: The bay is amazing.  It is mostly shallow and you can walk out into the middle of the bay.  Just make sure you shuffle your feet to avoid being stung by any sting rays.  Also, make sure you walk up to the mirador from the road leading to the parking lot for some amazing views and photo opportunities.  There are hardly any fish in the bay and so not much to see underwater.  They rent kayaks as well which we did as a family.

478240151.name: Beautiful Beach
478240151.author: a TripAdvisor user
478240151.reviewBody: It is a beautiful beach.  Make sure to rent one of the umbrellas...it gets really hot and the sun is very intense.  We were there on a Saturday and the crowds started showing up in the later afternoon.  We took the Eco Baja Tours bus from the Malecon.  It was a good price, but the buses are a little unpredictable...sometimes they pick you up and drop you off at different spots so it is easy to miss the bus.  There is limited food and water here, so pack something.  There are manta rays here, so be careful.

477705420.name: Beautiful beach
477705420.author: a TripAdvisor user
477705420.reviewBody: Beautiful beach.....too crowded for me. Beautiful water but all of the tourists go here too packed for my likings

477307310.name: Beautiful landscape but beach is busy and dirty
477307310.author: a TripAdvisor user
477307310.reviewBody:
I think a visit to this beach is a must do when you are in la paz. The water is so shallow, you can walk forever without the water even touching your knees. A weird and unique experience. 

But this phenomenon makes this beach very popular among Mexican families with kids, so that the beach gets really busy by noon with lots of people and many children playing and running around. Unfortunately there is also lots of plastic garbage in the sand, the dixi toilets smell really bad and by noon it's so hot there, you can't even breathe.

If you then want to escape the chaos ( what we did) I'd recommend packing your stuff and walking down out of the Bahia towards the lonely beaches on the right hand side. Welcome to paradise. 

These beaches offer snorkeling too as there are many rocks around.  After that we hiked up to the mountains and took awesome pictures from the Bahia!

Important facts:

-A taxi from la paz costs 250 pesos 

- the ride is 20 minutes

-It's easier to come with your own car. You can drive to the other beaches close by and to the mountains.

- there are only some private people selling chips and sodas but no restaurants there so bring food and water

- the only toilets are dixi toilets

477135963.name: Don\'t miss this beach!
477135963.author: a TripAdvisor user
477135963.reviewBody: Absolutely beautiful!!!! Gorgeous soft sandy beach and clear water. Take a cooler. Although no food/drink place at this beach definitely the most beautiful of this stretch of beaches

476511725.name: Beautiful Beach
476511725.author: a TripAdvisor user
476511725.reviewBody: Although the water was really Cold, its scenary its very beautiful. In the Beach you can find snacks, drinks (sodas and water) and you May rent umbrellas and chairs.

476110253.name: Crystal water
476110253.author: a TripAdvisor user
476110253.reviewBody:
If you're planning to go to balandra, be there early.
There is not a lot parking slots, and the umbrella renting is limited.
Beautiful beach with crystal water and you can have a nice walk to go on the other side of the watch an emblematic rock like a mushroom.
If you have aqua shoes bring them, a lot of rocks on the way and some at the bottom of the sea.

475962946.name: Super beach
475962946.author: a TripAdvisor user
475962946.reviewBody: Clean and relax beach natural space with great view . You can see and stay for a long  time enjoying the water you can walk to the balandra stone to take pictures and enjoy the natural  blue water

475689424.name: Pristine beach better accessed by boat
475689424.author: a TripAdvisor user
475689424.reviewBody: even though we were here at the highest possible time (Easter), it still felt quite private and extremely enjoyable. Great quality sand and very clear water.

475410121.name: Amazing beach
475410121.author: a TripAdvisor user
475410121.reviewBody: Get there early or late to avoid the crowds but spectacular beach.  Make sure and bring most of what you need as there isn\'t much to buy there which is part of the beauty.

475383964.name: Amazing
475383964.author: a TripAdvisor user
475383964.reviewBody: Quiet and lovely. Recommend going early in the morning. We have rented a car to get there and it was good decision.

475318070.name: Not to be missed!
475318070.author: a TripAdvisor user
475318070.reviewBody: Balandra is one the most beautiful beaches I\'ve ever been to. You can walk forever out in the water! Make a point of going up there when you are in LaPaz!

474935661.name: Heaven on earth
474935661.author: a TripAdvisor user
474935661.reviewBody: Paradise -perfect beach to relax at or kayak or paddle bots! Not much food , so eat lunch in La Paz before !

474251308.name: Balandra Beach Beauty
474251308.author: a TripAdvisor user
474251308.reviewBody: Approximately 2 and 15 min away from Cabo by car was a wonderful find in La Paz. Highly recommended if you are staying in Cabo for some time. Beach is not crowded at all during the week \nWater is warm tranquil so inviting to jump in. Bring your cooler with drinks as there really is nothing there as far as resorts. Young kids love it. You can Rent a kayak or stand up board along with chairs and umbrellas at that beach. No beer sales only snacks sold there. Safe drive\n

474083383.name: Beautiful if you come into it by water; just OK otherwise
474083383.author: a TripAdvisor user
474083383.reviewBody: This beach is a quick drive (less than 30 minutes) from La Paz.  Now that it has become more popular, like anything, it\'s lost some of its awesomeness.   Aside from the long sandbar and a view of the icon of La Paz, a mushroom stone carved away by water (think of it like Lovers Arch in Cabo), another beach up the way is just as beautiful (Tecolote)   But you probably would not feel this way if you hadn\'t seen it previously.   The truly breathtaking way to see it is to come into the cove by boat.  From that perspective there are several beautiful and secluded sand bars to lounge on.  Perfect for paddle boarding because the water is so calm.  There\'s also a mangrove area which is OK to paddle through, but it is a bit stiffeling with no air moving around much.

473240111.name: Most beautiful beach!
473240111.author: a TripAdvisor user
473240111.reviewBody: We love coming to this beach when we visit La Paz. It is so beautiful. We rented a kayak to paddle around the coves, but it really was too windy for this. Be aware of the wind before you rent. It\'s easy to wade around the shallow water even if it\'s cool like it is in January. Pick a sunny day during this month. There are a few permanent thatch umbrellas that you can use or bring your own. Fun place to take kids. There is a little vendor truck where you can rent paddle boards and kayaks. They also have snacks, drinks and sunscreen. There was a souvenir vendor the day we went also. We travelled here January 2016.

473054887.name: A favorite daysail from La Paz - Picnic, swim, and be back before sundown
473054887.author: a TripAdvisor user
473054887.reviewBody: Balandra is about a two hour sail from La Paz.  In the daytime, we anchor off the famous "Mushroom Rock".  We swim and snorkel in crystal clear water about two fathoms deep.  As always, the colorful reef fish favor the rocky areas.  This is a superb area to learn standup paddle boarding in the calm inner coves.  Novice kayakers have much to explore along this coast.  Larger sailboats and motor yachts anchor far out near the entrance to the bay.  Other visitors have warned about the stingrays that lie in the shallow waters, so shuffle your feet when you walk and they will move out of your way.  They are not aggressive, only defensive.  Summer is not the best season to visit as the bobos and other flying insects may pester you.  We haven\'t been bothered by jellyfish, but they may be a periodic issue.  It\'s always a good idea to ask the locals and observe carefully before entering the water anywhere.

472777075.name: Crystalline
472777075.author: a TripAdvisor user
472777075.reviewBody: Beautiful, quiet beach. No motor boats allowed. Several palapas to sit under. Shallow , clear water with many sand bars. Must walk out a bit to swim. Perfect for little ones!

471467575.name: Beautiful place
471467575.author: a TripAdvisor user
471467575.reviewBody: This is truly a most wonderful place.  The beach is wide, white and usually not overly crowded but we were there on a week day so not sure about weekends. Bring your own umbrella or there are some rentals.  Not much shade.

470849916.name: Beautiful beach
470849916.author: a TripAdvisor user
470849916.reviewBody: This beach is about a 30 minute car ride from La Paz. The road is being worked on so there could be some delays. Also, there is a port near there so there are lots of big trucks speeding on the two lane road. One you pass the port, then the road is less crazy. There is a parking lot, small place to buy some drink and rent gear. The water is calm and the tide takes the water out quite a ways. You can walk out far with the water still at the knees. Be aware that there are small stingrays resting in the sand under the water. It is safer to scoot your feet while in the water instead of picking them up. Apparently, people get stung quite frequently and it is very unpleasant. There are some umbrellas on the beach. You can easily swim or walk around the rocks and there is a really nice deserted beach on the other side of this one. I felt the water a bit too cold to swim but that is my personal taste. I like warm water. Probably better to rent a car so you can come and go as you please.

468933528.name: What a beautiful landscape, great place to relax!!
468933528.author: a TripAdvisor user
468933528.reviewBody:
Balandra beach is not mentioned in most of the travel guides we've used to plan our trip. Talking to a local person, he suggested it to us, and what a great surprise!!

This beach offers calm water, with different colors due to sand benches and a beautiful rock formation that completes the visual. It is easy to go up on the mountains that surround the beach and take incredible pictures... and the sunset is simply terrific!!

We took the day to relax there, in the main beach part you can find shadow and some infrastructure, but in the next one, where you can find the hongo, you must be prepared for the sun, nothing there.

We had a car, so we went to another beach, with waves, Tecolote, to have lunch, and I got the best pulpo ceviche of the trip!! Unfortunately I won't remember the name of the restaurant, but it has a sign with pictures of the food... so fresh, awesome.

We came back to Balandra to see the sunset, a bonus to close the day!!

468632248.name: Balandra one of the top ten beaches in Mexico according to the US Today
468632248.author: a TripAdvisor user
468632248.reviewBody: Beautiful beach and one of the top 10 beaches in Mexico rated by the US Today as I found this article by google it and I can say that for sure it is like to have a private paradise!! Balandra is a public beach with nothing in it but the beautiful sea of Cortes and the incredible almost white sand that everybody can enjoy for free. So if you go to La Paz visit Balandra is a must!!! It is amaizing the beautiful landscape you can apreciatte whe you are there!!

468512035.name: For a day at the beach...perfect!
468512035.author: a TripAdvisor user
468512035.reviewBody: Balandra beach is a popular local/family beach. The water is shallow and warm for a LONG distance so kids can play in a large area. If you want more quiet and you\'re mobile, just walk to the next beach around the corner but bring an umbrella if you want shade. If you want even more peace and quiet, just walk around the next corner and it\'s even better...very few people and a rock overhang that give shade until around 4 pm. Note: no bathroom facilities at all so you need to go au natural. There are some vendors at the first beach but bring what you want just to be safe. The walk to the second beach is fairly easy, but to the third is over coarse volcanic rock and you need to be nibble-footed and in shape to make it there. The first beach you cand drive straight there or take a local bus. Either way, go earlier as most people start showing up at around 11 and the shade huts at the first beach get taken up quickly.

468337552.name: Gorgeous
468337552.author: a TripAdvisor user
468337552.reviewBody: Beautiful, peaceful beach. Few amenities. You can walk a long ways in the warm, very shallow water. If you love beaches you should not miss the one.

468181534.name: The best beach I\'ve ever been to.
468181534.author: a TripAdvisor user
468181534.reviewBody: This place was increditable. Soft white sands, clear water. Great for kids. Get there early to get a good spot.

467894501.name: Heaven in beach form!
467894501.author: a TripAdvisor user
467894501.reviewBody: Had heard of Balandra the same time I heard of La Paz....had very high expectations for the beach and it did NOT disappoint. Plus, it was far less touristy than I would\'ve thought! Easy to get to either by $5 bus round trip or your own car. Beautiful, breathtaking, calm, relaxing- water is crisp and cool. Would pack your own drinks and food! Definitely a place you think you\'ll hang out for a few hours but end up wanting to be there from dawn to dusk

467684177.name: Breathtaking
467684177.author: a TripAdvisor user
467684177.reviewBody: White sand, azure blue water surrounded by rocky mountains creates a beach experience that will be memorable.  My husband and I arrived at the beach beach after swimming with whale sharks and seals.  Lunch on the beach..a lovely day.  You can reach the beach by car.  If you are in La Paz take a ride to this beautiful beach and enjoy.

467068516.name: Balandra Beach
467068516.author: a TripAdvisor user
467068516.reviewBody: Do not miss a visit to this exquisite beach. Gentle shallow water.\nGet there early for the best light for photography.

466665282.name: Mother Nature\'s giant turquoise wading pool!
466665282.author: a TripAdvisor user
466665282.reviewBody: This place is amazing. The water is so clear and shallow throughout the whole bay. Reco buy a cheap floaty on Amazon. Also b/c they have no services I reco bringing an ice chest with some beers and snacks. We hired a van to take us there and paid approx $7/hr for him to wait for us.

466660918.name: Protected and isolated
466660918.author: a TripAdvisor user
466660918.reviewBody: This beach is a few miles out of La Paz, and is in a protected bay so the water is very calm. There is a decent sized beach and a concession stand for snacks. If you drive a few hundred meters from the beach, you can pull over to the side of the road, climb a very steep hill, and see toward La Paz and out to the Sea of Cortez - a beautiful view.

466174337.name: Most Beautiful Beach in the World
466174337.author: a TripAdvisor user
466174337.reviewBody: All I can say is just plan a full day at this beach. If you can, get there at high tide and watch it go out and back in again. Walk all over, take pictures all over,take in the blues, browns, greens and crystals. If you are lucky, grab a palapa. Bus ride from town if $5 round trip.

466069942.name: A giant pool!!!
466069942.author: a TripAdvisor user
466069942.reviewBody: We did Balandra on day two of our trip and definitely want to go back. The beach was large with plenty of room to find your own personal oasis. Water was clear and very cool. There\'s a little stand where you can rent tiki hunts, kayaks, SUP, and buy small snacks The scenery just leaves you in awe. One of the best beaches I\'ve ever been to

466057010.name: Not for low tide
466057010.author: a TripAdvisor user
466057010.reviewBody: Great beach at high tide, but not that pretty at low tide.  Bring whatever you need because there\'s not much available there.

465863171.name: Named one of the best beaches in Mexico
465863171.author: a TripAdvisor user
465863171.reviewBody: Balandra is a site to behold. This is the place that my husband and I got married 8 years ago. There is a very large beach with many palapas to rent. When the tide is out, the water goes forever and only to your ankles while in the bay. Then as you round a bend, there the water gets a little deeper - your knees - and there is another beach that will take you to the infamous Mushroom Rock.\n

465697353.name: Beautiful beach, great for windy day
465697353.author: a TripAdvisor user
465697353.reviewBody: After fighting the winds at El Tecolote, I headed to Balandra and had a completely different experience.  Sheltered, shallow, non-commercial...several little beaches tucked in amongst the cliffs.  Wonderful, peaceful place to relax, at least on a weekday in March...can\'t speak to busier weekends or holidays.

465696481.name: It\'s like a 3D postcard of paradise.
465696481.author: a TripAdvisor user
465696481.reviewBody: We got here early (10:30AM) so that we could score on of the free palapas - and then lounged and bathed for hours. The water is so clear and you can walk (for quite a ways) and have the water not even hit your waist. Water was cool but refreshing in March but we loved this place so much that we came back twice! Rented a double kayak for an hour from a local guy (had to give our ID which I wasn\'t thrilled about but we got it back afterwards). Even offered to share our palapa with a local family that showed up later when all the palapas were gone - safe, fun and enjoyable. Had no problem leaving my stuff under the palapa while my husband and I swam. I saw some people came as part of a tour - so if you don\'t have a rental car, you can do that. Plenty of parking and the usual people selling local wares. No one was pushy - a simple "no gracias" had them moving on.  The one guy you shouldn\'t say "no gracias" to is the burrito guy. He came by the first time and I didn\'t take him up on his offer of a burrito - but there isn\'t any food out there so on the second visit I decided to give it a try.  $30 pesos for 2 - not your traditional American style burritos but smaller almost like a "roll up". Get the meat one - the bean one doesn\'t stay warm and isn\'t good. He delivers to your palapa but on the way out, I stopped by his car where his family was working to grab another ... and he had hot sauces! A definite treat!

464340303.name: Beautiful but no bathroom
464340303.author: a TripAdvisor user
464340303.reviewBody: This beach was absolutely breathtaking!!! Unfortunately we had to cut the day short, as there was no public washroom that we could find. \ud83d\ude2c\nRemember to shuffle your feet to stir up any sting rays so you don\'t step on them.

463935292.name: Beauitiful
463935292.author: a TripAdvisor user
463935292.reviewBody: This beache\u00b4s colors are out of this world, come take a photo with you at your personal in-the-open office ;)

463594102.name: Great beach for everyone
463594102.author: a TripAdvisor user
463594102.reviewBody: The bay is very shallow so the water is safe for young children.  There are water toys for rent.  A good pic site but check on the tide before you go.  Make certain you navigate the shore to the mushroom rock.

462938537.name: Bandera Beach
462938537.author: a TripAdvisor user
462938537.reviewBody: Beautiful. Easy to get to from La Paz. Shallow, clear, popular beach with stunning rock backdrop. Some hawkers at beach. A few concessions. Good place for swimming, kayaking, sunning?

462825621.name: Gorgeous but the Whale Sharks Had Just Blown My Mind
462825621.author: a TripAdvisor user
462825621.reviewBody: We did this as a blend of two tours (I was the only one booked to go to Balandra so they merged this and the Whale Shark Tour) - and I went with the Museum of the Whale (you get a free tour of the museum too).\n\nIt is one of the most beautiful beaches in the world, but after the tour we were cold and being put on the beach felt more like a punishment, I just wanted to wrap up and get in a hot shower.  But it is stunning.

462807174.name: Born to be wild
462807174.author: a TripAdvisor user
462807174.reviewBody:
Probably the wildest though accessible beach of Baja
There is a parking lot and a small food and beverages shop just beside. 
The water is really shallow so great for young kids and elder people
I don't concur with the "best beach of BCS or even Mexico" but it's definitely the best of this area.

462578519.name: Unbelivably beautiful beach.
462578519.author: a TripAdvisor user
462578519.reviewBody: Spent a wonderful day here with our kids (7 and 10). The beach is stunningly beautiful and the water is so shallow that you can just walk out for hundreds of metres. Would be a great place for those with young children. I can\'t do justice to it with words so go and see for yourselves!

462479392.name: Heaven!!
462479392.author: a TripAdvisor user
462479392.reviewBody: What can we say??  I have been all over the world and this was by far been the most gorgeous beaches we are ever at. So beautiful and amazing crystal-clear water blue blue. Don\'t miss it.

462343626.name: Beautiful spot, can be a bit crowded.
462343626.author: a TripAdvisor user
462343626.reviewBody: Go during the week if you can, it gets a bit crowded on the weekend.  Lovely spot for wading, and if you climb around the corner (through a spot that unfortunately is often used as a bathroom) then you\'re on another beach, and on the way to the rebuilt balancing rock (La Honga I believe).  Past that you can keep going, wading and walking, and get to another beautiful beach which you\'re likely to have to yourself.  Go when the sun is out and the water is beautiful blue (it loses a bit of color as the sun goes down).

462337556.name: One of the highlights of our trip.
462337556.author: a TripAdvisor user
462337556.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful beaches we\'ve ever visited. The water is so clear and pristine. So glad we had the opportunity to vist this most spectacular setting. A word to the wise...check the tide charts before you go. The second time we went the entire bay was almost empty of water! We still had a good time but not as enjoyable as we had to walk so far to get to the water. Did manage to get to the Mushroom that trip though and it was worth the walk. I would definately recommend this beach.

462041076.name: My favorite beach near La Paz - beautiful water and scenery!
462041076.author: a TripAdvisor user
462041076.reviewBody: We spent several hours at this beach - the beach is really beautiful and it is fun to hike up the rocky parts for beautiful views of the beach. The water was very clear and shallow for a long stretch - we enjoyed walking in to the beach in the clear waters. Highly recommend this beach if you are in La Paz. \nAlso, it is very easy to get to from La Paz - you can take the Aguila bus from the Malecon bus station and it runs quite often during the day. They have a schedule at the bus stop and it was only 70 pesos for the bus ride from Malecon to Balandra beach.

461949370.name: Clear, warm waters. Great view!
461949370.author: a TripAdvisor user
461949370.reviewBody: This is a short drive out of La Paz but well worth it. When we arrived it was a bit busy but the beach and the water was very, very clear. The hills surrounding the area were very dry and brown which provided an excellent contrast to the aqua colored water. There are a few beaches around this bay, two that are easily accessible from the parking lot, two that had people on them but I don\'t know how they got there. There are chair and kayak rentals on the beach. Unless you really have the urge to kayak, I\'d recommend skipping it. You can almost walk the entire bay area.

461259744.name: A hidden gem
461259744.author: a TripAdvisor user
461259744.reviewBody: We visited Balandra Beach while vacationing in Cabo San Lucas.  The 4 hour round trip was well worth it. The Beach was beautiful and clean.  We made some great memories there.

461240270.name: Beautiful scenery!
461240270.author: a TripAdvisor user
461240270.reviewBody: You have to hit this beach just for the stunning photo opportunities!  Make sure you go right around the corner to the right, walk the beach on the other side until you get to the Hongo.  But beware little stinging jellyfish in the water, and we are pretty convinced we saw a shark on the far side of the Hongo.  Another couple said it was a dolphin and some kids told us it was a Marlin... we will never know for sure, but best to be prudent.

460808308.name: Best beach ever!
460808308.author: a TripAdvisor user
460808308.reviewBody: Beautiful, remote, awe- inspiring. Water is crystal clear. Great for snorkeling. Shallow water for kids.

460514996.name: When tide is out, there is a lot less beach
460514996.author: a TripAdvisor user
460514996.reviewBody: Best part of Balandra is the short hike up the rocky hills for beautiful views of the sand and water expanse.  The bay area that Balandra is in is very shallow, so the tide level (in or out) make a huge difference in the look of the beach area.

459906749.name: the most beautyful beach in La Paz
459906749.author: a TripAdvisor user
459906749.reviewBody: turcoise water, long beach, nice to walk or swim,repaired from the wind, the sand is so thin!! You have to go there, and take wonderful pictures!!

459026524.name: Beautiful!
459026524.author: a TripAdvisor user
459026524.reviewBody: The sand is soft, the bay is shallow and walkable, and palapas line the beach. Claim your spot and enjoy warm sun and cool breezes in Baja while your friends shiver up north!  When the tide is coming in wading birds fish along the rocks...white ibis, egrets, herons...all having dinner while people walk around them. A great place to spend the day and see the mushroom rock - one of the La Paz landmarks. Just remember it\'s a natural area. Pack your food and drinks in and your trash out. There is no restaurant or bathroom at this beach but nearby beaches have both - El Tesoro, Pichilingue and Tecolote. Just buy a drink or food at the restaurant and you can use their facilities.

458710491.name: A place to catch your breath
458710491.author: a TripAdvisor user
458710491.reviewBody: Don\'t let the popularity of the place fool you, it\'s relatively unpopulated. Keep walking around the "mushroom" and find a spot to perch during low tide and you will likely be the only person in sight-the rocks keep most people on the sand. Take along a snorkel and mask to catch sight of flute fish and minnows. I waited several hours until the tide came up and swam back to the beach. What a serene experience!

458680412.name: The most beautiful beach in mex
458680412.author: a TripAdvisor user
458680412.reviewBody: We were there only for a couple of hours unfortunately we didn\'t had more time, but the time we spend there was awesome, the views, the beaches are so clean and well preserved, they are so virgin no one is there selling you a thing, you can find peace and very amazing sight seen the views are just out of this planet, I would recommend to be there around noon (12:00pm) the color of the sea changes with the sea level

458169963.name: Cool beach, beautiful views, lots of people
458169963.author: a TripAdvisor user
458169963.reviewBody: We were here on a weekend so lots of people but as we arrived around 3, we still were able to get a spot under a palapa. I think it would be cool to get their early and rent a kayak to go across to one of the isolated beaches across the way. It\'s very shallow so you can walk quite a distance so perfect for kids. Want more peace and quiet, go further down or across to a quiet beach

457955790.name: Beautiful beach !
457955790.author: a TripAdvisor user
457955790.reviewBody: A short 15 minute drive from La Paz. Get there early to grab a public umbrella. Rent a kayak. There is a path on the road leading up to a hill from you have a fantastic view of the beaches.

457776703.name: Calm lovely beach !
457776703.author: a TripAdvisor user
457776703.reviewBody: One of the best beaches I ever saw. Perfect to go with family and even younger kids. You can walk far into the sea water is clear and beautiful . There are no restaurants or so hence real calm . During the day less Mexicans or tourists in the evening a bit more when it is cooler. It is about 30 minutes drive from la Paz . But a must go .

457131564.name: Beutiful beach north of town
457131564.author: a TripAdvisor user
457131564.reviewBody: Took a 30 minute cab ride out here.  Spent a couple hours out here walking around in the shallow water.  Took lots of photos of birds and the mushroom rock.  Several of us got stung a few times in the legs while in the water.  Did not see anything in the water but felt like mosquito bite and luckily it did not leave a mark or welt.  Not much shade or shelter from the sun so take sunscreen and wear water shoes.  There are no services here.

456629062.name: Tiny cove open on wonderful beaches when tide is low
456629062.author: a TripAdvisor user
456629062.reviewBody: Close to Tecolote beaches, very different but as attractive, tenants of shops offer canoe and other nice activities in a safe context

456590177.name: paradise!
456590177.author: a TripAdvisor user
456590177.reviewBody: one of the most beautiful beaches i\'ve ever laid eyes one. scored a 4/5 because i found it to be a tad too windy. if you plan on spending the day, bring a lunch. there is nothing out there.

456589456.name: Among Best Beaches We Have Visited
456589456.author: a TripAdvisor user
456589456.reviewBody: We are not great surf beach people.  But we do admire a great beach, and this is one.  Although I have pictures, there are already enough here.  We stopped for lunch.  No facilities that we could find here, so be on notice.  There was a truck selling drinks.  And free thatch umbrellas, although in late January it was so beautiful not needed.  The inlet that the beach is on is all of 3-4 feet deep so you can walk across.  Great kayaking and they are for rent.  You need to be aware of a few jellyfish and some rays asleep in the middle of the channel, but hey, this is Mexico.  A great and beautiful place to stop.

456489850.name: clear water and amazing views
456489850.author: a TripAdvisor user
456489850.reviewBody: i was there with Friends, the water was very clear and great temperatura. we could see lots of fish, great for scuba diving

455504913.name: Must see beach
455504913.author: a TripAdvisor user
455504913.reviewBody: beautiful water and white sand, secluded beach.  if I could give more stars, I would!  walk along waters edge and see crabs scurrying along the rocks

455087505.name: Beautiful beach
455087505.author: a TripAdvisor user
455087505.reviewBody: This is the most beautiful beach ever. It\'s a little out of the way. You have to drive outside of LaPaz past the port but it so worth. There are summer palapas, chairs and kayaks available to rent. There are also a few local vendors to see. The real draw to the beach is after you walk or past the rock face to the right. Breath taking. We live in Cabo and make the two hour drive at least once a month to relax in the peacefulness.

454688092.name: Gorgeous scenery.
454688092.author: a TripAdvisor user
454688092.reviewBody: The stark contrast of color within the scenery here alone is worth a visit. Time your arrival at high tide for best scene and swimming. Weekends are busy with local day trippers. There are numerous palapa shade structures available free of charge. We opted for a umbrella and two lounges-$22 US- from the kayak rental/snack truck guys. The water is crystal clear and quite shallow for a great distance.

454263627.name: Tranquilty
454263627.author: a TripAdvisor user
454263627.reviewBody: Amazing tranquility and warm waters. Nice to be able to wade out as far as you can to find that you are waist high in water.

454099509.name: Nice
454099509.author: a TripAdvisor user
454099509.reviewBody: This is a very nice beach. It is shallow so would be good for kids & good for kayaking. We walk from one side of the bay to the other & water only got our waist. Worth the drive out from La Paz only about 20 min - 30 min.

454078762.name: Beautiful sandy blue water beach
454078762.author: a TripAdvisor user
454078762.reviewBody: I absolutely loved this beach. You can wade out quite a long way and walk into the water. There are grass huts for shade or you can rent chairs but you just need to throw a blanket down under one and enjoy the sun.

453901917.name: A nice slice Baja Mexico
453901917.author: a TripAdvisor user
453901917.reviewBody: Stayed in La Paz for a week and it was a blast!! it is a samll fishing town with enough activites to keep you busy for a week, slow pace good food and firendly folks

453898767.name: One of the most beautiful beaches I\'ve been to.
453898767.author: a TripAdvisor user
453898767.reviewBody: This place is breathtaking. Water is turquoise - emerald. Beach is super clean with free palapas. Super easy access from the road. Must see when in La Paz!

453652453.name: Disappointing Balandra!
453652453.author: a TripAdvisor user
453652453.reviewBody: No idea why Balandra is the best rated beach - especially when Playa Tecolote is 2 minutes down the road!! Balandra is crowded, with little parking. Because the beach is so shallow for such a long way out (really bad when the tide goes out), sting rays  come and nestle under the sand, to warm themselves. Really important to wear beach shoes in the water, and to shuffle your feet when you walk - you need to disturb the sting rays or risk being stung.

453205011.name: Beautiful - like something from Jurassic Park!
453205011.author: a TripAdvisor user
453205011.reviewBody: Rather than the typical "beach" from a postcard this is more of an inlet creating shallow water right across the bay. Its about 25 min drive from the centre of La Paz or $300 ish in a taxi. We didn\'t have a car so relied on the taxis but they were very good about retuning at the end of the day to collect us again.\nTake supplies as there is only one little stand selling drinks.\nA great place to spend the day taking in the scenery and paddling from one cove to the next.

452889924.name: Beautiful scenery and beach but not much good for swimming
452889924.author: a TripAdvisor user
452889924.reviewBody:
We arrived quite early (9.30) in the morning and for the first half an hour there were quite a few sand flies because of the absence of wind; we were told they come from the mangroves at the back of the beach. So remember to bring some spray just in case (luckily we had some). 
The beach is lovely (but not one of the best I have seen) and the water is crystal clear but very shallow (and the tide was going out so it got even shallower), so forget about swimming. On the plus side you can walk around the point to the next beach and see the rock called Hongo (much smaller than we had thought). 
Balandra beach is equipped with some umbrellas so you can get some shade, which is good as the vegetation at the back of the beach is very low.
We  went for a short hike following a path up a hill and came upon many different species of cactae and once reached the top we had a stunning view of all the bays and beaches and the beautiful turquoise water. It really is worth the hike.

452485025.name: Our Favorite Beach!
452485025.author: a TripAdvisor user
452485025.reviewBody: This bay is just fabulous, nothing quite like it.  Can easily walk for a mile through the shallow water.  We wore reef walkers so as not to step on anything.

452176255.name: One of the best beaches I have been
452176255.author: a TripAdvisor user
452176255.reviewBody:
Balandra is a protected beach with no restaurants and vendors 
It is extremely tranquil with no waves and it is not deep so you can walk a lot inside the small bay and water will hardly go above your knee level. 
Ideal for small children 
There is a small hill that you can hike to get outstanding views.

452013416.name: One of the most beautiful beaches anywhere and so peaceful
452013416.author: a TripAdvisor user
452013416.reviewBody: We enjoyed a wonderful afternoon at balandra.   Such a Wonderful beach.  So quiet, so clean, clear water. Wow!  Note the city bus comes here.

451964718.name: Beautiful setting, large crowds!
451964718.author: a TripAdvisor user
451964718.reviewBody: Balandra bay is a beautiful natural setting, within easy reach from La Paz. It is ideal for kids as the shallows extend forever and make for an inviting playground. The area is now very developed and hugely popular. The days of sitting there on the beach quietly by yourselves are definitely over. Many more palapas have been erected along the beach, sometimes occupied by people with boom boxes, and garbage and cigarette buds are omnipresent. Sad for such a natural gem. Nevertheless, a trip to that beach is a worthwhile outing. While walking in the shallow water be aware of small stingrays, which deliver a very painful, yes sting! Shuffle the sand to make them aware of your presence.

451827368.name: High Tide & Low Tide
451827368.author: a TripAdvisor user
451827368.reviewBody: We visited La Paz specifically to see Balandra Beach "The most beautiful beach in Mexico" we were not disappointed. We had the opportunity to return during high tide & go kayaking. It was amazing! During low tide we were able to walk to the mushroom rock & take great photos. It\'s definitely a place you have to see for yourself. We didn\'t venture very far in the kayak but our friends did and they were able to be on a beach all to themselves. We hiked up a trail to get a higher view of the entire beach. It was well worth the hike. Pleasant place to spend the day. Arrive early for high tide and stay for the low tide and walk to mushroom rock. Fantastic experience for the family.

451523295.name: Nice, but crowded
451523295.author: a TripAdvisor user
451523295.reviewBody: Very nice beach, but it is more for families or picnics. you cannot really swim. You can just relax. There are beaches around which are more spectacular.

451473009.name: Stunningly beautiful beach
451473009.author: a TripAdvisor user
451473009.reviewBody: Loved this beach and can\'t wait to go back. Clear, calm water that you can walk through or paddleboard on and gorgeous views. White sand and sand dunes to climb. Just a great place to spend the day.

451339985.name: Over rated beach
451339985.author: a TripAdvisor user
451339985.reviewBody: First there is no water , never mind swimming.Be very careful with the guy renting the chairs keep you eyes open he plays the money trick ,i did not pay attention and he change my 100 pesos  to a 50 Pesos ,stay away from him or make sure to give him the correct change and keep you eyes on the money

451297736.name: Spectacular Beach
451297736.author: a TripAdvisor user
451297736.reviewBody: This beach was absolutely stunning. Gorgeous water, impressive geology making for amazing views, and beautiful white sand. Very peaceful spot and a great place to spend the afternoon unwinding and getting some color.

450580807.name: Prettiest beach I\'ve ever seen
450580807.author: a TripAdvisor user
450580807.reviewBody: This beach is gorgeous. Took us a bit to figure out how to rent paddle boards, but once we did we were all set! We went earlier on our second visit to get a palapa. This beach is an amazing place, services are limited, so bring your own food etc.

449971607.name: Beautiful beach
449971607.author: a TripAdvisor user
449971607.reviewBody: Beautiful sandy beach. Very shallow. Can walk almost anywhere especially at low tide. Not well maintained. Cigarette butts and garbage left on beach. Some mildly annoying peddlers. One creepy guy staring at women. No washrooms. Great kayaking at high tide.

449941528.name: Very unique beach, popular amongst locals but no facilites around.
449941528.author: a TripAdvisor user
449941528.reviewBody: This is a beautiful beach with very unique formations. Nice to walk and perhaps snorkel (did not do). Can get crowded. Do not bring valuables as there is no security, there are no buildings or anything so you will have what you need with you from towels to swimming gear.

449847761.name: Beautiful
449847761.author: a TripAdvisor user
449847761.reviewBody: We caught the eco baja shuttle out to this beautiful beach.  We spent the afternoon snorkelling and wading in the water \ud83d\udca6 and walking the beaches.  Its a popular beach, if you have an umbrella, bring it.  There is a small kiosk with cold pop and a few snacks. There did seem to be umbrellas to rent too.

449284758.name: Pristine beautiful beach
449284758.author: a TripAdvisor user
449284758.reviewBody: This beach is absolutely beautiful and serene and pristine.  We spent Christmas Eve there.  Just a word for those wanting some libations on the beach - they only sell sodas.\n

449255204.name: Balandra Beach Beautiful
449255204.author: a TripAdvisor user
449255204.reviewBody: We drove 2.5 hours from San Jose del Cabo to this gem.  It is worth the day trip.  Coming Highway 19 from the south, take the 11 bypass around southeast La Paz to save yourself from going through downtown.  On a nice day, plan on getting there early just to get parking.  The beach of course is beautiful and the water is crystal clear.  Get a stand up paddle board ($8 per hour) or kayak and go away from the main beach and visit one of the several other private beaches just to get away from the crowd.  Don\'t get me wrong, although there were quite a few people here, there is enough space for you to relax.  The water is shallow out to 75 meters or beyond and at low tide you can walk nearly half way across the bay.  Bring food and snacks because there isn\'t much there.  No bathrooms.  Stop at Pichilingue beach on your way out for a nice lunch.

449169511.name: Quiet beach
449169511.author: a TripAdvisor user
449169511.reviewBody: Quiet cove for snorkeling. They rent kayaks and SUP boards on the beach. As well as table, chairs, umbrellas and lounge chairs. Water and tamales for sale. No toilet facilities. Bring your own lunch and beer

448919096.name: Spent the day lounging by the sea
448919096.author: a TripAdvisor user
448919096.reviewBody: The water at this beautiful location is clearer than many Caribbean islands we have visited.  The snorkeling was excellent. You can climb the sand dunes.  Bring a cooler of food and drink and spend the day soaking up god\'s beauty!!  We went by car to Balandra but the boat ride on the 2nd trip was way better.  Stopped to watch Sea Lions and a Stripped Marlin playing in the lagoon.  This area is something out of National Geographic!!!!\n

448901429.name: Simply Wonderful
448901429.author: a TripAdvisor user
448901429.reviewBody: I visited in December so did not have to deal with the crowds. Most all of the visitors were locals on vacation. The back drop to this shallow, warm bay are the desert mountains. Palapas line the wide, expansive beach area with soft white sand. Perfect for SUP, kayak, and wading. When it is low tide, you can easily reach the north side of the bay on foot. For those up for a hike, there is an easy climb for a fantastic view of the Sea of Cortez.

448170129.name: Scenic Beach
448170129.author: a TripAdvisor user
448170129.reviewBody: Very beautiful scenery, lots of people, but you can always walk a little further to get away from the crowds.  Rented a SUP for a bit to get to the mushroom rock, some swam but got stung by little plankton if you got further out in the water.  Very shallow and calm water, beautiful place.

447330095.name: A must visit beach
447330095.author: a TripAdvisor user
447330095.reviewBody: A crowded place but wonderful. The shallow water goes on forever and you can find yourself a secluded place all to yourselves. No facilities but a small trailer that sells some items

447321770.name: Awesome beach for snorkeling and swimming
447321770.author: a TripAdvisor user
447321770.reviewBody: We rented a double kayak and paddled almost straight across the bay to our own beach and snorkeled along the rocky cliffs. Great snorkeling continues towards the mouth of the bay and around into the next cove. There is where the best fish viewing occurred. Romantic and secluded was our impression. Just perfect, day after day. Well worth the low price to rent the kayak. Easy to paddle here as the water is warm, shallow and mostly protected from the wind.

447235331.name: Beautiful
447235331.author: a TripAdvisor user
447235331.reviewBody: Beautiful beach. We were told that there were no facilities there. There were palapas (umbrellas) and one stand selling snacks. They don\'t sell much, so you should bring your own snacks.

447155558.name: Its the place to go for \'the rock\'
447155558.author: a TripAdvisor user
447155558.reviewBody: Nice scenery you can walk out in the water for ever, we were told to shuffle your feet because of the small sting rays

447061370.name: Most beautiful beach in the world.
447061370.author: a TripAdvisor user
447061370.reviewBody: Excellent for swimming, sunbathing, and snorkeling, but beware of thieves scouting the area and hitting your car while they notice you are off in the water swimming.  Other than that, this is a small piece of heaven.  Located a good 10-15 miles out of La Paz proper but so worth the drive.  Crowded on weekends but almost deserted at times during the week.

446953814.name: Gorgeous
446953814.author: a TripAdvisor user
446953814.reviewBody: If it wasn\'t windy it would have been perfect. Beach was very clean and water was beautiful. We hiked around the rocks and nestled up on the beach away from many people.

446582986.name: Great Kayaking
446582986.author: a TripAdvisor user
446582986.reviewBody: We kayak here during the winter months.   Its one of our favourite places  within a short distance to La Paz.

446572475.name: Shallow!
446572475.author: a TripAdvisor user
446572475.reviewBody: The water is very shallow all the way across the bay.  You can only snorkel when you swim around the corner past "the mushroom" rock.  It is the best protected beach from wind and is lovely.

446094617.name: amazing!
446094617.author: a TripAdvisor user
446094617.reviewBody: almost virgin beach with a service of kayak rent, beautiful landscape, very peaceful (we were there in December and was not high season)

445846219.name: Beautiful
445846219.author: a TripAdvisor user
445846219.reviewBody: We took the day and walked the beaches. Tide went very low. Good beach for walking around and sunbathing, not so much swimming as the water is not deep. Very serene.

445723804.name: Popular but so beautiful, so well preserved, so clean and so virgin.
445723804.author: a TripAdvisor user
445723804.reviewBody: This is one of my most favorite beaches in the whole world.  The difference between Balandra from Mexican Caribbean beaches or Thai beaches in Thailand (where I am from) is the local people protect it.  There are no restaurants, no hotels, no development, even though it is very easy to to get to.  The water is so clear and shallow and the sand is white.  If you keep walking to the right, you will find your private beaches.  I moved to La Paz from Chiapas for a year because of these virgin beaches!  Take your picnic lunch when you go there.  It coud be so hot because in Baja there is almost no shade and no trees!  So beware of that.  I have never camped there as I heard that there are a lot of mosquitos at night.  In winter, the water is too cold for me.  Best months are from March to October.

445475223.name: Best beach ever
445475223.author: a TripAdvisor user
445475223.reviewBody: This is the most beautiful beach I have ever seen. Water like a warm pool. The sand is beautifully soft and white. They have palapas, some caves for shade and multiple beaches ! Great fir kids and kayaks

445302544.name: Beautiful Beach!
445302544.author: a TripAdvisor user
445302544.reviewBody: The first of a few local beaches our friends took us to. We have a car with us but if you don\'t, there is a bus service from the Malecon downtown to both Balandra and Tecolote beaches. Balandra has over 20 free palapas for your use, a food stand, but no washrooms. Stunning vistas and warm shallow teal water to wade through. Nice white sandy beach. What\'s not to love???

445105504.name: Divine!
445105504.author: a TripAdvisor user
445105504.reviewBody: If you are a beach person and a water person then you should not miss a day at this beach. It is so safe and shallow with warm water and no current. There are palapas and you can rent chairs. It is a well populated beach on weekends without feeling too crowded. You can walk away from the more populated area to get a spot by yourself away from it all. There are paddle boards and kayaks for rent as well.

443898081.name: One of Mexico\'s Best Beaches
443898081.author: a TripAdvisor user
443898081.reviewBody: This beach made our 2 hour drive from Cabo worth it. The last 10 miles of the drive were scenic enough to make it worth it, and then you arrive, seemingly at the end of the world, and there are a bunch of locals on this beach surrounded by mountains. The water is shallow enough to wade out for hundreds of yards, and if you\'re adventurous enough, you can snorkel out past the "mushroom" rock formation and check out a great variety of marine life, which we recommend. Pictures don\'t do this beach justice. Just go.

443347596.name: One of the prettiest beaches ive ever stepped foot on!
443347596.author: a TripAdvisor user
443347596.reviewBody: You must go to believe. You can walk about a 1/4-1/2 mile out and still be in water less than waist deep. If you dont mind walking the views are other worldly from the small peak above the beach. Rent a paddle board or kayak right on the water to enjoy the calm waters and stunning vistas. This is an absolute must if you are in La Paz and on the way back to la paz, stop in to anyone of the tiny little spots to eat as they are all good!

442067547.name: Loud, though maybe we caught a special (bad) day?
442067547.author: a TripAdvisor user
442067547.reviewBody: Looked like a beautiful beach, but we couldn\'t walk far enough to get away from the awful blaring music from the loud speakers,.... so we left and went to Tecolote beach instead.

441248431.name: One of the most beautiful beaches
441248431.author: a TripAdvisor user
441248431.reviewBody: Simply stunning.  So scenic and chilled out. \n\nThe only minor negative was a bit of broken glass on the main beach.

441204464.name: Good for kids
441204464.author: a TripAdvisor user
441204464.reviewBody: We rented a car for the day and drove down to Tecolote and Balances beach for the afternoon. We didn\'t get a chance to stay too long in Balances since it was near 5pm (sunset). But from what I can see, this is a perfect place for kids. Miles of pristine, shallow water will guarantee your kids to have a great time for the afternoon.

441170353.name: Anchored out at balandra
441170353.author: a TripAdvisor user
441170353.reviewBody: A beautiful picturesque spot. We anchored there on our way to la Paz and just can\'t wait to go back.

439647235.name: Like the Maldives!
439647235.author: a TripAdvisor user
439647235.reviewBody:
Like the Maldives!
Shallow water and multiple small cove beaches set to a mountain background and beautiful natural rick formations.  

Authentic, quiet,  clean and seemingly undiscovered. One if my favorite beaches in the world so far!

439533821.name: Beautiful with great snorkeling
439533821.author: a TripAdvisor user
439533821.reviewBody: Calm water and beautiful white sand beaches are nice, but go around the corner past the mushroom rock and the snorkeling is great! Lots of animals to see and just over 30 minute drive from La Paz. Tide pools are great on low tides, too.

439380598.name: A small hidden paradise
439380598.author: a TripAdvisor user
439380598.reviewBody: Just about 30 minute drive from La Paz this place is quiet, calm and so naturally beautiful. This is still a virgin beach location so nothing but water and sand. There are no restaurants or hotels at the location but is a short drive from La Paz with great sights on the way. Great for a romantic intimate get away.

439231449.name: A swimming pool in the ocean
439231449.author: a TripAdvisor user
439231449.reviewBody: Is a beach you have to visit if you are in La Paz, is a enormous swimming pool in the ocean, you can walk for miles and see a wonderful fishes under the surface!!

438858652.name: Beautiful !!!
438858652.author: a TripAdvisor user
438858652.reviewBody: Beautiful beach....take the kayak and go to the beaches in  front!! Great beach for small children , no waves

437656521.name: Perfect for small kids in November
437656521.author: a TripAdvisor user
437656521.reviewBody: The tide was low the whole day so the kids could search the tide pools for treasures with no problems

437290876.name: Have you ever seen a Martian Landscape by the Beach?
437290876.author: a TripAdvisor user
437290876.reviewBody:
This is one of the most unique and beautiful beaches I have ever seen!
Enjoy the clear and tranquil waters, the beautiful white sand and a perfect setting.
Balandra is one of La Paz' icons.
Love to go there and enjoy a day at the beach!

437166731.name: Must see!
437166731.author: a TripAdvisor user
437166731.reviewBody: Very popular beach but never crowded at all. Must see in la Paz! I\'d recommend cruising around the corner to the mushroom rock!

436961652.name: Perfect for kuds
436961652.author: a TripAdvisor user
436961652.reviewBody: Balandra is the safest beach in the world, especially for kids. I love taking my toddler here and letting him run and explore.

436257119.name: Sun and relaxation
436257119.author: a TripAdvisor user
436257119.reviewBody: Very good place if you want to chill and also if you have small children.  Protected from wind and big waves... always a mellow place  to visit.

436209906.name: Visit
436209906.author: a TripAdvisor user
436209906.reviewBody: A very nice beach and water.  The cove is protected.  Not too far from town. We will be going back at a warmer time of year.   You could walk a long ways

436140821.name: Great beach
436140821.author: a TripAdvisor user
436140821.reviewBody: Amazing beach white sand crystal clear water shallow can cross the entire width of that bay walking fun place for family couples a real hit with locals

434694709.name: Beautiful
434694709.author: a TripAdvisor user
434694709.reviewBody: It\'s a long drive to this beach, which seems to be very popular with locals.  The water is very shallow. The calm water and sandy beaches make this a good family spot.

434580784.name: Breathtaking!!!  As nice as any beach in the Caribbean!
434580784.author: a TripAdvisor user
434580784.reviewBody: I started coming to La Paz about 5 years ago and every trip to Cabo ends with a visit to La Paz.  this beach is beautiful and pictures don\'t do it justice.  the water is a color that is indescribable.  Make sure to walk out to Mushroom Rock.  It is a very important symbol to the people of La Paz.

433412765.name: Beautiful beach
433412765.author: a TripAdvisor user
433412765.reviewBody: Beautiful beach with basic services. Very shallow and sandy so not great for my snorkeling interest but nice for families  with small children. \n\n

433051289.name: great place for day trip. taxi or rental car access
433051289.author: a TripAdvisor user
433051289.reviewBody: If you cant make it to Espiritu santo this is a great option. location of famous mushroom rock. bring a lunch

432407460.name: Excelent and beautiful
432407460.author: a TripAdvisor user
432407460.reviewBody:
This beach is the most beautiful place to swimming, has a great view, cold water and you con see a lot of small sea animals.
You need to go with your weather, beers or sodas and a lunch.

If you walk around 10-15 minutes you can see the "balandra" mushroom

432130667.name: Beautiful beach winding road to reach
432130667.author: a TripAdvisor user
432130667.reviewBody:
The drive out of La Paz was a fun winding road, beware because no guardrails. As usual in Mexico, the speed limit is more of a suggestion! We slowed and pulled over a few times to allow people in a hurry to pass.
The beach itself far more beautiful than the camera could ever capture. We arrived after 3pm and near low tide. We found no stingrays but the beach was still filled with many local people. 
You could walk seemingly forever in 30cm of water. Kind of fun to sit down and have tiny fish investigating the invading humans!
Take your time and enjoy the sun and make the adventure your own.
The vendors were there but not pushy. All in all it is a place to be remembered fondly and a return visit is in order.

431301620.name: Beautiful beach
431301620.author: a TripAdvisor user
431301620.reviewBody: This is a very pretty spot to go hang out for a few hours.  Before you go, ask when high tide is, if you go on low tide, you\'ll be "swimming" in 8 inches of water.  The place is very pretty and because it\'s a pretty closed in bay, the water is very calm and totally clear.  WORTH THE VISIT.

430919748.name: Absolutely stunning
430919748.author: a TripAdvisor user
430919748.reviewBody: Six of us went on a day trip. Our host was Sammy Alcocer. The water crystal clear and warm. Just breathtakingly beautiful.

430480436.name: Balandra
430480436.author: a TripAdvisor user
430480436.reviewBody:
This beach is amazing. Secluded, quiet, clean, beautiful white sand and crystal clear water with no annoying vendors.

Tips: 
1. If you are driving from Cabo leave early to get a palapa. They have 23 of them at the beach. There is one vendor that rents umbrellas once the palapas are gone. If you do get there late, everyone was nice and sharing palapas.
2. Bring a waterproof camera/phone and a gopro if possible. 
3. Stop at an OXXO store to get a cooler full of drinks and food. 
4. Waterproof sunscreen and a hat are a must
5. Bring a change of clothes dor the ride home and dinner
6. Bring a water and wash rag to clean the dried salt off your skin. 
7. Leave around 4 or 5pm to stop at Todos Santos on the way home to check out the Hotel California and eat dinner.

430159010.name: Balandra Balandra,Balaandraa!!!
430159010.author: a TripAdvisor user
430159010.reviewBody:
The iconic beach of La Paz, were yo can see the "mushroom rock" or Balandra, cristal clear waters, wake free, surf free...then again.. facilities free, it is a shame how such a gorgeous place can be ruined by trash from visitors,  it is a must when in La Paz, no doubt.

Good snoerkeling beach, you can walk for half a mile at low tide across the bay  and walk back, take yoru kayak and go in the the mangrove, don forget your camera, great location for sunset shots and bird watching.

Bring your food and drinks, take your trash, only a dozen palapas available so take your own shade and be carefull with the tide, unless you are prepare to do a bit of rock climbing and trial walking you could end swimming back to the parking area..  recently voted the most beautiful beach in Mexico.

428883610.name: A day in Balandra !
428883610.author: a TripAdvisor user
428883610.reviewBody: It was our first time visiting this Beach in La Paz. Our concierge in our hotel mentioned that Balandra was a Beautiful Almost Virgin Beach since it\'s very isolated, so we decided to rent a car for the day and drive to this amazing beach. Be prepared to bring some water, snacks, or food in a cooler since there\'s no shops around. However there\'s a few people selling beer & snacks & they also rent chairs if you need any. We took towels from the hotel so that\'s all we needed. Don\'t forget your sunblock, sunglasses, or a Hat, The sun is pretty strong and there\'s not that much shade. Also No Restroom near by, we used one in a restaurant we stopped by on our way back to our room.

428857897.name: Beautiful pristine spot.
428857897.author: a TripAdvisor user
428857897.reviewBody: This is a breathtakingly gorgeous place. Sacred if I want to view it that way. I was warned about the Sting rays but did not encounter any in a negative way. We did see some swimming so you much be aware that they are there.

428848969.name: Beautiful Beach!
428848969.author: a TripAdvisor user
428848969.reviewBody:
Balandra a is 40 minute drive from La Paz via México 11.  The beautiful white sand beaches seem too perfect to be real, and the sea is the most stunning shade of blue you will ever see. The water is very shallow and warm, and perfect for wading and swimming! You can rent SUP or sea kayaks and export around the bay or some of the more secluded beaches along the shore. Be sure to bring an umbrella, or get there early to get a palapa. You will also want to pack food and water as there are only small vendors which are not always open. 

While at Balandra wonder over to check out El Hongo, a mushroom shaped rock one cove over. Do beware of STINGRAYS, and make sure to do the stingray shuffle while walking in the shallow water. 

About 5-10 minutes from Balandra is Tecelote. Here they have more rentals, and a restaurant and bar. The margaritas and chocolate clams here are a must after a day at Balandra.

428129412.name: Gorgeous Beach
428129412.author: a TripAdvisor user
428129412.reviewBody: Gorgeous Beach, just remember to bring insect repellant! The beach is very secluded and quiet, you can rent paddleboards and also kayaks and a small both has refreshments!

427669300.name: Beautiful!
427669300.author: a TripAdvisor user
427669300.reviewBody: When I first went to Mexico, I went thinking I was going to only Cabos San Lucas. When my husband I got there, we started to tour around. We look at the map and wanted to take a road trip. To be Honest the best way to do this vacation is to rent a car and drive and venture out. I did my research and found Balandra, after seeing the pictures I just knew we had to go. the pictures doesn\'t do it justice. Balandra was amazing. I didn\'t want to leave. I suggest you to go to this place. However it happens, make it happen!

427220702.name: Beautiful calm water and friendly people
427220702.author: a TripAdvisor user
427220702.reviewBody: Beautiful calm water and friendly people!  Get there early for one of the palapas (it is crowded most days...you will definitely want to arrive before noon) and bring a cooler with some snacks or cold drinks.  There is a small concession selling some snacks but no restrooms.  You can rent kayaks and paddleboards - the water is so calm (and shallow) that it is great for beginners.

426835674.name: Nice, but...
426835674.author: a TripAdvisor user
426835674.reviewBody: A beautiful bay, but the water depth is only about a foot or so for many hundreds of feet out.   Not a great swimming experience, more like a nice bathtub - with stingrays!

426825333.name: Beautiful beach - one of the best
426825333.author: a TripAdvisor user
426825333.reviewBody: As soon as you arrive at this location you appreciate the silky white sand, warn sun and happy smiling faces, mostly from the locals. This is a beach where you can barely arrive at before you have to go for a swim, the water is amazing and the shallow areas are the best. If you wade out (and you can go very far waist high) you will discover a second beach off to the right - thats the bonus.\nA small kiosk with chips and drinks are on site, but bring food if you plan to stay for a while. No alcohols is sold on-site and parking is easy.\nKayak rentals and sun shades are available in addition to the fixed umbrellas already on-site.

426245542.name: Definite hit
426245542.author: a TripAdvisor user
426245542.reviewBody: It\'s really pretty with public palapas. Affordable kayak rentals. If you go early, you\'ll have the place to yourself.

425986300.name: Amazing beach!
425986300.author: a TripAdvisor user
425986300.reviewBody: Very recommended visit. Good for a whole day activity. Kayak renting is possible to explore the beautiful area.

425172822.name: Simplemente Incre\u00edble
425172822.author: a TripAdvisor user
425172822.reviewBody: Incre\u00edble. Easy to get to in any type of vehicle. About a 15 minute scenic drive from La Paz. No real amenities on site. However, the scenery is breathtaking.

424820105.name: breathtaking
424820105.author: a TripAdvisor user
424820105.reviewBody: A must see! it really is what dreams are made of. hike up a beautiful white sand doon for an epic view!!\n

423350500.name: Absolute paradise
423350500.author: a TripAdvisor user
423350500.reviewBody: We got the bus from La Paz and could not believe how beautiful this beach was! Go there - you will not regret it! There was a man selling drinks from a cool box but I\'d recommend going with lots of supplies (and your own cool box if possible!). You can rent kayaks for 200 pesos per hour which was an incredible experience. The clearest calmest water you can imagine with a stunning backdrop of desert and mountains.

422181220.name: Incredible beach!
422181220.author: a TripAdvisor user
422181220.reviewBody: Definitely make the drive out to Playa Balandra.  One of the best beaches I have visited.  The water is bathwater warm and like a large crystal clear teal blue pool.  Worth the visit for sure.

421471467.name: this beach on a must visit list
421471467.author: a TripAdvisor user
421471467.reviewBody: A bit out of the way, another 15-20 north of La Paz in the middle of desert but located in a secluded bay off sea of cortez.  Literally walked/swam to the other side, to a very secluded beach maybe 300-400 meters across; fairly shallow. Beware of tide and also tiny jellyfish? got stung a bit but not too bad.  Beach has thatch huts you can rent from a little shack set up that also rents kayaks and SUPs.  Bring your own food,  and be prepared, the porta potties are nasty.  But the white sand beach is beautiful and worth the trip up from Cabo San Lucas where we were staying for the week. About a 2.5 hour drive.  Sun is strong and warm but felt good.  Was mid week but beach was hopping with people which was so unexpected.  As the drive from La Paz to get to beach was somewhat desolate then you come up on this beach and BAM! parking lot full of cars and beach full of people (lots of locals) everyone friendly.  Enjoy just lounging around, not much to do except swim, layout, and find serenity.\n Peace,  RandyCP

421172649.name: Balandra beach
421172649.author: a TripAdvisor user
421172649.reviewBody: To me it was ok not awesome just ok. The water made my eyes burn really bad for a few minutes.  There were a lot of flies Everywhere.  To me the water didn\'t feel fresh just yucky.

420669633.name: Great beach
420669633.author: a TripAdvisor user
420669633.reviewBody: This has to be the best bay in all of Baja California. Lots of palapasfor rent but being your own food and drinks.

419328804.name: A must do!
419328804.author: a TripAdvisor user
419328804.reviewBody:
Let's be honest, this entire coast is bountiful when it comes to stunning beaches. Balandra beach is just a touch more special. You'll have to visit to see why. 
For starters, it's very accessible by car, just a short drive out of La Paz town. When we arrived, there was a sea turtle laying eggs on the beach. If that isn't a special, magical welcome then I don't quite know what is!
If you're lucky and arrive at low tide, you can walk/wade in the water over to the other bays. If it's high tide, you'll have to hike over the desert hills or rent a kayak. It's not difficult to hike but the hot sun is definitely an element to deal with. 
We managed to hike over the hills to four other bays. We had these pristine ocean front areas all to ourselves! It did take us four hours but we didn't really notice as we were too busy exploring. We encountered numerous butterflies, sea birds, and picturesque photo ops with desert cactus against the blue sea of Cortez. Many people access Balandra by boat.
