If you don't have the money, you can enjoy it by foot. You will just have to work harder for it but the reward is great.

417688517.name: An Infinity Pool with Sand
417688517.author: a TripAdvisor user
417688517.reviewBody: Balandra is breathtaking!  Depending on the tide, you can walk  straight across to the other side, usually in the morning. Crystal clear water, but be very careful, manta rays camouflage under the sand and the sting is very painful. Balandra Rock is a landmark and may be seen by walking along the beach.  A must see and only a short  drive from La Paz.

416972610.name: Best Sandy beach - cannot find words to describe this.
416972610.author: a TripAdvisor user
416972610.reviewBody: We are so glad someone told us about this beach as it was pure paradise and as Jaques costeau says it is a natural  aquarium. The colors of aquamarine green, copper sulphate blue and dark blue come together where the depth of the waters ares shallow for miles and miles.  You can literally walk for hours on this water at it is shallow. Though cash rent kayaks and tables, umbrellas ans chairs for the day. Ranges from 150 to 240 pesos. The kayak can get you close to a mushroom shaped rock nearby. We spent so many hours here. People sell food and some gift items in their cars so our is not commercial.   This is  surrounded by mountains. We were sing by some thing like a needle pick whixh could have been the tiny jelly fish after the hurricane.  However this is not the poisonous like the box jelly and you don\'t feel it once you are out. This beach is ideal across generations as young kids and grandparents can enjoy this. Food options added 5 to 10 mins drive away.

414402566.name: Beautiful beach
414402566.author: a TripAdvisor user
414402566.reviewBody: Has the best time here the beach was beautiful we rented a canopy and a paddle board. People are selling food at the beach but take drinks in a little ice chest. Will definitely go again

411256563.name: Careful with the mini jelly fish
411256563.author: a TripAdvisor user
411256563.reviewBody: The beach is very beautiful, shallow, perfect for kids.. The down side is: lots of jelly fish that you can\'t see. Take Windex with you. Will save some burns!

410734606.name: Beautiful but beware
410734606.author: a TripAdvisor user
410734606.reviewBody:
So, kept hearing about this beach from locals in Cabo San Luca.  They said if you go to La Paz, you have to go to Balandra Beach. 

It is beautiful, but it's not touristy at all.  It's off the beaten path - which we like!  But, it's not very clean at all.  Lots of beer bottle tops and other small debris in the sand.  Porta potty for restrooms and they were NASTY!   

There were only a handful of people there when we arrived (it's a Wednesday, so makes sense).  However it did pick up a bit.  

Water is beautiful and you can wade out for several hundred yards.  Unfortunately, something in the water (maybe a mite or something) decided that I was their snack.  My legs got very itchy and a rash broke out.    It only affected 3 of the 4 of our group.  The local guy there said it was something in water and rubbed sand on it to help.  Not sure what happened, so will research it.  It took a few hours before it was painful.  This may be a seasonal thing since it's  summer and water is warm. 

So - come if you want peace and an amazing view.  Just be prepared.

410218854.name: Pure white sand, shallow water and snorkeling
410218854.author: a TripAdvisor user
410218854.reviewBody: This is a beautiful beach with very white sand, shallow water, and some nice snorkeling around the rocky edges of the south side of the bay.  You can drive to the beach, but that part is somewhat crowded, so a better way to do is arrive by boat and drop and anchor in the sand. The water is very clear and warm this time of year. (August ...)

409387588.name: Amazing Balandra
409387588.author: a TripAdvisor user
409387588.reviewBody: Excellent beach spot close to La Paz. Dont miss it when you are there. \nOne of the beaches nearby the city. And one of the beautiful.

409339117.name: One of the most beautiful beaches in the world.
409339117.author: a TripAdvisor user
409339117.reviewBody: We have visited this beach many times, and have enjoyed the warmth, the spacious nature, and terrific vistas, this area provides.  Matches the beaches of Rio, without the pollution, and shoreside development.

409095246.name: Good but watch out
409095246.author: a TripAdvisor user
409095246.reviewBody: With no chances to swim, relax yourself in this charming bay: peaceful romantic atmosphere, almost no waves, transparent water but seriously watch out from rays living camoiflaged in the sand

408089791.name: Awesome beach
408089791.author: a TripAdvisor user
408089791.reviewBody: It is a nice beach in a bay secluded from the ocean, with great mangroves which can be visited easily by swimming or kayak. Therefore, there are hardly any waves which makes it easy to do activities like snorkeling, kayaking and SUP-boarding. The water is very shallow (about 50 centimeters) which can be preferable (child proof) but also annoying if you want to swim more quickly. \nThere are parasols, kayaks, etc. for rent from local people. Also, you can take a 30-minute shuttle from La Paz bus station (Malec\u00f3n station) for 100 MXN round trip p.p.

407638955.name: Top beach ever
407638955.author: a TripAdvisor user
407638955.reviewBody: This beach was a pleasant suprise. Love that it is secluded and is some of the clearest water I\'ve ever been in.

407060786.name: Beautiful beach
407060786.author: a TripAdvisor user
407060786.reviewBody:
When you get there you can not believe we still have these kind of beaches in our beautiful Mexico. 
There is literally nothing but calm, gorgeous blue sea. 
Great place to go with kids but you need to consider shelter (it's really hot on summertime), lots of sunblock, water and if you want, some food.

406712488.name: A must
406712488.author: a TripAdvisor user
406712488.reviewBody: This has to be one of the most beautiful bays I have seen in El Mar de Cortez. If you are in La Paz, this is an awsome day trip and you could include the broken rock as well in the excursion.

405911774.name: Most amazing beach- EVER!
405911774.author: a TripAdvisor user
405911774.reviewBody: Absolutely fantastic. Beautiful beach and gorgeous water that you can walk around. Visiting on the weekend will bring a large crowd, but still a fantastic experience. Plenty activities as well as locals selling delicious treats.

404513610.name: Walk across the bay
404513610.author: a TripAdvisor user
404513610.reviewBody: Shallow warm water, beautiful clear and inviting. The three of us enjoyed several hours of aquamarine seas and warm surf. We walked out to the iconic "symbol" of La Paz. Bring sun screen, sunglasses, and a hat. Several of us wore shoes for the rocky parts, but you can go bare foot - just avoid "lug" worm castles. Parasol rentals are available; if you have a boogie or surf board, you can wander the whole bay, including the mangrove forests. Finish the day with a picnic, or head on out to Tecolote Beach, at land\'s end, only a half mile further down the road.

403773781.name: Best Beach for kids
403773781.author: a TripAdvisor user
403773781.reviewBody: My favorite beach, it\'s like a very big pool, the best for family retreats, kids don\'t need to know how to swim it\'s so low, no rocks just sand. Lovely to visit.

401526692.name: A Must See
401526692.author: a TripAdvisor user
401526692.reviewBody: This was a very relaxing and peaceful beach. The water is not deep at all. Food trucks available for snacks. Bring your own food and drinks. Lots of pelicans, at first this was nice, up close with nature. Then I got a little tired of the large birds.

400025464.name: Gorgeous beyond belief
400025464.author: a TripAdvisor user
400025464.reviewBody: We visited this beach at the end of July. It is absolutely worth the drive outside La Paz, just gorgous. It\'s safe to swim for adults and kids, and the water is shallow very far out. Bring a snorkel and a mask if you want to explore underwater, there\'s lots of little schools of fish everywhere and it\'s great for the kids to see.

397529715.name: Awesome
397529715.author: a TripAdvisor user
397529715.reviewBody: A fantastic beach, pretty "personal" and not crowdy at all, the tours to Espiritu Santo island are quite unique.

395328968.name: Best beach in La Paz
395328968.author: a TripAdvisor user
395328968.reviewBody:
Great beach. Clear green water. Definitely picture- worthy. Very shallow out about 800 yards. It's about 3 - 4 feet, sometimes almost 5. It becomes more and more crowded as the day goes on, so get there before 10am to enjoy the beach to yourself. In the afternoon, many families have staked their areas in the shade of the giant rock to the right, but the further you walk to the left, the more isolated you will be. Bring a towel and a cooler and enjoy the day here. There aren't any restrooms or restaurants here, although a vendor sold snacks and sodas out of his truck. You can catch the colectivo van over to the next beach, Tecolote, where there are restaurants and restrooms. It's a 7 minute drive away. 

Transportation info:
All La Paz buses arrive to/leave from the Terminal Turistico across the street from the malecón. Ask anyone and they'll direct you. 

- This is where you can catch a combi bus (van) to Balandra or Tecolote Beach. Buy a round trip ticket for 98 pesos. There are about 5 vans a day and they leave around 1.5hr apart. The bus station can tell you the route times, although the return van was 45 min late, so it's not an exact science. 
Tip: Board the van as soon as it pulls into the station/parking lot. They do not count the tickets sold, so it's first come, first serve. Grab your seat ASAP. 

Hope that helps! Enjoy La Paz!

395299991.name: Beautiful beach
395299991.author: a TripAdvisor user
395299991.reviewBody: Open beach for locals and tourist alike, has very minimum shade, you can rent a palapa if you get there early. I saw a lady renting beach umbrellas if you want to make your own shade. There are no restrooms or shower to clean yourself after a day on the beach. I would highly recommend it if you have small children, water is warm and no waves at all, it\'s like a big waist deep lagoon. Food truck selling a few selections of snacks and fruits, check it out !!!\n

394745407.name: Stunning!
394745407.author: a TripAdvisor user
394745407.reviewBody: This beach offers beautiful views and opportunity to walk long distances in very shallow water. Although it\'s a popular destination it doesn\'t feel crowded.

393742933.name: Fantastic!!
393742933.author: a TripAdvisor user
393742933.reviewBody: I spent a few hours in this beach. Great for swimming.  Bring a canopy, no shades. It is not possible to hike inland but the views in the beach are great. A good place to relax.

393611532.name: This is a great beach!
393611532.author: a TripAdvisor user
393611532.reviewBody: This beach is beautiful. My family enjoyed it because it is so shallow. Even though it was crowded it was still easy to enjoy since the water is so shallow for such a huge area. The sand is so soft and easy to walk on. The rocks were fun for the kids to play on, too. It looks like if you get there early enough you might be able to snag a covered tent but we weren\'t there early enough for that. \n\nWe definitely liked it and it was beautiful!

393585876.name: Unique layout
393585876.author: a TripAdvisor user
393585876.reviewBody: It was more crowded than we expected, but the gin-clear water, 2-3 feet deep nearly all the way across the bay, was nice.  Lots of fish, and it was fun for us to hang out in a different sort of beach.  Bring your snorkel and fins--plenty to see.  Bring your own food/drink; nothing available there (fruit vendor, though).

393063150.name: perfect beach for families
393063150.author: a TripAdvisor user
393063150.reviewBody: Crystal water with no waves. Perfect for children, kayaking and relaxing.\n\nThe perfect hour to visit it is in the morning or before 4 pm due the sun and the hot weather.

392891474.name: One of the best beaches I\'ve been to!
392891474.author: a TripAdvisor user
392891474.reviewBody: Very Beautiful! Great for individuals, couples or families! Amazing! Bring your water proof camera, you\'ll want to take it with as you explore the entire area and surroundings.

392564370.name: Awesome spot only a short boat ride away.
392564370.author: a TripAdvisor user
392564370.reviewBody: Great spot for families and young kids, the bay is very shallow and has a cool little snorkeling spot. Make sure you go by boat, it\'s much better for snorkeling.

392541262.name: Gorgeous beach with diverse crowd and great atmosphere
392541262.author: a TripAdvisor user
392541262.reviewBody: A lovely place, well preserved without commercial facilities other than helpful rentals.  Interesting crowd of all types from families to hippies, all enjoying the location and providing a very positive vibe.  Really beautiful beach and bay.  Strongly recommend your own car to get there.

391846441.name: beatiful beach!!
391846441.author: a TripAdvisor user
391846441.reviewBody: ive been in so many beaches: Bahamas, cancun, florida , Rio de Janeiro, Ilha Grande (brazil) Costa Rica, Nicaragua, La Jolla (san diego), cabo san lucas, Waikiki,  culebra (Puerto Rico) St Thomas,  so far this is my second favorite after flamenco (culebra) ... is an amazing beach....clear turquoise waters...

391205087.name: Getting popular
391205087.author: a TripAdvisor user
391205087.reviewBody: This was always our secret \'wow\' spot with visitors.  A great place to feel like s cast away.  But lately, even on weekdays, there are lots of people.  Harrumph- too good to last I guess.

387937862.name: Beautiful Beach!
387937862.author: a TripAdvisor user
387937862.reviewBody: This is one of my favorite beaches, its crystal clear water, no waves, warm temperature, it is just perfect to relax and chill with a nice cold drink.

386813270.name: Relaxing Sunday
386813270.author: a TripAdvisor user
386813270.reviewBody: CLEAN YOUR TRASH!!!! Amazing beach, weather and view. Too bad for all the trash left behind. There\'s overpriced chips and some street food. Ceviche and other options available but you save a buck or two by bringing your own food.

386472341.name: very scenic beach
386472341.author: a TripAdvisor user
386472341.reviewBody: We stopped by Balandra beach which is one of the favorite beaches for the locals.  Long shallow waters make it a great place for kids.  Get there early for a spot under the palapas provided.\nVery scenic.

386418920.name: Most beautiful beach I\'ve been to
386418920.author: a TripAdvisor user
386418920.reviewBody: This is the nicest and most beautiful beach that I have been too. It\'s basically perfect. I have no complaints not anything that was lacking.

385043413.name: The most beautiful beach ever
385043413.author: a TripAdvisor user
385043413.reviewBody: Don\'t have the words to explain how much i loved this place. For sure i have to go back sometime. Everything is perfect! The only thing is that you don\'t have any place to eat or to drink a beer nearby. You have to go somewhere else.

384471855.name: A beautiful bay to visit
384471855.author: a TripAdvisor user
384471855.reviewBody: It is true that Ballandra Bay is one of the most picturesque bays near La Paz. To really take advantage of the Bay you need to be there early and if possible avoiding the weekend crowds. The best beaches are a walk and a swim across the far side of the bay away from the car park beach but be sure to do the stingray shuffle if you are walking across. There are sit on kayaks to be rented on the beach and that can be an excellent way of exploring the area and getting away from the crowds at weekends. There are few facilities there other than  a few sun shades, a mobile taco shop and the Kayak rental. The area is within a easy twenty minute drive from the city through some spectacular countryside and I would suggest that if you want to make a day of it either take your own picnic or go to Pichilingue where you will find two very good restaurants that specialise in seafood. Tecolote is further north with several more possibilities for eating but Tecolote is probably the most popular beach with the local population and it can get very crowded at week ends and summer evenings.

381557330.name: Beautiful shallow water bay outside La Paz
381557330.author: a TripAdvisor user
381557330.reviewBody: A stunning bay and beach. Deep blues, and pelicans diving for fish. Get there early before the day trippers arrive in the coaches.

381457446.name: Beautiful, swim across
381457446.author: a TripAdvisor user
381457446.reviewBody: A must see/do in La Paz! Walk across to the other beaches away from the main beach. The sand is perfect and it\'s an amazing view. Bring some water and snacks. Go to the bathroom before you head to the beach. There are no bathrooms here. One of the most amazing beaches to experience!!

381298198.name: Beautiful, but come early
381298198.author: a TripAdvisor user
381298198.reviewBody: Balandra beach was tipped as one of the most beautiful beaches near La Paz. We rented a car and visited the beach early, which was good because we where the only ones. Enough time to enjoy the fresh, clear water and the stunning surroundings. Recommended!

381237921.name: Relaxing beach
381237921.author: a TripAdvisor user
381237921.reviewBody: Relaxing, beautiful beach, calm water, you can rent a kayak for 15DLS, take with you some beers before you arrive to the beach.

379730993.name: Gorgeous beach for lying in the sand and walking the beach!
379730993.author: a TripAdvisor user
379730993.reviewBody: The beach is lovely, there is a big sand parking lot and lots of palapas to lie under to get out of the sun. There is just one \'service\' truck for food, and they don\'t have much of a selection, but we had brought our own. We had to walk WAY out in the water before it got deep, and it was kind of gooey on the bottom, so we went back to the car and got water shoes. Cool hiking trails around the area!

377740847.name: Calmed & very nice beach, with a rare stone.
377740847.author: a TripAdvisor user
377740847.reviewBody: The reasons why this beach is special for those in La Paz: the beach is like a big pool, camping is really nice paying the corresponding fees, there is a rock that faced erosion with water & air that now has the form of a enormous mushroom. It was untouched for several years till a nuthead recently climbed it and broke it. Authorities did everything to restore it, so you\u00b4ll be able to see this curios wonder.

377728072.name: One of the nicest and most beautiful beaches anywhere.
377728072.author: a TripAdvisor user
377728072.reviewBody: Pluses: crustal clear turquoise water and white sand. The water is mostly knee-deep. There are some reefs with good snorkeling. Minuses: there is no surf whatsoever. The water is like a lake. That could be a good thing, depending on your point of view.

377162633.name: magical beach
377162633.author: a TripAdvisor user
377162633.reviewBody: Extremely gorgeous, I went midweek so i had it pretty much all to myself and the people I went with, but i have heard that it can get full, and that the people that go don\u00b4t pick up their trash. you can walk and walk till your hearts desire.

376601748.name: Secluded paradise
376601748.author: a TripAdvisor user
376601748.reviewBody: My husband and i stayed in la paz for a week and ventured here one day.  Absolutely breath taking!  We rented a kayak for 100 pesos per hour from a local guy.  It was a fantastic experience and there were maybe 20 other people there on a Wednesday.  Only a 20 minutes drive from the Malecon in la paz.

376116469.name: The most beautiful beach in Baja!
376116469.author: a TripAdvisor user
376116469.reviewBody: Crystal clear waters that unlike any other in Baja!  Be sure to bring an umbrella as there is no shade, but plan to spend the day!

374310705.name: Kids or adults a bit of something for all beach lovers
374310705.author: a TripAdvisor user
374310705.reviewBody: This beach location is gorgeous with its aqua water and brillian white sand.  It\'s shallow most of the time, and on a low tide one can walk all the way to the other side - it\'s about waist deep.  Near the center is a \'blue hole\' that is quite deep, so if you\'re not a swimmer, best to stay away from this.  \nBecause it\'s so shallow it\'s great for kids. and it\'s usually a nice tempurature even in late summer.\nKayaks and palapas can be rented.  Bring a cooler with drinks and snacks, floaties and sand toys and enjoy the day.  But remember your sunscreen and hats!

374186638.name: Blue waters exquisite beach
374186638.author: a TripAdvisor user
374186638.reviewBody: Arrived by boat on a early weekday morning and spent a good amount of time just walking the beach enjoying the blue waters and white sand beach. Very serene and peaceful. Encountered a group of researchers doing a study of the sand, measuring distances between crab holes and the tide line. Water was warm and very clear. Just a delightful place to chill.

373238772.name: Immaculate
373238772.author: a TripAdvisor user
373238772.reviewBody: Brought a cooler full of treats and had an awesome time relaxing at this beach. The water wasn\'t deep and wasn\'t too cold. We rented kayaks and went kayaking to the mushroom looking thing, and on around. The water was deeper the farther you went from the actual beach on around the rocks. It was an amazing time there. The water is so clear you can see every grain of sand.

373198419.name: Doesn\'t Get Better
373198419.author: a TripAdvisor user
373198419.reviewBody: This is a beautiful white sand-azure water beach, The little cove is very shallow and thus kid-friendly, but one must watch out for sting rays, especially in the hotter months. The concessionaire at the beach has snacks, beer and soft drinks, and rents kayaks and paddle boards. The mangrove-lined lagoon in back of the beach (accessible by kayak) is a treat for bird watchers.

372707509.name: Piece of heaven
372707509.author: a TripAdvisor user
372707509.reviewBody: This huge swimming pool is an unbelievable place, so virgin you wont even find restrooms, so take your precautions.\nIt\u00b4s a very enjoyable area and is so spacious that is almost impossible to feel is crowded.

372182966.name: Great place to spend a day
372182966.author: a TripAdvisor user
372182966.reviewBody: The sea is so shallow that you can walk across the bay at low tide. The water is clear and warm and it quite easy to get to from La Paz.

371732544.name: Beautiful beach and great if you have kids or non swimmers
371732544.author: a TripAdvisor user
371732544.reviewBody:
While staying in Cabo we took a day trip down to La Paz and then spent several hours in the afternoon at this beach
The water is amazingly clear and because of the white sand the blue colors will rival any Caribbean beach.  The stark contrast of  blue and turquoise water with the white sand dunes and several interesting rock formations make this beach a great photo opportunity as well,
If you have kids or people in your party that don't know how to swim this is the perfect place for them as the water is only knee deep and therefore warm in almost the whole little bay.  
VENDORS - There are vendors on the beach which will rent chaises and table with chairs -(we paid $215 pesos for two chaises, a chair, and an umbrella) - or if you arrive early in the morning you can lay claim to one of several palapas that are on the beach. Also the chair vendors do have kayaks which are $200 pesos per hour to rent.  We saw one person walking the beach selling tshirts and hats.  
FOOD - We went on a Monday so did not see any food vendors  however just a little way down the road is Tecolote beach which had several restaurants - so either  way bring food or plan to check out Tecolote beach and enjoy lunch there.
RESTROOMS - There are no bathroom facilities on this beach so be aware of this.
SNORKELING - A few fish in the water but no real snorkel opportunities here

370545777.name: Picture Perfect Beach
370545777.author: a TripAdvisor user
370545777.reviewBody: Only had an opportunity to stay here around 45 minutes because we were on our way to snorkel in the nearby islands but wow this beach looks amazing. Around 15 - 20 minutes away from La Paz, just bring all your items, no service here of any kind but it\'s well worth the drive or bus ride (about 90 pesos) to just be here.

370282683.name: Stunning!!!!
370282683.author: a TripAdvisor user
370282683.reviewBody: This beach is like living a piece of paradise on earth for the time you spend there. Crystal clear water from your ankles to waist with baby powder sand under your feet stretching for hundreds of yards. Oh yeah, surrounded by mountains. Are you kidding me? 30 minutes out of La Paz, piece of cake. We drove the 2 hours from Cabo and it was totally worth it. Maybe it was the time of the year but we encountered NO stingrays or jellyfish. A dozen or so extremely friendly locals and a couple other travelers scattered about completes the scene. Leave the resorts folks, explore, you\'ll be glad you did.

370279835.name: Most amazing beach
370279835.author: a TripAdvisor user
370279835.reviewBody: This beach is a bit out of the way, but let me tell you, it is worth it!!  You feel like you are in the Caribbean, crystal clear, aqua water!!  The water is only about waste deep, you can walk to other beaches, in the water!!  Stunning beach, mountains all around you, well worth the trip.  You can rent kayaks, chairs & umbrella.  Or there are about six umbrellas on the public side that are free.  No food for sale, bring cooler if you plan on being there a while.

370197000.name: Gota the most beutifull beeaches that i have ser\u00e9is gin mi life ,
370197000.author: a TripAdvisor user
370197000.reviewBody: Ok these beach it amaizing Tito like a Lagoon , you can walking at least 200 meter in the ocian , the color of the water is cristal , and i mean cristal you can see , everything , the color ar\u00e9 out of these word , there ar\u00e9 3 bays , one is the beach on the parking \u00e1rea , the main beach , if you walki tours the mashroom , its a famosos Stone, you will fine the second beach , and you keep walking north troug the Roks you will fine the 3 beach , its the most beutifull and quait and beutifull , off all, balandra is a protected \u00e1rea ,so brindg all you Needs, water food , toilet papaer everything becouse you wont fine anything there , taking for personal experiencia on My first da y , on main beach you can rent a kajack , recomiendes , i m love with these place , i cant wait to come beack , dont forget the c\u00e1maras ,

368992983.name: Beautiful blue water, shallow
368992983.author: a TripAdvisor user
368992983.reviewBody: Lovely beach to look at because of the shallow blue water.\nStingrays in water - shuffle your feet to get them to move.  No restaurants, bring your own food and drink.

368298831.name: Nice for inexpensive kayaking
368298831.author: a TripAdvisor user
368298831.reviewBody: The water was clear. No fish but birds galore. Chairs and umbrellas available. Snack available. Some locals said you you have to shuffle your feet to scare the stingrays away. The kayaks were 200 pesos for double kayak.

368167957.name: Gorgeous but shallow beach.  Great for hanging out with friends, family and kids!
368167957.author: a TripAdvisor user
368167957.reviewBody:
Gorgeous? Yes, a 100x over.  Fine white sand and varying shades of turquoise, can't go wrong here. The water is warm and at best when the tide is high, probably waist deep in most areas, and i'm 5'.  There are areas that are deeper though, crossing to the different beaches.  It's really perfect for kids because they can play in the water and since the water is shallow in most places and the bay is protected from big waves, it's generally safe for kids.

You can walk around to the different beaches, some more isolated than others if you want privacy.  The scenery is just stunning.  For a view of the whole area, you can hike to the top of a hill.  

There are kayaks for rent at the main entrance and small huts for shade.  Other than that, there is little shade and the sun can get pretty strong.  There are also some vendors selling souvenirs.  Bring your own snacks and beverage as there is no food or little food sold in the area.  

It can get pretty crowded with tourists and locals, it was when we were there.  The good thing was, we came towards the end of the day when a little of people  were leaving and we caught the sunset.  We experienced the place when it was crowded and when there were barely any people left.  When it was quiet, it was serenely beautiful.

My one MAJOR complaint was there were trash in some areas.  We walked the shoreline going towards the mushroom rock, the scene was beautiful with the sun setting, and you turn towards the rocks by the shore and you see soda cans and food wrappers jammed into little crevices.  So sad.

368099849.name: Other than the friends I stayed with, this Beach made my trip.
368099849.author: a TripAdvisor user
368099849.reviewBody: One heck of a changing of the tide and really something to see specially coming from a land locked Canadian. It\'s wading pool deep so perfect for children to play.  The view is spectacular.  I promise you won\'t be disappointed.

368008587.name: Wow Wow Wow
368008587.author: a TripAdvisor user
368008587.reviewBody: This is my new favourite beach of all time.   The combination of subtle desert hues and brilliant turquoise water is simply stunning. I love that there is no development, only a guy renting beach umbrellas and paddle boards (bring food and drink). It\'s also super clean in contrast to nearby Tecolote beach. Balandra is actually a collection of several beaches set in a sheltered bay with very shallow water...if the first beach by the parking lot is too busy, which it wasn\'t on the 2 days we were there, it is easy to wade along the shore to the next beach. We rented a car to get there but noticed that EcoBaja has many daily departures leaving from the bus terminal at the La Paz malecon. Do not miss Balandra!!!

367645150.name: solo
367645150.author: a TripAdvisor user
367645150.reviewBody: Walking out o your shoulders and it is only knee deep. The water is a tourquoise,  the scenery out of this world. I came on a calm day. It was stunning. The mushroom rock.

367622312.name: Beautiful beach
367622312.author: a TripAdvisor user
367622312.reviewBody: This beach is a must to visit. Crystal clear ,clean blue water. You can walk for ever and be only up to your knees. This is a super beach for kids.

367601118.name: Beyond beautiful
367601118.author: a TripAdvisor user
367601118.reviewBody: Well worth the drive from Cabo.  Beyond a vendor selling potato chips there was no food available, so pack a picnic and enjoy the day at once of the finest beaches Mexico has to offer.

367456504.name: Heaven on Earth
367456504.author: a TripAdvisor user
367456504.reviewBody:
This is one of my top 3 beaches (along with X'cacel in Quintana Roo, and Carrizalillo in Oaxaca).

You have this caribe-like colors, you can walk hundreds of meters with the water level not rising much (kee-deep and chest-deep most of the way), you are surrounded by amazing mountains (and that is a very special feeling that most people fail to note when telling you about beaches in La Paz).

Bring your own food and beverages. Stay all day long. Please be considerate of others and DON'T bring music with you.

367127074.name: Well worth the trip
367127074.author: a TripAdvisor user
367127074.reviewBody: This is the most beautiful beach in the La Paz area and certainly in the top ten beaches in all of Baja Sur.  We drive up from Cabo San Lucas simply to spend a few hours here away from the crowds.  The beach is remote (about 30 minutes past La Paz), the sand is clean, the water is clear and the inlet so shallow you can almost walk across it.  Just a wonderful place to relax and enjoy the sun and water.

366723382.name: Most beautiful beach in La Paz
366723382.author: a TripAdvisor user
366723382.reviewBody: It\'s the most beautiful beach in La Paz, The water is so clear and you can rent a kayak and paddle around the lagoon.

366715639.name: Road trip to La Paz
366715639.author: a TripAdvisor user
366715639.reviewBody: Most beautiful beach  ever! Definitely worth driving to. It\'s a quiet beach mainly visited by locals. About 25 minutes from La Paz.

366189446.name: Beautiful but lots of jellyfish and stingrays
366189446.author: a TripAdvisor user
366189446.reviewBody: This beach is every bit as beautiful as everyone says. But if you love being in the water prepare to stung by a jellyfish a time or two.

366114115.name: Last night on KharmaSeas
366114115.author: a TripAdvisor user
366114115.reviewBody: The most beautiful beach in the world, I spent my last night aboard my sailboat anchored for two days. \nUmbrellas for rent. Kayaks also! Has road access to drive in. If you get to La Paz and you don\'t visit Balandra you will miss the best beach you can ever see!

365869313.name: Unbelievable beauty
365869313.author: a TripAdvisor user
365869313.reviewBody: Took a drive and drove till the road ended and lo an behold we were in paradise. Beautiful clear water and white pristine sandy beach. There were palapas to shade you and kayaks for the adventurous. Loved it...would recommend the drive!

365750443.name: Gorgeous and only little used
365750443.author: a TripAdvisor user
365750443.reviewBody: Possibly because there are no facilities for bathroom or food, this beach seemed to me to be an undiscovered gem.  Parking for a few dozen cars.  A few free umbrellas and more that are rentable.

365705319.name: Beautiful place to spend a morning
365705319.author: a TripAdvisor user
365705319.reviewBody: Lovely water and peaceful surf the day we visited. The lush tropical plants that grow in the area can lull you into thinking this is a real paradise.

365463945.name: Beautiful Beach
365463945.author: a TripAdvisor user
365463945.reviewBody: This is a really lovely, peaceful beach.  The distance is a little far out from town so you need to either get a taxi, tour or rent a car.

364875657.name: Beautiful setting
364875657.author: a TripAdvisor user
364875657.reviewBody: Great place to go and hang out for the day. We took a taxi from our hotel, but there are buses that can take you there. Bring your own towels and water. There are fruit snacks and ice treats available on location  during weekends and  busy week days but are limited. You can walk from one beach to the next which is just amazing.

364409039.name: Shades of blue
364409039.author: a TripAdvisor user
364409039.reviewBody: My husband and I had been to Balandra a few years back and enjoyed the warm, shallow waters. To can walk across to more secluded beaches or stay at them aim beach and rent paddle boards and kayaks. If you are coming to snorkel you will be disappointed as there are little to no fish (no reef or rocks). Truly a lovely place if you are a beach goer!!!

363785401.name: Best beach for couples, family, and seniors
363785401.author: a TripAdvisor user
363785401.reviewBody: This is by far the must beautiful safest beach I\'ve ever been to. You can walk a mile in and just be waste deep. Super clear water. Few things to note, there are no bathrooms or restaurants so take your own food and use the bathroom prior to getting there.

362190410.name: Natural Wonderland!
362190410.author: a TripAdvisor user
362190410.reviewBody: We drove to Balandra Beach as a day trip from Cabo. The two and a half hour drive was well worth it! The white sand was so soft and the shallow waters allowed you to wade around the area. Be sure to bring good shoes or sandals in order to hike up and around Mushroom Rock. You cannot possibly miss that view! Kayaks and paddle boards are available for rent, but beware that as the tide goes out, it exposes lots of sand bars which can make kayaking tricky. Also, bug spray at Balandra Beach is a must.....we didn\'t have ours and left with many bites from tiny knats on the beach.

361916541.name: Sunset visit at BAlandra beach
361916541.author: a TripAdvisor user
361916541.reviewBody: Expensive cab ride but worth the 550 pesos. Beautiful shallow water you can walk and it only goes up to your belly. We went at Sunset and it was very quiet.

361861382.name: Beautiful
361861382.author: a TripAdvisor user
361861382.reviewBody: We took a taxi from downtown to this beach and it was absolutely amazing! Clear waters, quiet place and a beautiful beach. If you have the chance to go, do not miss it!

361666550.name: Thus is a local secret there\'s a reason
361666550.author: a TripAdvisor user
361666550.reviewBody: This was the most beautiful beach I have seen in years, you can walk for miles before the water reaches your chest. And the atmosphere is amazing.

361651717.name: beautiful beach!
361651717.author: a TripAdvisor user
361651717.reviewBody: Amazing shallow beach , you can walk in the sea for around 100 meters or more and water is still beneath your knees! Kayaking is a nice adventure across the bay to the beaches. You can see volcanic formations and dunes, paradisiac! Keep the good job by keeping it clean locals!

361346658.name: Beautiful but water still cold
361346658.author: a TripAdvisor user
361346658.reviewBody: Water not yet warm enough for this guapa however I loved lounging and sunning in such a gorgeous location... Def check this place out!

360993648.name: Not to be missed!
360993648.author: a TripAdvisor user
360993648.reviewBody: Take a packed lunch and enjoy this amazing beach of calm water and beautiful views. There are no restaurants which makes this beach even more beautiful.

360915011.name: Stunning setting near La Paz.
360915011.author: a TripAdvisor user
360915011.reviewBody: We spent the day at this beach, and enjoyed it\'s shallow water and clean, soft sand. What a perfect place for kids! We arrived early (about 10am), and got one of the free palapas, which was a welcome shelter from the sun. It seems very family oriented, and the tide was out, so the sand bars went clear to the other side of the bay almost! We would\'ve loved to have seen it at high tide, as the water was a gorgeous shade of Caribbean blue towards the mouth of the bays. Bring your picnic and enjoy!

360750543.name: Very Nice Beach Near La Paz
360750543.author: a TripAdvisor user
360750543.reviewBody: I have visited this beach several times over the past 15 years or so, most recently during the Holy Week before Easter this year.  The beach is nice and fairly clean, and the water in the shallow bay is a beautiful turquoise.  In past visits, there were few people on the beach and few boats in the deeper outer edge of the bay, and it was fun snorkeling around the rocky edges of the bay.  A good way to spend a few hours while visiting La Paz, from which it is a 20-30 minute drive.  During the the recent visit, though, the beach and attached parking lot were full, and the tide was out, so the bay was really too shallow to swim and snorkel in, and the experience wasn\'t as good as it had been at other seasons/times of day.  My recommendation is to check the tide tables and avoid national holidays.  A must-do is to walk up to the top of the hill next to the beach for a panoramic view of this scenic area.

360065825.name: The best beach in Mexico
360065825.author: a TripAdvisor user
360065825.reviewBody: Not kidding, Balandra just won the bes beach in Mexico, better than any one in the mexican caribbean, it is AMAZING, clear turquoise water, white sand, dessert surrounding it, it\u00b4s a paradise, do not miss this beach if going to La Paz you won\u00b4t regret it.

359796203.name: Beautiful and peaceful beach with amazing water colors
359796203.author: a TripAdvisor user
359796203.reviewBody: The beach is surrounded by mountains so the view is spectacular. The water is very clear in colors turquoise and light blue. It is very shallow so you can cross walking from one side to the other on the beach. It is a great place to spend the day relaxing and having fun. There are small spots to rent a kayak or beach umbrellas for the day.

359503713.name: Most amazing beach
359503713.author: a TripAdvisor user
359503713.reviewBody: I almost didn\'t want to write a review because I dont want this beach to become popular. Then I read an article about the beach being protected for not to became a comercial-touristy place.\nIf we are talking about just the beach and the clear waters,this is the most beautiful beach I\'ve ever been to. Also, for me, what makes it beautiful, its the lack of the human trail(no hotels,no restrooms,no restaurants..no nothing except sand and sea). This could be inadequate for some,but for us it was perfect.

358450163.name: Gorgeous beach
358450163.author: a TripAdvisor user
358450163.reviewBody: Get to this beach early because it become very full and popular later on in the day. Gorgeous beach no shops near just very expensive ice creams, water and fruit so I would recommend stocking up before you get there. You can walk via the water around to the right to experience a quieter beach (past the mushroom rock). Not a lot of shade so I would recommend taking or renting a umbrella. Definitely worth visiting I loved it!

358242098.name: What a relaxing time in front of an incredible view.
358242098.author: a TripAdvisor user
358242098.reviewBody: My brother in law lives in La Paz and he promised us to take us to the best beach for my 4 & 6 year old kids. He was right, Balandra is  definitely iconic!  Love to go back soon.

358034851.name: Lovely beach and calm waters if you want to rent a boat.
358034851.author: a TripAdvisor user
358034851.reviewBody: It was a windy day so there was no one at the beach. It is a lovely spot, often used by Mexican families for picnics and some beach fun

357475546.name: Safe swimming in lovely sheltered bay.
357475546.author: a TripAdvisor user
357475546.reviewBody: A favourite beach near la Paz by car, just above Pichilingue. Unusual scenery, soft sand, palapas, rental tables and chairs, and kayaks. The addition of toilets would be a definite plus.

357426024.name: Beautiful beach
357426024.author: a TripAdvisor user
357426024.reviewBody: This is a really pretty beach- you have to go out and around to get the best view. There is no alcohol served/sold here so bring your own if you want it.

357325272.name: Balandra beach
357325272.author: a TripAdvisor user
357325272.reviewBody: Amazing. Recommended visiting early (9 am) as later on many people come. To see the Balandra rock one has to go on the right from the parking

356921807.name: Stunning
356921807.author: a TripAdvisor user
356921807.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful beaches in my travels. It is in a large cove with clear shallow water you can wade through. Mushroom Rock is around the corner and easy to get to. Many boats spend the night in the cove as it is protected from the wind. It is a wonderful beach for small children and families. \n

356881341.name: Gigantic white sand kiddie pool
356881341.author: a TripAdvisor user
356881341.reviewBody: I can\'t imagine a more perfect beach for a family with multiple young children. We arrived in the AM when most of the beach was about 1.5 feet deep in crystal clear, still water. After about two hours, it had become a giant sandbox and the close in water was ankle deep. Lovely palapas, easy to park, don\'t forget the sand toys! If you are hoping for jumping in waves or swimming, go elsewhere.

355326557.name: Garbage everwhere near this beach
355326557.author: a TripAdvisor user
355326557.reviewBody: We stopped by when we were in La Paz.  The shallow warm water was cool, but there was garbage everywhere.  There are nicer beaches nearby.

355117825.name: crowded but nice
355117825.author: a TripAdvisor user
355117825.reviewBody: we went there adn turned around and went to another beach we passed on the way.Same water less people

355042883.name: Great beach for children (and adults ;-))
355042883.author: a TripAdvisor user
355042883.reviewBody: Very nice and lovely beach/bay! As the water is very low it is ideal for little children. You can walk for several minutes before the water starts to get deeper. And the bay itself is amazing.

354190987.name: Sailed into the anchorage
354190987.author: a TripAdvisor user
354190987.reviewBody: Beautiful white sand beaches, shallow water for paddling and deep enough for swimmers, lots of kayaking and beach walking. Home of the world famous mushroom rock.

353816049.name: Beautiful Beach
353816049.author: a TripAdvisor user
353816049.reviewBody: A very quiet, beautiful beach enjoyed by the locals. Some wonderful shade palapas. Lots of families enjoying themselves.

353181184.name: Too popular for my taste. Beautiful but lots of people.
353181184.author: a TripAdvisor user
353181184.reviewBody: If you don\'t mind enjoying the beach among the crowds this is beautiful. Otherwise, go elsewhere. There is food available. Merchants walking along the beach.

352959675.name: Paradise!
352959675.author: a TripAdvisor user
352959675.reviewBody: an absolutely gorgeous beach. clear, blue water, ideal for families,\na great spot to visit! you can walk out about a quarter mile and it\'s still up to your knees

351665194.name: Watch for sting rays but wow what a place
351665194.author: a TripAdvisor user
351665194.reviewBody: This beach is one of a kind and if you are in La Paz you should see it.  The water is warm and not very deep making it a comfortable experience

351558600.name: Amazing Beach with Azure Waters and Soft White Sand
351558600.author: a TripAdvisor user
351558600.reviewBody: This is a picturesque beach with warm blue water and soft white sand. Very shallow for family fun. SUP boards and kayaks are available to rent or bring your own. \n\nThere is no food or drinks served so bring your own and enjoy a day in the sun !

350669980.name: Stunning
350669980.author: a TripAdvisor user
350669980.reviewBody: We could not have had better conditions, and this beach took our breath away. Arrived in the morning on a Tuesday and it was not crowded. We snagged a palapa, relaxed for a while, then did a long walk around in the warm shallow water. I think it is nicer in the morning than the afternoon, as by 1, the people had doubled and the tide gong out impacted the incredible aesthetics of the blue-green water.

350639510.name: Beautiful quiet beach
350639510.author: a TripAdvisor user
350639510.reviewBody: Nice sandy beach that you can walk out in. water is warm, good for families,easy to see your kids as it isn\'t busy at all. Water colours are also nice. A bit of a drive from La Paz but easy to find- watch out for large trucks and don\'t be in a rush to get there, would not drive on the road at night.

350595164.name: So beautiful and pristine...I almost don\'t want to share it with you.
350595164.author: a TripAdvisor user
350595164.reviewBody: A rare protected and totally undeveloped beach with beautiful shallow water. perfect for beginner snorkelers, sun bathers and anyone searching for peace and quiet.

350591410.name: special beach
350591410.author: a TripAdvisor user
350591410.reviewBody: It s a magic place, the location has outstanding views. It is not much indicated how to get there, but once you are there, you can just sit and relax watching the sunset over Balandra beach.

349846127.name: Beautiful beach
349846127.author: a TripAdvisor user
349846127.reviewBody: We visited Balandra beach twice during our seven day stay in La Paz.  It was so beautiful.  It was absolutely the perfect beach to take our five year old to have his first beach experience.  Be sure to walk to mushroom rock if the tide is out and check out the tide pools.  We enjoyed checking out all the various sea creatures and fish in the pools.

349315947.name: Unspoilt Paradise
349315947.author: a TripAdvisor user
349315947.reviewBody: Peaceful place, clean clear water, You can walk for long distance in the see and the water is still in your ankle.Beautiful place a must if you are visiting La Paz.

349024051.name: Words fail me
349024051.author: a TripAdvisor user
349024051.reviewBody: I did a ton of research online trying to decide where I wanted to spend my 50th birthday.  My choices were pretty much anywhere American or Southwest flew.  We chose this beach, and it did not disappoint.  Pack light and walk a bit, as the crowds are all close to the parking lot.  (But even on a Sunday, it was not crowded.)  The beach is astounding in its beauty.  And the HUGE rocks offer tons and tons of shade, like shallow caves.  Not much infrastructure so if you want restaurants and bathrooms, go to one of the other beaches on either side of this spectacular bay.

348683806.name: What\'s not to like!
348683806.author: a TripAdvisor user
348683806.reviewBody: Balandra Bay is gorgeous....we arrived by private tour boat and brought kayaks with us to explore the Bay.  The water was crystal clear in most parts.  We stopped at a couple of the beaches to hang out. We had the beaches we went to to ourselves.  Very peaceful and relaxing.  There were a couple of boats moored in the Bay and a group of paddleboarders.  So glad this area is preserved.  Definitely worth a visit - it is a must do if you are near La Paz.

348670490.name: Gorgeous cove !!!
348670490.author: a TripAdvisor user
348670490.reviewBody: We came to this beautiful beach in the early morning. We were all alone for over an hour and someone camping in the rocks played the guitar. It was magical !!!  What a great way to start the day !!!  I will return to Balandra Beach !!!

348050778.name: Best Beach in Mexico--Balandra Beach in La Paz
348050778.author: a TripAdvisor user
348050778.reviewBody: Someone told us about La Paz and Balandra Beach so we had to see it. We rented a car from Cabo San Jose from National for a day about $60 dollars. It took us 2 1/2 hours driving 70 mph through the mountains on a paved highway. \nThis beach is hidden behind the mountains before La Paz Centro. Make sure you use google maps so you won\'t get lost. \nThe drive was worth it !! Bahamas beach in Mexico!!!

347948167.name: Beautiful beach!
347948167.author: a TripAdvisor user
347948167.reviewBody: We took a little drive up from La Paz and checked out the beaches along the way. Very pretty area, nice to just sit and look or walk around. A little cold for swimming with the breeze when we went otherwise would have stayed longer :)

347916220.name: Great place to spend the day
347916220.author: a TripAdvisor user
347916220.reviewBody: Beautiful white sand beach, warm clear water.  Safe for young children as it doesn\'t get deep for a very long ways, and sheltered by a sand bar from strong pulling waves.

347722670.name: Awesome secluded beach
347722670.author: a TripAdvisor user
347722670.reviewBody: A great little secluded beach at the end of the road in La Paz. A great place to walk around and see an amazing sunset and just relax. you can pretty much walk on top of the water, because its so shallow.

347497738.name: Loved it
347497738.author: a TripAdvisor user
347497738.reviewBody: Amazing beach!! You can walk and see clearly into the water the she time. Down side since my husband and I went alone someone walked off with my sandals -_- besides that amazing bringing my fam next time.

347483842.name: best beach in la paz area
347483842.author: a TripAdvisor user
347483842.reviewBody:
This review includes the beaches adjacent to Balandra. The main beach is tucked away in a cove. The water is never very deep, and at low tide it is barely up to your knees. Note that there aren't really waves here.

If you walk to the right around the rocks you get to another beach, and if you go to the end of that one and walk around those rocks you get to another. There are fewer people the farther you go. Those 2 beaches are a little more "classic beach" than Balandra, as they aren't really in a cove.

You can also hike up the hills bordering the beach, which provides some pretty good views.

There is a snack truck in the main parking lot where you can get some water, soda, chips and stuff, but there are no full-service restaurants. You can also rent kayaks.

347262995.name: Beautiful Balandra!
347262995.author: a TripAdvisor user
347262995.reviewBody: Stunning beach with crystal clear water.  When the tide goes out (around 1:00 pm in February), you can walk a LONG way and the water is up to your knees.  Nice shallow beach for the kids!

346249586.name: Nice spot to kill an hour or two
346249586.author: a TripAdvisor user
346249586.reviewBody:
So the draw here is that the tide goes out and leaves sand bars that you can walk across the bay to other beaches on.

It's very pretty and because the water is so shallow it can be pretty warm

There are no services here so bring your own food/water.  If you go looking for a private spot to pee you'll likely find that others have done the same and some spots are packed full of poop coated toilet paper and used tampons.  It can be a bit nasty but then people can be kinda nasty sometimes.

They rent table, 4 chairs and umbrella here but they charge it for a full day even if you only stay an hour and they charge $20.

Make sure to walk around the point on the right side.  There's a LOT more over there than you might think.

346034432.name: Photo Perfection
346034432.author: a TripAdvisor user
346034432.reviewBody: Lovely setting - sand that goes for miles! Easy to access and fun for small children to play.  Opportunities for various water activities and varied interests.

345718693.name: BEAUTIFUL BALANDRA BEACH
345718693.author: a TripAdvisor user
345718693.reviewBody: My daughter and I went scuba diving off of La Paz. The dive company which is excellent (Dive in La Paz) took us to this beach for a lunch they had prepared. Sitting on this beautiful white beach looking at the scenery and eating  fresh cervechi was so calm and peaceful. The sand is powdery and doesn\'t even stick to you. Definitely a unique experience. Since we were the only ones there, this is not at all what happens when you go to a CA beach.

345298268.name: A tropical paradise of blue water and white sand
345298268.author: a TripAdvisor user
345298268.reviewBody: An incredibly beautiful place and on the day we went there was hardly anyone else there, great for a swim and to see the mushroom rock

345240283.name: Shallow, private, beautiful waters and beach
345240283.author: a TripAdvisor user
345240283.reviewBody: We took a road trip from San Jose del Cabo to La Paz and came to Balandra Beach and were very glad we did, the beach is a very cool experience with water only about up to your knees as far out as one could walk, perhaps a 1/4 mile or more. The shallow water would make a perfect setting for families with young children and we even saw a dog on a paddleboard! They have palapas for you to sit under if you want shade, but there are no other facilities except a vendor selling snacks and trinkets.  If you wanted, you could walk across the inlet through the water with your things and set up in one of the many completely private beach areas, which we will definitely do next time.

344851759.name: Stunning beach, secluded, untouched, a must see
344851759.author: a TripAdvisor user
344851759.reviewBody: This beach has 3 parts, 1 part you can drive to, and the other two you need to take a boat to get there. Go to the boat only portions, as there are fewer people, and it really feels like you are on a secluded beach, with beautiful shades of blue waters, and fine white sand. Bring a nice lunch and relax in the Sea of Cortez.

344755255.name: Amazing!
344755255.author: a TripAdvisor user
344755255.reviewBody: don\'t forget your camera, is spectacular! flat water and white sand! Bring also food and drinks, as there is nowhere to buy

344398653.name: Walk Forever when the Tide goes out
344398653.author: a TripAdvisor user
344398653.reviewBody:
Went two times to Balandra beach. The second time the tide was going out, stayed for the afternoon. By the time we left around 4 o'clock The Bay was nearly empty of water. So if you hadn't seen it prior and arrived late in the afternoon you might be disappointed.
As you couldn't really kayak and it looked desolated.
 But all the other reviewers are correct it really is beautiful! The different birds are really something to watch and photograph. There are Palapas to hook your belongings onto the poles.
 The day we went it was also windy, so probably a good choice to be protected from the wind.

344388262.name: Beautiful, Must See
344388262.author: a TripAdvisor user
344388262.reviewBody: We went to Balandra beach this last Saturday for about 4 hours in the afternoon. There were some tourists and many locals at the beach but it was not overcrowded. The beach is clear and the water was moderately warm. The water is about knee high for several hundred yards out and there are several smaller beaches in the bay you can walk to through the water. We took a taxi for 550 pesos (about $33 with the current exchange of 18 pesos=$1) from the Costa Baja resort. Taxi drivers can drop you and return at a specified time. There was one vendor open on Saturday who was renting umbrellas and chairs for 200-300 pesos. There are some fixed umbrellas on the beach, so if you are there during the week you can likely snag one of those. There are no bathrooms and only some drinks and light packaged snacks for purchase. I am unsure how often the stand is open on weekdays when the beach is likely far less busy.

343874896.name: A "must go" in La Paz
343874896.author: a TripAdvisor user
343874896.reviewBody: This beach is just beautiful, quiet and has a magnificent view! If you plan to be there for a long time is best to bring some food and drinks because there is not much around.

342645134.name: Fantastice public beach
342645134.author: a TripAdvisor user
342645134.reviewBody: Just the most beautiful beach near La Paz!!  Easy to find and super safe for children.  Lovely rock formations too.

342039680.name: You can wade for a mile
342039680.author: a TripAdvisor user
342039680.reviewBody: It seems that way, anyway.  The water is warm and cerulean, the sand is white, the rocks are volcanic, the children are laughing, it\'s like a dream.

342039292.name: My favorite 5 star beach in the world.
342039292.author: a TripAdvisor user
342039292.reviewBody: So many people come to La Paz and don\'t get out to this excellent swimming, snorkeling beach in rural setting. Only 20 minutes out of town and well worth the drive. Child safe as you can walk out aprox half a kilometer in pristine clear turquoise water. No wind as its sheltered in a quiet cove. No services but ample parking. Often a food trailer has snacks drinks and souvenirs. \n

340979717.name: Rent Kayak to truly enjoy the Balandra Beach
340979717.author: a TripAdvisor user
340979717.reviewBody: Most beautiful beach I have ever seen. Went  twice just to enjoy the beauty. Rent a kayak and cruise the bay. You see lots of fish while kayaking.

340515679.name: Very nice beach
340515679.author: a TripAdvisor user
340515679.reviewBody: Very nice beach not too far from La Paz.  Waded around in shallow water and checked out the mushroom rock.  Didn\'t really find a good place to snorkel.  A little bit of trash from some ignorant beach goers, but unfortunately that happens.  Much cleaner than Tecolote which we visited afterword.

339771337.name: Must See Beach in Baja
339771337.author: a TripAdvisor user
339771337.reviewBody: The is possibly the best beach for kids I\'ve ever been too. It is a lagoon/bay that fills in to waist height at high-tide and has no waves. At low tide, the lagoon nearly empties and you can walk out and explore the inter-tidal marine life for hundreds of meters. I\'ve probably been 10 times in 5 years, and it hasn\'t changed a bit. It is great for SUPing, kayaking, relaxing on the shore or wading out for as far as you want. It is a spiritually significant beach to the indigenous people of Baja and is protected from further development, so should stay pristine indefinitely. There is one small kiosk in the parking lot where you can get snacks, rent a kayak or a SUP, but they don\'t serve beer - everyone brings their own.

339632639.name: Beautiful, get there early its popular!
339632639.author: a TripAdvisor user
339632639.reviewBody: Amazing bay, sooo. shallow. We wore our reef shoes and shuffled our feet as told, we didn\'t see any sing rays. Walked all the way round to the famous rock and snorkelled in water only 4 foot deep, very clear and chilly. No toilets here. We sat on the beach near some locals cooking up lunch for the entire family. Car park is small. So we headed over to Tecolote for lunch.

339225901.name: Gorgeous beach
339225901.author: a TripAdvisor user
339225901.reviewBody: If anything a bit too crowded because easily accessible. Lovely at end of day or early in the morning.

338780348.name: I have never seen such a beach!
338780348.author: a TripAdvisor user
338780348.reviewBody: I wanted to go to this beach for about 6 years, ever since I first saw a picture.  Be sure to wade out and explore around as many corners as possible.

338772066.name: Good as the pictures
338772066.author: a TripAdvisor user
338772066.reviewBody: Spent a half day there and it was a beautiful as the pictures we had seen in the magazine.  It was sunny all day so that helped the color of the water which was turquoise and clear.  We were warned about stingrays but walked all the way across to the deserted beaches, back and then across to the mushroom rock and never saw one.  There were four of us so don\'t be deterred by that.  Yes, there were wasps here and there but nobody ever got stung.  If you are in the area, it is a must see.

337290148.name: Amazing!
337290148.author: a TripAdvisor user
337290148.reviewBody: We sailed into this gorgeous bay and anchored in crystal clear water. The rock formations around the bay are very cool and there are 4 or 5 seperate white sand beaches to laze around on. This beach is a popular picnic beach just a short drive or panga trip from La Paz so its popular with the locals. The craggy mountains to the south are Coyote hills I believe. It is a special place.

337078896.name: Wow. Just Wow.
337078896.author: a TripAdvisor user
337078896.reviewBody: This beach is surreal. Miles and miles of knee-deep, crystal clear water and white soft sand. Lots of fish and birds - off-the-beach snorkeling near the rocks is amazing. A perfect place to take a day off, find a sheltered cove, read a book, take a dip, hike a hill and do whatever you like. One of the most beautiful places I have ever been to. Magical.

336911317.name: It is the best beach for kids
336911317.author: a TripAdvisor user
336911317.reviewBody: Water there is so shallow and calm,  you can walk long way in and still in shallow water. It\'s parking lot is so crowded and most people are locals. No restaurant. Only good beach. Bo one told us this beach and found it by ourself. Highly recommend it.

336500873.name: Possibly nicest beach in La Paz
336500873.author: a TripAdvisor user
336500873.reviewBody: This is a beautiful shallow bay with very safe swimming for children.  Unfortunately if you want to swim in deep water you will have to go very far out.  However the beach is very clean (not always the case in Mexico) with little garbage.  On the weekends and holidays it can get very crowded with locals. There is a SUB rental kiosk but no food or drink for sale.  You can see that means it is not really used by tourists, possibly because you need a car to get there

336235711.name: Beautiful beach, lots of people
336235711.author: a TripAdvisor user
336235711.reviewBody: This beach was beautiful! The water is very shallow for much of it, but we had a very lovely time. Great views, lots of birds!

336096928.name: Paraiso
336096928.author: a TripAdvisor user
336096928.reviewBody: The beach you dream about at your desk on Monday morning! An amazing little "hidden" gem with white sand beach, palapas for shade and a wide, shallow, warm-watered bay for splashing around in. Minimal  services (NO restrooms) include a truck selling cold sodas and packaged snacks and a kayak and umbrella rental. Though small, the bay is deep and rocky so even if there are many people here, they are spread out along the beach allowing for privacy even on busy days.

335108401.name: Our favorite beach near La Paz
335108401.author: a TripAdvisor user
335108401.reviewBody: We think Balandra is the prettiest beach near La Paz.  Plenty of room to spread out.  Good wading and snorkeling in the shallow bay (but shuffle your feet if you\'re wading to avoid the stingrays).  There is a snack bar that has drinks and rents umbrellas, chaises and kayaks.  Kids love it.

334103540.name: very touristy
334103540.author: a TripAdvisor user
334103540.reviewBody: There were a lot of vendors looking for you to spend your money. It was interesting to see the marina present as they had a first aid station set up. Not as nice as tecolote

333763492.name: Restful and scenic
333763492.author: a TripAdvisor user
333763492.reviewBody: Amazing. Beautiful turquoise waters crashing steadily on soft white Sandy shores. Incredible conglomerate walls of volcanic rock. Private beach with a few locals and some tourists. There are peddlers.

332937624.name: Great experience
332937624.author: a TripAdvisor user
332937624.reviewBody:
If you love to exploring inside to cortez of sea, this is a great place for snorkeling. 
We went with friends at this beach in La Paz and is like little lost paradise in La Baja that you must to exploring !! 

I recommend this place if you visit la paz one day

332314478.name: Too beautiful for words
332314478.author: a TripAdvisor user
332314478.reviewBody: Perfect turquoise beach. White sand, wading pool depth, and pretty as a picture. Be sure to shuffle walk when baby manta rays are present!

332262220.name: Beautiful beach
332262220.author: a TripAdvisor user
332262220.reviewBody: Beautiful place. The water is very warm and shallow. Would be a great place to take kids to swim. We rented snorkeling equipment, and found beautiful tropical fish here.

331831253.name: QUIET TRANQUIL WATERS
331831253.author: a TripAdvisor user
331831253.reviewBody:
Playa Balandra is 24 kms. from La Paz where you will find the calm tranquil waters perfect for families and travellers to escape from everything.  The lagoon comprises 7 private beaches of which 5 are only accessible by kayak, paddle board (for rent at the main beach) and swimming.  At low tide, guests can almost walk across to the other beaches.
On windy days, the beaches are well protected. 
Although Balandra is absolutely beautiful, there are no food or drink services, but Palya El Tecolote is only 1 km. from Balandra where you will find bars, restaurants and palapas to enjoy.
Palapa Azul, a bar restaurant, serves the best Margarita in all of Baja, along with a full menu of delectable seafood dishes.
I live on the mountain overlooking these beaches and has been my home for 7 years.
Don't forget to see the "mushroom rock" which Balandra is famous for!

331220523.name: Excellent
331220523.author: a TripAdvisor user
331220523.reviewBody: Beautiful beach on a bay, not a ocean beach with waves. Bring food and drinks. Very relaxing. Kayaking and paddle surfing available for a small fee.

331120044.name: Unique Beach
331120044.author: a TripAdvisor user
331120044.reviewBody: We took the advise of other reviewers and ventured out to this place - not too easy to find if you don\'t have a GPS since the road signs were non-existent.  Fortunately the local police on the road directed us.  The area is still not developed yet.  All we saw were few cars and a vendor truck and that\'s how we guessed we arrived.  It took us 3 hours drive from Los Cabos.  It was a very windy day as we could feel the sand pelting on our face.  However, the water was still calm.  The water is shallow and you can walk in for quite a distance before the water reaches your waist.  We could see that this would be a great family beach with future resorts build around it.  If we didn\'t have to drive for such a long time to get back to Cabos and if we had beach chairs and umbrella, we would have stayed longer!

330383090.name: beautiful and quiet
330383090.author: a TripAdvisor user
330383090.reviewBody: perfect for couples looking for nice secluded beach (on weekdays) and for families with children as there are no waves and it is shallow for a long distance. I visited on a cloudy and windy day and still worth seeing it. Visit with your car or hire a cab for a day (80$) and visit all the beaches in la paz but you can spend most of your time here.

330046734.name: A beautifully hidden gem near La Paz!
330046734.author: a TripAdvisor user
330046734.reviewBody:
Quite the hidden gem. Loved it. If you can get a shuttle or taxi or take a rental car here, do it.  It's a quiet and beautiful beach with clear blue water. Not a lot of wind since it's in a protected bay.  Not a ton of people. Some Locals and Tourist. Like any beach, bring your towels, coolers, sun umbrella and your own food. I saw one group pitch a tent. There is a small truck that rents out paddle boards, kayaks, some tables, umbrellas, and very limited snack like chips and soda. There are some permanent Palapa style umbrellas but that's on a  first come basis. Again, not a ton of people here so the chances of getting one early in the day is good.

You can hike up the rock mountain or walk around the beach to see the mushroom rock. Great views from the top of the rock mountain but make sure to wear the proper shoes. Lots of loose rocks and as you make your way to the Mushroom rock, you will encounter sand and water depending on the tide.

There is parking lot. I saw a porta potty.

This is a great little adventure nearby. The kids will love it. You will love it too.

329212467.name: Big hype for the mushroom, better seen by boat
329212467.author: a TripAdvisor user
329212467.reviewBody: This beach gets really croweded on the overhype of seeing the famous mushroom rock. You can see it better coming from the ocean in a boat.

328834190.name: AMAZING!
328834190.author: a TripAdvisor user
328834190.reviewBody: This is a must while in LaPaz. I was in heaven for the day. Turquoise water and white sandy beach. Hardly onyone on the beach. Bring a cooler and food with you. Really nothing there at all. A hut to rent paddle boards and a vendor at the beginning of the beach. Take a walk around the rocks to the right. You will end up inside a beautiful bay. It is shallow crystal clear bay.It was windy everywhere else on the coast. This beach is protected. We will be going back for sure!

328824533.name: Speechless
328824533.author: a TripAdvisor user
328824533.reviewBody: Pictures are not good enough to show how nice is this place. Calm ocean, blue transparent water and clean sand

328223766.name: A five star hike and snorkel.
328223766.author: a TripAdvisor user
328223766.reviewBody: Our guide, Manuel Rodriguez from RED Travel Mexico, headed us out of LaPaz,month to the Bay. He filled in the details of how this important area was saved from development. The views were breath-taking.

328099834.name: One of the best beaches in La Paz
328099834.author: a TripAdvisor user
328099834.reviewBody: Lovely beach, very clean and the water is amazing. A must when visiting La Paz. Take a cooler, a shade and some food with you, there is very little services so be prepare. There are some rental umbrellas and a soda truck near by but that\'s about it.

326915448.name: Great beach for windy day
326915448.author: a TripAdvisor user
326915448.reviewBody: In la Paz if the wind is high, this is one of the few protected beaches. The sand is nice beach clean and water warm but very shallow.  The surrounding cliffs make a picturesque view from the water. \n\nThere was a food truck with some paddle boards.  Visited by locals and tourists.

325975052.name: calm spectacular beach
325975052.author: a TripAdvisor user
325975052.reviewBody: fairly large beach, shaped like 2/3 of a circle with lots of little coves going around.  the mushroom rock is pretty cool to check out but being able to walk couple hundred feet from shore tells you how calm and shallow a lot of the water is here.  naturally its nice and warm as a result.  southern end has some ok snorkeling but this is more of beach to just relax and melt away.

325575841.name: Crystal Clear Water
325575841.author: a TripAdvisor user
325575841.reviewBody: Balandra is amazing!  It is a small inlet cove. The water is always no deeper than about 3 feet. This is a wonderful and safe place for small children to enjoy the ocean. You look down through the clear water and see your feet. This is the clearest and calmest beach I have ever visited.

325105866.name: simply paradise
325105866.author: a TripAdvisor user
325105866.reviewBody: Balandra Beach is a beautiful lagoon, sandy bottom and shallow. Take a lunch, drinks, floaties and anything you would use at any other beach, there is no restaurants or services here. It was expensive to take a cab here, 50-60$ so if you do go spend the whole day. We noticed 5 other beaches on the way there and all really quiet, will be checking out next time.

325072280.name: Beautiful beach - can be crowded...
325072280.author: a TripAdvisor user
325072280.reviewBody: We came during a holiday so not sure what to expect midweek.  The beach itself is nice, very close parking is available and the water in the bay stays shallow for a very long time which is good for little ones and those that like to wade.  (Do the stingray shuffle as always...)\n\nIt\'s fairly protected form the elements so even on a windy day, Ballandra is calm and inviting.

324305898.name: Worth the drive
324305898.author: a TripAdvisor user
324305898.reviewBody: Jsut go there and see for yourself!,\nWell worth the drive\nTake chairs, umbrella, water toys, snacks and beverages no real services there  but spectacular

322775302.name: Perfect
322775302.author: a TripAdvisor user
322775302.reviewBody: Such a quiet lovely beach, bring food and beware of the jellyfish! I got stung on Playa Tecolote the next beach along and then had to pay a Mexican guy for what he said was medicine but actually was vinegar!

322072751.name: A little piece of heaven.
322072751.author: a TripAdvisor user
322072751.reviewBody: This is not a large beach, but its just great, there are no restaurants or services, because it is not allowed. Bring anything your need and collect your disposals.

318941631.name: FANTASTIC VIEWS, GREAT BEACH
318941631.author: a TripAdvisor user
318941631.reviewBody: easy access by bus from the Terminal in La pAz (80 Pesos) . I climbed the little hill to have the view on Balandra becah and it is awesome.  very quiet and shallow water so suitable for childrren. There is a lttle truck selling water, sodas, snacks etc.....

318835021.name: On our way to San Diego
318835021.author: a TripAdvisor user
318835021.reviewBody: This is a beautiful Beach only 20 minutes from the center of La Paz, the sand is white and the water very clear, nice place to spend a day

318136222.name: Best swimming Beach
318136222.author: a TripAdvisor user
318136222.reviewBody: Be prepared to spend the day at this beautiful lagoon beach, because you won\'t want to leave. It is quiet and peaceful with sparkling blue waters only waist high. I recommend bringing a lunch and snorkeling gear. Also I suggest a small waterproof\nbag for your car keys. Once you enter the water you will not want to get out.  Swim all the way across to the other shore\nwhere you can have the entire beach to yourself or swim along the rock cliffs and take a break under the rock "ceilings" that have formed. Simply stunning!

316168413.name: Favorite Beach in Mexico
316168413.author: a TripAdvisor user
316168413.reviewBody: Clear water, only about chest high, more of a \'local\' beach.  220 pesos (about $12 US) for an umbrella and 2 loungers for the day.  We spent a week in La Paz and ended up here 4 times.  Guys who run the rentals are first class - my husband and i forgot our fins.  We came back the next day and they kept them for us.  Low key, perfect beach and we will return!

316153519.name: Breathtaking
316153519.author: a TripAdvisor user
316153519.reviewBody: We came into this beach by boat and were struck by the color of the water and sand. Interesting mangroves along the east part of the bay. We found good snorkeling in the rocky areas on either side of the south end of the bay. Warm wonderful water at summer\'s end. Beware the stingrays!

316121397.name: Best beaches in the world
316121397.author: a TripAdvisor user
316121397.reviewBody: One of the best beaches in the world should be visited by everyone who goes to La Paz,  another amazing place to visit on Mexico

315937634.name: A walk on the soft side!
315937634.author: a TripAdvisor user
315937634.reviewBody: amazing a must for any travelling to the Baja. A base at Costa Baja resort and spa was perfect. Walk out into warm waters chest high with soft sand  and dazzling views

311699265.name: Iconic beach
311699265.author: a TripAdvisor user
311699265.reviewBody: Simply an amazing beach, When we were there nivea was shooting a suntan lotion commercial and very kindly asked us to move out of their shot as we were so white! Very funny, and gives you an idea of how beautiful it is without overtly pale people hurting your eyes.

311683477.name: Balandra
311683477.author: a TripAdvisor user
311683477.reviewBody:
Great Spot for Groups to hang out or on your own. Long white sandy strips where you definitely find a spot to hide away. Some umbrellas are in the beach but if they are taken many shady spots under rocks available. 

Bring your  snorkel gear as there is lots to see around the rocks. :)

But you need to bring your own food and drinks nothing there besides a little store with snacks and rental equipment.

311335132.name: 5,000 star hotel
311335132.author: a TripAdvisor user
311335132.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful beaches in Mexico. I got to camp there with my girlfriend. We where completely alone at night, except for a yacht we could see far away. Ive never seen so many stars in my life. Its like a huge pool, water is only 1.20 deep. You can also do a little hiking around the bay.

309926729.name: Amazing
309926729.author: a TripAdvisor user
309926729.reviewBody: Love going here, we make sure to stop here each time we are in La Paz. Buy a ceviche and pack up the cooler and head out there. Sit back and relax and take in the natural beauty of the area. I sure hope that they don\'t mess this place up with a big development.

309839665.name: A wonderful beach
309839665.author: a TripAdvisor user
309839665.reviewBody: Miles of beach and my family was the only people there!  The garbage I the parking lot was overflowing and that was a bit off putting.  Gorgeous location.

309642099.name: kayaking Balandra Beach
309642099.author: a TripAdvisor user
309642099.reviewBody:
Beautiful, what else is there to say? The water is crystal clear, little fish darting here & there.
The white sand sparkles & the water is warm.
Great place to take the family for the day.
