Take a picnic & some shade & relax on a quiet serene beach.

309264820.name: Beautiful spot.
309264820.author: a TripAdvisor user
309264820.reviewBody: Stayed on a boat in the cove. The water is crystal clear. Great snorkeling and the beach is white sand. Easy to get there by boat or car. Famous photo-op.

309241619.name: Gorgeous
309241619.author: a TripAdvisor user
309241619.reviewBody: Ok. It\'s stunning and the water is insane but I prefer Tecolote in the off season. I like to be waited on and I like waves. In Sept there is nobody on the beach at Tecolote so I enjoyed having the waiter at Senior Marlins full attention. The fish tacos are super fresh and the pinacoladas are giant. There is no food services at Balandra  and no waves. It\'s pretty and peaceful though.

305883315.name: Relaxing and privet
305883315.author: a TripAdvisor user
305883315.reviewBody: Love this place,  you can do some water sports, there is not much shade so get there early so you can  take one of the little palapas.

301844318.name: best beach in the area
301844318.author: a TripAdvisor user
301844318.reviewBody: the best beach in the area, no crowd, some palapas, transparent water, easy to access, close to other good beaches

300643683.name: Family vacation
300643683.author: a TripAdvisor user
300643683.reviewBody: Best beach in La paz for family fun and relaxation. Trust me, you\'ll love it. I first went there with my parents when I was young. Now I brought my kids and they love it too. Just perfect.

296963354.name: Astonishing!
296963354.author: a TripAdvisor user
296963354.reviewBody: We loved Balandra Beach. It was a destination selected from Trip Advisor during an overnight visit to La Paz while in San Jose for a wedding. It\'s currently unspoiled and beautiful but there were some signs nearby suggesting it might be about to be developed. That would be such a pity as the place really is special.

296662272.name: The beach you see in the pictures!
296662272.author: a TripAdvisor user
296662272.reviewBody:
This is definitely one of my favorite beached in La Paz.
It's a beautiful cove-like beach with crystal clear shallow water & smooth silky sand.
If the tide is low enough you can actually cross the water and go to a sand dune where most people can only reach by kayak or boat (even though I personally swam across).

They have palapas and kayaks for rent to explore the sheer beauty that this beach has to offer. Just like any other beach, you have to be careful not to step on a Sting ray, but that goes without saying. There isn't much to see if you if you want to go snorkeling. If you wish to go snorkeling, I recommend renting a kayak and cross the beach to the rocks. It also isn't a scuba diving beach, especially since the deep end is only 30ft and that is outside of Balandra. But if you wish to spend the day with your partner or family while relaxing in paradise, this is the beach for you!

296434714.name: Beautiful beach
296434714.author: a TripAdvisor user
296434714.reviewBody: Most beautiful of the beaches around, no services though. Just bring a soft cooler with some beverages a little sunscreen and you are good to go. beautiful white sand beach, very shallow. You can walk all the way across in certain spots. There is one vendor and you have to go to him to get something, very nice.

296056461.name: One of many beautiful beaches..
296056461.author: a TripAdvisor user
296056461.reviewBody: Beautiful Beach and water. Try to visit during the week less crowded. Try to get out behind the small mountains..

294989512.name: Not what it sounds
294989512.author: a TripAdvisor user
294989512.reviewBody: I went to Balandra Beach when I first arrived in La Paz. I had done a lot of research online and reading the lonely planet travel guide and everyone said it was fantastic... however i found it to be average. i had before been travelling around the Yucatan on the east coast of Mexico and the beaches here are not as dreamy as the ones there but instead appear like a beach on the moon. they\'re interesting but if you\'re searching for bright blue waters don\'t come here. however, the waters are crystal clear but seem a shade of green when looking from afar.

294830546.name: Beautiful, peaceful and a fantastic way to spend the day
294830546.author: a TripAdvisor user
294830546.reviewBody: This beach was lovely but the water was irresistible. We plunked down our gear and expenditures hours in the Sea.

293702398.name: It was OK
293702398.author: a TripAdvisor user
293702398.reviewBody: Definitely not worth a 2.5 hr drive from Cabo. The water is clear and shallow. We got bit/stung by some sort of critters (crab/jellyfish larvae or sea lice) I don\'t know, but that cut our time short at the beach. I have been to many Mexican beaches, so I was unimpressed.

292886867.name: Very quiet place (not in the weekend)
292886867.author: a TripAdvisor user
292886867.reviewBody:
Balandra is a jewel : so nice, so quiet, clear water, white sand.
During the weekend it is a little bit crowded but it is normal so we usually go during normal days. You can choose to lay down on the beach for free or under a palapa paying some money to the owner of the little bar restaurant on the beach.
They dont sell beer so if you prefer that you have to provide by yourself.
You can rent a canoa.
You cant swim in this bay because the level of the water is not enough but you can do snorkeling.
Very good for families with children because it is not dangerous.

292689847.name: La Paz
292689847.author: a TripAdvisor user
292689847.reviewBody: A great city to visit. Very quite actually with many clear water beaches to visit. Snorkeling was pretty at most when you get close to the rocks. My wife was stung by a sting ray at Balandra Beach. That was the only bad part. Otherwise it was great.

291891573.name: if you are in Cabo, consider the 2 hour drive to Balandra
291891573.author: a TripAdvisor user
291891573.reviewBody: The beach here is special-it is a beautiful aqua color and it is no more than waist deep across the entire cove.  On your way to the main beach you will spot two or three beaches.  Don\'t get lured in-Google it and drive the extra ten minutes to the main beach-it will be worth it.  They rent umbrellas, chairs and kayaks.  But, they don\'t have food, so bring a cooler.

291623998.name: Amazing!
291623998.author: a TripAdvisor user
291623998.reviewBody: We went on a Sunday and arrived by 8:30am. Within one hour every palapa was taken. There is a truck with tourist rentals and plenty of people selling everything from Clamato ceviche freshly made, to mangos.  The beach was full of local families.  The water was crystal clear with soft white sand.  A true gem.

291615542.name: Great beach
291615542.author: a TripAdvisor user
291615542.reviewBody: We heard about this beach from several locals and finally decided to go check it out. WOW, glad we did! The water was crystal clear, calm and it looked like we were in the Caribbean. We heard this place could get crowded but we got there early and during the week so it was not too bad. Would highly recommend this beach, very beautiful.

291451421.name: Beautful Beach!
291451421.author: a TripAdvisor user
291451421.reviewBody: We stopped here on our way to Tecolote Beach. Balandra is beautiful and was quieter, too. It feels more like a lake surrounded by mountains. Not much else here as far as food and entertainment. There was a stand with snacks and a cart selling fresh fruit. It\'s just beautiful here!

290583549.name: Worth the travel to an amazing beach!
290583549.author: a TripAdvisor user
290583549.reviewBody: We stayed in Cabo San Lucas but was bored after a few days at our resort. After a reading a few reviews of other things to do outside of Cabo San Lucas, we decided two rent two vans to take our group outside of Cabo San Lucas. We hired a guide who we met through a previous excursion. He was kind enough to guide us through the city streets of Cabo San Lucas to our final destination of Balandra Beach in La Paz. It took us about 2.5 hrs to arrive at our destination. The drive was fairly easy; however certain parts of the city streets were hard to navigate and we certainly would have gotten lost if we did not have a guide. The beach was amazing! You could go halfway out to the middle of the bay and the water was still only was high. The area does not have a lot of shade so bring umbrellas and a lot of sunscreen. There are a few public umbrellas that you can use but they get taken up fast. When we went, there were some guys there who setup umbrellas, tables and chairs. They rented to us (after some negotiations) for $16 for a set of umbrellas and chairs. Take a water proof camera to take some awesome pictues. Also take along food, water and snacks as areas to get food is sparse. The only place to get food was a bit expensive because he was the only peddler there. Waves were very mild so I definitely recommend this beach if you have little kids. However, as stated before, the drive from Cabo San Lucas to here is a bit long. If you have the time and patience, this beach is worth the drive!

289551025.name: Go Early!!!
289551025.author: a TripAdvisor user
289551025.reviewBody: What an awesome experience. Great beach and fantastic views. Spent the day wading and swimming in the shallow crystal clear water.. Lots of fish and sea life. Go early, it got super busy in the afternoon.

288229780.name: Early Morning Sunrise Swim
288229780.author: a TripAdvisor user
288229780.reviewBody: Very clear calm water. Great for long lap swimming. A large open space and especially relaxing when not too crowded. A must see lagoon when in La Paz !

288170462.name: Great hidden swimming area
288170462.author: a TripAdvisor user
288170462.reviewBody: We drove up from Cabo in a rental car. The cove was beautiful and well worth the experience. Stay on Hwy 1 north of Las Paz. You will see this are to the west. If you pass it, Hwy 1 ends about a mile to the north at another swimming destination. Balandra was perfect for kids because it is shallow for 100\'s of feed from the shore.

286968707.name: Getting popular
286968707.author: a TripAdvisor user
286968707.reviewBody: Lots of folks on vacation now, many picnicking at Balandra. Solitude no longer on the menu. \nInversely, there is now a guy who sets up umbrellas and tables to rent for approx $18.  \nGreat to go wading- walk all the way out in waist deep water. Please respect the peace and don\'t bring noisy kids or frisbees and such. Anything above a whisper bounces off the rock walls and makes a beautiful sanctuary into a hassle.  Some food/drink for sale and some trinkets and hats.

283693341.name: beautiful
283693341.author: a TripAdvisor user
283693341.reviewBody: pros- clear water, no waves, wrap around beach.\ncons - VERY shallow, long ways from shore to 5\' deep water, few services, limited parking

282895841.name: A MUST DO!
282895841.author: a TripAdvisor user
282895841.reviewBody: Our concierge in Cabo recommended this beach.  We drove from Cabo to here in about 2 hours and it was well worth it.  Really out of the way beach but absolutely beautiful, even better than most beaches in the Caribbean. Not much here though, some guy selling food out of a truck and kayak rentals.  No facilities. Water is very shallow, only gets to about 3 feet way out so don\'t plan on snorkeling, just do and relax!

282737344.name: Beautiful, serene one-of-a- kind beach
282737344.author: a TripAdvisor user
282737344.reviewBody: This beach is about 30 minutes away from downtown La Paz.  It is incredibly beautiful and special.  You practically walk in the sea, the water is really shallow.  It is a small enclave surrounded by monoliths that seemed to be underwater many many years ago.  A truly rare sight, the seawater is clear, the sand is white and it contrasts with the rock hills and the barren  desert  look around it.\nThere are no services in this beach so it is a good idea to take a cooler with something to drink and snacks.

282518896.name: Wow,  what a beautiful beach
282518896.author: a TripAdvisor user
282518896.reviewBody: Stopped there for a couple of hours, we\'re impressed at the place, very clean, open to the public, water is nice and clear,  just covers your knees and there are no waves, ideal for small children, it is a must visit beach when in La Paz

280639580.name: Balandra Bay Bliss
280639580.author: a TripAdvisor user
280639580.reviewBody: About 20 minutes from La Paz...this is the one can\'t miss beach in the La Paz area.  During our trip (June 6-13) 2015....the place was uncrowded...there is one local vendor who rents kayaks, paddleboards, beach chairs...etc....but that is it.  There are several palapa\'s you can use for free which offer some shade and a place to hang your backpack and keep you cooler out of the sun.  The large beautiful blue/green bay is shallow in most parts and you can walk the nearly 1/2 mile to the other side by just zig zagging and staying out of the deeper blue water.  We visited this beach 4 times during our stay and could have spent a couple of hours everyday.  Just a couple minutes up the road from here is Tecolote Beach...also beautiful with several restaurants and boats for excursions out to Isla Espiritu Santos....and trip you should not miss.  Only $50 per person...you will visit a pirate cave....snorkel with sea lions and pull up to a beautiful beach for ceviche lunch.  Beer comes in the price of this trip.  You can also get to this Isla from the Malecon in La Paz but the cost is double and the ride out 2 hours each way vs. 50 minutes from Tecolote.  We used Azul tours but there are other options on this beach.   ENJOY!

277818854.name: Gorgeous Beach
277818854.author: a TripAdvisor user
277818854.reviewBody: Beautiful beach. White sand, turquoise water, good fishing. Depending on tide/weather conditions, snorkeling is good around the area. No services at the beach and it can be crowded especially on the weekends.

277545106.name: My fav swimming hole.
277545106.author: a TripAdvisor user
277545106.reviewBody: Balandra beach is my fav place to swim. We love to stop by on our way in from a long day of fishing. The crystal clear water energizes you the second you get in. Go by boat or by car, but go!

277468879.name: Beutiful and not busy
277468879.author: a TripAdvisor user
277468879.reviewBody: This beach is amazing.  The water is clear and you can basically walk all around. I\'ve been in balandra several times and I never get tired of it. Beautiful

277096858.name: White sand beach
277096858.author: a TripAdvisor user
277096858.reviewBody: Beautiful white sandy beach with palapas.  Twenty minutes or so from LaPaz.  Deepest part is chest high, can see some fish near rocky outcropping\'s.  Shuffle your feet as your walking through the water after it rain\'s due to the fact the Stingray\'s hang out buried in the sand to warm up.  Take vinegar in case you get stung.  went to Balandra beach three times and didn\'t see any Stingray\'s, just Manta\'s and flying fish and Angel fish.  Wonderful place not to be missed.

275090652.name: MUST GO
275090652.author: a TripAdvisor user
275090652.reviewBody: Just a 25-minute (or so) drive from La Paz, and well worth it. Such a calm little spot. Great for kids or folks who just want to chill in water. Very beautiful area, great for photos!

274897153.name: another wonder of the world
274897153.author: a TripAdvisor user
274897153.reviewBody: Great day at pristine beaches, coves and unique rock formations. You can drive there or even take a brief stop while boating around. Either way one of the world\'s best beaches.

274840506.name: Snorkeling perfection
274840506.author: a TripAdvisor user
274840506.reviewBody: This is a beautiful area to just walk around and snorkel.  Close enough to town to make it an easy drive.

273468396.name: Beautiful jewel.
273468396.author: a TripAdvisor user
273468396.reviewBody: This lagoon was very quaint and beautiful. Not very many people which made it very relaxing. The water was warm and clear. We were staying near Cabo San Lucas so it was a drive but well worth it. We will definitely make this one of our stops the next time we vacation to Cabo!!\nBring drinks and snacks because it is away from La Paz or any convenient stores.

271674390.name: Paradise
271674390.author: a TripAdvisor user
271674390.reviewBody: I had heard it was amazing, but was beyond my expectations.  A truly beautiful beach and a must when visiting Baja California Sur.  I would only recommend going well equipped with your beach gear and a cooler with refreshments for there is not much available there!

271534560.name: Gorgeous beach
271534560.author: a TripAdvisor user
271534560.reviewBody: Balandra is picture-perfect, like those ads you see of white sand beaches with someone drinking a cocktail while staring out over the turquoise water. Be sure to walk to the iconic "mushroom rock" that\'s on all the La Paz brochures. (And try not to notice the rusting re-bar and cement holding it up!)

270479616.name: My favorite beach
270479616.author: a TripAdvisor user
270479616.reviewBody: My favorite beach in La Paz.  Quiet, beautiful crystal blue waters on a quiet beach. A great way to spend a lazy afternoon.

270162125.name: Most Beautiful Water in Baja
270162125.author: a TripAdvisor user
270162125.reviewBody:
We just spent an amazing day at Balandras. The water rivals anywhere in the world- as good, if not better than Bora Bora, Turks, anywhere in the Caribbean, etc. 
One of the unique features that makes it great for kids and exploring, is the depth: it is only about 6 inches to 3 feet deep for hundreds of meters. so wonderful. we played football, went hiking, kayaking, paddle boarding, etc. 
There are some palapas provided, but get there early, or bring your own umbrella. There is also a place to rent water sports equipment and buy snacks. 
We will definitely be making this a new destination!

269141142.name: Our New Favorite Beach
269141142.author: a TripAdvisor user
269141142.reviewBody: This unusual beach is in a large bay that on average is less than knee deep. There are some shelters from the sun and a guy sells some snacks from a truck, but otherwise the place is pretty abandoned. You an walk around points to the left or right and find a completely secluded spot quite easily.

269047201.name: A Beautiful Gem that even Hollywood could not create
269047201.author: a TripAdvisor user
269047201.reviewBody:
Continue  on the road past the ferry terminal complex at Pinchilingue and you will drive past other small coves with beautiful waters and beaches. Towards the end of the road bear left at a Y junction to go to Ballandra. (Bear right to go to Tecolote).

The waters are incredible shades of green, turquoise and blues. The bay is quite sheltered from the open sea so is very calm and you can walk out quite a distance. There are very limited facilities with a small shop renting out beach gear. But the beauty will make you stay.

Bear to the right on the beach to follow the hillside against the shore. There you will see beautifully eroded boulders in shapes of mushrooms and more small sandy retreats. 

To snorkel you will need to find the darkest water which is about a mile out, but you can wade most of the way there!

Worth a trip by itself, buy you can continue on to Tecolote Beach which nearby for more of an experience on a beach open to the sea. There you will find restaurants, etc. and another view of the beautiful Sea of Cortes.

267565598.name: great beach
267565598.author: a TripAdvisor user
267565598.reviewBody: It\'s hard to believe how quiet this beach was, considering how pristine it also was and close to La Paz.  You can rent a kayak from a local vendor here for about 8$/ hr and kayak to some of the other small beaches in the lagoon, which were COMPLETELY deserted.  Pure romance and relaxation.

267554536.name: Kayak in Balandra
267554536.author: a TripAdvisor user
267554536.reviewBody:
Balandra is such a beautiful place.  The water is crystal clear, warm, calm and only goes maybe waist deep.

I've always felt too cautious of the sting rays which makes it overwhelming and can't really relax or enjoy Balandra to the fullest.  So this time we opted for renting kayaks.  We paid $200 pesos an hour for a 2 seater and kayaked to the famous mushroom rock.

On our way we spotted a sting ray gently swimming near our kayak and seemed to follow us.  I enjoyed the beach from the safety of the kayak.  I saw the pelicans dive to catch the fish.  We beached our kayaks on a secluded beach and ate our lunch their.  Can't get any better than that!

There was other families and kids playing in the water with no care.  Maybe I was being too paranoid over the sting rays, but was thankful we made it out without any problems.

265927983.name: Wow
265927983.author: a TripAdvisor user
265927983.reviewBody: And yes you can walk across the entire cove with out getting your waist wet. This is a protected area by the Mexican Government and when you explore make sure you walk around .....all the way around to find the stones shaped by mother nature and her ocean.

265276933.name: Get there early to get the most out of this hidden gem!
265276933.author: a TripAdvisor user
265276933.reviewBody:
This picturesque beach is situated about 20 minutes north of the city of La Paz and features clear to turquoise water that when we visited was only about hip-deep at its deepest points. You can access the rest of the Sea of Cortez if you exit the bay and the water there is also very calm but deeper. 

There were no working facilities when we visited, though a line of portable toilets was on the premises (they were closed). Vendors here rent umbrellas, but if you are lucky, you can use one of the 9 or so that are free and part of the beach. You can buy snacks here and rent kayaks, which seem unnecessary given the shallow depth of the water. Don't plan on snorkeling (diving isn't even an option!) since there is nothing to see but the beautiful white sand below (and all these suspicious-looking grey coiled mounds). 

This beach is a hidden gem and off the beaten path, but after about 2pm was transformed into a loud, touristy destination rather than the more peaceful getaway we experienced during the morning. The tide lowers throughout the afternoon until the water becomes knee-high at its deepest, so definitely visit early in the morning to get a shady umbrella, a tourist-free view, and water worth putting your bathing suit on for.

264880611.name: Amazing but beware
264880611.author: a TripAdvisor user
264880611.reviewBody: This beach is paradise, we have been there before to visit the famous mushroom many times by boat, but this time we went there by car and visited the place, everyone there was very happy, paddle boarding, walking around, we all got into the sea, since it is not very deep and the water reaches your knees, we felt very comfortable about it, we visited the mushroom and in here you better take this special shoes to walk on rocks if not you will have a difficult time getting there, on our way back to our place, a friend got stung by a small sting ray and she bled a lot, fortunately the marines were there and she got first aids by them immediately, they said that she has been lucky because the sting ray didn\'t sting her completely, they said that it happens like everyday, I wish there were signs warning people about it, and also warning people of how dangerous is to walk there even if it is not deep, the previous day someone died due to a whole on the bay or something. Besides that isuggest you visit balandra by boat, and i you do it by land be ultra super dangerous please! It is worth to be here, it will leave you breathless, but as always we must respect mother nature!

264322993.name: Absolutely beautiful
264322993.author: a TripAdvisor user
264322993.reviewBody: What a beautiful beach - water crystal clear and you can walk across in low tide.  Fun to watch the pelicans dive for fish.

263480009.name: Paradise
263480009.author: a TripAdvisor user
263480009.reviewBody: Wowzers.   This beach is gorgeous.   Not a stingray in sight when we went.   We rented paddle boards for 10$ per hour from the stand at the beach. It\'s a perfect place to paddle \nNever wanted to leave \nBring water and snacks and stay for the day

263166559.name: Beautiful turquoise water
263166559.author: a TripAdvisor user
263166559.reviewBody: The day we visited the beach there were no bathroom facilities that we could find which necessitated us to leave early.  The water had a beautiful turquoise hue and we were able to walk all the way across the beach.

263074546.name: Lovely, quiet spot
263074546.author: a TripAdvisor user
263074546.reviewBody: Beautiful, quiet beach with interesting topography. There\'s great wading and lounging in warm water Don\'t plan on snorkeling--there\'s no reef.  The craziness is mostly confined to Tecolote, which is down the road.

262051870.name: The kind of beach you dream about
262051870.author: a TripAdvisor user
262051870.reviewBody: We spent most of one day here just relaxing and wading around in the water. It was getting to be low tide so the water was mostly knee deep but the water was crystal clear. We could see so many puffer fish and smaller "bait fish" swimming everywhere. The sand was powdery and pure white. Beautiful rock formations ring the beaches. It was gorgeous.  There are a few palapas to get some shade and a small souvenir / food truck. Otherwise no facilities.

261966705.name: One of the most beautiful settings I\'ve ever seen.
261966705.author: a TripAdvisor user
261966705.reviewBody: Take a boat there or drive. Not far from downtown La Paz. Turquoise blue water, super soft white sand beaches. Sea birds galore.

261059461.name: Clear shallow water
261059461.author: a TripAdvisor user
261059461.reviewBody: Great beach, white sand, crystalline shallow water, so clear you can see the fish swimming everywhere. And apparently so can the various birds there as the dive in from high to eat their fill. \nThe "balandra" the famous mushroom shaped rock is all the way to the right add you stand on the beach and gave the ocean\nHighly recommend this beach

260758380.name: Very interesting place...not a lie on the beach place tho
260758380.author: a TripAdvisor user
260758380.reviewBody: This is a huge bay that is really shallow (4\' deep at its deepest) Everyone there tells you to shuffle your feet when you walk to avoid being stung but this felt way over emphasized as all it did was make older ones in our group scared to go in the water. We searched and didn\'t see a single sting ray or even a hint of there presence. One of the highlights is the dive bombing Pelicans as this is a perfect spot for them. The water is so shallow and clear that they can see the fish from high up and they continually dive from 100\' high and it\'s quite the scene. There were lots of wasps and flies if you just wanted to lie on the beach, so bring bug spray. The mushroom rock was interesting as was the rock formation (continue walking to the right and you will see it)\nThe other beach down the road had restaurants if you want that.

260524418.name: Beautiful local beach
260524418.author: a TripAdvisor user
260524418.reviewBody:
Well worth getting the mini bus from town and going to this stunning lagoon type beach
Full of locals-just one small snack stand-knacks for rent 
Very shallow-can wade for miles or swim -if you sit near the rocks the shades free-or you can hire a brolly and sun bed but it's a very simple family beach
Loved it

260339511.name: It was like walking on water
260339511.author: a TripAdvisor user
260339511.reviewBody: Look, I\'ve never actually walked on water but this is as close as it gets. The beach is WONDERFUL because it is shallow for a mile or two out and you just explore the rock formations. Driving the coast in La Paz is like a newly discovered PCH and it is just as sophisticated with a fraction of the people. We went as part of a 21 day road trip based on Cabo San Lucas and after driving up, walking on water, swimming with the whale sharks and going to a museum, my wife and I had a memorable experience we will always want to repeat.

260015790.name: Beautiful place
260015790.author: a TripAdvisor user
260015790.reviewBody: This is a fantastic beach, especially for children.  You can wade and wade and wade in the clear blue water.  The only down side is that it is quite popular and if you prefer solitude (I do), then you might want to just make it a short visit.

259656319.name: It Truly is Beautiful!
259656319.author: a TripAdvisor user
259656319.reviewBody: At low tide, Balandra Beach is pretty much a huge wading area that\'s beautifully scenic.  There\'s a lot of interesting geology around the site, in addition to beautiful white sand.  Paved parking is a nice addition, although the lack of restrooms is problematical.  At one end of the parking lot is a vendor from whom you can rent SUP and sit-on-top kayaks.  At any beach in the area, it\'s important to realize that sting and other species of rays may be present, so wearing shoes and shuffling ones feet while wading are advised.  The famous mushroom rock is located on the second peninsula to the right as you face the water at the parking area.

258276226.name: A perfect day at the beach
258276226.author: a TripAdvisor user
258276226.reviewBody: Balandra is a very pretty sandy beach, well protected from the surge. A bit of a long walk to the water if the tide is very low - otherwise a perfect beach to go kayaking or simply enjoy the shallow water. The rock formations surrounding the beach at two sides provide a very beautiful backdrop.

257678076.name: I fell asleep on my kayak in paradise.
257678076.author: a TripAdvisor user
257678076.reviewBody: Balandra was a dream when I saw photos.  Turns out it REALLY looks like that in person.  It\'s one of my all time favorite beaches in the world, especially early in the morning. You can drive there easily, park in the lot and rent a kayak from a man right there on the beach.  Slip into the water and enjoy the amazing water, always clear right to the bottom. It\'s so perfectly calm, warm and enticing.  The only detail you must remember at this beach, and most in Mexico, is to SHUFFLE YOUR FEET when you\'re on the sand.  There are rays - and they will sting you.  But if you always shuffle and pay attention, you\'ll be just fine.  If you do get stung, everyone local knows exactly what to do.  It\'ll hurt and be an inconvenience, but you\'ll recover and have a great story to tell.  Better to just shuffle though. Enjoy mushroom rock and get a glimpse of the boats anchored all around.  Can\'t wait to go back!

257489709.name: A little bit of paradise
257489709.author: a TripAdvisor user
257489709.reviewBody: Clear and not too deep for children.  A protected cove for the whole family to enjoy.\nCaution for baby manta rays so shuffle your feet when in the water.  No public bathrooms available.

256389431.name: Incredible Beach experience
256389431.author: a TripAdvisor user
256389431.reviewBody: Best beach experience you will have- just don\'t sit on a stingray !  Picturesque scenery. Don\'t be afraid to walk around the corner to the other bay for even better scenery.

256077222.name: Gorgeous beach
256077222.author: a TripAdvisor user
256077222.reviewBody: What a great way to spend a day! Crystal clear water that is knee high for most of it and if you make to waist deep you have gone out in the water a long way! A very quiet beach - don\'t just stay by the palapas, there is so much more. We snorkeled and swam and just enjoyed the sun. The was a small food cart/truck that sold bags of chips and a few beverages, but we packed a cooler with a picnic lunch and a few creveza\'s. No public bathrooms and not too many amenities, which is probably why it isn\'t a very busy place. highly recommend visiting this beach if you are in the area. The "mushroom rock" is pretty cool!

255695957.name: Most beautiful beach
255695957.author: a TripAdvisor user
255695957.reviewBody: So beautiful. Sandy beach. Shallow warm water. So calm. So quiet. Great place to paddle board. Bring your own food, water, shade and chair.

255262027.name: Pictures don\'t do it justice
255262027.author: a TripAdvisor user
255262027.reviewBody: Even though we saw pictures before we visited Balandra, we were enraptured by it\'s beauty and visited 3 different times in our week. We walked out far on the sand bars, climbed the path to look over the whole bay, and watched the sunset from the water. Another must see when you\'re in La Paz.

254715153.name: Stunning!
254715153.author: a TripAdvisor user
254715153.reviewBody: The best beach in La Paz, beautiful turquoise water and nice sand with no stones. There are palapas for shade. There is a small concession stand that also sells tours. It could use a porta potty but is otherwise perfect.

253735183.name: a La Paz gem
253735183.author: a TripAdvisor user
253735183.reviewBody: a beautiful place to spend the afternoon with a nice drive...keep the mega resorts away please.. nice sand,clear water,take some cool ones and relax

253400790.name: Balandra Beach
253400790.author: a TripAdvisor user
253400790.reviewBody: Here the tide shifts  so dramatically that you can actually wade across the entire bay if you time it right. Really fun for a day\'s enjoyment!

252889665.name: Neat for wading
252889665.author: a TripAdvisor user
252889665.reviewBody: Interesting beach...white sand and very shallow waters with black volcanic sharp rocks. Don\'t count on being able to swim. The water was only shin-high for us at low tide. If wading, watch for cute little puffer fish and poisonous rock fish. The beach has a concession where you can rent beach chairs, umbrellas and purchase snacks at a premium price. Overall it was not really worth the drive out there but the drive itself was pretty nice. Keep right at the ferry terminal to get around any traffic that is loading on to the ferry, then turn right at the intersection.

252671408.name: Not exactly what I was looking for, but it was pretty
252671408.author: a TripAdvisor user
252671408.reviewBody: We had just come from the Tecolote beach, and it was everything i love in a beach.  Balandra had beautiful water, and at low tide it is easy to get around to some outer sand bars. It would not be my cup of tea if it were crowded.

252333821.name: The best beach in La Paz
252333821.author: a TripAdvisor user
252333821.reviewBody: This is by far the best beach we have visited, incomparable to the 7 miles stretch in Cayman, not even close to the Florida Beaches or  the North and South Carolina beaches , the sand so soft  and  it is just so amazingly like paradise. I will definitely consider this location as one of my best beaches to visit over and over again.

251731556.name: This must be what paradise is like.
251731556.author: a TripAdvisor user
251731556.reviewBody: I have traveled around the world and this is my favorite beach by far. The sand is actually fluffy, I don\'t know how else to describe it. The water is knee deep for a very long way out and is crystal clear. If you come to La Paz and don\'t see this beach I would want to know why you came to La Paz. There may be a couple of itinerant sales people wandering around but not many. Bring your own umbrella if you want shade because this beach is not developed but all you really need is a hat. This isn\'t the place to come if you just want to lie on the beach, get out in the water and enjoy yourself. If you get hungry Tecolate with it\'s restaurants is only a couple of kilometers away. The only thing to worry about is sleeping sting rays who, for some unknown reason, object to be stepped on. Learn to walk with the "Baja Shuffle" when you are in the water which means slid your feet across the bottom to warn them to take off. The only time you will be bothered by them is if the beach is empty, which it is quite often on week days, or if you walk through the water across the bay to one of the other beaches which are inevitably deserted. The only other thing I can say is I have no idea why this is listed as "Balandra, Walmart Lapaz, La Paz". It certainly has absolutely nothing to do with Walmart.

251716829.name: Highlight of La Paz
251716829.author: a TripAdvisor user
251716829.reviewBody: Even though we visited this cove in January, it was still by far the highlight of my trip to La Paz. The drive to this cove itself is pretty scenic, with cactus forests and hills surrounding. This cove has a pretty serene beach with white sand and flat water. It is far away from all other settlements and hope that it gets preserved as it is. It is a great destination for swimming, hiking around or just chilling on the beach.

251664124.name: Favorite beach near La Paz
251664124.author: a TripAdvisor user
251664124.reviewBody: This by far was the nicest beach. It was on the warmer side than the others I hopped to. If the locals prefer it then it must be good, right? Lots of room for parking. The neat thing about this beach is its surrounded by cliffs and when the tide goes out, you can walk across to another beach!

251340390.name: Worth seeing
251340390.author: a TripAdvisor user
251340390.reviewBody: Beautiful! I\'ve visited twice. The water was knee deep one time and the other time, the bay was pretty empty of water. The water is clear and the beach is really nice. When the tide was out, we walked out to mushroom rock. There is kayaking available for a fee. Usually, there is a vendor selling snacks.

251240913.name: Beautiful daytrip but can get very crowdy
251240913.author: a TripAdvisor user
251240913.reviewBody:
Drive here from La Paz, or take a bus. Come early as there are only a dozen palapa's (umbrellas) for shade. Shop available for buying drinks etc and renting kayaks. Pretty expensive rentals though, especially since I wouldn't know where you'd kayak to (except maybe the other side of the beach for solitary, but remember there's no shade there...) 

Especially on weekends it can get crowdy, as the locals come with their entire family and build a tiny village under their umbrella, complete with BBQ and music... 

But still: it has white sandy beaches and crystal blue water, which can't be said from La Paz itself, so it's worth the drive... 
Snorkeling isn't worth the while, hardly any fish to see in the bay itself.

250858508.name: Beautiful, truly virgin beach in La Paz
250858508.author: a TripAdvisor user
250858508.reviewBody:
There are many beautiful beaches all over the world. Sadly, many of them are victims of their own beauty with scores of people visiting, many restaurants, businesses and people selling tacky items lining their shores. Such is not the case with Balandra. Balandra is a truly virgin beach with essentially no facilities. Perhaps that is why it has been able to keep its beauty. 

Balandra is a bit out of the way, about 40 minutes north of La Paz, the capital of the State of Baja California Sur. There are taxis that can get you there, but perhaps the best way to get to Balandra is by sea. You can rent a water taxi that can first take you to swim with the whale sharks - they are harmless and yes, you can get extremely close to them (you can touch, but they are shy and they dive deep if you get too close or touch). Then just cruise through the bay north towards Balandra. On the way, you will see a little light house that is now home to several sea lions, and finally reach the Balandra Beach. 

There is in fact not just one beach, but several beaches around the Balandra Bay. As mentioned above, there are no facilities so these are truly virgin beaches. The water is very shallow and soft sand for a long while - this is both good and bad. It is great for little kids, though you do not get much swimming, rather wading. The sand is also good and band - it is of course soft, but because there are no rocks (except on the edges of the beach - more on this below), there are typically few or no fish. So much of the beach area is not good for snorkeling. However, as you get to the edges of the beaches, there are some rocky areas where you can find some decent (though not great) snorkeling.

I should also mention an unusual rock formation on one of the Balandra beaches, the one locals refer to as the mushroom rock. The naming is well-justified, the rock looks like a mushroom, though a mushroom cloud is probably a better description. In the town, you will see pictures of this rock all over the place - this rock is a rock star in La Paz (pun intended). From the pictures, it appears that this rock is some huge, majestic, awe inspiring colossus. Yet, we you arrive there, the 5-feet rock greets you rather unceremoniously, a rather anti-climactic experience. Nevertheless, it makes some interesting photography subject,.

Overall, this is a very enjoyable part of La Paz. It is perfect for romantic couples, as you will find lots of space to yourself (and, yes, we did see some couples, who - shall we say - got carried away with the romanticism mixed with  hormones, leading to you know what!). It is also great for families with small kids as the water is shallow and the sand is soft.

250669811.name: Beautiful like the pictures
250669811.author: a TripAdvisor user
250669811.reviewBody: A bit chilly in January but exquisitely beautiful. I\'d recommend walking the beach, away from the crowds and find a nice rock and private sandy beach of your own. It does get crowded but it\'s a big, clear wading pool in a orotected cove with nothing but soft sand under your feet and calm water. We walked across the entire cove. Nice to see the sail boats outside in the deeper water and there is snorkeling along the shore amidst the rocks. Sit down, put your mask on and look at your own private salt water aquarium.

249949777.name: Perfect for little kids
249949777.author: a TripAdvisor user
249949777.reviewBody: Our son is 3, and he loves the beach and the ocean.  We live in Cabo and the waves are a little too big to let him run around on the shore, but at Balandra he can.  Since the water is only waist high for him, he can have a great time without having to hold my hand.

249056334.name: GREAT VIEW
249056334.author: a TripAdvisor user
249056334.reviewBody: If you dont get to this beach and are in the area, you are missing out. The sand is so "fluffy" and you an climb up a hill and look down on the whole bay. I can see why this a top 10 beach in the world.

248933192.name: Dreamy ..great ..like Long Beach Vancouver Island
248933192.author: a TripAdvisor user
248933192.reviewBody: Beaches here in January are unpopulated, and so peaceful and the water is so warm..sand here at this beach is great.

248855946.name: Beautiful Beach
248855946.author: a TripAdvisor user
248855946.reviewBody:
Gorgeous beach. Get there by bus from the Aguila terminal on Malecon. $83 pesos per person each way. Transport is in a shuttle van (Baja Eco). 

Walk around to the west to see the underwhelming mushroom rock, the beach here is quieter and nicer and you can walk up the bluffs for a view. 

Water is shallow but if you go far enough you can swim or snorkel. 

Vendors hire kayaks and stand up paddle boards and there is a truck selling drinks and food.

247944576.name: Lovely setting
247944576.author: a TripAdvisor user
247944576.reviewBody: Beautiful crystal clear water and gorgeous surroundings.  Unfortunately. very shallow with little underwater life.

247901054.name: Close to the perfect beach
247901054.author: a TripAdvisor user
247901054.reviewBody:
The only thing missing from this perfection is bathrooms and food. 

You do have to drive a ways out of town for this one, but it's worth the drive. It's a small beach so you could easily drive by it if you're not paying attention.

It's a beautiful cove, quiet, clear shallow water. Perfect for SUP. 

The is a vendor there with kayaks and paddle boards. This would be the easiest beach to learn SUP!

It would also be a great family beach with the clear shallow water.

247863790.name: great beach you can walk thru
247863790.author: a TripAdvisor user
247863790.reviewBody: this beach is very pretty due to atmospherical reasons the tide goes down so  you can literally walk for almost an hour and water will reach up to your knees. not for swimming but I saw many couples in kayak.

247622989.name: My Favorite Beach
247622989.author: a TripAdvisor user
247622989.reviewBody: I love beaches and seek out the beaches where ever I go.  I have travelled from Maine to Florida and British Colombia to Cabo San Lucas.  I have found many nice beaches but Balandra Beach has the white sand with turquoise colored water.  It is a beautiful beach and if you go out a ways you can actually swim.  I love this beach and it is one of my all time favorites.

247389758.name: Balandra Beach
247389758.author: a TripAdvisor user
247389758.reviewBody: Beautiful white sand beach. The water is warm,and as you get further out has pretty good snorkeling.

247103891.name: Big bath tub........
247103891.author: a TripAdvisor user
247103891.reviewBody: Beautiful white sand beach. The water is warm, reaching only calf high, clean soft bottom. Great spot for little ones to play, no waves. Can explore by foot or kayak to next bay over. Facilities not available here, which is a shame. There is a vendor with kayaks and SUPs, and seemed to have food/drink available later in the day.

246809915.name: A must
246809915.author: a TripAdvisor user
246809915.reviewBody: This is a virgin beach with beautiful turquoise waters. You can walk a long way and the water will cover only your feet. Take water, snacks and towels. You can rent an umbrella and kayaks but that is it.

246703798.name: Picture Perfect
246703798.author: a TripAdvisor user
246703798.reviewBody: It doesn\'t get more beautiful than this beach! Go late morning and stay till mid-afternoon, where you can watch the tide head out and then you can walk all the way out into the bay.  But PLEASE don\'t be a stupid tourist--pick up your trash and keep this place beautiful! In fact, bring a bag and pick up trash while you\'re there, so the beautiful marine life doesn\'t end up with it in their stomachs or around their necks.

246542320.name: Clear and present paradise
246542320.author: a TripAdvisor user
246542320.reviewBody: Not far from La Paz, this is a small white-sand beach that is very enjoyable when you don\'t have crowds of people around.  December is a good month for visiting, as the water is still relatively warm and you can walk all over the bay with water that never gets higher than your knees, until you get to the mushroom rock which seems to be hanging in the air. From there on, the level gets deeper and deeper. The beach doesn\'t have any facilities, except from a van selling a few items.  However, you can order lunch and they will bring it from El Tecolote Beach. Don\'t miss the sunset, get near the "hinguito" (mushroom rock) to enjoy the view.

246362198.name: Great daytrip!
246362198.author: a TripAdvisor user
246362198.reviewBody: The water is shallow enough to walk into many feet in, and even in December the water was warm enough that you could be there comfortably. If your up for it, you can rent a kayak to go from one side of the bay to the other, it\'s really fun with all the ocean currents that are coming in from the sea. I\'ve been here on all my trips to La Paz and will definitely come back again.

246117761.name: perfect day!
246117761.author: a TripAdvisor user
246117761.reviewBody: This beach isn\'t really a swimming beach, more of a sit on the sand and bask in the beautiful setting and sunshine. You could swim, it just never gets much deeper than 3 1/2 feet unless you really get out there. Seemed to be part local, part visitor destination.

246083020.name: Beach day
246083020.author: a TripAdvisor user
246083020.reviewBody: Took public bus from hotel to Balandra beach. Cheaper than tour.\nTide swing is  very great. Low tide can walk across bay.\n5 beaches total.

245829864.name: Beautiful Balandra Beach
245829864.author: a TripAdvisor user
245829864.reviewBody: Balandra is like a huge wading pool of beautiful clear water.  There are some rocky areas where you can snorkel.  Kayaks are available for rent by the hour, single or tandem.  Lovely beach with palapas to protect you from the sun.

245254672.name: Stunning cove; great for Kids/Families
245254672.author: a TripAdvisor user
245254672.reviewBody: Family with teens and everyone thought this was one of the finest cove/beaches due to the purity of the water, hills down to the water, and shallow bay.   You can walk in the water, all the way to the mushroom rock, (which is smaller than the pictures lead you to believe).  The water is warm and there are two porta-potties, a small mobile food truck plus a couple of fellows selling local goods.

245174120.name: beautiful postcard beach
245174120.author: a TripAdvisor user
245174120.reviewBody: on a weekday we had much of the beach to ourselves, at least in the morning and explored the famous shroom stone, much of the bay is not very deep, great for kids, but glad we didn\'t have to listen to any squealing\u2026.

245006053.name: Protected beach for easy swimming.
245006053.author: a TripAdvisor user
245006053.reviewBody: Balandra beach is located in an almost enclosed cove lined with a white sand beach. Shallow enough for even the most timid swimmer  within its confines but deep enough for sailboats to anchor at the entrance, it is also perfect for kayakers who can improve their skills by exploring the lush treed area that lines the shore at the inner end and provides a home for a multitude of birds. Great for families of all ages.

244832545.name: mind blowing contrast, desert and sea
244832545.author: a TripAdvisor user
244832545.reviewBody: This beach is in the top 5 of all the beaches i have seen around the world and it is so unique...\nI enjoyed walking to the mushroom rock formation.\nthis beach has no restaurant or bathrooms so if you are looking for a crowded beach go to el Tecolote with restaurant service and bathrooms.

244709742.name: Don\'t let the Taco stand guy charge you
244709742.author: a TripAdvisor user
244709742.reviewBody: The beach itself is wonderful, knee deep water, warm and clear. But don\'t let the taco stand guy try to charge you 200 pesos to sit under their umbrellas. no signs or indications that they were a service, we assumed they were free as no one was policing the area and they were right by the other palapas.

244198911.name: Heaven on Earth
244198911.author: a TripAdvisor user
244198911.reviewBody:
This is one of the best beaches in Mexico. Totally worth the trip, I am sorry for the people that say they didn't like......You can't get better than this. 

This is the place where many locals learn to swim, water is shallow for a long way, water is crystal clear and the scenery is absolutely beautiful. I am so happy it is now a 'protected area' and I just hope the Mexican government really protect it and don't ruin it like many other tourist spots in Mexico. Leave it like that, keep it real and let everyone enjoy nature at its best. 

The only thing we really need to work on is to keep the beach clean! Locals and tourists, please keep it clean! take a bag with you when you go and take your rubbish with you!

243763266.name: Paradise
243763266.author: a TripAdvisor user
243763266.reviewBody: The paradise in the word. Beautiful clear water amazing sunset. We stayed with group friends this amazing time in the vacation. Recommend

242784341.name: Most beautiful Beach in Baja
242784341.author: a TripAdvisor user
242784341.reviewBody: Love balandra beach, tranquil waters you can swim like your in a pool! I absolutely love this beach since brings back childhood memories

242640489.name: Golden sands and warm seas forever...
242640489.author: a TripAdvisor user
242640489.reviewBody: Not a long drive out of la Paz, Balandra Beach is, nonetheless, a world away.  With powder-soft golden sands, and a shallow warm bay teeming with fish (it appears not to get any deeper than about 4\' in most place!), this swimming \'hole\' is spectacular.  We wished we had time to go back EVERY day!

242631487.name: Really nice
242631487.author: a TripAdvisor user
242631487.reviewBody: Really nice beach... beach by the parking lot has a vendor with drinks, snacks, and kayaks.  There are 2 beaches across the bay, and 2 more to the right of the parking lot beach that if you get off to you will nearly certainly be alone.  \n\nIt was a fluke windy day when we were there, but my understanding is it normally would be fairly calm and very easy to kayak around.

242586237.name: Best Beach in the World
242586237.author: a TripAdvisor user
242586237.reviewBody: This is a fabulous beach to relax.  The aqua water is warm and refreshing.  It is a great place to snokel, paddle board, kayak or just seek seashells yet it is never crowded. So it is a great place to get away from it all.

242331349.name: Great Family Beach
242331349.author: a TripAdvisor user
242331349.reviewBody: High tide or low tide, the bay is shallow enough to explore surrounding beaches. Concession on the beach, including umbrella and chair rental.

240771484.name: Amazing beach, secluded and peaceful
240771484.author: a TripAdvisor user
240771484.reviewBody: Amazing beach, spend the whole day lounging under the tiki hut or laying in the water.\nYou can walk across to the other beaches. The water was warm and calm. You can rent chairs for 6$, paddle boards and kayaks for 20$ and there is some food/snacks you can get at the vendor truck. Its not a crowded beach. Had a great time enjoying the sun and great weather. Must go to this beach if your in the area. !!!

240285488.name: Secret Hideaway!
240285488.author: a TripAdvisor user
240285488.reviewBody: Love this secluded beach! It\'s a 20 min drive outside the hotel area but a must while in La Paz. There\'s minimal amenities such as food, drink, etc so it\'s best to go prepared. Travel with your ice chest and personal selection of libations, food items and then relax beachside. No waves, no currents to look out for but be warned about the sting rays. You\'ll definitely encounter someone being stung so thread lightly and wade your foot in before stepping around.

239405489.name: WOW!  Words can\'t describe...
239405489.author: a TripAdvisor user
239405489.reviewBody: This has got to be the best beach I have ever seen.  Calm turquoise water, white clean sand, few people.  We walked and walked out into the water; I think we could have crossed the whole bay but we got thirsty and turnned back.  I was all worried about all the sting rays I had read about on Tripadvisor so I was shuffling my feet in the water.  Saw one tiny ray all day.  We are here a week and I thin if I spent every day at Balandra I could not have a better vacation.  WOW!

239360493.name: Shhh! Let\'s keep it our little secret
239360493.author: a TripAdvisor user
239360493.reviewBody: This may just be THE perfect beach. The shallow, warm water is crystal clear and the only way to get to it is by boat.  I loved the quiet and solitude. There is not much to see as far as snorkeling goes but the surrounding beauty of the volcanic rock  for this horseshoe-shaped beach is matchless. Word of warning, however, shuffle your feet in the sand as there may be manta rays--at least that was the case in late October. Although I did not see any along the shoreline, as we headed out of the bay in our panga we followed a whole pod of them on the surface of the water.

238832591.name: Unbelievable
238832591.author: a TripAdvisor user
238832591.reviewBody: Pretty place I have ever been. Late spring or early to mid fall. Paradise. Super calm warm clear water.

238772530.name: Serenity & Tranquility...
238772530.author: a TripAdvisor user
238772530.reviewBody: Warm, clear water that is waist deep. White sands, & beautiful scenery that goes as far as the eye can see. It wasn\'t to crowded in Nov. palapas, seashells & a nice calmness about the place.

238508169.name: Beautiful and peaceful beach
238508169.author: a TripAdvisor user
238508169.reviewBody: shallow, warm water and white sandy beach, spectacular cove with a great view out to the bay of La Paz.

237918445.name: Not at all near Walmart La Paz!!!!!!!!!!
237918445.author: a TripAdvisor user
237918445.reviewBody: Balandra is one of the most beautiful beaches in the whole country of Mexico. White sand, turquoise water and beautiful landscape. Just be careful while walking in the shallow water, shuffling your feet instead of walking, to scare away a possible stingray hidden in the sand. That way they might not sting you!\nGreat for kayaking!

237591449.name: Great Beach
237591449.author: a TripAdvisor user
237591449.reviewBody: There are fewer really nice beaches in La Paz that one would imagine.  The one along the Malecon is nice, but Balandra Beach, and others in this area of La Paz, are actually nicer.

236250214.name: Gorgeous beach with ample amenities.
236250214.author: a TripAdvisor user
236250214.reviewBody: Great.  So glad we went to this beach for the day.  Bit difficult to negotiate to get to -you have to ask (it\'s not offered). Cab ride and US$20 ew.  But worth it.  Only 2 couples from the Grand Princess the day we were there.  Awesome!

235252029.name: Most beautiful beach ever!!
235252029.author: a TripAdvisor user
235252029.reviewBody: We absolutely love Balandra!  White sand, clear blue water, marine life - everything you need for a wonderful beach experience.  It is easily the most beautiful beach I have ever been to - like a picture postcard!  I could gush on and on, but you have to see it to believe it.  A couple of hints - take snacks and water as the food truck might be open or might not - it\'s Mexico!  Also, DO NOT STAY AFTER DARK - the beach fleas, black flies, whatever you might call them will bite and you will definitely be miserable for several days afterwards!

234691759.name: We love this place!
234691759.author: a TripAdvisor user
234691759.reviewBody: I hope it never changes! We have been here before in the past and now returned with our children. It\'s the perfect spot to play with the kids, build sand castles, have picnics, and fill their buckets with "treasures".

230757636.name: balandra beach
230757636.author: a TripAdvisor user
230757636.reviewBody: From all the beach destinations I have been.  Balandra is definitely my best choice.  If you like snorkling,  kayaking you will love it.   Water is in level 0 tide.  you can walk from the start of the beach like 200 feet and water will be beneath your waist line. It is like if you were in a pool.  My kids like it so much.   from our 7 day vacation at Los Cabos,  We spend two days at balandra beach.  Just drive 15 minutes south of la paz through the malecon highway heading to san jose del cabo.   It is a public beach.  no fees.  There is a kayak rental trailer on the side.  take provisions.  there are no places close to buy food and such. no restrooms.  all there is a parking and the kayak rental place.  there are lots of rays,  but once you start walking they go away.  they are not as dangerous as people think.  both days we was there.  we spent it kayaking and snorkling for miles offshore.  we did went to tesoro beach, which is five minutes before balandra but did not like it so much.  it was not as clean as balandra.  although did have restrooms and a restaurant.

230011377.name: YOU MUST BE THERE
230011377.author: a TripAdvisor user
230011377.reviewBody: The best beach in La Paz. Balandra Bay is 20 mins from La Paz and you can stay there all the day. You can park your car and enjoy the beauty. You can take a photo with the famous rock (The Hongo).

229059661.name: really nice beach
229059661.author: a TripAdvisor user
229059661.reviewBody:
The bus ride out to Balandra takes a whilte but is well worth it. There are some palapas for shade but they were all taken when we got there, but there were people renting out umbrellas and beach chairs. 

The water is really shallow and has a beautiful color and this is a really good place to relax or walk / shuffle to one of the neighboring beaches.  Be careful with the sting rays, they are much smaller than sting rays elsewhere and you might easily miss them. Another tourist stepped on a sting ray while we were there and it seemed rather painful. So remember to shuffle your feet.

btw. the mushroom rock is of course a fake, it is held together by steel and what looks like concrete.

227979412.name: Like a Giant Bathtub
227979412.author: a TripAdvisor user
227979412.reviewBody: Took a day trip over to La Paz from Pescadero / Todos Santos area to check it out and to hit a different beach. Quick and easy ride to La Paz, only took about an hour. Took another 30 mins to get to the Malecon area along the bay. Stopped to check it out but this is not really a swimming area so we drove along the coast about 18 miles further to Balandra. Very nice beach area. Just as everyone says; clear warm water, nice sand not to many people (we were there on a Sat.) and a few small palapa\'s  for some shade. Snorkeling was OK but not a lot of fish. There was a food vendor truck there with some snacks and drinks and a guy selling fresh fruit. As far as I could see/tell, there were no restroom facilities so be prepared! Another beach close by with a restaurant/bar is called El Tecolote. Just a quick couple minute drive beyond Balandra.

226795397.name: Nice but be careful
226795397.author: a TripAdvisor user
226795397.reviewBody: This might be one of the finest beaches I\'ve ever been, it\'s like a huge pond with crystal water.. be careful, there could be sting rays, so be sure to shuffle your feet while walking in it... otherwise the place is so relaxing and quiet, no crowded as other beaches.

225568892.name: Nice but small beach
225568892.author: a TripAdvisor user
225568892.reviewBody: Crystal clear water but the beach is a little small if you go on a Sunday very crowded................ .......

225326558.name: Beautiful place
225326558.author: a TripAdvisor user
225326558.reviewBody: If you are in La Paz, a stop at Balandra Beach is a must!  You can wade to each beach and the water is crystal clear!  Be sure to shuffle your feet though because there are sting rays.  This is an absolutely beautiful and peaceful place.  Not crowded either!

224407274.name: Safe swimming!
224407274.author: a TripAdvisor user
224407274.reviewBody: A beautiful beach with gradually sloping sand and clear water. Keep an eye on your car as there have been some thefts from cars.

223698434.name: Beautiful
223698434.author: a TripAdvisor user
223698434.reviewBody: Amazing, amazing beach! Words can\'t describe how beautiful this beach is -- it is a full day activity. If you are in Cabo -- you must go here!

222498009.name: Absolutely Beautiful....
222498009.author: a TripAdvisor user
222498009.reviewBody: This beach was perfect - the water was clear and serene, the beach was clean and it was very quiet.  We snorkeled here for hours.  Definitely my favorite beach in La Paz.

222445680.name: Incredible beauty, not so much for swimming as for wading
222445680.author: a TripAdvisor user
222445680.reviewBody: Do watch out for sting rays. DO the Baja Shuffle when in the water.\nThe turquoise of the water is mind boggling. There is a stand that sells water and snacks. otherwise it is pristine but without restaurants.

221739913.name: Beautiful Balandra Beach!
221739913.author: a TripAdvisor user
221739913.reviewBody: This was my favorite beach in the La Paz area! although it was a little busy,we still managed to find our own private area to relax on the beach ,swim and snorkel.I Spent hours at Balandra I wish I could be there everyday :)

220578285.name: There are many ways to get there but however you get there make sure to GO !  This place is Amazing !
220578285.author: a TripAdvisor user
220578285.reviewBody: I have been here many times returning from fishing trips and I also got there on the way back from the island seal lion snorkeling tour.  Its an amazing shallow bay and you see everything from panga\'s to mega yachts.  It can be deserted or fairly crowded depending on the day and time.   I would bring my own food and drinks, Shade and a blanket would be a good idea also.  Good snorkeling near the rocks ! Shuffle your feet when waking in the water due to sting rays.\n\nWater color is Amazing here and its very clear ! Bring your mask. snorkel and fins !

218588844.name: Crystal clear
218588844.author: a TripAdvisor user
218588844.reviewBody: We chartered an all day boat so we could go to the sea lions and snorkel, fish, and swim at other playas. Balandra is beautiful. You can look down into the water and see the bottom. There aren\'t many fish to see near the shoreline but further out, the fish are there. Mostly, clams, chocolate, white, and others.

218546598.name: Beautiful Shallow Beach
218546598.author: a TripAdvisor user
218546598.reviewBody: Beautiful clean beach. Very picturesque. Shallow and great for young kids and older adults. You could spend all day at this beach. Relax, have lunch and swim all day.

218468254.name: Best place to go w/ young kids!!
218468254.author: a TripAdvisor user
218468254.reviewBody: This was the best beach to go w/ my 1 & 3 yr olds.  There are no waves and the water is 2-3 feet high for majority of the beach.  It was essentially a pool w/ sea water.  We loved it.  We were in the water for 3 hours straight!

217168808.name: Amazingly clear blue water
217168808.author: a TripAdvisor user
217168808.reviewBody: Shallow water, only saw one small stingray in the shallow waters of the playa. A few fish farther away from the playa along the rocky areas, but not alot. Take a boat to farther coves to find better snorkeling.

215956322.name: Maybe the Best Beach in Mexico
215956322.author: a TripAdvisor user
215956322.reviewBody: About 12 miles from town.  A most beautiful giant cove, with shallow warm water.  Never very crowded.  We always go there at least twice when we visit La Paz

215769894.name: Wonderful experience
215769894.author: a TripAdvisor user
215769894.reviewBody: this is way off the beaten path but so worth it.  Very friendly locals beach.  Family oriented, I suspect because the water is so shallow.  The bay has got to be at least 5 sq. miles and the deepest was maybe 8 feet deep.  Great for learning to kayak.  No partying going on here.  Just families enjoying the warm water.   No bathrooms.

215638172.name: Cozy Beach
215638172.author: a TripAdvisor user
215638172.reviewBody: We visited this beach, which is more like a cove, in June. It was very hot! We were lucky enough to get one of the free palapas for shade. There are lounge chairs and umbrellas for rent if you need them. There are also kayaks for rent too. We brought our own food and drinks, but the there is a food truck and vendors offering fresh fruit or drinks who walk along the beach. The water is so beautiful and warm. There are no waves so its great for swimming and little ones who don\'t like waves. You\'re able to walk out very far into the water and still touch the bottom easily. We had a problem with bees so keep all food and drinks covered well to avoid them swarming. We had a great day there and would recommend it to anyone looking for a quiet relaxing beach day.

214906105.name: WOW!
214906105.author: a TripAdvisor user
214906105.reviewBody:
We used eco Baja tours from the main bus depot in La Paz to get to Balandra. (about $8 per direction per person) Be sure to know the schedule really well for what time to get retrieved! It doesn't run too often. This is a Locals beach, and so we stuck out a little. But it didn't ever get very busy. I brought my mask, but couldn't find anything exciting to look at - Just sand, no fish. 

The Beach was white powder and long and beautiful! There were about ten straw umbrellas, and a few other umbrellas for shade. Lucky for us one of them was open. 

The water was clear and warm. Beautiful colour. It is shallow (knee hight) for as far out as we wanted to walk. I rented a stand up paddle board for about $20 and went exploring. The area reminded me of Greece!

214104527.name: Tranquil and stunning
214104527.author: a TripAdvisor user
214104527.reviewBody: Beautiful sheltered bay, umbrellas, tables, su loungers and kayaks for hire.  Shallow and clear waters. Accessible by bus and with parking. shame the bus company is unreliable for the return leg, but taxi touts on hand. No toilets, but one limited snack truck, ice creams and fruit available. Avoid the weekends for more tranquility and less kids!

212966644.name: The Fiji of Mexico
212966644.author: a TripAdvisor user
212966644.reviewBody: This is by far one of the best beaches I have found in Mexico so far.  Completely remote and off the beaten path, you will find this extremely hidden gem.  I found it only by the recommendation of a friend in the resort I was staying in.  The water is extremely clear and calm and makes it very easy to see and spot all of the amazing marine life in these waters.  The water is very shallow no matter how far in you go.  I recommend anyone who visits the Baja California penninsula to visit this beach.  Bring your own refreshments and meals as there is nothing really going on at this beach.  Also, carry mosquito repelent.  They are extremely small bugs that bite and will itch for weeks.  There is a small vending truck but it is not always there.  There are no restrooms in this area either.  There are no changing rooms and no gas stations near.  It is very remote and would seem that the road goes on forever and you are lost but just keep going and you will find it.  There are many locals at this beach.

212858798.name: Gorgeous
212858798.author: a TripAdvisor user
212858798.reviewBody: What a Beautiful beach and so close to la paz. Loved the rock formations and shallow, warm, crystal clear water. We took a taxi out there with the plan on taking the bus back but we where told we had missed the last bus and luckily someone was there to call a taxi to bring us back. So don\'t rely on the bus service.

210783225.name: Beautiful and peaceful
210783225.author: a TripAdvisor user
210783225.reviewBody: We were vacationing in Cabo San Lucas several years ago and were driving around La Paz and came upon this beach by accident.  What a find! We spent the whole afternoon at this very special beach and now we return every year we go to Cabo San Lucas.  It is definitely worth the 2 hour drive from Cabo.  It is beautiful and peaceful and an absolute treasure!  I will definitely return to this beach at every opportunity

210340693.name: Gorgeous but don\'t go...
210340693.author: a TripAdvisor user
210340693.reviewBody: I beg you... don\'t go.... because really, I want it to be just the way it was the next time we go - quiet and perfect.

209332082.name: Beautiful beach, but be sure to walk around rock corner to see Balandra Rock
209332082.author: a TripAdvisor user
209332082.reviewBody: Balandra Beach is beautiful. There are actually two beaches, and the one with the famous "Balandra Rock" is around a rocky corner from where the parking lot is and not visible from the parking lot. (Head to the right as you face the water.)  You can either wade in the shallow water or walk over a small group of rocks.  The water is very shallow, as is stated here but there is something very unique and cool about walking halfway across the bay and the water still only being up to your thighs.  If you go to the beach with the Balandra Rock, there is decent snorkeling over by the Rock.   There are no umbrellas, palapas or anything on the actual Balandra Rock beach, but there are some at the beach with the parking lot.\nBeautiful drive and scenery getting here as well.

209091241.name: Pretty Beach
209091241.author: a TripAdvisor user
209091241.reviewBody: Lovely, peaceful beach.  Not suitable for swimming because the water is so shallow in the large lagoon.  And paddling has to done with the "stingray shuffle" to avoid being stung by the stingrays that recline in the sand.  But worth the visit for such beautiful surroundings.

209060881.name: Great beach to wade in the water or relax under an umbrella
209060881.author: a TripAdvisor user
209060881.reviewBody: The water is crystal clear and you can wade in knee deep water for half a mile. Because the water is so clear you can see little fishes swimming around your feet. This would be a great beach if you have young children  because they could collect shells, make sand castles on shore or just sit in the calm cool water.

208836482.name: Beautiful, but there are stingrays!
208836482.author: a TripAdvisor user
208836482.reviewBody: Balandra is a natural beach with really clear water. It is clean. The water is not deep and you can walk in the water. You can see all the beautiful fish while walking. But be careful- there are stingrays. When you step on them (they are reclined in the sand, really flat), they will sting (they are poisonous). There are no restrooms, no restaurants, only a man in a bus selling soft drinks and salty snacks. He rents kayaks, too.

207797109.name: Natural, impressive, away from the crowd beautiful beach
207797109.author: a TripAdvisor user
207797109.reviewBody: Getting to playa Balandra from La Paz is fairly easy and quick. Situated north from La Paz, the drive there is pleasant and the landscape is gorgeous.The best part about it is that is a natural reservation and people are not allowed to build any bars or buildings of any sort, so the beach is actually "wild". The water is warm and clean and extremely calm, making it the ideal place for relaxing and forgetting about civilization for a while. EXTREMELY RECOMMENDED. Even if you are staying in Cabo San Lucas it is worth to make a day-trip.

206845862.name: Make The Trip, It Is Worth It
206845862.author: a TripAdvisor user
206845862.reviewBody:
While Staying at the Cerritos Surf Colony, the bar manager, Greg, recommended we make a trip to Playa Balandra (Balandra Beach).  It is outside of La Paz, about and hour and a half from Todos Santos.

The road is very good from Todos Santos. We had talked to a couple of people who made the trek to Balandra Beach and they loved it.  All of them said they made the mistake of going through La Paz and it took 45 minutes longer than bypassing La Paz.  

We got the bypass directions and took off with an ice chest full of drinks and food.  The highway to La Paz is great but as you enter the outskirts of La Paz, it is hard to tell if it is two or three lanes and cars seem to drive wherever they want.

Once we got to the beach, we found a nice parking lot and 14 palapas that are free to use. The water was amazingly clear and waist deep forever.  The sand is white so the palapa is important and so is sun screen.

You can walk a long, long ways out into the bay. The bottom is all sand so make sure you do the sting ray sand shuffle (shuffle your feet through the sand instead of stepping).  I surprised a sting ray without any sting.

As you walk into the beautiful water, you will see big yachts parked just off the bay.  

If you want a chair or lounge chair, you will  need to rent them. The is a small food trailer there with pretty good Ceviche.  Of course food is a little pricey.

This place is very pretty and the water is great for kids.  We saw a lot of families and couples.

206333488.name: Lovely place
206333488.author: a TripAdvisor user
206333488.reviewBody: I love Balandra for me it\'s the best beach in Baja, I rater the clam and blue water, it is so warm and peacefull, really really nice place if you what to go away the civilization

204839863.name: Baha Shuffle needed
204839863.author: a TripAdvisor user
204839863.reviewBody: This is a beautiful beach and the water is so warm and clear.  They rent kayaks in this part of the inlet for a very specific reason.  Stingrays.  They come into the inlet to enjoy the warm water.  This is where the \'baha shuffle\' is needed...Shuffle your feet when walking into this water.  They will not kill you, but the sting in very painful.  Marlboro over on the Tecolote Beach area is known for helping tourists who have met the demise of these creatures.  I have never been stung but have met a few tourists who have.

203125578.name: Serenity and creation at its best!
203125578.author: a TripAdvisor user
203125578.reviewBody: Other than Sundays, when every Mexican family from La Paz heads to the beaches, please visit Balandra beach.  It is about 1/2 hour drive north of La Paz and totally unique.  The beach itself is divided into 2 sections - the furthest out having the well-known La Paz \'mushroom\' rock formation.\nThe beach is shallow - hence perfect for young children - but particularly when the tide is out, it\'s conducive to wandering with your camera to photograph amazing sea life from.  It\'s a great sunset spot as well.  Services are limited (a taco/seafood cart is available sometimes and a few palapas to keep out of the shade).  There is a mini-mountain to scale for those who want better vistas and exercise.  Can\'t wait to go again!

202637013.name: Incredible aqua waters
202637013.author: a TripAdvisor user
202637013.reviewBody: Definitely worth the drive out to this beach. It was quiet and gorgeous. We hung out under a palapa for shade and then cooled ourselves in the crystal blue waters.

202496141.name: The prize of La Paz
202496141.author: a TripAdvisor user
202496141.reviewBody: We loved our afternoon strolling on the beach and walking across the bay with soft white sand.  Hiking over to Mushroom rock at sunset was gorgeous. *<:`)

201589370.name: The best find of our Baja trip.
201589370.author: a TripAdvisor user
201589370.reviewBody: We walked in the water for almost an hour. The water was several colors of blue.  It was quiet and peaceful.  We walked around a corner and saw a beautiful rock formation. (see picture). There were several types of fish near the rocks. We saw a puffer fish too!  It was wonderful.  We watched an adult pelican teaching its adolescent how to dive for food!

200872542.name: Beautiful, Peaceful beach...
200872542.author: a TripAdvisor user
200872542.reviewBody: It is a pristine sandy cove with warm clear shallow water that barely reaches you knees. Some palapas on the beach for shade, but mostly quiet, calm, hot daze to be lazy. It\'s a must visit.

200271813.name: Fabulous Anchorage
200271813.author: a TripAdvisor user
200271813.reviewBody: Just a short hop fro La Paz, Puerto Balandra is a popular get-away for locals and yachtistas alike.   Home to the famous "Mushroom Rock", Puerto Balandra offers great beach walks, beautiful snorkeling, and a great place for a picnic lunch.   Those of us fortunate enough to have a boat, can enjoy the cool evening breeze and a sunset cocktail with a view to die for.

200149662.name: Stunning
200149662.author: a TripAdvisor user
200149662.reviewBody: You can walk across the entire bay in crystal clear blue waters. You can also walk out about 2 miles without the water ever getting above your waist. I guess there are sting rays that bury in the water but we never saw any.

200109032.name: beautiful beach
200109032.author: a TripAdvisor user
200109032.reviewBody: Just a short drive from La Paz. It is  a protected beach with great snorkeling, warm water and diverse sea-life. Bring a lunch and some extra Pacificos.

199935390.name: Most beautiful beach I\'ve ever been to!
199935390.author: a TripAdvisor user
