199935390.reviewBody: If I ever go back to La Paz again (which I\'m 100% sure I will!), I\'ll spend one whole day at this beach and it\'ll be just like I\'m in heaven! What other wrote is true.... I don\'t need to add anything. If you go to La Paz and missed Balandra beach, you have NOT been to La Paz!

199180581.name: Idyllic. Great for kids.
199180581.author: a TripAdvisor user
199180581.reviewBody: This beach is wonderfully beautiful.  It is extremely shallow, calm, and entirely sandy.  The color of the water startlingly blue/green.  There was a snack truck but otherwise no facilities. Parking is limited, so I\'d suggest going early or during the week.  Locals like this beach for good reason.

198342255.name: Small pretty public beach
198342255.author: a TripAdvisor user
198342255.reviewBody: Lovely spot for wading or swimming. Quiet for a public beach. Surrounded by beautiful mountains. Liked it for a day trip. Good for my puppies to play.

197750918.name: Stunning
197750918.author: a TripAdvisor user
197750918.reviewBody: Make sure to rent the cheap kayaks here and do an hour kayaking by yourself. Turquoise waters, the mushroom rock, the mangrove swamps at the southern end of Ballandra all make this beach wonderful.

197663593.name: Gorgeous!
197663593.author: a TripAdvisor user
197663593.reviewBody: A beach to remember, for sure. White sand, turquoise water, and beautiful surroundings. It doesn\'t get much better, which is why citizens of La Paz prize this beach.

197592514.name: Tranquility at sunset
197592514.author: a TripAdvisor user
197592514.reviewBody: We drove here on our own, in late afternoon when the day trippers had already left. Just our group, and some local people looking for clams - had a long, refreshing swim, a little hike, and got to see the sunset over the ridge. Very special!

196899681.name: very nice beach
196899681.author: a TripAdvisor user
196899681.reviewBody:
very nice beach
not easy to come and see it by bus
walking in the sea-snorkeling (few fishes)
if you walk on the right, you can go to a beach with nobody

196818935.name: beautiful Bay
196818935.author: a TripAdvisor user
196818935.reviewBody: Beautiful bay with warm water,  there were small sand manta rays that would sting if you stepped on them, it is a good idea to shuffle when you walk.

196699320.name: Great beach
196699320.author: a TripAdvisor user
196699320.reviewBody: We went for the day to Balandra beach and had it all to ourselves.  Walk around the corner and you have a half mile white sand beach with very little folks.  One of the best hidden gems.

196654184.name: Gorgeous beach -- Great for the kids
196654184.author: a TripAdvisor user
196654184.reviewBody: This lovely little bay is about 3 feet deep as far from the beach as you want to walk.  Shuffle you feet so you don\'t step on the Rays!  Snorkeling not good as it is too shallow, but it is the perfect place for the little ones.  NOTE:  Food available from local truck is good -- If you get the Cervichi be sure to get one ... it will feed two.  No beer available at the truck.

196244711.name: Not all it is cranked up to be!
196244711.author: a TripAdvisor user
196244711.reviewBody: Did not see what all the hype is about this beach.  It is a large cove with shallow water and birds and shells.  Yes, the water is a pretty clean color, and warmish (it is shallow), and it is pretty neat when the tide goes out and the cove gets almost a quarter empty, but I wasn\'t impressed, and it certainly didn\'t take my breath away, as many publications have stated it would.  Don\'t waste your time and energy, and the drive.  By the way, the road is lousy and makes it even less worth it.

196211064.name: Most recommended beach
196211064.author: a TripAdvisor user
196211064.reviewBody: It draws crowds, but you can find a private place to enjoy the ambience. Most want their photo taken by the balanced rock which is the signature piece.

195946456.name: Go at high tide if you want to kayak
195946456.author: a TripAdvisor user
195946456.reviewBody: The beach was beautiful. We went there to rent kayaks which were very reasonable but if you go at low tide you have to drag the kayak a long ways. We heard there were rays to be careful of but we didn\'t see any. Wasps were a bit of a pain. Nice area to kayak.

195604911.name: Great beach
195604911.author: a TripAdvisor user
195604911.reviewBody: Possibly the most beautiful beach I\'ve ever been to. The water is crystal clear and so shallow that you can almost walk across the entire cove.  However, be aware that there are stingrays.  I didn\'t see any here, but someone was stung while we were there.

195416269.name: Beautiful and tranquil
195416269.author: a TripAdvisor user
195416269.reviewBody: Lovely clear blue water and pretty beach.  Not much there but can rent kayaks, snorkels etc from a kiosk.  Definitely worth a look.

194958403.name: BEAUTIFUL!!!!
194958403.author: a TripAdvisor user
194958403.reviewBody: Amazing beach -  - a MUST visit!!!\nTake the bus out, it\'s very easy.  There is a snack cart onsite - but pack a lunch if you are looking for more.  Beautiful sand, water, excellent!!!

194859194.name: Unbelievably scenic
194859194.author: a TripAdvisor user
194859194.reviewBody: You come here and think to yourself, "wow, this is so beautiful..and so inhospitable to life, so harsh!" The stark beauty really has to be seen to be appreciated. We went here on a boat from costa baja, from the company funbaja, which was great, as we got lunch, a stop for snorkeling and a wonderful tour guide.  You must come here!!!!

194763090.name: go here!
194763090.author: a TripAdvisor user
194763090.reviewBody: Loved it here.  Go early to get a palapa and to see it at high tide.  you can nearly walk all the way across the water to the other side.  Water is crystal clear!  But cold (we went in February), but you get used to it.  No restrooms there, but there\'s a little snack truck and Tecolote beach is just a minute away with restrooms.  It\'s quiet and peaceful here.  At low tide in the afternoon the water recedes some and it makes little islands of sand in the middle of the water that you can relax on. So cool!

194568484.name: One of the nicest beaches I ever saw.
194568484.author: a TripAdvisor user
194568484.reviewBody: It may seem a little odd to write a review for a beach as opposed to a business (hotel, restaurant, tour operation), but this one is worth it!  We hadn\u2019t originally planned on going here on purpose but it was only a few minutes out of the way on the way back from our original stop at Tecolote beach.  So glad we did!  This is an amazing, locals only type of place.  The tide was out but coming in when we were there.  This allows you to walk far out onto the sand and access the secluded beach around the corner of the rocky point that separates it from the parking lot.  Hard to describe but I\u2019ll post some pictures to give a better feel.  If you\u2019re in La Paz, Balandra and Tecolote are both well worth the not-so-far trip north of town to visit.  Stunningly beautiful scenery and beach.  It has that amazing contrast you see so much around Baja, desert and cacti against crystal clear azure blue water.  I can\u2019t recommend it enough.

194323866.name: Beautiful, but mind the wasps
194323866.author: a TripAdvisor user
194323866.reviewBody: Great beach just a short drive north of La Paz.  We didn\'t have any trouble with the stingrays, but the wasps were enough to drive you crazy.  I\'m sure it was just the time of year we visited, and the calm winds probably didn\'t help either.  Definitely worth the trip, but don\'t pass up Playa Tecolote (just down the road) either.

194314884.name: good wading to the mushroom rock
194314884.author: a TripAdvisor user
194314884.reviewBody: the water I liked\nDisliked the little worms that tickled my bare left instep, on the exposed sand bar. They quickly disappeared but I wore my shoes after the third time! .

193896118.name: Great beach, BEWARE OF STINGRAYS
193896118.author: a TripAdvisor user
193896118.reviewBody: Great beach, the water was nice and since its in somewhat of a coldesack there is hardly any waves, the water is shallow and in the morning you can walk across..  nice clear waters and great views from the top of the mountain, but BEWARE of sting rays they are NOTORIOUS here.. if you get stung you need to go to the bar down the ways at tecolote one of the guys there is known for curing sting ray bites..  other than that its a great little place just be super careful with the sting rays. when we were there my friend and two others got stung

193276010.name: Beautiful beach out of La Paz
193276010.author: a TripAdvisor user
193276010.reviewBody: Not many people, great walking on the shore.  Mushroom rock interesting but smaller than expected. All in all a nice place to visit

192860185.name: Worth the Drive
192860185.author: a TripAdvisor user
192860185.reviewBody: We spent our vacation in Todos Santos and decided to drive to La Paz and visit some of the beaches in the area. Balandra Bay was worth the drive. I didn\'t anticipate the winding roads along the cliffs. There were some amazing views on the drive. Balandra reminded us a little of our trip to Isla Holbox because the water is so shallow that you can wade across the beach. Lots of crabs and some interesting rock formations, but the highlight is the water itself. There is a food truck available and some vendors make it to the beach. No bathrooms however. Be aware that stingrays can be an issue in warmer weather.

192411973.name: Worth the Drive
192411973.author: a TripAdvisor user
192411973.reviewBody: The knee-deep water throughout Balandra Bay is unlike anything we\'ve ever seen. You\'ll be drawn to a peninsula on your right.  As you round it, you will see a rock formation in the distance.  You\'ll only need to navigate the rocks a short while, then you can walk on the beach out to some interesting (and highly photographic) rock formations,  Don\'t forget to watch where you are walking, because there are some neat shells to be found. \n

192174287.name: Fabulous beach!
192174287.author: a TripAdvisor user
192174287.reviewBody: Probably one of the prettiest beaches I have ever visited! Thoroughly enjoyed swimming, kayaking, snorkeling and walking to the mushroom rock. No bathrooms however and the local food for sale was not advised by our friends who live there. Come prepared as you will not want to leave!

191929352.name: Perfect Kids Beach
191929352.author: a TripAdvisor user
191929352.reviewBody: No waves, shallow water, and very few people, especially on a weekday. Kids played for hours on the flat beach. Balandra also offered shelter from the wind on days when other beaches wouldn\'t have been much fun.

191830135.name: Beautiful
191830135.author: a TripAdvisor user
191830135.reviewBody: We went to the beach three different times during our stay.  The first visit one in our group stepped on a stingray - it was very painful but taken care of at the next beach over at one of the bars.  The second visit we rented kayaks and that was fun and the final time just enjoyed long walks and swimming in the beautiful water!

190968617.name: Great
190968617.author: a TripAdvisor user
190968617.reviewBody: Excellent beach to hang out and have a great afternoon specially at sunset. Very easy to get too, and its ver clean.

190305042.name: Gorgeous beach!
190305042.author: a TripAdvisor user
190305042.reviewBody: We absolutely loved our day trip to this beach from Cabo San Lucas! It was so beautiful and the water is so shallow and calm. You could walk really far out before the water got deep. My daughter and I also rented a paddle boat and went all the way across which was fun.

190304650.name: Beautiful beach, few amenities
190304650.author: a TripAdvisor user
190304650.reviewBody: It\'s a beautiful beach, but there are no bathroom facilities or\nfood service, so you really didn\'t want to spend a lot of time \nthere.  Tecolote Beach is better for a day trip.

190095805.name: Stunningly beautiful
190095805.author: a TripAdvisor user
190095805.reviewBody: My teenage daughter and I had a great day exploring the beaches.  It was too cold for swimming (in late December), but on low tide, we waded across the bay and spent a few hours walking and enjoying the view.   We had planned to spend a half day, but ended up spending a whole day there.\n\n Thankfully, it is undeveloped, other than for a small parking lot and a small  stand that rents kayaks and sells a few snacks.  I have heard that renting a kayak and exploring the mangroves is very nice.  You have to go to another beach if you want restrooms or real food.  I have traveled to many places, and this is one of the prettiest I have ever seen,

189933820.name: Beautiful beach
189933820.author: a TripAdvisor user
189933820.reviewBody: Shallow wading beach in a beautiful bay with turquoise clear water.  Eye candy!  Great for young children too.

189548810.name: Fantastic!
189548810.author: a TripAdvisor user
189548810.reviewBody: A beautiful beach, not to be missed when visiting the La Paz area -- and I\'m not a beach guy.  We took the bus, which can be found at the terminal on the malecon.  The smaller Eco Baja shuttles go multiple times per day, with returns later.  Cost was $70 pesos each way.\n\nThe beach has multiple palapas to sit under, or you can rent or bring chairs.  There\'s a food truck that seems to be permanently parked there, so you can get tacos and other food.  No bathrooms, keep that in mind.  Walking to the right gets you to the famous balanced rock, or climb the bluffs for another nice view.

189405560.name: Kick the sand to avoid sting rays...
189405560.author: a TripAdvisor user
189405560.reviewBody: Pristine beach and great views, no need to pay for boat to arrive to \'mushroom\' rock.  Kick the sand to avoid sting rays.

189089746.name: Amazing beach
189089746.author: a TripAdvisor user
189089746.reviewBody: It was low tide & we walked across the bay. This place is so beautiful. It used to be a secret, but now can get crowded around noon. Get there early for a palapa. Today we were blessed to see whales playing just a ways out! Beautiful place. Some reviews reported jellyfish, but that must be a seasonal thing because we didn\'t see even one & we walked the whole place!

188407331.name: wonderful beach
188407331.author: a TripAdvisor user
188407331.reviewBody: beautiful blue water, many white sand beaches, clean  and great snorkelling along rocks. has a inner lagoon of water and the bay is a good size but shallow at the end for great swimming. not many people, and not far at all from la paz.

187406186.name: Lovely little bay
187406186.author: a TripAdvisor user
187406186.reviewBody: Sheltered from the wind. Nice shallow bay for swimming, kayaking, walking, sun bathing. Close to La Paz and just a short walk to beach restaurants and bus back to La Paz. A must see for your trip to La Paz.

187358595.name: Nice hike with good photo opps
187358595.author: a TripAdvisor user
187358595.reviewBody: There are no amenities at this beach aside from the vendor truck selling drinks and snacks.  We walked back out the road from the beach about 200 yrds a picked up a trail heading up into the hills.  I found the hike on wikiloc.com just search hiking near la Paz.  We had a great hike with vistas and cool rock formations.  Kayak rental is another good option.

187228388.name: Jewel of a Place
187228388.author: a TripAdvisor user
187228388.reviewBody: Loved the beach and you can rent kyaks there\nIt is a pretty shallow lagoon with great sandy beach and a small food truck to get some food and drink ( no alcohol)  Be sure and go when the tide is in as when the tide is out it is too shallow to kayak.  This is also where the famous rock of La Paz is located.  It is pretty weathered by the ocean now and is shaped like a funnel.  Be sure and see Benjeman when you are there and he will give you a pretty good deal on T shirts of good quality

186644335.name: Amazing cove
186644335.author: a TripAdvisor user
186644335.reviewBody: Went there by boat after a day of fishing. While the captain was cleaning our catch, we took a dive into the warm blue waters of Balandra beach. It was simply amazing. The balandra rock is much smaller than it looks on the photos, but the beach is every bit as marvelous!

186583831.name: Really nice and quiet beach
186583831.author: a TripAdvisor user
186583831.reviewBody:
From the different beaches you can visit in La Paz, there are only a couple you can do it with kids. Balandra and Coroumel (don't bother to go here, btw, just not worth it)

Balandra is by far the most beautiful and nice beach you can visit in La Paz.

The water is shallow, and you can walk long distances and the water level is only up to your knees in average.

One thing to see here is the Hongo (mushroom) rock. It's around 15 min walk in the water.

Just be cautious if you have kids with you, take them with sandals. Mine stepped barefoot on a rock and cut her foot :(

Other than that,  everything is really nice.

You can rent chairs and umbrellas

186070575.name: Beautiful and beware the rays
186070575.author: a TripAdvisor user
186070575.reviewBody: Playa Balandra is a beautiful beach.  We were there at low tide, and you could walk out quite far.  We enjoyed a long walk on the sand and in the water.  One note of caution: follow the example of the locals and avoid walking in the deeper areas.  There are rays, and they will sting you if you happen to step on one.  Even with the sting, though, I still really enjoyed this beach.

185977176.name: Sooo beautifull and quiet
185977176.author: a TripAdvisor user
185977176.reviewBody: This beach is very very beautifull and the water is clear and turquoise. There\'s some fishes but not so much. Don\'t approach the mangrove part barefoot as there is some crabs in the water that can bite you

185780307.name: A Wonderful Family Day Trip Destination
185780307.author: a TripAdvisor user
185780307.reviewBody: Balandra Beach is located on a small shallow bay that empties into the Sea of Cortez just a few kilometers outside of La Paz city.  The white sandy beach is spacious and provides a great place for the whole family to hang out during the daytime.  The bay is very shallow and therefore the water of the bay warms up nicely even in the winter months.  Children can play in the sand or wade for great distances out into the bay in relative safety due to the shallow waters.  The bay is very calm and mades for a great location to go SUP boarding or kayaking.  Romantic adventurers can walk and swim across the bay to distant beaches for a private time away from the crowds, especially on weekends.  During the week, do not be surprised if you have the beach to yourself.  Do not plan on staying on the beach late in the day because swarms of mosquitos come out of the mangrove swamps at the upper end of the bay around sunset.  A number of palapas line the beach next to the parking lot, but otherwise bring you own shade umbrellas as the sun can be very intense during the height of the day.  Definitely a must see spot near La Paz.

185737784.name: Just freakin\' magnificent!
185737784.author: a TripAdvisor user
185737784.reviewBody: Usually the water is too shallow for swimming, but otherwise it is a special place. You can wade forever through the crytal waters and watch pelicans diving for fish and crabs scurrying past your feet. This is a protected area and the only service is a food truck in the parking lot, which we didn\'t use. The blue umbrellas and chaise longues are rented from the people who have the food truck concession, thought there are a number of palapas for free.

185399780.name: Peaceful, quiet, great for kayaking
185399780.author: a TripAdvisor user
185399780.reviewBody: You should go to Balandra early in the morning when the water level is not low. There is a truck there where they prepare food and also rent out kayaks and snorkels. This bay is great for kayaking. Go early in the morning, rent a kayak for a few hours, kayak around the bay. Not so great for snorkeling. Tides pull the water in the afternoon. If you choose to walk in the water, make sure you shuffle your feet and if you have water socks, wear them. There are small sting rays on the sand that you can\'t see. If you step on them, they can sting you. That\'s why shuffling feet as if you are skiing is recommended.

184540094.name: Best Beach in La Paz!
184540094.author: a TripAdvisor user
184540094.reviewBody:
Lonely beach with palm umbrellas, fine white sand, azure blue and ultra shallow water (you even can walk to the other sides small beach) within a lagoon like spot at the end of the tip of La Paz. 

Nicest beach for me in La Paz!
No highway next to it, no noisy restaurants on it, no people making money with renting chairs ;)

184184460.name: Great place to stand up paddle board
184184460.author: a TripAdvisor user
184184460.reviewBody: Balandra beach is in a gorgeous protected cove with no waves, gorgeous sands and palapas to relax under.  We rented paddle boards and went across to a completely deserted beach on the other side of the cove.  Unfortunately I got stung by a sting ray.  Be careful especially when walking in areas with no people and/or wear water shoes.  The lady running the snack truck who rented us the paddle boards was so nice.  She boiled water for my foot and squeezed out the venom.  Hot water is the only thing that makes it feel better so I greatly appreciated her help.  Even with the sting, I highly recommend Balandra for it\'s beauty and serenity.

183617109.name: Sunset Paddleboarding
183617109.author: a TripAdvisor user
183617109.reviewBody: I had an amazing experience paddleboarding at this beach at sunset, the day before I flew out of Baja. It was really beautiful, it was fun to float around and watch the sun dip behind the rocks... I also paddled to a rock covered with birds, and got some really cool videos and pictures of them. \n\nEnjoy! So much fun!!

183326151.name: Most beautiful beach in Baja but beware the sting rays
183326151.author: a TripAdvisor user
183326151.reviewBody:
We visited here twice towards the end of October. As everyone else says it is so beautiful, and you can choose to sit with the families under the palapas on the main beach, or walk round the rocks to the quieter beach on the other side - we had this to ourselves both times.

However be careful in the water - I was stung in my ankle by a lurking hidden sting ray - probably the most painful experience of my life. After the initial shock I was able to hobble back to the main beach where the very helpful senor who rents the kayaks bathed the wound in very hot water which denatures the venom. I was then able to go to hospital for treatment. 

Everyone says to shuffle your feet through the sand to unearth any hidden rays. Make sure you do this! Also subsequently everyone I spoke to said they had all heard of people being stung at Balandra, and in fact the second day we went there we saw another guy hobbling having been stung in his ankle too. 

Don't forget to shuffle in the sand, and enjoy this amazing beach.

182854472.name: Peaceful
182854472.author: a TripAdvisor user
182854472.reviewBody: So far this is the best place I have visited in Baja California. Worth the drive. Bring snacks and drinks with you before you head out since there won\'t be a store in sight.

182008553.name: Great would be an understatement.
182008553.author: a TripAdvisor user
182008553.reviewBody:
Bahia Balandra is one of those wonderful places one occasionally runs across in their travels. Nature at its' finest, with seven white sand beaches on the bay.
Beautiful may capture it in a word, but being there is better than any word(s).
The beaches on the inner bay are very shallow, with crystal clear waters and as safe as it gets for the kids. A set of three inner-bay beaches occupy this part of the bay, with the innermost part of the bay being a mangrove, rich in sea and bird life.
Famed for its' mushroom shaped rock that balances on a very thin base, that sits at the end of the second beach on the parking lot side and which most often is the furthest out most people go, though there is another great beach on that side of the bay, best navigated during lower tides as there is a bit of rocky passage between the two. Making it to the last beach within the bay pretty much gives one their own private beach as very few people go out that far. There are palapas (palm thatched shade areas) on the first two beaches, but none on the third, though there is a great rock overhang as you enter that beach.
At the end of the bay one can climb up the trail to the headlands for great views of Balandra and across the channel to Espiritu Santos Island (really a group of islands with Espiritu Santos being the largest) and across the Bay of La Paz. The point there is also a great place to snorkel, often with dozens of species and clouds of them.
Balandra Bay is also a Natural Protected Area and may soon be added to the list of World Heritage Bio-Reserves, as are the islands across from it and in fact all islands in the Gulf of California/Sea of Cortes now. 
You have to bring whatever you want with you as it is nature at it's finest, but the next beach over (Tecalote) does have a few restaurants and various water sports toys, as well as trips to the Islands.

181077490.name: Our most favortie beach
181077490.author: a TripAdvisor user
181077490.reviewBody: It is not commercialized and hope it stays that way....We love to walk in the clear warm water all the way to the mushroom rock. It does require bathroom facilities and sometimes there are mobile venders, but hope it is never developed as it is so peaceful and awesome there that we go as often as we can....

181069930.name: A must if you go to Cabo
181069930.author: a TripAdvisor user
181069930.reviewBody: The "real" paradise! Among those who\'ve seen it in person, the conclusion is that Balandra is the most beautiful beach in the world, and the only one that can truly be described as unique. Visit Balandra and enjoy a kayaking day in a sandy beaches and turquoise crystal clear water with your family, friends or alone. My favorite place in the world - and Gili Meno in Indonesia too ;)

180959035.name: A Beauty
180959035.author: a TripAdvisor user
180959035.reviewBody: A beautiful beach. Quiet, very few people, definitely worth getting out of the main city to enjoy. Landing on it from a boat is even more luxurious while on a scuba or kayaking adventure.

180629048.name: A natural pool in paradise
180629048.author: a TripAdvisor user
180629048.reviewBody: The most beautiful tranquil beach. White sand and crystal clear water. We were the only people there for about 4 hours and we just floated and enjoyed life.  A must see if you go to La Paz.

180269580.name: I LOVE THIS BEACH
180269580.author: a TripAdvisor user
180269580.reviewBody: We have gone, every time we go to La Paz, it so tranquil and beautiful. We can walk from all sides of this beach and the water will never be over your ribs.  We love it.  The only thing is be aware of little stingrays and jelly fish.  Walk with you feet rubbing the bottom of the sand and take vinagar just incase.

178873395.name: Balandra beach is like swimming in heaven ~~
178873395.author: a TripAdvisor user
178873395.reviewBody: Th is is the most beautiful beach in La Paz.....\nGorgeous blue seas with white sand and surrounding mountains.\nIf you are going to La Paz you MUST go to Balandra Beach...

178757952.name: Beautiful spot!
178757952.author: a TripAdvisor user
178757952.reviewBody: It\'s a great beach and calm water.  It\'s really shallow until you go farther out but it was great for stand up paddling!  It was 150 pesos to rent a board and paddle for an hour..... About $12.00 U.S.....reasonable!  They also had kayaks for rent.

177351395.name: Stunning clear water
177351395.author: a TripAdvisor user
177351395.reviewBody: A great place to rent a kayak and explore the bay. Come early in the day to avoid the crowds. Abundant fish, turquoise water, stark red cliffs and lots of sea birds.

177038530.name: Largest bath tub ever!
177038530.author: a TripAdvisor user
177038530.reviewBody: This is a large shallow bay with the warmest, clearest water ever.  We rented a kayak to explore another beach, but it really wasn\'t even necessary as we probably could have walked from end to end.  We were staying on the Pacific Coast where we were advised not to swim due to currents and rip tides, so this was absolutely a treat and a MUST!

176953034.name: BE CAREFUL OF STINGRAYS
176953034.author: a TripAdvisor user
176953034.reviewBody: Beautiful to look at but if you step into the sea be careful! (Maybe wear sea shoes). Stingrays are very common there, even close to the shore, many visitors have been stung. \nI was stung in September (which is apparently high season for stingrays there) and had to go to Tecolote beach around 1 km away over the road (which by the way has stingrays too) to get one of the workers to take the poison out which hurt a lot!\nIf you get stung, check that the wound doesn\'t have part of the stinger still in it. Then squeeze around the wound to get the venom out (it will look a bit like pus) and bathe in very hot water. I would recommend to see a doctor as well.

176389046.name: This is not a beach just a BIG NATURAL POOL !
176389046.author: a TripAdvisor user
176389046.reviewBody: One of the best beaches I have ever seen this is more alike to a big natural pool instead of a public beach. Tranquil water but dont forget to bring some "botanas" if you are planning to stay for a while, there are not good places to eat around.

174950458.name: Beautiful and original beach
174950458.author: a TripAdvisor user
174950458.reviewBody: It is a quasi desert Island where the food and drinks options are very limited but it is what makes it so beautiful! I recommend to take water, hats and snacks, just some cash to pay for a kayak rent (don\'t hesitate to bargain the price, $150pesos for the hour is a good deal). The water in the bay never goes upper than 80cm so it\'s great with kids or only if you like sitting in the water and enjoy! The ice cream man will walk in the water trying to sell you nieves! With the kayak you can and must go further, where the water is deeper but you will have access to empty beaches, caves and La Paz landmark, this artificial mushroom standing out of the water. \nBring your own parasol or arrive early to use the palapas which are already there!\nOn your way back from the beach, go to the fish tacos Bismarkcito on La Paz main avenue! Its a good cantina and their tacos are ...DELICIOUS!

174811951.name: AMAZING
174811951.author: a TripAdvisor user
174811951.reviewBody:
The best beach around La Paz. 
Absolutely beautiful, peaceful, with crista clear calm water. It's also very clean comparing to the other nearby beaches, always ruined by trash left there from local people or tourists who have fires during the night.
Unluckly in Baja it's very common to find fire's rleftovers, bottles and caps on the white sand... What a shame....
Bring with you water and food, there is a small kiosk I wouldn't suggest.

174043454.name: Beautiful Playa Balandra
174043454.author: a TripAdvisor user
174043454.reviewBody:
My husband and I visited this beach towards the end of our vacation. He wasn't up to the drive from Cabo San Lucas (2.5 hrs), but he was a good sport since I really wanted to go. We kept hearing how beautiful Playa Balandra is and I wanted to see for myself. Well, simply beautiful! My husband was even pleasantly surprised and didn't mind the long drive after all. The pictures on tripadvisor or even the pix I took do not do this beach justice. The water level is shallow - you can walk back and forth in the bay and I think it only was about waist high - maybe more. I'm short and was able to walk throughout. The water is crystal clear with shades of blue turquoise. The sun glistens on the waters surface and make it twinkle. There are fish, plants and sting rays. I only saw one sting ray and it was small. I was afraid to walk around at first because I didn't want to be stung, but got comfortable pretty quickly. 

The beach is about 30 minutes from the marina in La Paz. It is a pretty unspoiled beach, so bring a blanket, towels, water and some snacks. There is a food truck or at least it was there when we went. I'm assuming it's always there. It will be helpful for you to bring a few items and don't forget the sunscreen. There are palapas, but not a lot. Though there seemed to be plenty while we were there - but when we first got to the beach, there were only about 2 left. It can be hot out there, so be prepared. We stayed for about 3 hours and just chilled the entire time.

There are also kayaks that you can rent and I believe snorkel equipment too. There might have been an out house, but I can't remember. There are no true bathroom facilitates. Though not "posh" you won't regret it visiting Playa Balandra!

173798409.name: R&R at the beach
173798409.author: a TripAdvisor user
173798409.reviewBody: This place is awesome perios. You can walk what seems like forever with water waist deep and enjoy the environment around you. Still rustic very little people selling anything execpt the Fresh fruit and the Paletas both are very tasty and resonably priced yet very refreshing. We will be back to spend more time.

173577050.name: Nice and quiet
173577050.author: a TripAdvisor user
173577050.reviewBody: Balandra is a relatively small beach with palapas and a small tienda for drink and snak (we ate there one among the best chevice we had in Mexico). There is a lagoon with mangroves you can reach with kayak to see lots of different birds. Not too many people, it deserve a visit

172170521.name: Beautiful aqua water against desert backdrop.
172170521.author: a TripAdvisor user
172170521.reviewBody: Balandra beach was one of my favorite spots in baja sur! We arrived in time to get our own palapa and enjoyed the day. The water is clear, clean, refreshing and inviting! Our 5 month old floated around the bay while we walked or sat w him. It\'s a great spot to spend the day relaxing and soaking in the sun. There are guys who walk along the beach and sell fruit or frozen fruit bars. we tried the mango & coconut w spices, so tasty! We had no issues w rays, just shuffled our feet while we walked.

171493933.name: Find the mushroom rock!
171493933.author: a TripAdvisor user
171493933.reviewBody: Hot? Sure.  Walk waist deep around the corner and across the bay to see a unique sight.  Relaxing, families, and a guy with a bell on his floating ice-cream cart.  Fun!  Divertido!

171399579.name: Great for families
171399579.author: a TripAdvisor user
171399579.reviewBody: The county-provided palapas at the beach are great, and they go fast. Go early and claim yours. There is a large lagoon with shallow water that is great from small children to play and practice their swimming and snorkel. We did not have any issues with rays. We saw none.

170639026.name: Beautiful, but get there early -- or late in the PM
170639026.author: a TripAdvisor user
170639026.reviewBody: Fantastic landscape and beautiful beach. In Summer, stingrays seem to not be around as much. A few vendors provide welcome support. Get there by 9 AM or after 4 PM and you\'ll have better chances of scoring an umbrella and place to sit. Warm clear turquoise water.

169657030.name: Kick Back Beach Day
169657030.author: a TripAdvisor user
169657030.reviewBody: Great Day trip easy road access and Beautiful White POWDER Beach. Bay is very shallow allowing you to walk through the waters often seeing small rays, Blow Fish and small schools of bait fish. Depth allows small children to venture out without fear of undertows and the warmth of water is most inviting. Kayaks are available for a fee and a local Taco truck with drinks is almost always there!

169649359.name: Tranquil and beautiful
169649359.author: a TripAdvisor user
169649359.reviewBody: This beach is so gorgeous and surreal....shallow and beautiful...My cousin said it is the most beautiful beach that she has ever seen...and of course the famous balandra rock is there...great for taking a lunch and enjoying the peace there...

167940352.name: Superb beach - like a huge swimming pool
167940352.author: a TripAdvisor user
167940352.reviewBody: We first went to Balandra beach by boat, then decided to take the car and drive there from La Paz - only about a 20 minute drive.  Could not believe that a pristine beach like this could still exist so close to a large urban centre.  It is pristine, unspoiled, and the bay is like a huge swimming pool.

166742607.name: Stunning
166742607.author: a TripAdvisor user
166742607.reviewBody: We went early in the day and had the whole beautiful place to ourselves...MAKE time to go out to this place.

166502640.name: Balandra in july
166502640.author: a TripAdvisor user
166502640.reviewBody: The most beautiful beach in La Paz.  Fine sand, gentle breezes, umbrellas, snacks from vendors make for a great experience.

165893759.name: Chill
165893759.author: a TripAdvisor user
165893759.reviewBody: Calm warm shallow waters. Perfect for relaxation. Many families and kids. Gets quite busy on weekends so go early

165600607.name: Wonderful water colour, safe and clean.
165600607.author: a TripAdvisor user
165600607.reviewBody: Balandra beach is like a beautiful swimming pool excellent to relax.\nIs a local place to leisure without  disturbing the others.

163997104.name: Beautiful and (potentially) dangerous
163997104.author: a TripAdvisor user
163997104.reviewBody: I\'ve never seen a beach completely surrounded by mountains like this and the water is warm and shallow.  I definitely recommend going; however, if you are going to do a lot of walking in the water you should wear shoes or shuffle your feet.  My husband walked all the way to the other side and got stung by a stingray.  It took him 20 minutes to get back and he was bleeding and in a lot of pain.  As others have recommended, go see Manuel if this happens to you and also go to the clinic for antibiotics.  We heard that it was mating season when we were there (May) and therefore, they were more numerous than usual.

162786979.name: Beautiful, Incredible- But watch our for stingrays!
162786979.author: a TripAdvisor user
162786979.reviewBody:
This beach is phenomenal and embodies the one lesson I learned driving around Mexico- Just when you think you've gone the wrong way, give yourself 10 minutes and sign will appear to reassure you that you are going in the right direction :)

To get here, take the highway that goes along the malecon up toward Playa Pichilingue. Drive beyond Pichilingue on the highway and just keep going and going and going and going and the highway will force you to go either left (to Balandra) or right (to Tecolote). Go left and the highway will end right at the beach!

There are no official facilities here, but there is a truck with ice cream, drinks, snacks, Coco Frio, Mango, etc. You can also pay a small fee for chairs/tables/lounge chairs. Otherwise there are many FREE palm umbrellas all over the beach you can pop under with your own towel and relax! You can also rent kayaks which is awesome, it the perfect place to cruise around.

This beach is beautiful and wonderful, but no one told us how many stingrays are in the water. 
I stepped on one, got stung and had to walk all the back to the beach through the gorgeous shallow waters with a foot on fire! IF YOU GET STUNG: get on the freeway and drive 5 mins further up the highway to Playa Tecolote (remember, this was the right turn at the T that lead you to the beach). Ask for The Marlboro Man or Manuel and he will help you. I've been stung by many a animal, but the stingray is brutal and the longer you wait,the longer the poison creeps up your leg. I'm not going to give any official medical advice here- but many locals told us that if you go to the hospital first, they won't actual remove the toxin they just give you antibiotics. GO TO MANUEL and have him do his magic (vinegar and lots of squeezing) to get the toxin out and then if you want to go to a doctor, at leas your leg won't be burning inside with the painful poison of the stingray. 

Anywho- Manuel said stings are very, very, very common when it's super hot, so if you're a nervous nelly then I suggest skipping this beach or shuffling in the sand as to avoid the rays :)

162717325.name: Balandra beach - amazing
162717325.author: a TripAdvisor user
162717325.reviewBody: Baladra beach was peaceful with crystal clear waters that you could easily swim or walk out a few hundred yards.  From La Paz, it was only about a 20 minute drive and definitely worth a trip if you\'re in the area.

162576041.name: Public beach
162576041.author: a TripAdvisor user
162576041.reviewBody: nice beach, especially for families as shallow water extends far from beach.  Vendor provides beach umbrellas, lounge and regular chairs for 150-180 pesos per day. also kayak rentals available by hour.  limited food and beverages available

162001334.name: Beautiful Beach
162001334.author: a TripAdvisor user
162001334.reviewBody: Balandra is the most beautiful beach in La Paz! It is also a great place to take children since the water level is low and they can wade in it. Also, rent the kayaks ($12 USD/Hr) because you can go to the other side of bay to explore! They have about 10 palapas for shade and a food truck with snacks and drinks. This is a must see if you are in La Paz!

161082305.name: Beautiful beach/bay
161082305.author: a TripAdvisor user
161082305.reviewBody: Bay here is very flat and shallow, giving water a beautiful turquoise color.  Water was warm, and you could walk out probably a quarter of a mile and water was still not waist deep.

160825236.name: Beautiful Beach!
160825236.author: a TripAdvisor user
160825236.reviewBody: Balandra is a beautiful bay offering shallow waters, white sandy beaches and a beautiful mountainous backdrop! This is a remote location so there is no where to really buy food, remember to bring snacks with you! The downside is that this is often a VERY busy location and on the weekends can be extremely overcrowded!

160785287.name: Breathtaking
160785287.author: a TripAdvisor user
160785287.reviewBody: As we rounded the corner of road to the parking lot with a single vendor we were stunned at the color and beauty of this bay. As advised by others there are no services so bring all that you need with you. We gathered our things and walked down to and out into the crystal clear and warm waters. Schools of fish were swimming around our feet. We walked at least 100 yards off shore and were standing in water only over our knees. We found a spot around the side of the bay to set our towels and bathe and explore the beach. We had a fantastic day at this beach mid week, not crowded we had a whole side of beach to ourselves relaxed and enjoyed the day. Worth the 20 minute drive from town. But do come prepared with water, snacks etc as there are no services.

160449516.name: Very beautiful, calm shallow water, wade forever
160449516.author: a TripAdvisor user
160449516.reviewBody: This is the beach from which you can swim or kayak out to the famous "mushroom rock"  The bay is very protected and the water shallow.  At low tide, the water will only come up to your knees for hundreds of yards off shore.  No restaurants or bathrooms.  Some palapas, a ceviche truck, and a truck that rents kayaks for 180 pesos an hour. Great beach for children (we were warned to watch out for stingrays but no one was injured while we were there).  There seems to be many areas not far from the beach (along the rocks) ideal for snorkeling at high tide.  A great trip is to rent a kayak and paddle along the shore to your right past the mushroom rock, about three or four deserted beaches, on to Tecolote Beach, have lunch at Tecolote beach and kayak back.  That trip will take you about three hours.

159696565.name: Balandra\'s white sting rays
159696565.author: a TripAdvisor user
159696565.reviewBody: I was walking out in this lovely beach at low tide and got to the the famed rock that looks like a boulder on top of a four foot stand. I was carefully watching were I stepped and admired the schools of fish near the rocks. However, I stepped on a hidden white sting ray, which was the color of the sand and got the shock of my life. It hurt like hell and bleed for about 15 minutes. Then it felt like by calf was paralized up to the knee. The advice by the local people was to soak your foot in warm salt water. This was easy to do as you can sit near shore and keep your foot in the water. I massaged my foot for about 2 hours to get the stiffness out and ease the pain. The pain subsided in about 4 hours and then the foot felt number for another 6 hours. It was not fun and for those that venture out, you may want to wear some type of foot wear so if you do step on one, which is common, you won\'t have this pain. It is not life threatening, but you are sore the next day.

157844527.name: A nice beach ,
157844527.author: a TripAdvisor user
157844527.reviewBody: A nice beach, the one at the Costa Baja Resort is as nice, and they serve Corona.  But watch out for white sand at both.

157062355.name: Wow!
157062355.author: a TripAdvisor user
157062355.reviewBody: I literally stood for about 10 minutes just in awe of the beauty of this beach.  Sure you have to walk several feet before the water gets deeper, but it\u2019s worth it.  It\u2019s only about 15 minutes from downtown La Paz.  This is a great snorkeling spot!\n\nCloser to the evening though, watch out for tiny flies/mosquitoes that bite like crazy!

157019997.name: Perfect beach
157019997.author: a TripAdvisor user
157019997.reviewBody: Red rock hills behind, turquoise water and white sand - picture perfect beach. It is shallow water so you can walk for a while before being able to swim if the tide is low, but great for stand up paddling. Only a few palapas on the beach, no facilities so bring every thing you need. You can visit the restaurants on nearby Tecolote beach, or one on the way to Balandra. It can get busy at the weekends and holidays with La Paz residents escaping to the wonderful beach, but it is quieter other days. Spectacular scenery on the way to Balandra and around the bay to Tecolote, only about a kilometre away

156942989.name: Postcard perfect place.
156942989.author: a TripAdvisor user
156942989.reviewBody: Very calm, crystal clear water, soft white sand and a blue sky. The perfect tropical beach to relax. We initially just wanted to see the mushroom rock but was stunned by the beauty of Balandra Bay upon arrival. Any which way that we took a scenic picture, it came out postcard worthy. The mushroom rock was about 10 minutes walk to the right of the parking lot. The views made me just wanna linger a little longer. The bay is only 20 min slow drive from Costabaja Resort. Somehow, on the way back, we missed the turn to Costabaja as there were no signage indicating the turn to the resort. We ended up driving all the way across town thru the curving freeway and local streets. Took us an hour to get back to the resort but, it\'s worth the trip.

156554609.name: A little far, but worth it
156554609.author: a TripAdvisor user
156554609.reviewBody: We went there during Semana Santa (holy week) expecting it to be very crowded, and it was, but there was more than enough space for us to set up our shelter and chairs. The beach was lovely, nice clean white sand and the water was lovely, if a little cold. \n\nIf the guy selling donuts is there, I highly recommend you buy one. They are so tasty. Great beach.

156450820.name: for little kids perfect
156450820.author: a TripAdvisor user
156450820.reviewBody: Balandra is a quite large bay offering white sandy beach with some umbrellas and rocks/caves for shadow. No cost. the deepest point in the beach is maybe 1m. Absolutely save for little kids and water cristal clear ... absolute highlight.\nThe BUT/downside is - the beach is 25km away from La Paz. So you need a car o you go by the bus which stops directly at the beach(es)

156301531.name: Seemed like a sketchy drive, but well worth it.
156301531.author: a TripAdvisor user
156301531.reviewBody: Other than seeing a few pictures, we had no idea what to expect.  It was an amazing beach!  My expectations for lunch were quickly halted upon arrival.  There was a "gut truck" in the parking lot serving Marlin ceviche and Marlin Sandwiches.  We took our chances on the ceviche.  It was outstanding...from a kitchen with no real running water or refrigeration.  No diarrehea either.  I reccomment the ceviche!

155519740.name: More than the mushroom rock
155519740.author: a TripAdvisor user
155519740.reviewBody: Was a bit surprised how small the rock was, but wading in the warm turquoise water added to the adventure

154542085.name: Was there yesterday.......
154542085.author: a TripAdvisor user
154542085.reviewBody: As always, fabulous. White sand for miles, tide was out so you could almost walk across the bay and just keep your eyes out for sting rays as you SHUFFLE your feet through the water with your tennys on.....very hard to beat as your new favorite beach!

154238477.name: Breathtaking
154238477.author: a TripAdvisor user
154238477.reviewBody: Balandra is a true gem. I was there at the end of December and the water was calm and warm and sparkling. There is plenty of space on the beach although parking is limited, so taking a bus or carpooling is a great idea\n\nI did wander quite far out while the tide was out and stepped on a stingray - so, waders: be sure to do the stingray shuffle! Even the pain of that sting does not diminish my love for Balandra.

153968131.name: Beautiful
153968131.author: a TripAdvisor user
153968131.reviewBody: The beach was sandy and we could walk around the large rocks to see around the corner to the rest of the beach. It was so windy when we were there that it made the experience not as fun as it would have been. We would have spent more time there except for the wind. It was so windy that when I opened my car door to get back in, the sand blew all over the inside of our rental car. It would be a beautiful place to have a picnic if the wind was calm.

153745801.name: Beautiful beach!
153745801.author: a TripAdvisor user
153745801.reviewBody: An amazing beach,  wish I was there right now! The Best beach in La Paz! Watch out for the stingrays!

153483916.name: Most beautiful beach in La Paz
153483916.author: a TripAdvisor user
153483916.reviewBody:
By far the most beautiful each in La Paz, this place offers lounging on soft white sand as well as small "trekking" options for those who don't like to stand still all day. 

Balandra is the second last beach along the strip - turn left at the last fork instead of right toward Tecolote.  About a 25 min drive from the city. 

Balandra is in a large cove, more protected from the wind than Tecolote. The water is turquoise, and wonderfully shallow for hundreds of metres. Perfect for families with small children. 

Go with good water shoes and walk along the rocky coastline to the right of the beach to discover spectacular, almost deserted beaches. This is also where you will find the famed mushroom rock of La Paz. 

There are no restaurants or amenities here, so bring your own lunch. 

Stop at all the other beaches along the coast if you're curious, and leave Balandra last - you'll definitely want to spend the rest of your day here!

153401948.name: Wow!
153401948.author: a TripAdvisor user
153401948.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful beaches I have seen.  The water is the most beautiful aqua marine. It was just minutes from CostaBaja and worth the drive.

153315493.name: Favorite Beach
153315493.author: a TripAdvisor user
153315493.reviewBody: This spot is usually quiet and peaceful.  The water is shallow so it is perfect for little ones to play in.  There is a food vendor and a fellow that rents kayaks and snorkel gear.  The palapas are in good conditon and the beach is clean.  Good place to stop and enjoy the sun.

153230592.name: You should go
153230592.author: a TripAdvisor user
153230592.reviewBody: This place is really nice but you need a car to get there. You can take a tour to the caves or just bring your stuff. Water is clear and the beach has fine white sand.

152813257.name: Very peaceful
152813257.author: a TripAdvisor user
152813257.reviewBody: Good place for resting. Quiet, shallow, calm inlet waters. Not a great view, can\'t really see the sea. Only a roach coach for food. No restrooms.  BUT, Tecolote Beach is only 1 km away, and both are easy to get there.

152745915.name: not actually poor
152745915.author: a TripAdvisor user
152745915.reviewBody: this was not a bad beach, per se. it\'s just not great. there was a weird glistening to the water (like an oil slick?) which didn\'t tempt me to enter the water. though it started getting crowded around 1 and others were not as hesitant.

152738361.name: Balandra Beach, Go and Enjoy !
152738361.author: a TripAdvisor user
152738361.reviewBody: The beaches in La Paz may make you wish for a better beach to spent your time at.  Well, you have two awesome choices. Balandra is a great family beach, especially for younger children. You can walk in shallow water, forever almost, without fear of dropoffs or formidable waves. A very family friendly beach. There was even a snack vehicle there for those who didn\'t bring enough of their own ! An artist was there selling carved wood products at decent prices,  mid day in the middle of the week!  Enjoy ! Skippyfrizz !

152642926.name: Beautiful, but watch for stingrays!!!
152642926.author: a TripAdvisor user
152642926.reviewBody: This beach is absolutely gorgeous and peaceful, but I was stung by a stingray, which completely ruined our experience. I suppose I should have known better, but I stepped on one and it was one of the most painful experiences of my life. 10 days later, and I\'m on a aggressive cycle of cipro to cure the infection the sting caused. Do the "stingray shuffle" and beware. Once I was stung, I noticed them EVERYWHERE.

150377715.name: Pretty, but don\'t go for the snorkelling.
150377715.author: a TripAdvisor user
150377715.reviewBody: Nice white sand, and pretty if all you want to do is wade around.  Beware of little sting rays hidden in the sand, though, because if you step on one, it\'s going to be a painful experience.  If this happens to you (and it happens to plenty of people), talk to the guy running the concession truck, who will help you out for a small charge, which you will be more than happy to pay.

150134460.name: Fun day trip!
150134460.author: a TripAdvisor user
150134460.reviewBody: Hit the road and headed up to Balandra Beach!  Really cool... except for the wasps, which are everywhere because of the flowering cactus.  Of course walked out to the balanced rock for photo ops.  A few people out there, but not bad at all.  We dropped off our shoes under one of the palapas...  take them with you!!  The ground is basically lava rock once you get close to the balanced rock area.  We noticed all the little piles of sand that looked like little piles of poop!!  Evidently they is some sort of crab that constructs these.  Not really sure.  Worth the trip from La Paz or traveling in the area.  Don\'t forget to head a bit farther up the road to Tecelote Beach...!

149862566.name: Just awsome.
149862566.author: a TripAdvisor user
149862566.reviewBody: Magnificint bay and beaches.  Perfect for small children.  Spend an afternoon here, but bring what you need ( picnic, drinks, ice chest) as there are no services.  Palapas are free

149133482.name: Excellent spot for wading
149133482.author: a TripAdvisor user
149133482.reviewBody: I would recommend this beach of Telecolote Beach as it has a much larger area that you can wade around and the beach is a bit more isolated from the winds in the event of poor weather. \n\nWatch out for the birds around 4pm though, they get really hungry.

149027199.name: Perfect for SUP\'s
149027199.author: a TripAdvisor user
149027199.reviewBody: Balandra is perfect for kayaking and for SUP\'s. It was the most beautiful beach that I have visited in Mexico and would highly recommend it! Bring drinks and food as there are no restaurants as well as your snorkeling gear.

149010163.name: Perfection!  A great beach for families.  Much natural beauty.
149010163.author: a TripAdvisor user
149010163.reviewBody: This is a beautiful beach.  Feels hidden and removed - a bit of a drive outside of La Paz.  It is shallow with no waves, so perfect for kids and wading.  \nThere are kayaks for rent when we were there, which I highly recommend.  Unfortunately they are a bit expensive - about 180 pesos per hour I think.  But they are a great way to explore the cove.  Since you are also far from civilization, bring some snacks.  There is also a taco truck, which sold tasty but small marlin burritos.

148758366.name: Great beach
148758366.author: a TripAdvisor user
148758366.reviewBody: A must visit.  Shallow (waist height for hundreds of metres at low tide), clean, and not crowded in late December.  Look it up and go.

147820073.name: La Paz Beaches
147820073.author: a TripAdvisor user
147820073.reviewBody: This is a great beach. It\'s perfect for small children or kayaking in the lagoon-type area. There are a number of permanent beach palapas or umbrellas. You can also walk around a point to see the inverted rock (there is a model of it in the park opposite the cathedral in La Paz.

147264808.name: La Paz\'s Signature Beach!!
147264808.author: a TripAdvisor user
147264808.reviewBody: I say that for a simple reason, It is THE BEST BEACH!!!\nClean, peaceful, huge, the water is so clear it looks like there is no water GORGEOUS!

147029824.name: Its the prettiest beach in south Baja
147029824.author: a TripAdvisor user
147029824.reviewBody:
I drove up to Balandra from La Paz. I looked at all the beaches to the north. 
Balandra is the only one worth going to and it is really beautiful.
It is calm and the water is a stunning colour.
The sand is soft and white.
Ate delicious marlin escabeche from the beach truck.

146264223.name: Wow - neat spot
146264223.author: a TripAdvisor user
146264223.reviewBody: Balandra is a lovely place to explore - for me during slightly cooler weather. The shade palapyas were great, but the sun was too hot to spend too long exploring all the other connected and adjacent beaches.The on site kayak rentals would be a great way to get around - we had just finished a 10 day trip so were ready for something else. Water is very shallow with some potential for stings from skates - another reason to kayak.

146154270.name: Great beach
146154270.author: a TripAdvisor user
146154270.reviewBody: Totally recommendable. This beach is great for small kids. No waves and tempered water... you must leave early though or "jumanji mosquitos" will eat you up!

145691193.name: Peaceful
145691193.author: a TripAdvisor user
145691193.reviewBody: This beach was calming and relaxing we walked along it during low tide. I picked up several sea shells and only a couple of families were out enjoying the day.

144172740.name: Stunning Beach
144172740.author: a TripAdvisor user
144172740.reviewBody: We visited Balandra  by boat a few years ago and went by land last weekend.  We helped with a beach clean up and were reminded how beautiful Balandra Beach is.  There are kayaks available to rent, a food cart and palapas on the beach for shade.  A great family beach.

142602882.name: Ballandra is a Paradise Found
142602882.author: a TripAdvisor user
142602882.reviewBody: This is one of my favorite beaches in the world.  I try to go at least once a month for that feeling of "being away" and in more Caribbean style waters than where I live on the Pacific side. This bay is gorgeous.....the rock formations meeting the sea make for some interesting snorkeling.  There are lots of little fish everywhere and I\'ve seen tons of jumping fish as well.  The water is the clearest you can imagine (if it\'s not too windy a day which stirs things up), and you can walk out really really far and the water will still be at your knees.  Great for kids......except for some caution....there are definitely seasons for jelly fish...which are invisible to us.  You might experience some tingling, slightly stingy feelings anywhere on your body while submerged in water....that would be jelly fish.  You also have to do the stingray shuffle as you walk out, so as not to surprise one of the little creatures blending in with the sand color.  And on my last trip there a couple of days ago, both my friend and I had a new experience there....we were both bitten or pinched by what seemed to be a crab claw..but not sure....as it disappeared back in the sand. The pain was excruciating and didn\'t go away til about an hour passed. My toes swelled up and I saw 3 separate bumps where I got nabbed.   Do not put ice on it like I did....it made it worse.\nThis beach has a lot of local support to save it from development.  It would be tragic to see this pristine habitat and environment become yet another mega resort or god knows what else.  It has remained one of the most untouched easily accessible beaches the public has enjoyed for so many years.  It\'s charming that the ice cream guy pushes his cart through the turquoise waters....it\'s charming that in the high season, there\'s a guy selling cold fresh fruit in cups with hot sauce.  They just added some portapotties...but they are worse than finding a place in nature....disgusting condition and obviously not maintained.  I hope they take them away.\n We usually bring chairs, beach blanket, ice chest full of drinks and lunches, and most of the time we get lucky and grab one of the scattered palapas to sit under.  If they are all taken we set up our own umbrellas close to the water. There is also a food truck parked in the parking lot most of the time....and kayak and raft rentals during the season.

142568764.name: So Beautiful!!
142568764.author: a TripAdvisor user
142568764.reviewBody: The water was very peaceful and nice.  The different blue colors of the water was breathtaking!  The water was not deep and there were no big currents or waves.  My 18 month old was able to sit and play in the water as if it was a pool!!  It was gorgeous!  No restaurants or hotels close, you will have to go to La Paz (15 minutes away) for that.  So be sure to bring a cooler with snacks and drinks and stay the afternoon.

140069691.name: SERENE
140069691.author: a TripAdvisor user
140069691.reviewBody: Balandra beach was essentially deserted :)  The water clear and perfect for snorkeling.  It was my fist time snorkeling...I was NOT dissapointed!

137259931.name: Beautiful beach ,leave before sunset !!
137259931.author: a TripAdvisor user
137259931.reviewBody: Georgeous spot with powder white sand . Water can be shallow due to tides . Bugs get bad towards sunset so best to head out before . Be careful about the Stingrays - do the shuffle and you will be ok . A good place to kayak and spend a little time under a Palapa .

136940416.name: Peaceful, serene and beautiful.
136940416.author: a TripAdvisor user
136940416.reviewBody: This beach is a short bus ride from La Paz. The beach is what everyone thinks of when you think of a beach in Baja California, white sand and clear blue water. This is the quieter of the two beaches but calmer water as well. It wasn\'t crowded the day we went and there was only one taco truck so bring you\'re own food and drink when you come.

136743523.name: Ballandra Beach
136743523.author: a TripAdvisor user
136743523.reviewBody: Yes a great beach but not so sure that I would put it in the worlds top ten.   You dont have to go far for a better one.  Just south at the bottom  of La Ventana Bay opposite Isla Cerralvo walk north to the Light House end after parking at the old hotel-simply stunning.

136741607.name: Careful with kids here , lots of stingrays .
136741607.author: a TripAdvisor user
136741607.reviewBody:
We had the misfortune of getting stung by a stingray here. Apparently the fishermen clean there fish in this bay and this  as well as the calm waters is ideal for stingrays.
My son was stung and it is incredibly painfull, local remedy is to immerse the foot in very hot water with viniger ( or urine )  , then try and work out the barb by massage a gentle motion towards the exit wound.
Shuffle your feet on the bottom here as they bury themselves in the sand and are perfectly hidden. 
Other than this it really is a spectacular place.

136739730.name: Totally worth the drive!
136739730.author: a TripAdvisor user
136739730.reviewBody: We took a somewhat long day-trip from Cabo and worked our way around the different beaches near La Paz. This place was gorgeous! Absolutely beautiful!

136191520.name: Best Bay/Beach ever
136191520.author: a TripAdvisor user
136191520.reviewBody: so calm, shallow, peaceful.  Please get there earlier in the day as the afternoon the beach area became more crowded (not more than 100 people)

134222117.name: A little slice of paradise
134222117.author: a TripAdvisor user
134222117.reviewBody: This is a tidal beach and you can practically walk to the far shore at low tide. At high tide it\'s perfect for swimming. Lots of locals go here and the smaller children were a delight to watch.

134034752.name: The most beautiful bay in Mexico!
134034752.author: a TripAdvisor user
134034752.reviewBody: Balandra Bay is a MUST for anyone who visits the La Paz area. When the tide is low you can walk almost all the way across this calm, sandy bay and the always shallow water makes it a perfect experience for the little ones.

133977627.name: Hello hongo!
133977627.author: a TripAdvisor user
133977627.reviewBody: Beautiful as it seems in the countless photos. We enjoyed Balandra Beach in a peaceful working day, early May. Simply amazing and deserted. Great pictures, great relax.

133910634.name: beautiful, peaceful, perfect
133910634.author: a TripAdvisor user
133910634.reviewBody: Wonderful setting: a little inlet surrounded by cliffs. crystal clear water, that is shallow and calm enough to walk all the way across. The crowds were light; it didn\'t seem to get the same traffic as other beaches in the area, but was definitely the most beautiful beach in the area.

132494325.name: Wow. BEAUTIFUL PEACEFUL BEACH!!
132494325.author: a TripAdvisor user
132494325.reviewBody: So beautiful & clean. Kayak, snorkel, chill under a palapa, this is the most peaceful spot. Bring drinks, picnic etc, or sometimes theres a little fish taco truck. I loved this beach best of the four we visited!

132402148.name: This is probably the best beach in Baja, perhaps all of Mexico. The waters are warm and shallow, scenery is spectacular
132402148.author: a TripAdvisor user
132402148.reviewBody: Check out Benjamin\'s kayak rentals. This guy is a card!

132335714.name: Balandra Beauty!
132335714.author: a TripAdvisor user
132335714.reviewBody: This is one of the most photographed beaches in the world.  When you come here and dive into the clear, warm water and walk upon the sugar, sand soft beaches, you will soon know why. This is as good as it gets, anywhere in the world.  Balandra is the perfect bay to just relax and recharge your batteries for the day or weekend.  You can also travel by boat to over 100 different bays, all with about an hour from this incredible beach.  You really owe it to yourself to discover Balandra Beach! Also, an excellent place to dive for clams, enjoy!

131700184.name: Refreshilngy isolated
131700184.author: a TripAdvisor user
131700184.reviewBody: When we were here there was no one anywhere.  The beach is clear, beautiful and untouched!  Do not miss the place dreams are made of

131195327.name: Scenic
131195327.author: a TripAdvisor user
131195327.reviewBody: A quiet, tremendously scenic beach with a single mobile concession truck, rentable kayaks and free-use palapas. Many locals enjoy this beach. At low tide, one can walk (or paddle) across the entire bay to remote beaches. Sunsets are memorable. I can\'t think of anything I would add to make it better. About an easy 20 minute drive from downtown La Paz.

130493216.name: My new favorite beach!!
130493216.author: a TripAdvisor user
130493216.reviewBody: This is such an amazing place. It is so pristine, the sand is fine and stark white.  The water is only about knee high forever, a perfect place for kids.  Tends to be windy in the earlier, before noon, but winds died down and it was near perfection. No facilities, but Tecelote Beach is just around the corner( by car) for lunch or snacks.  Sat under one of the many palapas and just relaxed and enjoyed the spectacular view.

129957439.name: Clear calm beach and not to touristy.
129957439.author: a TripAdvisor user
129957439.reviewBody: This beach is so pristine and beautiful. It\'s not crowded. The water is so calm and not to cold but is not warm. They sell excellent fish tacos and u can rent a kayak and snorkel. The little fish swim around u just be careful for stingrays I was told but I didn\'t see any. No need for umbrellas there are plenty of palapas. Ou can walk far out it starts off very shallow for miles. Have fun!!

128430877.name: lovely peaceful beach
128430877.author: a TripAdvisor user
128430877.reviewBody: We spent a wonderful day at this beach it is absolutely beautiful, we rented two kayaks and went across to the other side ten minutes by kayak lovely white sand and very clean clear waters.

128167955.name: Beautiful
128167955.author: a TripAdvisor user
128167955.reviewBody: We went on Easter Sunday (!!!!) and even then it was not overcrowded. In the morning the tide was higher- to our waist- and later it came halfway to our knees. We took a cooler and rented an umbrella, This beach is soooooooooo clean. There are no paalapa restaurants there, so bring your own food and drinks! (There were port-o-potties, but I think it may have been just for Semana Santa)>

128071012.name: Great place to go during the week
128071012.author: a TripAdvisor user
128071012.reviewBody: Really crowded on weekends but lots of fun to walk the beach, enjoy the view & have a cold beer and some fairly good Mexican food.

128018097.name: Laid back beach
128018097.author: a TripAdvisor user
128018097.reviewBody: Everyone we spoke to recommended Balandra Beach as the beach to go to near La Paz. We were there on Easter Sunday and it was very mellow and mostly families. The water is very shallow and there aren\'t any waves - so might not suit everyone\'s taste. There was a truck selling food and a few vendors walking the beach - otherwise it\'s all sand and water.

127776470.name: One of the Favorite Beaches in La Paz
127776470.author: a TripAdvisor user
127776470.reviewBody: Small but is very quaint.  Offers shallow water great for swimming and kayaking or just wading.  Look out for Stingrays shuffle as you walk.  Is location of the famous Mushroom rock.  There are many small beaches close and on the other side which makes this so perfect.  Also, beware of the sand fleas that come out in the late afternoon you will look like you have the measles. hahaha Good area to explore with a mangrove to kayak into.

127703514.name: A must see
127703514.author: a TripAdvisor user
127703514.reviewBody: Most picture perfect place I may have ever seen. It\'s amazing, the one picture from my trip that I show everyone!!

127551116.name: Great place for kayaking and snorkeling - very safe
127551116.author: a TripAdvisor user
127551116.reviewBody: The water is crystal clear and because it is a small lagoon it is very safe. Be sure to go a high tide or near high tide. At low tide, this pretty much empties out.

662039851.name: World class beach
662039851.author: a TripAdvisor user
662039851.reviewBody: Other than the fact that it\'s shallow for a long way out into the water, this is one of the best beaches that I\'ve ever been to. The restaurant was good, the drinks were good. We rented beach chairs and an umbrella. It was paradise!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

660842990.name: Nice lunch spot
660842990.author: a TripAdvisor user
660842990.reviewBody: We left Balandra Beach to spend the rest of the day at Tecolote.  We had lunch there, and quickly realized this isn\'t really a "hanging out" type of beach, more of a beautiful lunch spot.  We spent about an hour here, and then drove back to Balandra Beach.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

658626481.name: Small beach
658626481.author: a TripAdvisor user
658626481.reviewBody: This is a small beach, but that\u2019s ok, as we were the only visitors there. No palapa, but we brought an umbrella.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

657914393.name: Great Beach wish I could say the same about the restaurant
657914393.author: a TripAdvisor user
657914393.reviewBody: Loved the beach especially if you\'re willing to walk a couple hundred yards you can have it all to yourself. The restaurant service was very slow, the food wasn\'t very good and it was fairly expensive by Mexican standards.They have the market cornered and they know it appears.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

657256098.name: Nice beach
657256098.author: a TripAdvisor user
657256098.reviewBody: Nice beach with restaurant and washrooms.   You can rent chairs and parasols and have a nice lunch and/or drinks.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

648021464.name: Shrimp tacos
648021464.author: a TripAdvisor user
648021464.reviewBody: Best shrimp tacos in La Paz the facilities are poor but the view fantastic. Very cheap. Margarita\u2019s are also good

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

647231243.name: Very good good
647231243.author: a TripAdvisor user
647231243.reviewBody: I ordered the chicken fajitas and thought they were excellent. Margaritas were very good as well. And all at a decent price.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

641375096.name: Endless stretch of sandy beach
641375096.author: a TripAdvisor user
641375096.reviewBody:
Crystal clear waters, shoreline perfect for sun worshippers and sea shell hunters you can easily spend the day here. 

A couple of restaurants on the beach offering great menus with local and familiar yummies.  

Boat tours, kayaking, jet skis - all easily available. It’s about 30 min or so from the malecon area of La Paz. 

If you want to unplug and enjoy the beach, you’ll love this gem.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

639804608.name: This is a spectacular beach!
639804608.author: a TripAdvisor user
639804608.reviewBody:
This is a spectacularly nice beach!  Flat, nice sand, and great views of Isla Espiritu Santo to the north.

It was VERY windy when we were there, so we did not go in.  Beach is flat - there were people 40 yards offshore with water up to their thighs.

We were there on December 9 - the beach was not lonely but definitely was NOT crowded.  Once we got 100 yards from the bus stop we probably saw 10-15 people tops over the course of a couple hours.

Take the bus from the Malecon in La Paz to the end of the road.  Literally.  

Tecolote has several restaurants and restrooms, while nearby Balandra Beach does not.  The restaurants don't look very imposing - the architecture is kind of "this is a beach in Mexico whatever we can nail or staple together".  

There are several places right there where the bus let's you off.  However, a local we met at the hotel told us to turn to our left, find the lonely place about 400 yards away in that direction and go there - simple family business.  We followed his advice and were glad we did - the place is called Restaurant Bar Isla Partida (but you pretty much have to be there to see the sign) - just turn left and head for the large building/shack at the left end of the beach).  Simple and inexpensive sea food.

This was a great way to spend an afternoon.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

638640639.name: Great beach- with a bar!
638640639.author: a TripAdvisor user
638640639.reviewBody: Balandra is beautiful, but we were ready for a bar when we reached El Tecolote!  The water is beautiful and seemed very swimmable (we were busy drinking).  FYI- we walked from Balandra to El Tecolote and it took about 30 minutes.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

635118167.name: Very nice
635118167.author: a TripAdvisor user
635118167.reviewBody: Nice beach with restaurants .. Chairs and umbrellas are  available for rent..Nice meals available with some of the freshest fish i ever had

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

631094561.name: Fun spot
631094561.author: a TripAdvisor user
631094561.reviewBody: The water is crystal clear and blue as anywhere. Great place to swim, have a bite to eat and relax. Worth the effort to get there.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

630822643.name: Best Beach bar of all time.
630822643.author: a TripAdvisor user
630822643.reviewBody: Best Beach bar of all time. The most amazing blue green water I\'ve ever seen, Great bar with great food have a Margarita from the gas powered blender!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

629104653.name: Not quiet
629104653.author: a TripAdvisor user
629104653.reviewBody: A windy  beach. Is beautiful and next to balandra beach, the problem is that there are a lot of restaurants and the jet skis are making noise all the time. The cars get to close to the beach.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

628554707.name: Windy, exposed beach, but not overcrowded
628554707.author: a TripAdvisor user
628554707.reviewBody: You can catch the Aquila bus to Playa El Tecolote from La Paz. You pass Balandra on the way. Balandra is a beautiful beach protected from chop and wind, but it is very crowded. Tecolote is a wide open beach with plenty of space for all, but it faces the predominant wind so it is not as peaceful a day as you might expect.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

618564635.name: Close to the sun in the blue sea
618564635.author: a TripAdvisor user
618564635.reviewBody: Free beach, white sand, blue and green sea: what more? Typical Mexican food on the beach, small restaurant. The sun is quite violent, beware!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

599433044.name: Perfect beach day
599433044.author: a TripAdvisor user
599433044.reviewBody: We took an uber from our hotel, La Concha Beach Resort reviewed separately. The driver stopped at Balandra beach which was packed. It\u2019s a no-service beach, not for us. Tecolote beach,  up the road, offered us everything. A long stretch of beautiful sandy beach, perfect turquoise water for swimming and excellent service at one of several restaurants. For a minimum purchase of food or drinks (500 pesos) we had use of the table, large palapa, and chairs. Our server was attentive but not meddlesome.
