Same for local vendors and we enjoyed buying fresh mango and pineapple cups. We arrived at 11 am and hitched a ride back to our hotel at 7 pm with locals, because we couldn\u2019t connect with uber and missed the last bus. A perfect beach day.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

598574384.name: Beautiful, calm waters with little traffic
598574384.author: a TripAdvisor user
598574384.reviewBody: I took a road trip from Cabo San Lucas, to this beach. 2 hour trip on a well maintained road. Was able to do seadoo activities, a lot of space to hang out, not a lot of traffic. There isn\u2019t many places to eat, however what is available is good enough. Maybe coming prepared. Didn\u2019t see any restrooms around. There is another beautiful location around the \u201ccorner\u201d which is head is like a cover. \n\nEnjoy

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

597908387.name: Take a cooler!
597908387.author: a TripAdvisor user
597908387.reviewBody: After a disappointing visit to Balandra Beach, our guide took us here. Our three teens in the group completely enjoyed this beach. Easy waves, clean sand, lots of shells, some vendors, bathrooms and shade for purchase is available. One table with 4 chairs and umbrella cost us $10. Need to use the bathroom? 10 pesos please. Take a cooler stocked with fav beverages and snacks. There was space for everyone. My only complaint, we didn\'t spend enough time there!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

593557917.name: A few tips for this beach
593557917.author: a TripAdvisor user
593557917.reviewBody: If you bring your own food and drinks you will love this beach.  The water is clear and clean.  The blue bud light restaurant we went to was awful.  Also bring your own shade or rent a palapa from the lady at the farthest building/restaurant to the right when you face the water.  She was very friendly and said we could bring anything we wanted to the palapa we rented.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

590373872.name: Great beach
590373872.author: a TripAdvisor user
590373872.reviewBody: If you love great seafood, this is your hangout.    The water is beautiful and there are quite a few water sports available.  Only issue is if you want a palabra it will cost you!!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

589870339.name: spend the day here
589870339.author: a TripAdvisor user
589870339.reviewBody: chill beach with a great view of espirito santos island. if you\'re adventures you can climb up to the cave!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

589767828.name: Overpriced restaurants, but good snorkeling
589767828.author: a TripAdvisor user
589767828.reviewBody: Head to the far left end of the beach for good snorkeling around to the next cove. Restaurants are loud, and serve overpriced and bland food. Bring your own lunch.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

588545619.name: Great place
588545619.author: a TripAdvisor user
588545619.reviewBody: Worth the drive from Cabo. Great beach with seaside restaurants. Kinda off the beaten path.  Close to la Paz. About 2 hours from Cabo

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

578162418.name: Big, hot beach
578162418.author: a TripAdvisor user
578162418.reviewBody: Tecolote is the beach you will be recommended to visit; however, Balandra may be a better option if you look for something scenic. Tecolote is basically a very long beach with no shade and pretty shallow water. Cafes on the beach are very overpriced; you are better off bringing your own food or at least beer.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

576586651.name: Beautiful Beach
576586651.author: a TripAdvisor user
576586651.reviewBody: El Tecolote beach is going to be the closest place were you could get something to eat if you\'re thinking on visiting Balandra Beach or stay at Tecolote Beach, there are a few restaurants and yours available.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

574252041.name: Attractive Beach
574252041.author: a TripAdvisor user
574252041.reviewBody: This is a very nice beach with attractive dunes and good sea shell collecting.  It is not as well protected as other beaches so it can get a bit windy.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

571799940.name: Fun Funky Beach
571799940.author: a TripAdvisor user
571799940.reviewBody: This is a fun spot to visit...it\'s a little funky though. Rebequita\'s Tours offers a trip to Espiritu Santo for around $50pp. Cheap beers and beautiful views!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

571376057.name: Lots of great beaches!
571376057.author: a TripAdvisor user
571376057.reviewBody: Nice beach but if you go a little farther into the sand dunes you will probably find an empty, or almost empty beach.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

567023020.name: The Food Outstanding, The Service Lacking
567023020.author: a TripAdvisor user
567023020.reviewBody: This is a really cool little place.  The food was fresh, well prepared and on point.  Unfortunately, we got the grumpy and snotty server.  We will go back because the food was so great.  Stay clear of the grumpy guy.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

566162312.name: Good swim spot
566162312.author: a TripAdvisor user
566162312.reviewBody: Nice sea glass and swim. It could use some upgrades, the facilities are there, but not the most attractive.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

565569895.name: Clean, long beach, great for swimming or hanging out
565569895.author: a TripAdvisor user
565569895.reviewBody:
The beach is great for swimming, with nice sand and very mild waves, maybe possible to body surf a little on a windy day. You can wade out maybe 30 meters and be only waist deep, with a very gradual drop off and crystal clear waters. When we were there people were watching a whale with binoculars. The beach faces Isla Spiritus Sanctus.  

There is a trail to Balandra, but it is not in great condition and the path down to Balandra is a little hard to find. (If you try it, wear good shoes and budget about 35 minutes from the main parking area.)

There are several nice little restaurants right on the beach, some quite good, like Palapa Azul (try one of their chocolate clam dishes), and at least one horrible one, Bar El Técoloté  (our worst food ever in Mexico) - go to one of the other restaurants/bars and listen to Bar El Técoloté’s loud classic rock mix for free if you want, but avoid their horrible service, food, and outrageous hidden charges (170 pesos because we ate under a palapa!)

There is lots of free parking, or you can take the scenic 40 minute bus ride from La Paz for 100 pesos round trip.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

564642631.name: Tecolote Beach
564642631.author: a TripAdvisor user
564642631.reviewBody: Easy bus ride to the beach.  Able to use umbrella\u2019s and chairs at a restaurant if we ordered food and drink - great service, lovely beach.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

563988290.name: Beach trip with Friends
563988290.author: a TripAdvisor user
563988290.reviewBody: This was an all day excursion with a group of 25. We stopped at Bandalera Bay first.  There are no facilities there.  The beach is beautiful and calm water. Lots of fish nice stop. Only a few miles away was the much anticipated Tecalote  Beach, don\'t get me wrong the beach is beautiful and so many choices of where to eat unfortunately we stopped at the first one with the huge palapa.  Although the guys came out and directed our bus to this area I believe that 25 people at one time was overwhelming. The chips and guacamole were disappointing as the chips were not homemade the guacamole was fabulous. The red snapper was fresh and delicious. service was very slow and it took forever to get my beer and a shot.  The beach was wonderful the water warm for a February day.  It was quite the excursion from Cabo.  Yes I would go back and take a picnic lunch.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

563431343.name: Coconut prawns and Marguerita....take me back there
563431343.author: a TripAdvisor user
563431343.reviewBody: Fascinating beach with great island views. Lots of huge Yankee mobile homes at one end and beach bars at the other end. Have a Pacifico and relax.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

563069838.name: Nice place. A bit oversold
563069838.author: a TripAdvisor user
563069838.reviewBody:
We got a ride with friends in one direction, and took a bus back to LA Paz after visiting both Tecalote and Balandra beaches.
Tecalote is more of an ocean front type beach with waves and wind exposure. It is long, and largely uninhabited for those who like exploratory walks.  We walked a couple of kilometers. There are some enclaves of wilderness campers squatting on the beach.
A couple of restaurants offering bar food and rickety chaise lounge rentals are located at the parking lot.
I think that Balandra Beach is a safer beach for small children. The sand and surf at Bay Of The Dead Beach are also contenders for a visit. We didn't stay too long.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

561344175.name: Gorgeous beach, great margaritas
561344175.author: a TripAdvisor user
561344175.reviewBody: We drove up to tecolte beach from la Paz, great road and so uninhabited.  We had margaritas in our beach chairs, attentive but not intrusive staff.  You can see the south end of Espiritu Santos across the water, very chilled day.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

561314188.name: Amazing beach in La Paz
561314188.author: a TripAdvisor user
561314188.reviewBody: This is one of many beautiful beaches in La Paz. It offers restaurants and activities for the family. It also has restrooms and open showers for a quick rinse.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

560885089.name: Best fish tacos!
560885089.author: a TripAdvisor user
560885089.reviewBody: The fish tacos are grilled, the cerviche is fresh and the beer is cold! Just perfect. You need a car to get there. Some people took a taxi and had the guy return to pick them up but that might be a bit risky.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

560677530.name: Excellent food
560677530.author: a TripAdvisor user
560677530.reviewBody:
We came to take a tour to Isla Espíritu but it was too windy that day. I'm glad they're safety conscious. 

So we had lunch at Palapa Azul. Incredibly good! We both had Tacos Gobernador which was three good sized tacos stuffed with so much shrimp I could barely eat all of it. Each taco was two apparently hand made corn tortillas fried a bit on the grill then filled with the shrimp, cheese and salsa. Also included a small salad.
About  $9US.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

558658389.name: One of a kind beach ... La Playa
558658389.author: a TripAdvisor user
558658389.reviewBody:
Tecalote is a beautiful beach and worth hanging at.

The beach is very gradual into the water
and the scenery is impeccable.

Across the water is Isla Spiritu Santos.

Tours can be taken to get a feel of the island.

Tecalote beach has numerous restaurants and bars.

Also many shade Palapas to use for free.

When looking from beach to shore you see beautiful rugged mountains... defintily a photo opportunity..
Its the type of hills that you could swear the apache are hiding in there and watching you.

Tecalote is approximately a 40 minute drive from La Paz.

Also take a side trip to Balandra which is about a 10 minute drive from there.

If I was informative... leave me a helpful vote.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

554671846.name: Awesome Beach
554671846.author: a TripAdvisor user
554671846.reviewBody: Good sand, nice water. Few people. You have to walk out a bit far into the water before it gets deep enough to swim. There are barely any waves. No big waves. It\'s a nice beach.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

553878264.name: turquoise seas
553878264.author: a TripAdvisor user
553878264.reviewBody: We stopped by for a beer. There are a few bars here. Was Very windy. Jet ski rentals and beach loungers available.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

550208885.name: Great day at the beach
550208885.author: a TripAdvisor user
550208885.reviewBody: it is right next to Balandra beach.   We stopped there first but it was low tide,  no bathrooms, food,  and the huts were all taken.  But at Tecolote we had restaurants,  beach chairs, tables and umbrellas right on the beach.  Not to mention it had waves!!  Its the perfect setting for a lazy beach day with all the amenities needed to feel comfortable. \nTable and chairs on the beach $200 pesos, and beach chairs are $150 pesos.  The food is pretty good and you have a waiter bringing you drinks to the water. Not bad. \nHighly recommend it.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

546900421.name: Like a Caribbean Beach Bar
546900421.author: a TripAdvisor user
546900421.reviewBody: We visited Balandra Beachfirst and then moved on to Tecolote Beach for lunch.  It was a pretty windy day but we sat outside and totally enjoyed the gorgeous turquoise water with some vigorous waves.  The color of water and soft white sand is what you would expect at an Akumal Beach Bar rather than in the Baja.  AND, our fajitas were delicious!   Certainly worth a trip when visiting La Paz!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

544494686.name: Beautiful, laid back atmosphere
544494686.author: a TripAdvisor user
544494686.reviewBody: I was staying in La Paz for a couple of weeks, and I discovered that you could jump on a super cool little local bus and go out to this awesome beach, round trip for 100 pesos! It was an amazing place to swim, super clear water, and sandy beach, but the best part of all was hanging out in the beach bars out there! Super laid back and I met lots of really nice people. A real slice of life in the Baja! Even on a Sunday when it\'s full of Mexican family\'s, it\'s totally fun out there, great vibes, I\'ll be back!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

543189701.name: Gorgeous beach, fun spot
543189701.author: a TripAdvisor user
543189701.reviewBody:
We caught the bus to and from La Paz tourist centre to the beach. It was an enjoyable ride and both bus and beach were not busy at all.

The drinks were great - the kids enjoyed a fresh still lemonade, we had piña coladas and limon margaritas. 

The beach itself is beautiful but we were a little apprehensive to get in the water as there had recently been an large number of tiny clear jelly fish come into the water. Our daughter was stung badly a few days earlier at Magote so we didn't want to go through that again! We did however bring the vinegar which we gave to other unfortunate beach goers who did get stung.  Another lady got stung by a sting ray which are apparently quite small and hide in the sand in the shoreline.

It is a fun spot but quite commercial so don't go if you think it's going to be a quiet day at the beach (there was Latin music going the whole time - which we loved and felt added to atmosphere).

We enjoyed seeing what the passing merchants had to offer and bought a few bits and pieces.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

543182244.name: Beautiful! Drink at Palapa Azul
543182244.author: a TripAdvisor user
543182244.reviewBody: The owner and bartenders at Palapa Azul were SO incredibly nice. They moved chairs into the sun for us, brought a little table over when we got ceviche from the palapa next door, and took all our bottles and plates off the beach as soon as we finished. One bartender even helped me brush my feet off before we left! Hilarious. We met a few other travelers there that we ended up becoming friends with and spending the whole next day with. When we returned to Tecolote and Palapa Azul on our last day, the owner came over and told us how cool it was to watch us make friends yesterday and said thats what his palapa is all about! Great service, great crowd and 1 US dollar for a cerveza!!! Can\'t go wrong. Ps you can rent jetskis at this beach too if thats your thing.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

537526851.name: Better than Balandra...in my opinion
537526851.author: a TripAdvisor user
537526851.reviewBody: So when we arrived to the beach early before noon, we were told for chair rental was a fee of $250 pesos whether we consumed food or beverages. We decided to stay and we enjoyed it too much!!! The tide was not low and the current was not strong at all. I was able to swim far out and enjoyed the views. We decided to get ceviche from the stand and it was sooo good. We got to drink Pacificos all the time and we miss it :(   This beach it\'s well preserve now, however while I was relaxing, I observed many tourist picking the shells from the beach and pocketing them. I hope the authorities and the locals can protect this natural habitat better as the ecosystem needs to continue to thrive. After few hours we decided to check out Balandra beach and we were disappointed. At the end of the day we figured to continue to explore other sites along the roads. Now, we can look back and hope to comeback to this beach again and admire its beauty.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

534142755.name: Private Gem
534142755.author: a TripAdvisor user
534142755.reviewBody: Decollate Beach is on of the finer places to go when in La Paz BCS.  The beach is crystal clear and beautiful for swimming and just plane relaxing.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

532176339.name: Out of everything
532176339.author: a TripAdvisor user
532176339.reviewBody: We went out for the day they charge  300 pesos just to set down to eat at one of there tables we ordered shrimp tacos it was like they cut one shrimp to make 4 shrimps they were all batter no meat. Every time we needed anything we had to go fined someone so for 6 tacos and 2 drinks it cost 1200 pesos I would not recommen this place to no one and I live in la Paz the beach is great and beautiful. They were out of everything we Tryed to order. Please eat before you go to the beach.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

529748237.name: Great beach for early morning
529748237.author: a TripAdvisor user
529748237.reviewBody: We went in early morning with less people and the water was warm and beautiful!  There are a few restaurants and rentals but not open until 11 am so it is quiet and peaceful in the morning.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

528345947.name: AMAZING
528345947.author: a TripAdvisor user
528345947.reviewBody: This beach is to die for! The water is so clear, you can see the fish swim right by you.. They have Jet ski\'s for rent.. we came back at night and looked at the stars.. I couldn\'t believe how clear they were.. I have never experienced anything like it!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

516052122.name: Favorite beach
516052122.author: a TripAdvisor user
516052122.reviewBody: We camped in this beach for the winter ten years in a row - love it, love it, love it. Nowadays I just love to drive out for a swim and a play with our dogs.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

514853882.name: Beautiful Beach
514853882.author: a TripAdvisor user
514853882.reviewBody: We stopped here because Balandra Beach was super packed. It was nice and it seemed to have more vendors and rental gear.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

510994878.name: Beautiful beach
510994878.author: a TripAdvisor user
510994878.reviewBody: We decided to drive to this beach because balandra beach was packed. We rented shade covers and tables for 12 people for about $20. We also brought our food and BBQ. I wish I would have brought a Bluetooth speaker. The water is fun to swim in, and is easy for kids to swim in because of the lack of waves. There is bar on the beach and plenty of snack stands. The bathrooms are gross. We spent 8 hours there swimming. Would not recommend going in August way to hot.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

510529421.name: Very nice beach!
510529421.author: a TripAdvisor user
510529421.reviewBody: We spent about 6 hours at Playa El Tecolote (on a Sunday). The beach is very pretty and a busy place for families.  I would suggest getting there before noon, as it began to get busy as the day moved on. The water was warm and turquoise in color with a white sand beach.  As others have mentioned, the Espiritu Santo island just adds to the character of this beach.\nThe drive from downtown La Paz is a two lane road, so if you are renting a car know that it is a windy road.  Also plan to park a little way from the beach (even though spots up front are available), because we parked right behind the bars and found that others had parked right behind us blocking us in.  I would add this as a must do while in LaPaz!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

508236230.name: Beautiful water
508236230.author: a TripAdvisor user
508236230.reviewBody: Beautiful beach with amazing waves!!! The Sea of Cortez is absolutely amazing place to see in your life!!!" Lots of restaurants by the beach!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

502648847.name: Beautiful swimming beach
502648847.author: a TripAdvisor user
502648847.reviewBody: The beach is very nice, quiet and safe. A lot of tours take you to the Isla Espiritu Santo, where you can snorkel with the sea lions. We did not like the one organized by the restaurant Tecolote, they made us wait a lot of time for the boat. After the refund, we went just a few steps further on the beach: the tour was great, very well organized and on time.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

498057090.name: The best place in the world for lunch!
498057090.author: a TripAdvisor user
498057090.reviewBody: I LOVE Tecolote beach. I have visited Tecolote at least 6-8 times and each time, I am thrilled to be there! The white sand beaches and clear water,  and views of Espiritu Santo island make it and ideal place to visit.  I always order totopos and guacamole for an appetizer and the whole fried pargo fish for lunch.  IT IS amazing!!! It feels like you are in a tv commercial to visit here, not even close to real it is so beautiful. I have eaten a dent eh big palapa and also the blue boat restaurant and both are wonderful.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

494987976.name: Perfect day trip beach hopping
494987976.author: a TripAdvisor user
494987976.reviewBody: We originally were going to Balandra beach but it was so packed we couldn\'t even park our car. So about 4 miles further we discovered Playa El Tecolote. It was amazing white sands and a perfect view of Isla Espiritu Santo. Mango Margaritas were going down smooth and the fish tacos were some of the best I\'ve had!! You won\'t be disappointed!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

494783809.name: Tacos and umbrellas
494783809.author: a TripAdvisor user
494783809.reviewBody: This beach had it all from adventure sports rentals to clear water for snorkeling to fish tacos . This was a popular place but not over packed.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

488055364.name: Great Location, Excellent Service, Good Food
488055364.author: a TripAdvisor user
488055364.reviewBody: We spent the day here while taking a break from fishing in May.  It\'s right on a beautiful sandy beach about a 20 minute ride from La Paz city center.  There are tables inside, or in the sand right on the beach with umbrellas for shade.  The staff couldn\'t do enough for us.  After arranging tables, chairs and umbrellas to accommodate our group of eight they brought us what seemed a never ending supply of whatever we ordered; buckets of beer, margaritas, fish tacos, quesadillas and chicken fajitas.  All very good.  At the end of the day we were all surprised at how inexpensive the feast had been. Incredible. There also was an assortment of water toys nearby for rent and locals enjoying the Sunday sun provided endless fun and entertainment.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

479326962.name: Really enjoyed visiting this beach on a Sunday
479326962.author: a TripAdvisor user
479326962.reviewBody: Great beach for families and couples, some quite parts and some busier ones, great spot for lunch wile the kids are playing on the beach and in the Ocean

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

475410288.name: Dirty, noisy version of Balandro
475410288.author: a TripAdvisor user
475410288.reviewBody: This place was nasty.  After visiting Balandro I wouldn\'t come within a mile of this beach.  Not nice in the slightest.  Got there and turned around as soon as I saw it

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

472777577.name: Good for relaxed swimming
472777577.author: a TripAdvisor user
472777577.reviewBody: This beach is just a few miles past Balandra. The water is clear and beautiful and better for swimming. There are a few restaurants and a kayak rental plus bathrooms. Some restaurants played loud music but it was still relaxing. Not crowded. We had fish ceviche tostadas and fish tacos with Pacifico beer and great limonada.  I would go again!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

471466932.name: Nice beach, good food
471466932.author: a TripAdvisor user
471466932.reviewBody: This beach is not as nice as Balandra, nor is it as much visited. A narrower beach and a bit rocky in some parts but still lots of sandy areas to settle down.  Water is warm and is fairly shallow for quite a ways so it would be good for children.  Had the stuffed clams at one of the restaurants and it was very, very good.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

470856278.name: Average beach
470856278.author: a TripAdvisor user
470856278.reviewBody: This beach is about a 40 minute drive away from La Paz.  The road is being worked on so there could be some delays. Also, there is a port near there so there are lots of big trucks speeding on the two lane road. One you pass the port, then the road is less crazy. There are places to eat and drink up and down the beach.  This isn\'t a quiet, deserted beach however, we went on a Monday morning and it was very deserted.  I can imagine it could get crowded.  The water seems calm but the hotel told me that that can be deceptive because some people have gotten caught in undertows.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

470642853.name: Get away from it all!
470642853.author: a TripAdvisor user
470642853.reviewBody: We visited this beach Midweek during spring break time and saw maybe 15 people total, many of them Mexicanos on vacation. Calm water, soft sand and a few small restaurants are all that\'s here. I rented a jet ski for $35 for 1/2 hour and that was plenty.  Highly recommend the fresh ceviche, even my 13 year old son thought it tasted great. Great views of Isla Ispiritu Santo and while we did not take a tour, I believe some tours leave from there and at a much cheaper rate than in La Paz. A few beach vendors, not pushy, a perfect place to while away a day in serenity. Bring your Spanish vocabulary, you may need it or just point @ the menu. Everything we tried was delicious on the beach and in La Paz.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

468680245.name: Long beautiful beach
468680245.author: a TripAdvisor user
468680245.reviewBody: This is the place to go with your family when visiting La Paz. The beach is long and wide. Mexican families come here with their extended family to swim, play in the sand and enjoy the view. The water here felt warmer than on the beaches near town and on Espiritu Santo. Bring your own food or order lunch and a beer at one of the beach shacks. I bought fresh chili mango from a local teen cruising the beach. The snorkeling is best on the end of the beach nearest town - but it is not terrific. We found more space to spread out at Tecolote when Ballandra was packed on a Saturday. Bring an umbrella if you have one.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

468676530.name: Paradise....
468676530.author: a TripAdvisor user
468676530.reviewBody: It\'s such a peaceful place,take a walk,a swim in the clear blue water,enjoy the view from the restaurant,enjoying a beer and a coupke of ceviche tostadas,thwy have lots more good food,at very good prices,only 30 minutes from malecon on a tour bus.come and just enjoy the fresh air,the waves....nature!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

468634957.name: An almost private beach.....beautiful
468634957.author: a TripAdvisor user
468634957.reviewBody: It\'s best to come to this beach, in my opinion, before Easter week.  Located about 45 minutes from La Paz, BCS, Tecolote Beach is not built up, soft sand, and has a beautiful view of Espritu Santo island.   We\'ve been here once a week since we arrived 3 weeks ago.  Come before noon and get a palapa because even in March, it gets hot....like 80s.  I was lucky enough to meet up with a guy that agreed to bring his jet skis the following week so that my group of 10 could have some fun.  He hadn\'t begun his season yet so I was happy that he and I could work something out.   The jet skis weren\'t as cheap as other things here in Mexico, but I got two hours for $120, which if you\'re from New England, that\'s a pretty great deal.   There are little bars and restaurants.  This is a total kick back bech, so bring a book and your own music or whatever.  Some folks camp in tents and some in RVs but there aren\'t many people people either way.   Don\'t miss this before it gets built up.\n

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

466054658.name: True Baja Experience
466054658.author: a TripAdvisor user
466054658.reviewBody: I\'ve been all over Baja and this place is the real Baja experience.  It\'s kind of funky.  The construction is crude.  The furniture is not fancy.  But, it\'s a great Baja place.  The service is extremely friendly and the food is as good as it gets. The beach is great.  I would go to La Paz just to spend an afternoon at this place. I had the best shrimp cocktail I ever ate in my life here.  A must visit beach and restaurant.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

464624014.name: Beautiful, great for walking, margaritas!
464624014.author: a TripAdvisor user
464624014.reviewBody: Although it was a really windy day and not good for swimming or snorkeling, I still had a wonderful time walking the long expanse of beach and sitting at the Palapa Azul restaurant watching the surf and enjoying a big strawberry margarita. Great day away from the city.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

464374793.name: So close yet you think you\'re so far away!
464374793.author: a TripAdvisor user
464374793.reviewBody: This is just a peaceful, calm, clean beach. We\'ve been in August and February with both visits satisfying our craving for the beach/food/drink and relaxation.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

464174631.name: Beach Review - not a restaurant review
464174631.author: a TripAdvisor user
464174631.reviewBody: Beautiful long white sand beach, shallow waters, with rocky area on the west side.  End of the paved hwy, sand parking lots.  Several restaurants.  No public facilities.  Bus service.\nBest part for us was the rocky area for snorkeling.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

463330162.name: Gorgeous beach
463330162.author: a TripAdvisor user
463330162.reviewBody: We just spent the day here. We walk north along the beach to be secluded area. We brought our snorkeling gear and there was some beautiful fish and coral. We ate at one of the restaurants and had great guacamole, amazing pi\u00f1a colada, yummy margarita. The food was OK, not amazing. The waiter was friendly and brought us to taste couple of different tequila\'s with lime and orange chasers. We had a wonderful day. The weather was gorgeous. Great day to relax and enjoy the water.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

462501567.name: Super Beach Camping
462501567.author: a TripAdvisor user
462501567.reviewBody: This is our favorite spot for boondock beach camping in Baja Sur.  We spent the better part of  month in Ja./Feb. Camped out on the east end of the beach, away from the restaurants.  The water is gin clear, the beach sand is soft  (several beaches we\'ve visited in Baja have very abrasive, rough gravel).  We enjoyed our kayak almost daily, but you need to keep an eye on the weather, as winds can come up quickly from any direction . Great place for desert hikes, or follow the dirt rooads out to the end of the peninsula.  We didn\'t go to the restaurants, not all that appealing....lots of boats to watch coming and going from La Paz. We had no security problems, other campers keep an eye out on your stuff if you leave.   Lots of spots to camp,, but NO facilities or nearby stores, so bring everything you want or need with you.  Great stores in La Paz.  Watch out when driving on the beach, the sand can drift from day to day, and if it rains, the whole area behind the beach turns to slop.  One of our favorite diversions was watching cars get stuck on the beach, although we or other campers often assisted them in getting out.  Beautiful setting, big rugged mountains in the background, the island of Espirtu Santo directly  north.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

461830774.name: Ready to veg on a beach
461830774.author: a TripAdvisor user
461830774.reviewBody: We went to Playa El Tecolote by bus.  We walked a short distance from the restaurant (spendy) and set ourselves up under a palapa in front of an aqua marine sea looking out to Isla Espritu Santo.  The water was warm enough for swimming.  The beach was perfect.  Might say that the bus goes by Balandra Beach on the way, which looked equally enticing.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

457823111.name: Great beach and view
457823111.author: a TripAdvisor user
457823111.reviewBody: Close to balandra this is also a very nice beach. Different than balandra as you will find more restaurants and people here. You can\'t walk so far in the sea but the waives and view are great. Good place to spend your day !!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

457146110.name: Beautiful beach
457146110.author: a TripAdvisor user
457146110.reviewBody: Beautiful beach with great views of Isla Espiritu Santo.   Ate a meal at the restaurant on the beach--excellent food and service.  Recommend stopping here.  It was a little breezy so bring a jacket.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

456628431.name: Wonderful beaches, quiet, beautiful, and particularly made for kids
456628431.author: a TripAdvisor user
456628431.reviewBody:
Outstanding landscapes, very wild while close to La Paz (Half an hour driving quietly).
The slope to get in the sea is very flat so their is very few risk for kid to go to the sea;`
2 or 3 beach restaurants/cafes very welcoming
It is a spot for a good rest and sea bath.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

456294666.name: Gorgeous beach
456294666.author: a TripAdvisor user
456294666.reviewBody: We had a wonderful time at this gorgeous beach at the end of the road past the Baja Ferry terminal. It\'s a beautiful unspoiled sand beach with rolling surf, but fine for swimming, which I did. Or body surfed! Good for beach walking too.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

453650707.name: The best kept secret in the Baja!
453650707.author: a TripAdvisor user
453650707.reviewBody: We were so disappointed in Balandra that we tried Playa Tecolote instead. Wow!!! The beach is vast with white sand and lots of shells. You can see Espirit du Santu out on the aqua/turquoise waters - really serene and picturesque, Although there are not a lot of people on the beach, there are some lucky gringo campers taking advantage of the view and crystal clear waters. There is minimal surf - tranquil and suitable for children. There are some stray dogs that comb the beach, but they did not bother us. We found our favorite spot was out past the campers. No idea why Balandra was rated #1 in La Paz - but then again, I have exposed a well-kept secret!!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

451327847.name: Well not what i expected
451327847.author: a TripAdvisor user
451327847.reviewBody: The service was nonexistant , not thats the place was bussy about 4 tables ,we did not receive the full order and when i complain the server look at me like sarcasticly ,like poor boy what you gonna do !!?? The steak was okay , the pasta where in way to much sauce and the shrimps where over cook . WE DO NOT recomende this place

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

450580981.name: Fun to visit one time
450580981.author: a TripAdvisor user
450580981.reviewBody: Beach was a lot more rough than Balandra. There are restaurants there and we ate at Palapa Azul and were given a great seat practically in the ocean (it was that close). Buildings are all a bit run down, but food was good and people were friendly. Once you get away from the restaurant area, the beach is very wide open and pretty.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

449942623.name: Beautiful beach wih waves
449942623.author: a TripAdvisor user
449942623.reviewBody: This is a beach that has actually waves and lots of sea birds. There are a couple of restaurants in the area they are not fancy. It is a good spot to visit in conjunction with Balandra Beach where there are no restaurants-well there are trucks with some food normally and street food sellers, but not a formal restaurant.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

448169710.name: Very nice beach
448169710.author: a TripAdvisor user
448169710.reviewBody: Fun beach, rented jet skis, snorkeled, swam, floated, relaxed in the beautiful waters.  There were some umbrellas available, without one you would have to be in the water, it is very hot!  The water is very clear and comfortable temperature!  Saw lots of fish, puffer, coronet or trumpetfish, lots of others I didn\'t recognize.  The trash cans were overflowing the times we went, but the beach itself was pretty clean.  Parking was easy, the sand was packed, our rental car had no problems.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

448168898.name: Nice little beach...
448168898.author: a TripAdvisor user
448168898.reviewBody: Only turnoff for this beach was the rocks mixed in the sand.  nothing you can do about nature but try another beach...  A few restaurants sprinkle the beach and a few activity options.  nicely tucked in the cactus filled hills.  Its quiet here and not packed...

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

446572825.name: almost deserted
446572825.author: a TripAdvisor user
446572825.reviewBody: Wonderfully long beach!   The snorkeling around the rocks at the left end of the beach is excellent.\nWe rented a palapa which included a table and chairs, which was convenient.   Lovely!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

446514685.name: Pleasant day spent at Tecolote
446514685.author: a TripAdvisor user
446514685.reviewBody: Very nice beach with several restaurants. Bus service runs to and from the Malecon. Bring a cooler like the locals do and have a picnic if you plan on staying for the whole day. You can also schedule your espiritu santo tour from this beach.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

443600139.name: Great food, awful service!
443600139.author: a TripAdvisor user
443600139.reviewBody: The food was great, but we waited and waited for our waiter to even realize we were there. He didn\'t have a CLUE that, HELLO, we are a bunch of hungry and thirsty women, with money to spend, and we were virtually ignored the whole time we were there. We had to walk up to the kitchen/bar to order food and drinks. There are THREE places to eat there, and we will NOT be coming back to this one.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

439558366.name: El Tecolote Restaurante... average
439558366.author: a TripAdvisor user
439558366.reviewBody: My family and I are use to have good food and good service.  Here the good food is close to be ok, but more average.  Definitively the service is bellow average... The price is a little bit expensive than what  I saw in La Paz.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

435970699.name: Good, Reasonably Priced Food - Excellent Views
435970699.author: a TripAdvisor user
435970699.reviewBody: The drive (1/2 hour north of La Paz) was lovely, mostly alongside the water and through desert on a well-maintained, 2 lane road.  We had both breakfast and lunch at this restaurant, on separate ocassions.  Both were relatively inexpensive (especially the beer) and delicious.  Service was a little slow, but not unexpected, as you truly are in a location where you would be on "Mexico time."  While waiting for service/your meal, enjoy beautiful views of the beach and ocean, unimpeded by throngs of tourists.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

435199397.name: amazing beach
435199397.author: a TripAdvisor user
435199397.reviewBody: This beach is wonderful,hardly any vendors,friendly people at any one of the maybe 7 palapas and miles of unspoiled beaches.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

435111735.name: Very Basic
435111735.author: a TripAdvisor user
435111735.reviewBody: Almost ad hoc, there are a few buildings, but most everything is brought in.  We wanted jet skis, so a call went out and within an hour a man showed up with two.  One was not in very good shape.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

434665880.name: Nice place to eat
434665880.author: a TripAdvisor user
434665880.reviewBody: Great for eating, there are a lot a of restaurants that offer drinks and local food witch is get good. The beach is beautiful with a view to la isla espiritu Santo . Perfect to swim and  hang out.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

433413065.name: Quiet weekday visit
433413065.author: a TripAdvisor user
433413065.reviewBody:
Come in the morning before the afternoon breeze.  Decent snorkeling at the far west end,  also some fish on rocky outcrops scattered 50 to 100 meters off the beach. 

Almost no people on weekdays so was like we had the place to ourselves.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

432989485.name: Beautiful spot!
432989485.author: a TripAdvisor user
432989485.reviewBody: We spent the afternoon here after spending the morning at Playa Balandra.  We went to the restaurant on the far right as you drive in.  The beach is beautiful, the people friendly, the food yummy, and all in all this is a great place to relax and spend the day.  Exactly what \'baja\' should be!  If you like to get off the beaten path and enjoy nature, while at the same time be able to have some excellent Chips and Pico de Gallo...then put this place on your list.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

431933609.name: Wonderful beach with great view of Espiritu Santo island
431933609.author: a TripAdvisor user
431933609.reviewBody:
Best to go in the week as it can get busy with local families at weekends. Went in the week - had it all to ourselves. Flat beach with white sand and easy access to sea. A few palapas but take your own umbrella as it can get very hot. Local tour operator nearby with two or three cantinas serving great food.
Snorkelling good further out. Beautiful to swim in with fabulous views. Can get choppy mid afternoon re: sea breezes but not difficult to swim in sea. No big waves. 
One of the best beaches I have been on around the world. 
Peace/ quiet / wondrous views/ food & drink nearby / access to marine tours / warm turquoise sea!!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

429019819.name: Best Beach in La Paz
429019819.author: a TripAdvisor user
429019819.reviewBody: We visited all the beaches in the area and El Tecolote was the last one to visit. It was a beautiful beach with numerous restaurants/bars to choose from. You can catch a boat from here to go do all the area snorkeling. It also has bathrooms which some of the other beaches don\'t have.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

428845567.name: Beauty facing Isla Espiritu Santos
428845567.author: a TripAdvisor user
428845567.reviewBody: Gorgeous spot. Not a lot of fish to see in the clean turquoise waters but thoroughly enjoyable because of the scenery. Have returned many times just to sit swim and watch.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

426835982.name: Great views, good food, but...
426835982.author: a TripAdvisor user
426835982.reviewBody: We came for lunch at Playa El Tecolote and found a palapa at Bar El Tecolote.  You pay $500 pesos to reserve the spot on the water in return for food and drink you buy.  Had some good fish tacos and a HUGE ceviche tostada (it\'s easy to over order here) and some beers.  All good, right?   The flies that come with the table are not advertised.   Not recommended on a calm day!  It turns out beer bottles make great fly traps....

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

423843436.name: El Tecolote beach
423843436.author: a TripAdvisor user
423843436.reviewBody: Tecolote beach was very  clean and private  with very  clear water like if it was a pool but it has waves. We really love it there,  it had beautiful views and the beach was so fresh and clean.  There are shaded areas with chairs and tables for you to eat there they also sell alcoholic beverages. I saw a little store that advertised having everything from sunglasses to souvenirs  but when i went in it was almost empty it only had a few things for sell, but who cares with that beautiful beach there just make sure you come prepared with everything you need because this beach is far and  there\'s no convenience store near by.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

422181866.name: Worth a visit.
422181866.author: a TripAdvisor user
422181866.reviewBody: The beach itself is great.  Water is fantastic.  Plus, you can at a table under a palapa at one of the restaurants/bars and order drinks and food.  Nice way to spend an afternoon.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

419007787.name: Beach lunch
419007787.author: a TripAdvisor user
419007787.reviewBody: We came for lunch and had whole fried fish and fish tacos, both were outstanding. We are at a table on the sand, drank beer and tequila, fantastic time, the water was warm and clear. We could easily see Espiritu Santos island.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

415086420.name: Nice and free beach
415086420.author: a TripAdvisor user
415086420.reviewBody:
If you want to spend the day in an free and nice beach, this is the one. The water is clear and calm for swimming, and there are some bars along the beach to get food and drinks.

There is plenty of space to park and the view is amazing!!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

411143776.name: Amazing beaches nearby La Paz
411143776.author: a TripAdvisor user
411143776.reviewBody: One of the beaches nearby La Paz Baja California, Mexico. Woonderful place, close to the city. Amazing sand\'s and water colors. Veeeery clean. Not deep when you step into the water, so comfortable to be with kids. Some cafes and sea sport activities are available for rent. No sunbed, take your own, and umbrella too. Good spot for picnic or barbeque.\nThere is a shuttle bus from La Paz to reach all beaches. Departute point is at Malecon. Ask locals for details.\nNice restaurant in Pichilingue, just on the beach.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

409547988.name: Beautiful Spot
409547988.author: a TripAdvisor user
409547988.reviewBody: The beach and water are amazing.  It was very peaceful while we were there.  The restaurants are nice, and the people laid back.  I actually had my license and credit cards fall out onto the beach.  I realised when we were back in La Paz.  We raced back, and one of the fishermen there had found them and put them aside for me.  For that I would give it a ten.  It\'s just a few miles out of town past the ferry terminal in Pichilingue.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

409093863.name: Beach, beer and sail
409093863.author: a TripAdvisor user
409093863.reviewBody: If weather conditions allow, take your day to enjoy the beach with restaurant facilities and - overall - to start your amazing trip to Espiritu Santo island

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

395328885.name: Good beach
395328885.author: a TripAdvisor user
395328885.reviewBody:
Nice beach. The water isn't green and clear like Balandra Bay, but it is clean and has some amenities, such as restrooms, restaurants, and beach/water equipment rental, such as kayaks, paddleboards, umbrellas, palapas, etc. This beach is more equipped for a relaxing day. You can catch the colectivo van over from Balandra Beach. It's a 7 minute drive away. Get there before 10am if you wish to avoid the crowds. 

Transportation info:
All La Paz buses arrive to/leave from the Terminal Turistico across the street from the malecón. Ask anyone and they'll direct you. 

- This is where you can catch a combi bus (van) to Balandra or Tecolote Beach. Buy a round trip ticket for 98 pesos. There are about 5 vans a day and they leave around 1.5hr apart. The bus station can tell you the route times, although the return van was 45 min late, so it's not an exact science. 
Tip: Board the van as soon as it pulls into the station/parking lot. They do not count the tickets sold, so it's first come, first serve. Grab your seat ASAP. 

Hope that helps! Enjoy La Paz!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

395113106.name: an amazing view of Espirito Santo and a great beach to boot
395113106.author: a TripAdvisor user
395113106.reviewBody: Playa Tecolote is a great beach for snorkeling, jet skiing and just playing in the water! The Tecolote Restaurant has great fresh sea food of all kinds,

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

393616259.name: Good beach!
393616259.author: a TripAdvisor user
393616259.reviewBody: This beach was very peaceful especially compared to Balandra which is right down the road. The only problem with Tecolote is that the sand is rocky and hard to walk on. We needed chairs (thankfully we had some) to sit on. There are little shade huts and that was nice plus it kept people a little bit separated. The water is beautiful!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

392543440.name: A great place for lunch and local culture
392543440.author: a TripAdvisor user
392543440.reviewBody: We spent a few hours on this beach before heading to Balandra.  Several restaurant/bars and rental facilities with activities.  We had our best meal of our entire time in the La Paz area at the large restaurant with the high palapa roof, I believe it was called Tecolote Beach Club, but the roof description can\'t be confused with any of the other spots.  Best camarones el mojo de ajo, great hauchinango frito, and grilled calamari (shrimp in garlic, fried whole red snapper).  We relaxed in the shade and drank lime daiquiris while our children played in the surf.  Balandra is more beautiful, but this was a wonderful place for a relaxed authentic lunch.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

392276718.name: Experiences to remember
392276718.author: a TripAdvisor user
392276718.reviewBody: Little beach bars on an amazing stretch of coastline was one of the highlights of our trip. From the moment we arrived till we left the fun & laughs kept coming. Beware though the margarittas pack a punch & they are huge. The friendliness of the locals is second to none.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

391047470.name: Get the stuffed Chocolate clams!
391047470.author: a TripAdvisor user
391047470.reviewBody: We had an amazing day at Playa El Tecolote! Great food,  jet ski,  and relaxation in water as clear and beautiful as any Caribbean beach! You won\'t be sorry. Eat at the Blue Palapa. We had delicious stuffed clams and fish tacos with cerveza. Nice little Saturday.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

387500129.name: windy but nice stretch of beach
387500129.author: a TripAdvisor user
387500129.reviewBody: this beach seemed windier than average, but it\'s a good beach to check out if you are in La Paz and want access to food/drink. I think Balandra and the adjacent beaches are a bit nicer, but Tecolote has a couple small bars and restaurants. \n\nThere is a shuttle between the two beaches and La Paz, and you can also just walk to Balandra in 15-20 min or so if you want.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

387096173.name: Must Stop here
387096173.author: a TripAdvisor user
387096173.reviewBody: The beaches, the sand, the food, the people and the weather , all together makes this a good idea to stop and have fun have a beer and just relax. The water is nice and clean , the food is nice and cheap, the restaurants are always trying to get you in in a very nice way so you might have a difficult time to choose which one! but i know that whatever you choose it will be nice.\n\nThe only thing i will suggest is to bring mosquito repelant as there are LOADs of MOsquitos. but thats all still 5 star!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

386673843.name: Good time with adult family members
386673843.author: a TripAdvisor user
386673843.reviewBody: Took family members to the beach so they could experience what we had done before. We got a palapa at one of the beach bars (note advertised warning of 500 peso minimum to use the palapa and chairs), got into swimwear and got into the water. We knew from our previous visit that if the wind is blowing from the north or northeast, the waves will be up. On this day, the breeze was light so the water was pretty flat. Good times were had by all.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

386474512.name: Beautiful vistas!
386474512.author: a TripAdvisor user
386474512.reviewBody: A very popular beach with the locals and understandably so.  Long beautiful beach with a view across to Isla Espiritu. Warm to hot days make use of the palapas or shade structures a necessity.  Get there early in the day to nab one!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

385040095.name: Guacamole!
385040095.author: a TripAdvisor user
385040095.reviewBody: The best of the best Guacamole! Lovely beach! But i prefer Balandra. Really good place to go to eat, take a dip, get tanned and drink a beer :)

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

375896596.name: Beautiful beach with nice palapa restaurants
375896596.author: a TripAdvisor user
375896596.reviewBody: This was a nice, scenic beach with good papa restaurants. I didn\'t see any trash on the beach reported by some other reviewer so I guess that has been cleaned up. It\'s only a mile and a half from Bahia de Balandra, so if you are anchored in Balandra bay on a yacht, it\'s an easy walk and nice afternoon outing from there.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

374084683.name: Don\'t go with Do\u00f1a Lupita\'s restaurant
374084683.author: a TripAdvisor user
374084683.reviewBody: When we first arrived, this place which is located to the far-right end of the series of little restaurants, we thought it could be somehow cheap in prices since it was completely empty and the place is not fancy at all, so when we approach Lupita jumped out of her chair asking us to eat there, we saw the menu prices and they were literally super expensive, Lupita did not stopped talking trying to convince us to stay there by telling lies about the other restaurants and their prices, so to me that was and indication that we should not stay there, then she tried to sell us a boat trip to Balandra which was super expensive just to realize that we were a couple of minutes away from that beach.\nFortunately we did not consume or stayed there and we decided to go and check the other restaurants just to find that Lupita\'s option were going to be the worst.\nThere are better options, Lupita is not a good option

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

372323006.name: Beautiful beach but very neglected!
372323006.author: a TripAdvisor user
372323006.reviewBody: A once beautiful beach sadly now being neglected  and abused by human activity and inactivity. The once pristine sands ruined by charcoal. Litter strewn all over the place, particularly on the back half of the beach. The waterline is generally clear of litter, one can only assume washed into the sea at high tide!  Not enough bins and those that exist often full and overflowing  through lack of emptying. Very busy at weekends and public holidays and thus noisy.  Best to visit during the working week when peace and tranquility can be had. Great views of the island and mountains behind the beach. Ample parking if arriving by car. Be prepared to have to clean the area around your palapa if lucky enough to bag one of the few remaining. The sea is calmer on the morning as the wind blows in the afternoon creating small waves. The beach has a handful  of restaurants selling good food and drinks. I wonder if these businesses  could do more to keep the beach clean and litter free?

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

371911343.name: Go early
371911343.author: a TripAdvisor user
371911343.reviewBody: Excellent beach.  Quiet on a weekday.  Take Ecobaja shuttle from La Paz bus station if you don\'t have a car.  Morning is better as winds kick up in the afternoon.  Very good food and drink available plus banos.  View of Isla Espiritu Santo across the channel.  Pretty interesting drive up.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

370273097.name: Visit to Playa El Tecolote
370273097.author: a TripAdvisor user
370273097.reviewBody: This beach gets a lot of use and I wouldn\'t recommend it on a busy weekend.  But on other days with fewer people it was a love place to walk to beach looking for shells and having food from one of the open-air cafes on the shores.  Beautiful view of the island.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

370203197.name: Cant miss these one too
370203197.author: a TripAdvisor user
370203197.reviewBody: Its the last beach , ver y nice beutifull water white  Sands ,   And amaizing des ser , the water is come , it has restaurant and bares , and rentas , the food is expensive and just ok i eat in cupl\u00e9 pla ces and it was ok , be ready to Pay doble price for everything , normally a beer in La Paz is 25 o 30 pesos i pa\u00edd 70 pesos there , and the food price were s\u00faper expencive , they Also have tour to isla del santo wich is beutifull , but you can get better prices in town

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

369404546.name: More fun than you can have in a day
369404546.author: a TripAdvisor user
369404546.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful beaches on earth! Stop by the bar and meet the Marlboro man! He runs the bar and makes sure you are having a great time and that your drink is always full and cold!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

368993300.name: Nice beach and good Restaurants
368993300.author: a TripAdvisor user
368993300.reviewBody: There\'s a lovely view of the islands - lovely beach, long shallow area.  Great blue water and wonderful restaurants to hang out for the day.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

367646103.name: solo
367646103.author: a TripAdvisor user
367646103.reviewBody: I paid a cab driver to drive me for a day to hit all the beaches. What a wondrous day , great food and great ambience.\n

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

365748902.name: Superb, beautiful, quiet beach
365748902.author: a TripAdvisor user
365748902.reviewBody: I grew up going to Jones Beach on Long Island, with up to 3/4 million visitors a day.  This was such a lovely difference.  We went on a weekday, and on a few hundred yards of beach, I think there were 12 families.  Water as clear as glass, the bottom being clean white sand.  Lovely restaurant that serves on the beach (bathrooms are yechh!)\n

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

363181389.name: Nice Drive to Get There - Pleasant Walking Beach
363181389.author: a TripAdvisor user
363181389.reviewBody: We drove up to see Balandra Bay and kept going to Playa El Telecote.   We walked parked in the middle and walked the length of the beach - a narrow beach but firm enough for comfortable walking.   There are several beach-side restaurants for a bite and beverage after the walk.   Lovely turquoise waters, good view across San Lorenzo channel to Isla Espiritu Santu.   A very good stop to get away from the hustle and bustle of La Paz!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

359803138.name: Very crowded
359803138.author: a TripAdvisor user
359803138.reviewBody: This beach is very crowded and full of noise. If you want to spend a nice relaxing day at the beach this is NOT the place. There is animators with microphones making a lot of noise and playing local music very loud.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

358238965.name: What a view!
358238965.author: a TripAdvisor user
358238965.reviewBody: Such an quite beach for the entire family. About 30 min drive from La Paz, it has the most amazing calm and clear water for anyone to take a swim and enjoy the sun. The islands just a few miles away provide a great background for your family pictures. We brought a little BBQ grill and had some Carne Asada.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

357477006.name: Relaxing afternoon by the sea.
357477006.author: a TripAdvisor user
357477006.reviewBody: Great place to hang out with friends. Larger restaurant serves great seafood inside or on the beach. Strong swimmers could have swum, but sea quite rough on this windy afternoon.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

357428660.name: Windy and so- so food/drink
357428660.author: a TripAdvisor user
357428660.reviewBody: My husband and I were excited to grab a cocktail and some snacks. His beer was pretty cold. Our waitress didn\'t speak any English. Usually we can get by on our limited Spanish but she didn\'t know chips and salsa. This is our problem and not hers but it was kind of a bummer. It was very windy the day we visited and it was mid-week so there wasn\'t much going on early afternoon.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

353463050.name: LIVE BAND SUNDAYS SUPER
353463050.author: a TripAdvisor user
353463050.reviewBody:
My husband and I have been driving out to Tecolote every time we head South for the winter.
Amazing Margueritas. Good job Enrique.
We go with our german shepherd, enjoy the beach and today we drove out soecifically for the Sunday Live Band at the great beach bar.
Terrific oldies.
Rolling Stones!!!!!
They start at 4.30 pm. 
Watch the booze if you have to drive home folks.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

352515851.name: Beautiful sandy beach
352515851.author: a TripAdvisor user
352515851.reviewBody: This is a 25 minute drive outside La Paz, and you are rewarded with a lovely beach, safe and shallow water and the possibility of renting a chair and umbrella if desired.\n\nThe best option would be to take your own cooler and drinks/food as the catering looks very basic here. This would be a great afternoon out for families with small children.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

348995949.name: Great food
348995949.author: a TripAdvisor user
348995949.reviewBody: We ate dinner here 3 times. Each time was better than the time before. They specialize in seafood and often have specials going on. We had garlic shrimp (10 each), rice and salad with 4 margaritas for about $14.00 for both of us.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

346726575.name: Gorgeous Beach
346726575.author: a TripAdvisor user
346726575.reviewBody: Plan to spend the day and enjoy the beautiful water and the great food from the virus venders. Week days are less crowded.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

345692615.name: Character
345692615.author: a TripAdvisor user
345692615.reviewBody: What beaches used to be like.  Authentic beach old Mexico complete with drinks and simple treats.  Basic.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

340225089.name: Lovely
340225089.author: a TripAdvisor user
340225089.reviewBody: Tecolote Beach is definitely one of the prettiest beaches around La Paz--I cannot say enough about the water, which on the day we visited was crystal clear and warm even though we didn\'t go for a swim because it was too chilly (which I now regret).  It\'s a great beach for a long walk and there are plenty of places to eat or relax with a cold drink.  We ate a decent lunch in the largest restaurant (can\'t remember the name but it\'s the one of the few places there that accepts credit cards).   Also met a group of Catholic sisters who were having a picnic.  Can\'t remember ever seeing nuns in full habit beachcombing and in general having a good time!  Not quite as exciting as snorkeling with whale sharks or swimming with sea lions, but definitely worth the trip if you\'re staying in La Paz for a few days.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

339639722.name: 20 minutes from La Paz
339639722.author: a TripAdvisor user
339639722.reviewBody: Its the place to eat on the beach, a 5 minutes drive from Balandar Beach. The sea is rough here, great for a long walk along the sea edge. Can park next to the beach for a picnic. A good selection of restaurants and bars.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

337387221.name: Best part of La Paz
337387221.author: a TripAdvisor user
337387221.reviewBody: We ended up going to this beautiful beach 4 out of 6 days in and around La Paz.  Try the bar on Tecolote Beach.  Beers are cheap and the Fish Tacos were amazing.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

337079594.name: Good place to stroll and watch waves
337079594.author: a TripAdvisor user
337079594.reviewBody: A long stretch of sand and turquoise waters, but usually very rough. If you like beaches of the wavy-kinds, you\'d like it. Lots of restaurants and tour operators on the beach, but it\'s easy to walk away from the madness and find solace. You can also see the Espiritu Santo Island from the beach, which was a plus.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

336650752.name: Beautiful beach with plenty to do
336650752.author: a TripAdvisor user
336650752.reviewBody: Fantastic beach, feels like you\'re at the end of the word. Pretty rocks in the sand. Lots of small beach kiosks for food and drink and to rent watersports equipment.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

335133206.name: Love Tecolote!
335133206.author: a TripAdvisor user
335133206.reviewBody: We love to go to Tecolote.  The beach is wonderful for swimming, sunning, beach combing, camping.  It is a long expanse of mostly white sand beach.  I have been warned by several people to lock the car and don\'t leave valuables in it.  We felt perfectly safe out there, but have heard that robberies do happen once in a while.  The beach wasn\'t crowded when we were there.  A few palapas are available, and there are a couple of restaurants.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

334104058.name: great beach
334104058.author: a TripAdvisor user
334104058.reviewBody: This beach scores top on our list of beaches in mexico and we have been to quite a few. There are a lot of restaurants here as well as drinking establishments on this very long beach. Eco baja tours has frequent departures from the central bus terminal for 70$ pesos. It was overcast the day we went but it was still busy

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

333763829.name: Fresh food and incredible guacamole!
333763829.author: a TripAdvisor user
333763829.reviewBody: Perfect Sandy beach for she\'ll hunting. Restaurants have delicious food and gorgeous views that can\'t be beat. The restaurant itself is a true beach atmosphere.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

331643634.name: Playa El Tecolote...my home
331643634.author: a TripAdvisor user
331643634.reviewBody:
Come and enjoy your day(s) with us at Bar Tropical Palapa Azul, surrounded by beautiful crystal clear water, access to some of the most incredible beaches in the world, mountains, valleys and guests from around the world.
Food is abundant and very good, with menus of fresh seafood from our sea.

I have lived on the mountain overlooking these beaches for 8 years, and this is my home and we welcome you to visit us.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

330387036.name: not recommended for windy day
330387036.author: a TripAdvisor user
330387036.reviewBody: go to balandras if it is windy. this one is very long and open to winds. visited it on a windy day and the water was very violent.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

329212883.name: Long sandy beach with pristine waters
329212883.author: a TripAdvisor user
329212883.reviewBody: This is a very long extension of sandy beach where you can take a swim in its beautiful clear waters surrounded by the Baja Desert. You can also hire a trip to Isla Espiritu Santo that lies just in front of here,

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

326916136.name: Nice view not good for a windy day
326916136.author: a TripAdvisor user
326916136.reviewBody: The beach was overcome by waves, some of the palapas were submerged. However nice view of the island. Several restaurants on the beach plenty of parking and chairs.  Go to balandra or a protected beach if the wind is up

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

325975649.name: standard beach, nice views
325975649.author: a TripAdvisor user
325975649.reviewBody: i\'d recommend going to balandra beach not too far from here instead.  this one has more traffic, more waves, more development (couple of restaurants included)\n\nnice view of espiritu santu,

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

325108784.name: relaxing and beautiful
325108784.author: a TripAdvisor user
325108784.reviewBody: Miles of beachfront, great view of Isle Espiritu Santo Island. Not busy at all during the week. There are good restaurants, jet ski and kayak rentals. Just a peaceful place to take in some sun, sand and food and drinks. Waters are turquoise blue and bathtub warm.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

322776566.name: Beautiful beach close to La Paz
322776566.author: a TripAdvisor user
322776566.reviewBody: This beach is about 10miles from La Paz, you can find here all the services, the food is good and not expensive. The Balandra beach is very close but has no services. So this one could be a better option to spend some time.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

318023952.name: Proposed to my fianc\u00e9 at Tecolote!
318023952.author: a TripAdvisor user
318023952.reviewBody: Title says it all. The restaurant is pretty good but the beach is incredible. It wasn\'t very busy when we went which was nice... And the color of the water doesn\'t look real. We loved it!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

316153151.name: Great but watch out for the stingrays
316153151.author: a TripAdvisor user
316153151.reviewBody: We headed to the beach for a few hours of snorkeling (pretty good). Nice beach, beautiful view in the distance of Espiritu. Off season we didn\'t have any problem  getting one of the palapas. Just as we were about ready to quit and eat at one of the restaurants on the beach, I got struck by a stingray as I was leaving the water. We were warned about Balandra Beach for this but not here. Ouch! luckily the caretaker (Roberto) at one of the beach clubs nearby knew just what to do and an hour or so later, all the pain and swelling was gone, leaving only this story. Still loved the beach despite the stingray!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

312703679.name: Beautiful beach
312703679.author: a TripAdvisor user
312703679.reviewBody: Beautiful beach with palapas, good restaurant nearby and almost empty of tourists.  Great view of the islands with companies operating excursions to the islands.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

311867744.name: Lovely beach
311867744.author: a TripAdvisor user
311867744.reviewBody: This is a beautiful natural white sand beach with great eateries, warm clear water and dozens of Pelicans fishing. A great trip.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

310699490.name: Awesome beach
310699490.author: a TripAdvisor user
310699490.reviewBody: A must go to beach. Awesome crystal clear beach. Made for relaxing. You could see the fish swimming around you. Nice restaurants along the beach with great food.. All I can say is awesome.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

309927757.name: Very cool
309927757.author: a TripAdvisor user
309927757.reviewBody: It\'s good that this place has restaurants unlike Balandra, but unfortunately the beach was much more dirty than Balandra for that reason alone.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

309389763.name: Senor Marlins
309389763.author: a TripAdvisor user
309389763.reviewBody: We loved this beach. Great everything. You can rent chairs, eat and drink and it has just the right amount of waves. Besides Espiritu Tours it is the only other thing we did twice while here.\nI also highly recommend a facial from Sonya at Zala.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

307571658.name: One of the best beaches I have ever visited
307571658.author: a TripAdvisor user
307571658.reviewBody: This is one of the top beaches I have been to, and I\'ve been to many. Clear, calm, warm water. Excellent beach service. Tropical fish right in the water !

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

307067298.name: Highly recommended... even driving from Cabo San Lucas
307067298.author: a TripAdvisor user
307067298.reviewBody: One of the most beautiful beaches that I\'ve ever seen. Probably two miles of sand facing Espiritu Santo island. Super clear and calmed water. Great place for kids and easy snorkeling. The beach has a few restaurants around. The freeway from Cabo San Lucas to La Paz is in great condition; very easy 1.5 hour drive.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

302444033.name: Worth the drive.
302444033.author: a TripAdvisor user
302444033.reviewBody: Casual relaxed and in the middle of August few American tourists. Very relaxed day with great views. the beach is ringed with laid back beach bars and food places. Nice to sit under the shade, have a drink and enjoy the day.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

301504497.name: Scammed for "table fee" by waiter at smaller restaurant
301504497.author: a TripAdvisor user
301504497.reviewBody:
I have visited the Tecolote beach area several times and had good experiences. This recent trip I was solo and accompanied by my cab driver who directed me to a smaller building just to the right of the main palapa restaurant as you arrive in the lot. I wanted to rent a kayak, and paid 300 pesos for 3 hours from the equipment shack which also has dining tables under an awning. The staff then "run" any order you have over to the main restaurant bar just next door. So, be careful where you sit!
