My affable, English-speaking "waiter", Alejandro, ("Alex who makes it happen") gave me a menu from next door, and told me I need to order  a minimum of 200 pesos )12 USD) in food and beverage----despite my 300 peso (18 USD) kayak rental! He then went next door and got us our fish tacos and sodas, totaling 220 pesos, more than enough, right? A minimum service order is legitimate at these beach clubs---but they are mostly reasonable---- satisfied with drinks or a food purchase.
As we were paying the official bill, printed on the main restaurant's receipt, Alejandro, told me in perfect English that I neeed to also pay him 200 pesos for sitting under the awning table! He explained this is an expensive location to do business and that I needed to satisfy BOTH 200 peso requirements. I protested, as this was new to me, but "Alex who makes it happen" insisted. This was an excessive fee, which, as I found out upon returning to La Paz, is not legitimate. It was simply what Alex could get from a tourist.
My point? Do business for food and drink only at the main palapa restaurant. Do not assume that every vendor is affiliated with that business.
The beach itself is great! Choose your service wisely!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

298506881.name: WORTH THE DRIVE
298506881.author: a TripAdvisor user
298506881.reviewBody: well worth the drive if you have a car. gin clear water, cute taco shacks on the beach, great view of Espiritu Santo, jet ski rentals, panga rides. excellent dry camping at the east end although this spot can get real windy.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

298277253.name: Great beach for kids
298277253.author: a TripAdvisor user
298277253.reviewBody: This beach is paradise!  I felt totally safe with my two kids there age 7 and 4.  Big beach so it was not crowded.  Also there are no hotels on beach so don\'t have to put up with loud music, wet t shirt contests, drunks, etc.  Remote and more pristine beach.  There is maybe 2 restaurants on the beach.  Water is calm.....great beach I would definitely return!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

296058144.name: Great People...
296058144.author: a TripAdvisor user
296058144.reviewBody: This beach is all locals and we had a GREAT time. They catered to us and fed us like it was ourlast meal. Been their a few times.. Jet Ski\'s, Tours you name it..

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

293431087.name: Location!
293431087.author: a TripAdvisor user
293431087.reviewBody: Great staff, average food, strong drinks. But the location makes it. A gorgeous beach, and the porch is right on the water. So lovely.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

292887534.name: Infinity beach
292887534.author: a TripAdvisor user
292887534.reviewBody:
It is a long beach where you can find what you prefer: silence, people, motoscooter, kayak, trip to isla espiritu santu, restaurant, small but good bar.
You can swim without problem and sometimes, if you are lucky, you can see whales from the beach.
The sunset hour is something amazing.
During the weekend becomes very crowded.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

291452141.name: Feels like vacation!
291452141.author: a TripAdvisor user
291452141.reviewBody: The drive to get here is fun and you feel like you are driving to the end of the world and then appears this beautiful beach. It\'s very long which helps it feel not as crowded. We were there on a Saturday. We had lunch at a restaurant there (Palapa Azul) and then had use of their lounge chairs. This was one of my favorite vacation days!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

289555041.name: great place to eat and snorkle
289555041.author: a TripAdvisor user
289555041.reviewBody: Short drive from Balandra, great little restaurant or take a boat ride to Isla Espirito Santo, a walk down the beach and super fun snorkeling

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

289294426.name: Great place for lunch and swimming
289294426.author: a TripAdvisor user
289294426.reviewBody: Beautiful beach. Great food and drinks. No one else was here! had the whole place to ourselves. Try the chocolate clams "natural". worth the drive from La Paz. Find a taxi driver to take you there for the day. You can negotiate prices with most cab drivers and he will stay and wait for you. Be sure to hit Balandra beach as well. We  were gone for about 5 hours and paid $500 pesos.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

286969635.name: Chocolate clams!
286969635.author: a TripAdvisor user
286969635.reviewBody: Love the beach restaurant here but would never bother with the beach. Often super windy. Waves can be rough, beach is not smooth, view is magnificent but the facilities are rustic at best \nFood is a good value, service is good, banos are a bit gross

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

283696429.name: Best beach near La Paz
283696429.author: a TripAdvisor user
283696429.reviewBody: Best beach of the trip.  We liked Tecolote the best because it was a nice blend - good services, activities/rental gear, friendly people.  Clear water, decent depth, great views.  My daughter had an awesome massage from a Portuguese woman there who was a pro.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

283089057.name: Family fun activities
283089057.author: a TripAdvisor user
283089057.reviewBody: Jet skiing, stuffed clams, margaritas, white sand beaches, sunsets, banana boat rides, views of Isla de Espiritu Santos

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

280642531.name: Great Beach
280642531.author: a TripAdvisor user
280642531.reviewBody: great beach, restaurants, pango\'s for trips to Espiritu Santos, rental kayaks, beach chairs, jet skiis, and more....love this place

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

280164268.name: Good for swimming not for snorkeling...
280164268.author: a TripAdvisor user
280164268.reviewBody:
First of all, this beach is very beautiful and clean. On the other hand, if you think you are going to see lots of fish, you are wrong. This beach is like a giant, natural swimming pool and will not disappoint for a swim.
For snorkeling you will need to take a tour to one of the islands, like Espiritu Santo.

There are two restaurants right by the beach, palapas for shade and vendors walking up and down trying to sell you souvenirs or hats.  I also noticed they offer massage right by the beach, too bad I did not try it.

The tours to Isla Espiritu Santo depart from this beach.  Playa Tecolote is about 20 minutes from La Paz seafront and it is very easy to get to by going northeast on the main road where La Paz seafront is at.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

277858143.name: Beautiful Tecolote!
277858143.author: a TripAdvisor user
277858143.reviewBody: From the gorgeous view of the island of Espiritu Santos to the lovely beach with all its services and delicious food....This beach is a winner!   Great for swimming and sightseeing and just a lazy beach day and proximity to Balandra beach which is extremely close and totally different make it a great outing for the day....\nI would recommend having raw clams on the half shell...so fresh and wonderful...\nAnd there are vendors there for visitors that like to take home little souvenirs...

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

275390871.name: Eat fresh seafood with your toes in the sand!
275390871.author: a TripAdvisor user
275390871.reviewBody: We happened upon this spot by accident, just taking a drive from La Paz one morning. There was a fairly large restaurant right at the end of the road but we turned right and found a smaller spot with the tables right on the beach. The ceviche was excellent and the fish tacos the best we found in Baja. And the view, wow, can\'t beat it. This spot is a must-do when in the La Paz area.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

271536323.name: Farthest beach out and gorgeous
271536323.author: a TripAdvisor user
271536323.reviewBody: We left from Tecolote for the Espiritu Santo sea lion trip and were glad to have done so, since it shortened the time in the boat (versus starting from La Paz) and also gave us time to explore the beach. Both ends have interesting rock formations to browse, and there are a couple of on-the-beach restaurants if you want a cold beer or dish of ceviche.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

269140325.name: Nice Beach, Beautiful View, Great Seafood
269140325.author: a TripAdvisor user
269140325.reviewBody: We visited Tecolote several time during our week in La Paz. This is a family beach with several clam shacks. We highly recommend Restaurant La Concha, at the far right as you drive up to the beach. We were looking for a shady spot to park our stuff, and a really nice guy calling himself "Big Nose" came up and offered us a couple of lounge chairs, an umbrella and all the bathroom trips we needed, 100 pesos for the day. During the five hours we hung out at Tecolote, we got the best Margaritas we\'ve had on this trip so far, a big plate of chocolate clams and beer. Big Nose was attentive, but not overbearing and very friendly, it made for a very nice day at a terrific beach.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

266142952.name: Landed at Tecolote Beach from Espiritu Santo
266142952.author: a TripAdvisor user
266142952.reviewBody: We kayaked across from Espiritu Santo, and landed at this beach.  It seemed nice, though we didn\'t spend a lot of time there.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

265899767.name: Enjoy seafood on the beaches of Sea of Cortez
265899767.author: a TripAdvisor user
265899767.reviewBody: lots of good restaurants to choose from. Spend the day on the beach. Can get windy in the afternoons!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

264323807.name: Great beach to have a Pina Coloda or a Cerveza
264323807.author: a TripAdvisor user
264323807.reviewBody: Only spent a couple hours there but great beach for swimming even though its a little rocky first few feet in the water.  You can see Isla Espiritu from this beach.  Quite a few places to stop & have a cerveza or cocktail with food.  Definetely worth spending an afternoon here.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

263307484.name: The BEST Beach in La Paz!!
263307484.author: a TripAdvisor user
263307484.reviewBody: Located on the Canal de San Lorenzo, this beautiful, long, white sand beach offers everything a beachcomber could want.   From the cold beer at the cafe to the snorkeling at the point, a day at Tecolote will be unforgettable.   When we\'re not out cruising the islands in our sailboat, this is where the Admiral and I go for our beach fix.   And, there\'s always a private spot; the beach is that long.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

263166770.name: Good margaritas
263166770.author: a TripAdvisor user
263166770.reviewBody: In addition to the beautiful beach, the facility on the beach that served margaritas were some of the best we drank while in Mexico.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

259655128.name: Nice Beach with Fresh Seafood Available
259655128.author: a TripAdvisor user
259655128.reviewBody: This expansive, white sand beach is a great place to relax.  Rocky headlands at each end are potential good locations for snorkeling, but it was a bit windy the day we were there.  I\'ve heard there can be good shore fishing but didn\'t have any luck.  Other than the palapas, there\'s not much in the way of shade, so be sure to put on your sunscreen!  We also had a decent late lunch at one of the little places on the beach.  A word of note for rental car drivers: this is an off-pavement area at which undercarriage damage that might not be covered by your insurance, damage which is very possible if you stray from the most packed areas of the sand roads near the beach.  It\'s also possible to get bogged down.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

257678502.name: Margaritas and chocolate clams in the sand?! Yes please!
257678502.author: a TripAdvisor user
257678502.reviewBody: Chocolate clams are infamous in the La Paz area.  They\'re huge - and not really chocolate, more of a pink color.  Eat them as ceviche or stuffed & barbecued with fresh tomatoes & onions. If they\'re out, sometimes someone will get a mask and go get more right there from the sea. You can get wild on this beach or just lay back and enjoy the peace.  And as always, with beaches in Mexico, SHUFFLE YOUR FEET in the sand to avoid the rays.  They won\'t bother you if you don\'t sneak up on them!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

255562928.name: Nice Beach
255562928.author: a TripAdvisor user
255562928.reviewBody: I enjoyed our day at Pichilingue.  It was a chilly, windy, January day, but I still had a good time.  I love hunting shells and I found several different ones than I already had.  The beach is a little rockier than some of the other beaches. Any day at the beach trumps just about anything else!  I understand that this is a good beach to go windsurfing and I believe it - the wind never stopped blowing.  Restaurants, drinks, and bathrooms available so would be great to spend the whole day there.  Will be doing just that next time I am in LaPaz.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

255262689.name: Beautiful...
255262689.author: a TripAdvisor user
255262689.reviewBody: This is the most beautiful beach in the area. We had a great time walking the long beach, meeting and chatting to folks camping there, and will definitely be back to sit at the Bar Tropical Palapa Azul for the best margaritas in the world! Seriously, they are - and I don\'t even like margaritas!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

255136043.name: Nice place great views of E Santo
255136043.author: a TripAdvisor user
255136043.reviewBody: Sorry my review of Danto posted here.  See my Esp\u00edrito Santo review. This place is great but only go to the big palapa for food and drink. Great staff. They are a 10 and they are very nice. Food is ok they feature Choclate Clams. I don\'t eat them but they look great. The drinks are great and fair prices. Well done.  LPM

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

253737171.name: not for me
253737171.author: a TripAdvisor user
253737171.reviewBody: we came to use the washrooms and a couple of margaritas, the whole place needs some new money to spruce up the existing beach clubs...but darn good margaritas...as it is now its just a turn around and go back to balandra beach for me

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

252672035.name: everything I love in a beach
252672035.author: a TripAdvisor user
252672035.reviewBody: It felt more remote and "wild" than some of the other beaches around, even though you can drive right to it and there are food stands around. I liked having the little restaurants--awesome ceviche and fish tacos.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

252610862.name: The beaches of La Paz
252610862.author: a TripAdvisor user
252610862.reviewBody: The waters of Playa El Tecolote are incredibly clear. The beaches are medium sand with a large assortment of sea shells to collect. Mostly beach shacks and the only tourists were the ones from tour buses .

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

252519698.name: Like a ghost town..
252519698.author: a TripAdvisor user
252519698.reviewBody: We visited and check out playa tecolote but there were no tourist the place was empty...so we went back and hit the road  straight to Balandra beach. ..

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

251986434.name: Just a beach
251986434.author: a TripAdvisor user
251986434.reviewBody: A few beach shacks with food and drinks. Was windy and a bit chilly.. might be more impressive on a nicer day. Lots of RVs, feel cats and dogs.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

251341172.name: Pretty clear, blue water
251341172.author: a TripAdvisor user
251341172.reviewBody: Very pretty beach. I\'ve been there a couple of times and it has never been busy. Only a mile or so from Balandra Bay so make sure you see both!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

250931453.name: Beautiful and empty
250931453.author: a TripAdvisor user
250931453.reviewBody: We were at Tecolote Beach in December 2014 too.  It was windy but you can\'t control the weather.  We swam in the surf and hung out at the palapa bar.  They have great margaritas (of course), pina coladas and chocolate oysters.  The oysters are not actually chocolate, they are called that because of the color of the shell.\n\nThis beach is beautiful and there were less than a dozen people when we were there.  If we could have been there on a less windy day, it would be ideal.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

249180393.name: Nice Beach
249180393.author: a TripAdvisor user
249180393.reviewBody: Unfortunately, during our visit over Christmas 2014, the weather was cooler and the wind was up.  This beach is not protected so the waves  were very strong and we couldn\'t swim there.  We have been swimming at this beach before and it is beautiful but this year the weather would not cooperate!  I would recommend visiting this beach though.  It is beautiful.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

249056464.name: Amazing Beach Bar
249056464.author: a TripAdvisor user
249056464.reviewBody: The little beach bar here is amazing. They make the most amazing Margarota on the planet. Be careful though :P Meet the people that live in the area and the "travelers" as Gary calls them. If you Get to this bar make sure to say hello from Neil and Cathy for me.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

248986032.name: Great Pina Coladas
248986032.author: a TripAdvisor user
248986032.reviewBody: The beach is wonderful and the food is to die for but the pina coladas will keep you coming back time and again. The restaurant with the boat had the most delicious guacamole and chips, had more than one of these over the week.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

247902850.name: Fun beach at the end of the road
247902850.author: a TripAdvisor user
247902850.reviewBody:
Past Balandras beach just a short way is Tecolate. It's a completely different vibe.

Different kind of beach, lots of rocks, long flat beach to walk on. Plenty of places on the beach to grab lunch and drinks, rent kayaks or take a boat across the bay.

When I was there, it was cool and really windy, so I couldn't see how clear the water was with the big waves.

Business owners were there painting and cleaning, definitely getting ready for the winter season. It looked like it would be a really fun place to come and hang out for the day.

There's a handful of restaurants so you have choices of where to eat.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

247107507.name: Pretty water. Period.
247107507.author: a TripAdvisor user
247107507.reviewBody: Visited on a windy day, so surf was rough and high on the beach. Restaurants weren\'t open yet, so vendors were quick to charge $10 for use of banos while someone chiseled concrete above my head! Safety and sanitation are recommended. Several restaurant choices are here, and several boat excursions to Espiritu, and no facilities at Balandra Beach, so the facilities here should be somewhat humane. Viewed large dead blowfish (2 feet long) on picnic table top on beach, as well as bird with broken neck hanging over table edge. Gross.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

245830148.name: Tecolote Beach
245830148.author: a TripAdvisor user
245830148.reviewBody: Tecolote is close to Balandra Beach.  There are a few restaurants/bars lining the beach.  Not as calm and pristine as Balandra, but with more facilities.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

245256649.name: Locals Beach for watersport rentals
245256649.author: a TripAdvisor user
245256649.reviewBody: Popular local spot because they have kayak, quads, jet ski rentals, along with restaurants, washrooms and there are bbq pits along the beach you can use of your own cooking.  Lots of local Families with Kids on the weekends.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

244089218.name: Great for hanging out
244089218.author: a TripAdvisor user
244089218.reviewBody: At the end of the road lies Tecolote Beach.  It doesn\'t look like much, but the atmosphere is totally laid back.  The beach itself is nice, and a great place to grab a palapa and plunk down with a good book.  There are a few rather "beachy" bars and snackeries, and you  can substitute "beachy" with "ratty" if you prefer, but then you\'d be missing the point.  The people are friendly, though we encountered a rather obnoxious fellow who had been drinking way too much curveball.  There are also some very sad looking homeless dogs hoping for a handout.  That always breaks my heart.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

243869330.name: Never miss a visit to this beach
243869330.author: a TripAdvisor user
243869330.reviewBody: Have visited La Paz a number of times and never miss going to Tecolote Beach a few times during our stay.  Beers are ice cold and Margarita\'s are great at the open bar. Enjoy having some great seafood from the Azul restaurant on site, visiting with other travelers and taking in the sun and the ocean from this great beach.\nI do have one WARNING though.  Pay attention to the signs about the sting rays that sometimes lie in the sand at waters edge.  IF you get stung it hurts a bit for a while and take heart in the fact that you would not be the only one that did this and also the staff at the bar and restaurant will offer a soothing remedy of bathing in cold water and some gentle massage of the affected foot.\nENJOY

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

242640767.name: Time for late lunch on a patio just steps from the ocean?
242640767.author: a TripAdvisor user
242640767.reviewBody: El Tecolote offers a reasonable beach, but even better - several restaurants with freshly-prepared seafood and great service, all overlooking/right ON the beach.  We enjoyed a HUGE plate of Baja nachos, loaded with meat, cheese, beans, jalapenos, with sour cream and salsa; with a couple of icey-ice-cold beers, we thoroughly relaxed after our day spent swimming at Balandra Beach.  \nAhhhhhhh

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

242587786.name: try a margarita here
242587786.author: a TripAdvisor user
242587786.reviewBody: This is one of my usual stops when I am in La Paz.  We always stop for a margarita in the afternoon just to enjoy the view of Espiritu Santo.  And we often meet interesting people from around the world.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

241903994.name: Awesome beach
241903994.author: a TripAdvisor user
241903994.reviewBody: Take the time.  Rent a car.  Take a bus.  Whatever...just get out there and soak up the peace.  Sundays are not so good if you don\'t like people.  It\'s packed full of families.  Beautiful, though, either way.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

239734452.name: Placid and Perfect Playa
239734452.author: a TripAdvisor user
239734452.reviewBody: If you like calm, turquoise water, you will love El Tecolote. It costs about 200 pesos by taxi to get out there, but the taxi driver will come back for you at whatever time you say. There are a couple of outdoor bar, restaurants, where you can sit in the shade and have a drink. There was very little current, and the water was clear and a perfect shade of turquoise. Fun for swimming.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

239406102.name: Palapa Azul, nice place to end a beach day
239406102.author: a TripAdvisor user
239406102.reviewBody: Spent the day at Playa Balandra a few kilometres before Playa Tecolote, we drove over to have a quick drink/snack at Tecolote before heading back to La Paz.  We enjoyed some nice margaritas and chips/guacomole, came to 385 Pesos for 2 huge (strong) margaritas and a nice dish of fresh guacomole served by a very handsome barkeep. Strong breeze and  blue, blue ocean under a bright sky.  No complaints!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

238833135.name: Super fun
238833135.author: a TripAdvisor user
238833135.reviewBody: Great place very rustic, nice people, food can be good. I like it out there. It\'s safe and pretty, close to Ballandra. Bring your own cooler. Spend some money on shrimp tacos. Buy a t shirt, ( playera) from the little guy with no teeth.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

238508538.name: Great lunch spot along the beach
238508538.author: a TripAdvisor user
238508538.reviewBody: Nice spot for lunch and cerveza! overlooking the Sea of Cortez and Isla Espiritu Santa, the beach is also lovely but can get a bit windy.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

237282058.name: If you like the water, ya gotta visit this place
237282058.author: a TripAdvisor user
237282058.reviewBody: If you like family beaches, then this is it for La Paz. Situated opposite the offshore islands, it is THE play ground for locals. Half a dozen very nice restaurants as well.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

227592690.name: Beautiful white sandy beach, warm water
227592690.author: a TripAdvisor user
227592690.reviewBody: We visited from Todos Santos and it took us about 1.5 hours to get to Tecolote which is the last beach you can reach. White sandy beach and water was very warm, almost NO waves at all. Great to swim and you could rent beach chairs and umbrellas and buy food and drinks.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

226989021.name: Nice taxi ride and beach time
226989021.author: a TripAdvisor user
226989021.reviewBody: This is one of the beaches at the northernmost point of the La Paz peninsula. It has a nice open air restaurant and rental equipment of all types, Kayaks, Jet skis, unbrellas, chairs . . . The beach is very nice and perfect for swimming.\n Good for a couple hours. It was 250 pesos each way in a cab (08/30/14).

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

225570213.name: Very nice beach
225570213.author: a TripAdvisor user
225570213.reviewBody: Have been to Tecolote several times and just love it. if you go during the week you just might be one of the very few people there. Saturdays are a little more crowded but Sunday it can get very crowded. Very long beach and the water is great for swimming and snorkeling.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

222497611.name: Not the best....
222497611.author: a TripAdvisor user
222497611.reviewBody: We just returned from Cabo San Lucas and La Paz.  La Paz definitely beats Cabo in terms of beaches.  Unfortunately, we visited Balandra first which was simply beautiful.  This beach did not compare.  We found the water and view beautiful, but the beach was extremely dirty.  There was trash everywhere and the sand was extremely rocky - we never even took our sandals off because you could see bottle caps and glass everywhere.  I will say that there are a couple of restaurants, but we didn\'t even try them because of the looks of them.  If the beach area were cleaned up and the facilities improved, this would be a nice place to spend the day.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

222446842.name: Teocolote has fabulous snorkeling
222446842.author: a TripAdvisor user
222446842.reviewBody: For a quiet long beautiful beach this is it!. The beach is long and faces Isla Espiritu Santo. There are restaurants that are quite good but expect touristic prices. The water is clear and you can see tons of fishes just looking at the water from land. Beautiful site!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

214169901.name: Nice Place
214169901.author: a TripAdvisor user
214169901.reviewBody: I had a few drinks in different places. Some better than others but worth the drive. Rented wave runner for hour and headed back towards La Paz ( the other way not much to see)  there are a few bays that look like bahama s here within minutes. Watch out for burried sting rays ! shuffe your feet always when walking in water. You can actually rent waverunner and go to Isla Espritu fairly easy as well.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

213679077.name: The Turquoise Playa
213679077.author: a TripAdvisor user
213679077.reviewBody: Tecolote beach is located north of La Paz about 25 minutes by car and the most northerly of the beaches out side of La Paz. The day we were there the weather was very hot and the beach was bustling with activity as this is obviously a favourite place for the locals to relax. If you like snorkelling the best place is at the south end along the rocks where you will not disappointed. There are all kinds of fish and an impressive array of beautiful living corals. \nThere are also several restaurants that offer good food and drinks. The fish tacos we had were really delicious and the setting is lovely. You can see the island of Espirtu Santos to the north. The beach is very long and with water so warm it makes for a great walk and you can cool off with swims. One caution here are the sting rays, you must learn the Baja Shuffle to be safe. We saw no rays on this trip but they love the shallow warm water.\nAll in all a great day at the beach!!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

213512300.name: Best Beach Near La Paz
213512300.author: a TripAdvisor user
213512300.reviewBody: Worthy of a Corona commercial. There are several restaurants and you can do things like rent jet-skis, but don\'t get the impression that this mile-plus stretch of soft white sand is ever overcrowded. Being on the Cortez side of Baja, the warm waters are safe for even the smallest children to play in.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

212932403.name: La Paz area beaches
212932403.author: a TripAdvisor user
212932403.reviewBody: Water as beautiful and clear as the Caribbean, but with a lot fewer tourists.  Then, of course, you look up towards the land and see the dry, cactus-laden hills behind the beach and you know you\'re in the Baja.    Playa Balandra was equally beautiful.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

204376968.name: Gorgeous Beach
204376968.author: a TripAdvisor user
204376968.reviewBody:
The Beach is marvellous! Some criticize it for being windy, yes, it is, mostly early mornings and evenings. During day-time is awesome. 
Plenty of activities, good sea-food. We had cocktail of shrimps and octopus, live clams, guacamole, it was a bit pricey, but taking into account the fact, that restaurant is far from civilization, the price is reasonable. 
Some criticize the all-rocky surface of the beach. 
Not true! 
It's all gentle white sand all the beach long, the only stripe of rocks (5-6 ft wide) is sort of in front of the restaurant, in the water like hip deep, once you pass it - it's all crystal clear unreal green water and pure sand you can see 2-5 meters down. So, as a conclusion, Tecolote is good for snorkeling. Also, as an added benefit, walking on the rocks massages your feet and stimulates all vital zones of your feet, just like expensive chinese feet massage. To say I prefer sand to rocks to walk upon is like to say i prefer Macdonalds buns to whole grain bread! It's hard, but it's worth it. 
One advantage that Tecolote has and Balandra doesn't - mantarayas. At Tecolote there are small waves, and rayas are rare guests. At Balandra you can't step once without stepping on a small raya. They are sunbathing in shallow waters, like on a mantaraya farm! Ugh!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

200985176.name: Best beach around
200985176.author: a TripAdvisor user
200985176.reviewBody: Better then Balandra if you don\'t mind a bit of wind.  Stay to the east end though, the west is busy on the weekends and full of garbage.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

199180884.name: Services and restaurants.  Good place to depart for Isla Espiritu Santo.
199180884.author: a TripAdvisor user
199180884.reviewBody: This beach is at the end of the road.  It does not compare to Ballandra beach in terms of beauty and easy of use, but it does have restaurants, bars, etc.  We left for Espiritu Santo from el Tecolote because it saves time.  Worth a look!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

198007474.name: Beautiful
198007474.author: a TripAdvisor user
198007474.reviewBody: This is a very beautiful beach, with a few restaurants and water activities available. The only negative I have is in regards to the snorkeling, which was just okay.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

196699360.name: Not the best
196699360.author: a TripAdvisor user
196699360.reviewBody: We tried to go to this beach yet it was so commercial and really windy.  Drive to Balandra and dont bother.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

196654451.name: Lots of Ex-Pats -- Rocky beach
196654451.author: a TripAdvisor user
196654451.reviewBody: Places to eat along this stretch of unprotected, rocky beach ...  Not my favorite beach at all.  We had fish tacos at the restaurant $140 pesos for 4 batter cooked fish tacos!  $40 pesos for a Pacifico..

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

196647423.name: Beautiful Beach
196647423.author: a TripAdvisor user
196647423.reviewBody: Good food and plenty of drink available.  Don\'t come to shop, but do come to enjoy a swim, sun, and perhaps a scuba trip to swim with sea lions

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

196211625.name: crowds, nice beach walk, wind, and services
196211625.author: a TripAdvisor user
196211625.reviewBody: A short distance from Balandra, a great windy beach walk, food and beach chairs, as well as boat service.  Not as good for small children as Balandra.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

195605145.name: Not my favorite
195605145.author: a TripAdvisor user
195605145.reviewBody: Compared to Balandra and Pichilingue, this beach really suffers.  It\'s not as clean and the day we went it was really windy.  There are jet skis to rent here, so that might be a reason to go (or a reason to stay away).

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

195416491.name: Disappointing
195416491.author: a TripAdvisor user
195416491.reviewBody: After the beauty of Balandra beach we were very disappointed with Telecote.  It was just a long stretch of sand with some unattractive shack type restaurants and kiosks.  It was a functional beach to hire kayaks to get to the Island Espiritu.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

195089401.name: Nice beach to walk on ,or sit for awhile.  Good swimming,
195089401.author: a TripAdvisor user
195089401.reviewBody: Fun to walk the beach and take a dip in the ocean. Very casual place. Some food and drink available.  Wasn\'t crowded the day we were there.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

194763267.name: Nice
194763267.author: a TripAdvisor user
194763267.reviewBody: This place is nice, but we liked Balandra much better.  Tecolote has the restaurants and you can rent umbrellas and chairs, but there\'s more people and it\'s not as peaceful and quiet as Balandra.  You can easily do these two beaches in a day since they are only a minute apart from each other.  this place has bathrooms, Balandra doesn\'t.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

194324563.name: One of the all-time best
194324563.author: a TripAdvisor user
194324563.reviewBody: I\'ve been to beaches all over the world--from Australia and Hawaii to Spain and North Africa, plus dozens of places in between.  But, for my money, I have to say that Playa Tecolote is one of the best.  Clear water, just enough surf to play in, and a reliable breeze to keep things pleasant.  You also have decent services in the form of a few restaurants and bars.  Perhaps most importantly, we nearly had the place to ourselves.  It was wasp season when we visited (February 7-14), but the bugs weren\'t nearly as bad as in Playa Balandra during the same time period.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

192860518.name: Quite a View
192860518.author: a TripAdvisor user
192860518.reviewBody: My wife and I visited the area and decided to eat at one of the beach clubs on the water. The food and service were okay, but we had trouble with wasps hovering around our food. We did learn the Spanish word for wasps so we picked up something new on the trip. We saw dolphins playing in the distance and the view of the offshore islands would be spectacular in the morning or evening. We sensed this was the "off season" pace because there were very few people on the beach and the pace at the clubs was pretty slow.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

192620142.name: Spectacular, secluded beach
192620142.author: a TripAdvisor user
192620142.reviewBody: In January the water was slightly chilly but still amazing for a dip. The water is crystal clear with a beautiful, picturesque beach. There was essentially nobody at the beach besides us...except a few local guys selling their goodies. We had lunch at one of the restaurants on the beach and enjoyed the food and strong margaritas. It is a great day trip to take with a beautiful view along the way.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

192590431.name: Worth the drive or bus fare
192590431.author: a TripAdvisor user
192590431.reviewBody:
If you have four people take a cab or its 70 pesos by bus (van type) out to this beach or/ and the others along the way. Don't miss it if your in La Paz.

See the pictures..... no peddlers, a couple of restaurants and you can rent some stuff (I think).

Viva Mexico

Mike

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

190902365.name: The BEST seafood I have ever had!
190902365.author: a TripAdvisor user
190902365.reviewBody: My wife and I headed to Playa El Tecolote on a recommendation from our hostess in La Paz to eat lunch. The beach itself is stunningly beautiful, with clean white sand and turquoise water. However, it was too cold and windy to swim or snorkel that day (early January). However, we ate lunch at the brightly-colored restaurant there and I can honestly say it was the best seafood I have ever had. I am not a "foodie".... there are people who can write blog after blog and read book after book about food, and I am not that guy at all. But this was worth writing a review about! My wife and I had the "Baja style" seafood platter, with incredibly fresh fish, shrimp, scallops, octopus and squid, with fresh corn tortillas and some amazing just-spicy-enough salsa. A massive amount of seafood, plus two drinks, for less than $40.00 (this would have been more like $60.00 in the U.S.) If you like seafood and you are in the La Paz area, you MUST get to this place for lunch!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

190304802.name: Nice beach, good restaurants
190304802.author: a TripAdvisor user
190304802.reviewBody: and there is good snorkeling around the corner at the west end\nof the beach.  Spent the day and had a great time.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

189369379.name: pretty but too windy when we were there
189369379.author: a TripAdvisor user
189369379.reviewBody: Beautiful stretch of sandy beach. It got too windy for us to stay warm but it was nice otherwise. Nice little restaurants.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

188819014.name: Beautiful and secluded.
188819014.author: a TripAdvisor user
188819014.reviewBody: Worth the short drive out there, although there is some rough road.  There are some small restaurants and the one we chose was excellent.  Take a look at the menus and choose the one that appeals to you, but seriously consider the larger enclosed palapa restaurant (don\'t have any idea of the name).

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

188524648.name: Emerald color water, calm cove and pristine sandy beaches.
188524648.author: a TripAdvisor user
188524648.reviewBody: This is a very nice swimable beach. The gradual slope of incline makes walking into the sea of Cotez a pleasent experience. Bring a picknic basket, a good wine and music and you are in haven. This beach reminded me of many pristine beaches in the Bahamas. So, enjoy and explore this beach.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

187358964.name: Beach with ammenities
187358964.author: a TripAdvisor user
187358964.reviewBody: Not the shallow flat water experience like Balandra near by, but a nice beach.  Much more developed than Balandra with restaurants and bars right on the beach.  After our 2nd hike at Balandra we were tired and did not stay here too long.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

186388788.name: Another Beautiful Baja Beach
186388788.author: a TripAdvisor user
186388788.reviewBody: We headed to the beach simply for lunch.  We enjoyed a beautiful view as we ate incredibly tasty shrimp.  It looked like the perfect spot for kayaking.  Next time we\'re on La Paz I expect that we\'ll spend more time at this beach.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

185737930.name: Our favourite beach in the world!
185737930.author: a TripAdvisor user
185737930.reviewBody: Perfect white sand, a gentle slope into the clear, warm waters of the Sea of Cortez, and the beauty of Espirtu Santo island across the sea are just some of the splendors of this magnificent beach. Never crowded, there are a number of restaurants and a couple jetski rentals on the beach. There is also plenty of room at either end of the beach to be alone. Loved everything about Tecolote!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

185539146.name: Fun day
185539146.author: a TripAdvisor user
185539146.reviewBody: Came here with a group of friends on a Saturday.   Picture personal service on the beach, walking mariachi bands, crystal clear blue water, cheap wave runners (with no restrictions of how far you can go).  We had a blast.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

185399983.name: Great for relaxing and taking pictures. Sunset is beautiful
185399983.author: a TripAdvisor user
185399983.reviewBody: Long beach with lots of palapas to sit under. You\'ll see a lot of locals especially on weekends. Some of them park their cars close to the beach, turn up the Mexican music and sit on the beach. I find that fun but if that\'s not cup of your tea, there are so many places in this beach where you can get away from it all and from everybody. It is a very long beach. A few restaurants on the beach serve great seafood. The whole environment is very relaxing and laid back. Also, sunsets on this beach are beautiful!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

185216579.name: Fun Beach
185216579.author: a TripAdvisor user
185216579.reviewBody: Go here to chat- over a beer- with other travellers- mostly Canadians and Americans about their travels and discoveries in the area. Very modest place but always pick up some good tips and you MUST buy a T shirt from the charming Manuel while enjoying the beach and the waves.   This is also a good place to launch your trip to the Islands where you can snorkel with the Sea Lions which is also a lot of fun

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

180629319.name: Crystal blue water.
180629319.author: a TripAdvisor user
180629319.reviewBody: Very beautiful beach with palapas to sit under. There is about 4-5 bar restaurants to eat at. We preferred playa Balanda.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

178758445.name: Loved this beach!
178758445.author: a TripAdvisor user
178758445.reviewBody: This is a spectacular beach!  In September it\'s practically deserted and so nice and  quiet.  Swimming and snorkeling was fun here!  There are palapas to lounge under too.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

174813673.name: Need to be improved
174813673.author: a TripAdvisor user
174813673.reviewBody: El Tecolote is not bad, the sea is beautiful but not as Balandra. The beach should be CLEANED UP much more and regularly, we spotted always the same problem: fire\'s leftovers and bottles caps. \nHere you will find very simple restaurants were have a good lunch but pay attention to your bill!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

172707387.name: My favorite La Paz beach
172707387.author: a TripAdvisor user
172707387.reviewBody: a bit out of town but well worth the drive - long flat sandy beach dotted with indoor/outdoor restaurants and bars, amazing water and very low key friendly family atmosphere.  Gorgeous view of Isola Santo Spiritu as well.  GO

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

171399835.name: Eat at La Concha del Tecolote
171399835.author: a TripAdvisor user
171399835.reviewBody: We had a great lunch under a large palapa at the beach, cooked by Restaurant\'s owner Se\u00f1ora Lupita and her husband. The fried fish (pescado empanizado) and the octopus were fresh and wonderful and the grilled chicken (pollo a la parrilla) was tender and juicy, enough to please our picky 9 yo. And it came with fries. The beach is very nice, but it has more surf than nearby Balandra. If you visit both, you get to enjoy the different moods of the gulf.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

170777427.name: Have a nice Beach day near to La Paz, BCs
170777427.author: a TripAdvisor user
170777427.reviewBody: Tecolote beach is the best in town. You can have a great day between white sand, blue ocean, and the friendly guys who attend the local restaurants. Food speciallity? Sea food. You can taste ceviches, clams, fishes, everything from the sea.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

167505859.name: All we needed was Tom Hanks..
167505859.author: a TripAdvisor user
167505859.reviewBody: Cruised to lands end beach at Tecolote. We went during the week on a Wednesday and there was no one there save the bartender. It was AWESOME!!\nThe Azul bar sits on the beach. Drinking margaritas, staring at the beautiful blue water, and hanging with just a few locals was perfect. We kind of felt like Tom Hanks in Castaway with a bar!!\nIf you are looking for a quiet day trip, Tecolote during the week is the answer in La Paz. Besides the bar, they offer a full menu of food, snorkling and hanging on the beach. There are also a few local with boats to charter there.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

166743238.name: beautiful
166743238.author: a TripAdvisor user
166743238.reviewBody: Very cool beach with various rentals and a restaurant.  The "adventure" services can be a little pushy but a great place overall.  If you want something remote and secluded go to Balandra but if you want activity, beer stands and food, hang out at Tecolote.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

166218540.name: A good place to find a good deal to head to Espiritu santo island.
166218540.author: a TripAdvisor user
166218540.reviewBody: Here you will find the best deal in case you wan to go to the Virgin Islands around the area.\nEven if you want to stay here I would recommend to head to the other tiny island where you can find corals and have peacefully time with super clear waters.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

165602481.name: The Hell in the Heaven
165602481.author: a TripAdvisor user
165602481.reviewBody: A crowded beach with bananas boats, jet skis, loud music, food tents selling everything. To be honest, I hated.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

163677140.name: Great beach restaurant
163677140.author: a TripAdvisor user
163677140.reviewBody: Great place to visit on the weekends. Friendly staff and great food. \nThe view is incredible. You see the beautiful island Esp\u00edrito Santo.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

162717729.name: Check out Tecolote Beach
162717729.author: a TripAdvisor user
162717729.reviewBody: Tecolote Beach is only a kilometer outside of Balandra Beach and a short drive from La Paz.  The beach is almost as nice as Balandra, but it\'s benefit are the restaurants right on the beach that\'ll give you a chance to refuel mid-day.  If you walk around the edge of the beach, you\'ll hit a rocky area with beautiful views.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

160826732.name: Run down...past its prime
160826732.author: a TripAdvisor user
160826732.reviewBody: This is a little piece of Cabo San Lucas in an extremely remote location just north of La Paz. There are two separate companies offering services on this beach however neither of them have been well maintained. The first wave runner I rented had engine issues and the second one was not much better. This is a long way out of town for a fairly disappointing experience not to mention the beach is not child friendly with the undertow and waves.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

158775144.name: Camarones (shrimp) cocktail at Palapa Azul
158775144.author: a TripAdvisor user
158775144.reviewBody: After a day of fishing the Gulf of California we ask our captain to stop at Tecolate Beach and enjoy the laid back ambience at the Palapa Azul right on the beach.\n\nTheir camarones cocktail is the best! They make a great margarita too or just enjoy a cerveca or two.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

157977694.name: Long beach with lots of amenities, crystal clear water
157977694.author: a TripAdvisor user
157977694.reviewBody: The last beach on the road to the tip of the Pichilingue peninsula with a view of Isla Espiritu Santo  We went there on Easter (very crowded with families) and on a weekday (very empty).  Plenty of restaurants and water sports rentals and tours. The tour operators are very low key, honest and not at all pushy.  The water is crystal clear and the sand nice and soft.  I preferred the weekday when it wasn\'t so crowded but depends on your preference.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

157028475.name: Lovely beach for the day
157028475.author: a TripAdvisor user
157028475.reviewBody: Long beach of white sand with red hills behind and desert vegetation. Palapas on the beach and restaurants for refreshments. Quieter at Balandra Beach but still a lovely place to visit. We parked at Balandra and standup paddled around to Tecolote, had lunch then paddled back on a lovely calm day. Do it early in case the winds arrive.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

156888188.name: Great views with amenities
156888188.author: a TripAdvisor user
156888188.reviewBody: Like many La Paz beaches, you won\'t find sugar sand, but the beautiful scenery, and easy access to an ice cold cervesa and lunch was why we spent one day here.  Stake out your spot at one of the many palapas, clear the round rocks from under your towel, sit back, read a book, or be entertained by folks kayaking and jet skiing in the clear blue water.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

154542232.name: On the beach........
154542232.author: a TripAdvisor user
154542232.reviewBody: Food that\'s good, drinks that are good and the beach at your fingertips...it just doesn\'t get much better for hanging out at the beach!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

153315343.name: Nice place for a Pina Colada
153315343.author: a TripAdvisor user
153315343.reviewBody: Beautiful view. the couple of restaurants have great drinks, cold beer and fresh seafood.  There are also tour guides that can take you to the island or set you up with a kayak or a seadoo.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

153230998.name: Just for checklist
153230998.author: a TripAdvisor user
153230998.reviewBody: Playa Tecolote is nice, has some activities and can have some places where you can eat. I prefer beaches like Playa Balandra.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

152815011.name: Long, pretty beach
152815011.author: a TripAdvisor user
152815011.reviewBody: More open to wind than others, but on hot summer days this shouldn\'t be an issue.  Several restaurants, but we didn\'t eat there. Great view of sea and hills. Sweeping.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

152745863.name: pick up your boat here
152745863.author: a TripAdvisor user
152745863.reviewBody: pick up your boat here, and that\'s about all you need to do. big parking lot but it\'s supposedly not very safe. there are better beaches around.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

152743452.name: Tecolote Playa, a very nice beach to visit and enjoy !
152743452.author: a TripAdvisor user
152743452.reviewBody: Tecolote Playa, please go, relax and enjoy a really nice beach, fifteen miles north of La Paz. Go by bus or find a good taxi driver to take you there for a decent price ! One of two or more great beach to visit just outside of La Paz. This beach offers a wide variety of services to enhance your beach experience.  You can take a tour of the islands, go kayaking, buy a T-shirt or some good food.\nSpeak a little Spanish, and the staff there will be very helpful. The water is nice and clear, although a little windy, when we were there, the waves were not bad ! All in all, a very enjoyable weekday, afternoon and photo op experience, too !  Enjoy, Skippyfrizz z,

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

150135112.name: Sooo Relaxing!!
150135112.author: a TripAdvisor user
150135112.reviewBody: Drove around the beach for a while... then stopped in at Palapa Azul for some lunch..  Hector is great!  We had margaritas that were also really good there.  Interesting place!  We love to hit these spots with so few people ...  just sit and have a ice cold drink and some great local food..!!!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

149862636.name: Nice beach for shells
149862636.author: a TripAdvisor user
149862636.reviewBody: Lots of kitchy mexican seafood resturants and bars along this beach; \nTiendas, palapa rentals, great views

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

149133645.name: Two restaurants and a beach
149133645.author: a TripAdvisor user
149133645.reviewBody: There were two restaurants here but the food was not very good. We\'d recomend eating before or after visiting the beach. During the windy days you are better off going to Balandra beach because it is more isolated from the winds. \n\nWe did see several Pelicans diving for food, it was really cool to see a set of three of them dive in sync.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

147956235.name: Beach disappointments
147956235.author: a TripAdvisor user
147956235.reviewBody: Not a very big beach, nor is it very clean. You pay to use the washrooms, and the restaurants did not look very appetizing. We drove off rather than staying for long.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

147265406.name: Very nice beach!
147265406.author: a TripAdvisor user
147265406.reviewBody: It is a very big beach, wonderful for a long walk, great for swimming and snorkeling. \nIt is very convenient because it has "palapas" ( palm big umbrellas like), it has restaurants and bathroom facilities. Also has rentals for Water toys ! Lovely beach!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

146264321.name: One of the best beaches anywhere
146264321.author: a TripAdvisor user
146264321.reviewBody: This is a gorgeous location and we had it mostly to ourselves. I suspect it feels very different when busy - we could see the quad tracks in the white powder sand. Enjoyed a beer at the nearby bar - far enough away we had to drive - on the road. Tried snorkeling, at the rocky end to the left as you enter and did see a fair number of fish on sandy bottom, but not a lot more.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

146170069.name: Nice beach
146170069.author: a TripAdvisor user
146170069.reviewBody: Was expecting a nicer beach. The sand is pretty rough. But once you get past the rocks at the water\'s edge, the ocean is great for swimming. We drove there, and parked our car down the beach a ways, away from the restaurants. Had a nice area of beach all to ourselves. Brought our own drinks. Later had lunch at Palapa Azul, right on the beach. Good tacos and beer.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

146154395.name: My favorite place to be!
146154395.author: a TripAdvisor user
146154395.reviewBody: There are no words to describe the beauty of this place. Fantastic and paceful. Restaurants available with great seafoods and some water sports available as well. This place is a must. Around 30 minutes driving from the city.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

145990284.name: Watch out for the sting rays!!!
145990284.author: a TripAdvisor user
145990284.reviewBody: We selected this beach to swim at on our trip to the Balandra / El Tecolate Beach area  (they are less than 10 minutes apart) to explore, picnic & swim.  A local from San Jose del Cabo , who we know very well, suggested not swimming at Balandra because of sting rays.  I swam and waded at Balandra, wearing my klog footwear, but my wife did notl  We had lunch there and then headed over El Tecolate to enjoy the water together.  We went in the water a number of times using the "stingray shuffle".  Ejnoyed the beach, water and vistas immensely.  It whole area was spectacular!!!  As a bonus we saw a pod of dolphins chasing fairly large fish very close to us.  The whole school would fly out of the water in a syncronized group as they attempted to evade the pursuing dolphins.  It was an extrodinary opportunity to view nature in action.  It was as we were heading out of the water for the last time, maybe over-confident about the possibility of stingrays, when my wife stepped on a stingray, very near the shore in less than a foot of water.  The pain was immediate and excruciating.  For the record now, treatment with urine, is NOT a sound recommended treatment by the medical experts. She immediately brought up that the Crocodile Humter, Steve Irwin, had died from a stringray sting.  We head for La Paz for treatment at a hospital.  The treatment was fast and professional.  The intense pain subsided in several hours and there was minor pain the next day or so.  It\'s  worth the visit but take care!!!!!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

145393266.name: summer beach
145393266.author: a TripAdvisor user
145393266.reviewBody: playa tecolote is great during the warm weather but not a good choice for children if it\'s windy outside. we love tecolote for the views of Isla Espiritu and the relaxed island feel of the atmosphere. it\'s not the "nature" beach like it\'s sister playa balandra.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

145046774.name: Nice little hideaway
145046774.author: a TripAdvisor user
145046774.reviewBody: This beach is at the tip of the peninsula. There are a couple of bar/restaurants here and palapas on the beach. The crowd seemed to be a lot of locals hanging out and having fun. Some kids were ripping around on a ATV and I had fun in my Jeep splashing around. This is a good place to go to experience Baja the way it was years ago- no crowds and lots of freedom.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

144872149.name: Don\'t take your shoes off!
144872149.author: a TripAdvisor user
144872149.reviewBody: There\'s no power on the beach, so the bar serves beer from an ice chest. The access path is deep in mud, and the so-called powder sand is littered with broken glass

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

142603366.name: Tecolate is great!
142603366.author: a TripAdvisor user
142603366.reviewBody: I used to go to Tecolate Beach to go swimming on a beach with a restaurant, bathrooms, and showers.  But....over the past 10 years, I\'ve stopped going there to swim (I much prefer the nearby Ballandra Beach, even with none of the above), and go to Tecolate to eat!  The dish they make there that is my favorite is red snapper that is so good with a delicious, crunchy crust, and in share-able size portions.  There\'s a full bar, great bloody marys.....\nThere are "bananas" pulled by jet skis...lots of fun....but the beach is not the softest sand...and the water gets deep quickly as you go out.  It still attracts a lot of people, though, and overall it\'s got a fun vibe.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

142570241.name: Beautiful secluded beach
142570241.author: a TripAdvisor user
142570241.reviewBody: We visited this beach near La Paz while on vacation in San Jose del Cabo.  The beautiful colors of the water are just amazing to look at.  My husband is from Acapulco and has seen many beaches in his life and said this beach tops them all!  He was completely amazed at the beauty.  Unlike Balandra Beach, the water was not shallow and wave free so my daughter could not sit in the water.  But she still enjoyed the warm water in our arms.  We never saw any crabs or anything else to poke our feet in the water.  No water shoes needed if you go to the secluded part away from the restaurant and public.  We just camped our stuff under the rock ledge without really needing a beach umbrella.  We could see through the beautiful water and see little fish swimming around us.  We were fun and gave them crumbled crackers to eat to see them swim and swim for it.  It was breathtaking and I will definitely want to visit again soon!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

139071876.name: Beautiful but need water shoes
139071876.author: a TripAdvisor user
139071876.reviewBody: Just went to this beach and it was incredible... except for some kind of water plant in the first 50 feet or so that have very sharp thorns and get stuck in your feet when you step on them - OUCH! You should bring thick-bottomed water shoes or swim over top of the dark band in the water until you get to the part with white, soft sand that is just incredible. You don\'t even have to swim, because the water is shallow enough to stand and walk around for a long way out. There are some fish in the water to look at and evidence on the sandy bottom that there are lots of clams underneath. My husband had some amazing, huge fresh clams that they took out of a bag in the water and cut open right there, with some herbs mixed in. it was incredible! I also recommend if you are staying in San Jose del Cabo to take the road back through La Paz and Cabo San Lucas, because we took the way back that said San Jose del Cabo, thinking it would be a short cut, and it took 4.5 HOURS. It was an incredible drive through lush mountains and valleys (at least during the rainy season ;-) and we enjoyed driving through a really pretty little town with lots of old style colored buildings,, but it was waaaay longer than expected, so take this as a warning!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

137260542.name: Super beautiful beach just 15 minutes from malecon.
137260542.author: a TripAdvisor user
137260542.reviewBody: This is probably my favorite beach in La Paz as it has a great view of the Isla de Espiritu Santo and also you can have a beer or food while enjoying the view .\nGreat sand and beautiful blue water and only 15 or 20 minutes from La Paz makes this a winner .

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

135080182.name: Stark, romantic beauty
135080182.author: a TripAdvisor user
135080182.reviewBody: Playa Tecolote is a dramatic beach less than a 30 minute drive from beautiful La Paz. The white sand and the amazing turquoise colored water complement a stunning view of distant Isla Espiritu Santo. It is somewhat exposed and can sometimes be fiercely windy. The camping is free, which is amazing. Be sure to be prepared for wind blown sand when camping, however. The sunrises and sunsets are incredible.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

134367053.name: Great place to camp
134367053.author: a TripAdvisor user
134367053.reviewBody: The beach here is a awesome place to camp. We camped for free and went to the restaurant for drinks. Peaceful and quiet.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

133800253.name: Beautiful secluded public beach without waves.
133800253.author: a TripAdvisor user
133800253.reviewBody: A great place to go to eat, ride wave runners, do banana boating, or take a boat out to the sea.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

132402919.name: really secluded- we were the only ones there. Scenery was fantastic
132402919.author: a TripAdvisor user
132402919.reviewBody: good tacos at the little stand, beer very cold. Washrooms were not great

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

131195796.name: Beach Destination
131195796.author: a TripAdvisor user
131195796.reviewBody: Has everything on a long beach with a view of Espiritu and the Sea of Cortez. 20 minutes from downtown La Paz, you could spend a full beach day here. There are several restaurante or cantinas, for most of your needs. Camping and day camping a little further East on the beach. Craft rentals, etc.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

130630173.name: Quiet and fun
130630173.author: a TripAdvisor user
130630173.reviewBody: Beautiful water for wading (and beach sports). Banos and beer nearby

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

129324768.name: Cool local beach!
129324768.author: a TripAdvisor user
129324768.reviewBody: It\'s a bit rough if you are used to white sand beaches and rolling waves, but really nice.  There are a couple of places to get food and drinks, also a bit rough, but great food and super friendly service!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

128168061.name: Clean, crisp water
128168061.author: a TripAdvisor user
128168061.reviewBody: This beach differs from balandra because it is not a shallow bay. You can actually swim around. It too is absoultely stunning. There are services here. Book a panga trip ride to Espiritu Island through Diana down near the palapa restaurant that has a boat built into the back wall.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

128018644.name: Way intense
128018644.author: a TripAdvisor user
128018644.reviewBody: We had visited El Tecolote about 15 years ago and had a nice time sitting at a palapa and enjoying the beach. This time it was packed with people - more young singles than families. The top of the beach is completely lined with restaurants. Lots of loud music, a beach soccer tournement going on. We walked up and down a bit and then decided we\'d prefer a quieter place. If you want to party at the beach, this is probably a good choice.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

127252417.name: Rustic area, quiet and remote.Very nice beach
127252417.author: a TripAdvisor user
127252417.reviewBody: Remote from La Paz. Food so-so but the beach and swimming\nis great with views of Espiritu Santos.\nQuiet, spent the whole day on the beach.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

126842156.name: Beautiful Beach!
126842156.author: a TripAdvisor user
126842156.reviewBody: We camp here 4 times a year with our Caravan Tours.  Love it!  The waters are crystal clear and the view of Espiritu is fabulous.\n

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

126830415.name: Just like home but with a server and bartender
126830415.author: a TripAdvisor user
126830415.reviewBody: We will visit in a 3 week period at least 3 times a week. It is one of the most quiet, natural, ocean beaches available to the public for swimming. Caution to the wind for sting rays. We witnessed one such event.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

126745362.name: Sand, shells, light surf, sparkling water, ramadas, all you need for a pleasant afternoon.
126745362.author: a TripAdvisor user
126745362.reviewBody: Although it can be a little breezy Tecolote beach has everything you might be seeking with the possible exception of solitude.  It is popular and you\'ll have the opportunity to purchase food and drinks. You\'ll also be able to relax by a sand dune or beachcomb undisturbed with your thoughts if that is your desire.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

125575191.name: A slice of heaven
125575191.author: a TripAdvisor user
125575191.reviewBody: Long walks early in the morning without the sight of chain hotels in the horizon a deklight to the eye !

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

124991292.name: Beautiful beach
124991292.author: a TripAdvisor user
124991292.reviewBody: We loved the view from this beach. However, dress warmly if the wind is blowing. We were freezing cold there in February.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

124721408.name: too crowded for my taste
124721408.author: a TripAdvisor user
124721408.reviewBody: family beach with BIG families, but could be worse, nice view over the sea, NOISY

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

123937731.name: Too cold to swim but shrimp cocktail was fab
123937731.author: a TripAdvisor user
123937731.reviewBody: Sitting on a deck above the beach, looking at Espiritu Santo, sipping a Negra Modelo, munching on the Coctel de Camaron or Pulpo (not like any shrimp cocktail or octopus appetizer you\'ve ever had), relaxing with friends, wrapping my shawl around my shoulders.  Loved it!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

122624634.name: Great for walking
122624634.author: a TripAdvisor user
122624634.reviewBody: What a beach for strolling and looking at Espiritu Santo, then returning to a beach chair for an afternoon of cervezas, shrimp and ceviche. Beautiful waters, clean sand, great views.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

122014078.name: White sand beach
122014078.author: a TripAdvisor user
122014078.reviewBody: About 12 clicks south of town. Go to the 15 seat beach bar in the center when you think you\'re getting sunburnt. Antonio, the bartender, speaks excellent English and pours a mean cocktail

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

121359010.name: sort of sleezy
121359010.author: a TripAdvisor user
121359010.reviewBody: one of those beaches where they will try to seel you all kinds of stuff and get you to eat in their reastaurants on he beach - a bit commercial for my liking...

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

121081841.name: Pulpo a la plancha
121081841.author: a TripAdvisor user
121081841.reviewBody: Stayed at Costa Baja so this was about 15 minutes away by car. Very pretty drive there with rugged hills/ cacti~ we stopped several times to take pictures. The beach is about 1 mile long, fine sand and a killer view of Isla Espiritu Sanctu. Water and swimming lovely first day, second day a bit rough. There is a constant wind coming onto the beach. We parked just to the right of the road in- no fixed palapas on the beach but the guy put up an umbrella and two lounges and we were perfectly happy. We ate at ?Azul- has a small bar building and an inside restaurant area. The grilled octopus was spectacular- so good we came back for it the next day and braved a bit of weather! Very inexpensive, large portion, nice people. You need a car to get here however.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

120440150.name: Best beach with public Palapas and facilities
120440150.author: a TripAdvisor user
120440150.reviewBody: We spent a couple of wonderful days at this marvelous beach where the public palapas are free (great shade) with a marvelous expanse of sand and turquoise blue waters. Look for Mario who is so enthusiastic, running the dive/snorkel shop (and cute, too!) he could be Mayor of Playa El Tecolote!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

120077417.name: Breath taking
120077417.author: a TripAdvisor user
120077417.reviewBody: This beach is one of the most beautiful in the world. The water a clear snorkeling is amazing. A must

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

117337135.name: A little bit of heaven in La Paz
117337135.author: a TripAdvisor user
117337135.reviewBody: Great spot, went with a tour out of Cabo. Beach was fantastic, water was calm, warm and crystal clear. There was no one there to sell you anything, just empty palapa\'s and an empty beach. Was the opposite of almost all other beaches in the Cabo area, A real gem.  Food is available and you can rent jetski\'s etc, but no one tries to force anything on you. Great spot

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

117284390.name: Like a dream.
117284390.author: a TripAdvisor user
117284390.reviewBody: Playa Tecolote is absolutely AMAZING.  I felt like I had died and gone to heaven.  The contrast between the desert and the crystal waters will leave you breathless.  We drove in on a Wednesday, so it was pretty empty.  There must have been a total of 10 people on the whole beach.  We were able to wade into the water with our snorkel gear and swim along the cliffs on the left-hand side of the beach.  We saw tons of tropical fish including schools of needlefish, a barracuda, and even a shy little octopus!  I highly recommend Tecolote and hope that one day I can return.

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

96522397.name: I am glad to give thumbs up to this beautiful beach!!!
96522397.author: a TripAdvisor user
96522397.reviewBody: Shallow and calm waters, black sand and very fine yellow-white sand, a couple of restaurants and a long, very long beach walk compliments the beauty of this remote beach 20 minutes away from La Paz . There is beautiful sea shells and very pretty rocks all along the beach. Enjoy!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

23421550.name: Absolutely pristine beach/water
23421550.author: a TripAdvisor user
23421550.reviewBody: If you have visions of sitting on a flat white beach with a minimum of waves on the Bay of La Paz overlooking the island of Espiritu Santo - this is your beach - it has 1 or 2 restaurants, bathrooms, a small parking lot and above all, very friendly people - a mix of natives and snowbirds that come here - to get here - simply go north from La Paz and follow the signs for the twin beaches of Tecolote and Balandra - both are not to be missed!

address.streetAddress: Km 7.5 Al Noroeaste de Pichilingue Playa El Tecolote

629973460.name: Very Good but Expensive!
629973460.author: a TripAdvisor user
629973460.reviewBody: We stopped here after a full day at Balandra. The food was very good and the service outstanding. The waiters moved tables next to the water for us so we ate our food with the water literally lapping at our tours. My only complaint is that compared to other top notch eateries in La Paz Pichilingue is quite expensive.

629025391.name: Not good
629025391.author: a TripAdvisor user
629025391.reviewBody: Just next to the road and very noisy. The cars can get into the beach and that\'s horrible. There were various cars with very loud music.

619810054.name: Middle of the road
619810054.author: a TripAdvisor user
619810054.reviewBody: Maybe we were there at a bad time.  I didn\'t find anything unusual about the place.  My advice?....go to the city..La Paz.

591408700.name: Lovely beach
591408700.author: a TripAdvisor user
591408700.reviewBody: This was such a pretty view. My friend and I had lunch at the hotel restaurant beside the beach and saw so much marine life. We had such a relaxing time on the beach. Like our own private beach. Saw soap bubbles coming out into the water from the hotel but that\'s the only downside.

589774585.name: Good snorkeling despite the litter on the beach
589774585.author: a TripAdvisor user
