589774585.reviewBody: Don\'t let the nearby ferry port fool you. The north side of the bay has great snorkeling along some surprisingly intact and beautiful coral. It\'s the closest beach to La Paz, so it\'s a popular place for picnics - don\'t expect a clean beach.

578695755.name: Family beach day
578695755.author: a TripAdvisor user
578695755.reviewBody:
This Playa, is one of the many you should stop by and grab a bite. There’s a Pichilingue restaurant for you to enjoy some fresh catch of the day while the children play in the beach a few steps away. Your sitting on top of the sand or you can choose other wise. 

The food was good and a reasonable price. They take credit cards but make sure to take cash for a tip. Tips can’t be added in most credit card machines in La Paz. 

There’s a beautiful view with the option to rent a jet sky or other fun activities. (By this time my battery had did so I wasn’t able to take pic of the food or restaurant.)

569111570.name: Location and service was excellent
569111570.author: a TripAdvisor user
569111570.reviewBody: The restaurant is right on the beach.  You can almost have your feet in the water when it is high tide.  The wait staff was excellent.  The food was good and the prices were in the average range.  I would recommend this restaurant.

524507366.name: you should go there
524507366.author: a TripAdvisor user
524507366.reviewBody: spend your day in A PLEIN SOLEIL... they rent lounge chairs and umbrellas for all day and they are cheap\nparking lot rithg there you can get there very easily by the highway

522709204.name: Mostly locals
522709204.author: a TripAdvisor user
522709204.reviewBody: One thing about this place was that it seemed that it was mostly locals. Nothing wrong with that, but we felt out of place. We left and went to Balandra, which was cleaner and nicer.

483698187.name: Beautiful
483698187.author: a TripAdvisor user
483698187.reviewBody: We took the La Paz tour and ended up at this beautiful beach. We had lunch at one of the restaurants, some great seafood, and took in the nice views. Recommended!

470433272.name: Ok
470433272.author: a TripAdvisor user
470433272.reviewBody: Australian beaches are beautiful and so Australians are very hard markers when it comes to beaches. It was interesting to see a beach in a desert, and the water is a beautiful color, but there\'s not much else going for it.  Ok for a couple of hours.

462943759.name: Quiet Beach, good restaurants
462943759.author: a TripAdvisor user
462943759.reviewBody: We had the beach to ourselves and enjoyed kayaking and swimming. Has a couple restaurants--great options for lunch.

456590338.name: the perfect beach!
456590338.author: a TripAdvisor user
456590338.reviewBody: gorgeous waters, a great restaurant. you really can\'t go wrong here. and it was quiet when we were there- no people!

456496294.name: great food
456496294.author: a TripAdvisor user
456496294.reviewBody: when in baja go at least one day to pichilingue, great to go with friends for a very good seafood meal

453653001.name: Small beach, close the highway
453653001.author: a TripAdvisor user
453653001.reviewBody: Playa Pichilinque is close to the highway and when the tide goes out, it is a lot of mud! But the sand is white and the water is tuquoise, so not all is bad! There are palapas for rent and restaurant on the beach as well. I think the Esprit du Santu tours take off from this beach.

442088736.name: An excellent location for lunch.
442088736.author: a TripAdvisor user
442088736.reviewBody: The location, food and service is all good. And the fishing from the beech is OK also. We snorkelled, fished then ate. Who needs Balandra bay?

439232399.name: Amazing view and seafood
439232399.author: a TripAdvisor user
439232399.reviewBody: The best seafood in town and just in front of the ocean, great variety of Mexican seafood style form cebiche to tostadas and tacos. \n\nAnd the view is breath taken !!!

434073351.name: Lunch @ Pichilingue !
434073351.author: a TripAdvisor user
434073351.reviewBody: We we\'re coming back from Balandra beach and were a little hungry, so we decided to stop by this restaurant I can\'t remember the name of it, but it was on Pichilingue beach. The restaurant was facing the beach and while we waited for our food we swam a bit. We saw lots of Fishes, lots of rocks though I wore my sandals, other than that very tranquil and enjoyed our little time there.

429414086.name: Charming day!
429414086.author: a TripAdvisor user
429414086.reviewBody: Perfect weather, and a great location, a very calm water bay, very low dept thus you need to really get out in order to swimm  in deep, some traffic on a north side with wave runners and pangas, 2 restaurants with great seafood, in the weekdays is a mre tranquil place, weekeds are fairly crowded, no public facilities, thus you are forced to buy a drink at the restaurants in order to use them; if you anjoy the sunsets, this is a good location to enjoy them with a nice cold drink.

428843359.name: Great underwater scenes.
428843359.author: a TripAdvisor user
428843359.reviewBody: We snorkels beyond the junk. Tires and assorted garbage underwater. Beyond that there were pockets of beauty by the rocks. Almost vignette like scenes with sealift. One would not expect good snorkelling when faced with the garbage underwater at first. But well rewarded if you go out beyond the junk.

408089464.name: Paradise in La Paz
408089464.author: a TripAdvisor user
408089464.reviewBody: If you are looking for a peaceful place you should come here. This beautiful beach is a must in La Paz. Far away from the noisy Cabo is, believe me, so close to heaven; this place is overwhelming. Take a beer and fresh chocolata clams beside the sea while you watch pelicans walking around or swimming beneath the waves. If you wish, you can also have lunch here and taste a very fresh fish and amazing seafood.

398893470.name: view
398893470.author: a TripAdvisor user
398893470.reviewBody: a quiet place to visit during the week but busy with locals on the weekend. A nice place for a meal and a drink with a great view of Espiritu Santo island.

395174073.name: Amazing beach
395174073.author: a TripAdvisor user
395174073.reviewBody: This beach is small but full of life. We say 4 rays jumping out of the water while they played hop scotch with each other and then landing with a resounding POP". There are lots of fish in the water to snorkel around with, too.

384139452.name: Clear waters no waves!
384139452.author: a TripAdvisor user
384139452.reviewBody: My husband and I ventured to beaches near La Paz at recommendation from locals, I got to snorkel a little , unfortunately they allow jet skis at this beach and was not completely comfortable with this. Nice and shallow , good for beach for families and kids , a restaurant on site but did not eat there, just had water and beer and they allow you to use seating and palapas if you consume .

378772018.name: Great locale better food!
378772018.author: a TripAdvisor user
378772018.reviewBody: We love Chocolate Clams ( shell is brown) and there is no better place to get this delicacy then here on the beach in Pichilinque \nThe whole fish and Tacos are excellent as well

372909727.name: Chill place to kick off your shoes
372909727.author: a TripAdvisor user
372909727.reviewBody: Excellent margaritas and almgjos chocolates not only fresh in the shell but brought up to the kitchen from the "casa chocolate" right at the waters edge where the clams are kept.\n\nSand was smooth and white and water clear and azure blue. Excellent service and a wonderful way to spend an afternoon.

359798092.name: Nice beach but very crowded
359798092.author: a TripAdvisor user
359798092.reviewBody: The beach is nice but it is very crowded. It is a good spot to finish the day and go to have dinner while watching the sunset.

358565379.name: White sand beach
358565379.author: a TripAdvisor user
358565379.reviewBody:
Went to a restaurant there. E X P E S I V E
BUT they accommodated us with a dog
Food was great
Margaritas superb
Vey friendly
The beach white sands. A bit north very dirty as nobody collects the garbage and it spills all over

356543901.name: Beautiful Beach
356543901.author: a TripAdvisor user
356543901.reviewBody: Local families park their cars and put up their shade and enjoy this beautiful beach all ay Sunday. Far from town if you don\'t have a vehicle, take a taxi.

350642162.name: Nice beach
350642162.author: a TripAdvisor user
350642162.reviewBody: Easy to get to, small restaurant to eat at with good service and reasonable prices. You can also get boat ride to nearby island during the day. local Mexicans go here as well. easy to watch kids on the back as well

343430774.name: "Old Mexico"
343430774.author: a TripAdvisor user
343430774.reviewBody: Very peaceful location. Had ice cold beers and watched the sunset under a huge palapa.  Water was tranquil and colorful.  Had the feel of "old" Mexico without the high rise hotels, loud music and beach vendors.   Easy access from town.

342039973.name: Wow. Very tranquil setting. Close to town.
342039973.author: a TripAdvisor user
342039973.reviewBody: Extremely calm waters in this stunning bay. Water colours to die for. A couple of eateries tons of easy parking a boat launch and wonderful snorkeling and kayaking.  Plan to spend a day or more on this white sandy beach. Untouched gem.

339270915.name: Gorgeous setting
339270915.author: a TripAdvisor user
339270915.reviewBody: Beautuful wide sand beach. Quite a few campers but lots of room to spread out. Bring a wrap as it was quite windy making it seem chilly.

337080477.name: Another little gem
337080477.author: a TripAdvisor user
337080477.reviewBody: We stopped at this beach on our way back from Balandra Beach to shoot the sunset. It\'s a nice little place to have a beer, or tacos or nachos. But we found the food to be very expensive.

334540906.name: so so beach
334540906.author: a TripAdvisor user
334540906.reviewBody: We went to the ferry terminal and then to the beach. The beach only has a few restaurants on it and the beach was not busy at all. I would recommend other beaches in the area.

331838440.name: CAMERONES FELIZ
331838440.author: a TripAdvisor user
331838440.reviewBody: Go to the Pichilingue Restaurant and try the Camerones Feliz (Happy Shrimp).  Shrimps fantailed, stuffed with cheese, andf wrapped in bacon.  Incredible, my favourite dish ever!

329212192.name: Beautiful and quiet piece of beach
329212192.author: a TripAdvisor user
329212192.reviewBody: This is a small strip of beach, but it is extremely beautiful, with its clear turquoise waters. You can take a good swim and see lots of colorful fish swiming right by you.\nIf you want to go to Isla Espiritu Santo, you can catch a tour from here for around 40-50 USD.

327500752.name: needs cleaning up
327500752.author: a TripAdvisor user
327500752.reviewBody: we were dropped off here...needs a lot of tlc and could again be a great spot...sad such a beautiful area and place...hope it gets taken care of

316676354.name: Amazing Sunset
316676354.author: a TripAdvisor user
316676354.reviewBody: What a beautiful quiet beach - Two restaurants to enjoy for a perfect sunset.\nDrive is well worth it :)

292977957.name: A special place to enjoy the sunset
292977957.author: a TripAdvisor user
292977957.reviewBody: We usually came here to have a glass of chardonnay, a plate of almeja chocolate and a marvellous sunset in front of us.\nThe beach is quite good also for sunbathing and swimming but the most I prefer here is during the end of the day. The restaurant Playa Pichilingue is our special place for this. Prices are probably too much high but you forget them easily when you leave after a good meal and an astonishing sunset. The staff is super kind.

291894844.name: Fresh seafood
291894844.author: a TripAdvisor user
291894844.reviewBody: The ;pier shown is in front of one of the best beach side restaurants in La Paz.  It is in the first cove past Pichiningue, first palapa on the left

290583958.name: Take a tour to Isla Espirito
290583958.author: a TripAdvisor user
290583958.reviewBody: Turquois waters & white sand. We got our snorkel gear & headed on our small boat to Spirit Island. We snorkeled with seals.

275353505.name: Last minute road trip....
275353505.author: a TripAdvisor user
275353505.reviewBody:
So a couple we met at our resort told us about this restaurant they went to earlier in the week. The food sounded so amazing me had to check it out. So two days later we rent a car and drove a little over 2 hours passed La Paz to this little restaurant out in the middle of no where. 

It's a hut looking restaurant with cheap tables and plastic chairs with the view of a pretty, clear water lagoon type of beach. We sat at a table and studied the menu with our feet playing in the most softest buttery sand!! The menu is Spanish so.....it took us awhile. Service was kind of slow but very hospitable. 

One thing the couple recommended was the margaritas made from fresh lime juice. Yes!!!! Order this. It's not on the sweet side, it's on the fresh squeezed lime juice side....and to us, it was delicious. 

Second, ordered the shrimp ceviche. Huge portion. Add the sauce that is on the table. Muah!!! So good. He also gave us their fresh pico, we ate half of it with their crunchy tortilla chips (it was kind of spicy) and I ordered some avocados that I added to the rest with some squeeze of limes from our ceviche and WHALAH!!! Guacamole!!!! And it was divine.

We asked for the waiter's recommendation because we didn't know where the fresh grilled whole fish and grilled prawns were on the menu that the couple recommended. So we ended up getting the lobster with a cream sauce topped with mushrooms and tomatoes...my boyfriend sucked on the shells afterwards because it was that delicious. We laughed about that but we were on vacation and we were having fun!!! Memories.

This is a memorable place with excellent, fresh seafood. We will definitely come again the next time we stay in Cabo. It can be romantic and family oriented as well. 

***After lunch, we drove to Balandra Beach which is also a must!!! A beautiful lagoon. Bring snorkeling gear, cooler with snacks and refreshments because it is far from a store.

272058298.name: An excellent location for lunch right beside the ocean
272058298.author: a TripAdvisor user
272058298.reviewBody: Pichelingue is a popular beach a few miles to the north of La Paz. There are more beautiful beaches further to the north like Balandra and it can get busy at the weekends. However,none of the others have such a marvellous restaurant right on the beach almost in the water! I would say it is defintely not the cheapest restaurant in La Paz but the quality of the food and service is outstanding. It\'s the idea spot for a very lazy afternoon lunch washed down with your choice of ice cool beverage and a view across the small bay. If you hang around long enough you might even take in one of La Paz\'s spectacular sunsets.\nIn my book it gets five stars

271820252.name: Why Pichilingue?
271820252.author: a TripAdvisor user
271820252.reviewBody:
Pichilingue has a real cool name. But the beach, in the context of the much better beaches nearby, is not a big deal. Shallow water, narrow strip of sand, they are okay; but across the bay is the ferry landing, uglying up the place.

Just a few kilometers up the road are Balandra and Tecolote beaches, much, much better.

So why do people come to Pichilingue?

271536755.name: Among the closest beaches
271536755.author: a TripAdvisor user
271536755.reviewBody: Lovely beach with nice snorkeling at the far end....just hide your belongings well in the rocks before going out. Bus service from La Paz to the beach is regular, on time, and inexpensive.

269412020.name: Best seafood
269412020.author: a TripAdvisor user
269412020.reviewBody: We went there by private yacht. Our captain ordered several dishes to share. The food was excellent.

261370573.name: GORGEOUS beaches
261370573.author: a TripAdvisor user
261370573.reviewBody: I almost hate to review this as I don\'t want it over run by tourists but it really is a beautiful drive and beautiful beaches. Water is bath-warm and pristine. There\'s nothing I don\'t love about Mexican culture so it\'s going to be a luv-review.

252672186.name: Um, it was not lovely
252672186.author: a TripAdvisor user
252672186.reviewBody: We were told to go to the restaurant there to eat the Chocolata clams, so that\'s what we did.  The beach did not look enticing at all, although it was chilly that day. Just not my style.

251720633.name: Excellent seafood ceviche
251720633.author: a TripAdvisor user
251720633.reviewBody: Sitting under the new palapa with our feet in the sand we enjoyed a lovely serving of seafood ceviche, with a nice glass of cool beer.\nIt was perfect.

247866064.name: much better
247866064.author: a TripAdvisor user
247866064.reviewBody: this a very nice beach where there is a very good restaurant and you can relax and take some sunshine not for bathing water too shallow better if you want to walk.

247818602.name: Great and calm beach
247818602.author: a TripAdvisor user
247818602.reviewBody: Water is a deep, turquoise blue and green. There is only one very good restaurant, try the clams. A good place to relax.

245830315.name: Kayak at Pichilingue
245830315.author: a TripAdvisor user
245830315.reviewBody: Pichilingue is not the prettiest beach, but we enjoyed an afternoon kayaking there.  There is a rocky outcropping on the right that has a small but colorful reef with plenty of fish.  Uncrowded and pleasant.

245255180.name: Nice beach but exposed to the wind
245255180.author: a TripAdvisor user
245255180.reviewBody: Lovely beach with places for food, rentals and drinks, however, if the wind is blowing out of the North this beach gets blown out.  So, good place to visit on a less windy day.\n

238833249.name: This place is great
238833249.author: a TripAdvisor user
238833249.reviewBody: The chocate clams are for seafood lovers. Saltines hot sauce and clams. There really good. This is the place to have them. Water is pretty and the service is good.

237906679.name: Chocolate Clams!
237906679.author: a TripAdvisor user
237906679.reviewBody: Tranquil Beach and a VERY GOOD beachside restaurant which has the BEST Chocolate Clams in the world! Tacos and whole fish are awesome as well\n\nThose  not in the know these are Brown Shelled clams which you can eat raw ( with Habenero sauce) or baked

222447822.name: Turned out to be one of our favourites!
222447822.author: a TripAdvisor user
222447822.reviewBody: The large restaurant with the sandy floor also turned out to be one of our favourites in this area. We shared a fried whole fish and it was delicious. This beach although looked like it was too close to the Ferry terminal action turned out to be one of the best for snorkelling. Off to the right hand side if you are facing the ocean, there are tons of fishy. Where it is n=more shallow, there are black sea urchins that made the under water scene look like an aquarium. Love this beach and the Playa Pichilnque Restaurant there.

218618619.name: Gem of a Playa
218618619.author: a TripAdvisor user
218618619.reviewBody: Had a great time there. Ate some great food and the beach is inviting. Can\'t wait to return. The water is turquoise and very child friendly.

216212321.name: Best sand
216212321.author: a TripAdvisor user
216212321.reviewBody:
White sand beach
Wonderful clear water
Great swimming beach
Fun small tiki bars
Great place to hang out have a few beers and enjoy the sun.
Bring a comfy chair if you are wanting to be away from the beach bars.

214696243.name: Whats not to like.
214696243.author: a TripAdvisor user
214696243.reviewBody: Discovered this place almost accidentally.  Talk about eating on the beach under a thatched roof and sand floor.  So good we went back the next day for lunch.  Really recommend the clams.  They have a pen on the beach where the divers put the clams and when you order them, they go out and get them out of the pen.  Price is real right.  Only bad thing is the 250 peso cab ride each way.

214170221.name: Small and perfect
214170221.author: a TripAdvisor user
214170221.reviewBody: Went to restaurant with Pier. Perfect setting. They made me Shrimp Cocktail tha tasted like abloody mary and it was PERFECT. Met some great people and Highly recommend this place!

213680045.name: Another Awesome Beach in La Paz
213680045.author: a TripAdvisor user
213680045.reviewBody: Pichiligue  Beach is another great beach. La Paz is blessed with great beaches outside the city that are really easy to get to and provide visitors with everything that one would need for a great day at the beach. Here we have really good snorkelling, a beautiful view, superb swimming in warm water and some really competent restaurants. In fact one of the best meals we had in La Paz was here. We shared a whole fried fish that was served with rice and a salad. That was enough for two of us. The fish was perfectly cooked and really tasty. I guess the beauty was in the simplicity. Wish I was there right now. The beach is also a family beach and it was so cool to watch everybody having a good time.\nWe will definitely return on our next trip to La Paz.

209332711.name: Spectacular Water, good restaurants
209332711.author: a TripAdvisor user
209332711.reviewBody: The water at Playa Pichilingue is picture perfect.  The beach is just on the other side of the ferry station and is fairly close to La Paz itself.  My husband sat at one f the palapa-roofed restaurants while I snorkeled across the bay.  The food at the restaurant looked very good-I saw a man walk into the kitchen carrying a big bag of clams right out of the bay!We were the only non-Mexicans there, which for me, is always a plus.  Pichilingue is worth the visit. Come hungry!

204840241.name: SUNSET!!!!
204840241.author: a TripAdvisor user
204840241.reviewBody: Have dinner and watch the sunset with the sand under your feet while nibbling tasty shrimp!!  Large boardwalk to stroll on.  The beach, during the day, also has palapa\'s for shelter from the hot Mexican sun

204509607.name: No Waves on the Beach
204509607.author: a TripAdvisor user
204509607.reviewBody: After staying in Cabo where we couldn\'t swim in the beach it was wonderful to take a dip in the calm, shallow waters of Pichilingue.  Definitely worth the 2 hours drive from Cabo to get there.  We followed up with dinner in one of the local restaurants in La Paz, but there were also a few restaurants right on the beach ( a little pricey) but you couldn\'t get a better view.

203034917.name: Lovely place to come for a day with a picnic
203034917.author: a TripAdvisor user
203034917.reviewBody: The water is amazing, the rock formations are interesting and there is no booze sold so no partying and minimal litter.  You can rent umbrellas and chairs/tables and you can buy soft drinks and fruit.  You can also  bring a picnic and walk (seriously) across the bay in the water to the other side and set up camp there!  Perfect place for children as the water is not deep and is nice and warm and very very clean.

202082189.name: you got to go to Isla Espiritu Santo
202082189.author: a TripAdvisor user
202082189.reviewBody: Pichilingue is a beach with really calm water, there are not waves at all, it looks like a pool. There are not hotels at all with is good if you are trying to scape from really truistic places. I just did not like that the space between the bars or restaurant and the water is very reduce but that is not a problem just personal likes but if you go you must go and make the tour to isla Espir\u00edtu Santo because it is just great and do it with Marlin Adventures with Capitan Boa, they unfortunately don\'t have tripAdvisor to make a comment on it but the are such a great crew, very nice and friendly people and Captain Boa makes sure you have a wonderful time, he will show you amazing places on the island. I highly recommend it

201207419.name: Rocky beach with lots of X-Pats
201207419.author: a TripAdvisor user
201207419.reviewBody: The beach here is rocky not sandy.  There are restaurants on the beach provided a great fish taco and the beer was very cold!  For sandy beach which toddlers will love -- try Balandra!

196647819.name: Lovely Beach
196647819.author: a TripAdvisor user
196647819.reviewBody: Take a ferry to Mazatlan from here.  Gorgeous beach with a few vendors selling the usual stuff.  It is an inexpensive bus ride from LaPaz.

195605252.name: Beautiful place
195605252.author: a TripAdvisor user
195605252.reviewBody: Although I\'d rank Balandra Beach a little higher, this beach is nearly as beautiful and actually has some amenities.  If you\'re looking to get a bite to eat and lay in the sun and swim, this is the place for you.

186644733.name: Nice beach with good restaurant
186644733.author: a TripAdvisor user
186644733.reviewBody: The beach is nice though a bit rocky, waves are non existent, and the slope is very nice and gentle, you can walk a long way into the sea and still be wet only at waist level. There are a couple of restaurants, and ample parking. The first restaurant is the better one, though a bit pricey.

183676438.name: Lovely beach ...not too distant from town
183676438.author: a TripAdvisor user
183676438.reviewBody: The beach is lovely and good for swimming and is close to town and has good facilities for eating and drinking....\nEverything you need is here for a relaxing beach experience...

170777750.name: Pichilingue Sunsets
170777750.author: a TripAdvisor user
170777750.reviewBody: If you want to have a nice seafood dinner and watch a very nice sunset, you have to go to Pichilingue beach. you can have a 365 different sunset, because each day of the year you can have one that will be unique.\nseafood is the speciallity of the house.

165602565.name: Beautiful beach
165602565.author: a TripAdvisor user
165602565.reviewBody: This beach is in front of a port so is a place only to see. Is beautiful but you can go to better places.

164632210.name: Blue green water
164632210.author: a TripAdvisor user
164632210.reviewBody: The beach is nice -- very hot when we were there, but the restaurant provided good shade and cool beer.  The food was not as good as described, but it was a great place to view the beach.

162044843.name: Had to pay twice for what we wanted
162044843.author: a TripAdvisor user
162044843.reviewBody: We ordered garlic shrimp.  We began our dinner - no garlic.\nThey gave us another table\'s grilled shrimp !  Had to order an\nother garlic shrimp for wife and we were charged for it !!!!!

156450890.name: nice beach with installations
156450890.author: a TripAdvisor user
156450890.reviewBody: Nice white sandy beach with some restaurants and toiletts.\nBetter for swimming than Balandro but usually more people.

154867815.name: Nice isolated white sand spot
154867815.author: a TripAdvisor user
154867815.reviewBody: One of the many isolated magnificent beaches outside of La Paz.  White sand, few visitors, and Pina Coladas and a beach chair are not to be missed.\nWaverunner rentals, kayaks and nice calm surf - a great way\nto spend an afternoon - and Far from La PAz.

150136504.name: I like it!
150136504.author: a TripAdvisor user
150136504.reviewBody: Beautiful  beach, nice blue waters, crystal waters! Great sunsets too!\nYou can bring your own food or you can sit at the restaurant and eat there, the food is good!

149862734.name: Incredibly beautiful
149862734.author: a TripAdvisor user
149862734.reviewBody: nice series of bays, where the water is waist deep and warm.  Perfect for children.  Bring what you need

147805280.name: Quiet by the sea...
147805280.author: a TripAdvisor user
147805280.reviewBody: Nice quiet beach perfect to have lunch and enjoy the sun. Had ceviche tostadas and sat under the sun. Peaceful and quiet during the week.

146328921.name: Fresh Seafood at Restaurant Playa Pichilingue
146328921.author: a TripAdvisor user
146328921.reviewBody: This is a great place to spend an afternoon with friends.  30 feet from our table we were able to ride our jet skis in the clear and warm waters of the bay.  The restaurant is very generous with their cadillac margaritas.  The deep fried fish was very good but the best food we had were the fresh chocolate colored clams (the raw ones were very good but the baked ones were a close second).

145393956.name: great warm water
145393956.author: a TripAdvisor user
145393956.reviewBody: this beach reminds me of being on an island in the  carribean. there is a restaurant practically connected to the boat dock. although it can be busier than other beaches, it is a beautiful cove to relax at for an afternoon. bring your own cooler or chill out under the giant palapa restaurant and bar.

138696703.name: Pichelingue Beach for a nice day once in a while
138696703.author: a TripAdvisor user
138696703.reviewBody: Nothing fantastic.  Average food, nice beach, fair amount of wind.  A few palapas available to sit under and get out of the sun on the beach.  Boats available to go out to the island for diving and wave runners for rent.  Very crowded on the weekends.

135837057.name: Tranquillity at it\'s finest!
135837057.author: a TripAdvisor user
135837057.reviewBody: Great beach.  Kids loved it. Beautiful.  Definitely check it out!  Nice for a walk, nice for a swim, nice for a nap! :)

129146698.name: Loooooved it!
129146698.author: a TripAdvisor user
129146698.reviewBody: I can\'t wait to return to this restaurant! The location was unlike any other. Enjoyed delicious seafood and drinks while just enjoying the view. By far the best restaurant with a view I have ever come by. This place itself is worth the trip to La Paz :)

127841508.name: Great chill out beach
127841508.author: a TripAdvisor user
127841508.reviewBody: Very relaxing - particularly resting on a day bed/lounge on the beach for 150 pesos, while drinking a corona from nearby bar. Also, the restaurant has amazing stuffed clams and crabs that are a must try!

33834952.name: Careful at the Pichilingue Beach Restaurant
33834952.author: a TripAdvisor user
33834952.reviewBody: The beach is a secluded spot with a Palapa restaurant for dining in the sand.  It\'s a nice place to hit the beach and catch the sunset.  The restaurant is expensive and well regarded amongst the locals this was a bad day.  My wife and I planned a big dinner out to Pichilingue to have the renowned seafood and we both got sick for two days.  We had mediocre margs, lobster tacos, ceviche, and baked clams; one of the above made us sick.  You\'d think a place with $30 tacos would be cleaner, we were let down tremendously.

653588620.name: What a jewel!
653588620.author: a TripAdvisor user
653588620.reviewBody: Such a nice public beach with food, restrooms, palapas, and more.  We walked to this beach after hiking Calavera and it was the perfect place to rest, get a beer, and lay on the beach.  This was yet another super clean and inviting place in La Paz.  It is just south of the city where the Malecon ends.

618565567.name: Walk at sunset
618565567.author: a TripAdvisor user
618565567.reviewBody: Sunset is the perfect time for a walk. You can enjoy the sea breeze, and find typical Mexican restaurants.

578162122.name: Very unimpressive beach
578162122.author: a TripAdvisor user
578162122.reviewBody: Locals will tell you this is the closest "nice" beach to La Paz, but it is completely not the case. You are better off swimming directly off Malecon. Coromuel beach is nothing special, and water is murky and shallow. Not really interesting at all.

549752580.name: Excellent, clean beach
549752580.author: a TripAdvisor user
549752580.reviewBody: Beautiful, quiet beach equipped with palapas for shade, very clean sea. \nThe buildings at the back are not an ideal backdrop but having public toilets so close is quite handy and everything is kept clean and tidy, the bugainvilleas are glorious.\nWinter is the low season so the beach is pretty quiet, although I can imagine that in the summer it must get very crowded, as it\'s the closest beach to La Paz. Last summer they inaugurated a zipline (very short, above the beach) but at the moment it does not seem to be operating.

524507570.name: very pretty and casual
524507570.author: a TripAdvisor user
524507570.reviewBody: this is a must if you go to La Paz, \nbeautiful place the are palapas and bathrooms so don\'t worry about it\nparking right there and you can get there easilly by the highway

464335999.name: Lovely lovely lovely
464335999.author: a TripAdvisor user
464335999.reviewBody: It is impossible not to enjoy this place. I love it early morning when I\u00b4m running and I can see the swimmers practice early morning. It is a beautiful place for working out, families and more. Close to town, don\u00b4t miss it!

463941679.name: Pretty beach, close to the city.
463941679.author: a TripAdvisor user
463941679.reviewBody: Coromuel is definitely a nice beach in a very convenient location very close to the city so you won\'t have to drive much. It was re-designed a few years ago so now it has some good looking infraestructure such as bathrooms and little commercial spots where you can buy seafood or bottled water among other things. I wouldn\'t recommend swiming here, not because its unsafe but there are better beaches for swiming.

459908465.name: swimming all the year!
459908465.author: a TripAdvisor user
459908465.reviewBody: Its a patrimony of the world, fish are protected and the tides allow you to swim all the year, sand and palapas, so well, and security ad the door!!

660915761.name: Fun and Interesting!
660915761.author: a TripAdvisor user
660915761.reviewBody:
I’d never heard of the Serpentarium till our Expedition Leader from UnCruise told us about it and decided to join the group for a visit.   I was surprised by the beauty of the plantings:  a mix of flowers, succulents and whatever would grow in the area.  The Serpentarium rescues animals, rehabilitates them and restores them to the wild.  They also educate the locals and offer to pick up unwanted animals (especially snakes) so that the people don’t kill animals they find in their houses.

I loved the aviary; it was an enclosed area with a double-door system that allowed the birds to fly free within the enclosure.  There were rabbits and hamsters underfoot!  Later I walked by and heard giggling; two young women were seated and allowing the birds to land on them.  

There was a demonstration area with seats where a young man brought out a few of the animals, told us about them and allowed us to pet or hold a few (depending on whether or not it would be harmful to the animal).  
Save a few pesos for the Gift Shop, which includes home decorations and jewelry. Beware of the Hello Kitty and other items actually made in China!

On your way out, pick up a copy of the Gringo Gazette, a free paper directed at tourists and expatriates.  It’s a bit irreverent and full of ads, but also gives some coverage to local political and environmental issues, notes cultural events and festivals, and gives you an idea of everyday life in the area.

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

653364120.name: A small beautiful attraction, with lots of interaction!
653364120.author: a TripAdvisor user
653364120.reviewBody:
Have you ever carried a python over your neck? Have you ever touched or fed a 200 lbs dessert turtle? Have you had parrots and birds all over your arms and hands? Best of all: Have you ever seen a snake eat a prey right in front of you?!
Think no more and come to this place. Not only has the owner been in several discovery channel programs, he is one of the most knowledgeable men in reptiles in Mexico.
Your kids or yourself will get to interact with snakes, turtles, rabbits, and birds.
It is not expensive! Believe me it is not (you will probably spend more in your alcohol if you are in party mode). The owner keeps the place through humanitarian donations and visits.

Enjoy this beautiful small attraction and learn about reptiles like youve never have before.

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

652872117.name: A nice place to take the kids.
652872117.author: a TripAdvisor user
652872117.reviewBody: There are a variety of rescue animals here, not just reptiles.  Staff are pleasant and helpful.  The place is small so you only spend an hour at the most.

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

638634170.name: Small but interesting and worth a visit for animal lovers
638634170.author: a TripAdvisor user
638634170.reviewBody: Not the most impressive animal sanctuary, but you can see they are doing the best they can with limited resources.  When I went there was no English guide available that I could tell, but it was easy to self guide. The aviary room with rabbits and guinea pigs is a lot of fun!

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

637660114.name: Fun for kids, up close look at animals
637660114.author: a TripAdvisor user
637660114.reviewBody: We enjoyed this place quite a bit. The kids really enjoyed getting to feed the animals, and I really enjoyed getting an up close look at Mexican birds and reptiles.

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

633504128.name: Nice surprise!
633504128.author: a TripAdvisor user
633504128.reviewBody: We\'ve been to El Serpentario a few times. The animals/reptiles etc. are rescues. And the people working there are mostly volunteers. Very interesting place to spend an hour or so.

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

625551962.name: Great place to visit (especially with a child) ...
625551962.author: a TripAdvisor user
625551962.reviewBody:
We took a taxi to get there ($80 pesos one way).  Our driver offered to come back to pick us up in an hour's time, which we gladly accepted ☺.
They offer interpretive sessions however we arrived close to closing time when none was scheduled but the workers/care-givers there were informative and seemed to care greatly about the progress of each animals health and rehabilitation.
Add this to your list of things to do in La Paz BCS, especially if you are travelling with a child.
Cheers :o)

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

609590656.name: GREAT PLACE TO MEET LOCAL FAUNA
609590656.author: a TripAdvisor user
609590656.reviewBody: Our children loved specially the free birds area. The staff is all volunteer and the director VIctor was very kind to explain us about the many rescues they did. Very recommended

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

564643803.name: El Serpentario
564643803.author: a TripAdvisor user
564643803.reviewBody: I suggest you leave your North American attitudes at home on judging how these reptiles are housed - they are doing all they can to rehab these creatures.  More English would have improved the experience.  It was pricey but knowing the $ goes to the reptiles helps.

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

557636860.name: A very worthy rescue centre
557636860.author: a TripAdvisor user
557636860.reviewBody:
I visited the Serpentario because my daughter, who is studying zoology, is particularly interested in reptiles. And she was not disappointed. There are in fact many iguanas and snakes, rattle snakes in particular and it was very interesting (and slightly alarming) to find out that most of them are endemic to Baja California. They even have a rather large caiman.
And the small aviary is full of colourful little parakeets, cockatiels and budgies you can feed purchasing the seeds in the gift shop.
The place is quite small and in desperate need of work and room to expand but the young man who volunteered there was very helpful and enthusiastic and offered a lot of information. He explained that the reptiles are rescued and looked after until they can be released again, although some of them can never be released, so they are kept in the centre.
He also explained how the place is run exclusively thanks to donations and volunteers and that it does not receive any funding or support from the government.
They are obviously struggling to keep it open but they keep going because they love the animals.
This probably explains the unusually high price of the tickets, which took me a bit by surprise; but having seen and heard about their work I was glad I paid it and knew it would go for a very worthy cause.
The gift shop is also very sweet, full of reasonably priced little animals, earrings, dream catchers, pictures... and the lady at the till very friendly and also clearly dedicated.
I urge you to visit it and support it.

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

545868507.name: Wildlife rehab
545868507.author: a TripAdvisor user
545868507.reviewBody:
CAUTION!!!  in the aviary exhibit. If you bring in bird food, the birds see the blue cap and they attack. Small parrot like birds landed on my hand and were trying to steal the whole cap of food, meanwhile the two geese were looking like they were going to attack. The small birds land on you as well. I ended up dumping it and moving away. I tried a second time and hid the cap from site and was left alone. 

Don't expect too much from this attraction. It seemed to me that many cages were quite small for the animals. There were a crazy number of turtles in the turtle pond. I kept telling myself that it is a rehab facility and that is why. 

There was more of a selection of reptiles to see then I expected. For 5 pesos you can by a capful of turtle food or bird food. When the turtles see you they all come clamouring over each other expecting food. 

The large parrot in the cage before the aviary exhibit likes the sunflower seeds. Careful he will stick his head right through the fence to you.

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

527148591.name: A place to see endemic creatures from Baja California
527148591.author: a TripAdvisor user
527148591.reviewBody: The Serpentario is a wonderful place to see some of the local wild life of the area. It has been set up as a rescue and rehabilitation centre for wildlife that have been found injured or abandoned in the area. Injured animals are brought in for a period of assessment and rehabilitation before being once again being liberated into the wild. There are mainly snakes lizards and spiders but there are a number of birds, includin =g parrots and budgies that have been rescued but because of the extent of their injuries it has not been possible to send them back into the wild. The sad thing is that the Serpentario is run without any government assistance and relies on volunteers to help look after the animals and birds so if you do manage to spend an afternoon there please be generous in your donation to help keep this essential facility running. It is definitely worth a visit for a morning or an afternoon.

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

492785929.name: Wildlife Refuge
492785929.author: a TripAdvisor user
492785929.reviewBody:
My husband and I saw this place on a local tourist map, and I was curious and really wanted to go. It was in a mostly residential area. The price I had seen on the website was incorrect and the actual price was double that. It was $8 each or about 150 pesos each. It seemed a little bit primitive in terms of some of the enclosures, but we found it interesting and enjoyed it. 

The snakes are in glass enclosures in a darkened building. They have a lot of smaller snakes and some large ones from other areas. They also have an enclosure with lots of birds including parrots, parakeets, California quail, etc. and a couple of rabbits. In that enclosure you have to move very slowly and carefully to avoid stepping on birds. They will come right up to you. You can get little cups of food to feed them (for no extra charge) and they flock to you. We watched one bird grab a little cup of food right out of a tiny girl's hand and fly up to a perch where it could eat it by itself. 

There was a pond full of turtles, close to 100 I think. We had little cups of food and threw in individual kibbles and watched them try to catch them or swim after them. Several of the turtles were basking on the rocks around the pond. They were all pretty good-sized, with shells probably in excess of 6 inches in diameter

There were a lot of lizards and a large alligator. The women's restroom door was hard to close. It was metal and scraped on the cement floor. I then had to have my husband pull the door open from the outside because I couldn't get out. Hopefully that will be fixed. Otherwise, have someone stand guard rather than closing the door all the way. 

They also try to rehabilitate birds and other critters there. There were a couple of large owls that had been injured. 

There was a small gift shop at the entrance.

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

477704864.name: Awesome little place
477704864.author: a TripAdvisor user
477704864.reviewBody:
Place is great they have a lot of different reptiles even a large crocodile. There's also a birds exhibit where you can walk in and be with the birds and take pictures. This is also a rescue so they have injured animals that they rehabilitate and release. We saw a baby fox who had been run over and also an owl that was injured and had eye damage. They have a small gift shop and price is great.

The bad thing is that most of their animal spaces are very small.Place is great they have a lot of different reptiles even a large crocodile. There's also a birds exhibit where you can walk in and be with the birds and take pictures. This is also a rescue so they have injured animals that they rehabilitate and release. We saw a baby fox who had been run over and also an owl that was injured and had eye damage. They have a small gift shop and price is great.

The bad thing is that most of their animal spaces are very small.

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

473471399.name: Impressive little facility!
473471399.author: a TripAdvisor user
473471399.reviewBody: The main purpose of this mini-petting zoo seems to be the rehabilitation and release of injured local creatures. They do take in non-local injured wild animals, as well as feature some non-local reptiles that "draw in the people" as the lady explained to us. For their resources, we felt the animals were well cared for and were impressed by the caretakers\' sensitivity to the creatures. \n\nThe local reptiles were surprising in diversity! The aviary of little birds and rabbits were a sheer delight to our littles. We will be back. Thank you for your hospitality, and for your stewardship of and education about your local creatures!

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

471538369.name: Wonderful small facility run by passionate volunteers
471538369.author: a TripAdvisor user
471538369.reviewBody: We visited this serpentarium with a group of naturalist/interpreters so the audience was extremely interested to learn about the rescue, rehabilitation, and reproduction this facility is doing to restore populations of endemic reptiles.  The director of the facility spoke to our group through an interpreter (our guide from Birding Los Cabos).  Although I speak limited Spanish I was able to clearly understand the passion that the director has for the work and had great regard for his dedication as a volunteer.

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

464625344.name: A fun place with a good heart
464625344.author: a TripAdvisor user
464625344.reviewBody: What an awesome little place.  Iguanas, gila monsters, snakes, turtles, all manner of colorful birds, and even two partially blind owls that could no longer live in the wild.  I loved getting to learn about the wild residents of Baja, as well as to fraternize with the birds and bunnies in the aviary...never been buzzed by a cockatiel before!  Also love that the crew here rescues and rehabilitates injured wildlife, then returns them to the wild.

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

464076729.name: CLOSE TO CLOSING? WRONG TIME?
464076729.author: a TripAdvisor user
464076729.reviewBody: Arrived 45 minutes before closing.  No guide.  No tour. No animal food.  No informative talk.  Good attempt to keep animals healthy and happy.  Some cages, especially the alligator, seemed too small.  Don\'t expect too much.  Didn\'t mind seeing and paying for animal rehab.

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

451468707.name: Animal Lovers Haven!
451468707.author: a TripAdvisor user
451468707.reviewBody: We took a couple hours to stop in El Serpentario and were delighted to find a vast array of rattlesnakes, boas, pythons and iguanas!  Also turtles, frogs and an aviary full of birds and bunnies!  What a great visit and cool stop!  The birds and bunnies could also be hand fed for a donation.

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

447219738.name: SO much fun!
447219738.author: a TripAdvisor user
447219738.reviewBody: We mentioned to a local that we hoped to visit the Serpentario, and she told us to skip it. My husband, our 18 year old daughter, and I went anyway and WE HAD THE BEST TIME! The admission was very cheap, and little dishes of food for the animals were 5 pesos each. The place is well-laid out with uneven paths. We loved the turtle pond, the rhinoceros iguana, and the dark snake area, but our hands-down favorite was the aviary with giant bunnies! The beautiful birds landed on us to eat, and the bunnies would jump in our laps to get at the food. The owner is passionate about education. Please support this charming labor of love!

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

446296741.name: Wonderful animals, relaxing and colorful place
446296741.author: a TripAdvisor user
446296741.reviewBody: We were greeted by wild parrots who sounded as though they were laughing up in the palm trees.  The grounds are covered with trees and flowers and the exhibits were well cared for.  The reptiles and birds looked healthy and there was a wide variety to see.  The aviary also had content rabbits lounging around.  We spent about an hour interacting with all the animals (we\'re amateur herpers) and when we left, we knew we\'d invested our time wisely.  Thank you to the staff who do a great job in maintaining the place well.

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

440478661.name: Great Place!
440478661.author: a TripAdvisor user
440478661.reviewBody: We are staying in La Paz for awhile and read about El Serpentario. We decided to visit and really enjoyed it. The staff are very friendly and the animals seem to be very well cared for. Everything was clean and we really enjoyed the birds/rabbits area where you can go in and you are right with them. And they have an area set up that is for school field trips.

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

367107697.name: Interesting place!
367107697.author: a TripAdvisor user
367107697.reviewBody: I really recommend this place, especially if you have kids! \nI loved to take photos of the reptiles and plants of the garden. The director is very competent and you can ask him whatever you like: he will be please to chat with you!

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

361655962.name: Small but exciting
361655962.author: a TripAdvisor user
361655962.reviewBody: We visited El Serpentario as a shore excursion while on an Un Cruise vacation. After hearing a talk about the center\'s mission and seeing and holding some lizards and a tarantula, we walked around the grounds and observed more reptiles and amphibians, bunnies, birds, and more. It was a very interesting way to spend an hour or so.

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

351604009.name: Fun little zoo
351604009.author: a TripAdvisor user
351604009.reviewBody: Very affordable and fun way to spend a couple of hours with our kids age 7-17. They have turtles, lizards, snakes and fish to look at but the highlight was definitely the aviary. You can walk inside it with little containers of food and feed the birds as well as the rabbits. The kids had a blast petting and feeding the rabbits and having all the different tropical birds land on their hands and eat from the food containers (and even fly away with the food containers). The food containers cost five pesos each so we kept buying more because it was so fun to feed the birds and they were so cheap.

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

345659137.name: Unexpected fun feeding the giant turtles
345659137.author: a TripAdvisor user
345659137.reviewBody: Small, unglitzy display of turles, birds, lizards and more. Great fun to go into the bird house and have a dozen small parrots sit on your arm to eat from the seed cup. The biggest treat was to feed sliced gourd to the giant tortoises. Suddenly they\'re moving and those beaky mouths are sharp and faster than you\'d expect. A real experience.\n\nThe place is low budget, but clean and tended. The animals seem well-cared for. Good people doing good deeds.

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

342427203.name: Great rescue/ rehab center for reptiles and other animals.
342427203.author: a TripAdvisor user
342427203.reviewBody: My friends and I spent a fun morning here with our wonderful local guide, Rodrigo Rocha Gosselin, meeting the various rescued reptiles, turtles, birds, and rabbits.  It was especially entertaining and informative for us thanks to Rodrigo\'s prodigious knowledge, but I would recommend it even without that advantage.  Feeding the birds and rabbits was particularly entertaining!

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

342184291.name: Hands on and Informative.
342184291.author: a TripAdvisor user
342184291.reviewBody:
We took a Mexico Riviera cruise and El Serpentario De La Paz was offered as a 'shore excursion'.  This animal sanctuary is not up to the standards most of us would expect.  The animals are rescued and cared for, but it would be nice if improvements could be made (lack of money?)  Those who run El Serpentario and the many volunteers really do care about these animals, though.

We first sat down in a little area to listen to our volunteer guide tell us about the El Serpentario and to show us some of their residents :-)
Most fascinating was the smallest lizard snake he showed us.  This little guy is under 2" in length, translucent gray, and has two feet up front with tiny toes.  People from around the world come to see this little guy and take photos.  After the educational show and tell, we were able to roam about.

  The Aviary is fun and for $1.00 donation, you get a little cap filled with bird food.  You walk in and the colorful parrots and parakeets/budgies flock to you...landing on your head, arms or wherever they can perch.  Be forewarned that there is at least one large Parrot that is the Alpha in that Aviary.  He/She scared off any birds that landed on me so that he could have all the food.  The other trick is that this large parrot will steal the cap from your hand!  So, make sure you have a good grip on that bird feed in the little cap or the bird flies off with it. (and yes they are that powerful to do it!). 

 For the little ones, they will enjoy the bunnies that are kept in the entry of the aviary.  You can buy a bit of rabbit food if your or your child wants to feed them.    The other fun thing was seeing the yellow Burma Python (about 6 1/2-7 feet length) and being able to hold it!  The handler helped visitors to drape the snake around their neck and shoulders.  Beautiful and docile animal!  Lots of turtles, terrapin, a few tortoise, Iguanas, and snakes.  

Not a large sanctuary. El Serpentario has a small gift shop (states prices in $, but it is actually pesos!  I got fooled thinking an item was $30 but really 17 pesos per dollar if you want to know what something really costs)  Restroom available..one for men and women.  Bring along wet wipes as they do not have soap or water for washing your hands.

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

338775736.name: Nice small rehab center for reptiles and birds
338775736.author: a TripAdvisor user
338775736.reviewBody: We went with a small group from our Un-Cruise adventure ship. This is a nice small center that we were told was mostly of local Baja CA Sur reptiles and birds but there were also several other species that are not local there too. There are several enclosures with larger reptiles and then a building with lots of small aquarium sized enclosures with snakes, lizards, frog etc.\nWhen we got there, Marco, a volunteer gave us a show and tell with several creatures that we either touched or held: green iguana, hornet frog, bull snake,King snake, and tarantula. He and all the other volunteers ( I think its run on minimal budget and almost all volunteers) were very nice, friendly and knowledgeable. They answered all our questions and were really great with the guests.\nIf in La Paz, I would definitely recommend stopping to see this "mini-zoo" /rehab center. The cost is minimal and its a great place to take the kids with lots of hands on and feeding of birds and reptiles.

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

336771441.name: Lessons in relaxing from turltes
336771441.author: a TripAdvisor user
336771441.reviewBody: Although I think we paid the tourist price and not the local price,it was worth it. For a $100 pesos each we fed hundreds of baby turtles, observed the alpha dance of giant turtles, fed birds and rabbits from the palms of our hands, and were mesmerized by serpents of all size and color. We lost track of time and were very engaged. You can spend 2-3 hours here.

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

335108823.name: Interesting place for the whole family
335108823.author: a TripAdvisor user
335108823.reviewBody: A visit to the Serpentario was recommended by some La Paz friends.  A little hard to find, even if you use a map, but worth it.  An outdoor aviary with native birds, an outdoor terrarium for turtles, and, of course, separate terrariums for the native reptiles.  Appears to be operated on a shoestring, but very well done.

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

328678483.name: Wonderful place to understand Baja\'s animals, snakes and insects
328678483.author: a TripAdvisor user
328678483.reviewBody: Worthwhile place to visit while in La Paz.  It\'s south of town in a quiet residential area and it\'s run by volunteers.   Interesting snakes, birds and insects.  The volunteers will bring out snakes for people to handle as well as the tarantula.  There is also a bird aviary where you can go in and feed the birds from your hand.

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

327273853.name: Gem in La Paz
327273853.author: a TripAdvisor user
327273853.reviewBody: Great educational facility, with activities for all ages. I have lived among Tarantulas for 20 years and had a new experience of a live one on my hand and arm. I liked learning about the different endemic species found in Baja California. While I am not a zoo person I found El Serpentario De La Paz animals to be well cared for.

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

284460948.name: More than snakes and lizards!
284460948.author: a TripAdvisor user
284460948.reviewBody: You can feed the turtles, pet the rabbits, talk to the parrots, have a staring contest with an owl or two as well as check out the dozens of snakes, lizards and fish tanks. They even have an enormous iguana. The entrance fee is only $100 pesos, (about $8 CDN) a good value.

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

271537518.name: Interesting and educational
271537518.author: a TripAdvisor user
271537518.reviewBody: From reading other reviews, we weren\'t expecting much but we spent a whole morning there and loved it! There\'s a lot more than "serpents" including cute bunnies that just ask to be petted. Then we realized why there\'d be rabbits in a reptile-focused zoo. (To produce food for the other animals.) We saw iguanas mating and all the parakeets were nest building. Guess it\'s springtime. A rescued owl was being rehabilitated for release, learning how to catch mice. (He was afraid of them at first.) Highly recommended!

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

267236808.name: Modest but interesting
267236808.author: a TripAdvisor user
267236808.reviewBody: Kids loved feeding the birds and rabbits (not reptiles but fun for kids).  If you can read Spanish you can learn a bit about local reptiles.  The centre does conservation work as well and rehabilitates animals.  We\'ve been back a couple of times.  It was interesting to be up close and personal with these reptile specimens.

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

266427671.name: Great little place to visit with birds, reptiles, and other Baja wildlife
266427671.author: a TripAdvisor user
266427671.reviewBody: Low cost (donation based), hands-on opportunities (hand feeding birds as they land on you and holding one of the Boa snakes for instance), great cause (wildlife rescue and rehab).

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

263341345.name: Needs TLC
263341345.author: a TripAdvisor user
263341345.reviewBody: We visited this small animal facility for the second time earlier this week. Was a little disappointed in the overall conditions and presentations of the various animals. Also, did not see some of the species that were highlights of our first visit--large tortoise, Raptor, various lizards. Not sure if they were released after rehab or what. Very nominal fee to enter and the informal setting will have us back again to see what may be new on our next visit to La Paz.

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

263239211.name: Great for reptiles and birds
263239211.author: a TripAdvisor user
263239211.reviewBody:
We have kids 8 and 11, and they really enjoyed this. It's small and not fancy, but as they operate on donations and a small fee, it's well done. My son enjoyed feeding parrots, and we kept going back for more food. The birds weren't shy, and landed on him to get the food. 

We have snakes and spiders at home, so I'm always interested to see exhibits of these. They have the different kinds of local snakes on display, including several rattlesnakes. 

It was worth the visit.

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

256078073.name: Pretty decent place
256078073.author: a TripAdvisor user
256078073.reviewBody: Didn\'t know what to expect, but was fairly impressed! It\'s nice to see that they are a rescue and rehab facility (there were a few there when we went) but its also nice to see some ccreatures that are of the area which you wouldn\'t get to see if you didn\'t go here. It is never great to see animals penned up, but they all looked well cared for. Worth the visit!

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

249124661.name: amazing place!
249124661.author: a TripAdvisor user
249124661.reviewBody: Did not visit this trip but have been there in the past and it is truly wonderful and worthy of your support.  A place which rescues and protects birds, reptiles, amphibians and insects, arachnids, etc.  Fascinating and fun.

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

243340563.name: Animal Rescue and Education Operation
243340563.author: a TripAdvisor user
243340563.reviewBody: We visited this site using Tropical Tours. Our guide, Rodrigo, was terrific. Very knowledgeable and passionate about La Paz and the flora and fauna of the area. He shared a lot of good information during the drive to the Serpenteria. Once there, he talked a lot about the mission of the sanctuary and the animals that were in residence. There is a good variety of reptiles and other creatures so the tour is perfect for the short amount of time we had in port. We had an opportunity to see some of the non-lethal varieties of reptiles up close and then went into the aviary where you could feed the birds. They were eager for the company and would eat from your hands and land on you. This facility can benefit from donations so I encourage you to contribute before you leave. They are doing good work and help allay the unreasoned fears of many people who have cultural biases against reptiles. The myths surrounding snakes are many and this group helps correct those misconceptions. You don\'t have to like snakes, but you don\'t have to fear them, either. A healthy respect is a good way to approach this and the Serpenteria helps with that process.

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

242760613.name: A little animal sanctuary
242760613.author: a TripAdvisor user
242760613.reviewBody: For animal lovers and anyone one with a general interest in the fauna of Baja California this place is a must. It is run completely on voluntary donations and volunteer staff so your visit will contribute to the well being of all the creatures in the little park. There is a wide variety of reptiles especially snakes, lizards, tortoises and freshwater turtles many of which have been brought in by the public for a very of reasons. There are a number of smaller birds in a walk through aviary and a rescued military macaw, injured owls and an injured Osprey ( Sea Eagle) who have been rescued in recent years. Financially the the centre does struggle but the director ,Victor , and his volunteer staff do their very best to make sure that the animals  are cared for properly and to promote fund raising activities. If you are interested in animals go along and help the staff to continue this valuable and essential work. It is a very worthwhile morning or afternoon trip.

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

242634864.name: good for kids
242634864.author: a TripAdvisor user
242634864.reviewBody: nothing amazing, but worth the visit for the price.... fairly enjoyable with kids, not sure i\'d bother without kids.

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

235253212.name: Interesting place to visit!
235253212.author: a TripAdvisor user
235253212.reviewBody: Enjoyable way to spend an afternoon.  Small lizards running all over was great fun to watch.  Be aware that this is not the US and the glass is not one way - the snakes can see you.

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

220558083.name: Not the right way to take animals
220558083.author: a TripAdvisor user
220558083.reviewBody:
I'm a biologist and an erpetologist, i keep also some reptiles in my house and the way how most of the reptiles of the Serpentarium are keeped is not good and not healty.

Except some Iguanas in the big cage and the Dipsosaurus (desert iguana) free in the garden, the other reptiles didn't look so good, from the other iguanas to the Tegu (that lost the nails to burrow on the concrete) and the alligator (?) (or crocodile, it wasn't very visible and there were only few descriptions) in a very little pool.

In addition all  the terrariums were too small.

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

198975422.name: Great for kids
198975422.author: a TripAdvisor user
198975422.reviewBody: Located at the southern tip of town in a residential area a block from the ocean, this little backyard zoo packs a lot of punch. My eleven year old and thirteen year old, two saavy travelers, enjoyed this serpentaria. Excellent collection of rattle snakes, many varieties including an Appalachian variety. There was one rattler that was so nasty! He kept rattling the entire time we were there posed to strike. It was fun getting my face right up to the glass, inches from his beady eyes. Huge alligator. An assortment of birds and red-ear turtles.. Cute pig that hangs out with a tortoise and constantly licks the tortoise\'s face, much to the tortoise\'s displeasure! It\'s in a family\'s backyard so it is tiny and not posh. It\'s like visiting a friend\'s home with a large animal collection. The little boy who lives there is sweet. Some interesting hippie homes in the area too.

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

193829652.name: Great for kids
193829652.author: a TripAdvisor user
193829652.reviewBody: This is a small facility, but with a nice selection of snakes, other reptiles, birds and a couple mammals.  There is something friendly an charming about it, and kids are bound to enjoy it.  Some of the animals are confined in ways that won\'t be appealing to adults who are sensitive about such things.

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

192802477.name: A place to visit!
192802477.author: a TripAdvisor user
192802477.reviewBody: I deeply like this place and enjoyed with my family... I have been in Serpentario many times over the last years and I always have good experiences.

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

190305058.name: If you like creepy, crawly things
190305058.author: a TripAdvisor user
190305058.reviewBody:
this is the place to see them.  Native reptiles and insects in glass
displays fixed up like their natural habitat.  Kids will love it!  The
aviary was my favorite, and there were friendly rabbits hopping
around.

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

183939758.name: SNAKES GALORE!
183939758.author: a TripAdvisor user
183939758.reviewBody: If you like reptiles from Baja, this is the place to go!  It is located in the LaPosada neighborhood right of Brecha California.  Entry is reasonable at 80 pesos to help with upkeep and the animals are worth seeing!  Take the kids and hang on for shrieks!

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

181077596.name: Very interesting and eduactional
181077596.author: a TripAdvisor user
181077596.reviewBody: Took our teenage grand-daughter there and were most impressed with the different species and loved all the turtles also.  A must to see when in La Paz...My most memorable moment was having a large snake around my neck and shoulders, wish I could find the photo to share...

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

178573881.name: Still a great spot to spend an afternoon
178573881.author: a TripAdvisor user
178573881.reviewBody: We have been coming to Cabo for a long time and remember meeting Abe Blank and his wonderful collection of crawling things before he opened the Serpentarium in La Paz.  Abe is no longer with us, but his legacy continues...  Kudos to all of the volunteers at the park who keep the "residents" happy, healthy and well fed.  Abe would be proud.

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

178352350.name: Great visit
178352350.author: a TripAdvisor user
178352350.reviewBody: We were here about 10 years ago and like it. We went yesterday on a ships tour and still liked it. We were there about ab hour, which I thought was adequate.

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

159629225.name: A wonderful place for kids and animal lovers
159629225.author: a TripAdvisor user
159629225.reviewBody: The serpentario has over 100 animals on display - reptiles, mammals and birds.  Many of the reptiles are housed in natural settings.  You can feed many of them and the animals are very friendly.  Largely staffed by volunteers.

address.streetAddress: Brecha California between Nuea Reforma y Guaycura

639393258.name: Lifechanging
639393258.author: a TripAdvisor user
639393258.reviewBody: Dolphins, Mantas, Sharks and amazing dive guides with the Solmar V crew! Lifechanging is the only way to discribe this place!

610941789.name: The diving is spectacular with large pelagics!
610941789.author: a TripAdvisor user
610941789.reviewBody: If you are an experienced diver and love large pelagics, this is the place to go! It is Mexico\'s Galapagos.

556209547.name: Whale shark haven
556209547.author: a TripAdvisor user
556209547.reviewBody: This is a marine reserve where the whale sharks \'hang out\' getting a good meal! You will need to take a tour to visit the whle sharks as a certified guide is required (and you get lots of great info as well). The ship Captain will be able to spot whale sharks so well worth the tour fee. A must visit!

532946971.name: A day in the worlds aquarium.
532946971.author: a TripAdvisor user
532946971.reviewBody: I have snorkeled many places including South Africa. But  los islotes is indeed a special place that offers diving with scuba or snorkeling above and some freedive off the radar in my view.

504877851.name: Amazing diving experience
504877851.author: a TripAdvisor user
504877851.reviewBody: This place is unique. Giant mantas all over the place. Marine life around "Roca Partida" is unique. The white tip sharks layer is one to remember.

485170757.name: Mega Diving!
485170757.author: a TripAdvisor user
485170757.reviewBody: Well I have been diving for more than 50 years and have dived as a professional in many parts of the world. The Revillagigedo Islands were one of my bucket list things too do and do you think I was anywhere near disappointed.No! The boat, the crew and the diving were exemplary and I would very much like to go again. Food was great in fact I could not fault anything. I do have one small moan but it is not that important our cabin in the forward part of the vessel was only a Gnatt\'s whisker bigger that my wardrobe and two people had great difficulty in being in the floor space of the cabin at the same time. ind you we didn\'t exactly spend much time in our cabins as ther was too much to do and see. Would I go again? Like a shot!!!!

365570978.name: Great diving for sharks and giant mantas
365570978.author: a TripAdvisor user
365570978.reviewBody: Spent 7 days diving this area on board Rocio del Mar. Great diving with hammerhead, silky, white tip and silver tip sharks along with dolphin and giant mantas.

300941603.name: No other Dive Trips needed once you\'ve experienced this place!!
300941603.author: a TripAdvisor user
300941603.reviewBody: However...you will want to return here over and over just to experience the mystical interactions with the gentle giant pelagics of the Pacific. I return every other year and can hardly wait until my next trip. All of the islands provide unforgettable dives, and the flights to Los Cabos are wonderfully short with the boat rides out to the islands being less than 22 hours! (Live-aboards) of my 40+ years of diving all over the world, this is the ultimate.....time after time!

676434338.name: More than we expected
676434338.author: a TripAdvisor user
676434338.reviewBody: Covers history of baja from prehistoric times to the mexican revolution. Well maintained in  chronological order. A great escape from the sun and heat.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Antropologia e Historia de Baja California Sur

address.streetAddress: Ignacio Altamirano and Cinco de Mayo

675813666.name: Fascinating--really glad I went!
675813666.author: a TripAdvisor user
675813666.reviewBody: Great and inexpensive (45 MX) stop on my trip. Really interesting artifacts and info about the history of Baja, from before people through cave paintings, the Spanish invasion, independence, and more. Wide variety of artifacts. As other have noted, signs are only in Spanish. I could understand enough to get a sense of what I was seeing, but it\'s still worth a visit even if you don\'t. If you speak Spanish, plan to spend more time--it\'s worth it!

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Antropologia e Historia de Baja California Sur

address.streetAddress: Ignacio Altamirano and Cinco de Mayo

668245043.name: A history museum of Baja California
668245043.author: a TripAdvisor user
668245043.reviewBody: We walked here from the Malecon. It took us about an hour to walk around and it outlines the history of Baja California. All the exhibits are in Spanish, We don\u2019t speak Spanish but still understood the exhibits. The admission price was very little. Our children of 5 & 11 both enjoyed it.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Antropologia e Historia de Baja California Sur

address.streetAddress: Ignacio Altamirano and Cinco de Mayo

660902422.name: Small but interesting museum
660902422.author: a TripAdvisor user
660902422.reviewBody: This is a small museum that took about an hour to go through, but I enjoyed it.  There are several floors, starting with indigenous people of the area and going through the early 1900\'s.  All of the explanatory signage is in Spanish, but you should be able to get most of it at an intermediate or maybe even advanced beginner level.  If you can read the signage, you\'ll also be able to read the Declaration of Independence on the top floor-- it\'s pretty fiery!

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Antropologia e Historia de Baja California Sur

address.streetAddress: Ignacio Altamirano and Cinco de Mayo

640441022.name: Interesting museum
640441022.author: a TripAdvisor user
640441022.reviewBody: This was a nice museum to visit while in La Paz.  Super cheap to get in (around $2 USD), though you pay a few pesos more if you want to take pictures inside.  The displays are all nicely set up, very professional, though they\u2019re in Spanish only.  Still, it was a good way to spend about an hour.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Antropologia e Historia de Baja California Sur

address.streetAddress: Ignacio Altamirano and Cinco de Mayo

631963322.name: Understanding local history
631963322.author: a TripAdvisor user
631963322.reviewBody: Lovely museum giving good chronological history of the area. Spanish only but still very worth the modest price.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Antropologia e Historia de Baja California Sur

address.streetAddress: Ignacio Altamirano and Cinco de Mayo

576518271.name: Interesting museum, very enjoyable
576518271.author: a TripAdvisor user
576518271.reviewBody: Really enjoyed the museum. Museography of the permanent exhibits is very good, quite professional. The temporary exhibit was poorly done and seemed thrown together by amateurs. We enjoyed the paleolithic rock painting exhibit a lot.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Antropologia e Historia de Baja California Sur

address.streetAddress: Ignacio Altamirano and Cinco de Mayo

568290741.name: Too dark and no English
568290741.author: a TripAdvisor user
568290741.reviewBody: I loved the museum per se but the lighting was way too dark, so dark that one couldn\'t  read the signage.
