I speak Spanish fluently but noticed that none of the information was in English.  In this day and age, I was outraged and left a note saying so as well as offering my services.  They did call me and I met with the director who says he will use my free translation once he gets his new signs.  I sure hope so!  He also said that the top floor already had new lights,  I was not able to go around the museum that day to verify.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Antropologia e Historia de Baja California Sur

address.streetAddress: Ignacio Altamirano and Cinco de Mayo

566936214.name: Neat stuff!
566936214.author: a TripAdvisor user
566936214.reviewBody: I particularly enjoyed the exhibit on paleolithic art, as well as the level dedicated to the prehistoric inhabitants.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Antropologia e Historia de Baja California Sur

address.streetAddress: Ignacio Altamirano and Cinco de Mayo

562169429.name: Nice stop on our guided tour
562169429.author: a TripAdvisor user
562169429.reviewBody: Nice small museum.  The exhibit about wall paintings of Baja was really neat and something we\u2019d not heard about elsewhere.  Being on a tour helped since display signs were in Spanish (sadly we only speak English).

itemReviewed.name: Museo de Antropologia e Historia de Baja California Sur

address.streetAddress: Ignacio Altamirano and Cinco de Mayo

662576522.name: Pricey to begin with and then they nickle and dime you to boot
662576522.author: a TripAdvisor user
662576522.reviewBody: This marina is for the rich, not the average sailor.  The docks are nice but they charge extra for water, electric and paying by credit card----they won\'t accept cash so if you can\'t do a wire transfer they charge 4% more when you pay with Visa (They send an e-mailing noting they charge 3.5% more for paying by CC but in fact they add 4%).  None of this I\'m sure matters to rich people but then the rich don\'t bother to read these reviews anyway.  Be careful as their website says the slip fees are charged by boat length but in fact they charge by slip length.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard General Manuel Marquez de Leon 2415 esquina con Topete

655678352.name: Nice slips
655678352.author: a TripAdvisor user
655678352.reviewBody: Very nice, well done marina, could use a few more imenities. Was pretty well occupied at the time we were there

address.streetAddress: Boulevard General Manuel Marquez de Leon 2415 esquina con Topete

649934777.name: Nice Marina
649934777.author: a TripAdvisor user
649934777.reviewBody: We take the boat from here to our home on the mogote.  Might have to have a margarita from the Capri restaurant while we wait for the boat.  Everyone if very friendly and helpful

address.streetAddress: Boulevard General Manuel Marquez de Leon 2415 esquina con Topete

643157366.name: Ok for a quick stop of the cafes
643157366.author: a TripAdvisor user
643157366.reviewBody: Not too much to see.  Maybe a few big yachts which you cannot go out on the pier to see up close.  A couple of decent restaurants to have a beverage.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard General Manuel Marquez de Leon 2415 esquina con Topete

632267320.name: Scenic Spot for Drinks or Lunch
632267320.author: a TripAdvisor user
632267320.reviewBody: This is a nicely maintained marina that we frequented primarily because our ferry from Paraiso del Mar picked up and dropped off here.  There are a few restaurants and bars as well as condos in the marina.  Would be better if there was a store or two.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard General Manuel Marquez de Leon 2415 esquina con Topete

594285142.name: Great relaxing place
594285142.author: a TripAdvisor user
594285142.reviewBody: It\u2019s a safe place with great restaurants. We walked with young kids and found it extremely safe. This place is beautiful for photography too. Totally recommend this place for all ages.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard General Manuel Marquez de Leon 2415 esquina con Topete

388514894.name: Great relaxing spot on the Marina!
388514894.author: a TripAdvisor user
388514894.reviewBody: Our first trip to La Paz was an adventure....we walked into the Marina off the Malecon and found it beautiful with a couple of good restaurants.  Our fist stop was an outdoor seating with lots of shade.  We ordered a mango margarita which must have been 64 ounces of fresh mango, tequiila, and lime juice...possibly the best fruit margarita we have ever had.  We ordered dinner and loved our fresh fish and steak selections.  Very beautiful sunset made this a perfect early evening.  We can\'t wait to go back!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard General Manuel Marquez de Leon 2415 esquina con Topete

351139668.name: February stay
351139668.author: a TripAdvisor user
351139668.reviewBody:
Marina Cortez was not our first choice.  The other marina did not have a slip for us.  After looking at the other marina though, we decided that we liked Marina Cortez better because it was way more quiet in a less busy kind of way.  It is located right on the edge of town.  A walk to the other side of town on the malecon and back is a little over 3 miles round trip.  That makes for a nice morning walk! 

The electricity and water are free with your dock fee.  The showers are located up in the main marina area, not too far.  They are decent but for a new marina like this, it seems to me they could have made them a little nicer.  

The marina personnel are very nice and helpful.  Laundry can be arranged at the marina desk.  They do not recommend the dock water for drinking.  They say it is not potable, however, the boats on either side of us use it for their tanks.  One of them adds chlorine and the other one just drinks it straight up.  They will arrange for delivery of water in 5 gallon bottles for a nominal fee per gallon. 

There are three restaurants at the marina.  We haven't eaten at any but they are always busy.  Two are outside and one of them is a sports bar.  

There is usually some kind of music being played at the restaurants or downtown which you can hear at night.  It's been nice.  They do not play too late.  

There is a strong tide going in and out of the bay so if you can time your boat entry at slack tide, that's probably best unless you like boating sideways.  

We've been doing some varnishing and it hasn't seemed to bother anyone here.  

The only reason I did not give the marina five stars is because the lock on the gate is broken.  Instead of needing a pass card or key, there is a button on the inside of the gate which can be accessed from both sides of the gate.  Not high security.  There is a 24 hours security guard across the walkway from the gate but I think he could be easily distracted.  There are security guards that walk the docks.

The rates are decent as well.  We are staying for a month and it breaks down to about $30 a day.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard General Manuel Marquez de Leon 2415 esquina con Topete

334805288.name: Had a nice walk around to check out the big boats and yachts ... good for a nice look see!
334805288.author: a TripAdvisor user
334805288.reviewBody: Had a nice walk around to check out the big boats and yachts ... good for a nice look see!\n\nImpressive boats ...

address.streetAddress: Boulevard General Manuel Marquez de Leon 2415 esquina con Topete

310606448.name: Wonderful
310606448.author: a TripAdvisor user
310606448.reviewBody: We spend 10 days in La Paz and had great dinners at the Marina Cortez.  From fine patio dining to a great sports bar, you will find it here.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard General Manuel Marquez de Leon 2415 esquina con Topete

302442602.name: Marina Lunch
302442602.author: a TripAdvisor user
302442602.reviewBody: We had a nice lunch on the edge of the marina. Nice breezes on a hot summer day with nice views, but nothing particularly special.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard General Manuel Marquez de Leon 2415 esquina con Topete

283914376.name: beautiful.
283914376.author: a TripAdvisor user
283914376.reviewBody: The marina is beaufiful, and very romantic. Perfect for a quiet sunset stroll with your honey and a nice chilled bottle of wine and a blanket. It\'s been a while since we\'ve visited (2007) but I needed to give a great review because the memories still inspire me.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard General Manuel Marquez de Leon 2415 esquina con Topete

274568385.name: Nice restaurant in the marina
274568385.author: a TripAdvisor user
274568385.reviewBody: While in La Paz for a month, we ate at Marina Cortez several times.  The food and service were consistenly good.  Recommend.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard General Manuel Marquez de Leon 2415 esquina con Topete

266878342.name: Fishing
266878342.author: a TripAdvisor user
266878342.reviewBody: Fishing and visiting Espiritu Santo island and its incredible beaches its an experience everyone should do.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard General Manuel Marquez de Leon 2415 esquina con Topete

247390616.name: Marina Cortez
247390616.author: a TripAdvisor user
247390616.reviewBody: Great marina. the staff is courteous, and the docks are well kept. It is also home of the Island Cat Baja, that you can go and swim with the whale shark

address.streetAddress: Boulevard General Manuel Marquez de Leon 2415 esquina con Topete

243115352.name: Delicious breakfasts
243115352.author: a TripAdvisor user
243115352.reviewBody: We stumbled upon this little restaurant when we were exploring the marina and looking at all the beautiful boats and fish in the water. We decided to eat here. The food was very good and we ate sitting out side on the pathway beside the water. We were entertained by the fish coming and going in the water beside us. It was very calm and beautiful.\nThe second time we went there it was so packed that we decided to go else where because we were so hungry.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard General Manuel Marquez de Leon 2415 esquina con Topete

237282722.name: Nice Place
237282722.author: a TripAdvisor user
237282722.reviewBody: Relatively new, by Baja Standards, well situated.  There are quite a few nice stores, hotels, and restaurants associated with this facility.  Good for boaters.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard General Manuel Marquez de Leon 2415 esquina con Topete

218588369.name: Eileen was so helpful in the Marina office.
218588369.author: a TripAdvisor user
218588369.reviewBody: The Marina offers several different restaurants. We tried three while visiting La Paz. Since our condo required a boat ride across, we found ourselves having drinks or snacks here while waiting for the boat. The staff here is friendly and very helpful. I especially enjoyed Eileen as she helped me with my Spanish speaking.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard General Manuel Marquez de Leon 2415 esquina con Topete

218546413.name: \'Nice\' Marina
218546413.author: a TripAdvisor user
218546413.reviewBody:
Second choice behind CostaBaja in terms of overall amenity, but way best location for the beautiful Malecon and access to main township. Cortez lacks basic amenities eg shower, laundry, Internet ...and is obviously aimed more particularly at larger crewed vessels rather than 'basic' live-aboard.
The staff are , by far, the best that I have come across Anywhere. 
The pricing is a bit below CostaBaja, and above Palmira and Marina La Paz being lowest of the 'larger' marinas. A disappointment for us was a substantial increase in price quoted, and price charged... One day later... So next time will ask for an email verifying.
A couple of nice restaurants at the marina, but easy stroll to the Malecon and the original town centre for surprisingly good shopping, food and a safe taste of authentic 'Mexico'.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard General Manuel Marquez de Leon 2415 esquina con Topete

198085878.name: Safe and secure
198085878.author: a TripAdvisor user
198085878.reviewBody: We were surprised to find a marina in our favorite anchoring spot, but it has been such a blessing to cruising boats. The staff is friendly and efficient.  The security staff go out of their way to make sure all of the boats in the marina are secure during storms and to insure that the docks and boaters are safe.  Eduardo is always available with a big smile, helpful information and other assistance as needed. Our one concern is that there is no breakwater to protect boats from the "North winds" and the accompanying swells. When in La Paz, this is where we call home!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard General Manuel Marquez de Leon 2415 esquina con Topete

197956845.name: Perhaps the best Marina in all of Western Mexico
197956845.author: a TripAdvisor user
197956845.reviewBody:
Marina Cortez is among the best kept secrets in all of Baja.   It use to be called the virtual marina but now is truly a gem.  The management is very hands on and it is odd if you don't see Edwardo walking the docks and saying hello to everyone once or twice a week.   Recycling and trash containers are kept clean and are accessible every 50 feet or so meaning you don't have to carry trash far, heck, even I began recycling.

The pricing at the time we visited was near the low end of stays in the La Cruz area, although the amenities were as plentiful as every other marina in the area.  One of the biggest draws is being right down town.   The small row of restaurants at the marina are affordable and offer breakfast, lunch and dinner, but if that doesn't satisfy you it is just a quick walk to many more local choices.

For parts, you are located in close proximity to many of the local chandleries, auto stores, upholsterers, and plastic stores.   Groceries are a quick walk or cab ride to any number of large stores, or even Walmart.

You can't go wrong with Marina Cortez.   We don't stop at marina's often, but when we do, we choose Marina Cortez in La Paz and score all other marinas against them when we are not.

Bill and Lisa
Beyond Reason, HC43 Ketch.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard General Manuel Marquez de Leon 2415 esquina con Topete

197331208.name: great marina!
197331208.author: a TripAdvisor user
197331208.reviewBody: Marina Cortez has become our preferred marina for our sailboat in La Paz, we stay a month at beginning and end of our season. MLP has great staff but less availability and is a bit busier with lots of permanent cruisers. Cortez is a slightly more expensive but we enjoy the lower occupancy and smaller size. The guys on the docks are very helpful, competent and friendly, and Eduardo is the best! This is our 2nd year starting our cruising season at Cortez and we plan to return next year. Love the secure parking, location and staff. The location is great - next to MLP and the malecon. The adjacent restaurants are good too - Zitius for pizza and Cafe Capri for breakfast. The restaurants have live music a lot of nights that is nice to hear from our slip. Not sure how well the floating docks will hold up in a heavy blow but so far all has been fine.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard General Manuel Marquez de Leon 2415 esquina con Topete

197217823.name: Very nice
197217823.author: a TripAdvisor user
197217823.reviewBody: Great location, friendly and helpful staff, nice docks. Not packed in so nice breeze and good views from the boat. We will be back!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard General Manuel Marquez de Leon 2415 esquina con Topete

196024971.name: 3 days of our honeymoon.Beautiful setting.
196024971.author: a TripAdvisor user
196024971.reviewBody: clean, friendly, delicious meals.fabulous views.\nThe chef prepared our fresh yellowtail. The service was very friendly and very good.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard General Manuel Marquez de Leon 2415 esquina con Topete

190968464.name: Great location
190968464.author: a TripAdvisor user
190968464.reviewBody: Its a beautiful marina with many resturantes, and the location can not be better, everything is near here. Service its great !!!!

address.streetAddress: Boulevard General Manuel Marquez de Leon 2415 esquina con Topete

190544662.name: It\'s The Best!
190544662.author: a TripAdvisor user
190544662.reviewBody: We love staying a Marina Cortez!  We stayed  two and a half months last year and came back to it for our stay in La Paz again this year.  Eduardo, the manager, goes far beyond normal duties helping us with visas and residency cards.  He has become a friend.  The ladies in the office are great.  They help with special requests and with our Spanish.  The guards and dock workers are always friendly and eager to serve.  The facilities are clean and we always feel safe there.  It is located conveniently in town.  It\'s the marina we will return to when the "bungee cord" draws us back to La Paz.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard General Manuel Marquez de Leon 2415 esquina con Topete

165260825.name: Stayed on our boat at Marina Cortez in April and again May 2013
165260825.author: a TripAdvisor user
165260825.reviewBody: We had an excellent experience at Marina Cortez. The dock was super clean, water was great tasting and low in Total Dissolved Solids, electricity stable, and dock staff that were always there to assist in whatever we were doing. It is located right off the west end of the malecon which puts the dock in the prevailing breeze all thru the day, as opposed to other marinas that are like sitting in an oven.  The slips are generously spaced so you are not ont top of your neighbors....Plus the slip rates were the best in La Paz.  I will be returning here whenever I am in La Paz and would recommend this Marina to any and all who plan on spending time in La Paz.  \n\nGene Gehlbach/SV Chalet Mer

address.streetAddress: Boulevard General Manuel Marquez de Leon 2415 esquina con Topete

160827884.name: Great Prices with a Great Location!
160827884.author: a TripAdvisor user
160827884.reviewBody: Although this marina lacks many of the amenities most offer I do love the location and the price. Given that it is located in the centre of town it is easy to eat out or go shopping. Unlike the other Marinas in the area it is easy to manoeuvre your boat never risking damage or over crowding! Great service for a new company and I am sure in time they will develop the other amenities like gym, showers and laundry.

address.streetAddress: Boulevard General Manuel Marquez de Leon 2415 esquina con Topete

672148787.name: Dove of Peace Monument or Whale Tail
672148787.author: a TripAdvisor user
672148787.reviewBody: The Dove of Peace Monument or Whale Tail as we locals call it is a great place to catch a sunset. Nice little garden and easy parking.

663558485.name: A perfect symbol for the city!
663558485.author: a TripAdvisor user
663558485.reviewBody: The peace dove and a whale tale = a perfect combination!  I had hoped to find it on a postcard never found one.  If I missed it, too bad for me, but if there isn\'t one available I hope someone will correct that soon!

640125313.name: The official logo of La Paz
640125313.author: a TripAdvisor user
640125313.reviewBody: This whale tail is now to be found on many souveniers one can buy around La Paz - keychains, magnets, t shirts, etc. This is the original, found on the highway to and from the airport.

630844201.name: Welcome to La Paz
630844201.author: a TripAdvisor user
630844201.reviewBody: One of the first sights you see when you drive in La Paz..To me it says welcome back when we arrive and adios when we leave for the states

613291000.name: So beautiful!
613291000.author: a TripAdvisor user
613291000.reviewBody: Drove past this late at night in the taxi I was taking from La Paz airport on my way to downtown. Even at night it is stunning.

589846572.name: La Paz Landmark
589846572.author: a TripAdvisor user
589846572.reviewBody: A nice place to pull over for a quick stop between El Centenario and La Paz. The small park has a short winding walking trail and washroom facilities.

536651711.name: Located at the entrance to La Paz from the North
536651711.author: a TripAdvisor user
536651711.reviewBody: Nice monument at the entrance to La Paz from the north, City of Constitution near the International Airport and Shopping.

468419372.name: A Beautiful Monumet
468419372.author: a TripAdvisor user
468419372.reviewBody: Nice welcome to La Paz when entering town,  Be sure to have your camera ready.  Its easy to miss and hard to get a goo photo of

467820547.name: Beautiful Gateway Feature
467820547.author: a TripAdvisor user
467820547.reviewBody: You will see this feature as you enter from the south. When a city dedicates resources to beautify and welcome visitors, you know that it has its priorities straight. Whether you appreciate the artwork does not matter. The fact that a city prides itself on allowing for public artwork with meaning is what is important. Kudos to La Paz for making the effort to  install artwork for all to enjoy.

466375260.name: Very nice and worth the view
466375260.author: a TripAdvisor user
466375260.reviewBody: This sculpture is so pretty. I\'m just sorry it is on the very outskirts of town. Great to see and thought provoking in today\'s climate

355009653.name: Great idea that comes off flawlessly.
355009653.author: a TripAdvisor user
355009653.reviewBody: Always loved this whale tail/dove monument.  It is extremely well done and well planned.  When one first sees it coming from the north, it looks like a whale tail, then as you get closer you see the dove body.  Great monument.

340357536.name: The Gateway to La Paz BCS
340357536.author: a TripAdvisor user
340357536.reviewBody: Great attraction, beautiful monument to welcome you to the city. The city\'s name stands for peace and it\'s only fitting the monument has the same meaning.

205652946.name: The Whales Tail
205652946.author: a TripAdvisor user
205652946.reviewBody:
Sounds like a book or a movie, but thats what is know by, by most of the locals who live in La Paz.
It is located as you drive North out of town on the way to the airport.  It used to be white, now a brown color, maybe to match the  dust in the area.

And now of all things they planted hundreds of plants around it so it takes away from being the focal point.  Once the palms are grown you won't even get a photo shoot any more :)

Anyway on with the story.  The artist is quite upset becasue every one calls it a whales tale, when in fact it is .. 2 doves, and they way they are placed makes it look like a whales tale.

The doves of course representing Peace.  since La Paz means the city of Peace.

192508343.name: So that is what it is.
192508343.author: a TripAdvisor user
192508343.reviewBody: Still looks like a whale\'s tail to me, but it is distinctly La Paz! Without the monument there would be far fewer La Paz t-shirts to sell...

183900928.name: Awesome Statue
183900928.author: a TripAdvisor user
183900928.reviewBody: This is an impending landmark and a beautiful piece of art!    I think it should be painted white as it was previously though...It truly does represent all that LaPaz is...Peace with the Dove and the whale tail combination...\nPerhaps it could be in a better location but it is an impending piece that everyone sees when they are driving and can be used as a point for directions as well...

167325676.name: Dove of Peace Monument - La Cola de la Ballena
167325676.author: a TripAdvisor user
167325676.reviewBody: The monument itself is awesome. The problem is where they put it. It is smack in the middle of the sewage plant area and always smells of raw sewage there. So sad.

135454255.name: History lesson
135454255.author: a TripAdvisor user
135454255.reviewBody: Two plaques, bilingual, on the twin towers give a brief history lesson, although they leave out the Mexican Government attempt to wipe out the church in Mexico.

132817775.name: The symbol of La Paz
132817775.author: a TripAdvisor user
132817775.reviewBody: A perfect way to be greeted to the fair city of La Paz.  And a perfect symbol for a peaceful, welcoming place to live.  It always gives me a thrill to see it as we drive in on Mexico 1 from San Diego.

128073028.name: Magnificant setting
128073028.author: a TripAdvisor user
128073028.reviewBody: Beautiful place to stop & walk amoung the native vegatation.  Grounds are well kept & clean

1539345.name: Dove of Peace or Whale\'s Tail: You Decide
1539345.author: a TripAdvisor user
1539345.reviewBody: It\'s been almost three years since I last drove away from La Paz, passing the Dove of Peace along the way. This monument was designed by a local artist (whose name now escapes me), who was employed as a graphic designer for the Department of Public Health. It is known locally as "La Cola de la Ballena," because, although it does represent a dove in profile, the greater sculpture bears the shape of a whale\'s tale, in honor of the many species of whale that populate the Sea of Cortez, as well as the California Gray Whales which annually migrate, breed and give birth in the lagoons of Baja California Sur\'s Pacific Coast. Though unfortunately frequently marred by graffiti and litter, The Whale\'s Tale is a striking monument, especially when flying into the nearby La Paz aeropuerto. As a symbol of La Paz, it is often incorporated into gold and silver jewelry and sold as souvenirs. It is a clever, beautiful and evocative public monument to a lovely city.

665595612.name: Absolutely fabulous
665595612.author: a TripAdvisor user
665595612.reviewBody: We highly recommend the horseback riding trip. An excellent way to connect to nature and enjoy the spectacular views the desert and the beach have to offer. The hosts are very friendly and made our trip one we will never forget :)

address.streetAddress: Carretera a San Juan de la Costa km. 11 Predio pozo Rodriguez o el Paraje, Alfredo v. Bonfil

583686628.name: Amazing day at Rancho Cactimar, July 2017
583686628.author: a TripAdvisor user
583686628.reviewBody:
We wanted to see what it was like living away from civilization, surrounded by desert and sea, in a rancho.  Found them online, spoke with Jean-Christophe (he has Whatsapp), talked about what we wanted to do, and he customized a day package for us.  

Only half an hour outside La Paz, but feels so isolated, very peaceful.  Jean-Christophe and Marjorie were so welcoming!  They are genuinely nice people, and took the time to show us how they live.  Check their web site to read on the different things they do to be eco sustainable.  

Everything they served us was made fresh and very very good, from the margaritas to the guacamole, a delicious lunch (if I remember, it was a fusion pork and tacos dish, Mexican and French, with salad and rice), and then dessert that night, a fantastic Pitaya pie.  The pie had two kinds of pitaya, one that tasted like strawberry and one that tasted like kiwi.  I have never had pie like that before!

We relaxed, slept in the hammock, dipped in their cool "hot tub" that had refreshing cold water, kayaked and spotted some whales far off breaching!, and went horse back riding to cap off the day.  That was a wonderful day(must have been 8-9 hours) spent with them and their Workaway volunteer from France who was great at handling the horses and entertaining our daughter.

Since that day in July 2017, we have sent friends who were visiting to go horseback riding, and everyone had a great time. 

We highly recommend visiting the ranch, it is a far different experience from what most visitors to the Baja are used to. It is so peaceful out there, looking out over the Sea of Cortez across to Isla Espiritu Santo.  At night it is so quiet, and so beautiful looking at the night sky covered in myriad stars.  They are blessed to be able to live out there, and we wish them the best in life.  

Go check it out, it will make you think about simple living in a whole new light.

address.streetAddress: Carretera a San Juan de la Costa km. 11 Predio pozo Rodriguez o el Paraje, Alfredo v. Bonfil

563549554.name: Horseback riding on the beach!
563549554.author: a TripAdvisor user
563549554.reviewBody:
Delightful! Jean-Christophe and his family have a great ranch and horses, and gave us a tour of the area, down to the beach and through the dunes. 

Our abilities were matched to the horses they selected for us, and when one was a touch more challenging than expected for the rider, they took the times to give some extra training. 

It was a beautiful route, timed right at golden hour along a rugged coastline. The experience is really worth it, 10/10 would do again next time we visit!!

address.streetAddress: Carretera a San Juan de la Costa km. 11 Predio pozo Rodriguez o el Paraje, Alfredo v. Bonfil

635312486.name: Beautiful Beach
635312486.author: a TripAdvisor user
635312486.reviewBody: This lovely clean beach is a short distance from La Paz. There were 6 people on the beach when we got there. White sand, lots of parking, no vendors, quiet. A tiny bit of paradise!

633504474.name: Great beach close to town.
633504474.author: a TripAdvisor user
633504474.reviewBody: Love this beach; so close to town. Lots of fish and good snorkling. Too bad they recently banned dogs so now we can\'t go there with our little "baby".\n

578069299.name: Only place to buy a Perla Bahia de La Paz
578069299.author: a TripAdvisor user
578069299.reviewBody:
I didn t know that La Paz was one of the most important place for pearl in the world . 
 As i am obsessed with jewelry i visited the place ( that is is just a small artesan handcraft spot ) and there is a very very small corner with some piece of pearl and silver and pearl  jewelry  that are certified by. PERLAS de BAHIA de LA PAZ
 This is the only place where you can buy in Baja California ! 
 I bought a breautiful cultived pearl

address.streetAddress: Paseo Alvaro Obregon Entre Bravo y Rosales

568291071.name: Beautiful store and very original items
568291071.author: a TripAdvisor user
568291071.reviewBody: My mom and I wandered in the store for an hour!  It isn\'t that big but I loved seeing all the arts and crafts from all over Mexico. I bought some postcards that were really nice.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Alvaro Obregon Entre Bravo y Rosales

508788830.name: Pretty unoriginal touristy stuff
508788830.author: a TripAdvisor user
508788830.reviewBody: Checking out the local landmarks, this one wasn\'t a huge highlight. Nothing I\'d buy for myself, maybe worth it if you have to local-looking (cheap-ish, likely factory made) souvenirs for friends

address.streetAddress: Paseo Alvaro Obregon Entre Bravo y Rosales

462039796.name: Good crafts and souvenirs
462039796.author: a TripAdvisor user
462039796.reviewBody: I got all my La Paz souvenirs from here. Though there is a lot of the usual stuff that you get everywhere there was enough here that was different and made well. The prices are for sure much better than other places. I got a pair of handmade earrings for about 300 pesos here and the exact same (same artist and same label) earrings were about 800 pesos in a store in Todos Santos.\nI am glad I discovered this place - it\'s a good place if you have the eye to look thru all the random factory made stuff.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Alvaro Obregon Entre Bravo y Rosales

335133546.name: Disappointing
335133546.author: a TripAdvisor user
335133546.reviewBody: I was disappointed in the variety and quality of the items sold here.  It seemed to me to be more tourist souvenirs than higher quality art.  But maybe it is just my weird taste in shopping.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Alvaro Obregon Entre Bravo y Rosales

334805866.name: Average handicrafts store .... a lot of prefab factory made stuff making the name of the place a bit misleading.
334805866.author: a TripAdvisor user
334805866.reviewBody: Average handicrafts store .... a lot of prefab factory made stuff making the name of the place a bit misleading.\n\nAs you would expect almost everything to be made by local artisans, which is clearly not the case.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Alvaro Obregon Entre Bravo y Rosales

269405566.name: Enough out of the ordinary
269405566.author: a TripAdvisor user
269405566.reviewBody: I bought all my gifts to take home at this shop. I had been here years before when I took a week long Spanish immersion class in La Paz and I was glad to see it was still here. There is a lot of "stuff" and it is worth walking around two or three times to let your "eye" adjust (I sent my male partner outside to enjoy the park so I could shop at my leisure). There are interesting reproductions of rock paintings on everything from stone to magnets, handmade mango lime soap slices, interesting (and inexpensive) stone bracelets, damiana herbal tonics and teas and much more. The prices are reasonable and the people were friendly but not pushy.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Alvaro Obregon Entre Bravo y Rosales

266143746.name: Lots of handmade stuff
266143746.author: a TripAdvisor user
266143746.reviewBody: This place has a lot of handmade stuff, but I didn\'t find it really that interesting, and wasn\'t tempted to buy anything.  It\'s not really touristy stuff (though there are booths outside with that), and not really high priced, but just not so interesting.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Alvaro Obregon Entre Bravo y Rosales

263615600.name: Too much junk
263615600.author: a TripAdvisor user
263615600.reviewBody: There are some nice artisanal soaps, syrups and other food stuff. However, the souvenirs are of the generally mass produced tacky kind.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Alvaro Obregon Entre Bravo y Rosales

253402277.name: Pottery Galore
253402277.author: a TripAdvisor user
253402277.reviewBody: If you love quality Mexican Pottery, this shop is worth a visit. Great quality, knowledgable owner. A little pricey, but good pottery is a bit expensive.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Alvaro Obregon Entre Bravo y Rosales

239252153.name: Don\'t buy the shore excursion for this!
239252153.author: a TripAdvisor user
239252153.reviewBody: Saw this was included on shore excursion from ship, but figured correctly we could walk to it from where the free shuttle buses from the ship dropped us off. Glad I didn\'t waste $ on the excursion, as you can see nothing is manufactured here, and while its a quaint shop, nothing shouts out how wonderful it is and must be bought. Found better selection and pricing on the dockside area next to the ship.

address.streetAddress: Paseo Alvaro Obregon Entre Bravo y Rosales

237283091.name: Well situated
237283091.author: a TripAdvisor user
237283091.reviewBody: Basically caters to tourists traveling the Malecon. Mostly native trinkets so don\'t expect to find any Chinese junk!

address.streetAddress: Paseo Alvaro Obregon Entre Bravo y Rosales

222450807.name: Good place for souvenirs
222450807.author: a TripAdvisor user
222450807.reviewBody: It is full of local crafts and very convenient to get to as it is right on the Malecon. The prices are fair and many ingenious items to look at.\n

address.streetAddress: Paseo Alvaro Obregon Entre Bravo y Rosales

668694998.name: Just another street to stroll.
668694998.author: a TripAdvisor user
668694998.reviewBody: Unless you have the need for services or shopping, Calle 16 de Septiembre is simply another street to walk upon in beautiful La Paz.

638937464.name: Fun street- and where the most ATMs are!
638937464.author: a TripAdvisor user
638937464.reviewBody: This ended up being sort of our reference point street.  There is a lot going on, and there are several choices of banks with ATMs.

630844490.name: Main street
630844490.author: a TripAdvisor user
630844490.reviewBody: This is main street La Paz with many shops and banks. It starts at the malecon and goes on for many blocks..

534201505.name: Lot of Dead Stalls.
534201505.author: a TripAdvisor user
534201505.reviewBody: I\'ve walked around Calle 16 de Septiembre twice already, and both times a good majority of the stores/stalls were closed. What I did see was typical Mexican folk art and handicrafts. Nothing I saw really stood out. But to be honest, after experiencing the outdoor market in Otavalo in Ecuador, everything pales in comparison. Otavalo is probably the best, most colorful, interesting outdoor market in the America\'s hands down. \n\nI wouldn\'t come down for the handicrafts and Mexican folk art, unless you are looking for something in particular. However, it\'s a nice walk and a pleasant way to pass the time.

465914789.name: Nice for a visit
465914789.author: a TripAdvisor user
465914789.reviewBody: This area has lots of cute little local shops. Lots of shoe shops and a few coffee places and food places to eat. Nice diversion from the main drag

453654776.name: Calle 16 de September is way better than the Malecon for shopping!
453654776.author: a TripAdvisor user
453654776.reviewBody: Lots of great shops along this street - and if you go up as far as Calle Sedin, there is a great candy store that sells authentic vanilla for 31.5 pesos - we brought back 5!

351214530.name: Interesting Street in Central La Paz
351214530.author: a TripAdvisor user
351214530.reviewBody: Our tour bus parked along this street just across from the Sears store as we were able to spend an hour enjoying the scenic beauty of this part of La Paz on 17 Feb 2016. The museum, the gorgeous trees, nice shops, and overall vibe of this area were very nice.

336772681.name: Stroll and Shop along the Calle 16 de Sept.
336772681.author: a TripAdvisor user
336772681.reviewBody: The street runs up from the Malecon and ends at Church Mission. A local coffee shop ) " 5th Avenue" to the left of the church had live music and great coffee. Ibarra\'s Pottery is a hop skip and a jump away on Republic and Rameriaz.

334805456.name: Nice little area for shops and I believe is where the funky/farmers/crafts market was on Saturday!
334805456.author: a TripAdvisor user
334805456.reviewBody: Nice little area for shops and I believe is where the funky/farmers/crafts market was on Saturday!  \n\nNice for a stroll.

334102925.name: great shopping area
334102925.author: a TripAdvisor user
334102925.reviewBody: A must see while in la paz. So many shops and the marketbhas great sea food....camarones medio for 200$ pesos and lots of seafood as well as cheese, fruits and veggies.  Lots of shops in the area

318123405.name: banks, a school and Sears, viva Mexico!
318123405.author: a TripAdvisor user
318123405.reviewBody: this is a ridiculous street of no attraction what so ever, La Paz should be ashamed, sewage river when it rains, god bless!!

251198766.name: main street la paz
251198766.author: a TripAdvisor user
251198766.reviewBody: this is a main street in la paz... has sears, the cultural museum, OXXO shops,  hardware stores, subway shop, coffee shops, and it runs right into the malecon....

247817896.name: local stores
247817896.author: a TripAdvisor user
247817896.reviewBody: nice walk, many local shops and not much to see. Avoid in hot weather. It is better to walk by the Malecon.

160167092.name: Fun place to look around - where locals shop
160167092.author: a TripAdvisor user
160167092.reviewBody: This main drag extends inland from the kiosk on the malecon.  The stores and kiosks don\'t sell many handicrafts or the things tourists usually buy.  This is where you go if you need everyday items or want to see what the locals re buying.  The small department store Perla De La Paz sells comfortable and fashionable locally-made cotton clothing.

154777782.name: Shopping on 16 de Septiembre
154777782.author: a TripAdvisor user
154777782.reviewBody: This street is the quintessential business district/shopping hub for locals.  If you want to experience a typical Mexican/Baja shopping experience, walk this street as well as the little ones off of it.  La Paz is a real place...not a manufactured for tourists town, and these shops exemplify what the locals buy, how they dress, what they eat, etc.  It\'s the real deal....from the stands that sell corn in a cup with crema and hot sauce, to cut fruits in a cup with hot sauce, or coconut pieces in a plastic bag with hot sauce, and of course all the shrimp and fish taco carts, too.  Try it all!  It\'s all fresh and delicious.  One of my favorite stops is the espresso/bakery on the corner 1 block up from the Malecon.  There\'s also a great Chinese restaurant and shop above it.  There are tons of store front windows loaded with everything from designer copy purses, sunglasses, cosmetics, etc.  Tons of clothing boutiques line all the streets packed with sexy mini skirts, outrageously high heels made in Mexico, and the oddest looking furniture I\'ve ever \nseen.  It\'s great fun to just explore....and don\'t miss trying watermelon water or one of the other fruit frescas offered like tamarindo.  Very refreshing.

148104604.name: Interesting Street
148104604.author: a TripAdvisor user
148104604.reviewBody: The street is relatively interesting. The cultural centre has a nice little cafe called Entre Especias y Cafe. It not only has the best coffee in town but the prices are great too (14p) for a big cup. They also serve breakfast and lunch. The shops are not that unique. It would be good to see some more indigneous art and local artists in this area.

148001619.name: Shopping Heaven
148001619.author: a TripAdvisor user
148001619.reviewBody: If you need anything at all while in La Paz, head for 16 de Septiembre...along this street and on the many side streets are hundreds of shops offering just about anything.   During the holidays there are many enterprising folks with package wrapping services.   A fun stroll!

145393428.name: downtown
145393428.author: a TripAdvisor user
145393428.reviewBody: 16 de Septiembre is one of the main downtown streets that you can walk around and enjoy the atmosphere of charming, old la paz. enjoy the architecture, shops, restaurants and the malecon and seaside as well.

141881718.name: el centro the center
141881718.author: a TripAdvisor user
141881718.reviewBody: this street close to cinco de mayo is fabulous my favorite coffee shop is here close to a big department store accross from gift shops and visitor information close to the cathedral. There are so many shops and restraunts in this area its a good place to shop and eat. behind many hotels off the malecon.

122148264.name: street shopping fun
122148264.author: a TripAdvisor user
122148264.reviewBody: neat little shops at certain times of the year they set up little tents to sell on the street in front of the stores, lots to see

640124489.name: Modern and functional
640124489.author: a TripAdvisor user
640124489.reviewBody: The Teatro de la Ciudad is a large modern theater a few blocks from downtown. Built in the stark but functional 1980\'s style of many modern Mexican buildings, the theater is comfortable for the audience and has ample backstage space for performers. I just played a Christmas concert here and enjoyed the theater and the warm reception from the La Paz public.

441655809.name: Dia de La Muerte
441655809.author: a TripAdvisor user
441655809.reviewBody: Really a geat show this year for Dia de La Muerte - so glad we made it out that night.  The highlight of the evening was probably the Catrinas competition with some absolutely spectacular costumes, and such amazing variety, with Catrinas from all ages. The food was excellent, with dozens of tables and stands.  Great family event and quite interesting!

240112145.name: The Day of the Dead Celebrations
240112145.author: a TripAdvisor user
240112145.reviewBody: We visited the Theatre for the annual celebration of the Day of the Dead. It was a free show in the open air outside the theatre. There was a couple of great bands singing modern and traditional Mexican music on a huge stage in front of the theatre and around the grounds were the exhibitions of various memorials set up in the traditional style to commemorate various personalities and , most interesting of all, women and children dressed as Catrinas with skeletal makeup and elaborate dresses and hats.They moved around amongst the crowd allowing people to take photos of their largely stunning costumes. The memorials and the Catrinas were all taking part in the competition for best and most imaginative interpretation of the tradition. There were stalls selling Mexican food from different states of Mexico and the crowd was one of the best humoured and well behaved crowd I have ever come across. We were there with my mother-in-law who was in a wheel chair and people could not have been more helpful in helping to clear access and help to ge the chair over cables and curbs where there were no ramps. It was a wonderful free evening.

183438109.name: Dia de Los muertos
183438109.author: a TripAdvisor user
183438109.reviewBody: For the 2 nights of this celebration this is the place to be . Food booths are set up . It is a family affair young children are dressed up. Booths set up for displaying the event of the days of Dead. There is entertainment , musica, dancing and a competition for dressed up Katina\'s. a big crowd gathers and a safe environment for the whole family.

160827219.name: Lovely little theatre
160827219.author: a TripAdvisor user
160827219.reviewBody: This building could use an update outside but the inside has a lot to offer the locals. Well worth the visit and your support!

150136128.name: Nice theater!
150136128.author: a TripAdvisor user
150136128.reviewBody: Nice and comfortable! They have concerts and nice events almost every day! \nIn October they have a wonderful event, the Day of the death celebration and it is very nice to see the offerings and the Catrinas (Mexican skeletons) all elegantly dressed! Beautiful, and totally recommend it!

120439977.name: The place to be for Dia de Los Muertos
120439977.author: a TripAdvisor user
120439977.reviewBody: This is the place to be if you are in La Paz for Dia de Los Muertos. Hundreds of people, food booths, extraordinary altars, music, and the roaming Katrinas are not to be missed.

589847355.name: Peaceful park to relax across from the Cathedral
589847355.author: a TripAdvisor user
589847355.reviewBody: Peaceful park to relax across from the Cathedral. The gazebo and replica of Balandra\'s "Mushroom Rock" are the plaza\'s features. A popular spot for local chess players.

471773171.name: The rock is good but the hike above is excellent
471773171.author: a TripAdvisor user
471773171.reviewBody: The now man supported rock was interesting, but that it was now artificially held up took the attraction away a lot.  go to the bluff cliffs above for a fantastic sunset view and a view the area.  it is an easy walk with huge fringe benefits.

465456917.name: Interesting little park / plaza in the center of town across the street from the Cathedral
465456917.author: a TripAdvisor user
465456917.reviewBody: Nice plaza that will sometimes have local vendors selling items from the area.  Most souvenir shops in La Paz have the same items so its nice to fine different items.

443181779.name: Probably Better With More Time
443181779.author: a TripAdvisor user
443181779.reviewBody: Saw the mushroom rock (which is the reproduction of a real rock on Balandra Beach, reportedly); saw the bandstand. Would have liked to have looked around the area, which looked interesting, but only had 15 minutes because the tour company I was with had to hustle us off to a jewellery store for an hour.

361358193.name: Interesting story, average place
361358193.author: a TripAdvisor user
361358193.reviewBody: Rather average place when you do not know the story of the monument. In fact, there is a fountain but no water. We were there at Sunday noon but it was nobody around.\nAll in all, nothing worth going up there.

334806381.name: Average Mexican central plaza ... not really much activity for a Saturday when I was there :(
334806381.author: a TripAdvisor user
334806381.reviewBody: Average Mexican central plaza ... not really much activity for a Saturday when I was there :(\n\nThese plazas are generally quite buzzing and a center of activity ... not the case in La Paz BCS I guess.

134925570.name: Quiet
134925570.author: a TripAdvisor user
134925570.reviewBody: Neat, and clean and near the Cathedral    A very pleasant place to just sit and relax

656439888.name: my favorite since 2007 walk it every year
656439888.author: a TripAdvisor user
656439888.reviewBody:
I love down town (el centro) and have walked it all... The street tacos across the street from the material store Modellos to The Bismark sea food restraunt. both markets are only 2-3 blocks from each other (about 10 blocks off malecon).
The picture shown above is the visitor information centre. Kitty corner to Sears and close to Cafe Gourmet. before Christmas there is a great little outside market from Revolution and Balsario Domingues. Right now I assume Carnival has started!
Go to the building you see here get a free down town map and enjoy the walk the adventure and all the flavours of food of Mexico, refreshing Michocan (fruit blended) waters and the fantastic honest hard working shop keepers that make this such a giving, caring experience. 

The people all look others in the eyes and greet them on the street. Mexico and especially La Paz is a great friendly experience. Filled with Amazing People who bring us the way Humanity should be aware of your Community and professional helpful people. shop clothing, textiles, pottery, hand made and blankets off the loom. Walk way behind sears and the Artisian store Kitty corner from (closed for many years) "Hotel Arcos"
where when coming from the west the Malecon street makes a wye in the road. One leads straight past the banks almost directly to the visitors centre. In the center of this are many more local artists who are currently dispaced in January 2019 but a Park is being constructed I can only assume its for street vendors. Enjoy

address.streetAddress: Calle 16 de Septiembre #120 Corner Belisario Dominguez, Zona Central

653698563.name: Small but quaint space, really good bookstore
653698563.author: a TripAdvisor user
653698563.reviewBody: Not much time to go through. Had an art exhibit upstairs, two rooms. \nBooks store is worth going to check out.

address.streetAddress: Calle 16 de Septiembre #120 Corner Belisario Dominguez, Zona Central

633282362.name: Revitalized building hosting art, restaurant, offices and meeting rooms.
633282362.author: a TripAdvisor user
633282362.reviewBody: I liked seeing how they refurbished this old building and are using it for cultural purposes. It\'s right by everything, so in your walks, drop in and take look!

address.streetAddress: Calle 16 de Septiembre #120 Corner Belisario Dominguez, Zona Central

629682438.name: Had a private tour with Vincente very helpful
629682438.author: a TripAdvisor user
629682438.reviewBody: Vincente told us about the local history as well as general information about the center and history.There are classes for children, they are building a library collection for English and Spanish readers. There is an art gallery and they have plans for many more programs as their budget allows. Highly recommend you drop in and ask for Vincente. He was very informative and helpful.

address.streetAddress: Calle 16 de Septiembre #120 Corner Belisario Dominguez, Zona Central

589844010.name: Free Admission
589844010.author: a TripAdvisor user
589844010.reviewBody: Historic building with a beautiful red brick exterior. Murals depicting history in courtyard. Small room with pictures and written history of Baja in English and Spanish - very detailed and easy to read. Coffee shop in courtyard.\n

address.streetAddress: Calle 16 de Septiembre #120 Corner Belisario Dominguez, Zona Central

576516403.name: Always closed, looks interesting from the outside
576516403.author: a TripAdvisor user
576516403.reviewBody: Looks like an interesting place, but it was always closed. Why close during vacation week? The government bookstore is typical for any federal cultural center.

address.streetAddress: Calle 16 de Septiembre #120 Corner Belisario Dominguez, Zona Central

552266007.name: Christmas market
552266007.author: a TripAdvisor user
552266007.reviewBody: We were there just before Christmas, and though the market was pretty lame, it was fun to see and enjoy the people.

address.streetAddress: Calle 16 de Septiembre #120 Corner Belisario Dominguez, Zona Central

491112483.name: Marginally HIstoric Building
491112483.author: a TripAdvisor user
491112483.reviewBody: On 16 de Sepitembre street, which is the ugliest street in La Paz, banks and Sears, a school and silly shops, this old Municipal "Palace" has been restored and spruced up\nbut serves no purpose really, Expensive book/souvenir shop, hasta la vista!

address.streetAddress: Calle 16 de Septiembre #120 Corner Belisario Dominguez, Zona Central

473245365.name: a little dissappointing
473245365.author: a TripAdvisor user
473245365.reviewBody: We were excited to learn about the culture of La Paz.  All they had were some stand up kiosk type boards with a lot of text and some pictures.

address.streetAddress: Calle 16 de Septiembre #120 Corner Belisario Dominguez, Zona Central

465904033.name: Beautiful Building
465904033.author: a TripAdvisor user
465904033.reviewBody: We stumbled into this accidentally. It is a beautiful building outside with lots of interesting info boards about the history of LaPaz on the inside. Well worth a 10 minute stop to get out of the sun.

address.streetAddress: Calle 16 de Septiembre #120 Corner Belisario Dominguez, Zona Central

463942483.name: Nice building from an old era.
463942483.author: a TripAdvisor user
463942483.reviewBody: I\'ve been here many times and I always enjoy visiting, there\'s always an art exhibition going on but even at times when I\'ve seen it with nothing on the walls this building is nice to watch. Its high ceiling and windows give it a relaxing vibe you can feel. It\'s usually quiet inside. If you\'re walking around down town pass by this building and go inside, it\'s free.

address.streetAddress: Calle 16 de Septiembre #120 Corner Belisario Dominguez, Zona Central

456590592.name: Good Exhibits So Check it Out
456590592.author: a TripAdvisor user
456590592.reviewBody: The building is pretty, the courtyard inside more than pretty, and we saw an exhibit on the history of Baja that was worthwhile and maybe a 45 minute exercise.  When walking around, make sure to find this.

address.streetAddress: Calle 16 de Septiembre #120 Corner Belisario Dominguez, Zona Central

650608752.name: Libreria indispensable para conocer autores sudacalifornianos
650608752.author: a TripAdvisor user
650608752.reviewBody: En esta librer\u00eda se pueden encontrar diferentes autores aut\u00f3ctonos de la pen\u00ednsula de la Baja California, que tratan diferentes t\u00f3picos como la historia, el paisaje, la naturaleza, la poes\u00eda, y novelas ficticias que abrevan de pasajes de la vida cotidiana de la campi\u00f1a Sudcaliforniana

address.streetAddress: Altamirano E/ 5 de Mayo y Constitucion, 1er. piso

629004708.name: Un excelente espacio dedicado a la promoci\u00f3n cultural
629004708.author: a TripAdvisor user
629004708.reviewBody: Un excelente espacio dedicado a la promoci\u00f3n cultural: La venta de libros editados en el estado, una peque\u00f1a pero agradable sala de exposiciones temporales y un c\u00f3modo espacio para la realizaci\u00f3n de talleres y cursos.

address.streetAddress: Altamirano E/ 5 de Mayo y Constitucion, 1er. piso

657030219.name: Visit the new malecon
657030219.author: a TripAdvisor user
657030219.reviewBody: Come and see our updated malecon with it\'s new look.. Take an evening walk and see for yourself.. the malecon is more then a mile long so enjoy

558603604.name: Good meeting place!
558603604.author: a TripAdvisor user
558603604.reviewBody:
The Kiosco is sort of the meeting place ocean side in La Paz

Lots of functions happen here.... bands, dances  speeches..
anything and everything

all kinds of small expositions.

Great view of the sea from here.

Take a stroll down the malecon...ocean side walkway.. goes on for over 3 miles for sure.

The Kiosk always has vendors selling something in the evening.
My favorite is the sweet and salty popcorn.
They give out samples as well.

Get out .. go for an evening stroll.

Experience la paz and its people

Leave me a helpful vote

556025729.name: Very helpful
556025729.author: a TripAdvisor user
556025729.reviewBody: The lady who helped us here had no agenda but for us to feel safe and informed. She gave great maps and offered advice on which tours to trust. She even explained how to handle traffic stops by the police.

658141353.name: A Must Go Snorkel Trip in La Paz!
658141353.author: a TripAdvisor user
658141353.reviewBody: We did San Rafaelito Island as part of the "Cortez Sea of Wonders" tour with La Paz VIP Tours - it was incredible!  We had amazing close up and personal interactions with Sea Lions! Highly recommend!

652157224.name: Awesome nature experience
652157224.author: a TripAdvisor user
652157224.reviewBody: We hopped a couple of kayaks on the beach and started paddling for an island at the mouth of a couple coves with beaches near La Paz.  This island has loads of birds on it, so much that the island is mostly white from their droppings.  The corals and fishes here are beautiful.  A school of larger jack fish swam right by us in shallow water.  Here I learned a little about freediving from our local guides at freefallacademy.net.  A little more paddling took us to isla San Rafalito where we snorkeled with sea lions.  They reminded me of playful puppies underwater which made me miss my own dogs back home.  On the way back we stopped at a very nice beach and did a little hike.  Definitely recommend this trip to see the natural side of the area with some cool locals.

590065700.name: You\'ll have the place to yourself
590065700.author: a TripAdvisor user
590065700.reviewBody: A great half-day trip from La Paz. Turn off highway 286, drive down the dirt road a couple of hundred meters and park by the cattle gate. Walk the loop to and from the dam. Walk along the top of the dam for good bird-watching. We could actually go inside the dam when we were there. Hike down to the bottom of the dam in the dry season, and hike around the building ruins. It must be quite the sight in the rainy season.

552823092.name: Small but worth a stop
552823092.author: a TripAdvisor user
552823092.reviewBody: Some interesting and varied items......fascinating fish depictions but not too many pieces to choose from.

address.streetAddress: 5 de Mayo 306 e/ Revolucion Serdan, In front of the Cathedral

654542261.name: House concerts, poetry, and literature readings in La Paz
654542261.author: a TripAdvisor user
654542261.reviewBody: La Levedad del Ser (The Lightness of Being) is a charming and intimate setting for house concerts, poetry, and literature readings near the heart of La Paz. The hosts formerly owned an art gallery/performance hall, but have recently moved their venue to a covered open-air patio on the first floor of their home to focus on the performing arts. We were fortunate enough to attend a performance by the very talented classical guitarist Guillermo Avil\u00e9s performing primarily Latin American and Spanish music. The artist was available after the performance to discuss his work and to socialize. While Guillermo performed solo under the covered patio, the venue also features a small outdoor stage for larger ensembles. Wine and beer were available for purchase.

address.streetAddress: Calle Jose Maria Morelos y Pavon 512

188244475.name: Tamal Gallery
188244475.author: a TripAdvisor user
188244475.reviewBody:
Tamal Gallery (urban art café) is a casa cultural tucked away in a quiet, tree-lined calle in La Paz’s historical district. It’s a few horizontal blocks behind the malecon and is surrounded by murals- many of which are sponsored by the small, independent business. 

Tamal Gallery has many facets. It’s a café, gallery, an English school, aerosole and specialty markers, and clothing retailer, an open mic, and graffiti art, rap and poetry, and paper mache workshop and more. 

The gallery chiefly displays graffiti artwork in a high ceiling, restored colonial.  
 
The Café lounge offers gourmet coffee, tea, and tamales to enjoy at the bar or seating under arched windows which open to the street outside.

Urban life inspired T-shirts, long sleeves, and hoodies hang on the rack; while aerosols and markers in a broad range of colors and finishes are neatly displayed for purchase. 

This is definitely a hang out for graffiti artists, rappers, and anyone who is interested in urban art and music.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Zaragoza 40 entre Artesanos y 16 de Septiembre, Colonia Centro

160107967.name: Old World Contemporary\u2014WOW!
160107967.author: a TripAdvisor user
160107967.reviewBody:
Traveling a lot is a challenge for me in ways I hadn't anticipated, like finding nourishment for my mind and soul, as well as my body. Places with local charm, or that at least provide a good taste of local culture, haven't been too hard to find, and cosmopolitan spots with some international flair have been conveniently located along most of the well-traveled routes I've taken. Finding old world charm and a fresh, sophisticated atmosphere together in one establishment, though, has been rare, indeed. That's what I discovered at Tamal Gallery, and I enjoyed my visits there very much.

Even before sipping the first rich, really excellent cup of freshly brewed coffee I had in La Paz, Baja Cali Sur, I felt at ease in the comfortable arrangement and good vibes of this unique art cafe. I was immediately taken in by the contemporary, urban style art, as well as the traditional works on display and for sale all around, on the walls, and hanging from the ceiling. In fact, I think it'd take an effort not to delight in the original, 5-foot tall, ostrich-like bird made from household and natural elements, that seems to be welcoming you in front, bobbing in the breeze. (I got on the waiting list to buy one for home at a very fair price!)

I think what the owners are doing here is promoting talented, undiscovered artists who are producing work that modern people of any age and background can appreciate. My spirits were definitely lifted during each of my visits to this place, and I lost track of time talking with the regulars and new visitors alike—individuals of nearly all ages, from their late teens to well-past retirement. Our conversations ranged from the latest news to movies to world travel to who's a real good, local hair stylist (Patricia at the "Diana Salon" on Revolucion) and where to get great  fish tacos (the stand at Madero and Degollado) or the best chille rellenos (in front of Mercado Madero, the last stall on the left from the main entrance.)

My only complaint about Tamal Gallery is that they don't have more food and beverage offerings themselves: their reasonably priced tamales and fresh juices were as good as could be, along with the coffee ... and being a late evening person, I wouldn't have minded if they were open later on weeknights, when they closed at 8 pm.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Zaragoza 40 entre Artesanos y 16 de Septiembre, Colonia Centro

567397683.name: Don\'t buy the refrigerator magnets in the gift shop...They all broke into pieces before I left LaPaz
567397683.author: a TripAdvisor user
567397683.reviewBody: It is an interesting museum. Small but worth the visit and it was nice to have this kind of attraction in this area. We found it fascinating.

473434713.name: Very interesting, but Spanish only!
473434713.author: a TripAdvisor user
473434713.reviewBody: My husband was able to read the Spanish sufficiently for us to understand what we were seeing. The political, religious, ancient, and later historical exhibits were all well done.  I had hoped to purchase something small in the gift shop, but it  offered only artwork and books in Spanish. Friends who were not Spanish speakers found it much less accessible. Still, an enjoyable day in an air conditioned venue.

386769920.name: Mixed
386769920.author: a TripAdvisor user
386769920.reviewBody: Mostly closed for remodeling.  The guide we had was good, but I was there with grandkids and a little disappointed.

261370432.name: Worth a look
261370432.author: a TripAdvisor user
261370432.reviewBody: I\'m not really big on museums but I do go to them and always find something to learn and a reason to be impressed. I am probably bias on this one because our friends have personal history in that museum so it was great to see & hear her family legacy.  Good location, not big so you can pop in & out. I think it\'s important to learn about the countries/cities you visit and show some respect by learning a culture.

259177104.name: World\'s worst
259177104.author: a TripAdvisor user
259177104.reviewBody: We went to this museum because the Lonely Planet gave this supposed anthropology and history museum a glowing write up. Don\'t believe them. It was the most disappointing visit to a museum in our lives. Three stories of dilapidated exhibits with no signs or information of any kind. Dioramas of dubious credibility (were there really sabre-toothed tigers on the Baha peninsula?!) and attendants on each floor more interested in playing with their mobile phones than with the well-being of the visitors. Here is U$3 better spent on ice cream.

242635111.name: nothing fancy
242635111.author: a TripAdvisor user
242635111.reviewBody: Nothing fancy, but a nice little history of the area, etc.  Unfortunately it was 1/2 closed when we were there due to hurricane damage, but would be worth the visit when fully open.

235253405.name: Great way to learn the history of Mexico and La Paz
235253405.author: a TripAdvisor user
235253405.reviewBody: Interesting history of Mexico and the Baja.  The staff speaks little English, so brush up on your Spanish!

164142407.name: If you have some time to kill...
164142407.author: a TripAdvisor user
164142407.reviewBody: The museum is a mixed bag of various exhibits such as a flag of the Republic of Sonora, a diorama of the first humans in these lands, pictures of Pancho Villa etc.\nIF you are a history buff and have 45 minutes..

158775312.name: Learn the local history
158775312.author: a TripAdvisor user
158775312.reviewBody: We hired a guide to take us around La Paz, our tour included the Museum. I was very impressed with the exhibits which explained the history of La Paz and all of Baja CA.\n\nVery informative.

155267818.name: A great afternoon.
155267818.author: a TripAdvisor user
155267818.reviewBody: The museum does a great job of bringing the history of Baja to life. Had a great afternoon there. The displays are in English and Spanish with prehistory as well as post Spanish occupation.

152737488.name: La Paz Museum, go ahead, you will learn something !
152737488.author: a TripAdvisor user
152737488.reviewBody: Not the best museum but it is definately worth a look. Lots of pictures and diaramas on three floors, which for the most part are well done. The native american cultures memorbilia and especially the pictographs are interesting. We do speak a little Spanish, so the staff really were very helpful in explaining things and answering question. Before you leave please  check out the area behind the museum. Although, seemingly forgotten and neglected, there sre some statues and interesting replications of famous Mexican Indian artifacts worth a look ! Enjoy ! Skippyfrizz !

141882403.name: worth the visit
141882403.author: a TripAdvisor user
141882403.reviewBody: Its a beautiful building in an old part of town its historical and a good way to beat the heat. It can be an eye opener when you think of how many times these people had to fight for their independance. I do love this culture.

132402692.name: a good overview of the anthopology of the area, I was especially interested in the cave paintings-there is a new diarma
132402692.author: a TripAdvisor user
132402692.reviewBody: gift shop kept very irregular hours- it was hard to purchase an item we had liked and should have bought at the time.  When we went back to buy it the shop was always closed.

128071481.name: Very interesting, great Mexican history
128071481.author: a TripAdvisor user
128071481.reviewBody: Really takes you back to beginning of Mexico, esp. Baja areas & what life was like, most  interesting was the sealife that were & or are in the Bay of La Paz

128018789.name: Small but sweet
128018789.author: a TripAdvisor user
128018789.reviewBody: If you don\'t have high expectations you will enjoy this small museum. It is actually very nice for what it is. There was an exhibit about pirates that was quite good. Since I find myself not remembering much else, I think it was not terribly informative, but it was a nice way to spend a little time during the heat of the day!

10940311.name: A place to learn more about Baja
10940311.author: a TripAdvisor user
10940311.reviewBody:
This is a great (if small) museum that covers the sweep of history from the geologic formation of the Baja peninsula to the prehistoric animals and people to the more recent days of Spanish exploration up to today.  

We pent about two hours touring the museum.  Because we don't read Spanish and the interpretive signs are all written in Spanish only, we missed out on some opportunities to learn more, but it was fun to try to translate what we could.

There is also a nice little gift shop with some tourist related things and a substantial selection of serious anthropology/archeology resources.

576878456.name: ARTE!!!!! :)
576878456.author: a TripAdvisor user
576878456.reviewBody: Ademas de ser un agaleria muy interesante cuenta con un servicio increible, nos brindaron toda la informaci\u00f3n sobre los tyalleres y clases de dibujo y pintura que la galeria otorga sin duda alguna un riconcito de arte en la paz!

address.streetAddress: Calle Francisco i. Madero s/n entre Independencia y 16 de Septiembre

663279579.name: Overnight on the Sea of Cortez
663279579.author: a TripAdvisor user
663279579.reviewBody: We took a much-anticipated ride on the California Star from Mazatlan to La Paz.  Since it was going to be a long trip, we opted to rent a cabin with beds and a bathroom complete with a shower.  Our trip was fun, very different than our usual driving or flying.  The whole operation is quite spectacular:  we arrived at 5:50 PM, boarded the boat by 6:15, got our cabin key, and went out on the other decks to watch the trucks being loaded on the ferry.  Then the cars came aboard.  As all this was going on, we could see the beautiful Mazatlan sunset.  Went back inside to find a cozy little bar where we ordered margaritas.  Very good!  Dinner was served cafeteria style.  There were many tables from which to choose for dining.  By 10 PM we were ready for sleep.  We slept quite soundly, waking up a little before 6 AM.  Dressed and went downstairs to the restaurant for breakfast.  Included in the ticket price is coffee and sweet bread in the morning.  Other options are available for purchase.   For about 1.5 hours I stood outside watching the crew get the ferry ready for docking.  Its an amazing feat of engineering to get the boat into the harbor and then dockside.  Everything was done in an orderly fashion.  By the time we disembarked, there were already trucks being driven out of the ferry.  Both my husband and I highly recommend this trip at least once. Keep in mind that the temperature in the ferry is cool - you need a sweater.  And in the cabins, the  temperature is cold.  Fortunately, there are blankets in the rooms.  We left Mazatlan at 8:15 PM and docked in La Paz at 10:15 AM.  All in all it was a very good trip.

651558013.name: Excellent service
651558013.author: a TripAdvisor user
651558013.reviewBody: Just came back from my trip in la Baja, used Baja Ferries to transport my motorcycle and myself, it is not expensive as I thought, food is good, the view is amazing, clean rooms and secure, I would totally recommend this.

640187402.name: The refugee experience
640187402.author: a TripAdvisor user
640187402.reviewBody: I took the ferry from La Paz to Mazatlan with my girlfriend in mid December 2018. It was the most terrible transportation experience I have endured, and I did 16h train rides in the low-class train cabins in India!! After we purchased the tickets we were informed that there are no more rooms left on the ferry and that we cannot access our car during the trip, let alone sleep in it. The later it got, the more we realized that more than half of the passengers on the ferry didn\'t have a room. People slept everywhere on the boat; by the vending machines on the floor, in the halls on the floor, under the stairs... It was a free for all. Me and my girlfriend ended up sleeping on the floor in one of the halls. By midnight, everyone has completely transcended the shame of sleeping on the floor in public. To make it worse, all the outlets on the boat are European, so you can\'t even plug your phone to charge. The boat it self was very nice and modern though, which made for a very interesting juxtaposition. in the morning we were served a breakfast which consisted of a coffee with powdered milk and a piece of bread.

639924004.name: Los Mochis to La Paz
639924004.author: a TripAdvisor user
639924004.reviewBody: Long wait at station, no reason why. Very nice staff, but seats very uncomfortable. We slept on floor like everyone else. No cabins available. But food  excellent for  cena at 1am. Good safe voyage.

633708503.name: Better than flying
633708503.author: a TripAdvisor user
633708503.reviewBody: First, the food was top notch...better than I\'ve have in many restaurants.  The cabin was larger than cabins on other ferries and the beds were good enough.  BUT when the sea got rough things began to slide and bang around all night long.  I\'m not talking once in awhile. I\'m very glad I didn\'t have a car below and we didn\'t get much sleep.

621335618.name: If no cabin, you better fly
621335618.author: a TripAdvisor user
621335618.reviewBody: If you travel in cabin, rate would be "Excelent", if not, is the worst, specially because of the kind of people who travel in the main passengers room

616483663.name: Excellent service! Professional and on time!
616483663.author: a TripAdvisor user
616483663.reviewBody: We traveled from Topolobampo to La Paz and had an overall excellent experience! Even food they provided was very tasty. Cabins are strongly recommended: clean, relatively silent, with shower! We slept like babies! Live music and entertainment were also very pleasant.

609887572.name: The worst experience ever in ferry, be prepared for additional charges without notice
609887572.author: a TripAdvisor user
609887572.reviewBody: If I could give this service a 0, I would. This is the worst experience ever in ferry for us. The company charges for every little thing, and they do not have the rules or rates for these charges written down anywhere. Paying the ticket fare is only the beginning of the multiple charges this company will nail you with if you plan to go in your car. In addition, getting on the ferry and disembarking the ferry takes hours, so be prepared. A 7 hour journey quickly turns into 12. They weigh your car 4 times, and charge $600 pesos each time. This is not included in the ticket price and no where is it written or was information provided to us about the number of times our vehicle would be weighed or the price for each weighing. If they believe you are traveling for commerical purposes, they charge an additional $800 pesos. The staff cannot provide a good reason for this policy, it is just one more way to overcharge their clients for this service. It seems like they are making up charges on the spot, given they do not have any written information regarding these additional charges and clients are not given any kind of notice of what they might be expected to pay. If you don\'t need your car in La Paz, I would recommend flying instead of taking the ferry. Never have we been treated so poorly, and without reason from the company. If we knew about all of the additional charges and time to embark, disembark, all of the revisions, etc. we would have opted for the flight and paid for an Uber once in La Paz. In the end, it would have been much more comfortable and cheaper.

606008608.name: No thank you
606008608.author: a TripAdvisor user
606008608.reviewBody:
This company is lacking organization.  I paid on line and still had to wait in line for more than 90 minutes to obtain a ticket.  It would be nice if Baja Ferries would explain what to expect on line when you get there.  Like the long line waiting for you vehicle to get weighted.  You have to pay for that.  Once that's done you get to wait to obtain you ticket.  
No one is telling you anything.  Like why we had to wait an additional 4 hrs to board the ship.  The food on board was terrible and the vending machines did not work.  They would not let us bring any food or beverages to the room I booked.  It was a pleasure to see all the bodies laying everywhere.  People trying to get some sleep.  The trip took us 15 hrs.

It also took us 2 hrs to get unloaded and to leave to port.  We had to get in line to pay an some kind of exit fee and another fee for the Federals to spray something on my car.  Thank God that's over.  

Sorry, but there is nothing good I can say about Baja Ferries, except that we made it to the Baja safely.  We thank you for that.

603624179.name: Quite the experience!
603624179.author: a TripAdvisor user
603624179.reviewBody: This is a thing everyone should do once! I sailed from La Paz to Mazatlan. Beautiful crossing. Peaceful cruising with very clean room.  The dolphins were very cute as well.  We sailed and arrived on time, loading and off loading was easy and well organized.

600893835.name: Topolobambo to La Paz
600893835.author: a TripAdvisor user
600893835.reviewBody: Making reservation was very easy took less than 5 minutes. They offer free dinner as soon as you get in the boat, they have like a bar with live music, and they let you walk around the boat. We rented a cabin to sleep and they have your own little bathroom and 4 twin beds (it will be nice if they had cabins with queen beds). Our trip was overnight left around 1a.m. and arrived around 7a.m. to La Paz.

593291808.name: Topolobampo-La Paz with motorcycle
593291808.author: a TripAdvisor user
593291808.reviewBody: I thought it was quite an experience. We took the overnight trip Topolobampo-La Paz.  We had a room with a bathroom and two beds which were comfortable. Our intention was to rest overnight as we were traveling by motorcycle. I am not a fan of the sea and it makes me nervous, so there goes my intended sleep. I would\'ve been happy sitting in the passenger seats watching TV. It has a dinner buffet included but not great. Better to have some tacos by the malecon. The way they load the ferry with trailers and cars is so well organized and our motorcycle was well taken care of. It is a ferry, not a cruise and if you keep this in mind it is very efficient and great transportation.  \n

590934098.name: Terrible Experience
590934098.author: a TripAdvisor user
590934098.reviewBody: Unfortunately the only reason to get on this is to get transportation from point a to point b... You are better off getting a plane.  The whole time they treated us like prison inmates...\nAfter 8 hrs of delay waiting at the port they yell women on one side men in another. They secluded us and then had the men strip all belongings on floor while we each got a nice pat down and going through metal detector.
