247828366.reviewBody: We took the ferry from La Paz to Topolobambo, about seven hours. The ferry is not very clean or in good conditions. Having said that you can watch the most incredible sunsets and views in the ride. If you don\u00b4t mind the rustic experience you might be amazed by the views.

246723233.name: night ferry to La Paz
246723233.author: a TripAdvisor user
246723233.reviewBody: long lines and the wait was very long--three hours standing, but we were able to sleep four hours in our private cabin

245042320.name: Read the tips, and don\'t expect a cruise
245042320.author: a TripAdvisor user
245042320.reviewBody: Definitely spent a lot of time researching this part of our trip. We took the ferry from La Paz to Mazatlan. We were unable to get a cabin online. However MAKE SURE you purchase a cabin at the reception once the ship has started its departure. Its a small cut out of your wallet, and worth every penny. The 4 beds in the cabin are comfy. They provide you with extra towels, pillows and blankets if needed. The shower is AMAZING. Only took us 30 minutes from departure before we got harassed by some drunk locals and needed some breathing room. Note: they only offer you one free meal so get in line before they run out. And don\'t expect too much from the ship. They are very quick at loading on and off. But they are still notorious for being late

242637242.name: It was an experience
242637242.author: a TripAdvisor user
242637242.reviewBody: Recently, we needed to get from Mazatl\u00e1n to Cabo San Lucas and decided to take the ferry instead of flying.  I found it a little difficult to book as I wanted a cabin and couldn\'t seem to get one online when I was trying to book.  I called the number on the website, but had a bit of difficulty as between the less than great phone connection and the language barrier, it was tricky.  Luckily, our estimator at work speaks fluent Spanish and phoned and did the booking for me....problem solved.  So, off my hubby, my two sons (4 and 6) and I went on a grand adventure.  :)\n\nWhen we first got to the terminal in Mazatl\u00e1n, there was some confusion over the whereabouts of my tickets which I was told would be held for me for pick up.  Fortunately, a quick walk to the next building and there they all were safe and sound.  We ended up waiting and waiting and waiting to board the ship, but the kids enjoyed watching the big trucks drive on.  We checked our two large suitcases and took a few small carry ons on board with us.  When it was time to board, we did have to climb a lot of steep narrow steps and it was generally a hot sweaty experience.  The staff were all very helpful and we got our cabin just fine.  The cabin we had was actually much better than anticipated.  It had four single beds (two sets of bunks), a sink, and a bathroom complete with shower.  All were very clean.  We spent until early evening on the deck which was nice watching the sunset.  The kids enjoyed watching and listening to all that was going on.  Being a prairie girl, I was somewhat petrified at the prospect of one of them going over the railing, but all was well.  The ferry itself isn\'t what was portrayed on the website or brochures, but more what one would expect of a ferry.  Basically a floating bus depot.  The supper menu was limited, but doable.  Between the four of us we had a burger, fries, and a plate of nachos all of which was just fine.  There was also beer for sale if you wanted.  We went to bed early and everyone slept well.  Somehow, we managed to miss breakfast.  My husband had gone out around 6 or 6:30 and came back with the two remaining yogurts from the night before.  We went up on the deck, came back in and showered and breakfast was over.  So, we were all starving for lunch by the time we arrived.  Getting off the ferry was even longer than getting on.  We waited for about an hour in a hot hallway, but we made it there.  It was an experience and I wouldn\'t be against doing it again, but I\'d definitely take some food.

232792253.name: 5 hours late
232792253.author: a TripAdvisor user
232792253.reviewBody:
We were traveling from La Paz to Topolobampo. They told us we had to be there 2 hrs before the ferry was scheduled to leave, so we did. By the way, we had one dog, 2 cats and a baby with us.
Around 1:30 pm (1 hour before the scheduled departing time) they started loading the big trucks onto the ferry (each of them had to back into the boat, so you can imagine how long that took). Finally around 3:30 pm the cars (with only the driver in them) started going in, and at 4 pm they allowed the rest of the passengers to board. 
Once in the boat we went to our private room and were expecting to be on our way soon... that didn't happen. Finally at approximately 7 pm the boat started moving. By that time the restaurant had already closed for the night. Good thing we did eat around 6 and had the idea of buying some sandwiches for later.
Our pets weren't allowed to stay with us (I can understand that), but this meant they wouldn't have water or food until we got to Topo since they wouldn't allow us to go and visit with them!
We finally arrived to Topo around 3:30 am, but took more than an hour for them to let the passengers get off the boat, even though they made us leave our private room even before the boat docked!
I would never, ever use this ferries again! Ever!

231566371.name: Looking for a pleasant cruise DON\'T take this ferry
231566371.author: a TripAdvisor user
231566371.reviewBody: We have travelled on this ferry a few times. If you have animals it is inhumane how they are treated. Your pet must be in a cage and then they are put up on the outside deck in blazing heat and you are not. Allowed to go out to give them water not can they leave the cage to go to the bathroom. You are treated like a criminal and I don\'t know why. The cost is extreme for what you get. If I didn\'t need my car I would not go this route

226796978.name: Good experience....but....
226796978.author: a TripAdvisor user
226796978.reviewBody: To be honest I had large expectations about this experience maybe because I believed it was going to be like being on a cruise...sorry but let me tell you that is not a cruise, it\'s a ferry. First of all, the Aduana in Topolobampo is a mess (old and unconfortable building), the ship regularly departs late, eventhough I think it is the best and affordable option to go to La Paz from Topo.\nIf you decided to take this ferry, please keep in mind that it\'s not a cruise, so don\'t expect too much. It is recommended to reserve a cabin to rest during the trip (7 hours aprox).\nIf you like to take photos, I recommend to you get up early before the dawn, the view is absolutely great

208270735.name: Just for the experience of doing it.
208270735.author: a TripAdvisor user
208270735.reviewBody: If you are up to the adventure you must take this ferry watching the trucks load it is very impressive. Service is not that good, but if you are a relaxed tourist and choose a good and expensier \u00e1rea to do the trip is totally worth it.

205341284.name: Excellent service.... feels like a cruise!! :))
205341284.author: a TripAdvisor user
205341284.reviewBody: That was a very surprising good experience... very affordable and comfortable.  We took the ferry in La Paz and traveled to Topolobampo, Sin.  We took our car so it was so convenient... great experience.  We leave on time, food is provided with your ticket, they have a bar (very noisy) elevators, awesome views at the decks..... very good experience

203663445.name: Sure beats driving the long way around
203663445.author: a TripAdvisor user
203663445.reviewBody:
We've taken the ferry several times (and will again in the evening).  The route from La Paz to Mazatlan is a long one, at about 14 hours.  This ferry is old and beat up but the cabins are OK and Baja Ferries does a great job getting everyone on and off.  
You'll get the Aduana hassle in La Paz and the Mexican army checks you on both ends, but they are professional and not a problem.  
The Topo/La Paz ferry is newer and the private cabins are very nice, the trip is about 6-7 hours but often late leaving and arriving by a couple of hours.   The food on both ferries is edible, although we prefer the Topo ferry.  

While it is a bit expensive when you look at 4 days travel, several tolls along 15D and rt.2 plus the high cost of and 3 nights in a hotel and the the ferry really becomes  a good deal.

The major problem is the website, it never works for us; however call the 800 number and they take great care of you.  

Bring snacks and drinks along to avoid the high prices on board.

200434249.name: Sang Karaoke for England!
200434249.author: a TripAdvisor user
200434249.reviewBody: Very clean - staff very helpful. Lovely just standing up on deck with the blue sky and wind blowing through hair. Thought the 6 hour journey to El Fuerte would be such a drag but when the music started it was such good fun. Had a nice meal all in all the time went by so quickly - magic.

200031455.name: Got us where we wanted to go
200031455.author: a TripAdvisor user
200031455.reviewBody: The ferry trip was actually better than we expected.  Right now, only the La Paz Star is operating between Mazatlan and La Paz.  It is the truck ferry.  The ship was old and unappealing to look at.  We were told to arrive at the ferry dock three hours before the departure time but trucks and people were arriving at 4 p.m. which was the scheduled departure time!  We left Mazatlan at 4:30.  There was an outside deck to watch the departure but only one small bench for seating.  Our cabin was clean with two sets of single bunk beds.  We had our own clean bathroom with a shower.  I would highly suggest getting your own cabin.  There are even cabins with outside windows (even numbered cabins?)  The dinner and breakfast were included.  The meals were very Mexican and the line for the buffet service was long but moved quickly.  We brought our own food but my husband ate the ship food.  He enjoyed it.  I strongly suggest getting a cabin, we slept in a quiet spot and had a clean bathroom.  The crossing was very smooth.  Getting off in the morning was a little strange.  I couldn\'t go with husband in the van so had to wait in the hallway until we were allowed off the ship.  We had to climb down several steep stairs carrying all of our bags needed for the evening.  We had to go through a security check and show our passports.  Our bags were put through x-ray.  My husband had to have his van weighed (150 pesos) and sprayed for bugs (30 pesos).  He also had to go through a security  check with the army.  This took an hour before we were able to meet again.  We got into our van then we were in another line for a check with the Federal police.  We had no problems, it was just time consuming.  The ferry landed at 10 and we left the last inspection at 11:30.

197630359.name: TERRIBLE FERRY!!!
197630359.author: a TripAdvisor user
197630359.reviewBody:
There were so many bad things about the ferry I'll try to just summarize the top 3. First, the departure time we were given was completely inaccurate. We were told to be at the ferry terminal several hours before a 2am departure (not sure why). After arriving at 10.30pm and waiting for a couple of hours we were told the ferry would not be leaving until 6am. We tried (mostly unsuccessfully) to sleep in the terminal only to find out the time had been pushed back again to 8:30am. Unbelievable! By the time everyone boarded the vessel and we left port it was approx 10:30am, 12 hours after we were told to arrive at the terminal! What a waste of time.

The second issue was that the ferry was crowded and dirty. We did not get a cabin but from the looks of them they weren't that great. However, anything would have been better than the "movie room" the rest of the passengers were crowded into. If for some awful reason I had to use this service again I would get a cabin.

The last of my top 3 reasons this ferry sucked is that the boat itself was not very accommodating to passengers. Besides the crowded seating and limited bathrooms, there was very little outdoor seating which would have been a great way to escape the diesel fumes from the countless semi-trucks on the boat. Note that this is not a typical passenger ferry! Another reviewer referred to it as a low end carnival cruise line. I don't think it comes anywhere near this generous description. The ship's primary purpose is to transport vehicles, not people...which is very apparent.

All in all the trip took 20 hours (including our wasted time in the ferry terminal). Good luck fellow travelers. Oh, and you might want to bring your own PFD. All of the life jacket bins we saw were completely empty.

192965281.name: DO NOT TAKE THE FERRY
192965281.author: a TripAdvisor user
192965281.reviewBody: We had read a 2010 review of the ferry between Mazatlan and La Paz and it sounded ok.  A quaint way to spend a night at sea to get where we wanted to go.  Apparently, between 2010 and 2014 things changed A LOT.  HORRIBLE.  Crowded, dirty.  We couldn\'t get a cabin, but from what we saw of them, they were none too comfortable, and as dirty and rundown as the rest of the ship.  We were with the masses in the "salon" were movies blarred until late in the evening.  There was ONE ladies toilet and ONE men\'s toilet for at least 150-200 people.  The food was disgusting, and you had to line up like grammar school to be fed.  NEVER TAKE THIS FERRY!

192307917.name: not bad
192307917.author: a TripAdvisor user
192307917.reviewBody: long (16hr) ferry journey, and quite expensive for Mexico. Worth getting a cabin if you want to sleep (4 beds, quite spacious, with private bathroom and towels provided) Evening meal and breakfast included in the price.

183852337.name: Old Ships - Expensive Trip
183852337.author: a TripAdvisor user
183852337.reviewBody: $300 usd for 2 people in bunk beds and a motorcycle, AHOY!   It\'s a low end Mexican Carnival Cruise, with edible meals and can beer or soda, that\'s it.  The Nachos were actually not bad.\n\nSince it;s a monopoly, shut up and enjoy the ride!

173708882.name: Gulf of Baja Ferry
173708882.author: a TripAdvisor user
173708882.reviewBody: Nice over night slow boat across the gulf. Sleeper and coach options - travelers can mill about a couple of decks during the voyage. The bus ride on the peninsula was also slow due to security stops every two hours.

151423548.name: Not advised, particularly with a dog
151423548.author: a TripAdvisor user
151423548.reviewBody:
I am a world traveller and normally have nothing but good things to say, but the ferry from Topolobampo to La Paz was a terrible experience.  I can see how others may have had it better, but several points soured us on this company.  In particular, when we booked in advance by phone we were told that our dog ABSOLUTELY had to be crated (any other ferry we could leave her in the car: it was January and not hot) and since they had only a few crates we were told we should bring one or we would not get on if their crates were full.  So, we spent time tracking down a crate (not easy in Mexico, not cheap either).  Our dog is not use to being crated and was quite stressed, not to mention the crate area was with the big trucks which idled for the whole trip.  We were not allowed to visit her either.

This is basically a truck ferry that is obliged to take people: that is how we were treated.  The ferry food (that we had no option but to pay for with our ticket) was pure slop, and the "lounge" was playing bad music at earsplitting levels. We would have loved to have sprung for a private room, but they were all pre booked.

Worst of all, while I was waiting with another wife on the tarmac at the other side while they subjected our husbands/vechicles to a separate search (dogs, you name it, to go from one Mexican province to another???) I found out they sweet talked the guy loading them into letting them leave their dog in the car!!

150136224.name: Nice!!
150136224.author: a TripAdvisor user
150136224.reviewBody: Well kept, nice service, comfortable!! Affordable and great asset for Baja California!! Good value!\nIs is a very nice e pertinence and the sunsets are beautiful!

148017136.name: La Paz to Topolobampo
148017136.author: a TripAdvisor user
148017136.reviewBody: An honest price to cross the Sea of Cortez although it\'s a long voyage.  Several of the lounges have seats that recline and you can catch a decent nap in (even at 6\'4).

135972907.name: Better than expected
135972907.author: a TripAdvisor user
135972907.reviewBody: Drove down Baja from San Diego and crossed over on the ferry with a van.  Loading was easy and we felt our car was safe.  We got a cabin to sleep in and it was clean and comfortable.  The ferry is like a small cruise ship, basic, not luxurious. Our room had a shower with lots of hot water.  Unlike some other peoples reviews we found a sit down restaurant that served decent food at very reasonable prices with waiters. \nWe did not use the seating that is available if you don\'t have a room, but it was certainly decent looking.  All in all we are glad we took it and got more than we expected, after all it is just a ferry.

129621490.name: Baja Ferries get you there and back
129621490.author: a TripAdvisor user
129621490.reviewBody:
We wanted to give Baja Ferries a try as everyone asks us what it's like - now we know.

Our experience was a mixed bag.  We took the Mazatlan to La Paz sailing, got a cabin, and enjoyed the trip.  It is not a cruise ship - the restaurant choices are either a cafeteria (it was ok, but not thrilling) and a very overpriced sit down restaurant.   The bar area was creepy.  Lots of truck drivers on our boat drinking a whole lot.

Our cabin had seen better days.  It was clean and we got to sleep.  For that I was thankful as the boat gets in very early am.

No breakfast was served on board.  We had someone picking us up, but there were lots of Taxis.  La Paz is about 15 minutes away.

Somehow we had to go through customs/immegration when we got off the boat.  Not sure why as all travel was within Mexico. 

All in all, it's not a bad way to go if you need to cross the Sea of Cortez with a car.  I would probably fly next time, all things being equal.

128675123.name: Terrible ordeal-especially for our pet dog.
128675123.author: a TripAdvisor user
128675123.reviewBody: We travelled earlier this year from Topolobampo to La Paz by Baja Ferries with our vehicle and dog.Their Website stated that the dog would remain in the vehicle on this ship "California Star", and not in the Cargo area.  It is a 6 hour nightly ferry leaving at 11.00pm.\nOur dog was placed in a cage on the Cargo deck, exposed to the elements(cold night air) on the same deck as all the refridgerated trucks, which were kept running all night.(exhaust fumes)- and she had no water available to her. We complained several times-to no avail, needless to say we were too upset to eat or drink ourselves and went to lay on the beds in our private cabin. We did not sleep and the 2 blankets that were supplied were not enough to keep us warm-so imagine our dog on the outer deck!  We were not allowed to go to our vehicle or visit the dog. It was a nightmare of a journey and we were all traumatised at the end of it.  There is a lot more I could say, this is just the incident concerning the treatment and abuse of our dog.\nBaja Ferries - shame on you. Will never travel with them again.

128070850.name: Checking out information
128070850.author: a TripAdvisor user
128070850.reviewBody: Hard to find out exact information if your Spanish is limited.  Best to check about ferry system at an OXXO

126751206.name: Save a thousand miles of driving
126751206.author: a TripAdvisor user
126751206.reviewBody: If you\'re on the Mexico mainland with an urge to enjoy Baja save a thousand miles of driving and take the ferry.\nYou won\'t have access to your vehicle on the trip which may present problems. If you\'re stuck with a caravan of sick RVers in the sitting room it won\'t be a pleasant night. If you\'re not skilled at backing your rigg onto a ferry you\'ll have some pleasant assistance.

125677330.name: You Can Take Your Car With You
125677330.author: a TripAdvisor user
125677330.reviewBody: I love being able to get to Mazatlan and the mainland from the Baja peninsula! In your car too!

124721354.name: small cruise
124721354.author: a TripAdvisor user
124721354.reviewBody: don\'t expect a cruise ship. but it is steady and rooms are clean and well mantaind

124111450.name: Very good service
124111450.author: a TripAdvisor user
124111450.reviewBody: Trip from la Paz to. Topo was in a large ferry with a comfortable bar.\n\nTrip from Mazatlan is in a smaller ferry with a bar which is not a comfortable. This ferry makes a much longer crossing.

123865247.name: A long delay but a great ferry
123865247.author: a TripAdvisor user
123865247.reviewBody: We caught a local bus from Los Mochis to Topolobampo and walked to the port (a few kilometres). Later in the evening we noticed a couple of buses came directly to the port. We bought our tickets before the ferry with no problem and opted for a cabin even though it\u2019s not such a long journey to La Paz. The ferry was delayed by a few hours and we only boarded after midnight and set sail around 2 am instead of 10:30 pm! This it seems is not uncommon. A friend of ours caught the first ferry of the week as it doesn\u2019t run on a Saturday and that way it seemed to catch up with itself and it was ontime! The ferry is great. Our cabin was a good size, very comfortable, with a nice bathroom and great hot shower. It was so worth paying for a cabin. Your ticket includes a meal from the buffet but drinks are extra. You check your bags in but if you are in a cabin you can keep them with you. On arrival you identify your bags on the land. We took the bus into La Paz which worked well. You can get a collective but the cost is about 50 pesos rather than 30 for the bus. Definitely recommend the ferry but be prepared for a wait.

120207940.name: Better than flying
120207940.author: a TripAdvisor user
120207940.reviewBody: We took the ferry from La Paz to Mazatlan and then the bus to Puerta Vallarta rather than try to fly from Cabo san Lucas.  We got a cabin with an en suite bathroom--definitely worth it--and brought our own liquor, also a good idea because they had a very limited selection on board.  We were on the Mazatlan Star, which is definitely not an upscale ship.  We had an excellent late lunch at Azul Marino in La Paz so skipped the on-board dinner.  Breakfast was OK, but nothing to write home about.  Not much to see until coming into port in Mazatlan, but the seas were calm & we arrived on time.  My husband couldn\'t sleep because of the vibrations from the engine, but I was comfortable.\n\nFrom the terminal, we had an easy taxi ride to the bus terminal and got right on a bus for Tepic and then another to Puerta Vallarta.  Altogether a good trip and better than trying to fly from Cabo to PV.

115550167.name: Not exactly as pictured would be an understatement
115550167.author: a TripAdvisor user
115550167.reviewBody:
OK, the best thing I can say about this experience is that the staff are all really friendly and helpful and they had nice big cages for dogs - we had one of our dogs with us. Oh and also we DID arrive safe and sound - if a tad overheated - in Mazatlan on time. 

The ferries are pictured on line as a sort of cruise experience. They show photos of a spacious lounge with comfortable blue plush chairs and another spacious lounge restaurant with plush burgundy chairs, a discoteque even. The on line photos also show frosty glasses of mixed cocktails served with snacks. The folder that our tickets came in had a happy couple in sort of tennis whites and a fancy plate of nicely arranged seafood on a white linen table cloth...well we went looking for either of those lounges - even the discoteque would have been OK - but the only food and beverage facility on our ship was a small, stuffy room with chipped arborite covered tables and tatty plastic chairs. It looked like a crew lounge for the clean up staff. There was a bar in the corner but no frosty glasses or plates of snacks. The bar offered beer or soft drinks - in the bottle or tin - and potato chips or cookies - in the bag. 

Two meals dinner and breakfast were served in what I would call army style from a steam table. You pointed at what you wanted and one of the staff plopped a ladle full of it on your plate - not quite the white linen and seafood experience pictured on the ticket folder or even the "buffet" experience pictured on the web site. The food was however, tasty and free! 

We had one of the outside cabins, it had a window overlooking a life boat (good to know that they DO have them), two very narrow single beds arranged at right angles and a tiny bathroom with shower. The room was fine for one night, it was clean, there were clean towels and sheets and the shower had plenty of water pressure. The a/c was a little weak but it was OK.  We stayed in the room a lot because the "on deck" experience was  not very pleasant.

The decks were dirty and everything metal was extremely rusty. It looked like the ship had not been cleaned or painted in years. There were few places to sit on deck anyway. The stern passenger deck was unbearably hot from engine exhaust and stunk of rotting garbage. The port side passenger deck had one small bench for seating, the starboard passenger deck had no seating at all. 

The elevator from the car decks was broken and the four or five flights of stairs up and down are extremely narrow and steep. 

All in all it was a horrible voyage that I would not recommend to anyone and I will never take again. I don't think that the ship we were on was either of those featured in the Baja Ferry's online site. It appeared to be of French origin based on the directional signage in French that remained painted on the walls and the interior didn't look like either of the ships pictured. 

Boarding in La Paz was brutal. We were kept waiting on hot tarmac with no shade in sight for over two hours while semi-trailers were boarded first. Another annoying thing is that all passengers except those actually driving a vehicle must embark and disembark on foot. I wasn't driving, I was the car passenger and I can certify that it is a hot and humid walk from the ship to the passenger waiting area when you get to Mazatlan. 

I'd suggest that if you want to book - or better need to book - with Baja Ferries you first determine that you won't be on the French ship we were on. The French would cry if they saw the state that ship is in today.

114881880.name: Worth the experience!
114881880.author: a TripAdvisor user
114881880.reviewBody: We took the boat (Baja ferries) from Topolobampo (Sinaloa) to La Paz (Baja California).  The boat left with about an hour late and the trip took just under 7 hours.  The ferry was very clean, well maintained with proper security.  We rented a room for the night (about 65$US) and this was well worth it.  Very little place to crash and sleep of you do not have a room.   I recommend you book ahead of time in high season and especially if you want to cross to or from Mazatlan.  In the summer (low season), the tickets were all sold out more than a week in advance.
